I left my car there for repairs, and he constantly updated me on the progress.

The finished repair looked great, and on top of that, they washed my entire car. I would recommend Iron Horse to anyone who is looking to get any work done on their car. Great service, great quality work. Keep up the good job guys!

Everything we had was amazing! I've tried many different sushi rolls and appetizers. Every bite was amazing! The best sushi place I've been to by far.

I also would like to mention the wonderful service!

We are obsessed with this place. The bartenders are so friendly and the drinks taste amazing! The happy hour is exceptional. My friends and I have tasted many items on the menu. We love their mussels & flatbread!
The line was out the door when we found this spot and we soon figured out why when we bit into our ice cream. The homemade cones are an extra special touch. Definitely worth the wait.

The restaurant was clean and food was pretty delicious  but the service struggled quite a bit. We waited about 15-20 minutes from our initial greeting before placing our order which included an appetizer. Our drinks were delivered to another table. The mozzarella bites were good! My blt and tomato soup were delicious.  My husband said his burger was ok.  We asked for a to-go box and server cleared away a plate with 3 chicken tenders on it that we had intended to box. However, our server was friendly. We chalked the disappointing service up to being a new restaurant -- they are probably still working out the kinks and getting everyone trained. We will probably go back another time.

In terms of Pier 1 stores, this one is small. However, it's still just as stimulating to the senses as a larger store would be, and I found what I was looking for, so I left happy.

The parking lot is pretty tiny and a bit busy since there is a Panera in the same strip mall, so be prepared to maneuver into some tight spaces and avoid pedestrians.

First time at Helena Av Bakery.  It was a bit confusing to locate, initially, as the address is Anacapa Street and it's not actually on Anacapa.
The bread was delicious,  the sopressata sandwich was divine, as was the green bean artichoke salad.  I was surprised and disappointed that the salad was not accompanied by 1-2 small slices of the baguette. When asked, the server said I could order a 1/2 loaf of the baguette (which I did), though that ended up being just too much.   Also, I would recommend not slicing the whole 1/2 loaf, rather, just make the single cut and leave it to the customer to tear it apart.... I'm hoping what I brought home will taste as good as those I ate with my salad.  All in all the food was very good and I look forward to returning to test other menu items.

Yummy! Short and sweet menu, which I actually love. It's basically a "pick your protein" kinda deal. Quick service. It's just one store front wide and not very deep... there are 12 seats in the joint. So don't bring the whole family. But for you and a friend or two... this is perfect. I had the special, which was a rice noodle dish, but the standard order is a rice bowl. Nice little, straightforward joint.

There were long lines for food and check out at lunchtime on a Sunday. Only 1 cashier was working! She was friendly though and trying to keep things moving as best she could. The coffee bar area was messy with a lot of trash and spilled cream everywhere. It seemed like they were just understaffed at the time. 

The breakfast panini I got was delicious, the bread was crispy grilled and buttery and topped with a thick slab of scrambled eggs. I ordered veggies and I just got some baby spinach, i was expecting roasted peppers or something. Coffee was fresh. They have a pumpkin spice blend for fall, which is one of my guilty pleasures -love it!

Homemade Ice Cream, hand crafted Milkshakes, barista style espresso drinks. This was an excellent place to stop in. The ice cream is great, milkshakes are divine, and the coffee is great. It is a hit with my family
Raving reviews for the whole family.  Six cones and a drink for less than $20.  Favorite was the maple bacon ice cream and the coffee was a close second.
Went to Joe's after drinking some beer at nearby Cigar City Brewery. I ordered two slices and a drink for $7 including tax. Great pizza, friendly service, and fun enjoyed by all
Good sushi and a nice staff. It does take a bit too long for the food to come out though.

The only reason I'm giving 2 stars instead of 1 is because my 2-year old liked the pizza.  The chicken cheese steak was overcooked chunks with no flavor....The wings were whole wings without the tips cut off, which just looks unappetizing.....The  cheese steak tasted like a cheap version of Steak-umms.  Oh, and the pizza is lousy!  I really wanted to like this place because they have a big patio and it is byob, but I can't eat there again.
Best ice cream in Nashville!  The shop is cute and old-fashioned, with a very unique fountain.  Very small inside, so no room for large groups if there are many customers.  Service was fantastic!

Truly an awesome little place. I've only done take out and delivery, but I love it. It's my go-to spot. Try to come like once a week now. Super fast, fresh and tasty. It has that comforting Asian flavor and texture without being oily and leaving you feeling gross like some other Asian food (mostly Chinese...). Everyone should definitely give it a try. My only recommendation would be for them to start offering brown rice. Otherwise it's perfect.
Food was ok but definitely overpriced. Also they have no high chairs for patrons with children. I think tuna bar is trying to be like morimoto but falls very short.

In love!!! I loved the build your own salad! Got exactly what I wanted and super healthy and fresh. My mom got a sandwich that was equally delicious. It was a little confusing to figure out what it was and how to order but after we figured that our food was really good. The staff was nice. Really liked the concept.  The one thing I wished they had was fountain drinks instead of bottles.

Wonderful brunch option in the Funk Zone. Food is fresh and biscuit sandwiches are made perfectly. I'd recommend Green Eggs and Ham for sure and am planning to go back and try all the baked goods as well. Also, sharing the space w a wine bar is a nice touch ;)

Only went here for a friends happy hour, but ended up getting some appetizers. While they were decent, there was nothing outstanding about them. Got calamari and crab dip. The calamari was good, but came with just marinara sauce, wish it was a diff house made sauce like some other places have. The crab dip was good, but again nothing special. Needed more crab in it, and by the time you're done you have dip left and no more bread to dip in it...

Wall-to-wall hoosiers.

I've been in to Tsevis' three times to pick up carry-out, because I don't typically sit-down at strip-mall eateries.  

All three times I ordered the same thing... all three times I was either 1) charged something different ($9 vs. $11) and/or 2) the food I was given was different (no fries vs. no olives).

One evening I waited at the host stand for my food, and the young man acting as hostess made personal phone calls on his cell phone (presumably to his girlfriend) while dropping the F bomb repeatedly.

One afternoon at the bar, surrounded by no less than 5 other Tsevis employees, I had to wait many minutes for the bartender to finish smoking and chatting with her friends before anyone would grab my order.  ...while another staff person also sat at the bar drinking with patrons.  ...and the bartender came back into the room stinking of cigarettes.

The ONLY reason I've been there three times is because it's literaly less than a quarter mile from my house, so it's the closest place for a gyro.  However, there are three other places relatively close to my house I could get gyros from... and given the lackluster performance at Tsevis so far, I might just start doing that.

If it wasn't for the tuna tartar, which was decent, this would be a one star restaurant.  The tuna tartar had potential, but needed some finishing salt and maybe a little heat and/or crunch to make it more interesting. 

Ordered three rolls and they were awful.  The spicy tuna and the unagi rolls contained this weird mixture, which I assume was pureed fish.  I've never experienced that before.  The salmon rolls had too much rice and the seaweed was too thick.  We slathered the rolls in soy sauce and wasabi to make them more palatable. 

Ordered three pieces of sushi.  They were some of the largest pieces of sushi I've ever had. The salmon was not fresh.  The hamachi was boring.  The striped bass, which was the cheapest of the sushis, was actually the most flavorful. 

A crisp Riesling is usually a good accompaniment to sushi.  Unfortunately, there is not one on the menu.  The one they had was cloyingly sweet, with no acid or fruit.  It wasn't even finished!  The pinot noir was too earthy.  The cava, while not great, was the best of the options. 

The main restaurant can be very loud.  The small side booths for two are a good option for a couple who want to be able to converse.

I love this place! Being from New York I'm very picky about my pizza. This is the only place in the neighborhood that I go to for pizza. The prices are affordable and the variety of pizza is great. The staff are always very friendly, quick, and kind. I would definitely recommend for lunch or a quick dinner. Out of all the pizza places on Main St. in manayunk, this is my favorite by far!

If you're looking for great tasting, high quality Italian food then this is the place for you. They make their own bread that is to die for. They have the best manicotti that I've ever had. Yum! There isn't a single bad thing on the menu. They also offer a unique Italian grocery selection with imported and domestic Italian products that are very hard to find at regular grocery stores. Support small business and give this place a try! Its worth every penny!

TALK ABOUT A HIDDEN GEM! I can't believe I didn't discover it sooner, but I'm glad I found it when I did! This place is literally the best, most authentic korean food I've had thus far in philadelphia. They offer only a limited menu of bibimbap (with various proteins), pajeon (scallion pancake), and yuk gae jang (beef stew), but they do it right! I think it's advertised as a take-out joint, but the actual restaurant is a hole in a wall spot on south st that seats about 8-10 people, max. I saw the glowing reviews and though skeptical, decided to bike down here with a friend for dinner and was not disappointed. The pajeon was smaller than I imagined, but delicious and surprisingly filling - certainly enough to hold you over until the main dish. I love traditional bibimbap, and BAP does it SO SO well. I always get the classic marinated beef as my protein, and this particular version comes with soybean, carrots, cucumbers, mushroom, cabbage, a gooey egg, and broccoli! I would HIGHLY recommend paying the extra dollar for the dolsot option to get that crunchy rice on the bottom for more flavor! Love this place and will definitely be back whenever I need my korean food fix! Maybe I'll try the yuk gae jang next time!

TIP: bring cash if you can!
Yum! Lots of great flavors. I settled for a moose tracks milkshake and it was delicious!

Holy effing shit, this has got to be the most ghetto grocery store I've ever been to! Lazy employees, scary clientele (think random homeless crazy guy wandering around), dingy store, bad produce...I get the creeps just thinking about it. 

My husband asked for an application for their club card (or savings card, whatever). The cashier gave him this look and said, "There's no one in the back to get it." What?? There's no one to get a piece of paper? I thought most supermarkets had those apps up front!

The produce and produce selection were horrendous. The stuff I got seems like it had been sitting out for days-- the onions were mushy! Eww!

Sure, if you want to save money, come here, but you get what you pay for. I'd rather hit up Acme.

Never going back here again.

We always have great service here. Only once in 3 years did they "mess up" an order and I wouldn't even say that it was a negative because they resolved it so effortlessly. They made our pizza on Hand Tossed crust instead of Pan Pizza, but must haverecognized the mistake once it was already been baking. They just baked the correct one, apologized and gave us the "oops" at no charge. Apology for a free pizza? What great service! When we do have delivery its fast and hot. Must have a really great team at this location!
This is not New York pizza it's thin crust andhorrible the service was horrendous and that's all

it is an alright Target. It's not my favorite in Tucson, but there are other retailers in Tucson that are far worse. This location can be more clean and organized. It's got your typical Target stuff, but limited than the more recently-built ones as this has been at this location for many years. I have nothing to say exceptional about the service, but didn't find anything terrible about it either.

Went in for a loaf of bread and cheese board.  Asked if they could slice a few pieces of the bread and bag the rest of the loaf.  We were told no, we only use the loaf slicer.  There was a bread  knife about 2 inches from the loaf rack.  We ordered  an olive loaf and when we opened the bag inside was a walnut loaf.  Glad we were not allergic to nuts.  They were not busy,  just careless.
The milkshake espresso drinks are to die for! And the environment is so nice and relaxed. My favorite part of the Nashville trip!

Ook!  I am close to giving it 1 star only.
Dirty, nasty store.  Dairy is unreliable.
Produce is Questionable.

Cashiers?  What Cashiers?  When yo9u can get a register open there is a huge line and the lady looks pissed off.  (I would be too if i had to work here.)

YUCK.

Packaged goods only.
I would never buy veggies, meat or dairy here.

And it's a shame - bordering on a sin.  This area of Philly NEEDS viable grocery stores - and this is all we've got.

SAD, SAD, SAD.

Although I read yelp reviews often, I've been holding out on writing any of my own. I finally made an account today just so I can give this place a 5-star rating. The friendly owner and tasty food warmed my cold, cynical heart today. 

My friend and I ordered the Korean savory pancake and the vegetable bimbimbap. The vegetables were fresh and crispy, and the ingredients and flavors were well-balanced. Great little spot for a quick, casual bite to eat. 

What makes this place 5-star worthy was the owner, who was unbelievably accommodating, generous, and friendly. The place has a neighborhood feel that makes it a very welcome addition on South Street. I'll definitely be back!

Food, my quesadilla, was good in size and flavor.  Service was carp, bartender, well we needed to pretty vocal to get a refill. Out waitress, with the personality of a pet rock really had me question my food order.  She delivered the food, nothing else, except an awkward comment about the bill upon delivering food.  Evidently, you pay for food before eating, so they bring the bill while I start to eat, and force me to stop and pay while my food gets cold, not the waitress decision, but her execution was bollocks.  

No interest in returning to this place, even though it looks like it could be a fun night out....

I had the worst customer service of my life. The food was good up until the dessert. When I started to eat my sorbet, THERE WAS A SHARD OF PLASTIC ABOUT AN INCH LONG. I told the waiter and when he told his manager about it, she literally ignored it and shooed him away. I am very disappointed in the customer service, seeing as if I was a health inspector, the place would have been shut down immediately. What I experienced could have sent me to the hospital if I had actually swallowed it. I am never ever going back there again, seeing as I want to keep my life.

Delicious and authentic! I paid the dollar extra for the stone bowl, and it was worth it: bibimbap almost like I had in Seoul. Only 3 differences: (1) It was larger than the portions I had in Korea, (2) The egg was cooked, not runny or raw, and (3) I had to ask for the (hot) sauce. The homemade tea was good too. The place itself is tiny, and the owner incredibly nice. I would return in a heartbeat.

For all these years, I never had a cheese steak.  Decide to finally get one.  My family in Ardmore suggested this establishment.  Their recommendation was SPOT ON!  The cheese steak was AWESOME.  It even held well as I made the trek back to Silver Spring.  From here on out, every time I come to Ardmore, I will come here to get my fix.  Forget Pat's or Geno's.  Forget fast food.  This is the place!

I stopped by Mike's for coffee, which is the basis of this review.  The service was decent as the staff was friendly and quick to assist us. The establishment advertises itself as a coffee and ice cream shop, thus I would expect superior quality of both.  In concept, coffee is not that difficult to make as you begin with roasted ground or beans and add water.  Sounds simple, right?  I was amazed that a place billing itself for coffee had poor quality coffee, i.e., brown water in this instance. As a native of Nashville, there are certainly better places for coffee and dessert, such as Cafe Coco. I had had coffee all over the United States and this place is one of the worst, but please keep in mind that I did not try to the ice cream. The location of Mike's is well suited for heavy foot- traffic and I suspected it targets tourists. Please do not be deterred to trying the ice cream. I may do so myself.

So this is review is not based on the quality of the food as they never delivered it! On May 26th, I ordered through Grubhub, which turned out to be a lifesaver. Why? Because when I attempted to call them they did not answer. I called back the next day and was told they would not refund me because they tried to deliver it, but no one answered the door. Yet, I never heard the knock, my dog never barked (she goes crazy when someone knocks), and I never got the confirmation that my food is on the way (that Grubhub sends when the restaurant confirms via their app that the food is out for delivery). Simply put, they tried to rip me off, which is something they apparently do to their customers on a fairly consistent basis, based on their other Yelp reviews. Luckily, sine I ordered through GH, they refunded me on their own. I am just pissed that I had included a 20% tip when I ordered. This is my only yelp review, in fact, I signed up just to post this. Customers beware!

We've been traveling the country for over a year since selling our home in California.  Consequently, we have taken many, many tours in multiple cities across the United States.  This cemetery and voodoo tour was, perhaps, the best we have encountered.  The tour was spectacular because of our tour guide, Adam.  His pithy comments about New Orleans, the St. Louis Cemetery #1, and voodoo made the two hour tour entertaining, informative, and captivating.  If you can only do one thing in New Orleans, take this tour, especially if you can get Adam as your tour guide.  As the five star description on Yelp suggests, "It's as good as it gets."

Okay so the exterior looks a little wild but this place is great. Everything is delicious, try the fried tomato skin appetizer! The best part is the large kids play area...you can enjoy dinner (and wine!) while your kids are entertained. Definitely a hidden Tampa gem.
Highly recommend this place for Chinese! Food is always fresh, service is fast and the prices are great!!
Eggplant Parmesan sub is amazing! You need to eat it with a knife and fork because it's jam packed. Enough for 2-3 meals.

Coming from queens  NY I know hero sandwiches. This place makes great Hero or subs. The Italian my wife said was very good and the large is enough for 2. Chicken salad with Swiss pickles and onions..awesome. Again just a great hero sub. Prices are very good also. 15 min drive from irb but well worth it..

Warning: be careful with reservations. We made a dinner reservation far in advance, and when we arrived our table was not ready. At first, no big deal/it happens. However, after waiting for 40 minutes outside, there was still no telling when our table would be ready. We were offered to squeeze into a (small) two person table for our reservation of three. There were no accommodations made, we were basically shit out of luck. So FYI if you plan a nice dinner ahead of time, reservations mean very little at this restaurant. They are obviously new to the business side of things, and really need to get it together. Will not be returning, nor do I recommend. (Also - first time I've ever felt the need to write a yelp review, it was that poorly handled).
Excellent pizza, surprising for the location. It's pretty rundown and watch out for drunk people. I recommend the honey mustard chicken pizza.
Eggs over medium where cold and NOT cooked right. Overall food was bad. However, the atmosphere is what you pay for and the architecture is pretty.

I just love wawa. My go to meal is the macaroni and cheese with mashed potatoes and chicken strips. It's a great place to pick up a quick breakfast. Unbelievable hash browns. Service is usually nice, the food comes out in reasonable time. Warm and fairly priced. 
Best day is free coffee day though. Any size. Self service.

I have to give this place 5 stars based on one thing. The sauce. That is all that matters in an Italian restaurant. Theirs is mixed with ricotta, at least for the eggplant parmigiana. Maybe that's cheating to slip cheese in there but it is a real treat to find good sauce in an Italian restaurant in tampa. 

We ordered the eggplant parmigiana and two pizzas. One gardinia pizza with eggplant,  zucchini and other vegetables. And a classic margherita pizza as we wanted a point to compare to the other places we've tried. 

The pizza is good. Three stars. The toppings were good. Mine came out a bit too cool but my husbands pizza was piping. My mother loved the pizza. The crust can be better but it is good pizza for the average person (I'm admittedly a  pizza snob). 

The eggplant parmigiana was 4 stars. Very good. A delight!  Eggplant very tasty. My husband thought it was too mushy but I liked it. The cannoli's were very good. The filling was a little thin for me but good flavor. Apparently they have tiramisu too. 



The service is out of this world. Sam greeted us at the door and was very friendly. Heather our waitress was on top of all concerns. A young man came out to serve the pizza and he was laughing and joking with us 

The music there is soooo amazing!!!  I was rocking out to bon jovi and Michael Jackson. 

The place is huge. Lots of money put into that place. They need to market more to get it packed. No one was hardly there. 

I noticed they have Italian lessons starting up sept 16. Dinner and a lesson. I think I'll join. Why not? 

I'll go back for sure. Nice atmosphere and I want to try more non-pizza items as well as the coffees.
Owner is very friendly, food is great and is made quick. I'm a regular here and love this place. Highly recommend for quick good food.

Have been here twice with my boyfriend. We had great food and service both times. The menu is a good size and there is an airy atmosphere to the place. Mike was behind the bar during the Italian Festival when we stopped in, and he was quite a fella. He was a great example of what good service looks like. The lamb burger is awesome!!

Pros: Decor, Alcohol variety, Simple menu selections, TV placement for sports viewing, friendliness of the staff and of course the "scenic views."

Cons: Restrictions on glass size for beer selections with higher ABV% (If you're not driving, then your glass size shouldn't matter), the drive in and out of the parking lot is riddled with potholes, menu items are overpriced for food has is only average in quality. 

The other guests in my party felt that their food was about average, but overpriced for what amounts to being nothing more than your typical bar food. I ordered the Ghost Pepper wings after being informed by the waitress that they were "really hot," but they were nothing of the sort. The wings were small, dry,  overcooked and the heat level of the sauce was very disappointing. Their Ghost Pepper wings had about the same heat level as what you might expect from the "hot" selection on a menu at BW3. 

Overall, the environment was aesthetically pleasing and the staff were very courteous, but the food was nothing to rave about. I have to agree with the guests in my party: The food quality is what you might expect to find in any pub, only more expensive. I may return for a beer and a basket of their fire fries, but certainly not for a meal.
Went Fri afternoon and had a nice time.  Service a little slow, but food was decent and oysters were fresh.

Love, love, loved this place! During our first visit, the staff was very helpful and accommodating. We loved it so much that we got it again on our way out of town. Mocha milkshake with an extra shot of espresso...that is my recommendation! So good!
OMFG Red Velvet Cake ICE CREAM. Thanks.

My family and I are not high maintenance customers in any way. When we arived were seating by a very nice host. As we sat down out waitress served the family next to us and promptly walked past us. No eye contact, no hello, no "I will be right with you". We waiting 23 minutes to be exact, as she walked passed us 4 other times, not saying one word or attempting to make eye contact. Never have I been stood up by a waitress.

Stopped by here right after lunch. My dad's first comment was that it's easy to get in and out of this Target's plaza in comparison to the other Target on Broadway. It's fairly clean and the staff is friendly! I was greeted when I was standing by the dollar section, looking at some cute doggy costumes and the cashier was a-OK as well!

Amazing!!!! second best ice cream I've ever had in my life. First was on a farm in Connecticut where I'm pretty sure the milk was straight from the cows I could smell while eating, so I'm holding pretty high standards. This is a must go to for when your in Nashville!

Holy moly this place is amazingly delicious and the staff is super friendly. My family and I tried 3 different sandwiches and they were all incredible and so fresh. Portions are huge too. Oh, and the cookies are what dreams are made of.

I like the pizza here, they are my go-to delivery pizza. Decent crust, sauce isn't too sweet as I find at Dakota, and they are generous with cheese and toppings. 

They are sometimes inconsistant, I think it just comes down to who is on shift.

Delivery is always fast and good, though, and they have the cane sugar coke in glass bottles. Yum!

BARFFFFF......Horribly over priced, not tasty with AWFUL customer service..here's the email I sent to them: I wanted to share my dining experience with you...in hopes that you can do better to the next customer. I can kinda understand, at an airport you don't get a lot of repeat customers....please verify my email with your manager on duty...
#1 - ordered a cheese steak - you were out of Kaiser  rolls, not the end of the world but you were also out a cheese that a gentleman ordered on his salad and some thing else the lady behind me ordered
#2 after looking around at other dining options I came back and ordered a roast beef sandwich...2 workers were in the back for minutes...when some one 
finally came out she made my sandwich and gave it t the wrong person...I said to the employee I thin you just gave my sandwich to someone else...she said "it's dirty back here I don't know what ticket that was". So she reluctantly and made my sandwich and the kicker to this evening was she almost threw the sandwich at me and said 'here you go" as if she was bothered by the fact that I ordered food from your establishment. 

I was absolutely disgusted at the fact that you were nearly out of everything then after I came back I was treated as if your company did me a favor after screwing up the order then finally making the sandwich...by the way it wasn't all that great.

but please don't take my word...I encourage you to talk to the manger on duty because the young lady who made my sandwich has no business working in front of customers.

Here's to hoping you can offer someone else a better experience. + yelping this.

Kate

Ordered for the first time a few weeks ago.  I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of the food and how delicious it was.  I ordered a pasta dish and the mozzarella sticks.  Both were hot when they arrived, the delivery driver was friendly and everything was in tact.  The mozzarella sticks did have a thick batter, but it states that on the menu.  I was sad when I found out they were closed on Sunday.  We have been ordering from Mimmo's Pizza for our pasta and while it is "ok" we were pleased to know that now can order for DeSandro on Main and enjoy quality fresh food.  Thanks!

AWESOME!  Sandwiches are large enough for 2-3 ppl.  And what a deal too   Prices are incredibly reasonable.  Eat in or take out. I grabbed an italian for my plane trip home. Fresh ingredients, so full of meat and veggies you can barely fit it in your mouth. I will definitely be back next time I'm in the area. This is an authentic east coast italian deli!  Yea!!!!!!

I'm unfortunately at this location twice a week as it is on my way home and nothing else is, but today I've had it with this place. Not once in my 2 years of shopping there has there been shopping baskets waiting for me. Not once. I've had to go in and get one from the checkout lines everytime. Both times I've chosen complained about this I've met met with indifference. I know it's not a huge deal, so have shrugged it off, but the other issues with today's trip took me over the edge. No lettuce except 3 heads of wilty green leaf and bagged lettuce. No iceberg, no romaine, nothing. Surreal. Worse than that, the seafood counter was totally closed with only a sign that read "closing at 4 today for lack of help". Long lines at the checkout and I choose the one where the woman with the screaming child in front of me paid with a million WIC checks that took forever to process...well, you get the idea. Avoid this place if you can. I sure wish this part of town had an alternative.

I've been on a couple haunted tours in the city and this one was by far the best. Janine is truly all about facts and history. I felt like I was also on a history tour and truly learned a lot about the city of New Orleans. Definitely requesting you on our next tour, Janine! Thanks for a wonderful fun filled evening!

Been here for a night and must say that it is one of the hidden gems.

Very inexpensive for what all they offer.

Staff are amazing, rooms are amazing clean, breakfast is great and the atmosphere is just out of the world.

For a Fairfield inn, I think it does a lot more than what it should...

Often hearing this place mentioned in the same context as Jeni's and Legato Gelato, I had high hopes for this place. I certainly enjoyed eating it, but then again, I just enjoy eating ice cream in general. Ultimately, though, I wouldn't say it was any better than a place like Baskin Robbins. That's not necessarily a bad thing, and it's certainly nice to know about if you happen to be downtown, but I wouldn't say it's worth going out of one's way to acquire in the way that Jeni's and Legato are. The consistency of the ice cream is not quite the way I would prefer it, and I prefer flavor profiles which are a little more in-your-face. Mike's diverse selection includes a lot of crowd pleasers, but nothing particularly memorable in my opinion. Still, the price is reasonable given the location, the portions are ample, and let's be honest, it's hard to REALLY go wrong with ice cream.

3.5 stars if I could.  I like the space, service was fine, and it's the only dining place in my new LS hood I hadn't been to (save for Lafayette Fire Co., which I'm in no hurry to try but will I'm sure at some point).  The food was fine - had a house salad and chicken spedini, but nothing special.  There is a Monday lunch buffet that might be a nice option to try sometime, and I'll give dinner a whirl as well.  Prices are all very reasonable.

I really love Roast, though I find it expensive. They serve your standard coffee drinks, with some twists like a bacon & maple latte. I love the option of ordering a beer or wine when I meet my friend for coffee, because sometimes, at the end of a work day, that's just what you need. They don't have a bad collection either, and I'm impressed with the unique variety of import bottles. Roast is a nice venue too, with exposed beams and brick, and they frequently have live music. There's few things more wonderful than curling up in an armchair in front of a fire with a good drink, and listen to someone strum a guitar. Roast is a regular stop on my favorite coffeeshop rotation, and I'll keep coming back for more.

Ice cream in the dead of winter? Yes, it was a lot colder in Nashville than I thought it would be and I only packed t-shirts and yes I was freezing on Music Row but why not get in some ice cream, especially when it's cold? It's my version of joining the polar bear club.

The inside looks like an old school soda shop which is nice. I always wanted to see what one looked like and Mike's fits the bill, even the soda jerk mural on the wall.

Decor only goes so far though, if you come to a place that says it is an ice cream fountain you better have the goods to back it up. I got the pistachio and peanut butter in a cone. My friend for nutter butter and the raspberry cheesecake. My peanut butter scoop was a little too thick, it was really like frozen peanut butter, delicious but really heavy. However, my pistachio was dead on though I thought it was flavorful but still light.

I tried the butter butter and it was what I was looking for in the peanut butter flavor. After reading the reviews and finding it's one of their homemade flavors I know why it was so good. The raspberry cheesecake also stood out and was jealous of the choice she made.

I would normally award three stars but something stuck out to me during my visit, at the front of the store was a gentleman who obviously hadn't bought anything in a while and was disheveled looking. It was cold out and the staff and owners had it in their hearts to let this man stay out of the cold and warm up as long as their doors were open, that should stand for something.

The owner Dennis is extremely unpleasant.  If you can use another store I would suggest it.  We just dropped off a package and when we asked for a receipt he asked if we really needed it.  I'm pretty sure I wouldn't ask if I didn't need it.  Geez 
This was not the first time but it will probably be last.  He's really just a rude person in general not sure why he would work in customer service.

We took the combination cemetery/voodoo tour - we LOVED it. I was expecting a bit of voodoo schlock a la Bourbon Street's version of voodoo, but this whole tour was fascinating.

The tour meets at a coffee house on Royal Street. We walked over to St. Louis Cemetery #1, which happens to be the final resting place for famous names such as Marie Laveau and Homer Plessy. Our guide Adam was full of information, even before we arrived at the cemetery. The best thing about the tour was Adam's passion for history, cemeteries, and for the city itself, even with all of its faults. It was really affecting. Adam was really easy-going and approachable, and he often stopped what he was saying to answer any questions that popped up.

He ended the tour by bringing our group to the Voodoo Spiritual Temple on Rampart Street across from the famous Congo Square. We got to meet Priestess Miriam, a very interesting woman with a lot of knowledge to offer.

All in all, this tour is worth every penny.
Excellent sports bar.  Great food and beer selection.  The bartenders, Amber, Brooke and Eric are the best!

I actually had a great experience at this lenscrafters.

For some context, the last time I had bought a pair of glasses was in the 10th grade at Costco, so 9 years later this was a different experience.  

I originally got my glasses from the KoP lenscrafters.  That was whatever, no biggie, insurance covered most of it and I walked out same day with some cool frames.  I went back to KoP when my lenses got scratched, I was able to drop them off and pick up a refined pair in 1 hour.  

When a lens popped out and lost, I went to Ply Meeting lenscrafters.  Instead of finding a replacement lens, the dude let me pick out a completely new frame.  If this isn't enough of a reason to go to lensecrafters, I dont know what is.

Cool, I had a new frame and all was good.  I lost that pair when they fell out of my pocket while running (optical pro tip - store your frames or wear them).

I went to the KoP lensecrafters and purchased the same frame + lenses (warranty did not cover lost frames).  Ply Meeting set the bar so high, I have 0 intention to return to this KoP lensecrafters my last visit.  Ply Meeting all day, the best lensecrafters in the west.

One word describes this grays ferry store's customer service (lack thereof, actually):

Ghetto.

If this is what you enjoy, you'll love it.  Otherwise, steer clear.  You'll come out of there just as miserable as the people working there.

What a cool brewery in the middle of an industrial area turned into a semi-art area.  The brews were and are delicious and the atmosphere is laid back. The staff were knowledgable, friendly and passionate about what they were offering.  I strolled in on a Saturday afternoon to check it out and left with a growler full of goods and a new sweatshirt!  I love their merchandise because their logo is really neat and the prices are very reasonable.  Who doesn't want to rep local breweries?!

Ordered two lemon lime margaritas and a peach margarita with salt at a food truck event at the McKinley Art Center tonight. Amazing drinks. The margaritas were each $6 but the completely fill the cups. They sold beer too but we didn't buy anything. 

The owners are really nice. I believe it is a father-son duo. 

I hope to see them around more often. Great great great drinks.

This Target misses the mark. 

Target is Target.... but this one was squeezed into an existing space and the layout is completely discombobulated. 

If you don't mind searching and searching you'll like this place otherwise set your sights on somewhere else.

Excellent place to eat
One the thing that I love about this place is that services was on point . 

The menu is small but it is just right , how time do you go some places new and just stare at the menu and get what you normally get everywhere . You see what you and order and it comes out right away.
Love it will be back later in the week

Can not recommend enough. Coffee, mocha, morning bun (warmed), breakfast biscuit sando, avocado toast, yes I had all of this and it was amazing. If I lived next door I would be 400lbs. I love this place! Everything you hope for when the sign says bakery. One day server was a bit dingy next day awesome but ey, shits tough out there.

Went for lunch and I was not impressed with the food or the service. The soup-salad-bread lunch was off the menu and the food we did get tasted like it had been under the heat lamp for hours. The server left the check with out entrees and then didn't return to fill our drinks or check on our food. Terrible.

I don't give 5 stars lightly. Bier is a world-class brewery, one of the best in Indy, and one of the three that I go to the most (along with Union and Black Acre). Here are the reasons why their beer is great:

* High quality and consistency (gotta have this, of course).

* Distinctive house style. Bier beer is instantly recognizable. Their beer has a very fresh, lucid, clear, clean taste with all of the flavors distinct. Good balance, and the flavors pop in a certain way that is hard to describe. Try it and you'll see what I mean.

* A solid niche. Although Bier can do hoppy very well (their PDG pale ale is distinctive and a real favorite), that's not their focus. They do lagers, wheat beers, and less-hoppy ales with great skill, and they make them exciting and interesting as well. Yesterday I sampled their International Exchange lager and Good Pils (humble name, this!), and both were subtly incredible.

Beyond the beer, there are some other great reasons to visit:

* Friendly staff with a great vibe. They clearly are enjoying their work and are fans of their own brewery.

* Great, comfortable space. It's inviting and easygoing.

* Dogs welcome inside!

* They don't do flights, but you can sample all of the beers at the counter.

* Lots of live music and activities.

If you are a beer nut, Bier definitely belongs high on your list to try. If you are looking for a good place to hang out with friends and have a sip of brew that will please connoisseurs and average drinkers alike, I do believe you will be pleased.

Food was awful!  Hamburger was burnt and cold.  Wrong  toppings. French fries were room temperature and already salt with to much salt. Don't order from there if you're looking for a regular hamburger and fries they can't handle it!!!

Not a bad choice for a quick Friday night pick up choice. The pizza crust reminds me of Pizza Hut (buttery and not crispy dough), I had a four topping pizza which was way to much and they over loaded which for me isn't a good thing because I was unable to taste the bacon that I had ordered. The sauce is darker but not super tasty As it was overpowered by the amount of cheese that was put on. All in all not a bad pizza but I will be getting less toppings next time and a smaller pizza.

Compared to the Oxnard Riverpark location, this location is a little lacking. There's no children's or baby department. And the men's department is a bit smaller, too. (If you are plus size or pregnant, there's no plus size or maternity section either) 

But there are deals. On a recent trip, I got a couple of cute tops and a pair of stretchy skinny jean crops all for under $35 including tax. That's really hard to find in SB, let alone downtown. 

Yes, most of the stuff is cheap looking and made in China but occasionally you can find some gems that look way more expensive than they are and I found some made in the UK and USA items on a recent trip, which I've never seen there before. 

Bottom line: A fun place to poke around for some deals/truly cute items if you have the time and patience. If you want more of a selection, need larger sizes or kids' stuff, head to Oxnard.

This place has amazing unique flavors of ice cream! I had to get the banana pudding ice cream! It was the best I've ever tasted! Everyone tried mine and loved it just as much! It's open late and was a perfect treat to end our last night in Nashville. Being a Sunday night everything was closing early and this place was right in front of us and still open! It definitely reminds you of those cute old fashioned ice cream parlors!

Attended a comedy night last weekend and they were all hilarious, I had tears in my eyes at one point! I tried a couple of different beers before making my selection, and the bartender was very knowledgeable and helpful. I love that they are dog friendly and I can't wait to come back and bring my dog!! I would definitely suggest the comedy nights or any event they host, it was a great night!

I honestly adore this bakery in Santa Barbara! I don't get many chances to wake up on a Sunday to gorgeous weather and be able to casually enjoy a small morning snack but for the first time in a long time, I was finally able to do this! No better time spent than at Helena Avenue Bakery. The only way I can describe the vibe here is modern rustic with a cute outdoor seating area that's shaded with umbrellas. A small part of me was making comparisons between this place and Republique in LA which is a huge compliment given all the great things about Republique! The scale of their menu and baked goods are much smaller though but the vibe here still somehow reminds me of Republique. I chose three items to share between 2 people. 
-Matcha Latte - fairly standard, price about what I expect for the size, would recommend getting a hot one
-Blueberry and Lemon scone - I'm not typically a scone persony but I really wanted to try this one out. I wasn't disappointed! Lots of blueberry with a lemony glaze. The scone was flaky on the outside and soft on the inside.
-Peanut and cashew butter with Banana toast - Hands down one of the best nut butter mix spreads I've ever had spread thickly over perfectly toasted sourdough bread. I wonder if they make it in house or if it's bought from somewhere because....I need more of this! The thinly sliced banana pieces cover the entire toast topped with bits of rosemary which just adds that extra flavor kick. As easy as it sounds like it is to make this at home, enjoying the toast here was pretty darn delicious. 

Overall, I'm a huge fan, I would definitely come back if I visited Santa Barbara again. I wish they had a larger variety of baked goods to try!

What a great concept! 38 wines on tap, oh yeah! This is a fantastic spot for those looking to learn/explore the world of wine. They have a very versatile wine list...the staff was very warm and welcoming...eager to share their passion for wine. I'm just hoping this crew opens a location in Houston! Ask for Mike at the bar...friendly and knowledgeable!

I bought my Walking tour group into Mikes Ice Cream today to cool off with some ice cream. They all bought a cone and absolutely loved it. Awesome place to take a pause on Market Street ie. 2nd Avenue to cool off and get a little local taste!
Free Tours by Foot Nashville

This is now my favorite place. Third trip since it opened in early December and it's turning into a habit. Healthy, flavorful, food is $5 a bowl and does a decent job filling you up.  For the ravenous, bring a friend and split 3 between you.  Probably the best quality food for the buck in the city.

On a positive, the pizza was great.  Excellent pepperoni and meat ball pizza.  Quality food, terrible service.  The waiter was short and rude.  Then he takes a cigarette break when our group was trying to collect our check.  Good food, bad service.  Maybe you'll experience better service.

Had the fish tacos average at best
Just so so
Girlie bar girls but with bad waitress skills

Delicious, convenient, and trendy. Caviar and Bananas is a great spot for Vanderbilt students and professionals alike. A variety of different options, with coffee and breakfast offered until 11:30 am and lunch options (salad bar, soups and sandwich station, grocery story, etc). I love their Far East Salad. Completely vegan! Lots of great options for vegans and vegetarians. Plenty of seating and a great space for meeting people, studying, or just chilling. It's adjacent to the Aertson Hotel, so this is a good spot for visitors to the city. Excited to return!

BEST. STEAK. EVER.  We drive an hour for the peppercorn tenderloin. It's fabulous....everything about it. The house dressing is delicious. And the fried artichoke hearts with butter dipping sauce....amazing.  You can't go wrong.

This went from a horrible review to an A-Ok review.

Asked for a medium rare brunch burger, received a well done burger with burnt bacon and 4 bite sized bits of potato with an awkward arrangement of grapes and strawberries. I took a couple bites hoping the burger would be more red and put it down on my plate. My boyfriend ordered their crabcake eggs benedict which came with fully poached eggs (no runny yolk), cold crabcakes, and dried out asparagus. We're not picky people and we never send food back to the kitchen, ever.

The manager came around and we both hesitated when she asked us how everything was. We explained what happened with our order and it was clear we hadn't eaten much of our brunch. Without even blinking she said she would replace our meal and that it would be comped. I've never seen such instant customer service. The food that replaced our original dish was night and day, it was like different people had cooked it.

I'm not jumping this to a 4 star because even though the replacement food we received was exceptionally better, it was still just mediocre food. I have to say that the service is great, the servers and managers were quick, apologetic, and did everything they could to make our experience better.
Just got done eating here, really disappointed at the quality of the food. Kind of a bummer since we don't get to go out to dinner much.

Kelcie is a horrible bartender.  We waited to order food for over 10 minutes.  Food was good , not worth the bad service though.  Beer sucks at 27.8 degrees, too icy.  Took over fifteen minutes to pay the bill and it wasn't even busy.

Such a cool microbrewery and tap room.  Bier is located in an unassuming strip mall on 65th St. just west of Binford.

The tap room is huge, and the tasting bar is all the way in the back.  Unfortunately (or fortunately depending on your point-of-view) the bar is tiny and can only accomodate about 10 people at a time.  This is good in a way because you get personalized attention from whoever is pouring your beers.  They will go out of their way to describe each beer they have on tap.   And describe they must because they usually have a prodigious number available at the time.  I think they had at least 10 the last time I was there.

They have no "house beers", meaning that if you find one you especially enjoy, you better fill a growler or two because it may not be available the next time you come.  They do try to have certain styles available all the time (i.e. lager, ale, etc.)

Reno, NV

A little slow being seated.  Friendly people, nice and ambient place to be. Good house Red wine if you want my recommendation.

This Pathmark has been in a downward spiral for years, I returned today after several months and fear it has hit rock bottom. First of all, the smell of something "off" hits you in the face when you walk in.  Produce was overpriced (more expensive than Rittenhouse Square prices) and near spoiled. Selection of other groceries is extremely limited.
Friendly chef owner, good food, very fair prices, this is now one of my go-to places. I highly recommend it!

Being Korean, I love traditional bibimbap, and BAP does it SO SO well. I LOVE the marinated beef and this version comes with a ton of veggies: broccoli. carrots, mushroom, cabbage, an egg of course, and soybeans! I would highly suggest paying an extra buck for that crunchy rice on the bottom! Prices are super cheap and the quality is amazing, food delicious and healthful! Love this place and will definitely be in my Korean food fix rotation.

Delicious food! The dolsot is excellent and came out sizzling hot. Great for a cold winter's day. Very spicy. Egg was made to perfection! Great place for folks with lactose intolerance/dairy allergies.

Great place, great beer.  Not much to the front, public area, but it's comfy.  A good number of beers always on tap, but they change every week.  Bier doesn't have a constant beer like Sun Light/Osiris.  Lighter beers on the right and stronger/bitter beers on the right (hope I remembered that correctly).  Passionate owner and co-workers (family).

This review is less about the food (which is generally good), and not about the service either (which is usually great). Rather this review is about the somewhat dishonest $7, 7 minutes lunch special.

We were short on time, and on a budget after Christmas shopping. We went into the Macaroni Grill for lunch and were seated as usual. Only to find out we had to get up, walk over to the "Kitchen Counter" to place our order and sit in a different seating area in order to get the $7 lunch special.

An awkward experience to say the least. Probably less likely to return now.

What a find!  What a lucky break!
My 11 year old recently enrolled in dance lessons and needed shoes, tights, leotards - the works!

DanceLine and their terrific staff saved the day.
They even have "Foot Undies" -  like little underwear for feet -used in lyrical dancing.

We'll be back!
I stayed at Nashville for 9 days and stopped by Mike's Ice Cream 4 times. The best ice creams I've ever taste. My favorites: birthday cake, raspberry cheesecake and chocolate chip cookie dough.

I found this spot who had some interesting sushi rolls. So, we went over to check it out. With the wall facing the street being all windows, the inside was flooded with natural light. They had a quite large sushi and bar counter in the middle, with seating all around it. They also had small two-person booth seating on the side as well. Very clean decor, I am glad they didn't put up any kind of cheap or fake Asian "artworks" on the wall.

We ordered an appetizer and side dish to go with our sushi rolls. We chose Creamy Rock Shrimp, Lobster Fried Rice, Sindy Roll and Old City Roll. All in all, they were all very tasty, high quality and we enjoyed them very much. Yes, everything was perfect until we ordered some desserts... 

Since they didn't have a dessert menu, we ordered Tree Cake and Green Tea Cheesecake based on the description of the dessert that our waitress gave us. 

This so-called Tree Cake...I call it "rip-off" cake. Our waitress described it as a cake made with almond, egg and butter. When it came out, I was shocked what it really was... If you are familiar with a common and popular sweets in Japan, one of them is called Baumkuchen which is actually a German layered cake. They can be purchased from most bakeries and stores, and not so pricey unless you go to some fancy boutique to get it. The cake we were presented with, in my opinion, was store-bought, and sliced as thinly as possible. For $10, you can buy an entire cake!!! Very disappointing... And on top of that, it was dry (with these thin slices being cut off from the cake, I wonder how long it has been since the cake was first purchased?). And if that is not enough, we were given spoons to eat this...why? I don't know...

Our waitress was very friendly and polite, and we were well taken care of. Everything we had, other than the Tree Cake was great. High quality and tasty, a bit on pricey side, but that comes with the quality. I wish if we made a different choice with the dessert. But then, you live and you learn. If you go there, avoid the tree cake!

I really enjoyed the pick 2 mix and match option for lunch. Good selection of tasty options. My favorite was the chicken Caesar calzonetto. It was really very yummy! The seating outside was nice and shaded so a good option for enjoying a meal outside during the summer. To top it all off our waitress was fantastic!

I have been anxiously awaiting the opening of this new restaurant and was very pleasantly surprised. The ambiance and openness is appealing and comfortable. Everyone was very nice and helpful. I had a hodgepodge of food because I was eating with kids but everything was delicious-pimento cheese, cheese plate, chicken tenders, BBQ chicken and a variety of sides. The coffee and wine bar had a great selection. I can't wait to try brunch. This will definitely be a new go to place for me.
Soooo good! The Nutter Butter might be the best ice cream I've ever had. It was awesome.

My co-worker told me that they have Smoothie King's in the South and that I should try it. Initially, I refused as I had my heart set on a small 400 calorie DQ Chocolate Xtreme Blizzard with Banana. Well, needless to say my co-worker treated me to a 20oz /small Slim N Trip Chocolate smoothie that was only 250 calories and every so good. I've found a healthy replacement to my weekly "cheat" treat.

Just tried this new Japanese restaurant in Old City tonight. There we're seven of us. The service was warm and enthusiastic. Loved the ambiance, they played great music. Full bar with great selection of spirits. The food was absolutely delicious! Had an assortment of sushi and sashimi, steak, crudo, and other appetizers. Everything was quite delicious. This will definitely be our new go-to place in Philly for sushi!

So so so dissappointed.

The service was non-existent. Our waiter was always rushed and didn't even try to make us feel welcomed. After I asked him to get us different prerequisite bread to go wth our frozen butter, he practically took my arm off as he grabbed the basket from my hand.

Why did I ask for different bread? here's a question to answer your question: Can someone please tell me how bread can be both burnt and freezing at the same time?

Overall, the food was really nothing spectacular and it was way overpriced. My chicken florentine was $22. It came with an overly sweet caesar salad and some steamed baby cut carrots. $22 for a piece of chicken? Sue's pasta was pretty good, but even that was sans protein and $17. 

This place has all the makings of a wonderful family jewel, but it's got a ways to go.

EDIT: mark's a good man for reaching out to me, but I stand by my review.
Great beer and phenomenal people. Highly recommended!

Although Mike's made my list of Nashville must-trys on a recent trip, we accidentally stumbled upon this place on a walk of Broadway on a recent trip--and boy, are we glad we did! Mike's is a small ice cream parlor, one that barely fits the patrons and its popularity. There is some effort that went into decorating this place like an old school ice cream parlor, with it's small tables and chairs, counter tops, and unique wall décor. 

Mike serves a wide selection of handmade ice cream in a variety of different ways and they are extremely generous on their scoops. Between the two of us, we shared a single scoop of pralines and cream on a waffle cone and it was almost too much--and we're both like our ice cream! The ice cream is very creamy and incredibly delicious. In this particular flavor, there were generous amounts of praline--a few in every bite, and lots of caramel swirls. Our ice cream was truly divine and it seems like everyone else's ice cream was also delicious as no one could make it to the register without first taking a bite! 

Although we didn't venture this way, I noticed a few cool things that could spice up your ice cream treat here, such as a cookie cone or a Nutella sundae...but who needs spicing to this already delicious treat? Definitely a must try and completely worth the calories!!!

We stopped in to the Macaroni Grill for a friends birthday lunch and this is where she wanted to go.  I'm a sucker for ravioli and I had heard they have really good ravioli.  They share a parking lot with Barnes & Noble and Great Basin Brewing so I imagine parking can be an issue during busy times.  They have two dining options - the first is with their traditional menu where you sit and a waiter takes care of you, the second is their express dining.  It's sort of a lunch line where they make the food fresh, but it's a limited menu and they do it for both lunch and dinner.  We went with the traditional dining and were seated promptly.  Our waiter was friendly and he kept the drinks and fresh bread coming.  The bread was delicious, piping hot with rosemary and they have olive oil and balsamic for dipping.  I ordered the Mushroom Ravioli for lunch and it was really good with lots of mushrooms.  However, I think the plate may have been left under the warmer a bit too long.  The plate was scalding hot - no biggie but the parts of ravioli without sauce were very dry and almost crunchy.  That's really the only reason I'm giving them 3 stars instead of 4.  I was really looking forward to that cheat lunch and it just didn't live up to my expectations.

When you're just craving chocolate...

This was such a cute little candy and chocolate place! They have an array of things and I got the turtle chocolate and the chocolate-covered pretzel. Both a little pricey for my taste but delicious!

The staff were very friendly too. Just needed a quick pick-me up. Delicious!

I Want To Thank ALL The Guys At Iron Horse Auto Body, Especially Craig! I Went In For A Window Placement A Couple Months Ago And Took Them Less Then 4 Hours to fix it. After They Got Done Craig noticed My Blinker Wasn't Working So He Went Outta His Way To Fix The Blinker (and It wasn't just a light bulb) Thank You Guy! Great Customer Service!!!

Refer to the Check-in description. 
Again the staff were great and food was at the high standards of Macaroni grill. 
The house wine (Rossi) was a good choice with the meal.

i shed tears last night...real, salty tears...when i realized that nashville, and, in turn, mike's ice cream, was a 45 minute drive and i would not be able to go daily.  TEARS, I TELL YOU!

this joint is ROCKSTAR!  i got the dark chocolate heath and my girlfriend got the caramel pie...i will carry the memory of that ice cream with me for life!  they have an awesome assortment of flavors, not your typical cold stone or baskin robbins selection.  

PLUS, they currently have hot chocolate from around the world, which means i FINALLY got the mexican hot chocolate i have been CRAVING for a year, ever since i left arizona!  a little bite to it, but not the overwhelming cayenne heat i've been getting from the mixes i've bought to try to get that flavor profile back.

i will be back...again and again!  i wish i was there now...

Soooo creamy. We had vanilla with fudge and raspberry cheese cake. Considering the touristy location the price were reasonable. Definitely a homemade flavor and consistency. Will def  go again.

Line moves quickly. Unlike many places that only list the flavors on the ice cream cases which slows down the line because people block them and you can't decide until you get to the counter, they list the flavors on a separate sign too. Wish more people would do that.

I'm still hunting for a decent Italian restaurant in Reno.  This isn't it.  The food had too much cheese and my daughter's meal barely had any meat on it at all.  Neither one of us ate very much of our meal.

   On the plus side the service was great and the manager comped my daughter's meal since she didn't eat it but I definitely won't be returning here.

The interior of Caviar & Bananas is very aesthetically pleasing but I was underwhelmed by the actual food (I ordered a salad). Because I went on a Saturday, it was very busy and it was a little confusing to figure out where to pay. I really wanted to love it; hopefully I can try it again when it's not so busy.

Marlon from TKO provided the dj services for our company picnic at Purina Farms.  He arrived on time, was pleasant and very easy to work with! The guests enjoyed the music selections he had available. We will use them again if the need arises!

We checked out this new addition to the funk zone and it was tasty! 

We tried the focaccia with cheese, tomato, red onion and kalmata olives. It just came out of the oven, so delicious!

We also had the peanut butter brittle cookie. It was soft, chewy and oh so good!!

The also sell sandwiches, a few sides and bread to take home. 

We will definitely be back to try more of their delectable treats!

This spot is kinda hidden but it definitely shouldn't be. Its super authentic Italian food, anf they make the bread in house and sell fresh dough too. It was pretty great and the size is very good for the money.

I recalled writing a past review, but I'm glad I didn't read it before I decided to post an update - I'm sticking with the 3 stars and despite giving Ardmore Pizza the benefit of the doubt several times over the years, the service has yet to impress.

The food is very good for a pizza place (one of few in the local area) with reasonable prices, but their service doesn't do them any favors - awkwardly pushy employees who aren't paying much attention to the order...clearly, see below. 

Missing side dishes or added toppings are forgivable, but now I'm starting to think they're out to get me based on a 3-star review. Every. single. time. I have visited, I've returned home giggling at how my orders are continuously messed up! I order pretty simple things, but wouldn't you expect to have marinara sauce with your mozzarella sticks? Shame on me - I should have learned my lesson to just check before I pay, but I kept wanting them to be a 4 star joint :\

LaFitte's is a new venture of A J Tusa, owner of New Orleans  Creole Cookery.

Large parking lot just off LAPLCO Blvd & Manhattan.

Nice decor, clean dining area, diverse menu.

We ordered stuffed lobster, mahi-mahi, & stuffed catfish platter.

Lively locals crowd, noisy, cold beer, can't hear music for din.  

"New" waitstaff is being trained.  Expect a little confusion.

Our foods were all disappointing; but folks at nearby tables had much better looking fried seafoods of several kinds.

My advice is to stick with salads, remoulade, & fried  shrimp, catfish, oysters, & softshells.

Cesarina's creations are amazing. She bakes everything with love & you can taste it!  My husband & I LOVE her almond cookies & baked bread. Her homemade sausage & mozzarella are delicious as well... Those are our must haves when we visit her shop, everything else is icing on the cake!  Oh ya, you must try her cannolies & her tiramisu!!! Just go hungry one day & try as much as you can!!!  You won't be disappointed.

I have fond memories of Mike's on Broadway. Now that the "Honky Tonks" have seized the boulevard and staked a bigger claim of SoBros "NashVegas", Mike's has moved around the block. There's more of a low key vibe, but the ice cream is still the best in town. After rambling around the district on your Nash Bash, you are going to need some time to chill. This is it! C'mon over with your new overpriced hat and boots and set your blue jean clad wallet down at the ice cream bar in Mike's. You'll be glad that you did!

Love the new location.  There is more room and better organization in controlling the line for this very busy store.  Ice cream is very good and employees act like they love their job.  It was a pleasant experience.
I've been here many times over the past several years.  I've always gotten the California Cheese Steak sandwich.  Ginormous and Delicious at a great price !

Order delivered was incorrect. I ordered 2 beef but the one that is delivered is beef and the other one was a noodle with rice. And I am not a fan of noodle and rice in a meal.They changed the order without informing me

As a kid we would occasionally eat at places like Rainforest Cafe & Planet Hollywood. It was all about the atmosphere. It seems like Twin Peaks serves the market with a similar approach. The food is fine. Drinks are fine. The service completely varies with each visit -- it seems best when sitting at the bar, less than mediocre at a table. However, it is probably one of the best places in the area to watch multiple games at once. So I guess at this age I'm willing to trade a great dining experience for something more mediocre if it means abundant viewing options on a Sunday during football season. 

Side note: Can anyone explain to me why every stall in the women's restroom has a 3 inch gap on both sides of the door? All these years...and it hasn't stopped being weird.

Naked is a cyber-cafe, one of the first ones to make a go of it in E-town. Maybe that's because it's open 24 hours a day. I've come here a few times when I had to work on projects late at night that had deadlines the next day. When I need a break from working at home but don't want to worry about closing time, this is a good option. It's pretty subdued, and most people here have their nose stuck in terminals with earphones on. There's chess table at the back, so sometimes people play, but mostly it's calm and relaxing. The walls are dark, and the lights are dim; no fluorescents here. They sell coffee and a few food items, but mostly make their money on computer and Internet rentals. This place is cash only, so come with real dough. No virtual stuff accepted here - ironically.

Great pizza, fast delivery less than 30 mins . Cheesier than most of the other pizza options. Terrific. Good delivery
.

Sticky Bun.
Cinnamon Roll.
Green Eggs & Ham Biscuit Sandwich.
Cold Fried Chicken Sandwich.
Potato Salad.

Lovely Place.
Friendly Staff.
DEEEELIOUS Food! 
Would love to return the next time in Santa Barbara!

We typically go to Macaroni Grill  to celebrate  special occasions, due to my moms terminal illness, we have not had opportunity in over a year to  dine out together but  decided to  go for my daughters 24th birthday -  so on 4-2-12 we  picked Macaroni Grill as it had  always been   good in the past. This turned out to  a huge disappointment on several levels -

We  went for lunch  the restaurant  was  basically  empty at 1:45 when we  arrived - 
the service  was  terrible - 
We were presented with the dinner menu  and when we asked for the lunch menu were told  this was all there was...

Once the  order was placed, the waiter parked himself  by the cooking line  & never came back, so we had to ask the bus boy for the Focaccia bread. The waiter then brought  everything  directly after the bread arrived, therefore we didn't have time to enjoy the bread, which  we  normally  devour as soon as it is put in front of us. Then had  to again wait for someone to come back so we could  ask  for balsamic vinegar to  add to the dipping olive oil.

My mom ordered:
Calamari Fritti crisp-fried, pepperoncini, arrabbiata 10
& house salad

The birthday girl ordered:
Bellini Cipriani - la marca prosecco, white peach purée 7

and we shared

Italian for Two @ $25.00

Tappas - Zucchini Fritti
 
Eggplant Quadratini
roasted eggplant, basil, tomato, ricotta salata, red chile 13.5

Chicken Milanese (add $3.00)
arugula Parmesan salad, roasted potatoes,  lemon butter

ok the -   Bellini  in a  tulip glass - lovely  but  $7.00??
The  Calamari was  a disappointment -  pale & - not  crispy  as  advertised-  the  house salad was  good.
Zucchini Fritti -  my daughter & I  each ordered one,  which for a change  was a mistake because one would have been enough for 3,  it was good but... not as good  as it looked on the menu or  I had hoped -  the " ribbons" were  not  long ribbons  instead they were small  pieces and a little greasy - should have  ordered only one of these and a different 2nd  tappas...
The Chicken Milanese was  pounded so thin  that it was  dried out &  had  no flavor -  the coating  was thicker than the chicken& the sauce  over top was  almost  non existent  - the arugula salad  had  absolutely no  taste what so ever,  the potatoes were plentiful, cooked  correctly &  had   loads of roasted garlic  which I did  love -

The eggplant quadratini was good going down, not so  much  later that evening when my daughter became ill and eventually  threw up after being miserable for several hours ... therefore she never touched the  leftovers...

The  ambiance we had always loved  in the  dining room  was  gone -  the music was no longer classic Italian music, the beautiful white gladiolas  were gone and  the happy birthday song which the waiters sing  in Italian never even happened - 
The hostess never looked up from the stand  to say goodbye -


Total for lunch for 3 guests including tip  almost  $70.00 

I don't think we  will  be using  Macaroni Grill for our special occasions anymore...

Everything I tasted was good!!  We had the ricotta rounds & tried a sample of the house pizza.  My friend got the manicotti - which she said was a little too cheesy,  but my chicken with veggies was outstanding! !  Highly recommend this place.  Reasonable prices and great food :)

YES!

Love this place and have since I moved to Nashville in 2004.  The consistency is always on point and the flavors are to die for. The Red Velvet Cake ice cream with a Chocolate dipped cone is my absolute favorite. Even when there is a line out the door, the staff knows how to keep it moving.  In this weather, that is much appreciated!

Perfect place to stop in for a latte or ice cream while you're trotting around downtown.

In a clamshell: the food was pretty darn good. The service sucked. 

Went on a busy Saturday night. After missing our reservation due to traffic, the hostess helped us to get seated right away. That was awesome. The restaurant is beautiful. We were told that the menu was new this weekend. Everything looked good, so maybe the menu is a bit too big, but that's not really a problem. After looking over the menu for a few minutes, the waitress came over to give us a "tour" of the menu. Dear Doc M's: This is not people's first time eating in a restaurant. No one needs a tour of the menu.

Ordered some oysters, which were FANTASTIC! Loved the Shooting Points-had never tried those before. Then the waitress came back to give us a tour of the menu (yes-another one). Remember, by this point, we had had menus for almost 20 minutes. We cut her off and told her we were ready to order. It took about 25 minutes for apps to come out. The clam chowder, a special this month, had a great flavor profile, but was definitely too thick, and for a $9 caesar salad, it was way too small. Entrees were very good, but definitely on the small side. Lobster roll was NOT served on buttered brioche, but instead on a small hoagie roll with bland fries. Grilled and blackened swordfish were both delicious. 

In the future, I think we would definitely go back, because the food was very good. But, you might be better off just getting a bunch of appetizers and items from the raw bar considering the size of the entrees. I hope they do away with the menu tours, and the coupons at the end offering free appetizers. That's cheesy.

I wanted to update and add a star. This deli is just a great spot for an excellent Hoagie and fresh made Italian salads, pastas, cookies, bread, etc... They have recently added some very nice wines - so now they have everything you could possibly need for a nice Italian meal, all in one shop! They have a couple of little tables, but it's really best suited for take-out.  Well worth the stop, though - I LOVE this little place!

My boyfriend and I took the Cemetery and Voodoo walking tour. Our guide was Adam, who does tours with this business and the Save Our Cemeteries organization. Adam does not disappoint, you can hear the passion he has for his beloved New Orleans. He answered all of our questions and presented stories that I would have never gotten out of tour guide book. Many thanks to Adam and NO Spirit Tours.
Food was delicious and place is not crowded at all. Nice experience.

I haven't tried enough food to give a very thorough review, but my experience at the bar was great! I was excited to try the Frosé, which definitely does the trick but tasted slightly like medicine. I love a dry Rosé, but I wish they had a sweeter one in the machine. 
My friend and I shared a few small plates and a cheese & charcuterie board, which was way too much food, but everything we had was great other than the salmon dip, not a lot of flavor. The eggs and wings were awesome! I want to go back and try their salads and the gourmet food. 
Might I add, the atmosphere is fantastic. Grab a few canned Rosé from the cooler for $3.99, go hang out at Centennial... made a fantastic day. And it's much cheaper than the $8 glasses they serve in the restaurant.
Another nice visit with great service, an involved manager who remembers you and nice food. Keep up the good work!

We all scream for Mike's Ice Cream!  It was so good.  This is not my favorite ice cream place ever, but its very good and as good as it gets, or at least that I could find, while I was in Nashville.  It was so hot the week I was visiting Nashville and this was a true joy to find.  Creamy ice cream in fantastic flavors... try the nutter butter!  Its a must try if you love ice cream!

Their bibimbap and their sides were awesome. They had seasonal kimchi - cucumber kimchi to be exact! It was deliciouss just like the cucumber kimchi I had in Korea. Their pajeong (scallion pancake) was also REALLY good albeit a bit different from the ones in Korea. I like this place a lot. Simple interior, set menu, good stuff.

I would go lower than one star if I could. They don't clean anything in there. I went there and had three drinks and was throwing up for 7 hours. They don't clean their soda lines and I doubt they clean much else. If they don't care about the health of their customers they don't deserve to even be open. I will never be back and I hope they go out of business and are replaced by someone who actually cares.

By far, my favourite coffeehouse in the city! I have never had great coffee until I started going to Roast. 

We stop in at least once a week, more if I have the time. I usually have the pleasure of seeing Josh in the mornings, and he is just so friendly (as is all the staff there) and I am pretty sure he remembered my name after the first time I came to Roast.

The drinks are all fabulous, and the small amount of food I have tried here, I have enjoyed. 

Oh if you remember to, order one of their cookies! They are delicious and I am sad I only discovered them almost a year after they opened.

Excellent service. I sat at the bar to watch the games and have some seafood. Good quality food but a little pricey. Tony the bartender was very inviting and I highly recommend the 'Cool as a Cucumber' drink. Overall a good experience.
I was helped by a gal named Margarita-she was incredibly helpful and knowledgeable  in regards to what I was looking for and available merchandise. Thanks again Margarita!

If there was an option for no stars, this restaurant would receive a zero rating. I'm not surprised though, the last time we were here, the food was bad then too. I must say that over the many years dining at this particular restaurant, the food has gone downhill. I ordered mamas trio and the food came out cold! Not just sitting in the window warmed ready to be taken the table, but cold out of the frig. I had our server touch the fettuccini with his finger to verify and he concurred that the noodles were refrigerator cold. He then took my plate and must have placed it in he oven and yes it came back hot, but the bottom of the lasagne was burnt and stuck to the plate, I couldn't scrape it off to eat it. Not to mention that he price of $19 was way too much for the small portions without a salad. We were one of only four tables in the restaurant and not once did my tea get refilled. My husbands tea sat empty at the edge of the table for quite some time and was refilled as we were paying our bill. My husband had the chicken scallopini--the exact same item he has had for years and obviously the recipe has changed...for the worse. There was no sear in the chicken, it tasted boiled. The cheeses for the first time tasted like velveeta, not the original butter and cream recipe.  The kids each had spaghetti and meatballs and no thank you, we don't want to mix those leftovers to take home. And just like last time, the bread was dry and tasted like it was old, not fresh out of the oven like we used to get.  Not once did our server come back and ask us how we were doing or if we needed anything. Sad to say, but you lost our business.

My husband, myself and our friends have always wanted to try Twin Peaks and drove 45 minutes to do so and it was a complete let down. Our friends arrived before us and were already seated.
