We started the appetizer sampler which really is just a taste of a bunch of different appetizers (calamari, fried mozzarella, bruschetta, etc.).  We also ordered desserts which were huge - I'm not a dessert person, and I didn't even try a bite, but people seemed generally satisfied.

The service was actually great.  The bottle of wine we ordered wasn't available, and they provided a few other options and allowed us to try them.  Also, our server was really attentive and nice.

I always stop in for the thin crust pizza. Basil, tomatoes, mozzarella spread generously. The Quattro cannoli from the tapas menu is another favorite. Since they redid the menu with the "tapas" dishes, I've enjoyed this place much more than in the past. My girlfriend always likes to build her own pasta dish. I usually prefer the meat based dishes over the pasta based.

The atmosphere/decor: 4 stars 

Service: 4 stars 
Our soy sauce pod was empty and we told one of the servers, he switch our pod with the empty table next to us lol...i don't know why he didn't refill it ‍ 

Food: 3 stars 
We ordered the sashimi sampler, japanese uni and toro (my fav) but was disappointed. The "freshness" was average. I don't know how they have a 4 star rating. We also ordered the scallop crudo as an app but they ran out of all the ingredients that went with it (i order that app because of the ingredients). They made it with completely different ingredients and the flavors did not go well together in my opinion. 

I don't think i would return for dinner or recommend anybody to come here if you're looking for good sush.

Okay, so you're asking, "What kind of jerk shouts out a commercial supermarket?" I do.

Why? Because time after time, I meet Philly 20-somethings complaining about the cost of groceries in Philadelphia. Few people ever venture to Gray's Ferry (unless for cheap car washes...more on that to come), but PathMark is the best to get all your essentials.

Pathmark is DIRT CHEAP, has a huge selection, and tons of free parking. What I would suggest is that you get your produce and meats at a Mom & Pop or Trader Joe's, but everything else... come to Pathmark. While it's five steps below a Fresh Grocer, this is very comparable to Acme, which sucks up money like marrying Robin Givens. 

There's another one on Oregon Ave, but I've never been... this one has been a staple in my routine for over four years.

Was really excited to try bar one as I used to live less than a block away from the location. They did a really nice job renovating the bar, but I was not impressed by the food. We ordered four things:

cheesesteak pretzels: were basically pretzel nuggets from the pretzel factory with a cheesesteak sauce to dip in

tomato and mozzarella flatbread:The flatbread was over cooked and did not have much flavor

chicken cutlet sandwich: bread was stale (hint:sarcones is across the street- USE THEM)

buffalo chicken egg rolls:were actually really good and the best part of our meal

I hope these are just small problems for the restaurant to work out because it is a great location with a good concept for their restaurant, but right now the food needs improvement.
This ice cream shop is totally legit and has some crazy flavors that happen to go together like magic. We tried the Blueberry cornbread and absolutely loved it!

Went to try this spot for brunch today and was slightly disappointed. I wanted to love it. The inside is really cool and we sat in the cute patio with beautiful weather. Unfortunately, the food was just ehhhhh OK. I had the DYO plate - scrambled eggs that needed seasoning, decent crispy turkey bacon, a yummy biscuit that came with no spread and a mixed fruit that was essentially all cantaloupe. I was expecting a better selection of fruit and my biscuit to come with jelly or butter or something! My friend had the burrito which was a tad dry and they don't have salsa. I would like to come back and try lunch here because it's such a cute setup.
Good place to grab a late night bite. I had the pepperoni and sausage pizza. It was pretty delish. I'm glad our drunken nights brought us here, a place Iv driven by almost every day!

We just got delivery from here. Got the tre-p with whole wheat pasta and chicken. The chicken never made it with the dish and the sauce may as well have been milk. We also go penne vodka with sausage... I've had better jarred sauces than this.  I get I paid $30 for the convenience of not having to make a dinner that I was more than capable of making but this was awful. We ended up eating leftovers from yesterday's dinner instead, should have done that in the first place and saved myself the money.

This is the first time I have been to this place and I was suprised on when I got my lunch, I ordered a Turkey Wrap which tasted so good they lightly grilled it so it made it even better. I will have to go back and try this place again soon!

Today was the second terrible experience I've had with scheduling an exam. The receptionist are short in their patience, rude, and inconsiderate of long-time customers. I scheduled 2 appointments for myself and my son at which time I was told they were very busy. Then I find out less than 24 hours from the scheduled appointments only one appointment was made and I was told "oh well you will just have to wait for the doctor to finish with the other patients". This was an awful experience and I would bring them my business let alone touch my eyes. There are plenty of other place you can go who will provide better care.

Food is good. Service is piss poor. There are a lot of TVs, but it takes an act of congress to get it on the game you want to see and there is no guarantee that it will stay on your game until the end. Tonight, the IU basketball game was switched with 2:30 to go (tied) for a MMA bout. Meanwhile, there was the same NBA game on 2 TVs next to each other at the bar.  Whoever is running this needs a course in common sense. I don't think I'll be back. There are too many other options.

I always really enjoy the beers at Bier. They are well crafted and a good variety of styles are typically available. I must admit I miss the days when you could sample everything but I understand. I suggest you tag team your three samples so you can try more of the deliciousness. Then buy a pint (if you can, depending on the day) or at the very least a bullet. Be aware, they'll probably sell out of everything by Sunday.

I've been here on several occasions and would have to say - it is truly a hit or miss.  I always get a few dozen oysters.  They are always fresh and flavorful.  The Maryland crab soup and steamed clams are ehhhh... mediocre.  Their salmon - very fishy smell, shrimp - small portions, and their crab legs are just okay.  I would recommend this place if you just want the raw bar, other than that - there are definitely better places to go.

When we walked in the place really nice, but they took us to a small room in the back. It was tight, and we were confused why they would take us to such a small room when the main seating area was open and had some people as well. As for the food, I had the chicken parmigiana which was good, but nothing amazing. It comes in a small plate with your choice of two sides. I had the Caesar salad which was mediocre and the pasta, which was normal. Food was nothing to talk about.

I ordered take-out...and I regreted quickly! I ordered online and not in store so perhaps that  was a huge mistake. I like carmelized onions and roasted eggplant on my pizza - what I've got was about 3 pounds of Eggplant parmegiana on top of my pizza instead. The pizza was 3" high. Way too much stuff which left the dough gooey and raw! 
Never again!

My wife and I contacted Bier Brewery about two weeks prior to our wedding in hopes of obtaining about fifteen cases of their delicious beers for our big day.  I was connect with Ryan who worked quickly to help us get everything together in a very short period of time.  To make things easier for us since we were coming from out of state, they allowed us to pay over the phone at an incredible price point for craft beer and they also allowed a friend of ours to pick up the beer outside of their normal operating hours.  We could not have been happier with the service from Ryan and the rest of the Bier Brewery staff.  Thanks Bier Brewery for helping make our big day even better!!!

Normally I like Macaroni Grill, but I don't know what in the hell has been up with them lately. Lack of concern? Lack of giving a crap about their patrons? Who knows. So I went there with my wife this past Monday night and our waitress was definitely not on point. Right out of the gate she asks us about our time constraints, and it was about 5:30 P.M. Now I can understand this logic if it were lunch time or earlier in the day, but that is literally the first time any waiter or waitress has ever asked me this at this time of the day. I hardly get asked this to begin with.

Not that it mattered, even if we were on a time constraint, we sure as hell weren't going anywhere fast, because "prompt service" was clearly not in her vocabulary. My wife ordered a glass of Pinot Noir and I got a Soda and Salad to start off with. I get my drink and Salad within 5 minutes... Still no wine for my wife. She's going around attending to some of the other folks, then mentions that "the wine is on the way." It's one glass of wine - what the hell? I didn't ask for a bottle of vintage wine from the Manager's personal stock at his house. 10 minutes later the wine gets there. My wife doesn't want to spoil the mood so I don't say anything, but I'm very visibly irritated and it's obvious at this point.

We had ordered around the time I got my salad, and come to find out now also, what my wife ordered she is just now finding out that they are "out of" for the night. Wonderful. So my food is almost ready at this point and my wife is having to re-order now. No offer to comp, no offer for complimentary dessert, nothing but pure apathy. Some of these waitresses and waiters wonder why people get crappy? Interesting.

We end up getting our food - I got the Chicken Marsala and my wife did a build your own spaghetti. My food went from pretty "meh" to kicking my ass afterward - it wasn't spicy at all yet it felt like fire coming out.

I won't go on and on beyond this because I don't have much else nice to say. I'm very disappointed with Macaroni Grill and their staff. I usually get better than this and they really flopped hard this time. I might give them one more chance... we'll see.

No Wheelchair Access!

- How is it that they just did a giant renovation, and somehow managed to get by the requirement to install a ramp and wheelchair accessible washrooms?

If you would like to try this coffee house, you'd better not be in a wheelchair.

First night.  Am here now.  Advertised free passed apps appetizers.  Corner table.  Ignored by EVERY server.  Other tables already had three apps!  If this is an indication of the future, FORGET IT!  And the music is too  loud!

I was intrigued by a Yelper review and in a quick for trip that I did to Clearwater I stopped at Cesarinas Deli.

Everybody In the staff seems genuinely kind and helpful. My disappointment is merely personal because I thought the cured meats were homemade and they weren't but one kind of sausage. 

So, I decided to overcome my over-expectations by getting other items. I was really happy by finding 8 dozens of Escargot for only $8.99!

I didn't have the chance to try their subs for what this store is famous about  but maybe next time...

We were so lucky to get this food truck at work last Wednesday! A fairly new truck, they specialize in a sort of flatbread/pizza rollup in a variety of flavors, in addition to decadent parmesan truffle fries and more apps. They were super friendly, fast and delicious, not to mention accommodating to our needs.

I LOVE that they had local drinks like Made cold brew and Mother's kombucha on tap!

Unfortunately, they did run out of a few items: cold brew, fried chicken; so, I recommend getting in line and ordering first before it's gone!

I had the meatball Impasto and it was so hearty and delicious. They do NOT skimp on ingredients and I had enough for leftovers.

Suggestion for the business: It would be great if you created a "half rollup, half fry" meal deal for people who don't want leftovers or who don't want to spend too much on lunch. I think it would do really well!

I ordered the hangover and no where on the menu does it say anything about onion I got the sandwich and it was full of onions I'm highly allergic that's something you might want to put on your menu for people that have food allergies..

I went there yesterday afternoon for the first time ever, and I feel like an idiot for not going there everyday since they opened.

Very lovely and cozy atmosphere, great for coffee and chat with friends, and for working or studying.

Their coffee is simply fantastic, the baristas are incredible at what they do. Highly recommended!

This is a great place if you're downtown and want some ice cream. It's not the kind of place that I go out of the way to get though. The building itself is adorable, very throwback. The line is usually pretty long too. 

They have the set up of a Baskin Robbins or TCBY, the ice cream is in tubs in a display case type thing, and you pick out what you want. The ice cream alone, isn't anything real special. They offer a variety of sundaes though, that really bring in the crowd. 

I think for two scoops and some toppings I paid under $4, which considering, ain't that bad. Definitely a place I'll go again if I'm on Broadway and want ice cream.

Excellent sub shop!  I have to admit I would have never stopped here without a recommendation, but I am glad I did. I had the Italian 12" sub.  This sub was large, the meat was excellent and the best was the bread. 

I would definitely recommend stopping here if you are around for lunch.

Friendly service. The blackberry panna cotta is a must try. It's soft, creamy, and smooth. These stores definitely embrace the open and shared space concept. I came expecting a full on bakery, instead it is more like a cafe with lots of inside and outdoor seating. It is nice and cool inside on this hot summer day. Perfect for sipping on our mochas or lattes while enjoying a pastry. A tour group came in and they were served the galette, which looks amazing. I should have ordered that instead of the donut. Although the donut was tougher than I thought (resembles more like the texture of a bagel), I still enjoyed it nonetheless.

After walking up and down Broadway, my friend and I came in here for some hot chocolate because it was cold outside. They have like a dozen different hot chocolates, and I wasn't sure what I would like. I asked the teenage boy who was taking our order for recommendations. He was just rude and snappy. I definitely did not appreciate his attitude nor his service. I would be happy to give this place at least 3 stars if I had better service. I just ordered the swiss hot chocolate and my friend ordered the white hot chocolate (which she loved). I wanted to sample some ice cream too, but I decided not to because I didn't even want to deal with this rude boy. So we paid, got our drinks, and left.

George was the best! I have back problems and was worried we would walk too far but it was perfect. Interesting and informed George did not embellish or act out fictional scenes. He was knowledgeable and had a great dry wit. It was the highlight of our trip! Thanks George!

I love this family run Korean restaurant. Super cozy and low key, affordable healthy eats.  Chicken rice bowl was delicious, with sautéed vegetables on the side, a gooey egg, some spiciness.  One of my favorite "off-the-beaten-path" Philly food treasures!
Fast and friendly service.  We needed a locksmith in the early evening during rush hour.  The technician made it to us in about 30 minutes.  He worked quickly and was friendly.  Highly recommended!

I'm with the other reviewer about this place. I was thrilled to hear Indy had its very own "chocolatier," but when I happened in the shop on 86th, I was a bit taken aback. It doesn't look like a chocolate shop at first. Maybe they do more business in novelty items, but they should stick to what they do best: chocolate.

I've tried several items on the "menu" ... including caramels (my fave) and chocolate pretzels. My husband likes the snappers, even though the name is a bit, um, strange.

Do stop by the next time you're near one of the locations (there's one near the Fashion Mall as well). You'll be glad you did.

I have always loved going to Macroni Grille but this time was really disappointing. They had removed my favorite dish the salad didn't have the great creamy Italian dressing and the bread wasn't warm. The service was so so  I think I will have to find another go to restaurant when I go to Reno.
I am at peace; the food has a calming effect at the end of the day. Loved it thoroughly.

This is our go-to pizza place since moving to Ardmore (at least now- we haven't tried all of them). Almost everything we've ordered (through GrubHub) has been just delicious! Our most recent order was a 3- or 4-cheese calzone (which my husband LOVED) and a cheesesteak wrap (which I also loved- it was giant!). We've only done pizza, cheesesteaks, and wings. The only one I didn't care for was the chicken cheesesteak- it was dry.

They've always been really friendly when I pick up the order, which is a plus!

This place was awesome!!! Their raspberry white chocolate cheesecake ice cream is some of the best I've ever had! Located downtown in tourist-central, it's worth braving the throngs of tourists. You won't regret it!

I came here to get a pool cue, and the salesperson was extremely friendly and helpful. He helped explain the differences between the different choices, and let me take my time testing them out. I also ended up leaving with some new flights for my darts, and a Rubik's cube. This is a very fun store with lots of board games too.

This Brewery is awsome.
Taste is All !!

Tap will often change.
This has also become a pleasure to go to Tap room.

There is an amazing kind Beer.
I want the future to taste all of the beer here !!

I like very much !!

Incredibly good, and they have so many great flavors - from Tennessee Fudge to Mint Chocolate Chip to Coffee! The hot coffee drink itself is super good! The people working there are very friendly, they move the line fast, the prices are honest, and there is a mix of old school (posters) and new school (electronic receipts) in there. I highly recommend this place

How could I not like Sonic?  They have a Peanut Butter Shake.  I've had a hard time finding those, so I always enjoy resisting the urge to actually get one.  My waistline clearly shows how often I am successful at this.

You really can't go wrong with Sonic!

I really enjoy going to Roast to work during the day. They have amazing customer service, their espresso is pretty good, and the ambience is perfect for an afternoon of working. I would recommend their vanilla iced lattes. 

The only thing I would say is make sure you get a spot by a charger, as there are only a few of them. Also use their loyalty program!

This bakery is new to Oliver Square area, and already this place is extremely popular. The bread  they bake here is made of spelt and kamut flour, which I never knew about before visiting this bakery. The person who assisted me, explained a lot about the organic ingredients used during the bread making process, and their health benefits. I am not allergic to soy and gluten, but I am always interested in trying additives-free and organic bread. I bought a pampernickel, a baguette and a loaf of rye bread which the gentleman at the counter offered to slice for me. Each was priced at around $5. Seems like a lot but once I got home and tasted what I bought, I realized that the price tag reflects the amazing quality. No wonder Breadland has royal customers! I very likely may become another one.
Pizza is Greek-style, so a bit more like a flatbread crust.  Have ordered from them several times, pizza is consistently solid and delivery is on-time.  Overall, the pizza is ok, not great.

Food is great ... But the service sucks. The girls that work there have horrible attitudes Ive been there about 4 times and each time same horrible attitudes. Its safe to say I will not be going here again

Good food but inconsistent.  Had the linguini alfredo and it was wonderful, swimming in sauce.  Next time I ordered it, almost no sauce, just plain tasteless pasta.  Great delivery service.  But wish meals were more consistent.

Got an iced mocha!! Absolutely delicious, have so many different flavors of ice cream definitely recommend ! Cool place to stop by and watch the city and get a little break from all the loud music. Prices are reasonable as well

Recently went to this location and I have mixed reviews. Food and booze came out quick and was good. It's the service is where my issue is. 
Server took my order, but very quickly gave me the bill. Felt like they were trying to rush me out. Look I get it, spent years in restaurant business. But don't throw me the bill unless I ask for it, makes people feel like they are not allowed to order more. Especially when they don't even acknowledge that you are there after. Gave the server $20 on a &45 dollar bill. You would think they would try and get more out of me at that point!! But no, did not speak to me once after I paid. 
I understand that this place has a theme, and that's mainly what people go for. But that only gets you so far. I have gone through the reviews of this location and others. And I have not seen management even try and apologize once at this location, once!!Where as at the other one I looked at. First review I read management had responded. 
Enjoyed the food and booze and willing to give it another shot. But if service does not prove to be nothing more then girls showing off the boobs and ass, and relying on just that to make money, I will not come back nor recommend this specific location to anyone.
The pizza is ok but the wings are great. The chicken parm grinder hot the spot. Work always orders from here and they have a great selection. They deliver in good time even though they are very busy.
horrible service. no  croutons on salad. no salad forks at all. overpriced slop.

It's so HOT HOT HOT outside!!  So why not come and COOL DOWN at Mike's!

I brought another friend visiting from out of town and while he got a simple iced tea, I helped myself to a nice scoop of their homemade ice cream and who would've thunk that Moose Tracks would actually be a tasty chocolatey, peanuty treat!!  DELICIOUS.  Perfect balance of richness and sweetness with a touch of peanut butter and chocolate.  So worth an update to my previous review.

There isn't a lot of seating but people come and go quickly because no one likes a melted cone.  So no worries, you'll soon find a seat as you have your treat!

Mike's Ice Cream is a must stop if you're down on Broadway and need something to cool you down!  You'll definitely walk out refreshed!
Very good place to get ballet wear. Very organized and friendly staff. Also lots of good quality and quantity. I will definitely be getting my things from here from now on.
Great lattes! Very trendy place--- cute little patio seating in the sun. Wish they heated the bakery items tho.

Have been twice with my boyfriend and both times had great food and service. The menu is a good size and the place has a nice open airy atmosphere. Mike who was behind the bar is an awesome fella who went above and beyond to make sure we had a good time. The lamb burger was really really good. Check it out :)

The tour guide was knowledgeable. About the only good thing I can say. We took the ghost and vampire tour which starts at 8:00.  Though the tour guide was nice, she seemed like she wanted to go home from the beginning.  Looking at other tour groups, the tour guides seemed much more animated and theatrical about their performances.
Really liked this place.  Off the beaten path, nice pleasant atmosphere, great outdoor space.   I had a very good tea and scone.

Don't ever eat or drink here. Severely understaffed, one bartender on a Saturday night. Food was microwaved and inedible. Beer and drinks are twice the cost of restaraunts around. Management is aware but cares not. I will never return again.

Went to buy one pair of ballroom shoes, ended up buying four!  The lovely ladies helping me were so friendly and informative.  I could have bought online during this bitter cold, but what could be nicer than trying on shoes you'll be wearing for hours with a great selection and fantastic staff. Well worth the trip!!! Wish I had worn these ballroom shoes for my wedding!

Got my wedding cake here and it was the best decision ever. So much more reasonable priced than American bakeries and way more delicious since it is not fondant based. Owner Kevin is an artist when it comes to cakes and he offered me great suggestions when I was torn between flavors and designs.

We ended up with 3 tiers: top: Strawberry shortcake 2nd: Chocolate sponge with strawberry filling 3rd: Green Tea with homemade red bean filling.

In normal weddings, there's usually a whole lot of cake leftovers. In normal Chinese weddings, there's usually a whole hecka lot more cause people leave after the lobster is served. So it's a huge deal when I tell you that other than a take out box that the server set aside for us, we had no cake leftover! 

They also custom made mini coconut tarts for our Cocktail Hour which were a huge hit! Much thanks!!

It was my first time eating Korean in the States. I went here based on all the great reviews about this place. they are correct, I hidden gem in downtown Philly. The food is fresh and very good. Your best option is to go as there are only 8 chairs for sit down meals. Great place nice, friendly couple run this restaurant. Even the simple interior has something special. Loved the chairs. I will be back

So if I lived in Santa Barbara I think I would find myself in this bakery each day with my laptop eating the great fresh breads they have while drinking a solid cup of coffee. The ambiance is awesome and their food is excellent. If you are wondering where to head for a light breakfast or a coffee and morning bun, this is the place. An awesome wait staff and incredibly warm and welcoming feeling. Definitely don't miss it if you are in town.
Super fast, fresh, friendly service, and most importantly, tasty!!  A real hidden gem.  I'm definitely coming back.
We ate breakfast here two days in a row. They have really nice pastries but their green eggs and ham breakfast sandwiche on home made biscuits are amazing. Would definitely recommend.
I highly recommend checking out Top Shelf Sports Lounge! The food is delish. Especially the ahi tuna stack. To top it off their beer selection is great and the hospitality is even better!

Oh my! Simple, to the point, what more do you need? Just bibimbap and that's it! Delicious and definitely Korean style. Had the real stuff in Seoul and it's pretty spot on(make sure to get the stone pot)

Pepperloin is still the very best, I sometimes have topped with garlic butter, baked potato loaded and salad with blue cheese dressing.  Hard to beat.  All are totally EXCELLENT . 
Excellent decor and nice private parking lot next to restaurant. 
Highly recommend this restaurant.....I've been dinning here since 1960.
Shai is the best locksmith. We had a problem with our front door lock and he was able to come right away. He identified the issue and resolved it quickly. I highly recommend him!

First off overall a good place to come. As we arrived, no one greeted us and took a minute too long to seat us when there was no wait and plenty of room. The service was average (girl forgot what sample of beer was what) my steak was ordered medium rare and came out medium. Didn't ruin the meal as it was still good. The mashed potatoes are amazing as well as the mac and cheese, highly recommended. My boyfriend got the "Hangover Burger" it was very good! The fries are also great and have a nice seasoning. Great place to watch sports and has a very unique environment. I think their downfall is a bunch of young inexperienced girls trying to run the place. Very good price though!

We're in Largo about 3 weeks out of the year, and we ALWAYS go to Cesarina's once or twice a week.  My favorite is the 12-inch eggplant parmesan sandwich with a side of tortellini salad, enough for two meals.  My husband likes the sausage calzone and veal Parmesan sandwich.  We try to stay away from the bakery, but the tiramisu is too delicious to pass up.  One time we were here in the summer, and were sorely disappointed to find it closed because the owners were taking a well-deserved trip to Italy!  Otherwise, no complaints from us.

This place is the best!!!  Food is fantastic.  And the wraps, delicious. I normally purchase the buffalo chicken wrap or the cheese steak wrap.  Awesome salads and pizza as well.  I can not say enough about this place.  If you try it once, you will be a customer for life, as I am.

Bonuses:
1. Child care
2. Free classes first time in
3. Les Mills group fitness
4. Great sound system in spinning room
5. Protein mixing station

It is tucked away in the corner on 38th/40th just off 4th street which is a bit confusing. However, upon entering you are greeted and staff is helpful. My first time, I called in and the lady helped me find the gym over the phone. 

I took my first Pump class here for free. Instructor was on point with her class. Then I took spin in the separate room too for free the first time. The room had a street view which was nice, and had quite a few excellent bikes on site. 

They have separate rooms for group fitness which is nice because classes don't have to wait around for one to get out. 

I am looking forward to trying Yoga. I will add that to my review once I do.

There's nothing wrong with ice cream for breakfast, is my point. 

Great flavors, some unusual and some expected. The butterscotch was yummy, and a dollop of the plain ol chocolate mixed with espresso was a fine way to start the day.

This location is moving and I went to their moving sale and got some great deals.  Their new address thought is:

8675 River Crossing Blvd
Indianapolis, IN 46240
317-816-1370
Store Hours
Sun 10:00AM-9:00PM | Mon-Sat 9:00AM-9:00PM

This place is always packed but I do not know why. The truth is that I am not very big on ice cream and I hardly eat the stuff. This place makes some tasty ice cream but I would not go out of my way to eat it. I am not sure if this place is just not that much better than the rest or if I just don't really care about ice cream.

I have no problem stopping in here to try one of their flavors but it was not special to me. THe service was kool. The scoops were pretty big.

Really good egg tarts. Scratch that, probably the best egg tarts in Philly. I keep trying to catch them straight out of the oven, but I think you probably have to ask them for that or something, because the last time I watched them bring out a fresh batch of egg tarts, and ordered it, it was still cold. Definitely still, good, I just want to try them right when they come out of the oven. I wish I knew when they baked those darn egg tarts. I'll have to ask them next time. Anyways, unlike most of the places in Chinatown, they use a flaky crust for their egg tarts. Pair that with the sweet, creamy baked egg custard filling, and it is a match made in heaven haha. Flaky crusts are the way to go for egg tarts. 

Their other buns and savory pastries are standard; taste the same to me anywhere I get them. My sister favors their butter bread though, which is very good, and can act as dinner rolls. The drinks here are ok, nothing special. They serve the standard milk tea, lemon tea, and they also have bubble tea, but I've never gotten that here. They have a few small tables for you to sit on, and a refrigerator with soda and canned/boxed drinks right by the door so you can grab and go(no five finger discount!!! Remember to pay). I've also had the lemon cake before, which wasn't bad, but sometimes I do stray from the cakes, as they don't always look fresh.

I don't think I've ever seen young people working here; it's usually 1 or 2 middle aged ladies behind the counter. They're not mean, but they're not overly friendly either. They just do their job, that's all it is. No extra smiles or small chat. And usually, there will be one or two middle aged/old men sitting toward the back reading the newspaper, making it seem more like the cafes in HK, where old people will hang out in cafes just to drink a cup of tea and pass the hours by. 

All in all, definitely come here for an egg tart, if nothing else. You won't regret it.

This is actually my very first time making a review for any business. Because this has been the WORST place I have ever been, I thought I warn others. Everything is pre-made and they messed up our entire order. The worst part about it, is that we get our check and they had items on our receipt that we did not purchase.
First time having ice cream in Nashville and Mikes was delicious! I got the homemade cookie dough ice cream in a waffle cone. I absolutely loved it!

The thee sundaes I ordered arrived looking kind of skimpy. I mentioned it to the waitress and she said the machine wasn't working right. I made the mistake of not taking my receipt and drove back around the building to get it so I could let someone know about being shorted on the sundaes. She printed a second but with no phone numbers for comments and she couldn't find the manager. She then offered to make me another sundae, wouldn't it be the same if the machine wasn't working right. Father's Day sundaes we're not as nice as wanted them to be for dad. Annoyed

These guys are simply amazing. Great prices (no, really!) and fantastic customer service. My Mercedes dealership recommended them to me and I highly recommend them to you. I have a very low riding SLK which tends to have the parking bumpers tear up the front end. They made it look like brand new and at a price I could afford (and I couldn't afford much, to be honest!) You won't be sorry with the work or the service. Chris and his crew are top-notch professionals. Give them a call and go get an estimate. You will be very pleasantly surprised at what you hear.

My wife is always on the lookout for good canneloni.   She ordered it the other night at Ricardo's and declared it to be as good as any place in St. Louis.   I had the Linguine Louisa and it was very good as well.  The pasta prices are what amaze me though.  They are the only place I know that has these $7-8 smaller portions of pasta that are just right.  Service was friendly and prompt, just like before.

I've been to Doc's many times but last night will be my last. It is way overpriced. The  crab cakes were small and mostly filler. The grilled seafood combination contained a lot of vegetables and very little seafood.
Took me ten minutes to order a beer from the waitresses fixated on their phones.  Beer was good service wasn't what I was expecting
Always a pleasant experience. The food is fresh and inexpensive. Great place to eat! If your in a hurry you can call ahead and order. Eat in or take it to go.

Sorry Dave, you need to stick to oysters and stay away from brunch.  Ordered the Eggs Benedict over crab cakes, Lobster Fritata, and Shrimp omelette.  Everything was overdone and dry, specifically the Eggs and the asparagus was roasted too long.  In general, the potatoes had no flavor.  Has to ask for butter with our toast and then Old Bay Butter was served.  Our waitress must have been hungover from NYE because the service was lacking and I know through reading your books that this is unacceptable.  In the future I will stick to Monday night Buck a Shuck.
My favorite sub shop in the area in terms of quality AND price. Expect to wait around lunch. First timer? Have your order ready on the phone/at the counter and you will fall in love with this place.

The beer was as good as any other small brewery in town and I liked the atmosphere of their tap room. I was also impressed with the attentiveness of one of the staff that served my samples, answered my questions and filled my growlers. 

I was not impressed with another of the staff I talked to and asked about getting a keg filled. I was told they could, but it would be expensive because they didn't really have to--they would sell all their beer anyway. I would never tell one of my customers something is expensive because it's something I don't HAVE to do for them. After having this conversation, seeing their slogan, Come Taste Our Awesomeness, and other information on their website, I'm left with a bad taste in my mouth--arrogance.

11/17/11: In respone to Darren C.:
You didn't tell me you wouldn't fill my keg for sanitation reasons...you told me you wouldn't because "We don't have to, we will sell [all our beer] anyway." I'm a homebrewer and am aware of the importance of sanitation--I have had more than my share of spoiled batches. I would have been fine with that reason or just "No, we don't fill kegs."

Best ice cream I've had in quite some time! It really tastes home made and you get a hearty portion for a reasonable price. Don't even get me started on their in-house waffle cones! I don't even live in Nashville, but when I come back up to these parts I'm definitely stopping here again.

While this won't be my regular hang out, I'm not going to object if anyone wants to meet for a drink there.

Pro's
- Solid craft beer selection.
- Good service.
- They often have live music.

Con's
- The food is good but, not anything special.

Hotel clean. Convenient location. Make sure to request a room on the parking lot side. I am a light sleeper and I requested a quite room. Well they did a mistake and they had left a room only on the " highway side". Not happy about this.

Great interior design for 1-on-1 dates or for bigger parties. Its basically a sushi restaurant, but kind of a fusion too because of the other types of food they serve. They also have a bar and I would recommend their cocktails (Geisha). As a party of 3 and we basically ordered 3 appetizers and 3 rolls, and it was definitely filling. The rolls came on one tray for us so we ate it family-styled. However, I saw tables where people had their own plates of sushi as well. 

I thought the brussel sprouts were really good, it had an asian style to it, probably from the sesame oil/seeds. The tuna tatare was served over a crispy thin cracker, which balanced out the creamy avocado and tuna. The mai fried rice was decent, just fried rice.

For rolls, we ordered the peppered tuna, white tuna, and J&J. Though the specialty roll (J&J) was almost double the price of the regular roll, there was definitely more going on and it was a lot more filling. I'd recommend getting at least one specialty roll. Still, the normal rolls such as the peppered tuna was refreshing to eat.

I also noticed that they have pretty exclusive sushi such as uni, el toro, kobe, and live clams.

Went here to enhance my local beer culture and might I say, these guys have it figured out. They focus on the craft of the beer and it shows. My wife and I tried all of their selection and they were all terrific! The flavor of each is unique and complex. It is not an overwhelming wall of flavor, but deep and rich. 

I wish I was still in the area so I could give them my money.

Looking forward to coming back to you guys and filling all 4 of my growlers!
I love me some pastries and bread. All organic and very yummy. I love the chocolate croissants. Everything just tastes better when you use all natural ingredients.

I went to Macaroni Grill because I was craving this specific pasta dish I always get in Cali ... so we go there... it took FOREVER for our waiter to come to greet us.  Then we finally got our food and it was cold and tasted dirty.   We told the manager, he quickly got us another dish.  Still did not taste great.  Overall the management staff was great, took care of us but the food was not.  But I will give a lot of credit to the management because even though I won't go back because of the food the management made a bad experience tolerable.

Super impressed!!   My first time at Cesarina's and it is totally 5 stars!   The lady at the counter is so friendly and kind...love her genuine laughter!  The espresso is some of the best ever...they don't do lattes or cappuccinos.  The cannoli is amazing!   Homemade!  Yum!    It's a full deli and Italian market.  Huge huge huge sandwiches.  Lots of happy customers. Be kind to yourself and come here.
Very nice environment, the setup is pretty intimate. They have a pretty decent selection of rolls to choose from and a solid drink menu. I'm glad it's around the corner!

Really if I order a three course meal
Soup App and Entree
I don't want it out at the same time.. just because I ordered it at the time it's still a 3 course meal.. don't tell me differently.. I know what I ordered 
The food itself was ok.. you could seasoned it a bit more

This store is great for men of any age. Case in point: while he certainly is no man of fashion, my dad is now hooked on the shave care and essentials that James Dant curates, creates and sells. He doesn't live in Indy, but he almost always stocks up each time he comes to visit me! I will admit that while the prices are a little high, the quality more than makes up for it. Great place for your boyfriend, brother, or yes, even father!

This place serves only a few options of very simple Korean fare, so that's great for folks like me who encounter decision paralysis. They offer bibimbap (well flavored, slightly spicy rice dish with julienned veggies) with your optional protein (chicken, beef, tofu). They also have like two sides and a special. Easy. I ordered the special which was jap chae and my bf ordered the beef bibimbap. Both were solid and filling but nothing mind blowing. But considering the value and that Bap doesn't face much competition in Center City Korean cuisine, I'd definitely return.

Cozy little spot with good beer. We went on a Friday and there was live music which was great, a little loud for the space, but not out of control. I wish they had longer hours as there have been several times I wanted to go and they aren't open, but the hours are easy to find. I will definitely be back.

It is my opinion that Bier Brewery is one of the finest (if not THE finest) breweries in Indianapolis.  In a city that is flooded with breweries trying to make their mark, I can always count on a Bier brew to be delicious.  As much as I enjoy downing a pint (or three) of their sudsy goodness at a local bar, it surprises me that it took me so long to make my way to their Tap Room.  Honestly I only stopped by because I was making a trip to their neighbor Great Fermentations and decided to head inside on a recent Friday night.

Their tap room is set up for groups of nearly any reasonable size.  Couples will find seating as easily as groups of 8.  They have several tables with mismatched chairs and couches.  In the corner they even have a spot for some live music which we got to enjoy during our visit.  

Head to the back right corner and tell the workers if you've never been, because they will be happy to help you sample and select a good brew.  Beers are served in plastic cups, which I think could definitely be upgraded at some point since it felt a little cheap to me (but hey, no dishes to wash!).  Follow the staff recommendations, because they want to make you happy and provide you with something new!

All in all I have to say that I would come back again!  One thing that was a tad disappointing is the turnaround time for a keg.  There are some places in Indy that can have kegs waiting and can provide them the same day you call, but Bier asked for 48 hours to fill an order.  We decided to go elsewhere simply because they could fill our order faster.

Nice bookstore, TERRIBLE cafe.

I asked the girl behind the counter if she could make me a latte macchiato, as it wasn't on the menu.  She said yes and then made me a caramel machiatto.  She remade the drink but seemed irritated that she had to do it.

The coffee was extremely stale.  it tasted like it came from a burner that it been left on for four hours. It was so bad I couldn't finish it and ended up throwing it away.

Good coffee and good books are a special combination for me.  They failed me on this one.

I had high hopes for this place. We heard they have great food. My husband and I went in during slower hours on a Friday. LOTS of empty tables so we thought it shouldn't be too long of a wait with our waitress. She took a while to get our drinks.  We ordered our food. He got the pot roast, I got the steak salad and added shrimp. Their menu is very small, not much to choose from. Like I said, it was not busy. It took almost an hour to get our food and it was cooked fine but it was so salty I couldn't eat it. Even my husband, who pours salt on everything, said it was so salty he didn't have to put salt on there. Which is ok for him but for normal people it was too much. 
On a side note, I personally have no problem with how the staff is dressed, or I wouldn't have went in, but is it mandatory to hire only anorexic looking females? These girls really do not look healthy. Out of the 10+ servers only 2 seemed to weigh over 110 lbs. The girls were extremely pleasant and nice though but the service was not that great either.

Pros: amazing ice cream and coffee. My dad is a huge fan of the chocolate ice cream he got and my sisters loved their coffees. 
Cons: Customer service here sucks! I work in the hospitality industry so i can understand if workers are tired and not being peppy at all times. But the guys that work here make it seem like you are a nuisance by just walking in. I went in about a week ago with my dad and 3 sisters. When we walked up to the counter, no one greeted us but just stood there and stared. we told one of the guys to give us a second to look over the menu. So after a couple of minutes i place my order and he abruptly walks away before my little sister can tell him hers. Makes my coffee and walks over to the register and waits for me to pay. So i told him my sister would like a mango juice and he ROLLS his eyes at his coworker and walks off pissed. He makes the smoothly with a bunch of banging and literally tosses it across the counter and walks off. He then asks another worker to check us out. ARE YOU KIDDING ME?! she is only 12 and i can tell see how surprised she looked at the way he was acting. The funny thing is, every person after us got a hello and a way better treatment. She even asked if it was because we were the only black people in the store. Do you know how hurtful it is trying to come up with a reason why we were being treated different than the other people at the store? We ended up leaving a 20% gratuity for the other guy that checked us out because he was at least patient. I hope that redheaded cashier reads this and fixes his attitude. I'm glad this happened on the end of our vacation there because i would have painted all of Nashville with a bad image.

Service was not very good. Asked for water did not receive it. Ask for mayonnaise extra and did not receive it. The music was so loud that the waitress did not hear our order. She kept asking over and over what we had selected. there was no choice between regular fries and fire fries. No ketchup was offered at the table. The menu selections are very limited. But they do have a large beer and liquor selection. observing the other waiters and waitresses, they did not seem to be in a hurry to do anything one way or the other. The hamburger that I had, was just like any other hamburger at any other restaurant. Nothing exceptional.it seems to be a very disorganized restaurant and management staff. In fact, I saw no management in the restaurant at all. More training is needed definitely. it is nice though to have a very large flatscreen TVs to watch all the available games and sports on.

This is a very well run, clean and well stocked store. We stopped here on our way home from a visit to Port Ricky. There is easy access in and out of the parking lot. Be careful of panhandlers as they were roaming around the front of the store asking for money. They can be somewhat forward so be careful.

St Honore Pastries is another one of those places that if I'm ever nearby I have to make a visit. They have a wide selection of individual size cakes, buns, and other nibbly things almost all less than $1, usually .70-.90 a piece. 

My personal favorite is the "cupcake" which looks like it's baked in a flower pot, it has a very eggy taste and a light and fluffy texture. The snowman cake, already mentioned by kathy t. is kind of really cute so I got one last time and it was pretty tasty. 

They also have a fairly large drink menu so if you're looking for a durian shake, or something more appetizing, this is the place to get it.

This is definitely one of the best places to eat in Alton. My family and I used to go here pretty much exclusively for our special occasion meals, and it's a great place for dates; in fact, you'll probably see a good number of high school students there around homecoming and prom, since Alton High and Marquette Catholic are close by. So it's a busy place, especially on weekends, but I've never had to wait very long for a table - plus, since it's a small town, chances are you'll run into someone you know, and the wait won't seem as long either way. 

I can't speak to their whole menu, as I only ever ordered two items when dining there: the toasted ravioli, and the peppercorn steak. Now, toasted ravioli is touted as a St. Louis original, and indeed it's something I've yet to find outside of that little circle of the Midwest. It's not very fancy, but it *is* good: well-seasoned beef ravioli, breaded and fried, with marinara sauce on the side for dip. It's technically an appetizer, but I'm one of those people who eat lots of little meals, so it was always enough for me. 

The peppercorn steak, on the other hand, is where this place really shines. A tender filet mignon, perfectly seasoned and served medium rare with a hint of butter and herb - this is the steak that got me into eating steak. It practically melts on your tongue, try though you might to savour every last ounce of flavour. 

I wanted to give this place five stars, since relative to the other options in Alton, it definitely deserves them. I'm still convinced that the steak alone is worth five stars. I only gave it four, though, because as much as I love this place, there *is* better food out there. (Just not in Alton.)
This place is incredibly good, inexpensive, and has great customer service. I'll be a frequent customer!
Food was okay. Had a gift card, so figured we would try it, most likely will not return. Service was NOT good!

I've been waiting for a special place to review as my lucky 100th Yelp review.  I do believe I have found it.

Mike's Ice Cream is far and away one of our favorite places in Nashville.  Both my husband and I absolutely adore this tiny little ice cream shop in downtown Nashville and make a point to visit anytime we're downtown - no matter how full we may be from our dinner or honky-tonk fun (somehow, there's always room for ice cream).  The homemade ice cream, in fun and delicious flavors, gets us every single time.  We love Mike's Ice Cream so much that we even bought 2 giant containers to serve to our guests at our wedding rehearsal dinner - and it was a huge hit!  Even the small container of mixed berry sorbet we bought for our dairy-free guests was quickly gobbled up and thoroughly enjoyed.

We love most of the flavors at Mike's, but there are a few that make the list of our "most-favoritist ice creams of all time".  Those flavors include:

-Take That (seriously, too delicious for words)
-Loaded Butterscotch
-Toasted Coconut
-Peanut Butter Cup
-Red Velvet

I once heard about a flavor where they take something like 6 different kinds of cake and blend them into vanilla ice cream.  I have not yet seen or tasted this flavor, but I do, on occasion, dream about it...

The only downside to Mike's is that the location makes it impossible to just stop in for an ice cream cone.  It's impossible to park on the street or anywhere close to Mike's without paying big bucks.  We're fine with saving our visits for when we're already downtown anyway, but it'd be nice to be able to stop by whenever the ice cream craving hits.  But, like I said - the ice cream is worth waiting for!

Love the atmosphere - it's very chic and clean! Croissants are wonderful, ordered a biscuit and bacon, biscuit could have been baked a tad less, but still very good! Will be back! The selection of pastries is incredible!!

If 0 stars were possible i would leave it.what a scummy place.the so called bartenders are a joke .very rude the food sucks the owner is a piece of trash. The fatboy bouncer is a joke .Hey fat boy your not tough or scary like you portray yourself.Do not eat at this scumbag so called bar.

Great! Wonderful to spend time with the cats and supports a good cause. Good coffee and we were even offered samples of a different coffee. They had free pet samples too if you have a cat at home. Check this place out :)

The produce is disgusting and the employees are so unbelieveably rude.  I used to be a cashier at a grocery store and do believe I would have been fired promptly had I treated a customer the way my husband and I were treated there.  Plus, I really don't like it when parents standby while their children ask ME for money for a gumball machine.  Ugh!
I've been the west Chester location a couple of times and have enjoyed my meals. Nothing in the menu particularly stands out to me. Definitely a nice place for locals to dine at.

came to nashville because i surprised hubby with a concert (Muse, in case you were wondering) for our 1yr wedding anniversary in mid-march. it was pretty cold. okay, for my So-Cal (southern california, for those not in the know) ass, it was FREEZING. 
the first day we went, there was a line. people in So-Cal don't even drink jamba juice in the winter, let alone eat ice cream! i don't know how they make their sodas, but it the "old fashioned" way. i had blackberry. it was pretty good. i already forgot what flavor ice cream i got the first time, or the second time, because this was almost a month ago, and i have trouble remembering what i ate a couple days ago. but it was gooooood.

This place has gone downhill fast. 

Everytime I visit my grandma, we try to go here, but I think yesterday was our last visit. (The previous time we visited, we walked out because our food took over an hour and my 4 year old was freaking out.)

My grandma had some coupons for their new "$7 meal in 7 minutes or it's free" so we each ordered two lunches at the counter. After about 15 minutes, we are still waiting for our food. All the employees keep looking at us nervously because they know it's been longer than 7 minutes. 

The lady who rang us up briefly says something to the head honcho chef looking man and then brings our food to us. I tell her she knows it's been twice the amount of time promised and that we want our food for free as advertised. Now, if it had only been a few minutes longer, I wouldn't have made a big deal. But it took TWICE as long. She immediately says, "you only get it free if you are dining it. It doesn't count for to go orders." No. I can tell right off the bat that's a load of crap so we ask to speak to the chef boss man. 

Here is a whole new problem. This man walks up to me and my 70 year old grandmother and says, "Hi girls, what's going on?" GIRLS? Really? What a patronizing prick. Don't you dare address my 70 year old grandmother as "girl." UGH. Anyways, he claims that corporate told them it doesn't count on carry out orders. I tell him to show me that on any one of their numerous advertisements. He can't because obviously he's lying. He just doesn't want to get dinged for being so slow. He says, "Alright girls, I'll take care of it for you this time, but those are the rules." Great, take care of it asshole. 

So while we are waiting for a refund, I look up this 7 minute express lunch deal on my phone and find that it is indeed for dine in OR carry out. I show it to him and he is immediately red faced claiming he had no idea. 

To top it all off, the lady who rang us up realizes that one of our sandwiches is wrong because the right one just came out. 20 minutes later.
they have some really good pizza here. STRONGLY RECOMMEND YOU ORDER PIZZA HERE. the chicken fingers are good too with the honey mustard. a little pricey but worth it.

I come here more than I should. 

It's always packed during lunchtime, but the cashiers are friendly and the lines move quickly.

Salads and sandwiches are reasonably priced and acceptably edible.

I confess....I really enjoy the Turkey Bowl. 

Thanksgiving, wawa style.

I hang my head in shame. 

Oh yes, free ATMs. Joy!
All the food is great. Honey BBQ wings are a huge hit and so is the pizza. Very flavorful and the delivery is scary fast. I wish i had them in Philly where i live now.

The store gave me misleading information.  One of the representatives told me that I'd be able to upgrade my Galaxy S9+ phone to a Note 9 and take advantage of a $500 off promotion.  However, since my S9+ had a cracked screen, I was told I had to put in an insurance claim (with a $175 deductible).  But for the promotional plan, I would not have shelled out the money and just worked with my original phone.  However, I got a replacement S9+ phone. Unfortunately, when I attempted to go for the promotion, I was informed that I was given the wrong information.  The S9+ was NOT eligible for this promotion regardless of its condition, and I would not have been able to take advantage anyway since my phone was not paid off.  None of this was conveyed to me.

When I called the store and complained, all I got was a "sorry" and no offer to make up for the grossly inaccurate information that I relied upon to spend $175 dollars. For this reason, I will not visit this store again.  I may also leave T-Mobile once my phone is paid off.  This store does not have honest brokers.

One of my favorite spots for a quick meal. 4 different bowls to choose from along with a few other options. I usually go with the chicken or beef bowl and it's always delicious! Fresh ingredients and perfect portion size for a reasonable price. Service is always fast and friendly. I usually eat in but I know they do a lot of take out. Definitely check it out! :)

Great little unique restaurant. The French Dip is great, along with their entire assortment of bakery items. I loved the setup of the building, where there are different sections for the bakery, sandwiches and salads. I'd definitely recommend it to anyone who wants a quick bite or a breakfast snack.
People are really cold and reserved didnt feel welcomed at all. Was rushed out the door quickly. Feeling welcomed is always important.
So good! I had the red velvet ice cream with a sugar cone. It was amazing! Beyond words, best ice cream I've ever had!

Outstanding meal with an amazing owner caring over you. The Hot Stone Bitmaps were delicious and the Japche was a great addition. Small dining room but very cozy and great price for dinner. We will be back often.

Went to Doc Magrogan's for the first time the other night and really enjoyed the experience.  My wife really wanted some seafood as she is from New England but has not found quality seafood down here yet.  I had also lived in New England for a while and believe this to be the best seafood since being in New England.  Service was great as well.  The only reason for the 4 out of 5 was due to the smaller portion sizes.

I live around the corner from this place it is my go to spot when I want something quick, healthy, and delicious.

My girlfriend loves their kimchi. Almost as much as she loves my kimchi. You know what I mean? ;-)

And it closed.
I wonder if others had the same horrible experience I did.   I swear I have not had a worse customer experience in a restaurant, ever.

Wonderful service and delicious food. However, really dislike how it is per management to drop the check off during lunch time when you receive your meal. Even though the server told us, "No rush, we are supposed to leave the check early at lunch time, it's per management. " I still felt really rushed and just really dislike that they do this. Can't customer's just ask for their check if they are in a rush? Anyways, my husband' and my meal was delicious and absolutely exceptional. Definitely recommend.

We recently entered a dish in a local cooking competition that featured the Fuggit Stout from Bier Brewery as one of the ingredients. We won the contest and the $500 prize that came along with it. 

Thanks, Bier!
Some of the best ice cream I've ever had! I had java fudge.. amazing! My son had chocolate with sprinkles and it was bomb. Highly recommend!!

What is the hype all about?  I tried their shrimp portifino.  It was tasty. But was it worth $13.99?  No, not really.  It was a small portion loaded with pasta with few shrimps.  

Love their bread!

Parking sucks!

Service was okay. Friendly servers but not too attentive.  I always have to call my server to get refills.

At this point, three stars for mediocre experience.

This restaurant just opened up next to Best Western. Used to be a Copeland's. The menu has a seafood theme to it. For my appetizer I tried the spinach and artichoke dip. It was pretty good. For my entrée I had the half shrimp and half catfish. That was also pretty good too. The prices start at about $15 for entrée meals and the appetizers are about $8. Overall I had a good experience and a good meal. I will definitely be going back.
good price and good food. I hope you would come to eat bibimbap. Nice place to eat inside and take the food out either.
Nice ambiance. Large open doors. For breakfast, all bakery items are good. Then come back in the afternoon for wine.

This place was amazing! The owner makes his own kimchi and spikes his soy sauce with magic. It was so delicious. We had the beef bow,  three bowls of kimchi (it was that good!) and the vegetable pancake. Super nice owner. Will definitely come back.

We had the best experience with TKO!  Josh and his team were professional and personal.  They gave us quick responses and even worked with our venue to make sure everything went as smoothly as possible.  We decided to use their specialty lighting and DJ services for our December wedding and are so pleased with the results!  Andy (the night of DJ) was wonderful at the event and made sure our dance floor was packed all night.  Thank you TKO!!!

This is a prime location and super convenient. It does tend to get pretty packed for breakfast and lunch times. The wait can sometimes be long depending on what time of day you go in. The service is OK but the selection of snacks and drinks is great. My food always has what I ordered in it but I can't say much about presentation and neatness. 

Wawa will always be bae lol 

Candy selection is amazing, drink selection is vast. For breakfast they always have breakfast sandwiches and hashbrowns by the registers; lunch time you'll find bagel sandwiches and a variety of chicken things. Coffee is always fresh, the coffee station is always fully packed. For breakfast I'm usually getting a breakfast burrito, it's very tasty.

This place has since moved to Madison Square Shopping Center just down the road from the old location.  They are now located on the left back corner across from The National College of Business and Technology.  Same great food with great prices to match.  I did notice that they now accept credit cards!

We were very excited to have TKO at our wedding reception! From the time I started wedding planning I knew music would be important and so I didn't want to wait too long before hiring a DJ. I went to a few wedding shows and at all 3 of them I had positive interactions with the guys from TKO! At the last wedding show I went to I put my name in for a drawing and to my surprise I actually won! The "prize" was $100 off DJ service! It was meant to be. My fiance and I scheduled a meeting with Chris from TKO and he walked us through the process and contract. We were delighted to work with him since he was super friendly. I asked about up-lighting and he said they would even be able to provide the lights as well. It was done deal. After we signed the contract Chris sent me a link so that we could go into their site and start creating our playlist. We were able to select songs to play and songs not to play. It was very easy. About a month before the wedding Katie called and reminded us to schedule a meeting with Chris to discuss logistics and planning. We made the meeting and discussed all the details. It's always nice to work with someone who can do the job efficiently. He was quick to answer questions and during our meeting he made sure we understood what to expect at our event. We talked about the start and stop time along with set-up and break-down. Once our meeting was over we received a copy of the report for the DJ to refer to. It was accurate and easy to read. On the night of our wedding Trevor (our DJ) arrived on time and had the place all set up. He had the lighting just as I had asked and he had his area all set up. Trevor was friendly and had just the right amount of energy! Trevor had people on the dance floor all night and really seemed to know which songs to play. He really was "feeling the crowd". I think it was a great night and he made sure to keep the energy flowing throughout the night. There were times when I needed to ask him to make an announcement and he did without complaint. Trevor really has a great personality and I think he rocked our wedding dance floor! I would absolutely work with TKO again.

I'm always finding new ways to get in the way of a regular sleeping schedule so it doesn't surprise me that most of the time I head to Roast, I'm scooted out not long after because they're closing.

The atmosphere is part local and rustic feeling and the other part is a Jay Z and Kanye West collaborative album cover. Flash, shine, and wood. The tank of water for all customers is a nice touch especially when they chop some cucumber in there.

The coffee and tea menu is pretty plain and basic but the baristas know what they're doing and made sure I got my custom Gibraltar (3 parts espresso, 2 parts steamed milk) the way I want it. The most pleasant surprise was the wine and beer selection, I usually spy into the beer fridge and am forced make a difficult decision with a kind of beer or even getting one at all.

Roast is a great place whether you're there to relax or have an awkward first date.

Caviar and Bananas - where you get to wait in line twice! If you're getting a salad or sandwich, you wait in line to order it and watch them make it. Then, you get to go to another line, wait some more and eventually pay for it! Such a fun way to spend your lunch hour. At least they validate parking because you've been in there waiting in lines so long -- oh wait, they are out of validation tickets with "no idea when we'll get more." So two lines, mediocre food & service, AND dashed hopes of free parking. At least you're pretty, C&B.

Food was underwhelming with the exception of the fries which were amazing. The service was not good, while our server provided everything we needed it took extremely lengthy periods of time to get it, so much so we went to the bar repeatedly to order alcohol because we were tired of waiting. The inside looked like that of an unfinished restaurant with bare walls and little decorative art. None of the employees were wearing matching attire which looked quite unprofessional for what is supposed to be an "upscale" place. We gave it a try but have no intention of going back. I don't see the place lasting long.

Since Bottom Dollar has closed I thought I stop by, while the store has gone down the last time I was here.
It's still big and bright but their prices are incredibly high and his selection is very low . Hopefully it will get better, maybe.

This was our 3rd time eating here. We have had a bad experience each time. This time the waitress was absolutely clueless and rude. It was Saturday and it should have been a kids eat free day. We explained that to the waitress and she looked at us like we were idiots. She then came back and the kids drinks were still on the bill. We asked for those to be taken off and she huffed and puffed and gave more attitude. My wife got the Hangover burger and it was as thin as a Mcdonalds cheeseburger and the egg was completely cooked not sunnyside up. I got the chicken strip basket and my 2 boys hot the kids chicken strips. The strips are somewhat slimy. The aren't very crispy at all. I will say the fries are very good and the beer is cold! 
I won't be coming back for a meal but I might come back to sit at the bar and watch a game. Hopefully the service will get better over time.
Excellent menu items and great selection of beers. Good place for sporting events via tv with plenty of seating and good service. Try the chili loaded it's excellent.

Went there for quick lunch.  We had $30 Groupon coupon.  We told waitress when we were seated that we had a coupon .  She said no problem.  She told us to download the app and we can get a free appetizer.  We downloaded the app and ordered the free onion rings.  Thank God for the remoulade sauce.  They were free so we didn't complain.  (At least we thought they were)  We both ordered the stuffed catfish.  The food was very bland but we were thinking we had a $30 Groupon coupon and free appetizer so we would get out of there fairly cheap. When it was time to pay, the manager said they could only honor 1 coupon, despite what we were told. We told her use the groupon. She came back and said the system wouldn't take the Groupon code. She honored the free app coupon. We would not have gone if we didn't have the Groupon, as they are overpriced. I can honestly say it is not worth the money the food is all bland with no seasoning. Salt didn't even help it.
Awesome and perfect!! Great staff and superb beir!!Having a great evening with Jeff & Tammy and Joshua & Mitch  !!!!!

This is the second time I've walked out of Doc's disappointed.

First things first, I really wanted to like this place: Its in a great location in West Chester, has outdoor seating, great oyster selection, and is one of the few exclusive seafood restaurants in the area (I love seafood).

We went here in a group of 7 for my good friend's girlfriend's birthday.

Sat at the bar for drinks waiting for the rest of the party, bartender was friendly and beers are beers.

As the other people arrived we were seated immediately in the back corner.

While the waitress was friendly, she was clearly new, and not trained very well. She did not know the specials, or the drink policy of the day (let us order an unavailable drink for that day).

I ordered 2 apps, a pound of sauteed littleneck clams, and half dozen oyster on the half.

First the clams: Portion was skimpy, barely a dozen. Clams were cooked properly but were very gritty, broth was over-reduced and way too salty.

Oysters: The waitress got my order wrong and gave me 2 of the wrong kind. no big deal. But the quality of the oysters were sub-par at best. The guy shucking the oysters had no idea of what he was doing; they were mangled, i mean like he stuck the knife into the oyster, blended it, pried it open, poured the liquor out and threw it on a metal pan, with jarred cocktail sauce, and a lemon. There was barely half the oyster left. At practically $3 a piece, i was disappointed. 

I ordered the crab cake sandwich as a main. The waitress got the order wrong, and I received the crab cake entree. Sent it back, came back to me on a stale bun (the one crab cake from the previous plate), was cold, tasted of being previously frozen, and definitely canned crab meat, and now included a side of frozen french fries.

I shook my head as a got the bill and signed the $70 check (just for my food and drink).

Such a shame, this place has so much going for it, just bad management.

I will not be going back.

This place is pretty run of the mill.  They deliver all the time (well, whenever I want delivery including weeknights), so that's a perk.  Their food is OK at best.  I could walk a half mile in any direction and find much better pizza.  I can also make better pizza at my house.  But when I'm feeling super lazy, Ardmore Pizza it is.

Totally rude guy that closes at night. It was not even midnight and when we tried to come in the cashier ran to the door and locked it in front of our face and put the close sign up deliberately avoiding eye contact. If you're open until midnight then customers should be allowed in until that time. At the very least he could have said sorry guys were closing up versus just locking the door in our face!

Since this posting we gave the ice cream parlor another shot and it was ok. Honestly cold stone is way better. The upside is the location and late hours.
Tuna bar was fantastic! We went with friends and were impressed with every dish! The ambiance was really nice. Finally, a great sushi place in old city!

I am never patronizing this business again! My husband and I ordered oysters (Oyster Rockefeller/Raw) Wednesday night. I complained my Oyster Rockefeller tasted burned but received no reimbursement for my order. Thursday morning my husband and I had a severe case of food poisoning at which time I emailed the director of Lafittes Landing  (advising her of a possible bad batch of oysters served to us the previous evening)due to our food poisoning. I received a response of "thanks,I will investigate". I was never offered any compensation,apologized to or offered a complimentary meal/reimbursement for our previous meal. This is not the proper way to run a business.
By far, the least attentive service I've ever received at a bar or restaurant in Philadelphia. Don't waste your time or your money.

I had a few tasters then settled on the Red Velvet cake and Key Lime pie. I was dissappointed there was more cream cheese frosting on the RV but was over the moon about the Key Lime!!!! Even if i think it is a bit expensive i will still go back!

Over 14 years and several moves, we have experienced a number of vets, but Indian Walk is really superb.  Everyone from the receptionists to the doctors are friendly, caring and solicitous if the animals.  They offer treatment options and explain the pros and cons of each.  My cat and dog could not be on better hands as they grow old.

Since Yelp doesn't use half-star ratings, if it has got to be between two and three stars for Ricardo's, I'm afraid I have to go with two.

Main strike:  Bland, bland, bland pasta sauces.  Four total pasta dishes were ordered amongst our party, and the verdict was the same for each:  Bland.  Uninspired.  Just... disappointing.

I had the Penne Michaelangelo which was described as coming "in a creamy Vodka-based tomato sauce."  Honestly, it just tasted like basic marinara to me.  I added the optional chicken breast for an additional $4.  This was dry and had clearly been pre-cooked at least an hour or so beforehand.  Total price of this dish came to $16.00. 

It rarely ever occurs to me to reach for the salt at a restaurant, but at Ricardo's I believe we all did.  Heck, I was pouring Parmesan all over mine and stirring it in.  I just kept thinking:  "This tastes just like sauce from a can at the grocery store.."

And when you pair that lack of flavor with the price Ricardo's charges, that is where I cannot rate above 2.5 stars.

Now, the place is visually pleasing with a nice cozy environment, and the staff is friendly enough.  But if I go back to Ricardo's I will be steering clear of the pastas.
Great food and service! Outstanding seafood platter! Grilled oyster the best. Red fish was cooked perfect!

I went to see Abby for some digestive issues. I was surprised that after she put the needles in she did energy work on my stomach and I could feel it begin to change. She sent me home a liquid herb to put in water and take several times a day. Wow, by the next day my digestion was back to normal.  
A few weeks later I caught a cold, went to see if Abby could help. This time it took 2 treatments to get me back, but I was over the cold in just 3 days! 
I highly recommend her for her knowledge of the special herbs and ability to identify just the right treatment to get you back.
Other accupuncturists I have gone to want you to back over and over, Abby gets you well and sends you on your way.

I'm a big fan of Italian food and this place is awesome! Sure sometimes there service can be long, but in the end it's all worth it. The only reason there slow is because they're packed. That must be a very good sign. I've had Carmela's Chicken Rigatoni and it's delectable. I've also had their fish dish. Aka sole. now I'm not a big fan of fish but this dish was very well done, it didn't even taste like fish it was so good. The place is clean and well put together. One time it took a while for my food to get there but the waiter felt so bad that he got me an apron. Kinda weird but helps with cooking food. I love it!!

This is my go-to place for fresh raw oysters and clams. Unlike some of the reviews below, I'm judging this place on the quality and taste of their oysters. After all, it's called the OYSTER house. I wouldn't go into a steakhouse, order a fish dish, then complain about how it didn't live up to my expectations.

The place looks great on the outside with a classic oyster house feel. Inside is dimly-lit and welcoming, with a warm and friendly staff. I always order a dozen of their raw clams. Clams have more taste and texture than oysters, they are absolutely divine. Then dozens of raw oysters are ordered from their ample daily selections menu. If I do order something on the side, it would usually just be fries or the peel 'n eat shrimp. Just something little, the oysters are the main attraction.

I go back to this place time and time again, and am never disappointed.

Oh, and $1 oysters on Mondays. Can't beat that!

As several other reviewers have observed, this place looks very good. One wants to like it. The management, however, is so clueless that I have decided to permanently give it a pass. There are so many really good places in this area where the management knows how to retain good people that one need not spend time in a place where the servers seem to change on a daily basis.

When I buy high-priced coffee, I like to have it in a real mug, not a cardboard cup that I could get at any fast-food joint. When the people here mistakenly put mine in a cardboard cup, I did not ask for a new coffee. Instead, I politely pointed it out in the hopes that they would get it right the next time. In return, I got an argument and nasty looks from the crew at the counter. Also, no matter now many people they have at the counter, they manage to keep even small groups of customers waiting on long lines.
