You know it's a real Italian place when you don't hear English in the kitchen! Absolutely delicious and 100% authentic!!

The restaurant is well lit, has many tables to accommodate a large lunch crowd, and the selection of TVs to watch sports or news is second to none. I have been there 3 times in the past two months and have had a great burger basket w fresh fresh hot french fries.  The burger was great tasting and I am impressed, and a cheesesteak sandwich.  The owners and staff at Joe's were busy and diligent in making the pizzas and wings and were very talkative amongst themselves, but when it came time to serve the food, you the customer were made to feel like a guest in their house.  They were very cordial and suggestive on items to try and they made you feel at home.  On a different visit, I came back for the renowned philly cheese steak, at the prompting of the owner,  which was excellent, I might add, but I wish it was a little bigger like a foot long.  I will definitely be a regular but its a bit far from my place in St. Pete. will try their Pizza / Wings next visit since the sign outside says Joe's Pizza... you think?

$6.50 for a Kenzinger and the bartender didn't even know what it was. Probably one of the most highly ordered beers in Philadelphia other then PBR. $7.50 for a shot of Jim Beam. I'm Wishing this place Well, but how did you not learn from the previous businesses downfall. No one in the neighborhood wants to pay center city cocktail bar prices, for  standard corner bar ambience, and a pretty average food menu. Better make some aggressive changes quickly or your gonna have Bar None ;)

I'm going to get real with you for a sec Target, and this may hurt... how many Target's on Broadway do we need? This one feels like an afterthought, not a real Target, just a slight suggestion of what a Target should actually be. The layout drives me nuts, it's usually pretty haphazard, and I cried a little inside last month when I asked for Chanukah candles and they said, "We don't carry those types of things at this location." Odd. In any case, there's a perfectly stocked, clean, well organized Target down the street at El Con. Go there.
Just missed happy hour last Friday when the oysters are only a buck a schuck!  Better timing next time!

The food here is delicious but the service leaves a lot to be desired. It felt like a zoo!!! You walk in and there are no visible directions as to whether you can sit anywhere or wait to be seated. You finally walk through a maze of people eating and find a counter which appears to be a place to order food. There is no direction as to how to pay for the food. So it's entirely plausible to have your meal and walk away or take it to go without paying. I saw a couple asking the exact same question of where to pay for the food as we walked in. We were also confused as to whether we should take the dishes away or leave them at the table. A really beautiful space. The sandwiches were really really delicious. Our lunch order with 2 Cuban sandwiches, 2 sides and 1 soft drink came out to $40! The sides were expensive!!! A small side salad came out to almost $5. For me that's too much for lunch, it appears that the dinner prices are the same. The only person who smiled at us here was the guy at the counter.

Came here early-ish in a Sunday morning with a large group. We all ordered from the coffee counter, took our number and waited at a table for the food. I ordered a iced latte or something similar which definitely took a long time to make. By the time it was done, my food was ready! 

I had the omelete with jalapeno grits and while I thought the omelete was good I found the grits so-so, I don't think I even finished them and I LOVE grits! 

This place has a very quick grab and go vibe to it all while remaining sophisticated. You've got paper plates and utensils but stylish seating, decor, art, etc. 

I didn't explore the place but they did have an entire salad bar where they build the salad for you or you can customize. You can also shop around and buy food here, which I didn't do although my boyfriend's mom did buy us some caviar (which I haven't ate yet). They packaged it in a container of ice for us!

My first time dining here. We came for our 1st anniversary. As soon as we were seated I overheard our waitress taking about how she wanted to go home but she had to wait until she had no more tables to wait on. They were out of the steak I ordered.  Didn't offer a dessert menu, I had to ask for it. They only have 6 desserts and she didn't bother to tell me that some were sold out until I inquired about them. And to top it off, we were charged for a whole bottle of wine when we ordered a glass. Of course it was corrected but I could have easily overlooked it. Overall an awful experience, the food wasn't the problem though. Other than the food they didn't have. Service was atrocious and I will certainly remember our 1st wedding anniversary.

Poor customer service will never be shopping at this store or location again. Chris was very rude arguing back-and-forth with me. He's A manager but not really sure how he's very unprofessional. And needs to work on his customer service skills.

In from out of state, just killing time. Nice selection of Midwest stuff, staff is helpful. We asked if they ship purchases and they acted like they were offended. Any place this size out West does. Anyhow, didn't see anything that tempted me to schlep it over to UPS. Bought a few little items that fit in our carry on bag.
Great food and awesome atmosphere!  Loved our front row seat to watch the USF Ice Bulls! Our server Callie was on point and catered to our every need!  We'll definitely be back.

We might've liked Mike's ice cream so much that we came here twice out of our four days in Nashville. With a bevy of flavors, it's hard to go to wrong.  We especially enjoyed creative flavors such as the blueberry and cornbread and the nutter butter.

For the holidays, they also have hot chocolates around the world, which looked interesting!

We don't dine here often because we live in out of town, but each time we've been the service is friendly, helpful and timely. The food is consistent in quality, love the paper table cloths and I really like the atmosphere.
Came back since this place is the bee's knees for folks in this town. It was gross again and our out of town guests agreed. Yucky!

Ambiance is industrial chic, service can be a bit lacking on Fridays (they really need a bigger bar area and more staff) but if you go in there on a Wednesday expect to have a good conversation about beer. Good variety they tend to have 6 to 8 beers for sampling at all times. The variety goes from wheat beers up to some very nice porters and beyond.  They don't have any food but if your lucky there might be a food truck there on a Friday. The prices are kind of high from 12-17 dollars for a growler but they do sell half growlers that they fill for half price. Overall I'm glad to have this brewery in Indy.

Had a graduation party catered by Zio's recently, and it is the real Italian deal, folks. Delicious red sauces cooked in house, amazing meatballs, and antipasto trays to die for that included some of the best mortadela I've ever tasted. Don't even get me started on their fresh-baked Italian bread. If you're from up north, then you know real Italian bread is hard to find down here, but not anymore!

I went to the actual store today for lunch and was torn between the "30 napkin" meatball sub, and the Italian.  I saw someone else order the meatball, and it was offensively MASSIVE.  I imagine a fork and knife is required because unless you're a retired porn actress, your mouth probably doesn't open that wide.  The freaking meatballs are the size of tennis balls.  No joke.

I was wearing a shirt I really like, so I went the less-saucy route and ordered an Italian sub.  As soon as the woman behind the counter grabbed the bread, I knew I wasn't gonna be able to take it down, so I immediately asked them for half to go.  The bread is probably 13 or 14 inches, but it's the girth that stands out.  This ain't no Publix or Subway bread.  This sandwich was big, thick and meaty.  And just to spice it up a bit, I added Capocollo to it.  What I ended up with was the best Italian sub I've had in Florida.  A full 5 out of 5 on my Italian sub scale.

Lastly, it should be noted that this place is a market and deli store that sells a lot of imported grocery items.  There are a few tables for those who wish to dine in, but while I was there, most people called ahead and got their orders to go.  

I highly recommend this eatery!
Seriously the shitest Indiana service. I only come because it closes late and its food is good. But their waitresses are trash
Great food and super cool location. Group had wings and tropical salad both great. Highly recommend!
Got a scoop of cookie dough and barely had any actual "cookie dough" in it. Don't call it that if you can't supply.

I stayed here for work, and the price was good. The room was standard. My room was on the first floor, being my first time there I Didnt know that I would be able to hear traffic as well as people having breakfast in the morning. If the option is available I would ask not to be on the first floor. Breakfast was great. I suggest you bring drinks/water with you. I ended up buying a bottle of water from the hotel when I arrived at night and it was about $2.80! The staff is nice, however either they are understaffed or unattentive- they have a room behind the front desk and it seemed very often when i would go to the desk there was no one there because they were in that room. I will be coming again for my work events!

This was our second time at Doc's and we enjoyed it both times. We ordered oysters and shared some appetizers both times so I can't comment on the regular entrees. But oysters were fresh and they have a nice selection, mostly East Coast. They could have been shucked a little cleaner though. From our first time there I learned that their food could be hit or miss. So second time around we were smarter and shared calamari - delicious, blt lobster tacos - good, and old bay fries - really good. We finished with oyster shooters - perfect combo of lemon vodka, cocktail sauce and fresh oyster. And could not help it but get some of their frozen desserts - cookies and cream for me and cream and raspberries for my husband. All in all, our bill was about $100 before tip and that included dozen oysters and glass of wine each. Service was exceptional all throughout the dinner and we left very happy.
Absolutely love this place! The food was excellent and the service was as well.  Very cool place to watch lighting games!

This place literally drives me crazy. Some days it is the best pizza around. Others days it reminds me of school lunch pizza. So I guess I now have a love/hate relationship with Ardmore Pizza. Please get some consistency!!!!!

I am a very big fan of this place, it's a great place to get an affordable lunch. They make everything from scratch and it always tastes fresh. You can even call in your order and it will be ready in minutes. 10/10
FYI, this restaurant is now closed. Forrey's restaurant now occupies the space. It has steak, seafood, pizza and other items.

Sad to see they changed so many great parts of their menu. No more cinnamon rolls or donuts now it's just a sugar coated morning bun. And adding bacon to their egg and tomato biscuit sandwiches was really not necessary they were good before. The first time I ordered 2 and realized that there was bacon in them I drove back and asked them to remake it and when I checked them again the egg they put inside was so tiny and thin I literally thought it wasn't in there and drove to the store to buy eggs just so it could have more filling! Disappointed in the menu changes but may still go back for other menu items.

We did all three tours and it was a lot of walking, but it was well worth it. Our guide on all the tours was George and he was great! He goes in to a lot of historical detail and really knows his stuff. He was very nice and always willing to answer questions the best he could. If he didn't know the answer he would say he didn't know instead of making some crap up. He also seemed very plugged in to the community which was cool as well cause he could give personal stories. I learned a lot about what voodoo actually is and not the Hollywood version. Very interesting. 
The ghost tour was our favorite. It is not the made theatrical crap some of the other tour companies seem to do. I would much rather have someone like George give me the documented factual accounts rather than some 20something chick with piercings who pretends to be a vampire on the weekends bs.  If you do not believe in the paranormal take this tour and take lots of random pictures of the balconies. 
We had a great time on these tours and highly recommend this company. It was really hot, but that's New Orleans in June. Take lots of water and wear good comfortable shoes and you'll be fine.

Food was pretty good, I had the chipotle chicken and it had a nice kick. Chips and queso were good, we wanted the pulled pork nachos, but they were sold out. Not much of a wine selection, but the beer was apparently very cold. Our server was really bad. She was very friendly, but did not seem to grasp our order. She forgot a lot and did not even ask for any food order until we had been there 30 minutes. She may have been new to serving.
I don't know how to review it, I don't eat cat lol. Cats here are soooooooooo cute! Living angels! Hot chocolate tastes good.

Raspberry white chocolate cheesecake. Nuff said.
(Pleasant people and place to sit too)
Great neighborhood spot.  Very clean and well-maintained. Excellent pub grub. Fantastic burger. They always have Peroni on tap which works out just fine for me. Nice happy hour too.
What a great experience we had at dinner on Friday night. Good was incredible and nice to see a family run business where the family is actually there and working!! We will definitely be back.

Underrated Italian spot tucked away in Lafayette Square. This place is awesome. Large portions, tasty cocktails, and a great ambiance. They now have 2 bars to enjoy. One is when you first enter the building, and the other is further back in the dining area. 

Local beer on tap. Not overly pricy for a high quality dinner. Also a decent spot for a happy hour drink and an appetizer. I'm all about this little neighborhood spot. If you're looking to get away from the Hill, and still enjoy Italian give this place a try!

I love this place! I tried to come here for lunch as much as possible when I attended Rutgers. I miss coming here and seeing the lovely couple that run the place. They're always so nice! The salads are great and affordable, I am a huge fan of the green goddess dressing. They give you a generous portion and I really miss coming here! Would highly recommend it if you're in the area.
best deli in Pinellas county, hands down.  quality  ingredients  and fresh toppings.  the homemade bread is stellar.  i wish i lived closer.

Amazing home-made ice cream!! We happened to walk by the place on a very hot day that we walked 20,000 steps!! Nothing can beat ice cream on a hot day! They offer variety of different types! Ice cream was yummy with crunchy waffle cone!!

Jennie was a major asset to my first home search. She is to the core a professional, highly personable, and has a deep understanding of the Chicago real estate market. She was there for every step of the process from the search, inspections, and closing. I always recommend her services to family and friends who are in the market and she will be the first one that I call when looking for a new property."

I shopped on Sunday with my girl friend and we spent $325 on good value for money "stuff". 
I went back on Monday to exchange a sweater and also bought some more "stuff". 
Had a few minutes at lunch time today so went again to buy 3 shirts, 3 T shirts and a scarf. 
Stood in line while a customer was at the till with a shop assistant and a supervisor (?). Plenty of staff at the counter and on the floor but now 5 customers behind me. There appeared to be confusion over a gift card.
I asked the supervisor (?) if she would open another till. She looked at me as if I had asked for the moon and mumbled something as she walked away from the tills.
I don't shop where the customers are not served quickly and effectively so dropped my "stuff" and walked out!
If S&M Santa Barbara wants to survive, they had better wake up to better customer service!!!

First off the owners are very inviting and really nice people.  Second, beautiful cats to hang with and adopt if so desired.  Third, coffee...I was apprehensive but then noticed the Chemex.  Chemex and cats, incredible.  I encourage everyone to at least go for the beverages.  Great local roaster represented and fun and appropriately named teas, bites coming soon.  The cats are in a separate well designed room to allow humans to chill with them.  The front portion of the cafe has a nice big window to enjoy the cats from a distance...but why get in there and pet them.
If you're visiting downtown Nashville and don't try the Nutter Butter ice cream at Mike's you have done yourself a serious disservice. It is wonderful, as is the staff.

Great shop on Broadway to get your ice cream fix. Also open late, so you can indulge into the night if need be.

Decided to get a local Tennessee Fudge, and it was righteous. The smoothness of the ice cream itself was spot-on, and the fudge flavor was just enough to make sure you knew it was part of the band.

Service was friendly and fast, so that's a plus to getting the crowd to move quickly.
Very good ice cream. Service is quick and it is very convenient in terms of distance from work.

Go to Italian spot for takeout. Every meal they sell easily feeds two. I especially recommend the lasagna which is obviously homemade top to bottom and exceptional. 

They also have some of the best meatballs anywhere and their fresh baked Italian bread really complete things well.

Be sure to be early though, they close just after rush hour on weekdays but all their food reheats well.

Definitely liked this place ... showed up for a late lunch and opted for a lunch special (11-2) of chicken Parmesan. The special came with a house salad, bread (with soft butter), the chicken and red sauce cavatelli. Everything was fresh, presented well and was priced well for what you got ($9). I also opted for a cannoli as I was about to get up and leave, and with a crisp shell and homemade filling, it was just the right topper to this lunch. Ricardo's has a nice comfortable interior with a small bar area and two rooms for dining. A good place to visit in the Lafayette Square area with owners very involved in the operation. Check it out.

When you are dating an Italian who likes solid, uncomplicated Italian food, and you don't feel like cooking said food yourself ... Ricardo's is the ticket.

Following up our visit to Square One the night before, we returned to Lafayette Square to continue our exploration of this cute little neighborhood. We enjoyed the outdoor seating (unique deck chairs with cushions) and had a funky waiter who said he and his whole family were not only from St. Louis, but from Lafayette Square, for a few generations. Interesting. The food was "A-OK." We had a nice bottle of wine, I had a tasty pizza, and my Italian had steak and pasta. Our calamari appetizer was a little disappointing, had clearly come from a bag and was not made in house, but we somehow managed to finish it all.

I would go to Ricardo's again because it's relatively inexpensive, has a nice atmosphere, and has food that will meet my expectations. One tip for the owners: you need better signage about which door is the entrance. Literally every guest (we had a final count of 10) that walked by us after we sat down got it wrong.

For downtown locals with a sweet tooth, this place rocks! Just a no nonsence ice cream shop that gets it right each time. Their homemade ice cream is amazing. Out of towners...swing by for a tasty treat and top off your trip to Nashville with whip cream and nuts. Enjoy!

Good chow for Afton, USA.  I went there for lunch and had the Philly Cheese and momma had the turkey wrap.  They didn't cheat on the meat..  I especially like getting onion rings with my sammie without having to pay extra, which were pretty tasty.  The tea was a little watered down though.

I'll be back for happy hour-$1.75 drafts.
The service is very friendly here! Food is always fresh. The salads are amazing. It's a little on the pricey side, but you're paying for a great atmosphere and clean tables. I would definitely return

My wife and I went here for an early Valentines day dinner and we had a great time.

First the good. The food and drinks were excellent. The beer menu was a little on the shorter side, but they had a nice variety of draft and bottled beer, My wife ordered an alcoholic lemonade (the name escapes me) which I tasted and I can say it was dangerously good. We started with a half perfect storm which is raw clams and oysters crab and shrimp. It was pretty decent considering how far inland we are (although my clams were slightly gritty.) 

For my entree I got the sirloin/ crab cake combo. The steak was delicious, definitely a quality cut of meat. The crab cake was slightly bland but the sauce really helped to pep it up. The sides were excellent and complimented the food nicely. My wife had the scallops which I can say were pretty damn good (and I'm not a scallops fan.) Desserts were tasty but small we ended up getting ice cream on the way home to satisfy the sweet tooth. 

The atmosphere was really nice. It has a friendly, old-world, everything is handmade look to it, but both the restaurant and the bathrooms were very clean. The temperature in the restaurant was great (it was a very cold day) but the bathrooms were frigid. There decor consisted of old and new pictures and knickknacks and really helped to enhance the ambiance.

Now for the bad. Our server was, there's no other word for it, incompetent. We had to ask for our water and he didn't remember to get it until after our appetizer was on the table, he did not know the specials and had to go ask his manager several very basic questions about the menu. It sometimes took several minutes for him to go get us something as simple as a refill. My wife's dish was missing one of it's sides and when she pointed that out he said "I was wondering about that". I really think he was upset because we interrupted him hitting on the new bartender and it showed in his service.  Frankly he is the only reason that Doc's isn't rated five stars. 

Overall Doc's had great food, great drinks and a really nice atmosphere and I would go there again, I would just make sure we sat in a different section.

Hope this helps.

Seeing negative reviews from one-timers made me feel like I need to set the record straight a little bit, because I love this store. Yes, prices are higher than used bookstores, but that's how it's always been. B&N always has great sales once or twice a month and has a huge clearance selection, so if you disagree with the price of a brand new hardback, either wait for the paperback or come back for a sale. Or, better yet, become a member and get ridiculous discounts on everything.

I come here all the time, and went to the store before it moved, and I've always had a great experience. The store is well organized (and ACTUALLY in alphabetical order) and now that they've moved, it's humongous. No more awkward aisle shuffling when someone else wants the same book as you. They don't mind if you sit and read for a bit, and the cafe is quick and friendly. Tech support for Nooks users is always available and they seem like they know what they're talking about. Now that I have a niece, I actually visit the children's section and appreciate that it's never a jumbled, grimy mess. They have everything labelled by age group to make it easy. 

As for the staff, they are always available and friendly and know their stuff. If I mention an author, odds are they know who it is and where to find it. If they don't have what you need in store, they jump at the chance to order it to be delivered to their store. The only reason I don't give this place five stars is because they suffer from the perpetual understaffed checkout line that many large retailers are afflicted with. I wouldn't blame customer service on that--I'd blame the chain. But I always enjoy coming here as a lover of bookstores, and I appreciate that they've grown to recognize me and my taste in books.

Attentive service and woodsy decor sets this restaurant apart from the competition. Booths with TV's make watching the game an intimate experience. Menu is limited but the cuisine is stellar. The only thing preventing this place from 5 stars is the lack of a vegetarian entrée.

Something has been amiss here for the last year-- Food  used to be great- now, after  3 meals there we  are convinced There must have been a major change in the front or back of the establishment.     2 nights they said they "ran out of" shrimp cocktail.   How does a seafood place run out of shrimp cocktail.    Fish of the day comes out  dry with a sad  pile of overcooked vegetable.  Crab legs in steamerpots I saw getting sent back because they were so skimpy-- Not  being mean here-- just trying to figure out  what happened to this place.

This place SUCKS!!!!
the advertise one special and then don't honor it. Over priced and always empty. 
I should have seen the poor service coming when 80% of the bar was empty on a Saturday night.

Place is pricey. I tried an espresso donut. It was good but nothing I'd have to have again. For $4 for a donut I was expecting an omg flavor, it was good but not knock my socks off. I'm glad I tried it but dont think I'll try again if back in the SB area.  Cool spot though and nice vibe.

Gavi is not a nice romantic Italian restaurant.  It is mostly green, with a wall full of alcohol bottles and sports paraphernalia littering the walls.  The dining room consists of many tables and two booths.  There is also an outdoor seating area that feels like it's part of the parking lot.

They have a version of mozzarella sticks that are a must try.  They're more like two slabs of cheese fried and then smothered in marinara sauce with basil and parmesan sprinkled on top.  Very good and you can use the extra sauce to dip the complimentary bread in.

The menu lacks flavor on all things but their marinara sauce.  The marinara sauce is not too sweet, not too tomatoey, not too bitter.  The fettuccine alfredo is bland and requires lots of red peppers.  The mozzarella prosciutto sandwich is my favorite thing on the menu, the bread is soft with a firm crust, the meats and cheeses are only alright at best, but the mustard-mayonnaise sauce gives it a nice kick.

I can't resist cannoli's.  They have them here, and for $6 you can get something that looks like a cannoli, is called a cannoli, but is filled with cream instead of cheese.  Still, it is very good and worth ordering.

When I went to Penn, this was THE Wawa - complete with the welcoming comittee of "usual" homeless guys - the same ones day after day.

They do alot of business at this well-travelled location.

\Smokes, coffee, junk food, sandwiches, ice cream - everything a college kid might need at the last minute.
My wife and I had an awesome dinner at BAP last night. Definetly one of our favorite take out places in the neighborhood.

We always get the sushi here, which I've got to say is pretty damn good, especially their special rolls. Their presentations are always unique and imaginative though you'll have to wait a little as they aren't very fast. Located at the Burlington Center Mall, but don't let that fool you, the quality of their food and frequent special prices makes this the best Japanese place in town. Great for dinner or business lunches.

Ardmore Pizza is hit or miss. I will recommend going here if you're not in the mood to cook - their food is good. However, they do have some issues. 

Their pizza is very delicious - sometimes a bit too greasy - but when it comes to getting a good late-night dish, they do a good job. Overall, they have good quantity for their prices.

However, every single time I have come here, they have messed up my order some how. every. single. time. 

I started to order online because I figured there couldn't and shouldn't be any missed communication (as opposed to a phone call) and they have yet(!) to get something right. One time they put the wrong toppings on my food (not happy about that!) and recently  they forgot to put in my sauces I ordered. Prior to leaving, I asked if the sauces were included and they said yes - I repeated because I still wasn't sure and they confirmed I got what I wanted. Granted, I should have taken a second to double check (seeing as this has been a repetitive issue), but still - it's not that hard! 

If you're in the mood for quick food, it's a good solution. Don't get your hopes too high and double check they give you what you ordered!
This place was great and had a huge variety of flavors! We ordered double scoops and it was so much that we couldn't finish since we had just had dinner. The salted caramel was amazing!

I haven't been to every pizza place in the Tampa area, but I've been to a lot.  So far this is easily the best NY style pizza I've had. The toppings are excellent and everything I've ordered has consistently been cooked perfectly. They also make a mean Sicilian, which I love, but isn't always available. Don't let the location or its history as a former Taco Bell dissuade you; it's a real hidden gem.
Eating the turkey and Brie sandwich now. Very oniony, but very delicious. Great combo of flavors. Their bread is so good I think anything would taste good on it.

LOVED  LOVED LOVED. Cheese steak, chicken biscuit, and even vegetarian options were great. Decor was adorable and staff was helpful. The layout was a little confusing for our first time but staff was more than happy to help us.
Good selection of flavors & it's exactly what you'd expect, old fashioned homemade ice cream.
My daughter and I came in and we have an amazing ice cream, the staff were awesome and cool we definitely recommend it

Apparently throwing a bag of Mac n cheese in the warmer is too difficult a task for this place to comprehend. After I waited twenty minutes the girl behind the counter stared flipping shit when she called my number and I walked up to get my food because they were "out of warm food so I have to get a refund". I'll make sure my laser vision/telekinesis so I can see though counter tops and read your mind is on point next time.
One of the best Ice cream places I've ever been. Great flavors large portions great value. The four of us had a great time and loved the ice cream.

My oh my, how the mighty have fallen. Holy %^&. I hadn't been here in 10 or so years, and evidently all I've missed is the steady decline of a not-to-be-missed antique mall into some covered bridge festival/ low-rent craft fair crap. Sorry to be harsh, but the contrast of how it USED to be, as to how it is now was just jarring and disappointing. People still talk about this place like it's still such a great place. It isn't if you are wanting to do some antique hunting. And overpriced! Geez, Louise, are the sellers here proud of their stuff! As a lifelong and avid antique mall junkie, I can tell you, this one has lost its luster. I'll never go back.

So I live in Santa Barbara and have visited the bakery on multiple occasions, always walking away unimpressed and slightly irritated. This morning was no different. Sunday at 9 AM, no line yet, and I asked if the egg and cheddar biscuit could be made with sourdough instead, (I was looking at the shelves loaded with their sourdough loaves), but I got an unapologetic "no, the kitchen doesn't do that" response. Strike 1. Next, my friend ordered a bagel with cream cheese and tomato slices, and was sorely disappointed in the measly portion of 3 tiny slices of "crisp" and utterly flavorless Roma tomatoes that were given. For their prices, one should be getting organic tomatoes, or at least larger, juicier, higher-quality ripe tomatoes. Strike 2. My son and I waited a solid 15 minutes for our egg sandwiches to come out, and watched as others who came in after us received their orders well before us. When we did get the sandwiches, we had to do a careful investigation to find the egg. We had ordered scrambled, and upon close inspection under the "hood" we finally found it: the thinnest "patty" of egg I have ever encountered, barely to be tasted within all the brioche bun. My 7-year old asked, "Where's the egg?" and I should have brought it back up to the manager to show what was actually coming out of the kitchen for $8.  Strike 3. The croissant my daughter ordered was not flaky or fresh (Renaud's is infinitely better) and she left a lot of it on her plate (something she never does). It's too bad, because the location is good, atmosphere OK, and their bagels better than most in the area (lots of chew and tug, hearty). Unfortunately, Helena Ave Bakery won't be seeing us around again, unless we stick to ordering bagels to go.

This is one of the busiest Wawas that I have seen. On many occasions, the bar with the condiments for the coffee has been totally disgusting. There seems to be only one cashier for all of the people in line waiting to pay. I have to go there since there are not many Wawas in the area.

Delicious espresso.
I ordered my usual short breve latte not filled all the way to the top. 
He even said decaf need to be compressed harder to get the flavor right. Bravo!

Overall the gym is big and has pretty much all the equipment you need, though a lot could be updated. The locker rooms are ancient and not very clean. My biggest gripe is what has been posted a number of times on here, cancelling your membership. I was transferred by the military and asked to cancel my membership (I was on a month to month contract). The guy at the front desk said all I had to do was send an e-mail cancelling my membership. I asked if I needed to provide additional details such as reason for cancellation and he said, no just say you want to cancel and it will be taken care of. Well I sent in the e-mail for request of cancellation, and sure enough my credit card is still being charged. I will be putting in another membership cancellation as well as having my credit card company block this company.

My last visit to this establishment was about 8 years ago and the experience was quite good. We had friends visiting us from Tanzania and we decided to treat them to an Italian evening, bad idea choosing Macaroni grill! 
We were seated promptly, our server was very friendly (1  star), bread was served, balsamic vinegars hit the table midway during the meal. The food was really mediocre, my Salmon was dry, the raviolis were ok to say the least, the chicken was also dry. We pretended to enjoy the food as we did not want our friends to notice our discomfort  I bet they were probably doing the same!!  Not spending my money here again.

Yes there are a lot of flavors, ice cream is of good quality- but the taste is not that amazing as other good quality ice creams I have had. I am pretty boring and stick to basics- like vanilla.. yes, vanilla. Oberweis for example has  a much more pronounced vanilla flavor. My family has more adventurous palettes and tried a mixture of flavors. While good, not great. Staff is friendly.

As a true ice cream fan, I had to try Mike's Ice Cream shop before leaving Nashville. Located in a great location in the heart of Broadway street, you'll see so many people walking around with their ice cream cones or cups up and down the street. 

On a nice day in the afternoon, the line was outside the door. So, if you can go on a week night after dinner time it's way less crowded and you can walk right in and get your ice cream. Ask for samples! Super generous and they will give you a whole spoon full of a sample. There are so many different flavors to choose from. I chose the mocha almond chip and I was pleased. The ice cream was creamy, and really tasted like home made hard ice cream. Be careful when getting a scoop on a cone as mine almost completely fell off! The perfect snack for a warm Nashville day. Plus you can walk off your ice cream right away walking back and forth on Broadway street!

#1 draw here is the tropical drink menu; usually $6-$7 per drink, price goes down to $3 per drink during happy hour.  Food is moderately priced; most of the menu items are under $10.  I never can remember what I eat there which speaks to the very average taste provided.  Also, the restaurant only plays three songs which gets old.

I had the BBQ pork fried rice. It was solidly mediocre. I've had much worse, and much better. The wait staff was friendly and the service was reasonably fast. Pretty much the definition of a 3-star review.

I lived in Korea and always have high expectations when it comes to Korean food. This place is perfect for a quick lunch/dinner on the go and the bibimbap is good. The price is a bit high considering the atmosphere and location but this is still my go-to spot for a Korean in Philly. Been here twice and always had beef bibimbap in a hot pot. I would recommend this place!

I came here with my friend on a thursday night and this place be poppin'. However, the ice cream was well worth the wait. I decided to be super basic and get the cookies n cream with a waffle cone. The total came out to be around $4.50, which isn't bad considering how much ice cream you get! The ice cream was rich, creamy, and sweet, but not sweet enough to give you a sugar overload. Best part about Mike's ice cream is the location! You can enjoy your delicious treat while watching all the crazy drunks strolling down dtown.

Despite what the name would suggest, Caviar & Bananas actually serves salads, sandwiches, and flatbreads, along with a stocked wine cupboard for sipping wine with some friends. Their salads and sandwiches are fresh and include some amazing ingredients like goat cheese and walnuts. All of their dressings are made in house and they offer good insight on which dressing to pair with the toppings in your salad. Overall the food is really fresh and delicious, but it is on the expensive side. Be prepared to spend 12-14 dollars on a salad or sandwich.

When you first walk in, there is an obnoxious odor.  It finally dawned on me that it is coming from the seafood department.  This store does not believe in customer service, rather, customer dis-service.  I finally gave up going to this place.  On two different occasions, I asked two different deli clerks about hams in the deli case.  Something as in: "What is this ham like".  Both clerks on both clerks looked at me like I was asking for them to walk on their hands and replied, in a disgusted voice......"It's ham".  Gee, thanks, that tells me a lot.  The last clerk, a particulary abrasive woman, was very smug when she asked in her raspy voice: "It's ham".  I could not contain myself and said that I knew it was ham, WHAT KIND?.  I used to use the self checkout to avoid the nastiness of the checkers.  Alas, that left me to deal with the nasty clerks at the self checker.  There is one who will blab away on her cell phone or to other employees and let you stand there waiting and waiting.  One day she looked at me and asked if I needed help.  Again, I could not contain myself and had to reply that this was the reason why I was standing in front of her.  Watch the prices, because the charged price is often higher than the self price.  It really is best to stay away though

This place is called "Twin Peaks" which, like "Hooters", is a not so subtle way of reminding you why you really came here. You didn't come here for gourmet food. You didn't come here to discuss Plato and Dostoevsky with PhD students who are working as waitresses to help pay tuition. You came here for the twin peaks.

Having said that, the food is on par with other sports bars, which means it's mediocre. So why four stars instead of the 2-3 stars I consistently give to sports bars with mediocre food (which is all of them)? Because twin peaks.

The perfect spot for: Date night, girls night, group night, whatever you want! 

I had been meaning to try Tuna Bar out since it opened up in the neighborhood, but I don't have a lot of friends that like sushi (shameful.... I know). My girlfriend and I decided to have girls night here and it was great! They have a nice selection of wines/cocktails and plenty of options for sushi. 

We ordered three rolls and shared between the two of us: the Wentz (special roll), the Fishtown (speciality roll), and a Spicy Salmon roll.  I think what I liked the most about this place was the plating. Everything is served on one long platter and perfectly set. We all know we 'eat with our eyes first' and this was definitely one of those nights. 

All three rolls were spectacular. Service was just ok, but honestly the food is great and it's a great addition to the neighborhood so I'll be back!
Good was on par with your typical sports bar. Clearly the cleavage motif is where they concentrate most of their efforts. Great place for game day food.
pretty much similar to other reviews. but i love the selection and i love the convenience of having starbucks with a place to read the books. pricey. staff pretty helpful.

Greatest place ever! I get the dolsot bibimbop. It is delicious, sizzling, spicy, tender goodness. Coupled with the Korean Spicy paste makes it even better.

Frances, the owner, is a super nice, hardworking guy. I really like him. He even brought over some sample pickled radish for me to try - it was delicious.

Definitely support this great, delicious place!!

This is the second time I've been there. After reading reviews they must have many friends & family writing them because my experience was not as pleasant. The food for the price point is acceptable, nothing more. Some staff, bartender & male server are excellent. That is where the compliments stop. Hostess is rude, the bar/waiting area is confusing & either too many regulars or family. As a customer I felt as I was intruding on a family function. They evidently still have cleaning crew issues. I thought I'd give it another try but was not impressed. I doubt I'll try it again maybe in a few years. St Louis has so many good restaurants to chose from.

First off they have one of the nicest wait staff! The food good, not amazing but good. I had the Chicken Marie which is chicken in a white wine sauce with broccoli and mushrooms. It was good but I felt that there was something missing in the flavor department.  My aunt got their special which was chicken stuffed with spinach and cheese with a lemon butter sauce and a side of tomato risotto, her chicken was good but the tomato risotto was amazing!  I will be back to see if their other food is great and apparently they have a dinner buffet on Mondays for $8.

DON'T USE CHASE CARDS!!!

Can we spell inept boys and girls?
These geniuses lost my application.
I called not once, but twice to follow up.
The second time they could not find it in their system, so they claimed it must have been archived. I am so upset with these bozos I am going to reveal a skeleton in their closet, just for Halloween.
And now for the dirty little secret... Whichever merchant you use this specialty card at,  the nasty people at Chase slam them with higher card fees.  That means its the bakery, super market, etc. that is paying for your air miles. And on top of slamming the merchant, they hit you with that nice annual fee.

DON'T USE CHASE CARDS!!!
SCAM ALERT!!!

Saw a review from Fox29 and had to give it a try! Love the atmosphere, trendy and vibrant! Quality of food is on point, service super friendly! Love the non rice options for rolls! If you are in the Old City area, must give this place a shot!

Had a terrible time. First my server was not very nice. Second, made my kids wait for their food while everyone else was served. Third, spoke with manager and then it just got awkward. Server got snotty and tried to show no I'll feelings, but just pushed us aside. Made faces and failed to connect with us. This was my wedding dinner that we did with our closest friends. This has ruined the meal. Dessert, I did not have the stomach to ask had a hard time enjoying my dinner also. More things happened that made the night very uncomfortable. Please stay away from this place if it means anything to you or your family. I will never come back again.

Started with bruschetta and it was super bland. The Alfredo sauce was overly salty had to send it back.  The spaghetti was pretty bland as well.  I had the fat bread and it was good, tons of crust!  The marinara for dipping was a little on the sweet side for my taste.  Overall disappointed in our visit.

Our waiter was very attentive and always making sure we were doing okay or offering suggestions. However, the food was "okay." I had the Alfredo, but there was nothing special about it. My first bite of the chicken had a long black hair in it, which definitely disgusted me, but I didn't want to make a fuss so I just kept picking through it carefully. My fiancé had the Truffle Macaroni and it didn't have any distinct flavor to separate it from any other macaroni at a restaurant. The cheese was a little hardened to the macaroni and was just overall, not the best. We ended up sharing my Alfredo. My sister got the salmon and was not impressed with that either. She maybe ate a half of it and then switched to eating the bread. 
Overall, if you are looking for somewhere that has decent service, Macaroni Grill has that! But the food isn't anything special especially for the price!
OMG... The bread here is super delicious, soft, moist, and perfect! The best bread I've had! Oh, the soft butter with a hint of sea salt was off the chart! I'm salivating writing this.

Went for dinner on a Tuesday night (relatively empty). Food was alright, not the best, but good. Service was not great. Server was attentive, but didn't get my order right. She did make things right by leaving the incorrect order for me to take home and brought the correct order to me without charging me for the incorrect order. Main downside to the service was how long it took to get the food. 

Also be aware, the Happy Hour specials are in the bar only.

Locked out the other night and was forced to call a few locksmiths. AMPM actually had a live, friendly individual answering the phone who was able to quickly handle my request (and follow up calls). 
Once he arrived, The locksmith only took about 5 min to get me back into the house. It did cost $120 - but given this was after hours and on a wknd (and after seeing what others have paid with other companies) I think it was a deal. 
Highly recommended

My spouse and I went to the restaurant on a Tuesday night about 7 pm .They were not very busy. We both ordered dinners.The service was very good, but the food was terrible. My spouses lasagna was burned on the bottom, the spaghetti was luke warm with very little sauce.My meal was an angle hair pasta with shrimp and it was not warm enough for me to eat. When I order meal I at least expect it to come to the table hot. We have given this place 3 times to get it right, we will not be returning gor a 4th try.
Great apps, great happy hour (who knew?).  Salads are fresh and tasty.  Love the pastas and the variety on the wine lists.  Its always a great visit.  Love the addition of the bar.
I'm a Ricardo's fan.  Friendly, locally owned spot and the owner is usually in the kitchen.  Usually go for the lasagna, but tried the pizza last time and loved it.

I visited Roast for the first time on a Tuesday evening. It wasn't crazy busy, but still busier than I expected for a weekday. I can understand how it must get packed at certain times. It's a very comfortable and inviting space in a beautiful historic building. I had actually thought they served only coffee, but there's quite a selection of various drinks and teas, and a variety of food. The staff were pretty friendly and there's lots of seating. I definitely plan on returning to try some of their other drinks.

I was so glad when the smoking ban in Phila  was implemented,because the old men smoking would have been the only the only reason I would have gave this place a lower score.Phew! it was foul smelling. The prices are unbelievable.I don't know how they can create such beautiful works of art for such small amounts of money .60 cents for a magnificent pastry decorated with glazed fruit to look like a expensive $5.00 french pastry.Crazy! and delish.My favorite is the buttery cream filled coconut bun.It is so rich we tend to share one with coffee.Buy a few and refrigerate them or impress friends at a party .So many lovely sweets so cheap and yummy.Nice enough for a bridal party. Street parking sucks but one goes in while the others circle.
Live music on Friday night.  Having a pint of chinook a licious.  This is becoming my favorite bar.

Terrible customer service, not 1 person said hello out of the 10 associates I saw. Yet there was only 1 person ringing a line of 10 people. Wasn't worth my lunch hour. I hate to leave a bad review but man, they need some people skills!
Great salad bar selection! I love the fresh ingredients.... However, I can't help but describe it as a more upscale Panera. It's becoming one of my favorite places to grab a pricey latte!

I dropped by alone on a Tuesday evening. The place was pretty quiet, and a sat at the bar. The bartenders were attentive and friendly, and the Guinness on tap was well poured. The oysters were fresh and very good. Lots of great choices of varietals from up and down the east coast. I had the crab cakes for my main course, and I have never had better. They are served with a slaw and shaved fried sweet potato, and were large and nearly all crab meat. The bartender offered to take my plate before I was finished and I nearly growled at him! It was a highly enjoyable meal and I will be back.

luv this place - just might be THE best local brewery. great atmosphere in tap room + dog friendly to boot! luv their germanized names & am continuously amused by their insistence to hoosierize the pronunciation of every one of them ;)

We went here after a wedding. It is a terrible dive. It took a while for our sever to come over. Maybe it was because they are not used to a crowd. When the server took our order, she seemed a bit bothered. When they finally came out, the fries were over cooked. On the plus side the draft selection was ok for the area. The wings were just ok. If you are stuck going after a wedding it's fine. I guess there are not many choices in the area. I would never choose to go here.

Had this twice now since the opening at the start of December.  Great for quick takeout, but also has about six seats inside.  Very comfortable atmosphere and friendly, professional service.  Time from order to ready to take out is about 5-7 minutes and at $5 each, the price is really fantastic.

I've had both chicken and beef so far (both were outstanding).  My girlfriend is a vegan and loved the tofu with no egg.  The tofu is grilled and seasoned very well.  The veggies and and sauces make each dish really hard to slow down on when consuming.  Spice level might be a bit high for some without any tolerance for flavor, but then why are you eating food to begin with?

We are so glad we stopped into Mike's for some ice cream and hot chocolate. They had many ice cream options as well as 9 hot chocolates from around the world. The staff was great and very patient with us as we took all the options in and made our decisions. My husband got the banana pudding ice cream which was out of this world and I got Dutch hot chocolate. It was the best hot chocolate I have ever had. It was filled with warm chocolaty goodness and topped with amazing whipped cream. We decided to enjoy our treat there sitting and taking in the music. Mike's treats definitely hit the spot and gave a break from the cold outside.
Great sandwiches! Addicting. Expensive, but worth it in my opinion. Really glad to have them across the street from where I work.
Quick delivery. Good food. Nice staff. Great selections. I've literally been coming here for years.

The wife and I stopped in here on a Saturday afternoon for an early dinner after catching a matinee up on 96th street. The parking lot was about half filled, but it looked like a lot less people inside as the restaurant is HUGE and very open. We were greeted by no less than 6 waitresses/hostesses standing around the hostess station. The person taking us to our table, who ended up being our waitress, decided to finish her conversation she was having with the other girls before seating us. It was kind of annoying, but she was very pleasant otherwise. 

The menu isn't extensive as others have previously mentioned. I decided on the "hangover burger" which is your basic hamburger with the addition of a fried egg on top. It was good but I have to say I prefer the Royal Red Robin over it. The fries served with it were pretty tasty with the seasoning they added to them. My Wife decided to just get the pulled pork nachos appetizer for her meal and we would share them. WOW there was a lot of food on that plate. They were very good, but I was too full to be of much help after my burger and we barely scratched the surface. At one point the waitress came by and said, "I was going to tell you how big they were after you ordered them."......haha ok why didn't you? We took them home and had them the next day. No big deal. 

My favorite part about Twin Peaks, besides the obvious, was how cold the beer was! They are very proud of how cold they keep the beer as there is an indicator on the wall keeping customers informed of just how cold it was. It fluctuated from 27 to 30 degrees while we were there. While there isn't an overabundance of choices, it was super refreshing. The top of the beer had small ice crystals forming it was so cold. DELICIOUS! Especially on a 90 degree day.

I don't think it would be a monthly trip, but we would definitely take friends back for the experience or just drop in for a drink. Like I said, the inside was huge with plenty of TVs everywhere you looked. It would be a great place to take a big group.
Got the buttermilk biscuit, bacon, and fried eggs sandwich it was very good and the gluten free blue berry muffin would definitely try this place again when I visit Santa Barbara again!
Friendly bartenders, $1 pool tables, decent prices on beer and cocktails. Very casual and fun.
Beer is really good. The staff wad amazing. I got a growler of their Rye IPA. Its a darker IPA and is probably the best IPA I've ever tasted.

Wow!!!! Best wings in Tampa Bay!! This is a hidden gem. The wings are marinated for 24 hours, baked, char-grilled and then covered in the most amazing house sauce!! It is to die for. This are the best wings I have ever had. 
We had ordered the

A clean Wawa in a very convenient location. They have the usual convenience store foods and drinks, plus other things such as freshly made sandwiches, quesadillas, Mac N cheese (which I got), donuts, milkshakes, and flurries. They also have decently priced good quality bananas and other fruit. 

The mac and cheese is decent for late night cravings, but it definitely tasted like the cheese was made from a powder. The milkshake was thick and smooth, and a good buy.

Met a friend for dinner last night. She wanted to go here because they were doing a fundraiser for the Humane Society. We were seated right away. Got our iced teas quickly and the bread shortly after. After we finally decided on what we wanted, our waiter informed us they were out of meatballs. Really? That is what we were both wanting. So she went with lasagna and I had the eggplant. Both were good. 

The only low point was we never got any water. This would have been fine except we had to ask for refills on the iced tea.

I love this place! We were deciding between pinkberry and Mikes, and chose Mikes because we'd never been. I realize that Mike's is ice cream and pinkberry is froyo, but Mike's is suppppper good. I got the nutter butter ice cream (on a cone!) and it was AMAZING. 

Great atmosphere! I loved the decor, and it was just so small town in the middle of a city. Not too much seating, so we ate outside, but no worries! It was great!

Arguably the best Chinese pastry shop in Philly's Chinatown... another favorite of mine when I was doing time in Philly for college years ago...

They have all the traditional favorites - hot dog buns, roast pork buns, coconut cream, coffee rolls, egg tarts, etc.  Prices have gone up since I last visited -- but the place is cheaper than most bakeries in NYC - ranging from $0.60 to $0.80 for most items.

They also serve up drinks including bubble tea - it hits the spot but is by no means earth shattering.

Top reasons why I keep coming back to Bier Brewery in no particular order! 

1.A fresh spanking new tap list comes out every Wednesday so there is always something new to try. 

2.If desired, line um up and sample each style. I must warn you this may make it challenging to pick just one. Well played Bier, now I must purchase two growler fills ...not a bad thing!

3.Bier is dog friendly!

4. PDG is so Pretty Darn Good it became my gateway IPA leading me to new hoppy adventures!

5. DFG IPA, Belgian Dubbel, Special K Kolsch 

6. Seasonals - Marzen, Pumpkin Ale, Pumpkin Porter, Chocolate Mint Stout 

7. As a aspiring metalsmith I appreciate the metalwork represented here.

8.Great Fermentations is right around the corner. There you can find extract kits of similar Bier styles to brew at home.  

9.Their beer is consistently exceptional and award winning! In fact, they just won a Silver medal at GABF for their Sanitarium.

Tuna bar has great sushi and a very creative mix of food on the menu. But it's drinks are WAY over priced and its service is lacking for the price point. I love their fresh sushi but I don't go there as often as I would like because of the service and prices. The drinks are $12-15 for very small portions and the sushi portions are very small too for their cost. Their outdoor seating is nice though! Overall, good place if you're looking to spend lots of money for little food in a cool atmosphere.

Not going to lie I wasn't expecting this place to have the amazing food that it does cause it's at an ice rink but seriously go here! Try this place! You will not be disappointed at all! We got nachos, wings and the tuna stack and it was so good we didn't have time for pictures! The food was incredible and we will for sure be back!!

This pizza is greasy, cheesy, and saucy... And it's perfect that way! This is a must go to pizza spot in Tampa, one of the top five for sure. The wait time has always been reasonable, and if you arrive early they always have a game on. 

I highly recommend the cheese pizza!

Don't say the "m" word here. This is a hole in the wall Italian market and deli. Doesn't get much better than this. The owners and staff are very friendly, true Italians which exemplifies the kind of business they run and why it's been in business at least 10 years I know of. Authenticity and consistence through and through. This place will remain a staple for me whenever I'm in clearwater. 

Their meatball sandwich and freshly Italian bread gives Mazzaro's a run for their money.

Got a breakfast sandwich. Biscuit with egg, bacon and cheese. It comes with greens and some tomato spread, i didn't want that. It was delicious. Cold brew decent also. Cashiers were sweet and accommodating. The girl serving the food had a flat affect. Ambiance is a chill, open, industrial vibe. I wish the outdoor space was larger. There is a wine tasting area in the same spot. Would come here again just for that biscuit!!

I've gone to this place many times with family (I never get the urge to eat here they for some reason do.) Every single order has been cold it's like they wait to serve the food together but half the plates come out cold the others hot. The staff is very friendly very calm place but I am not there for the staff or atmosphere I am there to eat and unfortunately every dish I've ordered has been cold. Serve the ******* food before it gets cold!

I'm a big fan of this place. I was in St. Louis and read the Lafayette Park area was fab. Found this place and stopped in for dinner. Sat at a table in the bar area and had a great dinner. Steak with a side pasta (with a meatball!) at a good price. Four stars and would have been five had either my salad or steak arrived without cheese (don't ask).

Do you want to read the good written material I have created today?

The Indy 500.  While thousands rushed to the track to drown themselves in alcohol in the blazing sun watching race cars zoom across the track going at speeds I've never traveled, I learned in the background.  I made a decision to go in search of a good spot to watch the race on television yesterday and that is a good thing today.  It sent me spiraling to Twin Peaks, a place I had listed on my calendar and scratched off the original day I chose to go.  Still my sub-conscious would not let me forget what I had tried to erase.  It pushed me in that direction and I arrived and met my destiny restoring the balance of today.  I walked in with a quarter.  I ordered a water and sat at the bar.  My bartender was a seasoned veteran.  She'd been there since it opened.  Her next career goal in life is to be a housewife.  I sat there for hours, just learning from the environment and her.  The pack sitting to my left get louder as their drinks keep getting refilled.  One of them speaks up and decides to order shots for the group.  I chime in, can I have one too?  No.  Then he changes his mind, calls it karma, and orders me up one.  Did we just become best friends?  No.  I soon learn what attracts me to the bartender, she reminds me of a person I knew in the past, Heather.  Coincidentally enough, a red head strolls into the bar to work next to my bartender and her name is Heather.  So I spend a few hours there just learning and being in the space.  I'm not a king.  I say at one point to the guy who bought the shots.  Kiss the ring bitch.  His response, drowning himself in booze.  When him and his pack are about to leave, he bows and kisses my hand.  

I return after a visit home for a nap and dinner.  My bartender and Heather are still there, grinding it through on a Sunday race day.  I order a glass a house red and the banana pudding.  Both were good then as of today.  It wasn't about me that good day, it was about her, the bartender, and Heather, and that's a good thing today.

Every now and then, I get a pasta craving and when the craving hit, I decided and hoped Ricardo's would be the answer to my occasional pasta cravings.

I got the baked lasagna and honestly, although it was "a-ok", it just didn't hit the spot. 

Looks like the best St. Louis Italian restaurant search is back on.

Very relaxing, the cats are well cared for, and great treats for humans and kitties. The staff are very friendly. I really like how they have catifed the space. I also like how you can choose between 30 mins or an hour.

We came here to get picnic eats at the picnic counter and were really impressed. The sandwiches were delicious and fresh. My favorite was a baguette with roasted bell peppers paired artfully with spicy arugula and creamy goat cheese. We also got olives, kale salad, and a cinnamon bun- all tasty. I do wish the cinnamon bun had more cinnamon in the outer layers- but that's the only criticism. I will definitely be back next time I'm in the area.

I've been told I have nice BAPs. I have no idea what that means.

Booty And Pecs?
Bum And Posture?
B*lls And P**is?

Who knows.

But anyway. This is the only Korean food I've had in Philly and I liked it. A lot. Especially the price.

I ordered Yuk Gae Jang as I always do.

This YGJ was nothing like anything else I've had - in fact idk if it was even YGJ to be honest lol - but at this price who is complaining. Five dollars or so. It was just like really delicious beef soup and I pretty much finished the whole thing despite not being that hungry. Lovely service too.

Speaking of lovely service, want to check out my BAPs?

Pretty decent food compared to other Chinese Restaurants on this side of town. I normally order the shrimp with lobster sauce which is good, and my spouse really likes the tomato beef. If you spend over $35 you get a free chicken fried rice.

Ricardo's sure did aim to please the other night and I am clearly a fan of this little Italian place located in Lafayette Square. 

We had dinner reservations for 7:00 on a Friday night; however, our group was running a little late and so I called to see if we could push back our reservations 30 minutes and the hostess was more than happy to accommodate my request! How awesome is that? 

Our group arrived just around 7:30 and we were greeted immediately by a hostess. She brought us to our table and introduced our server to us. We had water on the table almost immediately and also a basket of bread was brought out right away! Our server came over and explained the menu to us and made some recommendations. I wish I could remember his name because he was really great! We placed our drink orders and then he gave us time to review the menu. 

By the time he came back with our drinks we were ready to order. I asked for a small order of the manicotti. Others at the table ordered the lasagna and I believe my boyfriend ordered a steak with a side of pasta. We also ordered individual salads for an appetizer. 

The salads came out rather quickly and I was actually really impressed that they did keep the dressing on the side as I hate when a salad is pre-coated with dressing. Our server offered cracked pepper as well as Parmesan cheese for a topping as well. While we were eating our salads our water glasses were being refilled and a new basket of bread was being delivered. 

Once we were done with our salads the meals were delivered to our table and it all looked and smelled delicious. I couldn't wait to dig in. The small order of manicotti was just perfect for me. Our server offered Parmesan cheese again and then he allowed us time to try our meals before coming back to check in on us. I could tell we were all enjoying our meals since we didn't talk much. I also think we all ate everything on our plates-this is a good sign! The meals were delicious. 

Our plates were cleared and now it was time for the dessert order; yes, I was excited to try dessert too! They had a long list of items to try including gooey butter cake, tiramisu, ice cream, and of course a cannoli. I ordered the chocolate chip cannoli and others at the table ordered the ice cream (handmade by Bailey's Chocolate Bar next door). All the desserts were fresh and I really enjoyed the cannoli. I opted to share a few bites with my boyfriend as well and I think he enjoyed it too. 

At the end of the meal our server came over and made sure we had everything we needed before bringing over our check. What I liked most about this place is that we were never rushed to do anything. It was a very laid back experience for all of us. 

Overall, this was a great dinner and I can't wait to go again! Who knew I would find such a great Italian restaurant not in the Hill? I recommend checking it out.
I get awesome service every time I come here.  Thing is, they can get pretty crowded, which means long waits.

The industrial style renovation looks really cool, but food and service matter.

1. The system for getting your food is horrible.  They yell your name and put the food on top of a pastry display case.  Clueless tourists will push you and step on your feet, as you try to get through to pick up your food, so be very careful.

2. The bread is excellent, but the cooked food is not hot.  Cold egg sandwiches and lukewarm latte are unacceptable.

3. Don't wear sandals or other open toed shoes at the inside tables.  I almost sliced my foot.  The clamps that keep the wheels on the tables from moving are knife sharp.  They need to be wrapped with insulation or removed completely.

A lot of thought was put into the Helena Avenue Bakery, but clearly not enough.

I agree with all of the positive reviews! This is a take-out Korean place, conveniently located, that serves perfectly good Bibimbap at low prices. I finally don't have to spend an hour and a half or more going to Giwa or up to like Elkins park when I crave Korean. If you know what I'm talking about, this is the place for you! 

Your food will be prepared by a very nice man who will have it served in a matter of minutes. I've had chicken, vegetable and tofu, they've all been good. The egg has been nicely fried.

It is very bare bones but that's actually nice, because you get wooden chopsticks instead of the difficult-to-use metal ones found at most sit-down Korean places, so that's fine with me.

I'm a big sports bar guy and a sports bar food guy and don't expect a sports bar to be 5 star dining. Let me answer a question that people ask me when I said I ate there. "Is it okay to bring your wife and kids there to watch a game?" The servers do wear low cut shirts and shorts, but nothing that was any different than other themed sports bars. When I was there, there were groups of women together and also couples there. There were a few families with children there. 

The food is what made me give it a try....well that and the ridiculously cold beer. 

I am a big fan of nachos....good nachos. Twin peaks has good nachos, very good nachos. they are big enough for 2-3 people and be pretty full. We ate mostly appetizers while we were there. We had the sampler plate which has mozzarella bites, Fried Pickles and Boneless buffalo bites. They were really good. Even with them being fried they were not soggy from grease. Have boneless chicken instead of bone on wings in a sampler was a great surprise and was welcomed with an open mouth. I also had The cup of chili and it was very flavorful and I wish I would have got The bowl of chili instead. The food over all was above average for a sports bar. next time we might move to entrees next time.

For dessert we had the bread pudding and it was really good. I would definitely get it again. My wife are the ice cream and brownie dessert. She would get it again also. I also wanted the apple dessert they had on the menu, but the server says they don't carry it and wishes they would take it off them menu if they don't plan on carrying it.

It is my new favorite sports bar. Almost forgot they have a crazy amount of TVs and they are numbered so you can ask the server to change that tv to a game you would like to watch. They also have tvs over all the urinals in the men's room.
Very busy I waited for 45 min before even being able to be helped. Would not recommend

To understand how you earn 5 stars from me it is a specific combination of things: I return repeatedly if I can (assuming I am not from out of town), there is an high money to value ratio for me.  

For higher priced foods, it better be phenomenal.  This particular place has very low priced food, huge portions and good flavor, we have been here dozens of times.  For $6-$7 two average people can share a sub, and love it.  It isn't the best sub you have had in your entire life, it is the old Italian deli sub that you will come back for again and again.

Be sure to try their Italian sub (I like mine with mayo added), their meatball sub, and their mufalatta.  Oh and notice you can get halfs of all of these so be sure you and your friends get different ones to try!

Wanting to skip the carbs?  Try their salad.  They are loaded with olives and mushrooms and artichokes and meat, all served with their homemade vinaigrette.
I used to frequent this store for toys and collectible cards but then I found other locations with better stock and rotated inventory.
Super cute old school ice cream parlor. My chocolate raspberry truffle shake was delicious!

I can never say no to ice cream - and when I saw pictures on Yelp of the red velvet ice cream? Nothing could stop me from leaving Nashville without a scoop of it. 

There was a line nearly out the door around 7pm, but we figured it would be worth the wait, especially after having to take an uber all the way back to downtown Nashville. 

There are probably 3-5 tables inside, with 5-10 chairs available to sit at. However, the line moved quickly and we reached the glass display in due time. There is a brief video loop of all the celebrities they've had make an appearance in the shop, which is pretty interesting and passes the time. I had already made up my mind on a single scoop of red velvet ice cream, which came out to be $3.60. It turned out to be more than enough ice cream for me since I was still full from dinner.

Not the best red velvet cake ice cream I've had but definitely delicious. I want to come back and try the other flavors next time I'm in town!

I started ordering here from 2 different work locations using grubhub and I was so happy with my food that I have refused to try anyone else out. I am extremely picky about food and this place nails it every time. I get the Buffalo tenders with the honey BBQ sauce, which is so different than what I expected when it came, but definitely didn't disappoint. I don't know how they make this sauce but it's killer. The food is always hot and the delivery guys are friendly and courteous. It's been a few months now that I've been ordering from here, and I will keep referring my coworkers here.

I took 2 ghost tours during my weekend in New Orleans. The first one, in the garden district, was not great, so my friends recommended I try another one and to book one in the French Quarter. And I'm so glad I did! I met up with Tiny, the awesome tour guide, and no one else showed up so he took me out on a private nighttime walking tour of the French Quarter.
O. M. G. I was sooo scared the whole time! In a good way. Tiny has the most incredibly detailed stories and amazing historical facts. What a memory! The whole time I felt like I was reading a book. That's how detailed he was. There were moments that I was so creeped out though that I had to ask him to not share any more details lol I didn't know how I was going to sleep that night. I think he was also helping make up for the fact that my previous tour with another guide was not great. Which I so appreciate! He kicked it up a few spooky notches!
When you book with these guys, request Tiny if you can. He's incredible and I had so much fun!
so, so yum! all house made and loads of creative and delicious flavors. kid friendly and fun after a game of laser tag!

So as to not be redundant with all the other great, long reviews people have written, I will keep this short and sweet.

- This is the best beer in town.
- The staff is friendly and go above and beyond to help
- The bathroom was very clean
- They do NOT serve pints here, likely due to our goofy liquor laws, but they happily serve samples of all the styles they have on tap
- The prices for a growler fill ranged from $10 - $14 when I was there on Friday.
- Those prices are totally worth it.
Dirty everywhere. They serve food ?? Really ?? Who gives. Food not Michelin Rated but who cares. Love tight shirts and tops.  Tattoos and bedazzled belts.  So hot. Stripper smell permeates.

Bier Brewery has made an IPA believer out of my hop-averse husband, so I'm giving them 5 stars! 

We wandered in one weekend in July as part of our "every brewery in Indianapolis" tour (because it's good to have goals, right?) and got samples of all their brews. Unlike a lot of places, you can get a little sample taste of each beer they have on tap gratis. Nice!

They have several permanent beers, as well as rotating taps that change weekly. The IPA, according to my husband, was "not too bitter, and well blended". PDG (Pretty Damn Good) ale definitely lives up to its name, and the Weizengoot has a really nice array of flavors. 

We went home with a growler of the rotating tap IPA (praise the Lord for small miracles!) and a hankering to come back soon for more.

Amazing ice cream, incredibly friendly cool looking people behind the counter and a homemade waffle cone. I was only in Nashville for the weekend but had to make a 2nd stop there because I couldn't stop thinking about the ice cream!! A must stop in Nashville

Sure it's a nice place. But how the staff responds to a crisis is another matter indeed. These people should be re-trained, re-located or fired! On Saturday March 3, 2018, I arrived to the Fairfield Inn around 2 pm. (The power was still out in our neighborhood - we live 2 min. away - so we stayed one night.)  I walked through the powered sliding doors and a male front desk person checked me in on the computer, handed me a room key and asked if I wanted to also leave a credit card for "incidentals." Having booked the room through Hotels.com I told him I've never been asked to do that before. Why? To cover incidentals, he said, like HD wifi, or if I were to "trash the room - you know, like a rock star." What? I was confused. He said it was a joke. What joke - asking me for a credit card? That's when the other front desk person, I later assumed her to be the manager, or at least his supervisor, defended him and explained he was joking about the trashing the room part. Just kidding.
THIS IS NOT A TIME TO JOKE, I told them. I'm sick, with pneumonia. Double pneumonia, actually. Motioning to the lobby filled with people, I told them it's not funny that we are all there because the power went out. That my husband and I spent the previous night feeding wood in the fireplace to keep the pipes from freezing and me warm. That we dragged our mattress downstairs to sleep in front of the fireplace. That I had to run to the Giant that morning and purchase gallons of water so I could flush our toilets. MR. KIDDING HAD THE AUDACITY TO TELL ME HE TOO DID NOT HAVE A GOOD NIGHT. I told him, quite pointedly, that it wasn't my problem and that this is a business. I took the elevator to my room. Only one elevator was working, said Mr. Just Kidding, who walked by as I wondered about the broken elevator (door half open, no sign to indicate it's unusable). I went to find my room on the third floor, which, thank god, was located in the brightest part of a dark hallway - just across from the elevator. I realized there was NO POWER in the room.
I returned to the lobby. There's no power in my room! Yes, they know. Though they had had power all day, the power cut out about 10 minutes before I arrived. And they didn't know when it was going to return. Mind you, this conversation occurred while I sat on the sofa across from the front desk because I was weak. WHY DIDN'T YOU TELL ME WHEN I ARRIVED???
Excuses: we were busy when you arrived - didn't you notice? 
They both admonished me for "yelling and screaming." NO. I have pneumonia and both my ears are blocked. Elevated voice, very likely! 
A new front desk person came on (it's about 3 p.m.) and I watched her tell a man who had just arrived (and had a reservation) that the power was out.
