He immediately turned around and walked out mouthing WTF. I dryly said that I wish I had been told thst as soon as I walked in that the power was out. At least she did THAT much for the guy. Again, I'm admonished for "yelling and screaming" and "you don't have to stay here" and something something about complaining. I get up to return to my room. I round the corner and the power returns (DID THEY STOP THE GUY IN THE PARKING LOT WHO JUST WALKED OUT WTF-ING???).
I return downstairs to get some tea. NO WATER! Supervisor lady sees me motion to an empty urn. Coffee? she asked. Water, I said. It hadn't been flipped yet, she said. Excuses, I thought.
Next morning at breakfast, just after 9 a.m., the coffee urns are empty. I turn around and supervisor lady sees me motioning to them with my hands up in the air. A harried employee shows up with a full urn, plops in it and disappears. I try to pour half and half. Also empty. I turned around and held it up for supervisor lady to see. I had said nothing both times, just motioned. That's when supervisor lady told me it was a full hotel last night. 

OH YEAH, SNOWFLAKE, I HAVE DOUBLE PNEUMONIA AND YOU CANNOT MANAGE A HOTEL, CANNOT RISE TO THE CHALLENGE OF A CRISIS, AND INSTEAD ACTED LIKE THE VICTIM. 

I didn't need to speak to her on Sunday. It was just one pitfall after another. 

When we checked out, another front desk lady who had been apparently warned about what a bitch I was choked out a Hope you had a nice stay line. I told her it was memorable and left.

I got a major runaround trying to contact Marriott to complain. Finally, I had to leave a voicemail after the customer care rep stayed on the phone with me for 20 MINUTES trying to transfer me so I could file a complaint. No-one called back. I tried again on Monday and gave Marriott a chance to hear me out before committing to a Yelp or other review. Another 15 minutes on hold. 

Too late. Here's your Yelp Review.

UPDATE 3.9.2018. Still no one has called back from Marriott/Fairfield Inn & Suites

Just had our family-wedding-dinner for my son and his new bride with both families, at Ricardo's.  WHAT a great experience!  The ambience at Ricardo's is tailor-made for a sweet, romantic, elegantly-casual dining experience in their lovely, historic old building - from the cozy, comfortable bar area in the front to the pretty green walls with comfortably-classy decor in the dining room, and a sweet little garden area in the back corner featuring a trellis with touches of floral & greenery, and a stone fountain piece and white wood column for a cozy little dining spot.  The lovely party room we reserved featured great old-world Italian murals on the walls, an old upright piano, and antique low-boy dresser - perfect for the gift table!  And there was plenty of room for a large group to eat, have the Bride & Groom's cake cutting and wine-sipping ceremonies, fill out the guest-pages for their wedding-guest book, and enjoy laughing and visiting together, toasting the Bride and Groom, and just making some wonderful memories of their special day!  Ricardo's was just perfect!
  
Then the food - incredible!  Huge portions for an incredibly reasonable price.  The calamari was really fabulous - not tough at all, and fried wonderfully crunchy!  The toasted ravioli was marvelous!  Ditto for garlic cheese bread - so cheesy!  And the bruschetta was piled with delicious tomato/veggie topping!  The Tortellini Roberto is to-die-for.  The Lasagna got rave reviews.  Everything was delicious, and half-size portions on both the pasta and salad were more than enough!  Several ladies still took some home. 

Everything was wonderful.  And the serving could NOT have been more prompt and gracious.  David was in charge that night, and did an absoutely superb job!  Very welcoming, friendly and extremely helpful and accommodating to move tables where we needed for seating everyone the way we wanted.  And timed all the servings just right.  The appetizers came so fast, and the salads and meal servings came just at the perfect time.  Drinks were kept full, and you hardly knew he was there.  Perfect in every way!

All in all, I don't believe we could have possibly found a better place than Ricardo's.  We will definitely return many times.  Thanks David, Michelle and Mark!  You made our family dinner a night to remember...and our memories will be cherished forever!

We visited this location for the first time on our vacation and ended up going back because the food is so delicious. The service is amazing too! There is outside and inside seating with a chill atmosphere.Definitely try their PSL which made with fresh  pumpkin and their biscuits/ gravy.

I came here for an early brunch with friends and ordered the Frose with a BYO Brunch Plate. My plate consisted of applewood bacon, scrambled eggs, a biscuit and jalapeño cheddar grits. A

First the frose was very bitter. The champagne used in this is a cheaper brut which needed to be balanced with more sugary elements. Of the 8 girls that came with me no one liked their frose. I sent mine back for champagne. If you want a frose go to sambuca. 

My BYO plate is was under seasoned and poorly cooked. My eggs had no salt or pepper on them and were watery. My bacon sat in it's on grease which is not appetizing. When you cook bacon put it on something to let the grease drip off. My biscuit was the worst of all. It was hard as a rock and most of it was inedible. I tried to eat it because the  raspberry jam looked homemade and I wanted it so bad. I could not bite into the biscuit so I ate the inside layer and left all edges and crust. This was a very disappointing brunch experience.

Side note: everything here is plastic or paper. Every plate and every piece of silverware. I can't even imagine how much landfill waste this place makes daily. Panera bread has plates and silverware so this place certainly can too

There's a lot to like about this tiny Korean kitchen on South Street. The simple menu, fair prices, and the fact that there just aren't a whole lot of Korean spots in South Philly. 

I really want to give BAP four stars but I can't just yet. I love bibimbap and the beef bibimbap here was alright. The beef was good, flavorful and tender. I've never seen broccoli in bibimbap before, which was fine. I just wish the portions were a little bigger; I was still hungry afterwards. And I think more veggies would've made it better. I'd like to come back to try the japchae and I would give the bibimbap another chance.

Best place in the CBD. Rolled in rough around the edges but Rose saved our lives. She gave us the perfect recommendations and kept the drinks coming and us laughing until we became whole again. Love that spot and will definitely try and get her as our server on our next visit!

So the waiter was great, the atmosphere was GREAT the red blend copper vine wine was GGRREAT! Here comes the let down, the food...
I was shockingly disappointed.  I'm obsessed with escargot, naturally I ordered the escargot flat bread and I sweat they soaked them in some form of very tart citrus juice.. it was so bad 20 minutes after we left I still could NOT get the overpowering taste out of my mouth, it was so bad I got 3 ulcers from the acidity... and duck fat fries, they legit tasted NO different than hot fries from McDonald's, SAD
I'm still going back for the wine the atmosphere and next time I'm going to try the BRUNCH MENU! Come on copper vine let's get this food on point!

A couple weeks ago I noticed this little bakery besides the Second Cup in Oliver, but it hadn't opened for the day. By luck today I drove by before class, and Breadland had opened so I popped in. The lady at the counter said it would be about 20 minutes for the rest of the bread to be ready. I wasn't looking for an entire loaf, just a little snack and coffee, which they had. The coffee was good, just a standard drip coffee - I did see there were several types of loose tea to. The dessert I had was quite yummy - like a big layered cookie with jam and covered in chocolate and dried coconut sprinkles. Yelpers I wish I could tell you what it was called, but I've totally forgotten. I think it started the a sch or a sche - either way it was good. Nice little bakery. Next time I've stop by and pick up a loaf of something to take home.

Great clothes. European styles i suppose. Great prices.  Pretty much the same as other  ones  I've been to but the Staff was a bit more helpful and they had more of my sizes. I like the way they integrated the new store with the old style architecture of the city!

We have eaten at here on many of occasions although it has been a while since we have been in to the restaurant. Our server Jayme was fabulous. Nice smile and service throughout our visit. 

The food is why only the 2 stars. I ordered  rustica and my husband ordered fettucine alfredo with shrimp. I have ordered the rustica on several of our visits it is one of my favorite dishes. But tonight it was dry and the shrimp were small compared to all the other times I have ordered it. They were dry and tough. Size wise they probably were something you could buy in a 60 count bag. I did ask for extra sauce and Jayme was more than happy to get it for me. However, the sauce had a lot of black pepper in it which made it spicy/hot and not very enjoyable. A few pieces of the chicken were fatty. Just not a pleasant experience.  My husband said his alfredo was bland and needed some help. His shrimp was also the same size that were in my dish  and it didn't have very many in his dish. The bread was awesome. Hot and fresh. 

I probably will go back because this is the first "bad" experience we have had with the food here. I just hope they are not trying to adjust the recipes using less quality products.

Ordered delivery through GrubHub. Came pretty quickly, nice delivery guy. Pizza was ok, we got smells which I would say feed one person, maybe two. Be aware that "roasted peppers" are green. I was expecting reds. Still tasty. Wings were good, all was still warm. I will say the pizzas were pretty greasy all over the bottom of the boxes. I would give them a solid good.

Still don't quite understand why my boss would have given me, a girl who doesn't eat seafood, a gift card to a seafood restaurant for Christmas, but since my old man and one of my daughters love seafood, it wasn't a total fail.  Stopped in for lunch a few weeks ago and had a nice time.  The seafood lovers enjoyed their choices - mahi tacos, some kind of seafood chowder, a salad with four different kinds of seafood on it, and of course, some oysters.  

There weren't many choices for me and my other daughter who is a vegetarian, but we enjoyed the vegetarian linguine provencal dish that we both got.  It was yummy and chock full of some of my faves - roasted tomatoes, kalamata olives, asparagus and tons and tons of capers.  It was a nice size but for the price I would have liked to have gotten a side salad for just a few bucks more, instead of the $8 apiece we had to shell out for salads that consisted of just mixed greens, tomatoes, cukes and a few radishes. 

At $110 including the tip, it was probably THE most expensive lunch we've ever had (luckily the gift card cut that almost in half) so considering the prices, the location (a bit out of the way for me), and the fact that there are literally only 3-4 non-seafood lovers can eat there, I highly doubt we'll ever go there again.  Oh, and like my husband said, most seafood restaurants don't offer complimentary bread or rolls like other restaurants, but it would have been nice.  A nice hot buttery roll would have been nice...

Every time I go in here I brace myself for a blood-pressure raising experience. This time I needed cushion covers quick, so I put in an order online and had it set up to be picked up at the store. I tried to use the coupon that said "free mug" but it wouldn't let me use it online. So I get to the store and the cashier is on on 'ludes or something, brings me half my order and then takes forever finding the other half. Then I tell her about the mug coupon and she has to ask her manager who tells me it can only be used online (where it didn't work.) I mean, I could have gone in there and done all this myself with way less trouble. I was there over half an hour and was late for my other obligations. It's enough to make me go to Ikea.

My last visit to Twin Peaks, and it will be my last. I was told by the 21 and a half year old bartender that it was against the law to order a beer and a Crown on the rocks. 
I am 56 years old and I know this is an absolute crock of poop!! Order them all the time. Including the last two times I have been to Twin Peaks!!!
Fast forward to two gentleman across the bar. One orders a shot and a beer, the other a special shot and beer. Too surprise I say, "thought that was against the law"?  "They don't have ice in them". Now she begins to tell me how long she's has be a so called bartender,  whatever. Oh the patronizing b$&ch!! 
The service sucks, to busy showing their asses, and giggling to help anyone. 
Now this is at the bar mind you, don't want to talk bad about the whole wait staff just Heather!!
Judy was our tour guide and she was fabulous.  She was knowlegable and personable.  We learned a lot on the tour and had a great time.

I've been to Ricardo's twice now, though I should mention that the first visit was for happy hour and the second for their lunch buffet.  Appetizer and drink specials were good enough during happy hour, but be advised that the bar may feel a bit snooty as the regulars dominate the scene (and service!).  I felt like an outsider from arrival to departure without greeting or farewell.  Though the lunch buffet food is nothing special, it is a good deal @ $9 for salad, pasta, protein, veggies, and bread (and even desert).  I plan to visit again to try an entree from their dinner menu, and possibly update this review.

I had a delicious chicken bibimbap and sat here for an hour enjoying a Yeti Imperial Stout (purchased at Food and Friends at Spruce and 20th) with it. This place deserves to be WAY more popular. It is Tuesday night and there have only been two other customers. This is the genuine article and the owner is super nice - I just can't believe I am here by myself!  Next time I will bring a friend even if I have to drag one off the street!  The spice was just right, the serving size was just right, and the stone bowl kept everything warm to the end.

Looking for sub joint while visiting clearwater beach from cali.   Small hole in the wall mom and pop joint.  Found this place on yelp.   Ordered the Italian sub and it was very tasty and reasonably priced.  Far surpasses strip mall subway sandwiches.

I ordered the Zucchini Toastie and the best way to describe it is pathetic. The sandwich was $8.75 but probably valued at $2. Barely anything on the sandwich. I expected more from such a gourmet marketed place. It is very cute but not worth the money.

I think this might have been one of the WORST dining experiences I have ever had. Nothing about our time at this establishment even resembled passable. Our margaritas were horrible (and came with an awkward robitussen-esque cap full of tequila on the side?!), the burgers were literally inedible-- even the FRIES were bad! How do you mess up fries?! The burgers both came with Kraft singles UNMELTED on top. And the service was incredibly slow. The only and literally only thing this place has going for it, is that the interior decor is cute-ish (including a tiki sports bar with TVs for sports fanatics). I regret not asking to speak to a manager after our experience here.

The place is beautiful, great Monday night $1 oysters and PBR pounder specials.  But that's about it.  I enjoy quality food and I'm willing to pay for it if its good,  but  Doc's does not deliver in this dept.  I've had better seafood dinners at Red Lobster.  Seriously.  Food just doesn't live up to the atmosphere.

Okay, I promise that I'm not gonna 5 star everything, but for about 2 weeks I was on a Pesce alla Elisabetta binge at Ricardo's.  First off, it is located in one of the best neighborhoods in St. Louis City and the surroundings only add to it's ambiance.  

I've been there for a sit down lunch and takeout.  I was a little leery looking at the menu because although I like pasta, it's usually not something I order when eating out and the only time I will is if it's some kind of spicy/cajun pasta.  The first time I went for a sit down lunch, I forced myself to order something different.  I chose a chef salad and the Elisabetta pasta.  Okay we all know what a chef salad is, but I truly enjoyed the chef salad at Ricardo's.  It was all in the ranch dressing.  The pasta was the coup de gras of my meal.  The Elisabetta was a flat pasta with cream sauce (you can choose your sauce) with shrimp, crab and clams.  The pasta was so FIRE!  The sauce was seasoned just right and mingled with the seafood and pasta noodles perfectly.  I had truly underestimated this meal.  I was more than satisfied and full with plenty of pasta leftover for dinner.  The bread that comes with the meal is not so good, but who needs it when the food is so good.  I ordered the small salad and pasta and both were very hearty servings.  If you are a light eater, believe it or not, you could share a small salad and pasta with another person.  The ambiance?  I loved the decor; lots of old world charm, but it was lunchtime and it was kinda noisy.  Noise doesn't really bother me when I'm eating out, but if it's crowded here and you're expecting to be able to hold a intimate conversation, it might be a little difficult.

Take out was also a good experience and it seemed like I got even more food when ordering the same thing as take out.  I wasn't able to get to my pasta as soon as I'd hoped and by the time I sat down to eat, it was cold and kinda gummy, but I wouldn't take any points away from Ricardo's based on my inability to eat take out in a timely manner.  When heated it still tasted good to me!

Great to-go spot. Very reasonable and friendly service. 

The veggie bowl is balanced and delicious. I would highly recommend this place!
Hot pretzels house made and fresh from the oven.  AMAZING!!!  Coffee and pastries great too.  Nice little find near the Children's Science Museum.
Surprisingly good! Great bartender and German chocolate Martinis. Food does not disappoint... Always beyond expectation. Better food than many of the Lafayette Square spots.
I love this gym. One of best in the area. Never too much chaos even at peak hours. Clean and well kept. Great variety of classes. Wish there was a bit more parking...

This place is awesome! Food is great, LEGIT ITALIAN WITH HOMEMADE SAUCES, SOUPS AND ETC! The cook is absolutely wonderful and a blast, the delivery driver is awesome also, he keeps me laughing. I've traveled from Springfield Pa  to DeSandros get a slice a few times.. The owner is a pretty decent guy also, I've seen him do something kind things for patrons everytime I've been there. Greatest thing they are open till 3 a.m. if you're ever in Manayunk or Philadelphia shoot over to DeSandros, you'll love it!

Small, clean, mom&pop run joint. The tiny restaurant can seat maybe 10 people, so they cater toward takeout. Food comes out quickly. FYI - closed on Sundays.

Their regular bibimbap is $7.95 to $9.95 (veggie v. meats). If you want it in a hot stone pot (dolsot bibimbap), its $1 extra. Perks of dolsot - the stone pot crisps up the bottom of the rice which adds a great texture. However, the hot stone pot cooled quickly and I didn't feel like I got enough of a crisp on my rice. Of note, it comes pre-mixed with the sauce, which I wasn't expecting. Meanwhile, if you order the regular it does not come pre-mixed so the vegetables/meat are separated and you can decide how much hot sauce you want to mix in. For this reason, I'd probably get the regular next time.

My boyfriend and I ordered the chicken dolsot bibimbap and the vegetable dolsot bibimbap. Not the best bibimbap I've ever had. Since it came pre-mixed, it's very similar to spicy fried rice, especially since I didn't get enough crispy rice. They all come topped with an over-easy egg, the yolk of which makes a great sauce. For $9.95 and $10.95 it was a bit pricey, since the portions are not very large. We also ordered the seafood pancake, which was delicious, but again a bit pricey since it didn't taste like it was made from scratch.

Overall, lovely little spot. My boyfriend and I enjoyed it for a quick weekday lunch date, but I don't think I'd go out of my way again to return.

Doc Magrogan's Oyster House without a doubt waters down their booze. I have been here 3 times and ordered a martini that has tasted like water all 3 times. I went across the street to Avalon ordered the same exact martini with the same exact vodka and the difference is night and day. These guys are crooks.

This is not gourmet brick oven pizza. It's Greek-style: thick, slightly doughy crust with very generous toppings. It's also on the greasy side. 

Is it the best pizza I've ever had? Nope. Far from it. Is it tasty, consistent, and satisfying? Absolutely. I'm also a really big fan of their online ordering system. Want to order cheese fries with bacon, sour cream, and Russian dressing on the side?* You can do that and it takes about 3 seconds. 

I've also been quite pleased with the speedy delivery times and the fact that the pizza always arrives piping hot.

(*I do not recommend that you actually order that.)

Just wanted to take a moment to commend the staff of Tuna Bar for their professionalism and hospitality during an unfortunate power outage this evening. Despite the entire block and their whole building losing power (absolutely beyond their control), the owner and staff went above and beyond to ensure that we had a meal that was savory and special. We were beyond impressed with their service and dedication to their customers. Having been to this restaurant several times since it's opening, even with the power out, the food was fresh, flavorful and 100% satisfying. The tuna crudo and the rock shrimp are items we will continue to order as long as they serve them. The sashimi style fish was a delight to have served simply, as to properly enjoy the freshness of the ingredients. We will continue to come back again and again. Thank you to the owner and staff!!

Is it possible to give this place a - review?!?!?! Just left the place waiting to get served, literally watched the server help 3 groups that were there after us, drinks and got their orders and all, while my wife and I watch and still they do not acknowledge us!!! I dont post any reviews whatsoever but I feel that future customers may feel this type of service as well! Thanks but no thanks, I'd rather take my business to the Olive Garden down the street since past experiences we've been treated WAY better! BTW, when we first got there, there was no host, and they weren't even busy at all!!

My boyfriend and I came to Macaroni Grill for our anniversary and the most awesome waiter! I wish we had gotten his name, but he was so kind and wonderful to us. He asked us questions and talked to us every time he came over. Wonderful human!
Delicious food! Only wish that the portions were slightly larger and that there was more meat in the bibimbaps. Would go again.

Great Chinese food at great prices. I was in town for work, and didn't know the area. Found this place near the airport. The owner was very nice and helpful. The food was very fresh and cooked just right. Will be back again when I'm in town.

So-so at best. Nice atmosphere, but the food leaves a lot to be desired. The apps were okay, soup lukewarm, and my entree, a "special" of the day, a little scary. The "fresh" vegetables. were beyond over cooked, and maybe it was the lighting, but I swear the mashed potatoes looked gray. My salmon was covered in a sauce that was so salty I couldn't eat more than a couple bites. I am sure there are much better options close by.

I lived right around the corner and you can't imagine how excited I was to have a place like BAP pop up! I went here every week and was never disappointed. Great prices and great food. Lots of variety and on point consistency. He kept it simple and does simple really well. Keep on, Boss man! I moved to Raleigh and came back to Philly just to take a bite out of that good ole nostalgia.

Love it there! The best Italian grinder I have ever had, but more than anything.........I love the new small sized sub. It's the perfect size for an older guy like me. The large is just so big and filling. I'm even happier that they now make a small size sub. Always fresh great food. If I'm in ardmore, I'm heading there.

Beer sampling in the 'burbs! What's not to like about that?

Bier Brewery is one of Indy's newer microbreweries situated on the outskirts of town, which is definitely worth the drive and visit. I stopped by about an hour before closing, which was more than enough time to chat with the servers, learn about the brewery and, of course, sample some product. Oh, and the samples (no pints) are free. Woo Hoo! 

Granted, they aren't the typical 3-4 oz., but if your goal (like mine) is to try a little of everything, they were the perfect sampling sizes for nine different pours. Most of the current brews were lighter in color and flavor with nothing on the dark side, although one of the girls told me they can and have brewed up to 100 different varieties and their tap list rotates constantly...what!? Very impressive.

After enjoying their current lineup, I walked around the relaxed tap room, decked out with couches and lounging chairs. Oh, and if you want further proof that Bier is about quality in addition to quantity, make sure you check out their wall of fame, covered in numerous awards and ribbons from various brewing competitions, including the Great American Beer Festival. 

Just like one of their self-proclaimed/named brews, PDG, this place is pretty damn good. 'Nuff said. 4.5 Stars.

We had a reservation and were promptly seated when we arrived in the dining room after having a drink at the bar.  Bartender was not too friendly. In fact she was borderline rude.  

The waitress we had was excellent. Friendly and attentive. I returned the roasted red pepper soup because it was the consistency and look of orange risotto.  The peppercorn steak was cooked perfectly but the flavor of black pepper overpowered the flavor of the meat. The steamed fresh vegetables were fine but average. The blue cheese potatoes were ok but lacked much cheese. 

Too pricey. Overall a disappointment. We won't return.

Mike's.

Mike's.

Mike'sMike'sMike'sMike'sMike's.

Guess what day it is? Hump Day!

A very long time ago, in what seems like a different lifetime, I would travel the US in an old car, as a teenager, with the love of my life. She was twice my age, but full of energy and excitement after getting out of a nightmarish marriage that had lasted a decade and a half.

We would take turns driving, and often cross half the country in a day or night. We just kept moving, very rarely stopping anywhere for more than an hour or two. There were no rules or boundaries. No deadline or itinerary. Just movement and pure, unadulterated freedom. With emphasis on unadulterated.

Nashville was always one of our favourite places because of the energy, the nightlife, the impressive skyline, the toasty warm southern weather, the rich riverside air, and the gorgeous blonde girls driving up and down Broadway (this was pre-hipster, so not everyone had beards and vintage clothes from Etsy yet).

One night, I was too tired to complete the 3-plus-hours I still had left to get to Nashville. My darling took over at the wheel, and managed to get us all the way into Nashville without me waking up. She had a tendency to take the wrong highway and end up hours in the wrong direction, but not this time. I woke up parked in front of Mike's Ice Cream. She was nowhere to be found. Although I didn't really lift my head up off the pillow.

At first I thought she must be using the bathroom, but then I looked around, and realized I was on Lower Broadway. The night was dying down, and the last few blondes and their Cowboys (or Cowgirls, even better) were disappearing into alleys or hotel rooms or convertibles. Except that when they got into convertibles they didn't disappear, but you get the idea. Anyway.

Next thing I know, she emerges from Mike's holding a huge, shimmering ice cream cone. What could it be?

She walks over to the passenger window (it was the old days, so it was one of those that you roll down, and we were never big on AC, so it was already down), and presents me with the largest and most appreciated ice cream cone in the history of large, appreciated ice cream cones. It's your favourite, she said. Banana. In a waffle cone, no less. Oh, and here's a banana shake to go with it, she said.

She knew me so well.

Things change. Almost everything changes, actually. Often irreparably. People grow apart. Cities change. People with knit caps who only eat Korean Fusion Tacos made (and owned) by grad students who have never been to Korea, move in en masse.

But some things never change.

I still love her.

I still love traveling.

I still drive a lot, sometimes for no reason.

I still wake up in strange places.

I still love Banana Ice Cream. And banana everything.

And all these years later... far longer than I care to admit or acknowledge...

I still love Mike's.
Great all around. Love the vibe, delicious sushi and apps, awesome atmosphere! We'll be going back.

I'm a Wawa fan, generally, but this particular location is not getting it done, especially the sandwich counter. The Wawa veggie sub is mediocre at best. At this location, my sub has usually been made with the sort of love and care generally afforded a Manson family victim. Just because it's a sub doesn't mean it should be soaking wet. WTS?
Such a nice improvement from the previous bar (even though we loved and miss the old one). Menu is great.

Korean food at its best. Great food. They have very less options but they have mastered the ones that they have. We have BiBimbap Dolshot chicken and the beaf soup and the cardamom tea. The bibimbap is awesome. The soup is also nice. They had a small cozy ambience with light music playing. They cook and serve themselves, they are really friendly people. The last thing is all of these comes with very little pinch on the pocket - the food is pretty much reasonably priced. A must try for all if you are in South street.

Awesome place...Ice Cream is vey very delicious and Spanish chocolate is authentic and sooo good. Highly recommended one of the best in Nashville. So when ur in downtown Nashville don't forget to stopped by this Wonderful Place...

Just came from this bakery this afternoon and I really liked this little shop. They have the fluffiest, soft bolo bao (pineapple bun) I have ever had. Their milk tea was made fresh. I would probably ask for a stronger tea brew in my milk tea though. Their prices are very affordable. Yum!

The only downside to this place is their packaging. I'm from out of town and the open wax paper packaging makes it hard to travel around with and to keep fresh.

Came here for Monday night "buck-a-shuck" oysters. Fantastic! 

I love to pair my oysters on the half shell with a dirty Kettle martini. I believe it adds to the crisp, deliciousness of a freshly shucked oyster. Be adivsed if you come for this special on a Monday, your table can only order 2 dozen at a time --but if you like oysters, I definitely recommend coming here! Our table also ordered fried oysters and they were golden brown on the outside and moist on the inside. Basically, exactly how you'd want them to be when fried! 

For entrees, they have a wide variety of seafood options to chose from. For those who do not like seafood, there are poultry and meat options as well... oh, and salads too! I ordered the grilled scallops (options are: blackened, herb butter or herb gremolata) and I chose the herb gremolata. Delicious!! The scallops were succulant and fresh. My mom ordered the scallops blackened I liked them even more! They are paired with cauliflower mash, roasted fingerling potatoes and string beans. You can also order salmon, mahi-mahi, yellowfin tuna, tilapia, shrimp or the catch of the day prepared this way, and paired with those same sides or sub a salad instead. I was very pleased with my choice. Other members of our party ordered and enjoyed the seafood cobb salad and fish & chips. Everyone enjoyed what they ordered very much. 

Will definitely be returning here again soon! :)
Everything was awesome. Comfortable, clean atmosphere and the food was outstanding. Definitely making another trip. Thanks Ken.
Not bad for Seafood in West Chester!

It's about time!
Finally a store just for Men!! This place is great, I've been following them on Instagram since the first of the year building the store and the brand. And now they're finally open!
They have a little bit of everything here, shoes, clothing, accessories, sunglasses, watches, and the all important hard-to-find beard products! Yes there're plenty of stores for people that shave but no one sells anything for beard care, except for James Dant.
It's located in the charming Irvington shopping center off of E. Washington St.
The staff here is knowledgeable about everything they sell their very friendly and just fun to chat with. This is also the only store that I know of in Indianapolis that sells one off State bicycles. They only get one at a time so if you like it you better get it. 
This is a small shop privately owned and you can tell is the dream of it's owner!!
Beware of the insane lines, but the ice cream is really good!!! They had enough people there despite the insane line so service was pretty quick.
The food was amazing and the atmosphere was inviting. The restaurant is large and very baby and kid friendly, which was very important to me. I had the chicken biscuit and it was delicious!

Positives: Different menu, not southern or american food, great atmosphere, good happy hour special, a few good dishes, great sake

Negatives: Average service, high prices, food is not consistent

I was looking forward to eating here, my last experience the food and service in Knoxville were great. No so here. The waitress took close to 10 minutes to show up for my drink order. I gave my dinner order at the same time my iced tea showed up quickly but it took awhile for salad. I found out why when the salad and my steak entree showed up together. I sent the steak back and ate the salad that was crisp, fresh and very good. The steak came back out like warm and done to less than medium rare. The vegetables were good but also less than luke warm. I would  not visit this location again.
Delicious homemade ice cream. Had a scoop of the praline & creme. One of my favorite ice cream flavors and one of the best versions of it I have had.

The owner and all the staff of Absolutely Perfect Landscaping were courteous, responsive , professional and friendly. The landscaping and tree removal they did for our property was awesome- beautiful and professionally priced. Im not a fan of YELp as they try to influence you to review positively but trust me these people at Absolutely Perfect are the BEST
Good pizza, almost like home. Thin crust and a variety of options. Actually came here since the boba place was closed, but happy I walked in.

Went to river city to get darts for the wife and myself.found the sales person extremely freindly, knowledgeable and helpful.  We were able to try different darts there and were given very good deals on nice equipment. Will return whenever I need any accessories.

I went there a while back with my wife and was disappointed. We went there specifically to sample a pasta dish. I had spaghetti with meat balls. The sauce was watery and the meatballs were so dense that I had to use a knife to cut through them.  Additionally, we weren't thrilled with service. We were not told of any specials or asked about wine choices. However, a larger group came in and got better service as the waitress appeared to have known the group. The place was not crowded, so I don't see why service was so bad. My guess is there was no supervisor around.  In the past I've had a much better experience. It may have been an off night and also the server. I was very unimpressed with pasta dishes we were served at an Italian restaurant. I get the feelinh that they've pretty much given up.
Great stay...clean room & perfect location for longwood & Nemours.  Friendly staff & breakfast!

My husband and I have decided to have our lunch in this establishment, it's been quite awhile since last visited this restaurant.  The Maitre D welcomed us with swarm smiled and immediately seated us on a nice, cozy window booth.  The restaurant ambiance created a romantic old world feel.  Our friendly server Julian was accommodating and very thoroughly presented us their luncheon specials including their limited time, best flavors of the harvest season menus.  I have tried their Shrimp Portofino and my husband choose their Chicken Alfredo both were very tasty  we accompanied our meal with their raspberry ice tea.  The quick lunch was very refreshing and added more energy for our hectic afternoon errand.  Looking forward to visit them again this coming holiday when families and relatives comes to visit in town. 

So  just right after the holidays , we decided to try their dinner, the service personnel were equally pleasant and friendly.  The food were served quick and as tasty as I remembered.  Just so happens I have also received a $10 off $30 meal promotion on my meal made it even a better experience.  I think we are going to be regulars.

I have been here twice, and will continue to come again and again! Very perfect setting for an Instagram-worthy photo session, girls night out, romantic date night, or simple catching up with family and friends. What is very unique here is their complimentary self-serve popcorn with different spices/ flavors to add on top! 

Their main courses are also off-the-charts! I highly recommend their brussel sprouts as an appetizer! They are so crispy and the aoili dip compliments the flavor very well. I also recommend their gnocchi for any carb lovers out there! The mushroom pasta was particularly my favorite, however, my friends stated it was slightly salty. 

Their milky way dessert display was beautiful but was it worth the cash? Not really. It was okay. Very tiny cookie bites spread around a big dish mixed with assorted chocolates. I'll definitely skip that dessert and try the other ones next time. 

Their wines and cocktails are pretty cheap! And they also have half-off select wine bottles during happy hour from 3:30 to 5:30 PM. I loved the Eberle Cabernet Sauvignon. Very smooth and not too bitter. 

The only minor complaint about the location is the absence of lighting outdoors at night. Hopefully there will be a string of lights and also working heaters for the winter time in the future. However, these little things won't stop me from coming back! See you real soon Copper Vine. Stay beautiful!

This place is a family tradition, each time we go back to the Alton area. The toasted ravioli, pepper-loin with pasta and salad are to die for. Great food and reasonable service make this place worth a visit.
Amazing food! Great prices for so much too.  Too bad we showed up a day before they went on vacation lol. Will be back in a month when they are!

This is such a cute little spot- we stopped here on our way from SB to LAX to drop our friend off to airport then head to SD for a flight of our own. 

The customer service was great, prices were ok, the wait was a little lengthy.  We waited for about 10 minutes for 3 quiches to be heated managed to get a scone out of it and our three drinks. 

Great little spot and a gem hidden in the streets- if I ever cross the SB lines again I will be stopping here for sure.

So gross it's almost like a sex shop shop and eat gross I will never eat here again not that I did but the sign on the highway has got to go sorry sore eyesight for caselton if it's not bad enough I rock on eb on your career needs shut the fuck down it's like a parlor all over again eewwe

Really enjoyed our breakfast that Helena's on New Years Day! The Bacon, egg and cheddar sandwich was quite good. The bun was especially tasty. That and some hot tea and I was all recovered from the night before! :-)

The restaurant seating area both inside and out was really nice. The whole Funk Zone area is such a nice change from the commercial setting of State Street.

I had a gift card, so went with high hopes & we experienced nice service with ok happy hour drinks. I was hoping for good food but it fell short of the mark. The Alfredo sauce was runny & bland. The chicken parm was thin & served with spaghetti, why? If it wasn't for the free bread I might have left hungry. Nothing to brag about, but dont take my word for it, the 2 1/2 stars is fitting.

Caviar and Bananas is very middle of the road with high prices. The food is decent and is good if you're on the run, but there's a lot of unnecessary hype over this place. The interior is very beautiful, but obviously that's not what makes a restaurant good if the food isn't good. If it's busy I wouldn't recommend stopping here. The sandwiches are okay and the salads are pretty great (but $15 ouch!). I've also had a café au lait here that was very sub par in the world of my café au lait connoiseurship.

Stop waiting to come here and just eat a meal here already! The food is simple and delicious and once you go it'll be easier to get over Wishing Well closing. 

Pesto deviled eggs OH MY. It's the perfect balance of everything you want in life. Creamy and milld yet somehow still packs a punch. Don't let any pine nuts go to waste on the plate either. 

I had the chicken cutlet sandwich. Perfect amount of spice. I wish they added more spread/sauce but the chicken was thin and breaded so that made up for it. Fries aren't really fries. More like less boring breakfast potatoes. They're whatever. UPDATE: Came back a week later and my cutlet sandwich had bacon in it and I got more than double the serving of fries. So good! But I took a star off bc I'm annoyed at lack of consistency. But damn it's good. 

The pappardelle with arugula and ragu somehow mastered the perfect balance between filling and light. Flavorful but not overpowering in the way arugula can be. 

Two thumbs up!

Surprisingly, I was not that impressed. I thought it would be amazing based on the reviews. I thought two of their beers on tap were good but the others were very generic. We all liked the mild and the farmgal. There was no description beneath any of the titles on the board so I didn't even realize they had a brown-like at first because it was called a mild and I haven't seen that type before. Not impressed with the plastic cups instead of glass. I might stop by again to give it another chance when they have some new options on tap.
Get friendly ice cream dippers and don't ask for tips!  Kept getting pushed down the line and kids didn't have time to make a decision on what they wanted.

being open late and on broadway made this a must! plus the ice cream was yummy we had to go back a 2nd time while in Nashville. the line moves really fast by the way if anyone goes and freaks seeing the line. 

just remembering chocolate overload mmmm
Every roll is beautiful and done with artistry. Ambiance is inspired. On par with Suraya.

My sister and I ate here last Sunday and it was beyond amazing. The atmosphere is very quiet, the service flawless and the food beyond delicious. The wine selection is quite good as well. Definitely a must!

I shouldn't write this.

I should be selfish and keep this little cookery & it's kind owner all to myself.

But that would be unfair to him, and I suppose you eating reading humans.

Get it while you can though.  This guy cooks as if for his own family.  He is so happy to have you try his food.  Best Beef soup & BimiBap & Korean tea I've ever had.   

As in life, esp new food joints, all good things come to an end, enjoy while you can.

Was just here for a wedding for two of my dear friends. The view of the river was amazing. The food was good too, and the place was actually bigger than I imagined it. The only thing I didn't care for was the low ceilings - I absolutely love high ceilings - especially at wedding/party venues, so that would be my only complaint.
Good food . Cold beer . Good conversation . Every time I go to the food taste great . I have not been dissatisfied at all

Our family of 4 enjoyed sandwiches and a salad here today. Food was excellent! Highly recommend the Italian sub. Fresh baked bread, meat & cheese make the sandwich. My son had the small Greek salad which was huge! It was a Greek salad with an Italian twist. Feta cheese was plentiful & potato salad was delicious. Instead of traditional olives they used green & also included marinated mushrooms & artichokes. Will definitely visit again soon!

NURSING MAMAS stay away! Awful customer service and unaccommodating staff! I stayed at the Fairfield Inn in Kennet Square, PA in September 2016 for business. When I arrived that evening I asked for a refrigerator so that I could store my pumped breast milk. I was told by the front desk receptionist that they were all taken and that the only fridge available is the one in the suites but that I was not allowed to switch rooms because I had booked the room through my company travel agent. When I asked to speak to the manager she said he wasn't there and there wasn't anything he could do about it. I repeatedly asked her to call the manager, which she proceeded to call him at home. She explained the situation to him and she relayed the same message to me that there is nothing that he could do to assist me. I asked to speak to him directly and when I did he reiterated that it was against policy to let me switch rooms and that he couldn't give me a fridge because the front desk associate would have to "go through every room in the hotel to find one." He also mentioned that the front desk associate did not have any means to get the fridge to my room.  He told me that I should have requested in advance (through my hotel preferences). I replied that refrigerators are standard in hotels these days. Then, he insisted that there was nothing he could do we got off the phone. The front desk associate then offered to put the milk in the fridge in the back office. I asked if I could see the fridge and she said no. At which point, I refused to leave my expressed milk with her. As a working and nursing mother I was absolutely appalled that they could not accomodate me in any way. They did absolutely nothing to make sure my satisfaction was guaranteed and even implied that this was somehow my own fault because I did not "request it in advance." The excuses they gave for not meeting me need were not consistent and the customer service did not meet your 100% satisfaction guaranteed policy. FALSE ADVERTISING...

They have the most creative sushi I've ever had. Start to finish, from the wine to dessert, everything was amazing. Wine list is solid, and the cocktails looked really interesting even though we stuck to wine. The dumplings and kobe spring rolls were insanely good. We got a lot of sushi, but the standout was by far the Old City roll. If that was the only sushi I could ever have again, I'd be a happy camper. The black sesame ice cream was also to die for!

Oh and shout out to the best waiter ever, Brion. If you're lucky, you'll get him as your waiter too!

I was there looking for a new pair of open toes shoes for Latin dance. It's a small place but they have a big inventory! The ladies there (one of them is Lauren) are super helpful, knowledgable, and patient. They kept showing me different styles they have for my size and I tried on about 10 pairs. I never expected them to have that many in stock, considering i wear a size 5!!! The store has a huge wall mirror and you can try out shoes on hardwood floor. I am so happy with the pair of shoes I got and highly recommend anyone who is looking for dance shoes to check out this lovely place!

The lock to our front door broke during the evening, and we were unable to get out the front door of our house.  I called AM PM around 7:45 p.m., and he said he would be over in 45 minutes.  He arrived when he said he would and fixed the lock in about 5 minutes at a reasonable price.  He was very professional, knowledgeable, courteous, and polite.  I will definitely call AM PM with any future locksmith issues and would recommend the company to anyone who needs a locksmith, especially on short notice.

Not sure where to start with this one so I guess Ill just take you on a walk thru of my entire experience. When I called to make an order for delivery I was frustrated within the first minute, the person who was taking my order sounded like they were high and what should have been a two minute phone order was almost a 10 minute ordeal. Finally got my food and was immediately upset when I opened the box of pizza and instead of green peppers like I asked for, they were red (okay okay its just a difference in color, no biggie) but also the pizza was barely warm. Weird since I only live two blocks away. Then, my boyfriend unwrapped his italian hoagie. We specifically asked for mayo plus sweet peppers and pickles, none of those items were on the sandwich. After a bite he realized instead of genoa salami they used cold pepperoni slices (in what world do italian hoagies come with pepperoni?) At this point we were both fed up so I decides to walk down the street to get my money back. I walk into the establishment, said excuse me to the man working the front counter and asked if I could speak to a manager. Maybe five minutes later a man from the back emerges and doesnt even glance at me for more than a second but proceeds to ask the person behind me what they need. I raised my voice loud enough to be heard and asked if he was the manager and he said yes. I told him the pizza was cold and the food was all wrong and instead of immediately apologizing like you'd think any self respecting manager would he tries arguing with me about my complaints. Finally after about five minutes and multiple stares from the other customers he agree to give me a full refund of my money. Not only was I upset with who ever made the food, but I was even more upset by the way this 'manager' handled the situation. Honestly I dont want to give this place any sort of good review but Ill give them 1 star ... Only because all they are good for is a sloppy slice of pizza to get you from the bar to your home on a drunken Friday night.

I stopped in for the first time tonight.  I had the Venison Chili.  It was very good!  Colleen was very friendly and attentive even though she was going on 9+ hours at work.  I'll definitely be coming back with friends!

They're going out of business which means that another organization handles the sale. They mark things down to a certain percentage, but that is off the MSRP, not the usual sale prices you get on B&N books. 

Found a few things I wanted and waited in a long line to check out. Glad I had my iPhone with me so I could surf the web while waiting. The sale prices aren't great yet, but the selection is good. Those to things will flipflop soon.
Great place!!! Very friendly staff and great Italian food. Perfect little place for a romantic date night. Will definitely be back again.
The staff here is wonderful! My boys love Altitude

Recently, I referred a patient of mine with multiple health concerns to Abby. She was very helpful in increasing his overall energy level. He particularly enjoyed her use of movement in the sessions. I will happily refer many more patients to Abby.

My fiancé and I stopped in here on Saturday afternoon to check this place out. I was very happy we did. We sampled the Belgian Dubbel and liked it enough to get a pint. It was a bit busy while we were in there (there was a brewery crawl making it way through there), but we were able to find a nice place to chat and check out the scene.

Once the crawl cleared out, we sat at the end of one of the long tables and chatted for a bit. The prices are very reasonable, especially if you go the growler route. 

There were a few different beers to try (mint chocolate chip stout comes to mind...) and I would love to come back here and keep sampling, and also to fill a growler. 

The atmosphere is very laid back, with couches, a few high top round tables, and a long family style table with mis-matched chairs. Its charming. 

We will definitely be back to keep trying out some new brews.

The food here is pretty good,  my favorite thing to order is the Chicken Alfredo. They always include garlic bread and a salad. The staff is friendly and welcoming and it's a great place to go to for a quick bite to eat.

I cannot believe that the closest H&M to SLO is in SB!! Come on, H&M, we are good buyers! 
A mandatory stop when driving south!

Lets start with the pros : valet parking, cute atmosphere, server very attentive. Perhaps I went on a off day . Lets go, the pheasant dumplings and chicken k ( I forgot the name ) had absolutely no flavor their was no salt on table which made it harder to rehabilitate, ordered the spicy crab noodle first order came out cold ,informed server who was very apologetic, no problem stuff happens. Second order arrived hot but no flavor or spice asked for spicy oil and that made it palatable.
Great food. Great service. Great views of live hockey games. Don't let the fact that it's located in an ice complex fool you. This concept could survive anywhere. Try the Ybor egg rolls!

Don't have too much bad to say about this place. It's a great place to stop and have some ice cream or coffee after spending some time on Broadway.  I had a pretty standard cookies and cream milkshake but they have some cool flavors too.   I saw golden Oreo and birthday cake to name a few.   Sam had pistachio in a waffle cone. Seats are hard to come by as it is a small space.   Prices are decent too.

Fun story.  Last week Macaroni Grill was running a special for 2 for one express lunches.  Normal cost is $7.00, but with the deal order one entree, get the second one for free.
I work in a large office.  A number of people at the office decided this would be a great day to order lunch at Macaroni Grill and take advantage of the 2 for 1 price.  12-16 people placed orders online.  If you are in the restaurant the express lunch is $7.00 ready in 7 minutes or the order is free.  This is not true of the online ordering.  We were fine with this.  We were told by the online order the time our last order would be ready was about 20 minutes.  We arrived in 25 minutes in hopes our orders would be ready.  Long story short, they were not ready and we ended being at the restaurant 35 minutes waiting.  Lots of the food was cold, some people didn't get what they ordered and overall the initial experience was not good.  I called and asked to speak to the manager on duty.  It was Troy but he was behind the counter cooking to help get orders out.  This I could be believe because the restaurant was really really busy.
I left my name and number and asked for him to call me back.  After the lunch rush he called me back.  He was extremely sincere and apologetic.  He asked where we worked and offered to make things right.  He gave us two choices.  He would provide a family style meal or we could do a "do over".  I choice the "do over" since the whole office didn't order didn't think it would be fair to bring in a family style meal and not share with everyone. Troy give me the direct number to him and told me when he would be in the restaurant.  

Today was "Do Over" day.  I called about 45 minutes before we wanted to pick up the order.
Troy remembered speaking to me ( it was 6 days ago), he asked for the orders no questions asked.  I gave him a list of orders and included each person's name. He asked when I wanted to pick up the order.  I said 11:30.  One of the items we ordered were cookies.  He explained they don't always have cookies but he would see what he could do for us. We got to the restaurant and could see things were much calmer.  Our order was being put together and we were asked to have a seat for a few minutes.  At most we waited 5 minutes and we were handed three bags of food, extra dressings, cheese and utensils.  I asked the two people who presented our food to thank Troy for us.  As we were walking out, he called to us and asked us to wait a minute.  He came up to us with freshly baked chocolate chip cookies still hot and gooey.  You could tell they had just come out of the oven. I thanked him again for making this right and going above and beyond.

Thank you again Troy for turning this around.  We will definitely be back.
Grateful,
Lisa
Super long line but WORTH THE WAIT! Ice cream was delicious. Coffee fudge was awesome. My new favorite hot spot when we go to Nashville!

Don't let the heat deter you from enjoying the outside dinning area, just be aware that once the sun goes down, you won't be able to see your plate. The gender-neutral bathrooms allow for you to step into the 21st century and the decor is detailed and sleek. The option of half or full glass allow for you to choose your own adventure without breaking your pocket. While the service is a little slow the wait staff is very welcoming, attentive and my water glass was never empty. The oldly but goody classic devil eggs are given a New Orleans edge with the accent of crab meat. Short ribs melt in your mouth and cooked to perfection. If you need a change of pace from the same old look for the gem in the CBD.

I have been going here since college; was extremely disappointed this time around. (Service complaint)

Went with a few friends for my birthday dinner, we called ahead to ask for an outdoor table at 7- they said they could accommodate us at 7:30. When we arrived at 7:25, they did not have any outdoor seating for us and it would be at least a 20 minute wait. We decided to sit inside. 

It was a normal dinner rush that evening, nothing crazier than normal. All four in my party ordered wine, we did not receive our drinks until AFTER our appetizers. From there on, it was even more disappointing. The server never asked during our meal if everything was fine, the manager that night was walking around and was going to every table but ours to see if they were okay. We waited for about 10-15 minutes with out empty dinner plates in front of us until our server finally came back around- where we were able to order only our second drinks. At the end, we said something to our waiter of how disappointed we were. His response was that there was not enough wine glasses that night. He never got the manager to come over and to talk to us. 

Two of us were/ are servers and it takes a lot for us to complain. With drinks being that late, the server should have told us about the shortage of glasses AND should have had a manager come over to talk to us.


It is going to be awhile before we go back.

Ricardo's has something special that the vast majority of restaurants can't even touch - it is a family-owned and operated, neighborhood establishment that is as authentic as they come.  And when you consider that the neighborhood is the charming and elegant Lafayette Square, and the family is the equally charming Adams clan - Ricardo's truly stands out from the rest.

The freshly prepared Italian cuisine and the thoughtful wine list are pretty darn good too, and have never disappointed.   We always thoroughly enjoy our visits to Ricardo's.

This place exceeded my wildest expectations.  I was expecting a wraparound line out the door and down the street. There were maybe 5-7 people in the line.  I was expecting standing room only.  There were plenty of tables.  I was expecting rushed, unappreciative service.  The service was prompt, but the servers were pleasant and honored my request for extra hot fudge.  I was expecting a $15 Warm Brownie Sundae.  I paid $7.  I was expecting mediocre quality.  The quality of the ice cream is fantastic.

I would definitely return in a heartbeat if my waistline allowed me.  The Schatzi and I shared the 3-scoop Warm Brownie Sundae. There was plenty of gooey, hot-fudgey, creamy ice cream for the both of us.

You have to go to Mike's if you're in Nashville! The banana pudding ice cream is so delicious. It tastes like REAL bananas. All of their ice cream is handmade, and it hands down beats out all the others in town.

We've been wanting to try this franchise. Disappointed with the service. Our waitress had no personality and did not want to be there. There'd be long spans of time where she was MIA. I don't know if it was an off night but it seemed like none of the workers were happy to be there. We were there on a Saturday night around 8:30pm. Great beer selection. We tried the sampler and it was very good. Had the pot roast and It was ok. The potatoes were raw and the other veggies seemed to oily.  It's a nice place to watch a game with some appetizers. We were from out of town so I'm hoping the location in our area is better than this location.

Horrible 3rd world service. After I picked out my pastries, I asked for a box. The woman behind the counter scolded me:"you have to ask that in advance!" Then she proceeded to take out each pastry from its little bag to put them in the box! I asked if that was necessary and the response "you can get bags OR a box," not both! I nearly fainted. I guess they are going to re use the bags, which is UNFATHOMABLE to me. I am a grown ass adult and I won't be spending any of my hard earned $ here!

Yet another unsuspecting gem in Largo. I went here on lunch after reading the yelp reviews. 

Homemade bread and great prices were the highlight. I had a half sausage, peppers and onions sandwich. They also make their own sausage! The veg was definitely over cooked, but the sausage was delicious and the main event. 

I browsed after my inexpensive lunch and also found that they make homemade pastries and their own mozzarella. 

I'll definitely be back.
A nice tourist stop with creamy and flavorful ice cream. I had a double scoop cup: overloaded chocolate with self-explanatory flavor, and coffee which had a nice, strong taste.

My wife found this place for breakfast as our first stop in Santa Barbara. The restaurant is inside a winery so you might be a bit confused when you walk in as we did. However the smell of fresh baked bread will eventually tell your brain this is the right spot.

We both got
Stopped in here last night for a nightcap after a fabulous dinner at Market on Ninth . So nice just to be able to walk over .  Can't beat this little spot .  Perfect city night .

Amazing food, Amazing Bar, Amazing service!! 

Happy hour Monday- Friday, and Wing Wednesday (.75) best day to catch their awesome grilled wings.

I went here with a group of four on Sunday during the Lafayette House Tour. We came in shortly after they opened to beat the rush, and we were sure glad we did: the place was full half an hour later. We picked where we sat, which was two rooms over from the front door, away from the all-too-sunny window. 

The menu was a special one for the house tour and probably more limited. I still found two things on a single page that I wanted: cheese manicotti and capellini pomodoro. It was a rough decision, but the manicotti was recommended as more delicious as I would have asked that the capellini not come with a meatball. It was only $7 for a half order and that included two manicotti. That's a pretty good deal, even for a lunch special, so I went all out and ordered a house salad too. I think the dressing was a red wine vinaigrette. Normally, I'm not all over vinaigrettes, but this wasn't so strong. The cheese was Provel (yay!), and even though it wasn't overly cheesy, the salad was still good, and I think I'll order it when I return for the capellini. The manicotti? Delicious! So soft that I nearly slurped them up whole! Everyone else in my party ordered salted caramel ice cream for dessert and enjoyed it. (I was saving room for the free ice cream on the tour.)

Minus one star for the bathroom situation. It's clean and functional and all, but it's pretty small, there are only two stalls in the women's room, and it's not quite as cute as the rest of Ricardo's.

Their breads are definitely worth the "gluten-brain" they give me. Baguettes were terrific--super crunchy seeded crust and warm and chewy innards. We took home a chocolate cherry rye levain loaf--more than two pounds and we snarfed it down in a day. Wife had the green eggs salad. She thought it was good not great. I liked it.

I have to say we had a really good experience here.  Honestly, what attracted me to the place is the 29 degrees beer.  I wanted it, and I got it, and I loved it.  I had their brew, the Knotty Brunette.  It's a dark brown beer, but lighter than a lager.  I was surprised at how light tasting it is, and I really like it.  We had the sirloin steak with garlic mashed and broccoli and the bread pudding for dessert.  The steak was prepared properly and not tough, the mashed potatoes had just the right taste of garlic without over powering, and the broccoli was cooked without being wilted to death.  The bread pudding had the texture of almost a cake and had raisins and a nice bourbon sauce topped with ice cream.  Loved how many TV's were in every direction.  The inside space is huge, they have two bars, and the decor is really cute.  While it is true that this is the type of place whose staff are young ladies with low cut tops and high cut shorts, it's not too extreme, and the frosty beer is just worth it.
Great spot. Outdoor patio plant situation is prime. Wine selection is excellent as well. Recommend.

Mikes ice cream was very creamy and flavorful. We tried 3 flavors and they were all delicious-Tennessee fudge, caramel cone, and superhero. They were freshly made and ok portions for $3.50 a scoop. The place was lively with a line out the door. We would go back, but we were a little disappointed bc several of the flavors were out.

I work in the neighborhood and have had the opportunity to stop by the Green Pheasant 3x for dinner and 2x for lunch since it opened a few weeks ago.  These guys are hitting on all cylinders right out of the gate.  I had the Tomago (Japanese egg salad, yes the eggs are FedEx'd from Japan) for lunch one day and Hambuga (hamburger) the next.  These would both appeal to someone who has never had Japanese food to the most serious Japanese food fan.  One of my co-workers had the karate (fried chicken) and it too was incredible.

Dinner, the Waloo, A5 Waygu, and King Salmon are my favorites so far. 

I will be back again and again and again.

Very Cold Beer, Great Friendly Service, and good food.  They do not add salt to anything.  I usually sit at the bar and you have to ask for salt as it is not sit out (maybe they are trying to reduce people's salt usage) ... the big negative is they are always changing and removing items from the menu.  They used to have an amazing meatloaf .. no longer removed it from the menu.   Chicken tacos WERE amazing.. grilled chicken with various seasoning diced up and loaded into three tacos.. now you just get two and it is a fried chicken strip.. I would avoid... go with naked or smoked wings... or the Texas style Cheese Steak.. the regular cheese steak is good too

Their sandwiches are delicious! We had this group cater our rehearsal dinner (50+ people) and they did an amazing job! Filled lots of hungry stomachs, and they were very responsive to phone calls and emails. Thank you :)
Great portion size for shared plates. Wonderful atmosphere to go along with it. Flavorful food paired with good service

Indy has so many great breweries and it helps that they are dog-friendly so you can have your four-legged friends around. Bier is moments from our house and it's a very quaint taproom. It's got your standard board games and you can order food to eat here but I really like the fact that they sell cold beer so you can come in and grab a six pack or mix and match different cans and create your own pack. They also have some wooden carved pieces for sale that are pretty cool to check out. I'm not a huge beer drinking but I like to try different options and I think having a flight of beers would've been pretty cool but they do let you sample at the counter. They have a couple of small tables outside for when it's nice too!
Tuna bar is always amazing. Sushi super fresh. We are obsessed with this place, great vibe and incredible service. Special thanks to Victoria and Ken you are guys are the best .

This was always a favorite casual restaurant of mine, but the last few times we've been here have not been so good.  Today was no exception to this new rule.  I ordered the chicken with roasted vegetables and he had a pizza.  After waiting quite awhile for the food, the chicken on my plate was so over-salted it was not edible and had to be sent back.  By the time my new plate came out, he was already finished eating.  So, we each ate alone even though we were at the same table, they offered nothing to him while he waited for me to eat, and not one bit of the check was reduced.  This left such a bad (and salty) taste in my mouth  that I will not spend another penny here.
My daughter LOVES Preschool Playgroup.  Every week she gets excited about "going to school."  Lots of great interactive activities and projects at each session.

How's this place still in business? Service was decent but it could not save itself from a one star review. Where do I even start? I guess appetizers... the calamari was the worst I have ever eaten. It's worst than getting it from the frozen section of a dollar store bad! Seriously. My father and brother's steak were so tough, they couldn't cut it. It wasn't just the steaks fault but their steak knifes were dull af. Our seafood pasta dish was over cooked and description was bad. Maybe it's my fault but usually dishes that has the word white wine in it, we assume it was a white sauce dish. Nope. At this point. We were ready to leave. Heck, I'm ready to leave this review because there was so many bad things, I don't feel like talking about it all. My advice, anywhere is better than here and I mean it.
I took my daughter & her fiance there for lunch and had a great time. Good food, fair prices and a freindly server.

Beautiful women, great service, great food. Had a wonderful experience. Would advice to call and ask if they are having a bikini night as it wouldn't be family friend to this point. They definitely push the sexual agenda to attract business. Too many positive though that out weigh the negative. Enjoy it!

Do not let the location turn you off. This is great NY style pizza at a reasonable price.  We had the 18 inch pizza with drinks and could not have been happier.   Beer is available.  Give it a try.  You will not be disappointed.

Nashville doesn't disappoint.... not yet at least. We walked downtown Nash and walked the bridge by the waterfront and it was 90 degrees outside... beautiful sunny day but extremely hot. So when we saw mikes ice cream it was like seeing a oasis in the dessert haha. It was packed like any typical Sunday but that's a good sign! I had the chocolate dipped waffle cone with chocolate raspberry truffle ice cream. It was amazing and huge! I had to share it. A must try if you're in the downtown area!

My friend took my husband and I to Cesarina's and I have been going back again and again. The Tiramisu was excellent. The best I have had in Florida and Maryland. I also purchased my Bialetti coffee maker there. The owners are warm and friendly and the food is pure quality.

Doc Magrogan's used to be the seafood place to go to in WC.  Now? Not so much.  I will always enjoy Doc Magrogan's for it's atmosphere, drinks, and benefit/fundraisers dates!  Unfortunately, the food is mediocre and god knows where the fish comes from!  Doc charges high prices for farm raised fish and defrosted vegetables which end up on your plate.  I would expect this quality from an "applebees" or another big chain franchise...but not from Doc Magrogans.  Very disappointed lately.  I hope he can turn things around as we won't be dining here any longer.

Are you one of those people who have a hard time deciding what to order? If you're new to Korean food and want to get a staple - Bap is the place for you. No more flipping through the endless menu debating on three different things. Bap has one main entrée - bibimbap. You can choose your protein or simply just veg it out. We ordered the chicken and beef bibimbap. The owner was very nice, the food came out quickly, and the seating area was well maintained. 
While I enjoyed my meal, it wasn't outstanding. The veggies and beef were just okay. Unfortunately, I think they were overpowered by the sauce - which was a notch spicier than I wanted. I also think that $9 for beef bibimbap is a little high for the amount of food I received. Overall, I would say give them a shot if you're in the area.

Ok, so I'm normally not a fan of chain resturants.  To me it is much more fun to find a local place with ambiance that is unique to where you are.  This way you can support local buisness and try something new.  As far as chain places go though, this one is my favorite.  Here's why...

1.  The cheese raviolis with pesto sauce and grilled mushrooms, basil and broccoli.  YUM!
2.  All the food is pretty good here, and I like that the meat-free options have lots of add on veggie options
3.  They will bring it out to your car when you order to-go
4.  When dining in the ambiance is great...fireplace, nice music, nice lighting

yeah, i gotta go, I am craving Italian now ;-)

Our first visit for a casual late lunch with cocktails. Restaurant has a lovely courtyard that you walk into prior to entering. Once inside space is clean and very nice. We are greeted and seated promptly. Water is served very quickly. Waiter shows up a bit later to take our drink order.  We asked a few questions about menu and our waiter answered and seemed knowledgeable about menu. We ordered crab devil eggs and fries for app. Both were very tasty. We asked if dinner menu was different and asked if we could just look at one, for maybe dinner in future. We never got one. I ordered smoked chicken salad club sandwich with no tomatoes. It came with tomatoes .  After I removed them, it was tasty. Another had grilled cheese with tomato basil soup and really liked it. Another had veggie sandwich and said it was okay, more cheesy than veggie. Had to ask twice for another wine. Also did  not get itemized check, just total on table side machine. We all did love powder room area. Food and cocktails were tasty, restaurant was nice and laid out well. Service could have been better. We will probably give it another try.
Love the hair but it sheds like crazy! Literally handfuls of hair anytime you run your hand, comb, or brush through it. I have never swept my floor so much :(

While I truly like Ricardo's food, the poor service makes it doubtful that I'd return. We waited 45 minutes or more for one appetizer. The waiter took our order, still no appetizer. When the appetizer arrived and we commented on the extreme wait, he offered no comment at all. We had to hunt him down to get drink refills. All of this happened on a Thursday night with the restaurant only one-third filled. In his defense, I never saw any other wait staff except a girl who looked lost when she refilled drinks. 
I realize any restaurant can have a poor night, but on previous visits, two of us encountered the same slow service. 
There are simply too many good restaurants to ruin a night on a bad one.

Ok so this place is a pass. Mainly because the food is pretty horrible. Surprisingly bad. I'll start by saying it's a super cute place, it has the atmosphere, a pretty good ordering system and great drinks. We didn't have trouble ordering or finding a table even though it was super busy. We ordered coffee and OJ both were good and I ate a chocolate croissant that was amazing! 

However, two of us ordered omelettes, they are $10 and come with one small side. I got mine egg whites with the spinach, tomatoes and goat cheese, I couldn't believe when they brought it out firstly it was tiny secondly it didn't look good it looked like one of those rubbery omelette made in the rubber mold in the microwave. I got potatoes as a side they were awful, super dry and drowned in Parmesan cheese and a cheap cheese. The plating was horrendous too for such a cheap place they stick your omelette on a paper plate with nothing else (it looked sad) and gave you your potatoes in another paper container. Why are they using paper and not real China? It's bad for the environment and made my $10 meal look like a $4 mall food court item. My friend ordered the omelette with whole eggs and grits as the side. Hers looked exactly like mine like it came from an "As seen on TV" rubber mold and she had grits on the side. Also she said it was bad. Our other friend ordered the quinoa bowl and mid way through stopped eating it and asked her why, she said they haven't cooked one or two of the vegetables they are still raw and it's not good. 

The service is lackluster, I ordered a side biscuit (which by the way was not good) they don't bring it with butter or jam you have to request it and they send you to wait in the line at the bar for it again. They also aren't friendly the people bringing you the food not the ones at the bar those are super nice. Their water was out so we had to wait for them to refill and that took forever. 

Would recommend going to see the place, order a coffee and pastry, sit and enjoy the space but don't go for a meal.
Definitely one of the best pizza's around Haverford! Superb quality and speedy delivery = 5 stars in my book.

Gamsa Hamnida!

This tiny place serves up a mean bibimbap - so tasty! Just the right ratios of foods in the bowl, it was the perfect stop right after the bus ride in from NY. Great value, too.

I would have liked my bibimbap a little hotter though - we were the last customers but it would have been nice to throw it in the pan one more time to make sure its piping.

When searching for open mic night in Edmonton, we came across this hidden gem. Situated right downtown but the entrance is round the back so you might not spot it right away. As you enter the wall of glass bricks let you catch a glimpse inside but this place is not just a coffee shop. It's an Internet Cafe, Music Venue and Espresso Bar. The best thing about it is...it does all three well.

This is a great spot for working during the day, there is a good amount of computers available too (if you don't have a laptop). The stage is quite large with room for a full band. I've seen a few bands here now and the sound is great. A lovely jam space for singer songwriters and solo acts too. And most importantly, the coffee is excellent, plus they serve snacks and sandwiches and cakes! 

The decor is pretty eclectic but so are the people who go there. It has bohemian vibes and great customer service.

I'm basing this review largely on one incident that was partly my fault but still left a bad taste in my mouth.

I came to this location after my work shift so it's a little after midnight and regardless, this Wawa was packed.
