Bier has truly amazing beers.  I've been to most breweries in Indiana, and I think that this place has the best beer overall.  They have a great variety, and I really enjoyed the subtle flavors. 

Even the beers that were styles I don't normally like (weisen and smoked) were pretty darn good. 

The only downfall (?) is that I fell in LOVE with the tripel, and it's already out of the rotation.

Excellent staff here!! Everyone from the valet staff, the host, the restaurant manager, the servers were all nice! Our waiter had a great knowledge of the menu! The restaurant is beautiful with modern decor! We were lucky to be seated in a private room. The staff helped us get set up and I can't thank them enough. We all loved the stuffed chicken wings. The drinks were delish!!

The entrees are really not shareable because most items are bite sizes like the 4 dumplings you can eat in 2 bites. 
The only complaint I have is about the pricing on the Japanese wagyu which is very misleading. It was Amazing but absolutely not worth the price. It's $26 per oz for a minimum of 4oz in very small print!!! We had a party of 10 and all of us read the menu wrong. That adds up to $104. We had 3 to share in our table so imagine the shock when we got the bill. $416 for 1lb of wagyu is highway robbery!! If we return I'd like to try the American wagyu. 

PS If you visit be sure to use the restrooms. I know silly but I was so tickled by the Toto high tech toilets lol.

I had a Master Card with Chase since 2007.  Last year in some Chase WISDOM they decided to replace the Master Card with some kind of Freedom credit card.  I have never used the Freedom card in the 6 months I have had it.  In the meantime I log on to the Chase web site to download the Master Card statements from 2017 so I can see my expenses for my tax return and the statements are no longer there, only the Freedom card that I have never used.  I call Chase and I am told that the statements are no long available.  I am referring to statements less than one year old.  So what is up with all this PAPERLESS C...?  Banks want everyone to go paperless because the statements are available on the web site and so they can save $$$$.  What a bunch of ...  I can log on to Discover Card and see my statements going back several years.  So I told Chase to cancel the Freedom card that I would never use it because of this situation.   Then I had to listen to the message about balances and points.  I told Chase that I had never used the card which means I have no balance or points.....STAY AWAY FROM THIS BANK.

I'm happy this Target location is closing in June 2019. For some reason we come to this location about once a week and have a neutral to terrible experience each time. The store is clean and organized, I think the stockers and display team are great however the checkout staff up front is horrendous. The checkout team is made up of cocky teens and clueless, miserable 50 year-olds that didn't plan properly for retirement and are forced to work. There are about 15 checkout lines but rarely is more than one manned, while multiple (up to 5, I counted) carefree staff members urge you to use the self checkout. Customers must endure the headache of scanning/weighing their own produce, wait to get ID checked for alcohol or superglue, bag all purchases and struggle to figure out how to scan/run a coupon as a check or use a finicky gift card.

What caused me to write this review was our experience yesterday on 4/10/2019. My wife, myself and our newborn baby went to target to purchase some medical supplies, infant formula and some groceries. Not one register was manned but several employees were twiddling their thumbs around the self checkout stations. We were told by an older female employee to use self checkout and we declined and explained we were purchasing formula with complicated coupons as well as some beer. She opened a register just for us and seemed very unfamiliar with the workings of a digital cash register.She tried for about 10 minutes to run a check-type coupon to no avail. She called for help and I watched about 3 employees do an about face and flee the other direction. She and who I assume was the manager finally figured it out after I had walked outside due to our infant screaming. The best part was two other customers got in line behind us with completely fully carts, and were told by employees to use the self checkout. I really hope the checkout team does not get absorbed into other store teams when this place closes.Not surprising this location is being closed due to falling sales.

Worst customer service ever.  I spent 120 bucks on 12 glasses and asked them to be gift wrapped.  I waited ONE HOUR only to find that none of the six pretentious employees had even bothered to start wrapping.  At closing, waited awkwardly as the manager locked all the doors and stared at us while another employee hurriedly wrapped these expensive glasses.  5th grade wrapping job with no padding for the glasses.  Did I mention we were their only customers during that last hour!? Unacceptable.  Go anywhere else.

This is a cute place that combines a bakery with classic warm breakfast items and a wine tasting bar.
It is located in the middle of a street tucked in the back surrounded by other tasting rooms representing the different wineries of Santa Barbara.
It was Sunday and the bakery at 11:30 am had sold of nearly out all bread items. My plan of a simple warm sesame bagel with cheese was replaced with  the soup of the day : cream of mushroom a little heavy on the cream accompanied by 2 wedges of buttered sourdough.
I added a Cuban sandwich which was good but unfortunately , the same buttered sourdough was  used making it for a very heavy meal .
For the price, I would have  liked a salad on the side.
The flavors were good and the atmosphere inside was nice and cosy but minus one star for the heavy hand on the butter and the cream .

This place is cheap with a capital "C." Though most bakeries in Chinatown are very affordable, what made this place great was the service! The woman behind the counter chatted us up and helped us decide on which bubble tea to order. We went with the thai tea which they prepare themselves earlier in the day. The thai tea was tasty but could have been a little sweeter. I was tempted to try out some of the treats since they were only a buck but I was stuffed from dinner. Next time I'll try to the egg tarts.

The food here was phenomenal. We ordered the green breakfast bowl, which was unique and the sauce added a delicious flavor. Loved it. The turkey panini had jalapeños baked into the bread and it was very crunchy and delicious. The atmosphere both inside and on the patio was very nice and cute. Loved this place for a casual brunch.

Bap is run by a very friendly elderly couple that, coupled with the cozy decor, really make it feel like we're in someone's home.

The wood floors and tables are a dark wood and the warm lighting is dim. There's no music playing and it's often empty. In sum, this makes for a great place on a cold winter day to grab hot soup or dolsot bibimbap.

Prices are reasonable and you'll see from my photos that I got a filling dolsot tofu bibimbap and traditional ginger cinnamon tea.

I'd come back again for a casual meal and suggest you do the same.

I've been here a time or two before and did not think much of it. It's pricey and a bit too "frou frou" for my taste. I really just thought this place was another West End over-the-top restaurant. While in the area again, I figured I'd give it another shot, because everything deserves a second chance.

I've only dined in for breakfast, but have heard people rave about the lunch and dinner menus. They had salads, sandwiches, wraps, and other great options. They had a plethora of unique side options that looked so dang good--from chicken salad and kale salad to Thai meatballs and chicken tenders. It all looked (and tasted) so fresh. They have options for all sorts of diet restrictions and allergies, and a small shopping section with fun & unique juices, chips, and snack options.

The Thai meatballs and kale salad were TO DIE FOR, so fresh and so delicious--a must try...kale lovers and kale skeptics will enjoy it. I ordered a chicken wrap that was funky and soggy, and not the best--I threw it out because it just didn't taste nearly as good as my sides. The ambiance here is very cute, matching the food, a perfect place for that perfect Instagram snap.
Ordered the 5.99 deals tonight. I was able to feed the family on only $30. Great delivery time & great food! Thank you!

Went into the store today with our son. We were never once acknowledged. Not a single person greeted us or asked if we needed any help. They had a "train table" which consisted of a piece of ply wood on top of a coffee table. It was not secure at all and the ply wood slid around. Of course we didn't realize it wasn't secured (because it who has a train table that isn't secured) until my son started playing with it and the piece of plywood slid across the table causing him to slide with it and hit his face on the edge of the table. He started screaming and instantly had a huge bruise on his cheek/Eye. Still, no one came to check on us, ask if he was okay, etc. Terrible customer service and very surprising that they are providing unsafe play-setups for children.

Y'all, this place is the BOMB! We ate here for the second time. The food is amazing! The spicy crab noodles, chicken wings, Caesar wedge salad, mushrooms, the skirt steak with miso butter, WOW! Nothing like it, plus the atmosphere is amazing! We visit lots of Nashville restaurants and all I can think about is when I'm going back!

Keeping in mind that it was lunch and my friend and I had small plates, the score is based on everything from ambiance to presentation to service. I will be returning for dinner and for other samplings. 
Sui Gyoza, perfect beginning. The tuna tartar was elegantly presented and spicy special. We also enjoyed the wedge salad with hibachi dressing and the (very yummy) japanese fried chicken. 
Our server, Alex was top notch and steered us correctly to a dessert to share. We went with the tempura style chocolate cake with both leche and chocolate sauce,  dangerously delicious, but honestly, best shared. Special food, special company. Time well spent.

idk what it is about the way they make their pizzas but they're always insanely gooey and cheesy and delicious. They're kinda small unfortunately but it balances out. They also sell fries, cheesesteaks, etc. which are all good, except for the burgers.

When this place opened up down the street my husband and I were super excited that the neighborhood was starting to fill up with nice restaurants. We went in to check it out last night and we were not disappointed. Everything was amazing! The staff is super friendly, the ambiance is really beautiful, modern and chic but still comfortable and the food is out of this world. I mean, seriously. We've been to tons of other sushi places in the city and this was the best of the best. We had a bunch of sashimi, scallops, fried oysters (omg, so good), fried lobster rice and rock shrimp. The scallops were my husbands fave, I really loved the oysters and the rock shrimp. Everything was so fresh and so full of flavor. The sashimi was so fresh and "melt-in-your-mouth" that it sort of seemed insulting to put soy sauce anywhere near it.  We also had really great cocktails, I highly recommend trying the gin-cucumber-wasabi drink. (I can't remember what it's called, maybe Winston Heat? Wilson Heat? Something like that) I really can't wait to go back to this place, it's so perfect for date night.

We really enjoyed our meal but I was incredibly surprised to see a $2 charge for WASABI when we ordered the chirashi (raw fish).  I understand charging for "extra" wasabi with dumplings or noodles or something but it's pretty standard for wasabi to be included with chirashi.  Lol wtf

Went to Tuna Bar for lunch on a Sunday. Sat at a table next to the window and it was beautiful. The view was very good and so was our waiter. However, the food took a very long time to come out and we were starving. Other than that this place was awesome.

This place is alot of fun for mostly young children, it is not huge which is actually kind of nice but it is packed with things to do. There is a post office, bank, grocery store etc which makes for a fun day out and gets kids using their imagination for sure. The place is bright and cheerful and you could spend a couple hours and it would be well worth the money or you could pack a lunch and make a day of letting the kids explore and play while you join them or just relax on a nearby bench. It is not overly crowded and it is a very safe feeling place to be.
neatest little family owned place around. I really enjoy their food. nice and quiet even when full and great staff

Okay, Wawa is actually really good. The sandwiches are better than most chain shops like JJs, Subway, etc. and excellently toasted. They are also pretty cheap and don't forget about free coffee day and all the other deals they have.

The oreo flurricane is on another level. If you have ever been disappointed in a Mcflurry as I have, this is the order for you. The flurricane is everything a Mcflurry ever wanted to be. Loaded with oreos and well-mixed, Mcflurries can only dream of becoming flurricanes. They are also huge- while they cost about as much as a Mcflurry, they are over twice the size I want to say. 

Overall: Break up with your partner? Flurricane. Rough exam? Flurricane. Want an ice cream dessert? Flurricane. Dissapointed by Mcds? Flurricane. The only thing the flurricane cannot do is bring my grandparents back.

I'm sure the bartender is selling drugs. She does not want to get you a beer. I think her name is Lisa she drives a black Jetta. Sometimes a white ford pick up. The only reason I know that is I saw her seller selling drugs in the parking lot across the street. Avoid this place Unless you want drugs.   

Don't eat anything at sharkys you will get sick.
Great sandwiches, coffee, and service. Tennessee Trio was unique and had bacon onion jam.

I love this place in different location, but this one on South Virginia has to be the nastiest I have ever ate at. The chef over cooked the food, the waiter never came back to check on us or ask for more water. The food took almost an hour to get to us, the bread was cold and the waiter said they are fresh and coming out the oven, but how is it cold? When it came out the oven The cruton in the salad was so overwhelming with burnt taste. My little brother order the mama trio, and that lasagna with wine, was so overwhelming with the bitterness of the wine, to the point he couldn't eat it, because they did not reduce the wine down.i will never ever go back to this place. Maybe you should hire a real Italian chef who knows the culture food, instead of a sloppy Mexican chef who doesn't care how the food comes out

This place has oat milk! And I don't mean that in a hippie dippy way, but coming from LA, oat milk is delicious and a great way to enjoy lattes. All that to say, this place is cute, rustic, the food is delicious (I recommend the ricotta toast) and is a perfect way to start your morning for breakfast or brunch!! Highly recommend this place!

On vacation to New Orleans and this wine bar was FANTASTIC! I absolutely loved the menu and food, but the service was second to none. Justin was fabulous. He constantly checked on us, provided new wine suggestions based on my tasting experience and truly made the visit to Copper Vine memorable. We have to return before we leave NOLA. If you love wine, Copper Vine is a must.
Great ambiance. Food and drinks were good.  Server was super funny and attentive. Only drawback is the kitchen was a little slow.

This place was awful. We were waiting 1 and a half waiting for our food. The waitress would ignore what we were saying and we would then have to ask a different waiter or we would have to repeat what we were saying. She claimed that the"computers weren't working and lots of other excuses. But there was another waiter who served his customers before us when we arrived before them. In conclusion I would not recommend this place one bit, we were so mad that we just walked out of there.

I used to live two blocks away from this pathmark and I've never been disappointed. Their fried chicken from the deli rviels ANY others in Philadelphia! I never had a problem with produce or customer service. Also one has to take into account this store IS on gray's ferry.
Best Chinese food I've ever had. Way better than PF Changs! Try the lemon chicken!

3.5

I am a japchae fiend.  I can eat gallons of that stuff if it's in front of me. I was excited that this popular and well-reviewed place was close to my office.  It's a tiny place, so they purposefully only offer a few signature dishes, all under $10.

I finally had a chance to pop in and ordered the japchae with anticipation. I think it was just under $9, a bit pricy in my opinion for a vegetarian japchae with a small scoop of rice. It didn't have that much flavor, to be honest.

Friendly gentleman who took my order, cooked and rang me up.

So sad I used to love this place sadly on my last visit I ordered my favorite  eggplant parmesan which is usually a pretty big platter, instead I got 3 golf ball sized pieces of eggplant. I was disappointed in the size and when I took my first bite I tasted a charcoal flaver ALL of them had been burnt to a crisp!!! then flipped over and served!!!!!!! We alerted the waiter who just brought us more eggplant 30mins later by the time I got it everyone in my party had eaten! and it was under cooked this time raw eggplant is not delicious, then they expected me to PAY for that!!! This branch has gone down the drain

I stopped in for a lunch today, they had the medium smoothie on special for $5.00, which was pretty awesome!  I got the blueberry blast which was pretty yummy, loved the blueberry/banana mix, and the clear cup that it comes in - I like to see my smoothie!  They had a lot of great options, pre-mixed smoothies, or you could make your own, and you can pre-order online, and just go pick it up!  It's a good smoothie option on the south side!

I'm rating it 3.5 stars but decided to round up.  Friendly staff, clean, free breakfast and wifi, near attractions and some shopping area.  There's a swimming pool and whirlpool, small gym.  

There's no couch in the hotel room, only a single seat.  The room is small comparing to other marriot chain hotels.  My hubby and I and our 2 small kids had a room with 1king sized bed.  We expected a larger sized room with a couch.  We asked for a rollaway bed and now the only issue is where to set it in the room.  Space is small. 

If it's a single or two people guests, then I'm sure the lodging arrangements would be more comfortable.
The spinach artichoke was to salty., shrimp pasta was over cooked , good oysters , bad Bloody Mary- bacon at bottom .. Slow service .. But waiter was nice ... Won't be back though ...

Let me tell you, if you are over 65 years of age on a Monday Night, this is the place for you. They've got the old man that only came for dessert and has probably been here for 3 hours. They've got the two older men watching sports and talking too loud because one of them cannot hear and the other has all the things to say. All the things. And last, but not least, we've got the older lady in the bathroom shoving paper towels in her purse.

All and all, it was okay.

I thought they were closing soon because the waiter came back in minute and a half intervals to if we were ready to order. Come to find out she was just super attentive because it is after all a slow Monday night. She was actually really nice. She's the reason this review is a 3 star instead of a two. 

I'm one of those people who look over the menu searching for something new to try and inevitably get what I always get: in this case, chicken fettuccine Alfredo. I give this dish effort for trying. I wasn't creamy, just oily, but it was still flavorful, so that was cool. 

My significant other got the truffle mac n cheese, which he was all about. I wasn't that into it, but as you can see, I'm kind of a turd. 

They had Coca Cola, which made me happy because I dislike Pepsi very much. They also give you a free square loaf of fresh bread... but no butter knife, which pretty much sums up the experience.

Saturday night - service was absolutely awful. There was no one but me & my brother. It took 30 minutes to get our food, there's no reason why it took so long. Food is very mediocre - you can get the same quality food at wawa. Do not come here, avoid at all costs. This place does not belong in a nice place like manayunk.

I just ate ice cream at 10 in the morning, and Mike made me do it!  

This quaint and cute, old-fashioned ice cream parlor hails back to the days when quality service mattered.  Each of their twenty-something ice cream flavors is "handmade" (although I'm not...quite sure what that means), and their frozen cappuccino is freshly composed each day, in house.  Pastries and touristy-treats are also available, although those are provided by outside vendors.  Service does take a little while, since each drink is made to order-- I guess you could say, "with love."  The ice cream is worth the wait, though!

Perhaps Mike knew that I was a tourist, or, perhaps I am just that cute *wink*, because I was served a scoop of Tennessee Fudge so generous that Texas would be jealous!  It was smooth and creamy, but not gluey, like some other gourmet ice creams can be.   I also sampled the Pistachio, Red Velvet, and Moose Tracks, which were also delicious.  

Yes, it was still so early in the morning that people were just barely arriving at work.  Didn't matter.  I was on vacation, and on vacation, what girl doesn't enjoy a fun and indulgent treat?
Great job fast and understanding. I was locked out my home on a Sunday. Got me in my home in seconds. Thanks a lot.

Great place to eat and hang out! We had some drinks outside in the patio area and then went inside for dinner. The service is what made me give them 5 stars, the chef was outside hanging out with everyone, seating, chatting, asking how we were doing. So many people checked up on us that I couldn't keep track. Food was great and the atmosphere was fabulous!

The food is tasty, I'll give them that. But when one buys a $9 cup of soup, to be you need to purchase a half baguette if you want a piece of bread with the soup because they are low on bread is absolutely ludicrous.

Cute pastry shop, very authentic chinatown feel. I had their egg tarts including the almond tart. I definitely prefer the egg tart over the almond tart. It was flaky and the egg custard was sweeter than the almond. The almond tart didn't have any almond taste to it. The flaky crust was definitely a good compliment to the egg custard. Not bad for 80 cents a pop.

Decent little wine bar in New Orleans. Lots of choices on drinks (wine by the half pour, full pour, carafe, bottle or on tap - beer and cocktails).

Their food was quite good as well with a modern American menu. Duck fat fries were awesome!

Quite a variety of foods, although I might recommend sticking to land-based food as better seafood is available throughout New Orleans.
This place is all hype. Also I was denied entrance because I was accompanied by my service dog (with proper ADA documentation) and the manager told me I couldn't come in with a "pet".
The food was amazing! Highly recommend the Lobster and Corn Dumplings, Spicy Crab Noodle, and the Ni-San cocktail.

One of my go to places when I have family in town, whenever we go to Nashville I have to stop by and get some ! 

The cake batter is always my go too! Very delicious

Beautiful outdoor space and a great menu. Loads of options when it comes to wines & great suggestions as far as pairings! The chefs muse is a must try! My only complaint was awful service - although the manager was great and knowledgeable, the waiter was rude and ruined the experience all together.
Great stuff, great variety, tasty flavors...decent ambience. Well located.
Food was good. No wow factor about it. This place doesn't really set itself apart from Applebee's or Chili's etc.. but like I said, no complaints about the food.

I was in here a few months back, and only found one pair of shoes that worked for me . . . somehow many of my shoes wear out at the same time.

A couple weeks ago, I went back during buy-one/get one half off. This was an epic shoe trek that lasted two hours, and I ended up with four lovely pairs of shoes.

Lots of styles from boots to slippers to running shoes, pumps and flats. And there's a pretty substantial sale rack.

There's a "club," too. Accumulate "points" with your purchases and get discounts. Fine and dandy!

This is a great place to either browse books to buy or just sit and read a book or magazine where it's quiet. They have nice chairs throughout the store to read in and it's well laid out. The coffee shop seems worth trying but I have always been here in the evening and not been in the mood for caffeine!

Not the best looking gym.  A little smaller than what I would like but clean.  I went here one time to attend a Les Mills class of a friend.  The aerobics room not the biggest but they have more than one.

Located not too far from Shore Acres and across from one of the many Publix plazas it is great location if you live in the area.  Offers a variety of machines and has many classes for those like me who prefer group fitness.  The Les Mills classes are some of the best, structured classes I have taken so I would recommend giving those ago.

I gave it four starts because I guess I have seen better looking gyms and the front desk was only so courteous.  Aerobics instructors are great and this would be a good gym to get a great work out on be it cardio or strength!

Good place. Cold beer.  Service started off slow, but when bartenders were caught up they were friendly and talked ... provided personable service and definitely one of the better Twin Peaks I have been to... next time I will see how they do... bareback was excellent as well.

Have been here a couple of times now and have been blown both times. Service has been quick and attentive, and I love that the servers offer suggestions and let you order throughout the meal. 

Every single item I've tried here has been amazing. The crab noodles are my personal favorite with the chicken gyoza coming in at a close second. 

Also, highly suggest one of the cocktails with the Japanese vodka. They are delicious.

I WAITED 8 MINUTES AND WAS NEVER GREETED
and the bar was 2/3 empty (see pic).
Apparently there was an important group in for a wine tasting. Regardless, I should have at least been acknowledged.

I WALKED 2 BLOCKS TO JUAN'S for happy hour
(3-7pm daily).

I did get pics of the most current menu (attached).

Micayla was extremely professional , pleasant, a great server. She made our dining experience very nice. She truly cared about our table . Ask for her!
Paul the manager was great
One of the best sports bars we've been too and always go to one if they have one in the town we are in

Rob and Rachael were absolutely fabulous to work with! We were pretty new at weddings and Rob met with us as many times as we wanted to walk us through the day of itinerary, he was almost like a coordinator day of! His music choice was also amazing! The dance floor was always packed. We had a few hiccups at our wedding but as I was losing my mind, Rob went with the flow and no one knew anything different! I recommend Sierra Pro Events for your next event of you want seamless and flawless work!

Best ice cream that I have ever had! We came on Monday night and got lucky to get a seat by the window. I am sure this place gets crazy busy on weekends. Not very stroller friendly, it is in a tight space.

Went for Bottomless Mimosa/Rosé Brunch, and we were lucky enough to get Christopher as our server. He was so friendly, welcoming, informative, willing and able to answer our questions, and was checking in on us appropriately and unobtrusively. As a local, I like to drag my sister to "Brunch Recon" before I bring out-of-town guests. The space has been beautifully renovated since it's days as Happy's, lots of natural light, comfy bench seating with pillows, lovely courtyard seating option weather permitting. Brunch menu has something for everyone, Bottomless mimosas were on point - they give you the orange juice in a small, separate carafe so you are able to add as little or as much as you'd like. We ordered the fig and goat cheese flatbread, the shrimp and grits, and the gulf fish. Shrimp and grits were excellent - grits were flavorful and not runny like they can be some places. Gulf fish was cooked perfectly and the green beans were in a subtle, tasty sauce. Fig and goat cheese flatbread had - dare I say- TOO  MUCH goat cheese, but was still very tasty. Would order everything again, but will probably try something new next time as there were so many delicious sounding choices. My bottomless glass was never empty, and believe me, I tried!! We never felt rushed, and actually had to ask for the check which was so wonderful in a "bottomless" environment. Highly recommend Copper Vine for bottomless brunch! Thanks again for such an excellent experience, Christopher!

Favorite restaurant in Nashville for date night. I dream about the spicy crab noodles sometimes. The bar is perfect for a drink with friends and the place itself is beautiful. And for dessert get the chocolate cake thing (can't remember what it's called). It's SO TASTY and unique! Keep doing what you're doing because y'all are killing it!

We have eaten a lot of food in our lives, but this meal is right up there with the most amazing food ever to enter my pie hole. Wow. We tried the tuna tartare, broccolini, crab noodles, king salmon and wagyu beef. Every dish was its own culinary adventure. I never imagined beef could be like this, and I'm a Nebraska girl!!  The salmon, too, was melt-in-your-mouth. We may have to stop in again sometime to see what else is awesome.

Pretty good place to order pizza for delivery (i only live 5 min away tho). Pizza came fresh and hot. Cheese was still melted. Plentiful amount of pepperonis. Crust flavorful and fluffy. Altogether delicious and I would order again

I heard that is was supposed to be one of the best ice cream joints in Tennessee. I even read a few articles that this was supposed to have some of the best ice cream in the nation. That's a lot of hype to live up to. But I have very rarely come across ice cream that I haven't, to some degree, cared for. So, obviously, I was going to try this place out.

It's not impressive from the outside, or the inside for that matter. It's pretty small actually. And the employee's are unfriendly. But, I would get tired, real quick, of people asking me for sample after sample and taking their sweet time to order, even when there is a huge line. So, hindsight is 20/20. 

Anyway, there are a ton of flavors to choose from, which I always appreciate from creameries. Especially ones that hand make their own product. I ended up getting the Tennessee Fudge flavor, as did my counter-part. It seemed to be a vanilla base with copious amounts of fudge folded in. The other flavors were traditional favorites, simple staples, nothing really off the wall. That Tennessee Fudge was delicious, though. I would order the hell out of that again.

All in all, Mike's is good. Not outstanding, not the best I have ever had, not one of the top in the nation, but delicious nontheless. What you'll find here is just a good creamery who makes good homemade ice cream.

Dolsot bibimbap, served up with everything mixed already.

So easy, sizzling, and delicious

I'll admit, I'm not typically pleased with Italian restaurants; they can so often be overwrought with banal romantic attempts and utterly dull food. I'm happy to say my experience at Ricardo's did not fit that mold.

The menu offers several traditional Italian choices and prices are fair; about $20 will get you an entree that includes a salad and side of pasta or vegetables. The dishes were executed fairly well though I have seen better. The veal parmigiano was tasty but perhaps a bit one-note, and the tender meat was not as melt-in-your-mouth as it could've been. The shrimp scampi were all cooked perfectly in a lovely, well-balanced butter sauce. However, the side of pasta was on the salty side. Unfortunately, the tiramisu was the most disappointing part of the meal - not enough rum and too thick a cream took away from the lightness of the dessert.

But, while Ricardo's may lack slightly in their food, it certainly makes up in atmosphere - a solid 5 stars. The tables are spaced out enough to allow privacy and the dining area is relatively small, which creates just the perfect amount of ambient noise. Service was also excellent; our waiter was polite, timely, and welcoming. All of this made for a clean, classy environment (or dare I say...romantic?!).

So even though I may not have been truly excited by the food, I did feel at ease throughout the meal, and sometimes that's exactly what I want when I go out. Dining at a place like Ricardo's just makes you feel good.

I love this place. I live in Tampa, but I definitely drive out to Pinellas Park with pleasure to see Kim. My nails look amazing. They stay forever, and Kim worked with to find a top coat that wouldn't come off from all of the hand sanitizer I have to use at work. She doea a wonderful job on my SNS. I convinced a friend of mine who also lives in Tampa to come try them, and now this is her spot too.
Definitely come here even if it's a bit of a hike. If you're getting SNS, ask for Kim or Diamond.
So typically this Sonic is okay, but don't show up 10 minutes before close. Because apparently the "real" closing time is 11:45 on Sundays. #annoyed

Super simple mom & pop spot. Unassuming decor. Friendly greeting. Delicious food. 
Two big thumbs up!

Only getting 4 stars because their hours suck, everytime we check the hours online it says they're open and noone answers the phone. But it's probably the best pizza I've ever eaten. The bacon chicken ranch and buffalo chicken is amazing

I had high expectations for Bier since they are such large distributors but their tap room disappointed me. There wasn't much seating so I had to stand to drink since it was busy. I wasn't a fan of their beer selections at that time and haven't been back.

Ordered a birthday cake here for the first time based on the reviews. I ordered a few days in advance, a chocolate cake with vanilla frosting that said happy birthday mom. They only did 8 in chocolate cakes which is fine. When I went to pick up, I was disappointed to see they had put some chocolate frosting on the top of the vanilla. I paid $23, my mom would still like it but it's not my order 100%. The lady at the counter didn't seem to speak English and I didn't want to argue. The lady I spoke with over the phone spoke perfect English and we confirmed at least 4 times my order back and forth. I think just be careful when placing an order here. There must have been a miscommunication or it wasn't written down right as the paper that came with the cake just said chocolate cake. The cake was delicious, the price was fair and the cake was beautiful so that's why I give it 4 stars. I may just order all vanilla next time.

Such a great place to stumble upon! One of the best cheese/charcuterie boards I've had! Especially if you like pickles green beans and okra. We also had a great server named Justin, luckily he understood our humor so it was a great experience for all of us. If you're easy going and enjoy a good time ask for him!

Not impressed. To start, the group of hostesses at the front were far too busy socializing with each other to bother to acknowledge us. When we were on our way to be seated, we noticed that the restaurant smelled strongly of sewage throughout, luckily we were seated in the back where it wasn't AS FOUL, but still there nonetheless. Frankly, I lost most of my appetite already because of that stench. The hostess sat us down and seemingly forgot about us, as a server didn't come around to get our drink orders for another 20 minutes. They weren't even busy. The server was not friendly and wasn't familiar with the drink or food menus, she didn't want to answer questions that my father had about the menu. Our food came out quickly but was not good. In a party of 6, half of us did not get what we ordered, and the food we received was all either way overcooked, or undercooked. My husband felt that his chicken wings tasted off, and has been sick to his stomach for the last two hours. None of us had been here before tonight and it's really unlikely that we'll be back. Pretty dissatisfied with this place, which was surprising because of all the hype we've heard. I don't get what all the hype was about for unpleasant service, wrong orders, sewage smell, not to mention that everything was so sticky from our table to our silverware and glasses.

I took my Tibetan Terrier in to repair a bad grooming at another place of business. They were able to fix his bad haircut and he came home happy and looking & smelling great. We will be taking him back for future grooming needs.

Caviar, as we call it, is a regular destination among my coworkers, but I can only give it three stars due to the lack of consistency and the sky-high prices. 

Like others have said, Caviar has an excellent ambiance. I love the design sense of the space and would happily hang out here with a coffee (if the coffee were any good. Spoiler alert: it's not). Unfortunately, the quality and quantity of the food is just not high enough for the prices charged. The desserts have been very hit or miss--the flourless chocolate dessert I had once was dreadful--and the sandwiches range anywhere from "delicious and perfectly grilled" to "tragic and falling apart."

I'll continue going here for the convenience, but I wouldn't necessarily recommend coming from farther than a few blocks away to eat here.

I live a block away and have always wanted a good bar to move into this space. Unfortunately, for one reason or another, they never work out and I won't be surprised if Bar One follows suit. 

The drink menu does not have prices. That should have been the biggest indicator. We ordered Kenzingers and Philly Pale Ales and the prices were absolutely ridiculous. Almost $7 for a single Kenzinger is unheard of, even in the most pretentious Center City bars, and this is South Philly. A shot of Jim Beam- $8. 

I'd rather walk a few blocks and go to literally any other bar then give this place my business again. 

Two stars go towards the half-way decent music and I can't deny that the food smelled pretty good. Can't imagine how overpriced that must be, though...

This place really epitomized the California rustic vibes...wooden tables with open air space and great lighting made for a cozy but sophisticated feel. The food was excellent. My friend and split the green eggs and ham sandwich and ricotta toast for dessert for which I would highly recommend! At this place the carbs are worth it but that being said the green breakfast bowl looked delish too.

Tried to add a phone to the family plan.  The new phone was broken.  The worst part is the store said that I had to wait two weeks and use the broken phone before I could get a new one. Totally unacceptable yet this is how terrible this store treats its customers. Stay away from this place at all costs. This is not how a phone store should operate.

I wish I would've planned better with this place. I was walking around looking for places to visit in Nashville when... ICE CREAM! That's a must, right? I check Yelp, 4.5 stars, let's go. 

There are 2 very distinct reasons on why this place isn't receiving a 4 or 5-star rating. The size of the shop and how sweet the ice cream is. 

This ice cream shop is tiny which is surprising. This shop is right in downtown. Lots of foot traffic. Tourists galore. Luckily on a Friday evening it wasn't too packed when we arrived. We didn't have to wait in line at all. It is Autumn though. On a hot day I can't imagine how packed this place gets. It's almost like they expect you to order your treat and leave. They do have a couple of tables, but it's not an inviting location. In particular... during my visit there was this creepy guy sitting close by that kept staring at me while I ate my cone. Stop it dude! Just stop.

I ended up ordering the Superhero flavor. It's 3 different flavors(red, whitish yellow, and blue). I believe it's cherry, maybe banana/vanilla, and blueberry ice cream. I normally wouldn't order some bizarre flavor like that, but this time it sounded perfect! My ice cream was good, but it was too sweet. I only ordered 1 scoop in a cone. I was so full that I wasn't able to eat the cone. It seems too sweet might be a recurring theme for this ice cream shop. The great thing about this ice cream is that it's extra thick. 

The other oddity is that I was hoping for an ice cream/coffee shop perfect combination store as the name(Mike's Ice Cream & Coffee Bar) suggests. Coffee definitely takes a back seat to the ice cream here. They have plenty of hot coffee drinks, but you know that feeling when you walk into a coffee shop. That yummy mmmhmm feeling with your brain yearning for coffee... you don't get that here. You feel more like a kid in a candy shop but ordering ice cream instead.

Next time I'm in Nashville I'll stop in here to try another flavor. Truth be told... I might be spoiled by local Louisville favorite, Comfy Cow!
Wine was very good , margarita flatbed needed salt and instead of basil they substituted micro-greens ... really bland .....olives good, service was ok
Completely remodeled! Whole new building! So happy to have our local Publix RE-OPENED!!!

We had a really great experience here. First, the whole vibe and decor of the place is just so cool and really thought through. If we hadn't had a table I would've been totally fine with sitting at the bar even. They also had a really slick little lounge area too. The food was delicious and different, even the sides were fun to try. Can't wait to go back!

I transferred to Chase more than a decade ago when a smaller bank botched a rather significant fraud charge. 

Today, I had another experience with Chase customer service that reminds me why I still bank with Chase and will continue to.

I wish I could just keep this place on the down-low, but since I also want the couple who own the restaurant to get the support they deserve. Having moved to a few blocks away from this spot, I finally got to visit the place more frequently.

I always came here for the "bulgogi bibimbap", "japchae" and "yukgaejang", all of which are of amazing homemade quality and come out of the kitchen quite fast. Every time we finish our meal, the owner always asked if everything was okay, with utmost modesty, making us feel like we were actually having dinner at our grandparents'.

That being said, if you want to eat something homey, a quiet place run by kind people, this is your spot.
Had delicious pancakes. Nice place.  Friendly staff. Interesting menu. Was convenient to our hotel.
Delicious as expected! Recommend the Tennessee fudge, line was long out the door but it moved quickly.

Having a great lunch a Twin Peaks today! 
Trying the new Green Chili Chicken soup and a Burger. Great atmosphere at the bar. Samantha and Jessica  take care of your every need. I have become a regular!

It looks better than what you get. We were disappointed by it. The music was loud and we couldn't really talk because of it. Food is served on paper plates and my coffee was forgettable. Shame. We were really hoping it would wow us, instead it was like whoa .
Delicious! So many yummy flavors and tons to choose from! Great place to still people watch! This was a perfect place to stop for a treat.

Since I'm a Westbanker, I tried this place out.  It's the old Copeland's building on Lapalco.  The waitress we had was very nice and attentive.  There were employees watching over the tables almost too much....The food was way overpriced!  My husband and I have no problem paying for quality meals, but $18 for a hamburger steak that lacked seasoning?  $21 for Coconut shrimp that looked and tasted frozen.  We will not return.  It was so bad, I didn't even take any pictures.

If I could give this place 10 stars, I would!!  I LOVE THIS ICE CREAM SHOP!!!

They have so many great flavors of ice cream, and delicious concoctions as well.  Two nights in a row, I ordered the s'mores sundae (yes, you read that correctly) with Tennesee fudge ice cream!  It was so delicious!  It was crushed graham crackers on the bottom, ice cream, whipped cream, chocolate, chocolate sauce, and candy topping.  Seriously amazing!

Over the course of the four days we were there, I got ice cream here five times.  Yes, it was that serious!!

I highly recommend anything having to do with this place.  SO good.  You won't be disappointed!
A wonderful little hidden spot. Surrounded in ivy you walk into a beautiful display of food and smart craftsmanship. Check it out.

Okay so the food at Copper Vine is pretty amazing and so is the atmosphere , because of these two factors , I rated a 3 star. The Customer Service here was not the best and that was a huge let down . My waiter was decent for the most part and I made sure to leave him a nice tip but we definitely felt rushed after about an hour . 

I understand that they want to get other people seated and make more money but it is my right as a customer to take my time and enjoy my dinning experience. ( Especially since I made reservations) Maybe I just caught them on a bad day but management definitely needs to speak to the waiters and hostess about being kind , pleasant and patient with the customers- after all , we are how you stay in business . ( We purchased bottomless mimosas and after the third glass , the bus boy tried to come take our glasses . I had to tell him we were not finished ) 

This is the south folks, be friendly, smile at your guest and make them feel welcomed , not rushed. Other than that , I would have to say I enjoyed my brunch at Copper Vine .
Creamy high quality ice cream in the heart of downtown. They have tables to sit and eat it too.  No complaints!

Good, not great.  Service a bit slow, bread served in one large hunk so everyone at the table has to put their hands all over it to cut it.  Salad mainly romaine ribs, not leaves and too big for bite size. Now I remember why I haven't been there in years.

This is a very beautiful spot! It's always busy and crowded there. Their sushi is good and their cocktails are excellent.
My friend and I shared a scallop appetizer. I don't think the fishiness of the scallop was masked very well but it was still good. Their omakase was okay.. it wasn't the real omakase experience I was expecting but the sushi choices were not bad.
Docking one star for the omakase and scallop app
Great authentic Korean food! This place deserves more business. The homemade ginger cinnamon tea is great as well (just not sweet)! Cheap too.

I loved Mike's ice cream! It was soooo good. Their workers were super friendly and even offered me ice water because it was so hot! It really hit the spot on a hot Tennessee day when my friends and I were wondering about Broadway. I got a scoop of the huckleberry with cornbread on a waffle cone and it was amazing! I ate it so quickly and the entire thing cost me maybe $5 which is not bad! The consistency of the ice cream was awesome, dense and creamy, the flavors were all there without being overpowering. It's a traditional ice cream shop vibe with some traditional flavors but they do have their signature flavors that you should definitely try! I'd recommend this place if you're looking for ice cream in Nashville, forsure. Loved this place and would definitely pick this over Jeni's ANY DAY. Mike has no froof, no fluff, just damn good ice cream.

Went here today on account to wanting to try a new place downtown and possibly some italian. Lets start by saying I just love Lafayette Square. I love the atmosphere. We were seated in kind of a corner with a good view of the vacuum and extra chairs but I tried not to pay attention. 

As previous 'yelpers' have mentioned, the service was a little slow but nothing I couldn't handle (see Lewelyn's review). Our drinks were never empty it just took some time for our waiter to take drink orders and food orders etc... but then again I think he was the only waiter on shift tonight. 

From other reviews and the raves about the lasagna, I decided to go with that. It literally was a mound-ful of cheesy goodness (thanks for the good review Emily B.). There was just enough sauce and meat to make it delicious. We also ordered the toasted ravioli. The sauce was amazing. Nice consistency and delicious flavor in the ravioli. The fiance for the seafood cannelloni. He says 'it was awesome'. He said you can def. tell there were good portions of lobster, shrimp, and scallops. It was fried but not over fried to where it has that complete grease flavor. The mushrooms were cooked to perfection and the sauce was a white wine lemon sauce---perfect for dipping bread. 
The house dressing had the perfect blend of sweetness as well.
The overall decor in the restaurant was lacking a bit but the lighting was still enough to set a romantic mood (when you don't look at the vacuum). There does need to be updated decor and maybe some paint touch ups on the wall. Overall a good experience and very easy on the wallet. With 2 pasta dinners, and appetizer, soda, and salad we only spent $35 (before tip).

We were in town for a baseball tournament.
Most of the team decended in for dinner so our teenage boys could appreciate a meal "with a view".
The servers were attentive and gave the boys some fun.
Food was good for the large chain they are.
Mostly fried foods, very few vegetable options.
Bison is on the menu which is at the very least, a healthier option.
Personally I left with a fun case of food related heartburn but our group had fun.
If you're in the area, with a group or looking for a dinner with "peaks", it's worth trying once.
The service was decent here for lunch and the food is just alright.  I probably would only come back if I was super hungry and nothing else was close by.

I walked by this bodyshop and saw the owner, Chris, hitting a damaged vehicle with what looked like a tool covered with a rag and then taking pictures of the damage. My guess is he is committing some type of insurance fraud! I wouldn't trust this guy at all! Before this incident took place, my cousin and I got into an accident and we took her car here and while we were picking up her vehicle we overheard him say to his employees " I think it'll pass, they won't notice." So we go out to look at the car closer and find the paint peeling on our newly replaced bumber  The owner said he will fix it at no charge but we were still out of a car for another 3 days and just the fact that he said" They won't notice" tells a lot about the person that he is. DO NOT COME HERE!!

They may have good bread but the sandwiches need work. I ordered the Cuban and had to bring it back because it was cold. She said they only heat it upon request???  I love Cubanos this was not it, it was just a ham sandwich. The sandwiches are pre-made and put in the refrigerator rendering the fresh bread not so soft and fresh anymore.

I normally like to go to this place, but yesterday was horrible. The waitress had zero personality to start with. There were four of us there to drink, eat and watch the football games. We spent quite a lot of money and were there for a couple hours when a manager told us that we were buying too many drinks and there was a family sitting next to us. We had a driver who had 0 beers or alcoholic drinks, and we were not being disrespectful or rude to anyone. I look over at the family and they weren't paying a bit of attention to us. It didn't look like they were bothered at all.

 Then we were accused of turning off tv's and the manager tried to stare us down. I'm sure he got his courage from the policeman who was working the door. Needless to say, we weren't intimidated. It was pretty busy there and I was assuming that the point was to let people watch some games, have a good time, and they make money in the process. I won't be going back there anytime soon.

I never do reviews but this hair has me upset (Drake voice)! Very disappointed with this hair. I tried it because all of the photos and hair look great on the website and Instagram. However This hair is just a waste of money and I got the "mink line" so I was expecting it to be flawless. I also emailed the company and they never replied. Also my hair stylist commented on it while she was putting it in saying "are you sure this is diamond virgin mink hair it seems like Ali express". The ends are horrible from the beginning, I was pissed. And couldn't wait because I needed my hair done ASAP. These pics are post install 5 days.
Best steak in the area. Also the service is excellent. It never disappoints. I would definitely recommend.

Delivery: Order was 45 minutes late and there was an item missing. Would have been somewhat manageable but the terrible customer service compounded the entire disaster. There are so many other sushi places in Philly; we will not be making the mistake of ordering from here ever again.

Pretty unprofessional when the workers are sitting down when you walk in. Female Staff sitting hunched over on a bench with her back exposed singing the songs and making fun of her workers. Is she high or drunk? Because she sure is acting like it. With the lack of customer service I'm doubtful that I'm going back.

Even though it's a store for men, I find myself in there all the time buying t-shirts for myself. I love going here to find stuff for my brothers and my dad. The owner and everybody else who works here are super friendly and chill.
Great ice cream, good waffle cones.  Loved the old-fashioned ice cream parlor feeling.  Place could be a little more clean but we enjoyed ourselves.

Came here with my dad & step mom on a Saturday afternnon,  nice amount of people inside. They have a playground for children, I'm sure folks have a few quams with that but I didn't think much of it. They have a good beer list offering pilsners, stouts, ciders etc. Me and my dad both got a beer flight - you can choose any four with the exception of one beer because it came in a can. Each beer me and my dad chose were good. My favourite was the stout. The food was just okay. Ordered the smokehouse pizza and the crafty fries. The pizza had a good taste however it was really greasy (I had to put my tide pen to work). The fries were okay. Maybe if the grease from the pizza didn't overpower the taste of the fries, I would have nicer things to say about them. Other than that, this establishment is cool to grab a drink at, meet up with your friends, and just chill out. Check it out!

Good chain gone bad!
We'll never eat here again!
Poor service and bad food

Pointless to expound beyond what has been said so eloquently and with passion by others..

REALLY PHENOMENAL BEER !

This reward card stinks.  Not worth your time and do not spend money with them.  When you finally spend enough money to earn a night it is at a really shitty hotel.  One that's under their 5  point system so nowhere you would want to go. What a disappointment.

This bakery is a gem! It has the most delish pineapple buns!! The service was excellent as well! We enjoyed buns with Vietnamese coffee! They were very kid friendly as well! I highly recommend this bakery!

The restaurant was well decorated and had a unique feel to it. The waiter was informative and quick and the food was good. The only thing that I can say was that the quality of ingredients were great but a little underwhelming in terms of the sushi that was served to us. I think I set my expectations a little too high for the price I saw in the menu (as I've had "better" tasting sushi at cheaper prices). Overall the experience and food was good and i would recommend this place for a fun date.

They provide no service nor protection to their card holders. Avoid any card that is serviced by these rotten business people. We were robbed of over $200 because they could not stand up for us. We have cut up any card serviced by Chase.
A great quite, dive. Typical south Philly at its finest. Food was on point and drinks were delicious too

Great sandwiches at an even better price!

I went here to get a sandwich since I've been reading reviews on this place for a while now and never made it till recently.  I decided to go with the 12" Italian since that seems to be what everyone recommends and it was spectacular! all the flavors blended really well in this sandwich and nothing overpowered the other but I would say the best part of the sandwich was the bread. 

The place is also a bakery so the bread was freshly made there and it was awesome!  you can't beat a sandwich on fresh bread you just can't.  

The place is authentic Italian wish pastas and pastries as well,  I'll most likely go here to buy pasta and see how it compairs to store bought brands.  

Everyone working there was really nice as well and I was in and out pretty quickly but not rushed in any way.

I have had a credit card dispute pending since 9/10. A dispute that I thought had been resolved. The credit was issued. THEN I get a letter in DECEMBER asking for more data. The letter was dated 12/9, but not received until the 17th. It wants me to verify that the merchandise was returned and it wants me to contact the vendor, AGAIN.

While I know that credit disputes take time, it seems that Chase went way overboard in the amount of time it gave Metro PCS to respond to the dispute. 

To add insult to injury, I contacted Metro PCS. They promised to call back and of course, did not. I mailed off a copy of a receipt that said 'DELIVERY INSURED" with the form Chase sent. I called Chase to let them know that I had tried to call the vendor and I had mailed more documentation to them. And what do they do? Some a-hole was so anxious to get that file off their desk, that they CLOSED the file BEFORE the date specified in their own letter! The next day I got another letter saying the matter was closed and that I would be re-billed. WHAT?

I called the rep who sent me the new letter. By the time I was finished talking to her, I felt as though I was being interrogated as a criminal. She disputed everything that I said, including the USPS receipt that I sent to them saying "DELIVERY INSURED!" In fact, I became so frustrated talking to her that I could feel myself wanting to cry. And I am not a cry baby. She offered no recourse. She would not even tell me where she was sending the file. She made it sound like that was just gonna be that. OH YEAH? So this is the purpose of this review. I want people to be forewarned about how some reps behave in the credit dispute services dept. You know, the department that is supposed to be helping defend you against being taken advantage of by a sleazy company like Metro (Ghettro) PCS. Instead of help, all I got were justifications as to why they could not "make the vendor pay." Excuse me? I could not believe what I was hearing.

I've never had a disputed charge encounter become adversarial with a company that is supposed to be servicing ME before.

Protect yourself, people. Save every shred of paper. Document every name. Cuz you will need it to defend yourself. Don't accept anything less than what is right. Know your rights. Send follow up letters when you talk to people. It's the only way. People lie on the phone to get rid of you. If you don't get satisfaction, tell them you will contact the FTC, your congressman, alert the media and report the issue in social network forums.  

For the record, I rarely dispute any charges. But this taught me a lesson. The fact that credit card companies offer a dispute system is NO guarantee that any purchase issue will be resolved to your satisfaction. So caveat emptor. Buyer beware. I will never again rely upon any credit card company to be my advocate in a purchase transaction. EVER. I will not "shop with confidence" any more, no matter what any credit card company advertiser says. 

I feel so strongly about consumer advocacy that I will offer anyone who contacts me templates of some of the letters that I have written to resolve disputes that have worked in the past. There are no guarantees, but usually written letters get results. Do not rely upon phone calls. Document everything you do and say, ad nauseam.

I will post updates to this situation as they occur. For reference about the dispute, see http://www.yelp.com/user_details_review_search?userid=OfddPlzVNLSwlOTaeBGZKA&q=Metro+PCS or find the Metro PCS review in the L.A. area.

With tall ceilings, long wide windows, and green velvet furniture, The Green Pheasant is a good looking place. On a cool and rainy winter night it felt kind of drafty and chilly. But we were excited to check out this new place. 
The menu is simple and split up into two sections: cold and hot. Since it was so chilly we only got one thing from the cold menu: the Tsukemono. I think of Tsukemono as pickled vegetables and was expecting such, but instead got a mixed greens salad with some chunks of raw fish in it. The chunks of raw fish were quite good, and though it seemed like scraps from other raw fish plates, we enjoyed it. I love scraps and not wasting!
We then moved onto our hot plates. When we asked our waitress about the order and timing she promised all of our dishes would not arrive at the same time and she was right. They all arrived at the same time except for the one larger dish we had ordered. Eh, a few kinks to a new restaurant.  I understand. 
The dishes:
Dan Dan shishito. I love Dan dan Mian the spicy Sichuan noodle dish and I like shishito peppers so we got this. It was a competition on the plate: the shishito vs the dan dan. There is not room in the bowl for two such strong flavors! Neither won. 
We then got the kinoko: warm mushrooms with finely grated cheese on top. A salty warm cheesy dish which felt good on a drafty evening. A small bowl for $13 or so but who's counting?
The star of the night was the stuffed chicken wings: the tebasaki gyoza. The bone removed from the meaty half of the wing and a shrimp toast mixture stuffed in, it was warm, savory and my favorite. Three wings on a plate if you were wondering how many to order for a table. 
Finally we got the trout: a good idea of a whole trout lightly fried with cold slaw and three little steamed bread pieces to make your own little baozi
of fish and slaw. Fish was a little overdone and slaw was a little mayo-naisey for our taste. I think we would have preferred a sharper crisper more vinegar heavy slaw. 
Overall, I think it has potential, but needs to work on some execution and pricing. I mean $22 for a bowl for potato udon? Oy!

Of all the Williamstown bars, Sharky's has the youngest most rock orientated crowd.  That's what really makes the place special.  Otherwise, its a decent neighborhood bar - not quite the dive others describe it as, though you'l never mistake it for an elitist establishment.  

The bar is spread between two floors.  Downstairs has a corner bar vibe, upstairs more of a sports bar.  The bar also has a deck upstairs.   Like the other bars in the area, Sharky's opted to put "good looking girl" ahead of "fast and attentive" in their qualifications for bar tender, though the service isn't bad.  Unlike House of Brews, Taylors, and Geets, the bar tenders are more milfy hot than out of your league tart hot.   Ordinary beer prices are what you would expect for a bar of this kind. The beer specials tend to be on nasty Coors.  They frequently have booze brand reps giving away trinkets.  

 But in the end, its the crowd and the music choice is what makes the place.  Bob and Doug's is ghetto.  Geets is more middle age and kind of lame.  House of brews is older and more stuffy.  Taylors is d-bag central.  But Sharky's is a house full of rocker kids.  Since that's my style (even if I'm a little old for it), that makes Sharky's the place for me.

Stopped here one afternoon to try some yummy ice cream. They have a great selection of flavors...I got the nutter butter flavor and it was delicious! The line was long so it took a while to get through, but the ice cream definitely hit the spot. I'd come back for sure!

This is one of the worst banks, I ever had a misfortune of dealing with. They sent me a pre-approval notice for one of their credit cards and invited me to apply. I was stupid enough to do that. Then, they rejected my application and left me with a hard inquiery on my credit score report. Perhaps it was mh fault to take the bait, because this is not the first time Chase does something like that to me. Last time, they denied me a checking account because of my national origion (I am a green card holder and legally allowed to have an account in the US). Even if I have a billion dollars, I won't do business with this xenophobic bank. I mean if they want to do ICE's job, why don't they just buy one of those private prison businesses and get it over with?

Should been 4 stars but they are pretentious snobs. I forget that I don't fit the trendy profile so I get lower service than the white folk here. Take a look thru the glass cuz all I see are Mexicans baking your bread but not one is eating here. 
I ordered the egg salad sandwich on sourdough. It was fresh and gooey. The capers and pickled onions add a salty sour surprise that may be too much. A tomato maybe could help? But it was already falling apart.
I did enjoy my food in the car with plenty of napkins. I would have ordered some bread but like I said, snobby staff. I will just wait in the alley and get some from the workers.

I had a bite and I'm adding another star for the sandwich because it was good, but can't get past the snobbery.

This bar is an awesome addition to the neighborhood! I came here for the grand opening and I wasn't disappointed. They passed out free delicious food to everyone and the beer selection was awesome (especially if you're a local beer lover like myself). Everyone seemed to be having a fun time and the live music was a great addition. I can definitely see myself coming back here in the future.

I went to eat lunch at this restaurant two days ago. Knowing  that i forgot my sun glasses after we ate. Then I called and ask if they found my sunglasses they said they don't find any and they cleaned up after we done eating. I have it with me I know for sure because after eating I am planning to go to Meadow Wood  for the maintenance of my sunglasses then My Bf came so we decided to go home instead. Then I remember my sunglasses that I have and it's not in my purse so I called up the restaurant and ask if they find any sunglasses on the bench seat they said they didn't find any  - They are sure that they clean the table and that place where we sat and never find any sunglasses I know I have it with me I never gone anywhere else before and after we ate so somebody had taken my sunglasses and never bring it to the lost and found. It sucks because I don't feel comfortable and and knowing that if you left Something in that place it's all gone. Are you going to tell me that it's all my faultBecause it's my responsibility but sometimes things happens and somebody will take advantage of it.You guys suck
Great night out! Fun watching the game while eating some awesome nachos! Callie was the best server!

I absolutely love the atmosphere of this cafe/bar. You can tell a lot of thought went into their design. I also appreciate their covid protocol. Their panini sandwiches are delicious and their fries are literally the yummiest fries I've probably ever had!! This is a great place to come and do work and grab lunch/breakfast/coffee with a friend. This has definitely become one of my go-to spots!!

Shrimp portofino. If you come to MacGrill, order this and only this. 

Otherwise, you may find yourself disappointed. Notice I didn't say that you WILL find yourself disappointed, it's not sure thing. Which is why, for now, I can only give MG 3 stars. I've given this restaurant more chances than I really should have. And consistency is really the only factor that is just not quite where i'd like it to be. 

Some days the meal is delicious. Some days my entree was somehow never placed with the rest of my table's order. Some days my meal is a disaster. 

As far as chain restaurants go, I'd still pick MG over almost anything else. 

And really, for a server to have to learn how to spell his/her name upside down and in crayon at every table without screwing up? That deserves some props. Not ever server at every restaurant has THAT as a prerequisite. ("heh, well, so uh, actually my name is Antoinette. But f*ck you if you think i'm going to write that on your table cloth. You may call me A. Can I get you all something to drink?"

Shrimp portofino. End.

I enjoy this place because of the size and super cold beer, but the service is the worst. The food is hit or miss depending on the night, as well as the waitresses attitudes. 

If you are a sports fan that likes super cold beer, and don't really mind if the food is great, then this is the place for you.
Amazing tour! Janine our tour guide was wonderful! Highly intelligent, informative and fun! Best tour in NOLA! BOOK YOUR TOUR WITH HER!
First time here and didnt know what to expect. Our server was Ty. She was awesome and made our stay exceptional. I will be back to this place when ever i get a chance.
Compassionate and competent.  The bet vet around.  I have had pets for over 40 years, and for the first time, none of my crew minds their trips to the vet.  That speaks volumes.

Tony's has a new location and we wanted to try it.  Meet friends there Tuesday afternoon around 4:30, got seated right away.  Our server Meka was prompt in getting our drinks orders. There is a new menu and I really like it.  Not too wordy and overloaded.  They kept many of the favorite entrees.  I had the shrimp scampi,  had about 10 nice sized shrimp on a bed of linguini.  It eased delicious,  linguini cooked just right and shrimp tender.  Had a salad and steak fries as my side.  Salad wad loaded with dressing.  Hubby had the 12 oz pepperloin with baked potato and salad.  He said the steak was good.  We'll be back.

James Dant, what a breath of fresh air. Indy needs more stores like this for men and women.

Quality products from around the world - Great Britain, Japan... And even Indiana!

I bought a Peregrine sweater for my husband from here for Christmas. He wears it all the time (I win!). The owner helped me pick the right size, which was very helpful. 

If you love coffee, they have their own small batch. My father-in-law gave us some and it was the bomb.com. It's made somewhere in Indiana. Coffee snobs can geek-out over the fancy coffee mills for sale too.

I will return to support this small business! Well managed, curated and styled!

For a rather large banking institution, your website is HORRIBLE. I am ready to pull all my money out of this bank and take it to a bank that values their customers. Hire some IT programmers that can improve your website. Every time I log into your site it is down and not working properly.
Best ice cream of my life! Got a warm brownie sundae with three scoops of their ice cream...soooooo good!!

Their bread is great. Their ribeye and peppercorn filet mignon are both terrible. Service is average. Ambience is great - has a 1920's kind of feel.

Overall, your better off eating elsewhere for the money.

Meh. Valet parking is $12. Not a big deal, but nearly every quality dining establishment has free valet these days. The space is definitely beautiful. The food was pretty okay-nothing special. I found it a bit annoying that they refuse to serve any beef dish at any temperature other than medium rare. I'm a medium rare girl myself, but this temperature isn't everyone's cup of tea, and I see no reason why there is zero flexibility on this one. Anyway, the experience was fine, but with all the top-notch competition in town, I don't really see the need to return.

The pretzels are simply the BEST pretzel you will ever have! I could eat these all day! Grab  a few to go on your way to drink wine and/or beer. For breakfast, I recommend the biscuits with their homemade jam. This place is just so worth the stop. So glad they opened up in the neighborhood! THANK you!!!

Tried this for a mid week dinner with the family. Place was dead but service was very slow, bread was very stale. Bathrooms were disgusting, as were the floors and tables. This place was dirty and all furniture could use a good wipe down. Our waiter sucked. We waited nearly 20 minutes for our salad, entrees came much later and 1 was cold...neyver again.

The ice cream is delicious and the staff had great recommendations. My husband got the Tennessee fudge and I got the mint chip. They were both amazing! You can tell they're homemade. We each got one scoop and the portions were huge! I had a hard time finishing mine! We paid just under $9 for both, so a really great value for a really great treat!

Give me the spedini---and I won't be a meanie!

Chicken spedini is the entree of choice for me at this cozy, casual, somewhat rustic spot in a cute neighborhood.  I've had it three times and will likely order it again next time.  The chicken is plentiful---enough for me, several bites for my DH and a few bites to spare.  DH always orders the veal parmesan and has been satisfied each time.  The price of the entree is fair and includes a side (we always get the pasta) and a crispy salad with a lovely italian dressing.  I've had the marinara and the white sauce---I'd suggest you go marinara.

 The meal moves slowly here---don't drop in for a quick bite before the show.  There's always a petit mal service seizure between being seated and putting in the drink order, putting in the drink order and getting the drink, getting the drink and sending it back because the wine had turned, getting the new glass of wine...you get the picture.  But, the staff is hustling, so it's hard to hold it against them.  Maybe the owners could hire a runner....

DH and I have a 22 year old tug of war regarding restaurants---I like to try new places and he likes to return to the tried and true.  Ricardo's makes it easy for me to make him happy.  Grazie!

I have been wondering when people would realize that we all want our kids to play while we eat/drink! Other than a McDonald's... 

Craft hall is a MUST for families with young kids! If you ever wished you could go out like you used to, if you ever yearned for feeling cool again... finally! You can have it all!

They were SO accommodating to the large group we had. I love that it is just bar service- you want water? Go get it! Ketchup? It's over there! YES! This is what people with kids want. Let us do it ourself so we don't have to wait for anyone! 

My kids loved every single detail about this place (1,3). They played for 3.5 hours, which is exactly 2.5 hours than we have ever managed to be anywhere else!!! 

Thank you craft hall -we will be back!!!!

Great place to stay if you are planning a visit to Longwood Garden. It's less than a mile away.  The hotel provides a free hot breakfast every day, which is quite good.  

They have a pool and fitness center . The fitness center is very small with only a few machines.  I feel for a hotel of this size, it should have more equipment.  The staff is friendly and they have coffee in the lobby 24/7.  Also fruited water, which ran out late in the day. 

It is reasonable priced and a great option for staying close to Longwood.

This place would be five stars if it was for the fruit flies at our booth. I am pretty sure a fruit fly problem comes from miss managed liquor bottles at the bar. At least, that is what I have learned from Bar Rescue.

Besides that....The food was awesome. I love wings, and their wings were top notch. I got my wings breaded like I would at Hooters, and their breading is nice and crisp. Their sauces are good although not as many to choose from as Buffalo Wing Wings. In always better than Wings, Etc. I liked their wings above all wings because of the breading. You can get them without breading too.

They have two beers that are made for them. One they claimed was like a Blue Moon, but Blue Moon is better. The other is a brown ale. Both were good. They advertise 29 degree cold beer. I had to be that temperature, because it was slightly slushy at the top. I would rather the beer just be in the high 30's. No need to have ice in me beer.

They have TVs at all the booths from what I could tell. It was really neat to watch a college football game at my table. The restaurant sound system was turned to play that game over the speaker system. On a side note, not all the tables were turned to the same channel. Not sure if you can get it changed for your table or not. 

The ambiance of the place looks like the inside of a log cabin. It has a Ron Swanson vibe from Parks and Recreation. Long tables have axes dividing them. Some chairs are made of of branches. Tables are made of slabs of wood. The walls are decorated with pin up girl calendars and beer related materials. The ladies looked very pretty in their outfits.

I would come here again. Hope they fixed their fruit fly problem. I informed corporate about it hoping it gets fixed.

The beer was cold and good. I had the wings which tasted like grocery store ones. My husband and son had burgers which they said were good. My son said there was way too much mayo on his but other than that. The service I was really not impressed with. We sat with dirty dishes at our table the entire time. Twice she would come over and take maybe two glasses but not come back for rest. There was a shift change and the other waitress same thing. Both were sweet but could of cleared our table as we sat there finishing up our beers.

Food is not bad...but the staff just sucks! 
I was actually told one time by the hostess not to come in at 5pm because that's when they do a shift change and everything gets lost in translation with the wait and cook staff
Good luck future diners!

Fallon is a great bartender. I really appreciated her knowledge and expertise on the beer list. 
The brunch menu is pretty great, albeit a bit on the expensive side. $17 for chix and waffles is a bit extra. However, I will say it is probably the best chix and waffles I've ever had. Also, the the poutine with eggs was also bomb.com. 
The space is fantastic! The games are fun!

I hadn't been inside a B&N for years until I received a gift card for my birthday. I have to admit, I was shocked at the cost of books -- the one I wanted was only available in hardcover and it was $28. Without the gift card, there's no way that I would have purchased it!

Service was fine -- I was left alone which is how I like it. :-) Nice selection, of course, and they had a huge display of Nooks and accessories upfront, but I'm a Kindle girl ...
