Another thing that makes Tony's pizza stand out from others, is his sauce. As stated by James M. it has a little "sweet" twang to it. When it is combined with all the toppings on my Special Deluxe it made things pop. That sweet sauce covered in meats, onions, green pepper and black olives was a true heavenly delight.  If a picture paints a thousand words, the one I posted of my pizza is worth thousand calories. 

Our server was a blast, she knew it was a holiday celebration (gift exchanging made it obvious) and she made sure we were well taken care of.  I wish Tony's was closer to my home instead of my work so I could become a true regular.

Even when I didnt got the chance to use their service yet, because of the miscommunication that the receptionist made on my cancelled appointment, Shay the owner just called me and apologize for the mistakes that made by the receptionist, he did try his best to help me and even offered a big discount to make it up. He even told me the way to save more money, he's been very respectful and helpful.

Myself and 3 friends stopped in after spending the day looking at tux's for one of their weddings. Not many people and a good place for beer... usually... this experience was awful, took us about 15 minutes to get seated, 20 minutes to get our first round of beers, 40 minutes for the appetizers, another 30 minutes before the waitress even came by to ask us if we wanted a main course. We finally ordered, got the food, ate, and after the waitress came by and said she'd be right back we waited 25 minutes before asking the manager if we could finally get our tickets. By far the absolute worst experience at a restaurant we've had. Wouldn't recommend this location to a friend.

If you are expecting to talk to the bar tenders then good luck. It's just your typical bar with expensive drinks! Don't waste your time if you want a conversation with anyone working, even if they aren't busy it really isn't worth it. You can get a better conversation with your loca
l liquor store attendant. Worked in the bar serving area for years and all this place is and it's a trap. Don't waste your time or money. Thought I'd give it 3 tries before I posted, but it's the same every time. Just ok service and expensive drinks. Kinda sad because I've had much better service and conversations at other twin peaks restaurants. Too bad about this one.

I was hoping Nashville had a good ice cream place and I came across Mike's while walking downtown.  The staff were friendly,  and the ice cream was delicious.  The Pistachio and Salted Caramel were flavorful and fresh. And the scoops were placed in a delicious waffle cone, that helped up pretty well. I would say this was a delicious discovery.

Loved everything about this place. Perfect for the whole family. They have socks to purchase if needed and good and a parent lounge. They could add a little bit more sprucing up to the parent lounge in my opinion but it's ok for now. Maybe some wine or beer?? It's a little pricey for what it is to be honest but it's a lot of fun. I like that they have other activities besides just trampolines. They have a rock climbing wall, monkey bars, basketball, and some other cool things.
Second best only to Jeni's. Excellent homemade ice cream and modest pricing. Worth the cost to park!

This is one of the most tasteful, well-curated stores for men you'll ever visit. 

From the selection of boots and denim to every functional trinket imaginable to exclusive collaborations, you'll leave with deep sense of appreciation every single time. 

The best part about the store? The staff. They're extremely informative without being condescending and they're never pushy. They help find what works for you.

Give them a look!

Vegetarian Spicy tofu stew was delicious.  Kimchee as well.  I ate everything.  The cooks were so thoughtful, and it is very much like eating in someone's kitchen.  Realized there is likely fish sauce in the stew and also anchovy in the kimchi but I let it go.

Terrible service!  Dumb... Really dumb girls running around acting like servers!  Food is ok if you get to order it.  Our server LaShay was too busy hanging around at the front door by the fireplace laughing and chatting with other dumb girls!

We heard about Tuna Bar when watching the news one night. They do sushi making classes, we definitely have to check it out! We took the train down and walked a few blocks to reach the restaurant. We arrived before our reservation but were seated right away. We had a window view which made it great for people watching, but it definitely would be better in warmer weather because the windows seem like they could turn the restaurant into an open-air concept.
What we ordered: 

Chicken and shrimp dumplings: Long chives, ginger, crispy chicken skin, steamed. Just your average dumpling. Nothing too unique about it, but they were tasty nonetheless.

Wagyu Beef Spring rolls: onion, ginger, cabbage, scallions, and mustard sauce. The mustard sauce was a star of this dish.  I could honestly drink it. It went really well with the spring rolls but made the dumplings much better. We honestly wanted to order like 6 more servings of these. SO GOOD.

Eel Avocado Roll A perfect balance of eel to avocado. It had a teriyaki-ish sauce on top.

Spicy Tuna Roll  Just your normal spicy tuna roll, but it's my go-to. I definitely didn't need to eat any more sushi at this point in the meal, but I love trying them wherever I go. 

Dragon Roll: crab, avocado, cucumber, topped with fried eel and avocados. 

Dynamite White Tuna Roll: spicy walu, crunch, and shishitos.

They weren't kidding about the spice of this roll. The spice was at a good level between the spicy sauce and shishitos and the tuna seemed to balance it all out. Would definitely order this again.

 KJ Roll: seared scallops, Kani, cucumber, avocado, and wasabi aioli

Also delicious. Just the right about of heat and had a great amount of seafood in the roll

Rolls that weren't our favorite: 

Broad Street Roll: spicy salmon, avocado, crunch, soy paper, topped with king salmon and spicy salmon. No rice. 

This was the roll that our server recommended. although it was good, it was probably my least favorite roll that we ordered. I'm not sure if I ever had a roll without rice, but it felt like it was missing something texturally. If you like salmon, you should order it, but it was just meh to me.

Overall, we liked the Tuna Bar. The food and service were good, but the atmosphere was a bit loud for our liking. I think I saw that they have happy hour deals, but I know we definitely missed it by going on a Saturday night. I think the prices were reasonable for an upscale sushi joint. The drinks were a bit pricy, so we just had a drink (a Sapporo for him and Prosecco for me).

I appreciated the atmosphere of this restaurant, and visiting from out of town, I was happy to see an asian food option. 

The bartender really saved me from rating this restaurant one star down, here's why:

I ordered a Chirashi bowl, and when I asked for wasabi, I was upcharged $5 for wasabi that wasn't even good - the wasabi was tasteless. Consider being upcharged for wasabi with your sushi - that's like getting charged for ketchup with your fries, or getting charged for butter with your toast. Just doesn't make sense. I also had to wait an extra amount of time to get the wasabi and soy sauce. Since I didn't know about this charge while ordering, I passed the $ threshold in my bill where I now have to go submit an expense report. What an annoyance! The rice was on the stiffer side, and the fish was cut into small cubes, which is not ideal. 

The bartender apologized for having to upcharge me, and his kindness made up for it. Otherwise I would've left the restaurant sort of pissed.

Overall though, I appreciated the restaurant's vibe and the staff's courtesy. The cucumber appetizer I had was delicious.

Warm atmosphere, Creative menu, and Delish!  Blueberry lemon scone, Green eggs and ham sandwich, Fried Mortadella and egg sandwich, Almond milk latte and a coffee. It was all excellent and the service was similar.  Kind and knowledgeable people that make you feel appreciated and welcome. The world would be better place if all businesses adopted this approach. Merci Helena Ave Bakery!

I really wanted to love this place! It's charming as heck and owned locally, but I couldn't find anything to enjoy that was free from animal products and if I wanted sustainable and cruelty-free plant milk in my coffee, would have had to pay a hefty penalty fee. Sadly we left empty handed. Helena Avenue, please consider dropping your penalty fee to those of us trying to be compassionate and create some plant based menu items as other cafes and restaurants around town are doing. It's good for business as well for the planet.

Rude waitress food was not good don't come here the waitress said she was anti military cause I wore a marine sweatshirt and the waitress said I won't take pics cause of the USMC sweatshirt and said I don't support the military marines don't support this place

I am not happy with these guys. They nickel and dime you to death. Since getting a 0% credit card with them I have sent in payments far in excess of the minimum due every month. Nevertheless, they have found ways to charge me fees on two occasions over the last year. This time my payment was due on a Sunday - and "Oh Gee," they didn't process my payment until the very next day on Monday and BOOM $27 late fee! Really? Just plain wrong. The whole scam is to reel you in with 0% interest and then find every little way to add unreasonable fees. Find a different source for credit!

One of the most comfortable, clean and conveniently located hotels in the Wilmington, DE area. This is our second stay here and we are very pleased with the both.
Thanks to all the staff for such a great maintenance (everything looks like brand new), cleanliness, great free breakfast, and the nicest attitude of the front desk. 
But the most appreciation goes to the people who are responsible for the interior design of the rooms. Everything we needed was in the places we needed it to be. Great layout of the furniture and all other features. 
Will plan to be back in the future and recommend highly to everyone.

All around SO GREAT. Came here with three others and sat in the outdoor patio for a late dinner. The whole space is beautifully decorated and the food was delicious -- we ordered multiple dishes to share and even our one vegetarian found plenty to eat on the menu. Also, the wine-on-tap concept is super cool, especially because they're able to reuse the bottles (once they're emptied and sanitized ofc). BEST PART had to have been our server. Dom is hilarious and amazing, he gave us plenty of recommendations from the menu and places to go around the city. He was also very attentive in general and especially to our dietary restrictions without needing any reminder!!! Also there was another server who was incredibly knowledgeable about the menu and vegetarian establishments throughout the city and just all around so friendly, just can't remember his name unfortunately. Without a doubt will be returning next time we're in NOLA!

First time here and it's amazing. The open market style is fantastic. Different stations for different items. Jerry at the sandwich counter was great. He explained how everything work, even pointed out different features of the place. Food is great and fresh.
If you're in Nashville during the summer this is as good as it gets.  Great value, local flavors, so tough to beat.

What's good after some atomic hot chicken when you've been in town for a total of an hour!?

ICE CREAM!!!

Specifically, Mike's Ice Cream! 

We enjoyed our sweet and cooling dessert while we watched a musician outside try to give away free hugs while he smoked like a chimney and played the guitar. The poor guy didn't do too well but at least he tried. Hang in there, dude! Don't give up!

I'm in Nashville for a few days. After a few days of not being home, there is no fridge to grab a little snack. The guys I'm with are into going to all these different clubs. I had to put the breaks on the party when I saw Mike's Ice Cream.

Walking in, it's not giving off an ice cream vibe. It's a dark space and in the back is where the ice cream and coffee (?) is happening. 

A few years back, I was in a Chicago suburb and I found an ice cream shop that used a local dairy to make their ice cream. I was looking for something similar for Mikes Ice Cream. Their website has an apartment rental?? Ok, so Mike is a little quirky. Does he make good ice cream?

Walking up, I see "Blackberry Cornbread". Sold! One scoop cone please.
I grab my ice cream and sit up front. Wow! Mike, you did good. The ice cream is creamy, and the blackberry is dreamy. The corn bread is nice but it didn't allow the ice cream to stay together. A big hunk of ice cream fell (I caught it in my hand) at a piece of corn bread. 

I appreciate the fact that Mr. Mike made an interesting flavor. Total fan of Mike's Ice Cream, if your in town and want to cool off then come to Mike's Ice Cream. They're also serving coffee!

I would have given this place a 3, because the food was just okay, the best breakfast item we had was the egg sandwich. What tipped this review to a 4 was the blueberry scone and iced coffee I had that was perfect to get a hot summer day started.

Huge disappointing downgrade with the new owners. Formerly had wonderful gourmet salads with ingredients like poached pear and crispy prosciutto, sold champagne and little delicacies. Now they have a Southwest salad the likes I which I can get at McDonalds. I am so tired of Nashville restaurants starting well and then downgrading to what they think is more marketable to the Nashville pallet then going out of business. Now it's basically Panera quality with less built in efficiencies. 

If you like Panera and want an alternative come here. I'd give it 3 stars under that standard and am downgrading it due to my disappointment.

I have never had such delicious ice cream in my life. All natural with herbs chocolate cookie enhancements. The mint chocolate chip was the best I have ever had. The baklava had bits of sweetened philo, and the lavender enhanced cream brûlée had crunchy caramel throughout.
Loved this spot for a quiet and delicious breakfast on the little outdoor tables! The green eggs and ham and bacon egg and cheddar biscuit sandwiches are perfection.

Loved Tuna Bar! Upon entering I was so impressed with the modern, trendy space and impeccable attention to detail every where I turned. So many decor pieces and architectural aspects I love here! They had me at wrap around banquet seating in a pop of turquoise. I had a feeling I was in for a good meal from the interior design alone. I was...

First visit was for a casual, lighter lunch with my daughters and an old girlfriend which it was just perfect for! We did make ressies on Open Table which wasn't necessary for a mid week lunch, but I would suggested for dinner. 

While we stuck to some basics, they were pretty great! California, California with real crab made crispy, cucumber roll, peanut avocado (the kids' favorite!), seaweed salad, edamame, and incredible Brussels! Must order! Everything was super fresh and came out in a timely fashion. 

Service was fantastic! 
Prices were fair. 

I can't wait for my next visit perhaps for date night when I can taste some of those delicious sounding cocktails and dig into some entrees. 

I love having Tuna Bar as a new option in the Old City area just a bit away from the hustle and bustle, whether that be for lunch, happy hour (which sounded really great!), or dinner...with the kiddos, or without. It will be be on my radar for the next First Friday or after a movie at The Ritz!

I actually found it a tad difficult to spot from the street. It's the door just to the left of United Blue. Not a huge sign. It's there, trust me :) 

*Limited kiosk meter parking.

First and foremost our food was great and Thanks to Madison service was as well, but i felt so sorry for her that the manager felt our party of almost 25 people didn't deserve 2 waiters. Now we have been to Twin Peaks probably a hundred times since its opened and even with a party of 10 we have had 2 waiters. I even pulled the manager Mike to the side to ask could he make an executive decision to give her some help to ensure twin peaks service stays up to standards since i suggested the place for the party dinner. He looked at me and said no, I was shocked and also embarrassed at the same time for Twin Peaks to employ someone like that and I've always spoke highly of Twin Peaks. So thank you Madison for all you did for us all, and im sorry you under appreciated.

this is some ggggrrrrreeeeaaaattttt ice cream.  i love ice cream and like it when its good - but this is upper echelon stuff.

when i go back, i'll be at mike's...awww yeahhhh...

personal magic nashville 300 continues...

I ate at the Impasto truck at the Viso Sunshop grand opening party and was impress-to by their food! 

The Itali-bano was a great take on a cuban, but with enough touches to make it unique(prosciutto cotto, deli pickles, and mustard aioli), though it was a tough decision to go with that over their many other offerings. Portion size was good as well, mine stretched into two meals along with the truffle fries which were crispy and golden, perfect amount of crunch.

I would highly recommend stopping by if you ever see them out and about or need a lunch option for an event!

Holly shit, red velvet ice cream?????   Where has this flavor been hiding?  And it was real red velvet--not just chocolate with red dye.  The yellow cake batter was heaven sent as well.  Went here everyday while in Nashville.  Yum!

You know how you feel when you eat too much dairy and didn't pack any Lactaid? That didn't deter me from trying a double scoop at Mike's.  The Raspberry Chip was good and the Moose Tracks was amazing!  I will get a double scoop next time I visit Nashville....of Tennessee Fudge and Moose Tracks. I didn't even get a gurgly stomach from it. Yay! Highly recommended!

Convenient location, but overcrowded most of the time. Coffee is always fresh and snacks seem well stocked.

Sometimes feels understaffed, especially at checkout. Lines can take a while when there's only 1 cashier open.

With chain restaurants, I write short reviews because basically they meet apparent corporate standards or they don't.

This breastaurant met all my expectations of a higher end chain. Been there three times. Friendly, cute servers and excellent food.

HORRIBLE SERVICE!!!! Never coming back. Walk in, no host, waiting for a few mins for anyone to even acknowledge us. It is not busy AT ALL. As we were about to leave someone finally came to seat us. Ok fine. Got bread quick but our server never came back. We were SO thirsty. A few other groups who sat AFTER us got their drink & food orders. We just walked out.

Stopped by for HH before the Sixers game and I must say they have great HH deals. Certain appetizers are half off and their house wines are $4 a glass. The bar wasn't that busy as most people trickled in as the game began, but its a good space for friends to hang out and watch the game. 

The stuffed long hots were the favorite. They are spicy and stuffed to the max with perfectly cooked sausage. 

The flatbread on the other hand was meh. Its not on your usual flatbread. What i thought was going to be a naan or pita like texture was more like a cracker. It's so thin and the toppings are piled high which made the "cracker" soft and soggy. The taste of the veggies needed salt too. 

Last thing we ordered was the beet salad. Slices of tomato, beets, and mozzarella cheese with a balsamic vinegar drizzle. I didn't think i'd he a huge beet fan, but these were good. 

If you get a chance to stop by for HH definitely hit up their drink specials and get the stuffed long hots!

I will say the food and drink above average but the atmosphere and setting are very nice and romantic.   Not bad for a romantic dinner and gathering but not so sure if they have the best Japanese or Asian foods there

I was very surprised to find great quality ice cream
shop in such a busy touristy area but Mike's Ice Cream definitely delivers. The flavors are not very gourmet and trendy like the current fad but they have a wide variety of delicious flavors such as Chocolate Bread Pudding and Cake Batter. I settled on Loaded Butterscotch in a cup, it was really delicious and different from my normal selection, sizeable chunks of chocolate and cookies and a buttery salty ribbon of butterscotch swirled throughout. The staff is friendly and helpful and their is a good amount of seating inside.

Live in the neighborhood and it's much better than the bar prior. The staff is always attentive and nice. Food is pretty good, more bar style appetizers than real meals but nonetheless appetizing. They also make a great Moscow mule.

Not bad. The Farmhouse Club was a good sandwich, but not what you'd be expecting of a typical club sandwich.  This is a fried chicken sandwich with avocado, bacon, onion, and tomato, not arranged on layers of toast.  Disappointing were the house chips.  Although advertised as "seasoned", these were considerably more bland than Kettle Chips, but thicker. 

They have a pretty good selection of beers and spirits, but my second glass of water was slow to come.

This place is not worth a drive, but if your child is playing hockey or ice skating, or if you're a guest of the Hampton or Holiday Inn they are a fairly satisfying stop.

In 2017, I completed their Balance Liquidation Program. My husband and I experienced financial hardship and I was late on some payments. When I first enrolled in their program several years ago, my phone representative advised me that any negative items on my credit report would be modified to show as current. My credit card APR was exuberant and it was difficult to meet the minimum payment. Needless to say, their rep lied to me and although I have escalated this issue to CFPB, they will not adhere to their verbal agreement although I successfully finished their program. Each of their executive banking reps has back peddled and none are accepting responsibility for their rep lying to me. This situation happened with another creditor and they immediately assisted me and made things right. My husband and I have been Chase banking customers for over 10 years, and my request is justified. 

Do not apply for any of their credit cards. They are notorious for lying to their customers and if you file a complaint with the BBB or any other entity, they reply just to save face. One of their specialists left a vm message that they had reached a resolution regarding my BBB review; it was a lie. I received a letter from their office that they will not provide any resolution to my formal complaint. I will continue to share my experience onward with all of our friends and family so they are not subjected to the negligence and "miscommunication" that I have personally experienced.
Homemade ice cream! Blackberry Cornbread ice cream is soooo good! The line was long but it was worth the wait.

Terrible service, this place is just trash.
Probably 10 mistakes, mistake after mistake.
Took too long and made mistakes with the soup and salad. Like shit. Some Mother's Day dinner, no wonder why there is no one here. Probably at cheese cake.. 

Where is the manager when you need him?
Haha soup was delayed and salad looked like some McDonald salad. 

Some unlimited soup when there isn't any.. akward

Not happy.


Food is okay 


The best server was the African American lady and a lady with glasses. Knew service was lacking and tried to fix it
Loved it truly tasted like homemade and the prices were great. The ice cream parlor is on 2nd street across from george jones.

This is some of the best ice cream I ever had.  14% butter fat, homemade, waffle cones made fresh right in front of you.

I originally thought I wanted cookie dough, but was instantly swayed away when sampling other flavors.

If you must try any flavor, it must be Tennessee Fudge.

Great place to take the kids, but when its busy, good luck in finding a seat. 

Espresso was average, but a good top up while the kids ate their own ice creams.  

Three kids scoops in cups, double espresso and tylenol were $12.50.

One of my favoriteeee places in Santa Barbara. It is definitely a hidden gem south of State street in the Funk Zone but I love the architecture and love that it is also a wine bar inside! The patio is great on warm days. I ordered a mocha and the cuban sandwich on my last trip here and both were delicious. The mocha was huge, which I love and they both came out quickly. You do have to get your own water/utensils/napkins which can be a little annoying, but they are located right next to the front door. It would be fun to sit inside and watch them bake on one of my future trips and I have yet to try the wine bar. They have a great selection of food, drinks and the pastries look delicious and are huge! That is also on my list for next time. 

Parking is a pain, so just know on busier days it might be harder to get there.

When I'm home I always come for an Italian sub, some mushrooms, and a couple cannolis. I've been coming here since I was a little girl and it's still my favorite for that good local Italian deli. The main reason that I love Cessarina's is because after all these years she and her husband can always be found in the shop serving food with a smile. Her freshly made bread is the best and I've tried several of their subs and they're all amazing. The anti pastas are fresh and the meatballs are gigantic. Her cookies and desserts are to die for which makes sense because they're now being sold at other local restaurants like Havana Harry's! It's also worth mentioning that she sells tons of awesome Italian imports including pasta beer and wine !

Meh. Nothing really to write home about. Drinks, in my opinion, were trying too hard. I had the double cheeseburger and a side salad (which literally were comparable to any fast food establishment). My bf had the puffy tacos. Decent bar food, good atmosphere. One shining star is the homemade tater tots!

This is a review for the cafe portion of CB (haven't tried the food yet). When you walk in, you're greeted by high ceilings and a very spacious area with plenty of seating. Lots of natural lighting and big tables which are great for hanging out or studying. There's plenty of outdoor seating too (with umbrellas). The only downside is the lack of outlets, but there is free wifi and CB is open pretty late for a cafe so it's a good place to study. I'd choose CB over SB any day... 

I ordered an "Illuminated Mind," an organic green tea. The matcha flavors are strong, which I like. The drinks are fairly priced in my opinion. I paid $3 flat for the smaller size (silver) and it was pretty good quality tea. Next time I will definitely try one of the pastries or one of many assortment of snacks/chips.

Bier has great beer,  We made a point to go on Wednesday so we could play some bingo. We arrived at 6:15 had a couple beers while waiting for the bingo to start at 6:30. We hung around until 7:15 but no bingo, we left. I'm relieved our friends decided not to come with us. Not a big deal but don't advertise it if your not going to follow through.
It makes me so very happy when I can find a breakfast spot with homemade bread, cashew butter and banana. Great spot!!!

Twin peaks is a wonderful place!  I always enjoy their food and craft beer selection.   Of course, the beautiful ladies are also a nice addition to the experience!    Allie was a wonderful bartender and kept me and my friends entertained with jokes and conversation.    The atmosphere at twin peaks is wonderful and inviting to the customer.   If I did not travel for work every other week, I would be at twin peaks on a regular basis.   Great restaurant with great food!

This place is not bad at all, considering one goes here out of pure necessity. My first visit someone greeted me right away and helped me get what I needed. The second visit I thought I knew what I needed from where, but the staff was still very attentive and came to help me right away without asking. No complaints, although I wish it was cheaper and had more choices for small girls.

I recently went to Philly because I wanted a good cheesesteak.  Tony Luke's was alright but  I think Wawa was a lot better value for the money.  We don't have Wawa in NY so I really wanted to see if the hoagies were as good as I read about.  This particular Wawa in the UPenn area was pretty nondescript.  Inside it looked like a bigger and better version of 7-11.  

I ended up getting an Italian hero because it seemed pretty basic and a good baseline for the Wawa experience.  I got it with a little bit of oil and vinegar.  It was the 10 inch version and the total came out to $7.01.  I was blown away by the price because I don't think you can find a full Italian hero in NY for less than like $10 minimum.  Of course you can't compare Wawa to a genuine Italian hero but still.  

I took the hoagie to a nearby Panera Bread and ate it there.  The hoagie wasn't the biggest sub ever, but it was decently sized.  I believe they put ham and salami in there along with lettuce, onions, and provolone.  

The experience of eating this thing was pretty interesting.  Because there is nothing really special about the hoagie and it's far from the best sandwich ever.  However, it was just so solid for the price.  There was nothing spectacular about the hoagie, but also nothing glaringly offensive about it either.  All in all, it was a really enjoyable eat.  The bread was fairly chewy.  The cold cuts were pretty tasty.  The provolone went well with the cold cuts.  The hoagie was just so easy to continue biting into.  After I finished it I had a bigass smile on my face.  

I was so happy with my Wawa hoagie that I stopped off at another Wawa on my way home and got a 6 inch Meatball hoagie ($4.89 total).  That was also pretty solid too.  I also got a medium coffee ($1.65) and 2 kit kats for $2.  I'm definitely a huge fan of Wawa now.

Every time I walk into Mike's I feel like I am in that movie Pleasantville where everything turns black and white and is fantastically 50s. The ice cream, true to the setting, is great and though I'm not a big ice cream float person (now that I'm all grown up) it's the only place I have had one in the last decade. Something about the place just makes you want to see an ice cream scoop float in some soda. If you can grab a window seat, do it, because there is no better place to people watch!
This was our first time at Tuna Bar and we were very impressed. The food was amazing and came out super quick. The cocktails were creative and delicious. Can't wait to go back!

I would have given Top Shelf 10 stars if I could. 

I am a regular at this establishment and decided to order catering for my office for the first time. Not only was the process so simple, but the food was incredible. We got the house wings (which I think are the best), house chips, cuban (OMG) but the real shining star was the pasta salad which was the best I have ever had. It was so full of flavor in every bite I just had to have seconds. Portions were great for price and the food was incredible. If you have not eaten here, RUN! Certainly best food in the area. WOW!

Went here for a Saturday night out to catch some sports and listen to some live music (which was going on from 5-8). 
The place was pretty crowded in the bar area, not so much on the table/restaurant side. 
Our Waitress Jess was very nice and helpful. It seems as though many people there knew each other which indicates there is a local element to the place which is fine, they obviously have a base clientele. 
We started with a few appetizers, the cheese steak egg rolls were good however one of them was a little overdone. They had good flavor with a little spicy kick. The other appetizer was a fried seafood sampler with Calamari, Shrimp and Clams Casino. This was very good and cooked to perfection with a nice portion. 
We decided to split a meal since we were pretty full from the appetizers. We went with the Chicken Marsala and again the portion size was generous. The Marsala sauce was tasty as were the green beans and mashed potatoes that came with the dish. No big complaints about the food. 
The noise level in the place is pretty high, probably because the place is wide open. This noise was apparent even when the live musician was playing. There was a DJ that started at 9 and he did a great job of mixing up the music genres. The crowd really picked up around 10 and the age group of the crowd was pretty diverse but leaned toward the 20/30's group. 
Overall this seems like a fun place to hang out or have dinner. The noise level is high so if you're looking for quiet/intimate then this isn't you're place. 
I will add that since it is winter we found the restaurant seating area to be pretty cold. There are 2 exit/entry doors on that side of the building and every time the door opened the cold air rushed in and there was no protection from it. The heat didn't appear to on very high so the cold drafts made it tough. We actually moved tables once to avoid the cold from the door opening. 
Overall the experience was great and we would definitely consider going here again.

Stopped in with the wife and kids for Sunday brunch. And wow!! Cool spot for the kids to play, great brunch menu. Wife had mimosas while I drank the local lager!! 
Chicken & waffles, biscuit & scrapple, and crafty breakfast all delicious and so fresh! Will definitely be back.

Mike's is bomb.com - there's just no getting around it.  I'm from the West side of the Mississippi and I have no idea how Nashvillians eat Jenni's Ice Cream... blegh! Mike's is that Midwest, hometown, ice cream shop feeling. Their staff is always friendly, happy to provide samples, and getting people rung up and out the door. Just wait in line like everyone else and get you a double scoop, because, YOLO. And while you're yolo-ing, opt for a waffle cone - they have the perfect batter mix - enough to hold ice cream but not too heavy and never stale. If only one could order ahead at Mike's and just go pick up - maybe someday!
Went to an event there last night. The venue is awesome with some great views. The food was delicious. The staff was very helpful and everyone had a smile on their face.

This is a restaurant in the Westin Hotel. And I would agree with anyone who would prefer to venture out into the Quarter to seek out food and booze. My wife and I used the restaurant twice on this New Orleans vacation. No need to go into the reason and we were happy.

The food is good and the service was even better. Bonita, Dedra, and Bernard made sure we were served properly and our glasses remained full. Whether that was with water or the good stuff. 

The food is on the high side but the portions are large. If you just don't wish to go out and need something to eat that will satisfy you River 127 is acceptable.

If you're looking for high quality sushi at a reasonable price, this is the place! I am a sushi snob having lived in NYC and Singapore for years, and this is the only place I've been to in Philly that remotely compares aside from Morimoto and Tomo. Their tuna is very fresh and high quality, the salmon and yellowtail are always very good and fresh too. They do a spicy tuna roll 'the right way' with little mayo and big pieces of sushi, as opposed to the mushy, orange paste-y consistency of most spicy tuna rolls I've had in Philly. The lobster fried rice is also very good with a fresh flavor but a little light on the lobster. I haven't tried anything else as of yet.

What sets this place apart is their happy hour and daily specials - you can't beat it anywhere in The City! Salmon avocado, spicy salmon, or spicy tuna toll for $5! You can also choose from chicken and shrimp gyozas and a couple other items for $5. Drinks specials are $5 for the cocktail special and about $4 for beer and wine. Tuesday is Tuna Tuesday where you can get tuna tartare for $7, and Wednesday is hand rolls for $5. 

The service is definitely one of my favorite things about this place. The bartenders are friendly and prompt and super professional. The atmosphere is really cool, a mix of rustic with an Old City feel. They've been open for a year, but I wish I'd found them sooner!

Never signing up with Chase again don't know why I even have their company since they try to screw somebody over every time. I called after they've been calling me 2 days in a row trying to get a dispute filed for a product that I received which was a toy cap gun and some little ammunition for it. I guess that I need to tell them what exactly it is that I ordered not just the information they gave me to fill out on the paper which didn't ask me anything except order numbers and things like that anyways I didn't get back to him after 2 days which I had things going on I got back to him on the second day after they called me that day and they still close the dispute and told me I have to refile for a dispute and explain what it is that I ordered and I ordered this back in April disputed it in June8 since I still didn't receive my product they closed it out before they can get back to me in 2 DAYS!! Mind you they woke me up yesterday told them to call back after 12pm. They called me at 1:45 did not receive a missed call. They called me the next day around the same time did not receive the call because I was in surgery call them back the same day after they called me the second day and told me that I had redispute because they could not get a hold of me within pretty much 2days. If i could give 0 stars i would. Ill be paying off my cards as soon as possible and ill be closing my accounts with them and will never get loans from chase jp morgan ever again. The supervisor was rude. They really want me to jump through hoops to get my 34$$ back fuck them i hope they dont get bailed out the next time their company goes belly up

I love this place and I'm a frequent visitor. The first time I came here, they had a Wasabi Oyster special that they haven't had since. It blew me away and I keep coming back hoping that they will serve it again some day.

Besides that, the atmosphere is wonderful and the food has been consistently tasty. They have two fun oyster drinks as well: Slurp-a-burp which is an Oyster with cocktail sauce and lager or the Oyster shooter which is the same, but with vodka.

The oysters I've gotten there have been high quality and good-tasting. For the squeamish - I've never gotten sick. And on top of that the other dishes have been delightful.

The only problem I've had is that some nights they don't have enough people shucking the oysters which can cause really really slow service. But not to worry, this has only happened once in the several times I've been with family and friends.

Thank goodness for Yelp reviews.  We take the 101 many times from SoCal to the Bay Area and are always looking for a place to stop for breakfast.  This was a perfect choice for us.  The restaurant has both indoor and outdoor seating and the decor looks industrial/funky.  They have some nice breakfast options and we enjoyed our choices.  The only problem was that they took a very long time to deliver our meals and when my eggs arrived they were not hot.  I sent them back and kept an eye on the kitchen.  I had to go up to the cashier to ask if the eggs that were sitting on the counter in the kitchen were mine.  Yes they were and fortunately I saw them in time to enjoy them at the right temperature.  It may have been a bad day for the servers and we will definitely try it again.
DELICIOUS! This is my absolute favorite neighborhood spot. The food never disappoints, and the owners are extremely kind and gracious. I highly highly  recommend!!

Stopped by Craft Hall today and boy was I surprised....This place has had a total overhaul and just opened today! Soft open, but all was in place, great service from the bar tenders, really good beer! And had some fantastic bites from the kitchen...go for the BBQ pork it's awesome.
What i really liked was that place is that it has a great hang out space to hang with friends but that it also a great area set up so that "friends with kids" can also come and hangout. You have gotta check this place out....seriously! Yea and great music too.

We had a reservation made plenty early but waited for 30 minutes past that time to get our table for 4. The chicken parm with pasta was delicious but unfortunately with the late seating we had to run to our appointment and couldn't savor the meal as anticipated. Server worked to get us food in the time we had so that was appreciated.
The service is impeccable & the lady's are Gorgeous... Great job with the training too Morgan is doing great

We had a coupon for buy 1 get 1, so my husband and I ordered of the senior menu.  It was surprisingly a generous portions and tasty. I had the country fried steak and my husband had the omelette. The waitress was attentive. My only complaint was she didn't understand I didn't want lemon with my tea.
Great ice cream. Creamy, smooth, Interesting flavors. Chocolate raspberry truffle? Yes please. Service with a smile, provided samples willingly.

BIG thank you to China Dragon that catered lunch for our teachers and staff! It made our teacher appreciation lunch a huge success. The food was delicious and your service exceptional! We were very happy with our experience.. we'll see you again!

I've been to Bier a few times.  I have always been greeted warmly and the staff is knowledgeable and helpful.  It is nice to sit down and have a pint or get your growlers filled.  I will be back for more bier.

Food is good, but overpriced. Disappointed that they only serve their ramen dishes at lunch, not dinner. For such an expensive place, the fact they refused to split checks was ridiculous and infuriating as we had a party of four and had to spend ten minutes trying to figure out which dish was whose and how much each person owed (the dishes are small so you order multiple ones which adds to the confusion). When the waiter told me they don't split checks, I thought he was joking and I literally said "are you serious??" out loud to the dismay of my poor husband. Service is also poor and they only check on you once or twice. When we went for lunch, the place was empty, yet we had to get up and find our waiter just to get our check and get out of there.
Very good! Great food in a beautiful space. Highly recommend for a date night, happy hour or lunch with friends if you want something yummy and stylish!

This amazing find on south street is worth a try. Small Korean eatery run by a husband and wife, with close to 7 menu items there not too many ways it can go wrong. The hot stone bowls are healthy and delicious. We tried the shrimp pancake and the japchae, also yummy. Portion size is slightly small but it makes up in the taste. Slightly expensive, but it's worth the taste. Do try this place next time you are in the mood for some good Korean bowls.
Great service and coffee. The breakfast sandwich had the fluffiest eggs. Mouth watering and tasty

I can't believe I ordered from them again and once more I regret. 
Will keep it super short this time. 
Ordered two pizzas one plain one white with onions. I've got two pain instead - one with onion. They did get Part of it right!!!
GREASE!!!!!!!!!!!!GREASE!!!!!!!!!!!GREASE!!!!!!!!!!!! AND HELL LOTS OF SALT!!!!!!!! NEVER AGAIN !!!!!!!!! Even if that was the last pizza on planet !

This company tacked on a charge months after my account was closed.  This charge was the same dollar amount of a disputed charge that was approved and removed in Feb 2017.  I closed my account a month later with a zero balance.  They quietly tacked the charge back onto a closed account and never sent bills for it.  However, they began to add late fees.  By the time I learned & called them (Fall 2017) there were 3 late fees too.  Now they're messing with my credit.  I had perfect payments with them and every other bank my entire life- never late.  Now I have a mess on a dead account and they will not get me someone accountable who can fix it.  Good luck to you all.  I could never recommend this company.

Went in on a Sunday evening and it was very quiet. Nice bar with approximately 15 tables for seating. We sat at the bar and the bartenders were super friendly. We ordered spiedini and sausage and pepper spring rolls. Both appetizers arrived hot and both were delicious. 
Next up was the papardelle with short ribs topped with Arugala.  Absolutely outstanding!!  Highly recommend Bar One aka Barone!  Can't wait to try the Brunch menu too.

This place is really good. It isn't your all-you-can eat or $4 roll type sushi spot so be prepared to spend a little more but in my opinion it's totally worth it. Aside from the food below the place is really comfy inside and super swanky. 

My girlfriend had a real California and a shrimp tempura roll, I had a real California and the small Omakase (which comes with a tuna roll as well) and we both had the gyoza to start. Both the gyoza and sushi were the best I've had in Philadelphia for sure. The Omakase nigiri was absolutely phenomenal, every piece was perfectly formed and just delicious. Real sushi chefs behind the counter. Gyoza was flavorful, pan seared just right as well. 

Service was good, albeit a *tiny* bit slow but we were also there an hour before closing on a Friday night when there are tons of people there at the bar and sitting outside -- our waiter was doing the best he could. He was also super friendly and knew everything about what was being served. 

2 drinks and the food above - $105. Very worth it.

Great place for a romantic date.

Was able to get some one-on-one time with my girl. The woman singing opera was amazing. I was really not expecting the dimmed lighting but was very impressed with everything. Outdoor seating would have also been great since they have heaters.

The bread was so good. I really enjoyed the Pasta Milano but saw some other great choices on the menu.

Expensive and not the money.  Smug service and an overpriced breakfast sandwich with only one egg.  Wouldn't recommend, cute space in a nice neighborhood but better options for food considering the price.

Look, I don't leave reviews on Yelp, but my boyfriend is from a korean family and we've been on the hunt for the best korean food in philly for a while now. This place has our hearts. 

Just a married couple with a small menu, but flavors that pack a PUNCH. Some of the most authentic Korean food we've had in Philly and easily the cheapest too! 

Great hospitality, great food. We're regulars.

So delicious!! Everything we ordered was amazing except the calamari (ika karaage), which was unfortunately very bland.

Keep in mind that this is a tapas style restaurant so be mindful that you'll be sharing and ordering small plates. 

Also, they have a cake fee. I think it was $25 to have them store the cake in the back and also cut and serve the cake for you.

I live in W. Philly with no bicycle, which presents a serious problem for my grocery-shopping ways.  Despite being LITERALLY THE BROKEST, I demand fresh veggies and decent-enough meat.

I went into this Pathmark gratefully and with open arms; it's a very convenient 64 ride away.  However!

Everything is weirdly more expensive than it should be?  Examples:

Can of black beans at Target -- 69c
" " -- 89c

Pound of green peppers at Fresh Grocer in UCity (which should be outrageous) -- 99c
" " -- 1.30$

The meats were more expensive, too.

I honestly just can't come back here when I can be saving money more conveniently.

However, customer service was fantastic!  Multiple people dropped everything to try and find me some quinoa.  They were apparently totally out ...

I grew up around the corner from this place and I have to say, the delivery guys knew our address by heart.  

I am not a huge fan of their style of pizza, but its greasy and its good.  Where they deliver (pun intended) is their cheese steaks.  In fact, this last Christmas, I took a road trip to Michigan to visit family who had been from Philly.  Ardmore style went above and beyond packing up steaks seperately for the long road trip.  They survived and the fam was happy for the tasty philly treat.

I think they have platters on their menu that come with fries and a salad...its been awhile since i got that, but I remember the salad being tasty.  You don't exactly go to a pizza place for the salad, so that says a lot.

I think they are open really late on weekends too!  

Ardmore style has a special place is my family's heart...I hope it never closes!

We have been there twice. Once a few weeks ago and again today. Honestly the food is not only amazing but the service is at least seven stars. The first time we went we had Rose who not only made us feel welcome but also so informative about the menu. She led us to to an amazing brunch. Today Ari (spelling) ? Made us amazing drinks and again made us feel so welcome. Our number one brunch spot in the ENTIRE city of New Orleans!!!

I am a crafter and was doing the Manayunk arts festival and this restaurant was right across the street so I decided we would get lunch there. First off I was told they were only serving a limited menu that they had on a chalk board above the counter. So I settled for what was on the menu and ordered and paid. Then while I was sitting there waiting for my order I proceeded to watch the counter guy take orders for things not on the limited menu. I asked him about this he said "sorry man". Then on top of everything they got the order wrong and the food was just okay. If you are thinking of eating here I suggest you step 30-40 feet down the street to mikes. We ate there the second day on someone else's recommendation and even if it looks a little like a hole in the wall the food is great as is the service.
The worst food we have ever had.  Feel sorry for our server, not her fault the food was not edible.  Too bad because we used to live going there. Never again

To call this place a Japanese restaurant may be one of the bigger insults. I am a fan of Two Ten Jack and was excited about trying Green Pheasant. Boy was I let down. When we walked in the music was positively blaring. When we said something to our server he told us that we were not the first, but the fourth person to complain. When they turned it down, it hardly made any difference. I started with the tuna tartare with crispy rice. We thought they brought out the wrong dish because the tuna was unrecognizable, looking like chopped liver on rice. (See photo). They charged for soy sauce and for wasabi which I have never seen before at a Japanese restaurant. They are trying to get rid of the American influences so did not have the American whiskies on the menu. The food was doused in butter and you could hardly taste the Japanese flavors in any of the dishes. My lips were puckered because the food is so over salted. And to seal the deal, we found a hair mixed into the rice of our chirashi. I will not be coming back. At the end of our meal, the a server came out and let us know he saw our review. Rather than apologizing for the poor service and our bad experience, he could not have been more unkind. One of the wait staff walked us out of the restaurant telling us how pathetic we are. To call one pathetic is incredibly rude, especially to customers in the service industry who simply voiced their opinions of a bad experience on yelp.

The waitress was very nice and knowledgeable.  The dishes were very heavy and overly greasy.  We ordered the chicken wings gyoza which was ok but greasy.  The hash browns we drenched in BBQ sauce which was overwhelming.  The fried rice was ok, but again with the sausage.  It was just greasy and heavy.  We really wanted to like it.

I incurred a balance on my card and paid it off last month. However, this month they charged me *again* for interest. After speaking with the customer service representative, it seems they continue charging interest FROM THE BALANCE CLOSING DATE UNTIL PAYMENT IS RECEIVED. I find that practice highly deceptive as there is no way to really prevent further interest payments until the following statement. I don't even know whether the day they credited the payment is the actual day they received the payment. What does that mean? If they sit on the payment for a week before crediting, is that on me? I will NEVER put a balance on a CHASE card again. 

While they have been good resolving disputes in a timely manner, this experience in how their interest system works has been really jarring and overshadowed whatever service they provided in the past.
What's not to like? Authentic Italian food at dirt cheap prices. The canolis are out of this world!

Three of us stopped in and had an amazing dining experience! The hostess, Megan, greeted is joyfully and seated us quickly. The menu was different than I'd ever seen before. Each item we ordered served four people and it was so delicious! The tomatoes, mushrooms, lobster... It was all so yummy. Our waiter Michael explained all the dishes well and made great suggestions! We will definitely be back. We do recommend making a reservation to guarantee a table! You will not be disappointed!

Yummo! Homemade ice cream with homemade waffle cones = night made!! Visited this shop on a Monday night and it was packed... that's always s good sign to me! We waited maybe 15 minutes in line, but this gave us time to decide which flavor we were going to get as there were maybe 15 to choose from! I was torn between red velvet, salted caramel, caramel waffle cone, and birthday cake. I ultimately went with the caramel waffle cone flavor in a waffle cone and was not disappointed. I would have gave this joint a 5/5, however the seating area was cramped And difficult to get around.

This place is good for people that are having a party they give you a cake for good deeds!! The food is overall REALLY DAMN GOOD the pizza cruft is really soft and cool! We really liked it here but it was my first time going here I thought it was like a really bad place but I was wrong! This is amazing the people are really nice and I hope the get some good luck for 2019-2020! You good customer Jorge I'm from the north east side ok bye! Ok

Really really really good. Stopped here on a whim for breakfast and wasn't disappointed. Bustling with good inside and outside seating. Got the toast with peanut/cashew butter, sliced bananas, and rosemary. Husband got the whipped ricotta and honey toast - amazing! Also ordered a loaf of fig and rosemary bread (seriously super dense and beautiful) and it was incredible - so soft inside and freshly made! Do make a visit. Very cool spot.

Amazing on all fronts. 

Guys, park in the self park garage and get it validated for free. Don't pay $12 for valet, silly!

We were seated immediately by a friendly hostess and given warm eucalyptus towels which were SO nice on a cold night. What a nice touch. 

We had the sonomono, shumai, chahan w/american wagyu, and the ora king salmon. Each dish was flavorful and delicious. The sonomono is like ceviche but better. For dessert, we had the tempura chocolate cake - my husbands choice because I usually don't love cake but this was excellent.

The japanese old fashioned was probably one of the best I've ever had. My husband enjoyed his cocktail too - the green chartreuse gave it a complex flavor. 

I'm looking forward to trying more items on the menu next time.

Mr stomel was absolutely great. He kept me informed from beginning to end of my case and always kept in contact with me. When we went to court he got me the best result that he could have gotten for me with my situation. I received my license back and was more than pleased with his services. Simply, the best lawyer I've used in this area point blank.

Sorry but we were very disappointed in this place. We came there off of a Yelp recommendation but found the food to like taste and the portions to be small. I've had better bulgogi and smaller cities. The place is small which we liked and the staff were friendly but the food did not seem fresh and was not desirable we both have to beef bulgogi.

The second Saturday of every month they have a FREE comedy show. It is usually very good and super funny. I would actually pay to see it. Also I think it goes without saying that the beer is the best in Indy or possibly anywhere. Fan forever.

Tasty food, lovely outdoor patio service, great wine selection and Cemille was a wonderful server. My friends enjoyed the Wagyu burger and their side arugula salads which were huge! And I enjoyed a cup of the new French shallot soup and the blackened tuna Niçoise salad. Our bottle of Tempranillo was lovely, and the outdoor patio seating was sweet. Sadly we were too full for dessert!

I came into twin peaks with my friend to have a few beers. We sat at main bar with Kaylee and Sammie. They were very attentive to our needs and answered all our questions. I highly recommend the smoked wings tossed in the spicy Thai sauce.

Note: don't forget your Costco card, $100 value for $79.99.

My wife decided to bring me here for Father's Day. It was a good choice, I really enjoyed it. It is been over 10 years since I've been here. Couldn't really remember why we didn't return, 

The service was great, the manager sat us and was very friendly. For Father's Day, it was not that busy. However the server did tell us that it was really busy earlier, before we arrived, and they are shortstaffed. We saw none of this.

What we ordered:

Drinks
Top shelf margarita, on the rocks, no salt.
Peach sangria
Lemonade for kids

Dinner
Father's Day menu
Steak & potatoes, medium rare, 
Garden salad
Shrimp Portofino
Kids meatballs with spaghetti
Kids chicken with broccoli

Dessert
Decadent Chocolate cake

The garden salad is a $2.50 ad on, however if it is unlimited refills. It arrived and was very tasty, made with bib/butter leaf lettuce. It was missing tomatoes. I asked her for another salad as it is unlimited, but I asked her to add tomatoes. She came back and said it was a very busy day and there was no tomatoes. So she took it off the bill. The dinner also came with a small loaf of bread, that was tasty. It was topped with fresh butter and Parmesan. A little on the salty side.

The steak was cooked perfectly. It was also very tender. Probably one of the best steaks I've had in the restaurant the last few years. The potatoes were baby red potatoes, roasted with a Parmesan cheese. It was powdered cheese, kind a like the Parmesan shaker you get a pizza joint. They had a nice caramelization, tender, yet a little crunch. Can't ask for better. The broccoli that came with it, had a nice rich flavor, but was a little too al dente for me. I think that's just a matter of preference though. 

My wife's shrimp was also cooked perfectly, it came with angel hair pasta and mushrooms. The flavor was a little bland. I think it was a garlic butter, but just not enough flavor for me. But she didn't complain lol. She did like the pinenuts in it and the green leaf vegetable in it.

The kids dishes had good flavor. I think the chicken was about 2 ounces, as well as two small meatballs for the kids meals at six dollars. Lots of pasta in it and marinara sauce. I do feel the kids were a little bit short changed. Not very much protein at all, tons of pasta for six dollars. I was able to share my steak with them so they were happy. 

The decadent chocolate cake was perfect. It was included in the Father's Day menu, and very large. We were able to share it and still not finish it.

We had a Mother's Day dinner of 8. We had reservations but there was no need since there was no one really in there.  2 of us got our food 10 minutes after everyone else. It took another 5 minutes for the last person to get there food.  The manager or the server never even apologized or offer any type of discount. Horrible customer service.

I ended up stopping here twice during my trip. Once for happy hour and another time for brunch. Their happy hour includes a great wine flight and discounted appetizers. I got the Brussels sprouts and olives...amazing! For brunch, we did the bottomless mimosas, filet mignon brochette, chicken sandwich & the burger. We enjoyed our entire meal!

I hadn't had Dominos for at least 15+ years so when I moved to Whitehouse, we gave them a try.  I'm pretty sure that a frozen pizza would have tasted better!  Even a generic store brand one would have been better.  I ask for extra sauce but what I didn't know is that when I ask for extra sauce they must have misunderstood me and thought I said extra grease.  I had to use paper towels to soak up all that grease before I could even make an attempt to taste it & there was barely any sauce on it & what little bit there was, had no flavor.  The cheese tasted like it was not even real; the imitation stuff.  The pepperoni was dry & curled up around the edges where they were laying in all that grease I suppose.  I got through 1/2 a piece and the entire thing went in the trash, my husband couldn't even eat it.  I just couldn't do it.  I won't even get into the price! OMG!  It was around $26 for an XL pepperoni pizza, nothing else on it.  I went to the WH pizza shop on 31 and got one loaded with toppings and it was about the same price and it was delicious!  Dominos is horrible & I will never go back, skip this place, save your $$.

We went in for a wedding gift for a friend and after we purchased the gift they asked if we would like it wrapped. 30 mins later we come back and it looks like a 3 year old got ahold of it. So now we are out buying wrapping paper to re- wrap their terrible job. The sales people spent more time trying to talk us into working there than helping us find gifts. Very condescending and "bless your heart" treatment.

The pint comes with three flavors of out choosing so we got the white chocolate banana pudding, caramel cone, and toasted coconut. The favorite out of the three was the caramel cone where the bits of the crispy cone added texture. But, the other favors were also delicous.

If you can stop by for a tasting, do it. They have over 100 beer recipes, but usually about 12 or so on tap, based on memory. The tasting room is spacious for groups and the wall is adorned with brewing awards. The bartender told me this is the second oldest brewery in Indy next to Sun King.

I can't imagine giving this place anything less than 5 stars.  Sometimes you're downtown for an event and it's 11:00 PM; you don't want to go home yet but you don't want to weave your way into a honky-tonk either.  Don't get me wrong, I'm not too "I'm local" to be above enjoying some honky tonk time; we always end up at Robert's, Rippys etc when we have out of town guests.  But when you don't feel like that scene, or you need a cherry on top of a fun evening, enter Mike's Ice cream.  We've been here no less than a dozen times...from the heat of summer when it's packed with out of towners to a winter evening when you just.want.ice.cream.  The folks that work there are speedy yet fun and friendly at the same time...and you just know they must have to deal with some real jerks in the course of a day.  The ice cream is top notch..it's not Jeni's gourmet, but it's not Baskin Robbins either, it's pretty perfect in fact.    They know how to move people in and out too...you can almost always get a seat if you want one.  That place is a gold mine.

I love board games and puzzles, and River City Games is the place to go for anything table-top related. I've been a customer of River City for quite a few years, and I made a trip last fall to stock up on jigsaw puzzles.  The selection here is one of the best in the city, and honestly the prices were much better than Amazon or other online vendors I checked. The sales staff are very helpful, and were happy to go through their stock with me on the phone before I drove over. Along with puzzles, there are aisles of board games, and a huge section of supplies for pool tables, ping pong tables and other themed decor. I love coming here to browse, and prefer this location over their West Edmonton Mall store (which is also great) - there is more stock and more room to browse without feeling crowded.
Place is so good. Highly recommend. Went with a large group and every loved what they ordered which is rare.

We had a fairly large party of 12 for dinner.  The waiter seemed like he was new or wasn't very good at his job.  We waited about a half hour for the salads and soups to arrive.  After the soup and salads were finished the food was brought to the table....well most of it.  Three people didn't get their food until most of us were done eating.  The food was okay, but most of it was barley warm.  The bill was also a big disaster.  It was like a comedy of errors and the entire time this was going on (2 1/2 hours) the owner/manager didn't come over to the table to apologize or even acknowledge we were there.  I would never return to this restaurant.
Coffee and Pistachio were my favorite! The best part was that you can do 1/2 a scoop of one and half a scoop of another. Their scoops are pretty big for the price!

Ridiculously overpriced for food that borders on terrible. My husband and I both ordered sandwiches (caprese and black and blue) that were completely flavorless and tasted like they were microwaved. I used to come here often under the previous ownership but after this experience we won't be back.

We had so much fun today! We went with several families with little ones from 15 months to 2 years went for the afternoon and had a blast. The playground was crowded with kids (many different ages) so we had to stay close to our daughter as she ran around but in general it went really well. The beers were tasty and we liked the food a lot. The pizza, soft pretzel and wings were great. We'll be back! Love what you did with the space!

Bottom Line:  Very expensive but good food

Like a lot of places in the Funk Zone, this place is kitschy, filled with hipsters from LA and very expensive.

I have to say right off the bat that the food was good - we defiantly enjoyed it.    The thing is, it was so expensive that I'll never be back.  I love riding in new Mercedes but I would never own one as I simply cant justify the cost when I can have something else for 1/4 the price that is essentially the same and its gets me where im going in similar comfort.

We got the Burrata sandwich which was $15.....um, what?  $15 for bread, cheese, bacon - and it was delicious but $15?  Frankly, I resent the normalizing the $15 sandwich.  $10-$12 is already pushing it for some of our local hero sandwich shops and those are almost certainly good for two meals and I'm 6 foot 3.

We also got soup and a pastry.  Our bill with tip came out to more than $30

We also got there almost exactly when they opened and my wife had to fight to keep our seats as I had to go change our daughter diaper.  People - quite rudely actually - kept trying to physically take our seats as they we not occupied by humans but by our things as we were going to come back.  I get the feeling had we all gone to the bathroom at the same time, our things would have just been tossed onto the floor.

Lets not even discuss the parking situation.

Honestly, the LA hipsters can have this place.  It's good but not good enough to justify the cost or the trouble

Great place to grab a bite. Food was great, service was awesome and beer was super cold! Miranda from hogwarts took great care of us. We where super excited to find out they had dart boards and pool tables at this location.  We will be back next year when we come back into town.

We had an amazing experience here.  With covid, and puppies and all that life throws at you, it's nice to get out, drink and forget it all.  Copper vine is that place.  Amazing social distancing and COVID preventative methods, along with an amazing staff (shout out to Jen/Gin/Jin dang it you all know who she is.). She was an amazing host, very attentive and related well to us and even conversed with us, which we loved.

We found this place to be fairly disappointing. Maybe we just ordered the wrong stuff? There were several different breakfast sandwiches on the menu. We were looking for just a quick bit. Simple pastries, donuts etc. The place calls itself a bakery, so I assumed the croissants, pastries, and donuts would be very fresh. This was not the case. I had a ham & cheese croissant, which was ok, but not that fresh, flakey etc. My daughter ordered the "seasonal donut" which was $4.00. It was just an iced cake donut with colored sprinkles. Nothing more than you'd find at a cheap donut place for $1.00 or less. My wife had a blueberry danish. Again, it was OK, but not great. This place says it is a bakery. Am I wrong for assuming the baked goods would be fresh and better than average? If you're going to charge me $4.00 for a donut, it better be the best darn donut I ever ate. Next time we're in town, we'll try somewhere else.

This is my new favorite place for happy hour! Half off all tap wine! By the glass, carafe, or bottle. The atmosphere is wonderful and open. The food is to die for! A MUST order is the mushroom pasta, just wow. Side note, if you're lucky enough to get Chance as a server, makes the experience that much better.

Absolutely not! Walk away from this overpriced, disgusting place! The poor service set the tone for a lack luster lunch service. There are reasons this restaurant was nearly empty. Issues:

-Server brought three dinner rolls for all ten people to share, then dripped balsamic vinegar from the broken container all over the table and menus.
-Kitchen was extremely slow  with over a half hour wait
-Server informed me my meal was not available, just a minute or two before bring the remainder of the meals to the table. One person finished their meal before mine arrived.
-Others noticed their plates of pasta were not hot, just lukewarm
-Spaghetti noodles mixed into a plate of fettuccini
-One of the mussels in my meal was so undercooked the shell had not even opened - SERIOUS HEALTH HAZZARD
-The restroom had a dirty diaper and a religious brochure in the stall; from the horrid smell, it's clear the diaper had been in the bathroom many, many hours. Possibly overnight

There are far too many disappointing facets of this restaurant to consider returning.
Went there for the first time Saturday. Unbelievable!! I even had our waitress give much compliments to the cooks. Food was unbelievable!! Can't wait to go back!

Can't say anything bad about target one of my favorite shopping stores and I love the fact that at any's target you go to your always know what you're looking for Abs the items seem to be placed relatively in the same areas and have to love the end caps its where they have all the clearance stuff!!!
I shop at target whenever possible
In & out of town

Tuna bar is an awesome addition to our city that already has some awesome sushi spots.  I love the ambiance, the decor and the cozy feel.  Its modern and very cool inside.  The food is outstanding, we ordered EVERYTHING and cant wait to go back so we can order more. They have a bar with a nice drink menu that compliments the sushi perfectly.  So glad to have a new neighborhood sushi bar around the corner and wait to come back!!!

Kyo Hin sushi is awesome! The fish is fresh and generous portions. A wide variety of special rolls. The presentation is gorgeous. I always leave satisfied. Just stick to sushi when you come here - that's what they're best at. The rest of the menu is just ok which is why I can't give 5 stars.

Went in with a very large party.  Paid an entry fee for nothing.  Was not seated and was refused refund after sub-5min in the restaurant.  You'd figure a place would care about potential customers.  This particular location does not, which is unfortunate.  Our party rewarded another restaurant that wanted the business of 20+ people.

The food is kinda flavorless and small portioned, unless you order a bucket of seafood. Even then it's not that great of a portion. We actual got served undercooked fish the last time we went, which coincidentally was the last time we will ever go back. Our server was AWESOME though, but the manager definitely wasn't. She tried to blame him for our food being bad.

Went today for the opening and was very pleased!  They advertised a noon opening, hyping it up by passing out flyers downtown last weekend.  They said there would be freebies for the first 250 customers.  I didn't really want to wait in a long line for a clothing store that I could find on weekend trips to LA, but when I was downtown today and the line to get in the store wasn't long, I decided to give it a shot.  They were giving everybody $10 off coupons for $50 purchases.

I expected the worse as I entered the store... I thought it'd be a mess.  But it was one of the best organized, cleanest, neatest H&M's I've visited... and there were SOO many people!  So that shows that this staff has it down from the beginning.  Very impressed.  The space is pretty big, and there are a lot of clean dressing rooms.  Yay for H&M finally coming to Santa Barbara!
Christina is absolutely amazing. I go here all the time, but this was definitely my favorite visit. She is so sweet and on top of it.

OOOO BAP. I love restaurants that only make 1 thing, but they make it right. Bibimbap is one of my favorite things in the world. With that said, you can choose a vegetarian, tofu, chicken, or beef version here. I like mine extra spicy, so I always get extra sauce on the side.

So why not 5 stars?

My wannabe Korean roots tell me that this should be served in a hot stone bowl if I am eating in ( FYI: only 6 seats in this establishment) . I love to here that sizzle of the rice cooking. However, cute old korean men cook it in a hot-stone in the kitchen and reassemble it in an alternative bowl. So, this was a disappointment. However, the flavors are all there.

Sometimes, they also have a beef bone soup for 5 dollars.  Don't forget to get some cinnamon ginger tea too!

In an ideal world every vet would be as wonderful as Indian Walk. When I became frustrated with my previous vet I asked for recommendations and my friend who has every pet you can think of told me about Indian Walk. They picked up the phone on the first ring and the receptionist was so cheery I instantly felt welcomed. They even take pictures of your pet and put them on a board welcoming you to the practice. The doctors are knowledgeable and I was always able to come in right away. I credit them to saving my cat's life because I know I wouldn't have gotten in right away with the previous vet who ignored his symptoms when I knew something was wrong. Everyone in Newtown, New Hope and Washington Crossing should go to Indian Walk. Their prices are fair and their service is the best. Our cat Salem has been so cuddly since we first brought him. They saw he had not one or two, but three infected teeth and pulled them out. I have no idea how long they were hurting him but he's been giving us nonstop headbutts ever since, even on the day of the surgery! So many cuddles. Thank you Indian Walk for giving me another year with Sebastian and a new life with Salem. Shadow, Harley and Serenity miss you too!

I love Target. Perhaps too much...  Once when I was visiting Tucson, I went to four different Targets in one day. That was my first time visiting this particular Target.

I have been back a couple times since and I must say, this is not even close to my favorite location. It's smaller then the Target by the El Con Mall, which is just up Broadway a bit.

Since it's smaller, they do not carry everything other Target stores have. The layout is also different then most Target locations, making it harder to find things, even for Target regulars like myself. I usually have to ask for assistance here, and I usually have a hard time finding an employee to assist! 

I think I will stick to other Target locations from now on...
Ton'y is an Alton icon, so it probably gains points for that alone. The dinner menu is kind of expensive. We used one of the back rooms for our wedding and the buffet options were pretty good.

Visited this place with my 2 nieces to catch up and buy them lunch since they drove all the way up from Fernley to visit and were excited to check this place out and were pleasantly surprised to not only see how empty it was but also how the decor seemed to be on the "fancier" side for a chain restaurant and we actually felt underdressed. Our waiters name was Alfredo, I believe it was. His demeanor was pretty strange whenever he would come up to the table he would interrupt the conversation, make a strange joke and then before leaving he would take my nieces empty specialty drink glasses and bring refills without asking so throughout the entire meal we assumed that the refills were free. They both ordered the Alfredo with chicken added and I was told they were pretty underwhelmed by the under salted Alfredo and the dry chicken; for $14-17 per plate Its safe to say I expect a proper Alfredo. I ordered their "signature" truffle Mac and cheese and I didn't find it to be good at all; too much truffle oil, not enough salt, pepper or cheese.  When i was given the bill i was unpleasantly surprised to see we were charged for SIX specialty kid drinks for each time our waiter so kindly refilled their glasses without asking or informing that refills were full price or else I would have verbally declined. For 1 appetizer, 3 entrees, 6 specialty kid drinks and a water for myself was just under $95 after tax not including a tip....Woulda spent less if we went to Texas Roadhouse and all got 2lb steaks. Keep your options open when suggesting this place to take your friends or family

This used to be my favorite restaurant for Italian food. Unfortunately though, over the past few years, the price has gone up and the food quality and service has gone down. Way down. 

The last two times I've been there the waiters have been absolutely terrible. The first guy was on speed or something and made it obvious that he was annoyed when we asked for bread and other simple requests. During this same trip we waited there for over an hour for two simple salads. 

During our next visit, it was clear that the waiter was hung over. In fact I think he may have been still drunk from the night before. He even knocked over a couple of glasses at different tables. He would constantly repeat his introduction even though he had already been by to take our order. Finally after 30 minutes our salads and soup came. The soup was ok, but the salad was old and the croutons were so disgusting that my girl friend spit them out. They were beyond stale. Our eggplant Parmesan took over 1 hour and 45 minutes to make. We literally were getting up to walk out when it arrived. To make matters worse, the red sauce was so cold that parts of it were still frozen. The eggplant was disgusting as well, we needed a steak knife to cut it. Then the manager came by as she could tell we weren't happy. Her attitude from the very beginning was very defensive. We explained our frustration with the salad, wait time, staff, and entree. She immediately tried to justify the wait time by saying eggplant takes at least an hour to cook.
