She then claimed that the croutons were made about an hour ago - clearly a bunch of BS. She concluded with "I'm not supposed to tell you this but our eggplant is very earthy". Whatever that means. I've had eggplant at other fine restaurants and it never takes longer than 30 minutes to cook nor does it take much effort to cut. Bottom line is the manager needs to go and maybe Mac grill can be saved. Otherwise this business will not survive with her at the helm. She simply isn't manager material, has little to no people skills, and really is a disgrace to the reputation of Mac grill.

We used to come quite often. The kids menu has changed.  They don't give the kids ice cream anymore after their meal.They used to have the best honey mustard. They don't have that anymore either. The portions have gotten smaller.  The servers wear jeans now instead of black pants. Service is not as good.  Alfredo is a good server. Hopefully you get him. If not, good luck! Food is good. I recommend the Parmesan crusted sole.

3.5 stars (3 stars for food, 4 stars for price, service) 

BAP is a no frills traditional Korean food establishment that has been doing takeout this pandemic. The menu is just a few items long and largely consists of different types of bibimbap, all under $10. Ordering was really effortless -- I called ahead with my order for a vegetable and chicken bibimbap and it was ready within 15 minutes. Pickup was also easy and done at a window in the front of the store with a really nice elderly man who I assume is one of the owners. I was pleasantly surprised to find that they gave us free coffee packets which I have since used (I love me some Vietnamese iced coffee). 

The food itself was okay. With the price point, the speed of service, and the no frills menu, I assume the bibimbap is meant to compete with other fast food options, and as a result it should be critiqued as such. Within this category of food, BAP provides a light, healthy, and balanced alternative, which I appreciated. However I think the portion size of the vegetable one was a little small and the flavor slightly bland. You'd do better with spending that extra dollar for additional tofu or meat. Overall, though, it was fine for a $9 bibimbap if you're looking for it. If I lived in the area I could see myself going back if I needed a quick healthy meal and wanted to support a small local business.

Been here a few times now. Every single experience has been wonderful!

The food and service has been exceptional each time. This last visit we enjoyed live Italian style opera singing. It was very unexpected and fun, definitely not something you typically see at a restaurant chain. 

Every time we've come we couldn't leave less than a 20% tip, these waiters and waitresses are not just nice they are truly genuine. They aren't over the top, with a cheesy "hello and how may I help you's" only to scurry from the table as quickly as possible. They genuinely smile and make conversation, have impeccable timing and attentiveness even on a busy Friday night, and know how to make recommendations from the menu. Really wish we could note all their names individually to give them props. 

The food is fully flavorful, not just salty. The bread is warm a loaded with rosemary flavor, I always request balsamic with my dipping Olive oil. Each dish has a unique flavor profile not just your typical Italian style chain where the only options are salty cheesy or salty tomato. People have complained about portion size/cost ratio on other reviews but honestly, I have never left here anything less than STUFFED with left overs for lunch the next day. We typically spend $55-$60 on two specialty drinks, two appetizers, and two entrees (my choice usually being a seafood/lobster dish) at dinner, not shabby at all when you consider the customer service, atmosphere, quality, AND quantity at that price. 

If you suffered a bad experience here, I am strongly advising you give it a second/third shot and even mention your last experience to your waiter when you come in, I'm positive a place like this will make it up to you. This is probably my favorite restaurant of the moment. Totally worth the five star review I'm giving it.

I have been bringing my dog here for years. We usually see Dr. Golblum but all of the staff is very kind and knowledgeable. They are not trying to push any treatments or sell you things like some other vets I have experienced.

Nothing overly executed well on an ENORMOUS menu, which is always a red flag for not fresh...using canned mushrooms on your pizza is a HUGE no no in my book. This place seems to be a fading alton staple, but they have cheap drinks, lots of choices, but could be done a lot better, you are better off at bossa nova down the street, that place wont make you poop in your pants

This place was recommended by a foodie blogger. Didn't think much of it before until I tried it. Their house made buttermilk biscuit is so good and salty. The bacon is really good on it as well as the fried egg. I came here twice on my 2 day trip in Santa Barbra. I couldn't imagine having a different lunch besides the great buttermilk biscuit that I won't be able to have until my next trip. Also the red Pap dish is really great. My friend ordered this dish and the pastries are perfectly crispy. Completely inspired me to try to make them at home. Also, everything was perfectly salted, highly appreciated that. I will definitely be back for more. Until then, I'll currently fantasize about the oatmeal raisin cookie I bought to take home. Can't wait to get out of work and have some

Went back on a Tuesday and were able to get a table for 8 easily. We want Barone to be our neighborhood spot, but they're making it hard to do so. My friend ordered the mussels which were delicious, but when she asked for bread they told her they only give out bread for sandwiches. Bread. Sarcones is right across the street. 
We will come back because we understand that it's new and they may be working out the kinks still. Fingers crossed.
Eh use to be good wish they hadn't changed but what can you do? I'll give them some time and see if they change back

Very good ice cream.  Unfortunately for me I discovered my stomach is unable to handle ice cream any more...I have developed a little bit of lactose intolerance...darn.

Still recommend a visit for some deliciousness.

Stopped by around 11 on the other night. The man who I assume was the owner was so arrogant I felt a bit threatened by his glare. Everyone who I was with felt the same. Myself 2 girls and a guy all dress approiate completely sober. To say the least the pizza was so bad we threw it in the trash and walked next door to the other pizza place I think Mikes.
Gia the Trainee was off the charts amazing. One of the kindest people I've met in a while! Will definitely be returning to the business thanks to her awesome attitude!

The food here was amazing and the restaurant is super cute inside and outside. Our sever Justin is what really made our experience enjoyable. He gave us many recommendations on the food and beverages. We are also here on vacation and he also gave us recommendations on things to do for the rest of our time here. Would recommend this restaurant to anyone and will be back before we leave.

I have been here twice in as many years and felt I got a fairly decent meal here both times.  I came close to having their pizza but they were closed on Monday so that might have pushed this to four stars.

I have had pasta on both visits and this weekend I even ordered it slightly different from the way they listed it and they accommodated me to a T.    Their meatballs were also very good.  I feel the salad was kindof tired and uninspired, that could definitely be improved but my dressing was on the side just like I requested.  

Our waiter was very patient with my 90 year old father. that meant a lot.  I would not make a special trip here but will definitely come again next time I am in Alton.  And I will try that pizza!

Not much to say about this spot except that it has become a staple of downtown Nashville. I'm embarrassed to say that this was my first visit to the new location since they moved off Broadway. The inside was nice and blasting A/C which we appreciated after strolling downtown in the 90 degree heat. I went with a waffle cone and a single scoop of coffee ice cream, which totally hit the spot. This is one of my favorite spots in town to grab a sweet treat

One of the better places in Philadelphia Chinatown for rolls and egg tarts (multiple layer crust here!).

Service is generally faster if you can speak in Cantonese, though... I tried to use Mandarin and it's still faster than English.

Teas here are okay, although probably better elsewhere.

Limited baked good selection, but they do everything almost equally as well, and they're very consistent about it.

This was the best overall dining experience I've had in Nashville in years. The staff was kind from when we were greeted at the door, to when our awesome waiter walked us through the menus and took great care of us. The vibe inside is modern and stylish, the food was delicious, they have tons of sake options, and the prices were decent! Two Ten Jack is owned by the same people, and both restaurants know what's up!

I always enjoy going to Twin Peaks, and this is a nice one. There were lots of televisions and my wife joined me this time (so I didn't feel bad). 

My spicy chicken was awesome, and I felt like it was kind of healthy. The scenic views were nice, but we were actually there to watch football. Our server was friendly and the food came fast. She made the dessert with . I'll go back.

I am in love! This is my new favorite brew place! The best part about it, the variety! I was lucky to go on a pint night, the vibe was fun, and everyone was there loving these good brews. I go to GABF every year and this is a nice mini taste of a varietal of beers. I had their Kolsch, it was crisp and cold as it should be. I am not always the biggest hoppy fan, but the DFG IPA was clean, light and very fresh tasting. It didn't kill my taste buds as I enjoyed the Pumkin beer (best one I have had all fall and winter) next! 
The hours kind of suck but the fact that next week they will have different beers next week will have me hooked!

Meh. I came here based on the many good reviews, but I was pretty disappointed. I sampled a few flavors - they tasted average, nothing really stood out to me - so I ended up ordering a scoop of the blackberry cornbread, since that was at least a unique flavor. The blackberry part of it was quite tasty, but the cornbread was very dry, and I wished the cornbread bits weren't there at all.
One way you can tell that the flavors are artificial - look at the color of the pistachio ice cream. Mike's was a bright green. Real, unadulterated pistachio ice cream is much more of a dull green, almost brown color. I guess I should have just left when I saw that.
The space itself is also quite depressing. Maybe it's the awkwardly large tables, or lack of decor. But it wasn't a relaxing, or energizing, or fun place to sit while eating ice cream.

Delicious ice cream! Ordered the coffee fudge and chocolate chip cookie dough in a cup! The servers however weren't very friendly and gave us chocolate chip instead of chocolate chip cookie dough. It was still tasty though! Also good seating and music selection!

Thats was Thursday night after hurricane in New Orleans. Place was packed, so it caused a little waiting time on everything. Friendly hostess helped me to find a spot inside, because outside was pretty chill. I tried few items there, and I can't say that it was something special. But I really like exterior and interior. Place looks so cool to me. I really enjoyed being there.

BIG WARNING: This store has one of the worse return policies in the shoe business. If you had worn the shoes, forget about ever returning them.

I usually wear a size 10 wide sneakers. When I went into the store, I told the sales associate this and they told me they don't have 10 wide available for basketball sneakers, but a size 10.5 would be fine. I was skeptical but it seemed fine in the store. I played a game of basketball that evening and realized within 20 minutes they were giving me blisters to both my feet.

The next day, I tried to return them because it was not as the associate had claimed. The store manager flat out refused the return citing their policy. And didn't even offer store credit.

So moral of the story, don't buy shoes from this store unless you are sure you want to buy them. And don't trust their associates. Go to the DSW next door.

Good amount of shoes, and pretty cute flats. They also have a few boots to choose from, now that it's almost fall. They have some good sales, where you can buy one, get one half off, so I try to come in here first before stopping in the DSW next door. Oh, how I love being a girl!

Look everyone comes to Nashville for the BBQ and Hot Chicken however, after a few days of that your mouth needs a different flavor.  We had a great meal at the Green Pheasant.  Authentic and modern, the dishes were all hits except the chicken gyoza.  Didnt love those.  Nice drinks and great asian flavors

My family stopped in for some ice cream while we were downtown. The shop itself is small considering the amount of customers that come in and out. Despite the smallness of the store, the service was fast. They had plenty of servers behind the counter and the line moved quickly- almost too quickly to decide on which of the almost 45 flavors to chose from- but that's not a serious complaint. 
The prices for the ice cream is pretty reasonable all things considered. As of 7/27/14 it was $4.20 for a double scoop on a cake cone or dish, with waffle cones and sugar cones of course costing extra. The ice cream itself was delicious, although nothing incredibly groundbreaking or special. It's really soft and drips all over the place, so be sure to grab a few extra napkins. Long story short, good ice cream, reasonable price, cool atmosphere, definitely worth a try! 

Tip: don't buy the drinks out of the cooler! $2.50 for a bottled water?? Outrageous! Go the the karaoke bar across and down the street about half a block that has an outward facing shop where you can purchase cold drinks and bottled water for $1.

Meh. The food is alright - service is awful. The associates who work here act like they do you a favor waiting on you. They don't listen to orders - ordered a latte HOT and came iced down. OK. Just poor attitude in my opinion. It's a shame could be a step above McDonalds if they put any effort into it. Gave it three tries - I'm out. Not on my list next time in Nashville.

Amazing, inventive cuisine. The salmon is mind blowing, literally best salmon I've ever had. Another of my favorites is the crab noodles. Super comforting in this cold weather (but I'm sure I'll eat it when it's sweltering out too)! The American waygu is amazing- almost melt in your mouth. The sake on tap is nicely rice-y and feels like it has the tiniest effervescence. And then for dessert, don't miss out on the strawberry chocolate chip mochi if they have it!
Food took forever soup was cold. Manager was touching people's food bare handed. Food receipts on top of salad while waiting to be served. Waited forever for food that was cold

Great place with tons of potential but ultimately they need a lot of work. Food was ok, service was poor, drinks were weak, and they do not honor there happy hour on saints Monday game days. This should have been explained when I booked my reservation being happy hour was the reason we were dining here.

Wonderful food and a great chef and owner.

I eat here several times a week.

You cannot go wrong with the beff bowl.

This place is outstanding. Family owned. 
We ordered on a Thursday afternoon and it was quick and fresh. The Italian sub had a generous portion of meat and ingredients such as lettuce, onion, tomato, banana peppers, and housemade oil and vinegar. The bread is also made fresh daily in house. 
We also ordered the manicotti which included homemade sauce. They also have pizza by the slice daily.
This place is a must for anyone in the Largo area.

Soooo could have given 4 stars to this adorable place but the militant 11:00 am cut off of breakfast is just too, well, militant. Totally understand a kitchens need to change over but perhaps offer the simple granola with yogurt or create a breakfast "flavored" baguette to help out the late morning arrivals?? Maybe a fruit and yogurt parfait in the cold case??? Even on weekends if you spent the night out in the funk zone and return the next day in hopes of revitalizing only to be faced with a salad or sandwich at 11:02 am? Honestly it was 11:02. I would have rushed over had I known that s BAKERY would stop serving brekkie at 11:00. Who knew? Well I guess I do now. 
Suggestions to HSB.... help with the transition! I stood at the counter watching what I wanted to order be handed to the person who ordered 3 minutes earlier than me. OUCH! 
Even granola on yogurt would have earned you an extra star from this reviewer. A 3 minute exception to your hard an fast rule would have earned you 2 more stars despite the food only being a 4. Your staff is lovely. They must cringe when the clock strikes 11:00 knowing they can't bend to any pleading a customer might attempt. 
Don't fight the change .... give your customers a little help with the transition and next time we are here perhaps I can give you a star for improvement. 
Thanks for the 11:02 toast n biscuit. Not bad but not enough

Industrial atmosphere... Cody and very nice. Food... I would love to say it was great but... not quite there yet. We had 3 different orders and all came " just " as a thick slice of bread topped with our selection (I had Huevos Rancheros, the others had avocado and cinnamon). Would go back to give a chance to something different than the thick bread option...

This place is incredible. The beers are excellent. The menu is huge, which to me, is a good thing. I liked that it was family friendly but not to the point of it being obnoxious. 10/10 would reccomend anyone to go there.

During the Nashville summers the heat can get pretty unbearable and I was looking for places to cool off. Mike's ice cream is right off Broadway so there is a good chance it will be busy when you go in. 

I ordered the single Tennessee fudge ($3.75) on a chocolate chip cookie cone ($1.50). There were so many huge chunks of the fudge! I loved eating the chunks in one bite. I wasn't a huge fan of the cookie cone because it was really crunchy and hard to bite. I can understand why because it has to hold the ice cream up but I was worried I was going to break my teeth. It did taste like chocolate chip though.

My ice cream was melting so I went to town on my ice cream after I took my pictures. It was pretty good ice cream.
Nice bartenders. Bier has good beers made to the style. It's not a spot that does off-the-wall stuff, so don't expect any oddities.
My husband and I tried their double cheeseburger and chips. It was an amazing burger. The hubby says a burger that he will never forget. The place is clean and atmosphere so warm and inviting.

This was by far the worst dinner we have had in a long time. The portion of Lasagna was not worth the price, just a small piece on a plate with nothing else with it...no salad, had to ask for a slice of bread. The bread tasted like old stale over seasoned shoe leather. The bread came with a small plate of seasoned oil...awful...not olive oil! It was rancid I'm sure of that! Also ordered a bowl to tomato soup. I had one spoonful as well as my husband. Both of us said no way! I told the waiter we can't eat this and sent it back. It looked and tasted like you opened a jar of Spaghetti sauce and poured it in a soup bowl. Just awful! My husband managed to eat the Lasagna. I drank my soda, which was all I had for dinner. I can't even tell you how filthy the restrooms were, especially since everything is to be sanitized these days. The floor under our table was sticky, hadn't been washed after a soda that had been spilled who knows when????  We would  never go back even if it was free.

I'm about giving establishments a second chance so that's what I did recently.  Overpriced mistake.  Rubbery eggplant parmigiana, garbage spaghetti and if you want a salad, oh that's extra.  Save your time and money and go elsewhere.  I just can't figure out how this place is still in business with the garbage they put out.  I hate to be negative but I've tasted better frozen "Italian" food than the pathetic plates this place puts out!!

Twin Peaks in located in Castleton right by I-69 on 82nd Street. Parking is free with a large parking lot in front of the restaurant. 

Everything appeared handicapped accessible from the parking lot, entrance, restaurant, restrooms and the firepit on the patio.

We were seated immediately on the patio as requested at a tall-top table. The view was the parking lot but it was still nice to sit outdoors. We were just a few feet from the community fire pit where several folks were hanging out having a few beers.

Twin Peaks has daily drink specials from drafts to shots with $5 Happy Hour Bites and Drinks. They serve 29 degree beers if you enjoy ice cold beers. Many drink specials so check out the online menu. The restaurant is a great location for a meal, watch a game whether football, basketball or a fight but especially the upcoming Olympics. TV's are located everywhere and there is a pool table, a man cave and games.

The menu offers all your typical Pub food plus more. Several types of Pub Fries are available (recommend Hickory Smoke Pulled Pork or Brisket Chili), Wings, Fried Pickles plus more. A lunch menu is offered Monday -  Friday from 11:00 - 3:00pm. Burgers, tacos, ribs, salmon, pot roast, chicken are also on the menu.

Our food was good, the server brought our appetizers well before our dinner and she checked on us several times. We had a great time on the patio and will return.

I have only tried 2 smoothies here but both were delicious. Recently I tried the high protein Chocolate Activator after a night out with friends lol. So good. I see some reviews on places like Smoothie King talking about calories. Well fruit has sugar, it's natural sugar and far healthier than that from soda, candy, etc... but yes it still has calories. Anyways, staff is awesome. It takes a few minutes to get your drink, but hey they have to make it fresh so ‍ be patient. Will gladly continue to grab my post workout activator and the smoothie king near me.

4/5 stars just because I'm picky. I like my smoothies smooth so I made sure to ask them to pulverize the smoothie when I ordered from the drive thru. 

The Pineapple Surf smoothie was good. I got a 32 oz and spent ~$8. I'm not sure how often I'll be visiting, but if you are in the area, are tired of Costco's $2 Berry Smoothies & you have $, I would definitely recommend it.

Got the chicken Bibimbap and it was delicious. Fresh veggies, nice sauce, perfectly fried egg. Was large enough that I was quite full by the time I was done and very tasty. It was also a very clean restaurant!

Had my vehicle repaired here after I was side swiped. They did such an amazing job. You can't even tel there was any damage. Customer service was great. If you need body work done, this is the place to do it. I hope I never have to come back, but I know I'll be happy with the work if I do.

Well upon my visit to Nashville while walking on Broadway this place caught my attention. It was a little hole in the wall ice cream shop with a long line to get ice cream.

Being not a big ice cream eater decided what the heck let's give it a try as everyone said it was the best in Nashville. 

The line was long and the place was not that big but let me tell you no one cared. The other thing was that the temperature was about 40 degrees and people were still lining up and eating ice cream.

They had a huge selection of home made ice creams and like all other ice cream shops they would let you try if you so please. I tried the vanilla chocolate chip as well as the roasted coconut, let me tell you I am from the Caribbean and coconut ice cream is always popular, I never thought that I would have to go to Nashville to have the best coconut ice cream ever.

I had asked for one scoop because I did not want much, their one scoop is very generous I must say. The prices were not bad as well, for one scoop was about $4.00 or less which was worth it.

The staff was very friendly and was very helpful, I would definitely recommend this place to any visitor who wants to try ice cream in Nashville.

This use to be my goto bakery for coconut buns. Then I became a freak about my sugar intake and I stopped getting most baked goods.

I remember Linda N.'s review about them and ventured there during my lunch break. I didn't want a drink but saw they had a sign for custard buns, my childhood favorite!!!  I go in and look for their steam machine thing... But nothing is in it. I ask for the bun, and they said it was frozen. I assume for take home orders. Womp Womp!!  

I felt weird leaving without buying something so I got the egg custard. I'm glad I did, it was pretty bomb. Well done in my opinion. Can't beat price, 80 cents. I'll try the hk tea next time... Didn't realize they sold it in ice lol.. Didn't want hot since it was hot outside.

I ordered so many cake from here for our family's events.
They all came out good. Easy to communicate with the owner cuz her English is pro. Price is reasonable.
First visit to this new and very local brewery! Such a great space, very family friendly... wonderful, warm atmosphere!  Oh the beers... everything I tried was awesome! Welcome to the neighborhood!!

Absolutely fabulous food the brussels sprouts were scrump-delicious the green salad was fantastic with candied pecans  and the margarita pizza was wonderful. Do not under estimate the serving size. I  order way-more than I needed to eat but  plan on eating every single bite.  Definitely worth a try.  I will be back.
The Ice cream was regular icecream, the service was great though. It seems like I pretty popular spot though. They serve ice-cream and coffee!

Made mistake of going to restroom first.  It stunk like a sewer.  Realy bad. Yuk! I have to say the restroom looked great, like newly remodeled.  My friend went in after eating.  Same response from her. Had to stay and eat because others were hungry.  Never again, even though grub was good.

I've always loved Bier brewery.  We've been going here for years!  It's such a cozy place to sit on an afternoon and watch sports, play a game, or sit and talk.  We always bring our dog and they are so accommodating and sweet to him!

My favorite thing to do is order a Wiezengoot and sit on the couches in the middle.  They have great views of the tv and a coffee table to play games on.  I do wish they had food, but I believe they are okay with you ordering food or bringing it with you, not 100% about that though!

Awesome unique and tasty food, beautifully presented. Crab noodles, beef dish, and chicken gyoza and ginger creams brûlée were excellent. Brocollini was a bit too salty. Choc cake tempura cake was ok.

Seriously. Every time I come the wait is ridiculous!! 
I cannot wait for one stop to open up. 
The wait isn't even normal time period. !!

While feeding my sister's cat while she was away, I managed to lock myself out on the balcony. Luckily I had my phone on me and found called them. Shay arrived super quick and I was free and on my way in less than 30 minutes. The rate wasn't bad (standard) and he didn't have to break any of the locks. Definitely would use again.

Such a fan of this place! I've been twice now, the most recent being with a group of friends for happy hour, and both experiences were amazing. Happy hour starts at 4 and offers half of the carafes of wine. In addition to ordering a few different wines, we also shared several small plates including the duck fat fries, olives, and vegetable flatbread. Everything was delicious, reasonably sized for a medium group, and a good complement to the wines we ordered. 

While the food and wine (on tap!) is definitely worth a trip, their outdoor patio is PHENOMENAL. The live plants and simple, but rustic seating makes an intimate "getaway" from the hustle and bustle of the CBD/downtown area. The crowd is professional, sophisticated, and relaxed. Definitely worth a visit!
Awesome food, great service! The tuna stack  amazing, also exceptional poutine and the Ybor egg roll.

I ordered food through Uber eats and it was inedible. The salt content was soooo high, we literally could not eat the food. $60 later and there was no response from the restaurant. Poor customer service and crappy food. It used to be amazing. I guess they've joined the others in microwaving because this was not fresh at all. The Bolognese had no sauce and the big tortellinis were filled with salt like the topping. They've definitely gone downhill, and the fact that they wouldn't credit anything? Unacceptable. I was starving but would not touch it. So I paid for crappy food I couldn't eat but I will NEVER do that again.
Excellent food, phenomenal drinks, superb service, delightful atmosphere.  We had Wonderlust cocktail and margarita pizza with crab deviled eggs and tuna salad all was delicious!
Good hair but what's the point of offering a payment plan if you are just going to hold the entire balance anyway?

Not bad as far as antique / junk malls go. Some items were way over priced as far as I was concerned. Lots of repurposed stuff and lots of new items made to look old. Didn't find anything I couldn't live without. Everthing is pretty well organized and it was really clean.

Enter through the courtyard on the corner of Poydras and O'Keefe. Go through the first door on the left to find host stand inside. Had the happy hour tuna tartare w/caviar and bacon wrapped dates. Both were good. 5 stars for service and gorgeous plant covered courtyard. Hostess was welcoming and my server Cemile was a sweetheart. Bonus: They have easy touch-less QR code pay option.

Presentation of the Place: The Bathrooms are nice. It reminds you of  an overpriced hotel that you can feel fancy in while taking a dump. The inside of the place reminds me of an amalgamation of the sets of Cheers, Sex in the City, and some French Noir.

The Food: 

Starter:

Jumbo Lump Crab Deviled Eggs

So, this is the first of many dishes were the common complaint is the lack of salt in the food. From the egg, filling, and crab itself, everything was void of salt or seasoning except for what was a little paprika. The textures are boring and 1 dimensional. For 8 dollars, you are getting 3 deviled eggs at the lowest effort of innovation and care. It is something with less flavor and passion than the ones you are partaking in during Thanksgiving at your grandmas.

Brussels Sprouts with Garlic Aioli and Grated Parmesan.

The Brussels sprouts are cooked exceptional well, which is rare. This is ruined, by the lack of salt and seasoning again. I assume this is due to the amount of Parmesan shaved on top of the dish. This gives the dish an overwhelming umami flavor, and it forces you to reach for the garlic aioli to counter it. After about 10 bites, you begin to realize how white you are because you are essentially eating cheese and mayo. 


Entrees:

Ratatouille with filet

No salt on the filet on top. No salt in the dish itself. What is on the Filet is a lot of balsamic vinegar, which is overpowering. The tomato paste hasn't been stewed long enough, so the dish is really acidic especially with the amount of balsamic vinegar being used.  

Quail and Boudin

This dish is weird. If you ever had a fever dream and was wondering man I wish I could eat that, this is what it taste like. The portion of boudin and quail you get is actual small for the price. Guess what the quail doesn't have on it? The fry on the quail isn't good and the breading breaks offs. The chicken gumbo taste so strange like they almost put soy sauce in it and also has notes of sour. The boudin is really good and is the oasis in this odd dish. 


Drinks:

1 Bottle of the Smith and Hook. Your standard Cabernet nothing flashy.
 
Service: 

I usually don't critique service. I understand that we all take breaks at work, but man no water refills, the restaurant isn't busy, and people from the pass are having to bring our food. This is happening while you and your bartender friend are talking the entire time. Not a good look hombre.  

Verdict: A Salty No

If you want to have a glass of wine with the girls or boys, while you look out at Poydras St. I guess this is the place for you. In my opinion, there are far better options location and culinary wise for you to go to.
Fantastic dining experience.  Knowledgeable staff helped us make menu choices.  Everything we had was outstanding.  We need to come back so we can try more.  Great atmosphere.  Highly recommend

I was pleasantly surprised by this place. TLDR; this place has steep prices for the drinks and sushi so if that's a problem, go elsewhere. There is a happy hour, but we went for dinner. 

Super nice trendy decor. My date made a reservation and we're were seated at a nice two person booth by the sushi bar. 

Drinks are steep. Like $10-15 a drink. But the drinks were strong and super creative. Since I was on a date I didn't take pics, but they were super pretty. We got the lychee (vodka, lychee, lemongrass, and sake) and the winstons heat (gin, wasabi, lemon and cucumber). Both were super refreshing. 

For the appetizers we got the creamy rock shrimp and the brussel sprouts. The shrimp portion was small but these two were probably my favorite of the night. We ended up getting a regular tuna roll along with king salmon, bluefin, and yellowtail sashimi. 

By the end I was pleasantly full and buzzed haha. A great end. Anyway, for two people, we hit the $130s range. Expect to pay that much for dinner with drinks.

Excellent spot! Definitely get the menu run down!! 

We tried a few small plates!
karaage (fried chicken- small plate- so yummy!)
sui gyoza (pheasant dumplings- when in Rome)

spicy crab noodles- spicy and super delicious! 

kaisendon was my main dish! It was very tasty but needed a balance with some crunch. 

Overall great experience- SUPER friendly staff and not a big wait time in food. Definitely check it out if you are in the area!!

This was our first time at Twin Peaks. We were visiting from Chicago and we've heard a lot about this restaurant. Don't be scared away by the parking lot...they have plenty of seating even if the parking lot appears to be full. We were greeted by a group of excited girls at the door. They were able to seat us right away. We wanted to watch a football game that was not the colts. The manager came over right away and asked which tv would be best for our table. 

We ordered an appetizer, sandwiches, and burgers. The food is reasonably priced and comes in large portions. The bloody Mary's are awesome!!...but the price is a little high at $8.75. 

They have a great patio with a ton of TVs. This will be great place to hang out in the summer. The garage doors open up to the restaurant. 

The service was ok but not the best. We would go back for the drinks and to watch a game. Overall...good restaurant with a great view!

Fail. Went in for my girls birthday.  I've never been before.  Service was ok I guess lots of going back and forth for food. My place setting had old food stuck on it and when I got my salad it came with the wrong dressing I asked for balsamic I'm pretty sure it was rasberry or something definitely not balsamic.  I think our server  was amie. I got the osso buco. Was hesitant because it was 28 dollars.  It was cold. Not appetizing at all to eat cold mush potatoes and beef.  Portion was small and looked like cafeteria food kind of slopped on the plate. Held my tongue so my girl could enjoy her  piping hot steaming chicken parmesan. Went to use the restroom.  I'm serious it was like 50 degrees in there. Sitting on the toilet was cold and uncomfortable and the lock was broken. And the topper was as we were walking out one of the cooks was standing right in the open kitchen eating food of the line with his bare hands.  How disgusting. Just knowing he probably made my "food" made me feel sick. I cook for a living almost 16 years. I'm not a fan of bad Yelp reviews being in the industry my self but I will never go there again. This is the first bad Yelp I've written in a looooong time. I do get the fact it is macaroni grill but come on. Fail...

This place was incredibly dirty! Tables all had crumbs on top and trash underneath. Chairs were not pushed in. The customer service was just okay - nothing great - they did their "basic" job duties. I attempted to go to the restroom. I walked in and immediately walked out - the smell of urine was overpowering. The ice cream itself was just okay. I definitely do not plan to return.

I have tried to give Caviar and Bananas the benefit of the doubt because it's so convenient and the inside is really cute. But the food is so subpar and highly overpriced for what you get. The service really isn't bad in terms of the employees they are usually friendly but god is the food terrible. Picture of my "sweet potato and kale hash".

My hubby took me out for my birthday and I couldn't be more impressed with everything. The portions of food for the price. The ambiance, the Italian singers in the background. I ordered the butternut pasta dish soooooo good! My husband order shrimp scampi and was very shocked to count 8 jumbo prawns in his dish. Normally he get 5-6 at other restaurants we have been to for that same order. When it was time for dessert, the waiter had been told it was my birthday so he came by with a plate of goodies and had me pick one. I chose the tiramisu. On point! A man sung me happy birthday in italian and my tiramisu had a candle in it. Overall experience was awesome, staff was extremely friendly!!!! Way better than my experiences in the past at olive garden. A++++ I am one happy customer.

I came here as my cousin accidentally stumbled upon this sushi place and saw how it was always busy - so why not right? We managed to squeeze in early as it as a weekday after the rain and no one was exactly out. I highly recommend reservations here as they are literally always booked and it was my cousins 3rd try. Their sushi is extremely fresh and they do have very unique takes on rolls compared to what I have seen in the area. Our waitress extremely patient and kind. The decor is beautiful but of course its dim and romantic so you can't really see what you're eating either. Seating is small and parking is of course limited.

Everything about the place is insta-ambiance worthy and picture perfect but I can't help but feel it was a little over-hyped. We got the Tuna Crudo which was delicious (aka tuna carpaccio as a comparison fyi) as an appetizer. As for the rolls, the only memorable one that is all over yelp and pictured everywhere is the broad street roll which is that salmon roll you see with the beautiful filters. I thought it was unique in that it had no rice and the fish was fresh but other than that I am not sure what I was expecting. If you want romantic lighting with your sushi and date, here is your place and it caters to the area!

This is a tough review to write, because I have been a devoted take-out customer of Helena Avenue Bakery since they opened. I live nearby, so I go in at least weekly and buy loaves of bread, biscuits and pastries. On Mother's Day, I even asked for their special breakfast of a biscuit with berries and cream, which my husband got to go. In fact, the day before this awful customer service experience, I had purchased over $45 in loaves of bread to take home. 

This past weekend was the first time I ever ordered drinks and sat down at a table to eat in. My husband and I took out-of-town friends for a special breakfast and it turned out to be a fiasco. The bakery was not crowded when we arrived on Friday morning. At the counter, the cashier (a 30-something brunette, who seemed to be the manager), was speaking over the customer in front of her, to a woman walking away, "Would you like to register a complaint with the owner?" The woman kept walking away and the cashier/manager turned to the customer in front of her and said: "Nothing like a customer complaint when you're already having a shitty day." She went on to complain about everything that went wrong with opening the shop that day before she took her order. My guest and I looked at each other and shrugged it off, since I had had so many positive experiences with take-out orders. 

We went outside and got a table and waited for the other two in our party to arrive. Later, the four of us went up to order. One of our party was a little picky - wanting to know what was in the green harissa, and that was met with some aggressive eye-rolling from the young man helping us. Finally, our order was placed. We sat on the patio and discovered there wasn't a pin to hold up the umbrella and it was starting to heat up. I went back up and waited in line to ask for a pin for the umbrella. The young man rolled his eyes again and said he'd look for it. Our iced teas were up on the bakery counter, so I took those and sat back down. I sent my husband up to get his coffee, which wasn't on the counter, and perhaps the pin for the umbrella, if the young man had located it. Ten minutes later my husband came back with his coffee and all our meals, which were wrapped in to go paper. One was a salad, so that was a mess. 

I went up and waited in line again to get plates, silverware and napkins for us all. There appeared to be plates in the self-serve area under the silverware, but went I bent down to get some, I noticed half the plates had bread crumbs and spilled milk on them. Half seemed clean and half seemed dirty, so I waited in line again to ask for plates. This time, the blonde barista waited on me and I asked for plates. She told me to get them in the area under the silverware, and seemed irritated when I told her half the plates there had milk and crumbs in them. She left and came back with 4 saucers. I asked her if there were no clean dinner plates and she rolled her eyes at me and said she'd see. 

Then, I stood there while she made 2 coffee orders, waiting. After she placed those orders on the counter, she looked at me and said, "Oh yeah, plates." She then went over to the kitchen area to a stack of plates. She picked up one and then another. She wiped crumbs off the 2nd and 4th plates with her hands and brought me a stack of 4 and aggressively asked, "Are THESE big enough for you?" I ignored the crumbs I had seen her brush off and said, "Perfect. Thanks!" 

Over the course of breakfast, which everyone thought tasted delicious, my male guest went back inside three different times and fetched iced tea refills for three of us in our party. When we left, we cleaned up after ourselves and put our dirty plates in the tubs provided. I stopped by the barista and asked her for some more iced tea and she sneered at me: "Sorry. We don't provide free tea refills." I said to my friend: "I didn't realize you were paying for all those refills everytime you went back inside and got them. Thank you so much." My friend said: "I didn't. They were free." He nodded to the same blonde female barista who had sneered No Free Refills at me and said: "She gave them to me free." 

So, if you are a handsome man, you'll get clean plates and free iced tea refills, but if you're a middle-aged, heavy-set female who drops about $50 a week in the establishment, be prepared to get dirty plates, a big sexist and ageist attitude and treated like shit. I've dropped my last dollar in this establishment and will be taking my business to the excellent D'Angelos Bakery, where their baked goods are cheaper and just as good, their breakfast menu has more than a couple of choices, their parking isn't a battle with day drinkers in the funk zone, and their staff doesn't treat customers with disdain, like weekend tourists they'll never see again.

Shame on you, Helena. Shame, shame, shame.

The coffee was good; the turkey and Swiss croissants were extremely dry and lacked both  turkey and cheese.  No one offered to heat them either. Staff were unfriendly and did the bare minimum. We won't be back.

A quick trip down to the Funk Zone today provided a delightful breakfast outing. Although everything is still "to go" only, the food and coffee we're definitely on point. Had an Oatmilk latte and avocado toast. It is Santa Barbara so be prepared to over pay for anything but the quality is at least worth the funds. Can't wait to go back and try the next item on my list.

I have been here a few times and I feel very strongly when I say this place is waaay to hoity-toity for my taste. I mean, it doesn't really matter what I say about the pricing because that has basically been said in every review on here. 

Quality of products is okay, but not great for what you get. I can't wrap my head around paying $10.95 for a salad. Granted, it can probably be 2 servings, but it is so inflated! Quality of food doesn't match quantity. I do not particularly care for their sandwiches nor the snooty service I have experienced.

Many times I would come here because my co-workers preferred it, but I long learned that ship has sailed. Not my style. Kudos for free wifi.

Bye Felicia.

This place has gone so downhill it is awful.
We went there for a birthday dinner last evening and the service was horrible  we waited for our order to be taken at least a half hour!  We never got our water refilled and were not asked if we wanted dessert but all we wanted was to get out of there!  The food was also horrible !
We remembered this as being a good place for quick Italian !  Never will we go there again! 
Should of known by all the empty tables !

I love what this bar is doing. I enjoy the yoga on Mondays and the different offerings that are available during the week. The cocktails are on point and I am happy that the beers are still very diverse but less abundant than when this was chumleys. It makes a decision easier to make.

The beer taps are ever rotating and half of them are local. A must check out on the strip.
Love love love this place! Staff is super friendly and food is delicious every time we go here. So many favorites but everyone has to try the mushroom ravioli

What's not to love about Marshalls?! I absolutely love shopping there and am so happy they have one in Land O Lakes.  They have so much great merchandise as such a great price.  This is one of my favorites!! I shop a lot for my granddaughter (who is 8) and the prices on the cute clothes cannot be beat.  My only qualm is that they are owned by same company (TJ Max) but they don't offer the senior discount like TJ Maxx does :(   So when I want to get my additional 10% off, I just shop at the TJ in Wesley Chapel or North Tampa.  Love, love, love this place!

No frills, no non-sense...just simple good food.

Ordered the tofu bowl. Came out really fast, all the ingredients seemed fresh and it was a good size portion. The sauce was the best part. It had a small kick so if you aren't a fan of a little spice ask for it on the side and if you like it a lot they have bottles on all the tables.

Owner was extremely nice and I walked in with him and presumed wife cutting fresh vegetables in the kitchen which gave it a very genuine wholesome vibe.

Awesome place! Clean, big, well-staffed, well-maintained bathrooms and so much for kids and adults to do. Our 6 year old loved it and we stayed for 3 hours! There was great music playing the entire time and a wonderful area with some comfy couches and massage chairs to chill. We will definitely go again!
best dental office!! All the staff is amazing!
The store has reopened! The new owner Wendy is very flexible in meeting needs. Highly recommend for gifts, company, and all around. Great candies, soy candles, gift cards, etc.

HOOOOOOOORIBLE!!! It was 8pm, a friend and I walked in after hearing how "AMAZING" this place was and were left standing at the host stand for several minutes.  I honestly thought the place was closing although there were several people seated both indoors, outdoors on the main floor and outdoors upstairs. 

Finally this chipper but rather confused host comes out to semi great us, but was paying a lot of attention to what was going on back where he had just arrived from. When I asked if we could sit upstairs, we were informed there was a party, which was fine, and then requested the main floor patio. 

After about 10 minutes, the host came back with 2 empty glasses, no water, no tea, no soda, just 2 empty glasses and then walked away. 

We were both starving and it was getting late, awful service, dry drinks, figured we would get better service elsewhere, and we did.

Home made pastries are yum! We always stop in for a crossiant . Decided to try their sandwiches for lunch it was huge! It was a turkey with bacon, avocado and pepper jack cheese. It was so good! It was more than enough for my husband and I to share.  FYI this place gets packed!

My coworkers always order from here; we've eaten pizza at least 3 times from here in the past week and a half. The people seem nice enough, even the guy who delivered to us in the pouring rain the other day was still super courteous even though both he and the pizza box were drenched.

The pizza is better than the stromboli; I'm not sure why. Portions are great as well; a 'small' stromboli will be good for at least 3 meals for me, which brings me to the overall quality.

The pizza is probably average at best, but still good if you happen to be nearby.
Jessica P is the best waitress. She is fun and exciting and cute. If I ever come back I will definitely ask for her! Food was good. It was crowded but still great service.

We strolled in here while waiting for our table at Nada next door. It was a Saturday night, and this place was very quiet. I think the concept is really cool, but execution is poor. First and foremost, there aren't any prices on any of the snacks, such as chips, granola, etc. They're just on unassuming shelves, and the restaurant owners are probably hoping you won't care. Plot twist - we care about price gouging. Second, having separate "stations" with different options was a cool idea too, but the menu boards were kind of confusing, and again, pricing was whack. I did like the idea of the coffee/bar area by the door. 

All I bought was a 10oz organic lemonade. It was almost $5. Yea, I won't be back.

This is such a great place for kids. The facility is very clean, the staff is friendly and they have awesome summer camps. After 3 weeks of camp my son could not get enough. I definitely recommend this to anyone who wants to get the kids off technology for a few hours a day.

Nice ambiance. Good place for a date night, but pricey for average sushi. 
We ordered the tuna tartare which was pretty good but the chips were a bit greasy. 
The fried brussel sprouts were prob my favorite out of all that we ordered. 
For sushi, we got the Geisha Roll, spider roll, spicy tuna, and yellowtail with scallions. Sushi here is over priced and it all tasted average. The soft shell crab batter was not as crispy as I would have liked. And my boyfriend did not like the chewy texture of the yellowtail sushi.

Yummy!!   My wife and stopped by while on a morning walk, and really enjoyed the avocado toast, and the ricotta toast (plus two hot teas).  We were able to sit outside, and liked that they wore masks and had hand sanitizer available. They were excellent!  We will be back!

Went there for lunch with my husband.  The restaurant was nearly empty yet it took forever for our food, which was only 2 burgers.  We both found the quality of the meat to be poor.  I ordered mine medium rare and it came out completely raw in the center.  They brought me a new burger, but only after my husband finished his entire meal.  Also thought it was strange that you have to pay extra for condiments on a plain burger.  I should have known to leave when the waitress tried to push fruity alcoholic drinks at noon on a Wednesday.

I had been trying to simply get a car key cut, not even programmed this past weekend.  No one seems to want to do this, especially if you have the key fob like I had.  Wal-Mar, Lowes & Home Depot all said no.   

A simple search lead me to the this locksmith right down the street.  I actually contemplated going all the way to West Philly for a locksmith since everyone seems to have a mobile service and charge alot of money.  

I was able to get the key cut for cheap and was offered programming of the key to the car for a really good price that I couldn't pass up.  

I don't even want to say how the price it was, but even cheaper than the big box stores and done within a really short time.    Please support this local business.  If I ever have to get a car key cut and programmed again, I am coming here.

Ok, we didn't have a reservation but they said a half hour wait and we would be able to get something. Well an hour later and she forgot about us.... no big deal we were sitting at the bar and they have over 30 wines on tap! Great concept right? Well we finally got seated outside upstairs. Another great idea, but the street lighting made it incredibly difficult to see the menu and your food. As for food we'll it was a disappointment. Very bland considering New Orleans is a culinary mecca. The layout and looks of this place has incredible presentation. Food needs to be better and this place would be an absolute home run making it almost impossible to get a table on a Friday or Saturday night. Love all the wine options and bartenders down stairs. That's the only reason for the 2 starts. This is New Orleans people! Your food needs to be much better!

You're never going to beat this place for lunch. The food is absolutely SUPERB. And the prices are downright cheap. Try a $5 12-inch Italian hoagie. But, unless you are a really big eater (and I am), you might as well have them wrap half of it so that you can have it for dinner. It is that good and that big. I have also had their meatball sub which comes with four HUGE meatballs.

They also have a case full of yummy-looking desserts although I have not yet tried any. And they sell a variety of Italian grocery items such as tomato sauces, pastas, etc. They make their own Italian sausage, too, which is out of this world. I took some home and used it in my homemade spaghetti recipe (made with San Marzano tomatoes which I purchased at Cesarina).

The place is small and they have only a few tables for those that want to eat-in. But even at noontime, I have never had a problem finding a place to sit. I found it odd that they are located in a small strip center right next to a pizza restaurant which I have not tried - and why WOULD you when you can eat at Cesarina?

My friend and I arrived to a near empty restaurant around 5PM. As soon as we walked in we were asked if we had a reservation to which we stated no. We were told by the hostess to sit at the bar since we did not have a reservation. We were a little confused but obliged. The bar was extremely sticky and uncomfortable to be at. We were sitting near the entrance of the restaurant and another group of people walked in and stated that they did not have a reservation, however they were quickly seated at a table. My friend and I went on to order a drink and start with a small plate. The small plate we had was the lobster dumplings and they were extremely salty, we could hardly taste the lobster meat. We ended our dining experience at that and left quite unsatisfied. The customer service here is extremely subpar. I felt as if the staff didn't really want us here. Save your money and explore the many other amazing options Nashville has to offer.

What's better than great food & wine? Great food, wine & service   

Nic took amazing care of us again!! We came for brunch and we were enjoying everything that we ended up staying for lunch as well‍‍

Today we tried the 
- baby Dutch pancake (5/5) 
- 8 oz wagyu burger (5/5)







Love the ambiance perfect outdoor patio seating right in the heart of downtown. 

The landscaping is everything you can tell they really care about details . I also really appreciated the great service thanks Nick R for all the recommendations they were all superb. 

Highly recommend! We will definitely be back I heard they have an amazing brunch.
Excellent ice cream. Good service in difficult circumstances. Lots of interesting flavors. We go two or three times a week. Love their chocolate and raspberry! Covid precautions are good.

They have good food but some of the crappiest and slowest service. They have one lady there that is almost as fast as reverse. And it seems for me three times I have to wait to pay when I get my order as opposed to everybody else paying when they give their order

I have been going here for several years, and its time I wrote a review.  I always buy the whole rye bread. Its hard to find fresh rye in Edmonton.  The quality is always outstanding. I also get their whole wheat hamburger rolls, which are also excellent. The owners are very knowlegable, and skilled.  They put much more whole rye flour in the bread.  I also buy bread in Toronto and NY, and Breadland can match anything I buy in either of those places.
The Crusher petite syrah - 100% varietal and DELISH. Great atmosphere. Good, solid food. Brussels were excellent. Waiter was friendly and personable. Comfortable environment.
Great vibe and terrific staff. I had cannoli ice cream and it was delicious. Just off Broadway and all the activity.
Green eggs and ham was really good and the interior was terrific. Will definitely be back! Thanks

I recently signed up for a Chase Southwest credit card.  I thought I was receiving 50,000 bonus points for this transaction.  Turns out i made an error and signed up for the wrong promotion.  When I contacted Chase about the issue they said there was nothing that could be done.  I have been a Chase customer for over 30 years and this kind of treatment was a surprise.  I do not understand how a change to my account could not have been made.  The points mean nothing to them.  And they were willing to lose me as a customer over a simple error.  Guess you can't rely on loyalty anymore.

Had high hopes and was really looking forward to trying one of my neighborhood restaurants, however I left disappointed.

Went with a friend on a Wednesday evening around 6:30. We were seated by a hostess with a pair of white sunglasses on the top of her head. Not what I expected for a first impression of what I thought was a nicer restaurant.  There were two other parties in the first room where we were seated by the window. Shortly after being seated a girl came by with water and bread. Then a different girl came by to see if we wanted anything to drink besides water. After my friend got his tea and we ordered an appetizer from girl #2, the hostess came by to see if we wanted wine or a drink from the bar. Throughout the whole experience I honestly couldn't tell you who our server was because between the three of them they all brought us food, filled our drinks, checked on us, brought us a dessert menu, brought us the bill, etc.

Now on to the food, which seemed to take longer than it should for a restaurant with three tables. I must say that we got to "enjoy" each course before the next one arrived instead of getting less than half way through your salad before your entree arrives.

Ordered the Calamari for an appetizer, the sauce was good but the calamari was way over cooked and were leaning towards the burnt side.

We ordered a large House Salad with chicken & large Pasta Primevera to share. The waitress offered to split the dishes on two desperate plates so we didn't have to do it on our own. Since she was doing that I asked if my friends plate could have the cheese & onions held on both his salad & pasta. She said it wouldn't be a problem.

The salad plates came out after we gnawed through the calamari. They came separate with mine only having the cheese and onions. The salads looked pitiful and both plates were missing croutons (which we couldn't figure out what was missing while we were sitting there). At one point my friend picked up a piece of lettuce and dressing was literally dripping off the piece of lettuce. Needless to say it was way over dressed.

Now on to the pasta, which we also asked for no onions or cheese on one of the dishes. Well the salads were too good to be true, because both of the pasta dishes came out with onions and cheese. My friend didn't want to be a pain so he ate it anyways and I'm sure paid for it later. The pasta had plenty of veggies in it but it was swimming in olive oil instead of being sautéed. Neither of us finished and turned down her offer when the hostess came by to see if we wanted boxes.

Girl #1 (the hostess) came by to see if we needed anything else and then brought us a menu so we could look at dessert. Unfortunately they didn't have Sorbet for my friend so we didn't end up getting any dessert even though I'm sure I could have polished off a plate of tiramisu on my own.

Again I was under impressed and disappointed with my first visit to a neighborhood restaurant. I'll go back and give them another try, but it'll have to be on somebody else's dime.
Cute bakery with good coffee and delicious pastries. Counter people are super nice. And for sure get the olive oil cake!!!

Perfect spot for a group of people or a date night. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I got a flight of 4 wines. They say it was 2.5 ounces each but I think they had a heavy pour! They explained each wine and left me with the names written down. We split the goat cheese and fig flat bread and the charcuterie board. The charcuterie board was worth the money. They offered plenty of  accoutrements with the selection. High quality meat and cheese noted and were not skimpy on portions. Probably could skip the flat bread next time. Split the impossible burger which is the best one I have tried thus far in the city. We swapped fries for Brussel sprouts which were worth it. I can't wait to go back to try more wines.

The Childrens Museum in Edwardsville is pretty much under the radar.  So much so that we got lost, stopped at a gas station about a half mile up the street for directions and none of the three locals trying to help knew anything about it.  It's a shame, because this is a cool little place for kids.  

It's in an old schoolhouse, built in 1895, just off rte 159 south of downtown.  They've done a nice job of  providing the goods to entertain kids for a couple of hours.   It's more of a hands-on museum than a place to come and be entertained, so come prepared to use your imagination.   I describe it as a place to come and play with your kids more than a place to let your kids run around entertaining themselves.   The highlights for us were the little newsroom complete with camera and TV and the earthquake table, where you build a structure, then select the level of earthquake you want to simulate using a nearby computer monitor.  The walls are decorated with some pretty good artwork, especially the library area. 

The staff was very friendly and helpful.  The price is currently $4 each, pretty fair, I'd say.   The ideal age for this museum is probably 3 to 9 or 10.   I noticed they have a wine and whiskey tasting coming up.  I guess this is a fundraiser.  If you're in the area, please check and see what grown-up activities they are putting on so you can contribute a little $$ to this museum.
Love this place, my go to breakfast when I'm in Santa Barbara...scones are perfect texture, yogurt and granola; as well as, the breakfast sandwich are all high quality ingredients and delicious!

Enjoyed a glass of red and the fig goat cheese flatbread on the patio with a few girls. Wine was delicious as usual! I will say our server did not have one of us sample it before serving us all, which I found a bit odd considering it's a wine bar. The fig and goat cheese flatbread was fresh and came out warm. I did feel it was lacking a bit of flavor- although the goat cheese was great it was really the only thing I could taste on it. The atmosphere is wonderful and our server was friendly. Would consider trying again

We usually buy durian birthday cake from this bakery but this will be my last time buying from here. Just got a 10" durian birthday cake and the quality is going down while price is going up. The cake cost $50 and back then you'll get more durian filling but now you get more cream! The cream is not even good.

I recently went to Bar One for  my second time which was as good as the first. The first time I had the short rib potato skins which were to die for and the second time the flat bread. Well I have to say the food is second behind the great bartender Mike. He was working his butt off and still trying to give everyone the attention they deserved. I will be back!
Incredibly friendly and helpful people from the minute I walked in.  Listened to my concerns about my bumper paint problems and came up with a good and affordable solution!

BEST DAMN VEGAN PIZZA IN PHILLY. I can't believe how could the pie was. I can't say enough great stuff about it. At this point, I wish I had a subscription to be able to get a pie every week   I'm so happy that I found this place. My life changed for the better.

Went in here hoping to find a green juice (either fresh or bottled) and couldn't find one, but they did have a large-enough breakfast menu with everything from steel cut oatmeal and overnight oats to breakfast burritos.

I have been looking for chestnut cake around for a while for my birthday and they have it! It's like an angel fruit cake with chestnut paste as the filling! It's delicious!
The quality is very good!and it's very affordable as well!
They also have regular fruitcake,tiramisu mousse cake and more!some of the items are made to order like the chestnut cake,and some are pre-made(see pictures)Have a look next time when you are around!
Authentic Hongkong style pastries!!

I really enjoy Ardmore Pizza's food but I would say that 90% of the time, something with our order is incorrect. The latest time we ordered, we got their Mac and cheese bites with ranch and honey BBQ but received mozzarella sticks with marinara. It says directly on the ticket that is taped to our bag what is supposed to be on there. I'm not normally one to write poor reviews on restaurants because I've worked in one, I know it can be difficult to get everything right but every single time is a bit much. We order all the time, normally once a week and normally the same thing so I wish that we could get our orders correct to keep us coming back in the future.
Good spot for a drink to two with some pretty good menu items too. Awesome and friendly staff in a really nice updated and clean space.

I am highly disappointed in the customer service offered by Chase.  I have been having a credit card issue for 3 weeks that they have failed to resolve. They continue to give me the run around of transferring me to different departments but no representative appears to have an idea of what the solution is and they do not listen to me despite my multiple attempts at explaining the situation. This has left me extremely dissatisfied and frustrated.
Great food! This atmosphere is nice and the service was not overwhelming. I highly recommend the chicken/shrimp gyoza. It wasn't what I would've expected but was delicious.

Mediocre. I've given up on everything besides Buck-A-Shuck Oysters on Mondays. They have a really nice selection of oysters, and they're all really delicious. Beyond that though, it's all downhill. The most recent time I went, we sat for twenty minutes before our server remembered we were there. We ordered 24 oysters and calamari since we knew the oysters would take long time to come out. We ended up getting the oysters before the calamari. That's the thing about buck a shuck, expect to wait 20 to 30 for those oysters to come out, especially if you order a bunch all at once like I do.

Calamari was good but there were banana peppers breaded and fried in there with the squid so I kept getting a mouthful of Dear God No.

I haven't ordered food there since I went for "brunch" and left so hungry I went next door to eat. I ordered eggs Benedict but got eggs on uncooked English muffins with some ham and so little hollandaise sauce it literally looked like it came out of McDonald's ketchup packet. 

I mean it, one whole muffin didn't have any at All. What kind of eggs Benedict doesn't have any hollandaise sauce? 

Between that and never having what I try to order in stock (take it off the menu if it's so difficult to keep!) I see no point in counting on Doc's on anything beyond cheap oysters. But if you go, don't eat the oyster crackers.

What a great little spot on South St. I never even knew this place existed! Their menu is simple (veggie, chicken, beef, tofu). Prices range from $7-$9 depending on the protein you choose.  I got a veggie bibimbap and it was delicious.  They give you plenty of rice and a whole assortment of veggies.  The fried egg is the star of course. The sauce is what makes the dish. It's spicy just the way i love it!
John is the best sever you're will get period. Such an amazing experience, and the food was delicious. Highly recommended!
Great ice cream. Not on the menu but they make a damn good afrogato. Try it with the Tennessee fudge!

This place was great. Order at the counter, seat yourself dining. Good coffee! We had the green eggs and ham biscuit (yum) and the huevos rancheros. Both were different and delicious. One suggestion would be to give descriptions on the board of the good items. It's a bit dark inside but there's outside seating. If you're in Santa Barbara this is a must stop!

My girlfriend and I used to love going to this Macaroni Grill. We hadn't been there in a year and it has definitely gone downhill. Last Sunday I decided to order the dish pictured (the mushroom ravioli) via Doordash. Ordering went fin, but when it arrived, it seemed a little light for a dish that might resemble the dish featured on their menu, especially one costing $21. I opened it up and I saw this monstrosity. Only a few pieces of ravioli, burnt to the point of being inedible with a dash of (also burnt) mushroom gravy. I immediately called up the restaurant and demanded an explanation. I was told that the General Manager cooked this particular dish and that I would be getting a refund in a week. 
Well, it's been a week. I called and was told it might be another couple of weeks before I get my refund because the folks in the corporate office are only occasionally in the main office anymore. I did get an offer for them to remake my order. No thanks. Fool me once . . . 
I will never be eating here again and I don't recommend anyone else do until they either hire new management or, at least, banish the GM from the kitchen. They clearly don't know how to cook or about appropriate portion sizing.

Short rib potato skins and eggplant stack are awesome. Playlist of music in the bar thanks to Chris et. al is great. Atmosphere is fun and friendly and loud on week, but quieter on weeknights. Just as friendly and pleasant.

Wawa is the best convenience store on this side of the Atlantic*, but this particular location is a bit lacking.  I don't know if they cut a no-competition deal with Cereality or what, but their cereal offerings are limited to a single box of Cheerios hidden away on a bottom shelf.  WTF, Wawa?  Don't you know that cereal is one of the four student food groups?  I had to trek all the way up to Fresh Grocer just to get some freaking Cinnamon Toast Crunch.

*except Famima!!, which doesn't fully count as American anyway

My experience with Iron House was great and pain-free! Chris, the owner, is the MAN and he couldn't have made the process of my totaled vehicle more simple. I hit a deer two days before Christmas and my insurance ended up considering the car a total loss. Chris gave me the best advice on how to handle the decisions of repairing the car or accepting the total loss and I am very appreciative for his honesty, friendliness, and genuine understanding of my situation. I'll always recommend Iron Horse to those in need of auto work.

I work at a restaurant and would never treat my costumers the way I was treated here.  There were multiple issues, but most notably my food was undercooked.  Rather then believing me, the waiter had another worker taste it... unacceptable.

Finally got to try Copper Vine for brunch.  Basically, the two big pluses are the food and the ambience.  The courtyard is VERY nice now that we're starting to get some cooler days.  The food was also mostly very good.  The deviled eggs appetizer, while good, wasn't really a standout over other deviled eggs I've had at restaurants.  The main dishes, however, were much better.  My salmon dish was pretty good.  The salmon was nicely cooked and seasoned.  The spinach was very well seasoned as well.  In fact, for some it might be TOO well seasoned.  For me it was enjoyable because I like a bit of spice, but you guys may want to mention on the menu that the spinach features a pretty heavy sprinkle of red pepper flake.  In fact, I'd probably refer to it as a "spicy" spinach because I could definitely see some people being taken by surprise.  The crabcake dish was also very good.  Crabcake was very heavy in crabmeat and light on filler.  Potatoes were done nicely, and sauces on both dishes were handled just right.  As far as main dishes go, the main negatives were the Dutch Baby being I think a bit underdone and the poached eggs having slightly overdone yolks but slightly underdone whites.  No idea how they pulled that one off...    But the main reason for subtraction of a star is the service.  First off, lil black dude who was the host, seemed to have ZERO care about doing his job.  We walked in to no smile or greeting or anything.  He just looked at us.  Fiancee says Hi table for two please.  He says "this way" and unceremoniously brings us to a table right next to the other two parties in the entire place.  So the courtyard has (I counted) 11 tables.  There are 3 parties in total dining at the time.  And he thinks it a good idea to sit us all on top of one another.  That's just a lack of care or common sense or both.  Spread us out a bit!!  He did seem to care GREATLY, however, when an attractive single diner came in.  Even came back to check on her at some point to see that she was "doing OK" *eyeroll*.  Our waitress, on the other hand, was very nice, but maybe seemed to not have a great grip on the POS system as literally EVERY DISH was brought to the wrong table.  Not just ours, but everyone else's.  By the time we had all of our food, there were only 4 tables occupied.  How hard can it be?  Also, she completely forgot my second drink.  BUT she caught her mistake and brought it on the house.  So that is a great positive.  She realized she made a mistake and went above and beyond to make it right without me even bringing it up.  But at the end of the day, the food was very good so I'll very probably be back.  Just, in all honesty, replace the host.  I'm never one to try to rid people of their employment, but if he's only going to show hospitality to patrons he thinks he can flirt with, then he is quite simply in the wrong business.  That, and retrain your wait staff on the table numbers.  I think if y'all can do that, combined with the quality product that the kitchen is putting out, y'all will be very successful.

I have been coming to Bala Better Health since I moved to Philly for over a year now. Theresa and Allyson always have the best attitude and are so inviting. Theresa has been doing my laser hair removal (underarms & lower face) and I was extremely impressed with the results after just a few sessions so added more. I plan to continue to return for all my beauty needs!

DO NOT RENT FROM HERE !! RUN !! Seriously this company should not be in business and it's pretty pathetic the type of operation they run.

For starters , they're listed under ACE at MSY, however, they're Nifty Car Rental and they are not directly at the airport like the other car rental companies.

So I land at MSY get to the car rental
Location and I don't see them inside. Asked around and was told to call some number and they will come pick me up and take me over . That was red flag number one. The owner Steve comes and get me (very fast ] in some dirty dusty old van that smell horrible and he's Wearing no mask despite all that's going on.

We get there and this place is FILTHY. Old trailer looking home that looks as if it's going to crumble any second. Red flag number 2 is that all the contracts are handwritten out on paperback like is it not 2021 WTF ! They call your insurance because they do not offer insurance which is also a red flag and get your policy number . In all my renting years never had someone call for my policy number. If u read other reviews u will see people say they file claims on their old dusty cars .

Here's the real information : first car I get is so was a white Kia Forte that smelled like so much weed mildew and had burn marks in the seats. I go inside to tell the girl and she's like "oh that's New Orleans people for u " like excuse me ? Clean your cars and get rid of them . Next car is a red Corolla with a broken bumper and it also smelled like smoke . I sat and called around and couldn't get a car soon so I had to take this one because I quickly needed to get to Mississippi in a press time. Why I turn the car on it have 136K+ miles .... These people are unreal . Plus the tire pressure light was on which she said was the sensor malfunction. How dare you rent these old cars to someone like that. I drove to Mississippi in silence cause I was so scared I would break down and plus the touch screen in the car don't work so you can't pair your phone . When I got to Mississippi I rented from someone on Turo and let that car sit the weekend.

When I returned I made sure I let them know I was recording because u can't record without someone knowledge in the event you need to use it against them. I got the lady to talk around the car with me and verbally acknowledge that there were no new damages and everything was good.

I was so fed up I called a Lyft to take me to the airport cause I didn't want Sh*T to do with them. Stay say please !!!!!

Expensive and LA hipster?  If you like greasy spoon places on the cheap-motel strip- this is not for you.  Everything in California is expensive and this place is no different.  You pay for quality of ingredients, preparation, and setting.  If you like Dennys- heavily advertising on Yelp! or oversized heavy food - again don't go. 

Cappuccino was really good. 
French toast is not French toast but pound cake topped with fruit. Avocado toast is great - bread needs steak knife unless you  just bite. ( real bread not wonder(what it is) bread.)

In SB for the weekend - go.

For the second day we chose a beach cafe, sat down, got up and went back here.  Guess why.

The Mercer Warehouse downtown and I have had a love affair that has been going on for years.
