Terrible, terrible, terrible. The worst card I have ever had - their practices are not only rude but should be illegal. I have had a Chase Freedom card for a few years now. Last year, they had canceled a Walmart charge without notifying me. A week later, having not received my merchandise, Walmart informed me that the credit card had canceled it. I was lazy and let it go. Now we ordered a ticket for my son to study abroad overseas -- $600. We were so happy we got a good deal. Chase canceled that. We had to settle for $850 a few days later. Customer service told me that it was their right to do so and that I had no recourse. They said that they could do that at any time. I have always had Mastercard and Amex, and they notify me if there is a potential fraud. Not Chase. They just cancel it. The reason for having a credit card is convenience, and I have spent over 3 hours on the phone with different reps and managers, all not only unhelpful, but rude. And at times I have had to wait over 20 minutes to get a rep.

We visited Copper Vine last week. Our server, Grace was wonderful. We ordered a few apps. The food was good but what stood out for us was the service. Copper Vine has multiple wine menus...I wanted to try something new but didn't know where to start. Grace made a few knowledgable suggestions and even brought over the sommelier. Since we were having a casual night I was unsure about bringing over the sommelier...typically I would shy away from something like that. WOW, I was so pleasantly surprised! She was so bubbly and friendly. She didn't sacrifice any professionalism in her demeanor but talked about wine in a way that wasn't elitist...I felt like she didn't care if we thought she knew a lot, she wanted us to know about wine and the brand. This girl is something special. By the end of our talking I had a flight of 3 amazing wines...a Napa Valley sauvignon blanc, a chardonnay from Santa Barbra, and an Albarino....and I could tell you about all 3, Thanks Copper Vine!  The night we visited was busy and we definitely weren't the table spending the most money....the sommelier still came back to check in and continue conversation. Grace was attentive and ensured we enjoyed our experience. We felt welcome and every staff member seemed to be happy and passionate. It looked and felt like a family run operation in a classy modern atmosphere. So cool! Great venue, Great food, Impressive staff. Worth a visit!

Good tasted good - but I'm a bit confused as to how a Vietnamese Good trick serves Vietnamese egg rolls with a mayo-like sauce?? I love Vietnamese food, and have always had fish sauce as one of the condiments. The egg rolls on their own was ok, I even tried the mayo sauce - (not great). Next time - I'll stick with authentic Vietnamese restaurants. But to be fair, the food was standard . I'd actually try it again...if they had the right sauces, of course!

I applied for a Chase Freedom card after hearing positive reviews from friends and family members. I have only had one credit card previous to this, which I paid off on time. My credit score is above 700 and I make a decent and steady salary, and yet I was told that I can't have a chase credit card because I don't have enough credit history. The entire purpose of my applying for a chase credit card was to build my credit history. It is unbelievable to me that three of my friends, who are in college, with no income have Chase Freedom cards, and I cannot because I haven't had enough credit cards in the past. I've heard great things about Chase credit cards and am disappointed by the level of discretion (or lack thereof) that they use when approving credit cards.
Oh my goodness this salmon bagel was so good I literally had to stop to write this review before finishing it so I could snap a photo. Yum!

Excellent customer service--I had a question on an online order and Tommy was very quick to reply and resolve my question. His store carries some unique items and they definitely have an eye for fashion-will definitely be ordering again!
This place is amazing. Tuna flatbread is to die for. The staff is beyond nice and welcoming. Love this place. Need to bring the rest of the family. Nancy that works there is so sweet. A+++++++

Absolutely terrible.   Nothing was done up to code.   Had to replace all landscape lighting.  Steps are caving in going down to patio.  Walls and steps not treated properly and water wicking up ruining my stucco and causing water infiltration in basement.  Outdoor kitchen not up to code.  Caused a lot of problems with township.  Trees they planted are uprooting pavers and make a huge mess on patio and pool.  A total nightmare and for that I paid over 100,000.
Went for brunch and found the food to be just fine. Certainly not bad and there were some moments but overall not excited. We had the fritatta and chicken and waffles.

Had a great time stopping by twin peaks last night, the beer was EXTREMELY cold and frosted up the glass . I ended up ordering the chipotle chicken and meal come out PIPING hot,  just how I like it!!   

I sat at the bar with Kelsie and Brittany, both were attentive and on top of their game. Each had a VIBRANT smile that radiated across the room like an evening sunset on top of a beautiful mountain. 

The GM, Ryan is what I think his name was stopped by and made sure the service and food was up to my liking.  Then we proceeded to chat about the good ole days playing sports and acknowledging how the old body just doesn't up hold up like it used to. 

Thanks TP

Great spot for lunch close to VU! Various lines to get whatever you'd like (salad, sandwich, coffee). I had the Nashville Hot Chicken Salad and it was wonderful! Big enough to eat for lunch and dinner!

What a disappointment. As a parent with young kids in the neighborhood, I heard so much excitement about this place. It was not good. Service was awful- slow and indifferent.  They lost our order, resulting in cranky hungry kids. Then, they got the order wrong. Food was overpriced and mediocre. Worst of all, the play area (basically the whole point of coming, for us) was poorly thought out. It's a big wooden structure that you can't see many parts of from where you're sitting and eating. So it's not like you can sit and relax while eating and drinking and still keeping an eye on your kids. You have to keep getting up and looking for them. Also, there's a bunch of other random stuff in the play area that is broken or not appropriate for young kids - like a foosball table with handles right at 3-year-old eye poking level.  Yeah, I won't be back.

First off holy shit, this place is amazing from the start the hostess gives you oshiburi's (hot towels to wash your hands) the cocktail's menus are decorated with awesome Japanese inspired art. The spirits and sake list is located under the table in a secret pocket. They have a sake somm. Who is very knowledgeable about her selection and it's not small by any means, the Japanese whisky list is also very impressive I got to try a few whisky's I haven't tried yet.

We started with a few cold items the wedges which were awesome very light crisp and full of flavor, first off everything is full of flavor. The tsukemono was perfectly seasoned and fresh, the chirashi was also very fresh and had walu, oprah, and ora king salmon. I definitely reccomend starting with the cold before the hot because the dishes come out as ready. After chatting with the sake somm. And ordering a bottle of the otokoyama we ordered from the hot list. Jesse our waiter was very helpful with our questions and very attentive to our table. We ordered the (pics available) Dan Dan shishitos, the brocolini with rock shrimp (order this please) the kinoko which is a mushroom miso flavor bomb, the ika karaage which is basically tempura squid, the spicy crab noodle is a must every noodle is covered in great sauce the noodles al dente (another please order)the shuman came next and they didn't disappoint either but now I'm starting to think I ordered too much oops... on to the Jidori chicken a never ever chicken and I don't mean not to order it, it was fried to perfection came with a kewpie mayo and a sweet and spicy sauce. I just meant it's a strain of chicken that's DNA has never been tampered with by humans and is raised in completely open pens not the kind PETA shows in those tapes and fed an organic Vegan diet. On to the beef I'm dying a happy death at this point... the first two to show up was the mishima ranch American wagyu and the A5 miyazaki prefecture wagyu both very tender and cooked to perfection the American wagyu has more bite to it but the A5 is like seared foie gras melt in your mouth yummy goodness. Last but not least the American skirt steak showed up ... truly a sizzling flavor bomb the corn the onions the miso butter and the j sauce make sure to get everything in one bite for the perfect bite. I've been writing so much I forgot to talk about the trout just check the pictures ... kudos to chef Kynsey and her amazing staff the GM Michael seale for coming to the table and chatting with us Kristin breringson for the awesome recommendations and most of all Jesse for taking care of us and making sure put needs were met. I will definitely be back just make sure you try it too the place is awesome. Best culinary experience in Nashville.

Wow! This is one of those rare places where every single thing I tried was outstanding. My wife and I ordered a few coffees, a few breakfast sandwiches, and a pastry. Each one of these items stood out in its own way. The cinnamon roll was impossibly gooey and had a surprising dash of salt that really intensified its cinnamony flavor. The breakfast sandwiches blended a number of different flavors that complemented one another well. The chicken sandwich was buttery at the same time it was peppery, and sweet while it was salty. For breakfast on the go, this has got to be one of the best places in Santa Barbara.
The smoothie was okay but the cashier/smoothie maker was veeeeeery rude. First time here and probably will not come back.

Can I give zero stars? If I could I would. Absolutely horrible customer service, rude, and impolite. Also pizza tastes like cardboard. Also takes advantage of drunk people and charges however the guy feels like. Don't go here. Don't waste your time or calories.

Had business meeting on Tues last week during Happy hour starting at 2 :00 pm Plus I'm a Day Drinker Hahaha,  where can I start the  Atmosphere is Truly Amazing with all the gorgeous vines hanging everywhere,  then I ordered the Tatar with Caviar every bite was excellent  tasting experience especially with the Caviar as i was sipping my fresh made Mojito. The fresh made  Flat bread Margherita pizza had totally Killer flavor & the crust was nice and soft which I really enjoy !!!

We went there yesterday at 1pm. There was 4 of us. Bailey was our server. The place was quiet. There was one large table that had been served. Our waters came fast. It took 30 minutes to place an appetizer order. Our salads came quick. The soup, I ordered tomato basil. It was bland. Our food took an hour to get. The pasta sat under the heat lamp so long it was dry and crispy. We asked for more sauce. Our waitress never came back. My sister got upset and found the manager. The final straw was when we decided we were going to just take our order to go and Bailey came over with our containers, dropped them on the table, with attitude and said, "Here you go." And walked off. She never refilled our waters or asked how we were. The manager, Troy apologized. He told us he gave her a big table before us and she was overwhelmed. She could've communicated that. He could've also stepped up and helped her, but he didn't, based on his odor, he was out back smoking cigarettes. He comped our meals and told us to smile. My mom looked like she was going to cry. I felt like I wanted to cry. We have always loved this place. We will never be back. If Bailey would've been apologetic it would have been better. But, she finished off our loyalty.

We attended a wedding celebration here at it was a fantastic venue. The views were spectacular, the food was great and the service was on point.  

It was a large venue that seemed very intimate.  There were at least 150 people and it was very comfortable.  There was a large dance floor good amount of seating are and two patios to enjoy the view of the river. 

ReLly enjoyed the venue and would recommend to friends

I've been here three times and everything I've tried has been below average. This place is trendy and decorated well, but when you have 500 different dishes to try from you can't be good at any dish. I had their "most popular" sandwich today and couldn't even finish it. I highly recommend choosing one of the 300 amazing restaurants in Nashville before wasting time on this place.

Walked by this place 3 times before having to indulge myself and give it a try! The ice cream and malt were excellent. The little red head that took our order was delightful! The multicolored hair young lady , not so much! I know scooping and pouring drinks may not be your dream job, but at least do it well! She had an attitude and made me want to return my malt quickly back at her in a forceful manner! What a little .....
Thanks for some great treats!

Love! Love! Love!! Decor (check) wine (check$   Gender neutral bathroom (check) customer service (check)   

Copper vine is a must do for groups and friends from out of town! Came we saw we conquered. Order multiple 2.5 pours and make your own flight.

Beautiful views, nice outdoor patios, big dance floor, great lighting. The roast beef station is the best thing they serve and maybe a few of the items they pass around.  But     I would def recommend this place. It has a great atmosphere and professional staff. Guests have to pay for parking($12-$14 for a wedding)

This is a solid ice cream place right in the heart of Nashville. The ice cream was great. Fairly straightforward flavors and good waffle cones. The staff was friendly and had no problem giving me a sample so I could choose a flavor. What the real bonus is to me about this ice cream parlor is that they are open late. I think I read midnight and that was on a weeknight, so maybe even later on a weekend. So while you are strolling the Broadway strip, listening to music and enjoying being outside, you can pop-in for a late night ice cream. Fabulous.

One thing I absolutely love about this place is the relaxed, casual atmosphere here. Although I don't know many of the regulars here yet, as I myself am not one (yet), I feel as though I could stop by any table on any given night and easily strike up a conversation with the guests. But I couldn't in good conscience write about my love for this place without acknowledging how crazy I am for being a dog friendly establishment. It has been a life saver for socializing our puppy during the winter time. The chalk  art work is always incredible thanks to their resident artist, one of my favorites being her rendition of Hulk Hogan. They have an ample selection of their brews, and good specials throughout the week. Their standby kolsch is always a good go to, but their seasonal never disappoint.

Greta happy hour; 1/2 priced all drinks except premium liquor. We had the Flintstones push-up and Berry refreshing. I like the push-up pop, but I want it without the liqueur and I broke up the sorbet. I'm not sure how to capture the blood orange taste without the liqueur. Berry refreshing is very sweet and quenches your thirst. Careful you might drink it really fast, but if you go during happy hour you can two for the price of one so go ahead and drink up!
Oh and while you drink for 1/2 off at HH from 4-6 pm you can enjoyed 1/2 priced food and nightly specials too!!

This place has everything that a UNR fan needs. Always have the latest styles and fashions. I usually get gift cards here for my family at Christmas or for birthdays. Mark, the owner always makes sure his customers are taken care of. They always carry so many different sizes, you will never leave empty handed. Keep up the good work and GO PACK!!

Always had great pizza there. We typically get plain, veggie, hawaiian, and/or the special pizza. Consistent in tasting fresh, generous amount of toppings and great taste. I always pick up and the wait time has always been quick although I always see them so busy. A great staple in Ardmore!

I had been looking forward to eating here for several weeks. My expectations were met in every way. The service was excellent; the cocktails were excellent; and the food was outstanding. 

The Sunomono was a real stand out as were the Spicy Crab Noodles, Ora King Salmon and Broccolini. The absolute star of the show was the Japanese Wagyu. Pricey? Yes, but it was simply excellent. 

The Japanese inspired cocktails were outstanding and our server was excellent in recommending various sakes to try.

For dessert our party tried pistachio mochi, ginger creme brûlée, and tempura chocolate cake.

This place is not cheap. You are ordering small plates that are meant to be shared, so you can run up a pretty expensive tab really quick. The food that you receive however is top shelf all the way. This is now one of my favorite spots in Nashville.

A fun food fine for lunch or dinner. A well curated environment with an equally well designed menu and plate presentation. 
Friendly staff and attentive service.
This place is amazing!! I love the environment of this restaurant. The food was incredible. I had the spicy crab noodles - will definitely come back if I come back in town!

Server was nice however they have a chunky bald chef  that walks around to talk to each of the guest and the two to three times we have came here he has never once stopped at our table? First time it happened my husband suggested it might have something to do with race but I disagreed but now I'm in total agreement. It's not a coincidence that this has happened to us each time

Was very excited to try out Helena Bakery.  I ordered the cheese plate for ~$17 (this was before the new menu). Once I paid for my order I waited by the counter for 25 minutes while they prepared my plate.  During that time three different workers rearranged the accoutrements on the plate with their bare hands, picking up and replacing each piece of cheese like they were working on a Rubik's Cube.  While I appreciate having a nice presentation it seemed a little ridiculous to have three people not wearing gloves reorganize the dish while I stood there and watched.  Finally after the 25 minutes of charcuterie design I brought the cheese plate to my table.  It came with a ramekin full of seven almonds and no crackers.  Since we wanted something crunchy to go with our cheese I walked back up to the counter to ask for more almonds to which they told me I could NOT have extra.  I then asked the employee if I could purchase more almonds for ANY amount of money.  The employee responded "NO".  For being such an expensive cheese plate without the ability to purchase more almonds I give this place 1 star.
Great store that provides superior service. Purchased several pair of jeans and accessories and am happy with all of them. Make this a staple for your closet.
My new favorite sports bar!  Excellent food! I had the Havana Bowl (recommended by our awesome server Callie) and it was delicious!

i am very surprised by the bad reviews. On my numerous visits here i loved my food, as did all of my friends. We always eat in the dining room so maybe they have better food the bar area. 
Anyway I believe this place is famous for its steaks and rightly so. The signature pepperloin steak is delicious. Always a good solid piece of beef perfectly cooked. Side portions are enormous so put on your stretchy pants before you head over to Tonys.

High quality ambiance, food, and service. The brussel sprouts were divine - especially the garlic aioli! So flavorful and crispy. The beet salad was very colorful yet light on the stomach. The charcuterie salad was a unique and delectable option on the menu. Every restaurant should add this option! It's all the variety of tastes and textures of a charcuterie board with the added bonus of dressing and greens. The fig and jam flatbread was perfect to share and very savory! Wine is on tap and comes in a variety of size options (different pour sizes, carafe, bottle, etc.). 

If I had more time in town, I would go back for their bottomless brunch! Michelle was an exceptional server who took great care of us.
A great selection of raw oysters service was good, the " chowder fried" we're a great side hidden on the menu.

Beautiful wine bar with plenty of selections on tap! We had the Cuban sandwich and burger which were delicious & reasonable priced. Nice music playing and manager came over to ask how everything was. Clean and unique restrooms and decor and table settings very inviting.

Sent my credit report to the wrong address no number shown on paperwork Called a number got outsourced to India did not understand a word that man said. Asked to be transferred he gave me a number that was not Chase.
Still trying to find the correct number to dispute the address they have on file for me.  I had a home loan that I just paid off . Thank God I don't have to deal with these people any more.
Bad burger, pieces of bone , not tasty. Great Service.

Was very disappointed in our dinner tonight.   Chopped salad way too spicy and not very good.   I wish the waitress had removed the charge from our bill after she asked why I didn't eat much.   Took a very long time to get our meal with no apology.   Will not be going back    Plenty of other choices in town.   We are sad this one has gone downhill so much as it used to be one of our go to places.

This nail salon is under new ownership, and I'm so glad I stopped in to check it out. My daughter and I had a wonderful experience there! They are very customer minded and they want you to leave happy! My daughter had a pedicure and I had a pedicure with a gel manicure. The facilities are extremely clean. Linda and Diamond were excellent. Would return in heartbeat!

This is such a cute brunch spot!  I care here with a friend and had the Green Eggs and Ham Biscuit Sandwich with Avo instead of ham and it was delicious.  The biscuit was amazing!  My friend had the fresh OJ which was great, too.  I had a latte which was also good!

And then we split the olive oil orange cake which, guess what, was also really good!  It wasn't too orangey - it was moist and delicious - kind of pound cake meets yellow cake but not too sweet.

My only complaint is that the wifi wasn't great and the bar back was reluctant about plugging my laptop in behind the bar. 

It's a great spot to meet friends, have a date, try some wines and get a little work done!

If I'm back in the area, I'd go back!

Disappointed.

I have been going to Tony's since I was a baby, literally. This used to be the nicest restaurant in Alton, IL, but that is not the case anymore.

I have had two awful experiences there within the last few months, and I don't see how I can support this establishment anymore. The first bad experience was a mess from the beginning and ended with me waiting over 30 minutes to get my bill because "the computer was down." To compensate me for my $40 bill the manager sent me a $10 gift card (thanks you cheap skate), which I gave to my parents because I was so disgusted by the service that I had no desire to go back.

Just a couple days ago my best friend was begging me to go out to eat with her and I agreed, and she chose Tony's. Great. I started off by ordering a Mojito, which is considered one of the most popular cocktails in America. According to this website it's #1...

http://www.themost10.com/10-most-popular-cocktail-drinks/

Anyways I digress. They couldn't make me a mojito for some reason so I ordered a Moscow Mule.  The waiter first asks me what is in a Moscow Mule (ginger beer + Vodka). So I made sure they had a ginger beer and explained how easy it was to make. Apparently the Moscow Mule is too difficult for the precious bartender to make. Although they had ginger beer and they clearly have vodka they refused to make me one stating that "they didn't know how to ring it in."

Anyways that's the most pathetic excuse for customer service I've ever had. I will be taking my business to Gentelin's, Moonlight and the amazing Bluff City Grill.

I know with this kind of place, they are overly nice for good tips. Regardless, all the wait staff is friendly, food is good. Fairly priced. Their signature beers, the dirty blonde and knotty brunette are really good. So many tv's, you won't miss any sport you want to watch. I've only been there a few times, but had really good service. Better than Hooters and Tilted Kilt. Melanie and McKenzie were so far my favorite waitresses. I recommend to anyone who just wants to relax and have good food and drinks.

My flight got cancelled and I ended up arriving to New Orleans airport after hours. The owner was kind enough to pick me up with his own vehicle and bring me to the lot. It took minutes to do the paperwork and I was on my way. When I returned the car he was able to help me in minutes and bring me to the airport. I will definitely use them again.
Stayed at the airport and came out for the reviews. Good local old school bar and grill. What sets this apart is the service. Outstanding.
Fantastic Brussels sprout.  They have a good selection of beer.  The service was excellent.

The beer is great! Very cold and great flavors. I had chicken and waffles and was very good. Prices are a little above average. Waitress was friendly and the service was good. Great place to watch sports endless TV's.
Tried their breakfast sandwich, bread, peanut butter cookie and iced tea = all delicious! Worth the wait.

Staff was extremely rude.  It was not a pleasure to have to do business with these people.  The uniforms are also way over priced.

My review is based on the previous owner and not the current owner.

A little bakery that appears to share dining area with the adjacent wine bar, love the warehouse atmosphere

I'm sure their menu is seasonal but we came last summer & figs were in season! 
---fig cheese honey toast with arugula: a bit pricey but it was so so so good! Giving the avocado toast trend a run for its money!!

I'd definitely stop by for a snack again next time I'm in the funk zone

If I were to describe twin peaks to someone, I would tell them it is an upscale Hooters.  The main difference between Hooters and twin peaks is the quality and the customer service. I'm not saying hooters is bad and does not have good service, but I would pick twin peaks over hooters any day of the week.   Yes, the waitresses are dressed in cow girl attire and sometimes in skimpy lingerie, which makes coming to twin peaks even more enjoyable for a guy like me, but the food is terrific and the selection of craft beer on tap also makes it more reasonable to come to twin peaks.  The TVs all around the restaurant are a great feature if you want to watch a particular game or event for the day.  My friends and I like the $2 PBR beer special they have going on every day since it allows us to save money and enjoy beer at the same time.  The wings are awesome and I've enjoyed the avocado smash burger very much!!  You will not find a food item or a beer that you will not enjoy at twin peaks!  It is priceless!
So delicious: the outdoor patio is the best. John S. was our server and he was so great. Helped us pick amazing drinks and food. Will absolutely come back!
So fun! Great drinks - wish they had more of their cocktails on happy hour but all the food was delicious!

Now there is tuna bar and the. The rest of the sushi restaurants in Philadelphia.
Don't expect rolls mounted with heaps of unrecognizable mayo mixes; this is real clean cut rolls and prime grade nigiri and sashimi.
A must go to restaurant!
The service is impeccable and the decor perfect.
Nice crowd too.
Must go

I have used Chase credit cards for over 12 years and I can say that their customer support which should be available to protect customers against crooks and scams is absolutely WORTHLESS. 
To be fair, Chase is good for when your card is being hacked or stolen and they usually immediately notify you and cancel the card, and even send you or overnight you a new card most of the time.  However, one time while traveling out of the country, our card was stolen by a pickpocket.  I reported the theft, got a verification number and when I got back to the States I found that Chase had done NOTHING.  That same card continued to be used for three weeks after I reported the theft.  After I raised heck they reimbursed me for my trouble, but it was scary.
Please pay attention to the below:
When it comes to MERCHANTS RIPPING YOU OFF, NOT PERFORMING A SERVICE PROPERLY, WHATEVER ... Chase is shamefully negligent and unhelpful.  No matter how blatant the ripoff is, or how bad or fraudulent the service by the merchant, Chase only stops payment for a month or so while they go through a fake show of support which always results in you not winning and losing your money to an outright crook.  Most of the reps they use are foreign, you waste tons of time thinking that Chase is looking out for you, but you get fooled every time.  Buyer Beware.

Chase decided to accelerate my interest rate and not notify me. After I spoke to a representative they told me that my interest rate would remain at 0% for another 7 months, and once I saw my bill, it was at 9%. The Chase manager said all he could do was apologize and suggest I just close the account. Chase is such a shame, I have all of my lines of credit and checking accounts with Chase. They clearly don't value customer relations.

Loved this place. Would have been a five but I'm EXTREMELY disappointed they've gutted the man cave by removing the couches and the pool tables. They didn't even have the firepit lit when I was there on 12/12. Sad to see a good place go downhill.

Ok I know!! It's DENNY"S!! ("Lenny's! LOL! Showing my age!) 
But after a Dr appointment, my daughter and I were looking for a breakfast place that we thought would have decent social distance policies - Denny's did not disappoint!  Staggered seating and masked staff made us feel welcomed and safe! 
Our breakfasts and the coffee were delicious. I had an omelette with a gluten free muffin and my daughter had the chicken fried steak and eggs.
Everything was fresh, hot, filling, and tasty! 
The staff were attentive and friendly! Our cups were never empty. 

Thanks!

Just wanted to touch base after our big event.  We were a bit disappointed with the DJ experience.  We thought by booking almost a year in advance, and a venue such as The Fox Theatre we would have had a more experienced DJ for the wedding.  They announced things as requested, but I don't know why we filled out the questionnaire. It was a small detail, but they referred to Natalie's dad the entire night as MR. Morris, rather than DR. Morris.  Clearly they did not reference the form.  Also, it was our understanding that the DJ would be wearing a suit or a tux.  The young man with her had no jacket or tie.

Concerning the soundcheck for our friend who was playing the guitar and singing for the father-daughter dance:
They called her the day before and said to be there 4-4:30, so she arrived at 3:30 just in case they were ready early.  She walked back with my husband, (Natalie's father), but she was just getting set up for the actual ceremony.  She said they'd do it during the cocktail hour.  Our friend stayed close by the entire time, to remain available. When the time came there had been no check and the DJ was attempting to set a mic up for vocals, and no mic for guitar (although that is what they said they would be doing when they called).  At that point our friend declined the mic because the balance of vocal and guitar would have not been good.  She ended up singing and playing with no mic whatsoever. 

We requested the DJ to interact on a moderate level.  The level of enthusiasm by the DJ was underwhelming.

Maybe I am being overly sensitive, but we had just expected more from your staff and business. We have friends who are planning weddings in the near future, and I would be hesitant to recommend you.

This place is an oasis on the corner of two busy streets downtown. The plants create an excellent barrier from the street and provides for a great atmosphere and background. This place is extremely photogenic if you're looking for pictures for instagram. I would not recommend the indoor seating. The outdoor patio seating is so much better, but it's small and fills up fast. Make a reservation for this because you want to be outside! The brussels sprouts are a must order. Even if you don't like brussels sprouts you will like these ones. The truffle fries are also a delicious appetizer. Their happy hour is weekdays 2-6pm and they have great prices for drinks and snacks. I've never been for brunch but I have heard great things about it. This place is a favorite for me and I can't wait to return!

This restaurant does not only have amazing wines and a very cute patio downtown but also good food and service every time I went there: girls day out, celebrating birthday or even a book signing.. I never had a bad experience there and that's the reason why I highly recommend it!!

So happy we found this little gem. Helena Avenue Bakery is a fairly big space, tall ceilings and plenty of seating inside and outside.

We asked for some recommendations and damn, I'm glad we did. We got a blueberry lemon scone, a croissant and a morning bun. The blueberry lemon scone was the business! The morning bun was so good - not too sweet. And the croissant was light and flakey. Coffee was good as well. Definitely make it a point to check this place out if you're in SB!

Yesterday I returned to have Dr Michael Adams put the final cap on a tooth.  I have been very pleased with  the  service he has provided over the past 12 years. My husband and I  have been coming to him since moving to Clearwater.  This is a medium sized office so the staff gets to know you well.  The office staff consists of two dentists who are are a husband and wife team, Dr Michael and Dr Pamela, with a support staff of about 8 hygienists and other staff.  The office is open Monday- Thursday. They open early in the morning to accommodate working people.  We have usually seen Dr. Michael and he is very concerned with painless dentistry. After doing a  procedure such as prepping for the cap he will call in the evening to make sure you are doing okay. I  know Dr. Pamela does the same thing.  He has referred us to others such as oral surgeons when needed and we have been very pleased with them.  I feel he has great concern for his patients and takes many seminars to keep up on what's new.

This place has THE BEST FOOD & SERVICE!!!! The Manager Wyatt Davidson was so nice that we came 2 days in a row. He made us feel special and valued. That's how you want to feel when you go out to eat. Great food, excellent service!!!! Looking forward to coming bk!!!!

Altitude is by far the best trampoline park around! We have been to all the others around town and this one is our favorite. We usually go during toddler time for my 3 year old son (almost 4). It is always very clean and the staff is very friendly. Some of the other places we have been have less than friendly staff and that is a huge turn off for us. There are so many things for my son to do and we love that there are not a bunch of bigger kids running him over. It is just as fun for the parents as well. Parents can jump during toddler time with the kids for only $2 more, which is a steal in my opinion. 

We just had my son's birthday party here during toddler time and it was a huge hit. The staff was very helpful and friendly during our whole event. They ordered and served the food for us as well as helped set up decorations and clean up. The price was more than reasonable and we will definitely be back for more birthday parties. My son had a blast!
Their food is bomblicious, love the cheese burger and the chick sandwich is one of the best I've ever had, bomb dot com!

I almost let the bad reviews keep me away from this place, but I had a craving for mushroom ravioli and decided to try it anyway. Most of these bad reviews revolve around poor service, and I was feeling exceptionally patient yesterday so my husband and I gave it a go. 
When we arrived (Wednesday night 8:45 p.m.) it was very slow, I counted two other tables inside the restaurant when we entered but several people dining at the bar area. 
The guy who sat us (Zack) was also our server, so we were able to order drinks right away. This place makes a fantastic Shirley temple. I'm normally not a soda drinker and I finished my glass. 
Zach was courteous and competent. He brought us bread and even came back by with balsamic vinegar per our request. We ordered the mac and cheese bites appetizer with truffle sauce. So delicious (you can't go wrong with fried macaroni and cheese!) We also ordered mushroom ravioli. This has always been my favorite dish from Romanos, and it did not disappoint. In fact my husband mentioned he thought they added more mushrooms than usual and we love mushrooms. 
Our entrees came with Caesar salad. This is new or newer, in the past you always had to add a salad if you wanted salad with your entree. We were surprised when it came to the table since we had not ordered them, but Zack let us know they come with our entree. I'm not a huge fan of Caesar dressing but this salad was so delicious, the lettuce was crisp and cold, the dressing was creamy and it had the perfect amount of Parmesan cheese on top. We really enjoyed our meal here. Zack came by to check on us, offereing us dessert before bringing the check. We were so full after the bread, appetizer, salad and entree we had to decline on the dessert but based on how wonderful the rest of the meal was, next time I will save room! 

Don't let the bad reviews keep you from eating here! It is a chain restaurant but if you've eaten at Romanos before you know what to expect and they definitely meet the expectations at this location. 

I give this restaurant 4 stars because it is a little on the pricy side, dinner for two with tip cost us around $56 but it was delicious and our service was great!

TRAVELERS / CUSTOMERS BEWARE!! DO NOT SOLICIT BUSINESS WITH "NIFTY CAR RENTAL"!! 

If Yelp gave the option to give NO STARS. I would. 

The services this horrid establishment provided proved to not only be unprofessional but distasteful at its best. One employee in particular, whom i regret to remember her name, was very rude and sarcastic. In in a couple of instances, we notified the employees at the "Nifty Car Rental" to let them know that we wanted to keep the car that day, however they responded in a mocking and sarcastic manner. Taking the hint that the employee of "Nifty Car Rental" did not want to deal with our courtesy calls, we asked to speak to a more understandable and professional employee. (Which you would think would help, but alas... NOPE.) 

Do not bother asking for quotes. The shady business that is "Nifty Car Rental" will charge you whatever they please. The consistency is not there between pricing, employees, and management.

The icing on the cake of this abominable organization is when it was the day to return the vehicle, they did not give us a ride to the airport. Therefore we were subjected to WALK to our terminal. 

AVOID "'SHITTY' CAR RENTAL" IF POSSIBLE. YOU MIGHT AS WELL WALK. 'CAUSE THEY'RE GONNA MAKE YOU DO IT ANYWAYS.
The Carpenteria Avocato on Sourdough toast is amazin. Nice setting and wonderful food!
This crew is awesome - super fast, beautiful quality and great pricing. And they are very nice people too. A great experience. A super duper positive recommendation!
Yum!!!  Tried their banana chip and I swear it was like eating banana cream pie!  Fabulous ice cream.  Teeny tiny shop but worth the visit.  :o)

This place Bl**s. I am customer experience centric and this place doesn't get it. Pay a cover charge and not find a table. Go to a table and told you need to go back to the hostess station and make a reservation. Wait! I just paid $5 cover charge for no place to sit and eat. Then when I go to leave I tell Mr. Big Shot at the table where they are extorting money for entrance. Mr. Big Shot tells me the cover charge doesn't guarantee a seat. WHAT! I'll NEVER go back to this dump. I'll never recommend this dump. Give me a good experience in a dump and and I'm good. A bad experience in a dump ? NO WAY. 

Get your reality readjusted, Twin Peaks. There are better places for food etc. unless you rate food according to breast exposure. I'll be back in Indy fir business but I'll never be back here.

I went in this restaurant with my family of five I was in back of a party of two that was sat down immediately and then the host turned me and my family away and said we don't have any room for you he was very unprofessional and rude it's no wonder I never eat at this place do yourself and favor and skip that place to eat go to Cheesecake Factory or Olive Garden  they treated me and my family disgusting very unacceptable

I have went to the link that u asked me to go to

I was looking for a new nail salon for pedicures and found this place. It had great reviews so I figured it was worth a shot, find a place closer to home, that HAS to be better than my previous pedicure place at the Largo Mall which was questionable at best. 
I took today off from work and called to see if I needed an appointment but they said it wasn't busy so I could come on in anytime (Wednesday at noon). 

I was greeted by Diamond and she told me about the manicures with dipping powder instead of gel. I decided to try it out! New day, new nail salon, new procedure! Mani-pedi day!

The salon was clean, they set me up in the massage chair, offered me a drink and Na came over for the pedicure. She was amazing! I got black gel on my toes and Diamond started working on the dipping for my nails all in the comfort of my massage chair. 

Dipping is like acrylic nails, come to find out, although healthier with the vitamin powder and can last up to 3 weeks. I picked a tanzanite blue/purple and Diamond shaped the nails to look very natural as dipping is layers of thickness once piled on. 

Na and Diamond were so sweet and friendly and the massage for my feet, legs and hands was Devine! This is my new nail salon! Great place!!

I was most impressed with the service and attention I got when I shopped here. It was an unplanned visit - actually I hadn't really noticed it before and had some time so decided to check it out. I was very impressed that their food is also made without soy! This is becoming an increasingly intense issue for me because; 1. my allergy has worsened, 2. they've started putting soy in baked goods - even the grocery stores with bakeries right inside!

I had a chocolate croissant which was awesome because it's extremely rare to find chocolate made without soy (which really gets on my nerves!!!). They also had some kind of marble bread on special that had a swirl of chocolate running through it. Very tempting indeed, but I resisted because I simply couldn't afford it. 

The atmosphere is decent - it's just a quaint little place with a few tables.

The yelp summary "Meh. I've experienced better" captures it well. The hotel is perfectly normal, but here is the problem. They were never able to give us working keys to our room. So it took us about 45 minutes to get into the room because we had to try 4 sets of keys before the desk clerk finally walked us to our room and let us in using the master key. The trouble continued the second day when the maid and desk clerk had to let us into our room anytime we wanted to enter. The front desk clerk told us he was actually still in training which is why he did not know how to quickly give us a new room. The person who was supposed to be training him did not show up on time so he was working alone.

I ate at this restaurant for lunch and had the blue cheese wedge salad, trying to be somewhat healthy.  It was delicious and I could not even eat it all. I was with a large group of women and the manager sent over free dessert.  Beautiful to look at and delicious!  I went back with my husband in the evening and sat in the sports bar area.  Fantastic service and great food.  We all loved it.  The front dining room is too large and impersonal for my taste, but love the sports lounge.  Great prices.  We will be back.
Awesome Greek style Pizza!!! Deep dish & thx best crust.   Wings are delicious too. When in need...we head there from East Falls for pizza wings & fries for take out. Worth the trip!!

A girl friend and I had dinner rez's for 6pm on a Thursday at Tuna Bar. It was a beautiful night, so not surprisingly it wasn't long before it got crowded. We opted to get a drink at the bar before heading to our table, so after Happy Hour it started picking up for sure. 

My friend and I shared a bunch of sushi rolls, and split a seaweed salad. 
My favorite thing I ordered was probably the peanut and avocado roll - surprisingly! 

I may be back, but I want to explore other sushi places in the city first.
The ice cream was fresh and amazing. We got the Tennessee Fudge and I would highly recommend it to everyone.
Best rates on the coast! New manager who really cares about his customers. Will definitely  recommend.
WOW! Everything we ordered was perfect! Best shrimp and grits EVER. Our server, Jen was awesome.

We haven't ate at this restaurant in a while and thought we would give it a try. It was a very disappointing pick up order for sure. We were giving a meal with an oil cup that leaked all over the place because the lid wasn't secured properly. The Mushroom ravioli was over cooked and difficult to cut, not standard for sure. My wife's soup came in a child's to go cup and not near the portion you would get at the restaurant. The Mac and cheese balls were over cooked and burnt on some areas. I'm so disappointed in what I wanted to be a nice Italian meal.

Omg. This ice cream was sooo good! I'm so glad I found this place on Yelp because it was just minutes from where we were. I had two scoops, banana pudding and pralines and cream. I was in heaven. The waffle cone was great too. It was thin so the ice cream started to sweat through. It just meant that I needed to eat it faster! This ice cream was definitely 5 stars. My only complaint would be the man who rang me up. He made some very inappropriate comments to me. I was shocked that he would say that to a paying customer... aside from that, I would highly recommend!

Like what they did with the space. Feels huge inside.  The beers are solid, like they were when it was just mainstay open in the space. Main issue are the food prices, $15 for a burger and no fries, $4 for 1 pretzel stick, really let's rethink that this.

I love this place!!! This was my first visit and I am hooked. The food was delicious and the drinks were great. Our server was very friendly and attentive. I love the decor and the inside or outdoor seating options. This cute place was definitely a vibe!! Will definitely be back.

Tony's...there is almost nothing bad to say.  They have been a landmark in Alton for as long as I remember.  The pepperloin is to die for, the pasta is terrific, especially their red sauce pastas.  Their white sauce is a little, well it's different.  I'm not sure how to describe it but it isn't my favorite.  The pizza is heavenly, again the sauce is a little sweet and it is covered with top shelf ingredients.  All of the steaks are out of this world good.  As far as ambience goes, well the "dining room" side is a little stuffy for me and my wife on most occasions but it is nice for a special occasion.  It is quiet and dimly lit, perfect for a romantic night out but for us old married folk?, we prefer the "bar" side.  There are plenty of high and low top tables to sit at as well as the bar and in the warmer months, even a nice little patio to sit out on.  The bartenders and wait staff on the bar side are much more laid back then the restaurant side.  Tony's is a great place for food but also drink as well as they have dozens of beers on tap....better than most micro breweries.  In short, the food is great, you have a choice in ambience, and the staff is friendly and helpful.  Oh and for the review that said they are dirty?  It is one of the cleanest restaurants around.  You must have had dirt on your glasses.
This pizza restaurant makes some of the best New York style pizzas in Tampa. They also make a sandwiches and a few other dishes. My boyfriend and I get a pizza from Joes whenever we crave pizza :)

in town from SA, TX and DAMN! in my best Kendrick Lamar voice. 

Waygu!
Stuffed wing!
tuna tartare!
Karaage! 
Gold can Sake!
Tremendous waitress!
Great Lunch!  
Better Dinner!

My tastebuds thank you very much!

Dyno-Mite!
We picked up some breakfast snacks from Helena Ave. Bakery to bring back to our hotel and were so pleasantly surprised by the amazing food quality, freshness and creativity.

Don't sleep on the Elvis-style banana bread with peppered bacon and peanut butter.  There's enough for left-overs later in the day.

The salmon bagel with pickled onions, fresh dill and cream cheese is perfectly toasted, presented and packed with flavor.

We also loved the green eggs and ham sandwich.  Sky-high fluffy eggs with shaved ham, cheese and green harissa for a spicy/tangy kick.

The coffee was very flavorful as well.

Thank you Helena Ave. Bakery for the great start to our day!

Gotta be my favorite craft beer place in Indy. The tasting room has a nice atmosphere with some couches and bar top tables. There also an outdoor patio out front. Not a huge place. They don't do food, but the quality of the beer definitely makes up for that.  I would stack up their menu of beers up against any others in Indiana hands down. The spend their money on quality, not advertising. Check em out.

I went to Tuna Bar for happy hour on a weeknight! The restaurant wasn't too busy that night, although it seems pretty packed on weekends. We ordered everything but the miso soup from the happy hour menu. We got the several of each of the spicy tuna rolls, spicy salmon rolls, salmon avocado rolls, special rolls, chicken and shrimp dumplings and edadame. We basically got almost everything that was on the happy hour menu, since it was pretty limited. Each of the rolls came with 6 pieces, and we ordered 3 rolls per person. The rolls were good, but I would probably prefer to go somewhere like Double Knot, that has a more extensive happy hour menu. However, I liked the vibe and pretty decor of the restaurant!

Room was clean, check-in was contactless, and smooth. 

No room cleaning during our stay and no answer when we rang the front desk or operator. Room was small, as others noted, and the mattress has a trough where most people must sleep. The AC unit was loud. I have stayed at better Fairfield Inns.
This place is the most convenient and delicious spot in the area!! Wide variety of pizzas, wings and fries and they're open until very late hours. The best place to be in Manayunk.

Seriously I came here for hockey but would go out of my way to eat here. The food is fantastic from chicken wings to salads to appetizers. Everything was amazing and the service is top shelf! I planned all of my meals on our trip around this place which I never do. I'm all about trying new things but I had to try multiple things on this menu. Thanks for making our tourney losses more palatable!

I ordered an ice cream with my 9 year old daughter. When we got to the register to pay, another guy cut in front of us and ordered 2 chai lattes, I didn't say anything because I figured he'd ring us up before making the mans drinks, nope. He began making the drinks after ringing him up so I asked him if he could ring me up for my daughters ice cream because my family was waiting outside and he got very rude and said, "I'm sorry you're so impatient" as I was explaining that we were actually next in line he told me to "f**k off" in front of my daughter. I went outside and told my husband and we went back in to speak to the manager who completely ignored me. The same man at the register who was rude began yelling about how I had attitude, yes I did, after her cursed at me in front of my daughter. Then some skinny guy with glasses began yelling and telling my husband to get out then threw his hands up and said, "I really don't f**king care". We left before it got really out of hand. I will do everything in my power to contact the owner, I hope you all working there are reading this, you need training in customer service. There's a reason you're working at an ice cream shop well into your twenties. Grow up.

Raw oysters were bad!!  The Rittenhouse Roll (lobster) left us with indigestion.  Dragon Roll claims "crab" but is mock crab stick.  Prices are high relative to portion, even for Philadelphia.  Parking is impossible, so be prepared to pay.  Would not return or recommend.

We specifically came over to the Village Tap Room from a different bar/restaurant to check out the new digs and get some food.  We were sadly disappointed.  

We ordered three things off the menu to share:

Mac and Cheese with Chorizo: It was ok at best and it did not look at all appealing. 

Chicken Wings:  They were small and really had no flavor ( we ordered them hot) there are way too many places to go to have good wings (Keystone Sports Review or Fat Dan's) to think about coming here again for wings

Potato Skins:  These were good, but really, how hard is it to cut up a baked potato, put some cheese and crumbled bacon on top and stick it under the broiler a second to melt the cheese.

I was really excited about this place after I read the IBJ article but nothing that was in that article was real life when we went. 

I will say, our server, when we could get her attention, was very nice. 

Major improvements need to be made. The bar is higher than this in Broad Ripple

I really like this shop. It has a great selection of clothes, accessories, and all the products are expertly curated by the owner who has impeccable taste. 
Signficant others, this is a great place to find gifts for your beloved man. 
Kind of surprised this shop is in my neighborhood but honored all the same. 
Too classic for Keystone at the Crossing
Too styled for Mass Ave.
Too refined for Broad Ripple
Too sophisticated for Fountain Square
So, good job, Irvington. You're lucky to have such a great store for men right in the center of your heart.

I purchased almost $1,000 in one visit here and was met with such a rude and annoyed manager making this such a lovely experience. Notice my sarcasm. I will NOT be shopping in this store again until that lovely pleasant woman who hates her job is removed. What a shame.

Besides tasteless. Had the seafood salad which was over priced.  But how you mess up a salad.  So they so called had this dressing already on there. Well I had to ask for some Ranch dressing. And that was tasteless. I will not be returning. If you can give a lame salad no telling how the other food will taste.

Mikes ice cream is a great place to go for hard style ice cream. 
The location is in the middle of downtown. Where all of the famous bars are. Live music is playing at just about every place but mikes. 
The location is tiny. There are a few tables inside but I just took mine outside. 
The staff was super friendly and asked me 2 times if I was being helped. I just got a hot coco because it was raining out and my friend got a ice cream. He told me the ice cream was very good. 
I like the fact that they have a place other than a bar or eatery where you can go for deserts. It is right in the middle of everything. I would recommend it if you want something after a night out or just to get ice cream and go for a walk around town. 

PROS:
-Location

CONS:
-very small inside

I have been here a few times. It is right on the main tourist trek on Broadway in downtown Nashville. I am not sure why, since Ice Cream and Alcohol doesn't mix. I know they have it there for the tourist with their children...but I just feel that Broadway in Nashville is JUST NOT THE RIGHT PLACE for small children. 

I know we are trying to promote family travel...but okay, off my soap box..The location is nice. The prices way too high (again for the tourist). I do like the interior. Reminds of the past, but not doesn't look original...
I am not that impressed. Typical high priced ice cream parlor

This is a great place to get a bit of breakfast and coffee. The bakery has both indoor and outdoor garden seating. Nice atmosphere. Cheerful employees. 

We got a cinnamon roll and the chicken sandwich to share for breakfast, along with a couple of lattes. The cinnamon roll was massive - great for sharing. Lots of good cinnamon. The chicken sandwich comes on a brioche bun, with bacon and a sweet and spicy jam. The chicken is perfectly cooked, crispy and savory outside and juicy inside. I would definitely recommend making this a place to get breakfast while in Santa Barbara.
Great, fresh bibimbap. The owner is incredibly friendly and kind. I will definitely be back soon!
Clean! Large! Multiple options to challenge your bounciest skills. Looking forward to many return visits.

I've been to Copper Vine twice now and can say that both experiences have been less than mediocre. 

The space is beautiful; walking distance to the dome jf you want to go before the game or easily accessible to an after work happy hour for people who work downtown. 

The menu is creative but maybe a little too ambitious and the kitchen seems to be a little sloppy. The best appetizer I've had is the lump crab deviled eggs which are served as 3 halves. Three. Not 4, not 2. This makes splitting awkward and every time I go I chuckle about not getting the remaining half. I've had the ratatouille which is hearty but despite all the different ingredients tastes like it's just oregano. This dish also led to unfortunate digestive issues later. The second time I visited it was for brunch and my crab cake Benedict, along with another persons dish, arrived with hard boiled eggs which were supposed to be poached. I stuck my fork in the egg expecting the yolk to come dripping out but instead the ball just rolled elsewhere on the plate. I felt bad, but I had to ask for another egg. Even though we were one of maybe 4 parties in the entire restaurant, by the time I got our servers attention the crab cakes were cold. The egg they brought me later was undercooked enough that I questioned if it would make me sick (the white still has clear parts in it) so I opted not to eat it. 

I feel like I've given them a fair shot at this point and they've disappointed me each time so I don't plan on returning again.

Loved Green Pheasant. We went with another couple and it was about $100 per couple, food and drinks included. This is great for Nashville. Every plate we tried was great - mushrooms, sausage fried rice, ikinari steak, SPICY CRAB NOODLES, and all of the sashimi. Recommend for lunch or dinner!

This place was not inexpensive, but I was prepared for that after seeing a very helpful picture of their menu. I enjoyed my visit, I ate at the bar and the bartenders were great, both giving me space to eat, and also not neglecting me. I ordered a "cold" item and a "hot" item. I felt that the Hamachi was a day or so older than it should have been, with a slightly fishy taste, but nevertheless the food was very tasty. Great combination of apple, jalapeno and a crunchy item which I'm too unsophisticated to identify. The salmon "hot"item was great and exactly what I was looking for. The food combined with the locally brewed Proper  Sake made for a great meal.
I would return.

I would like to give this place 3.5 stars but we all know that's not possible.  My wife and I were out and had heard a lot about this place and decided to give it a try.

When we entered we noticed that my wife was the only girl in the establishment that wasn't working.  No big deal.  Our hostess turned out to be our waitress and was with us immediately.  She took our drink order and came back quickly with our waters and shortly thereafter with our cocktails.  We decided to order the pretzel and asked if they were large or small (they sell them in 1 or 2 pretzel options).  She said they weren't large so we ordered two.  When they arrived we were surprised at how large they were.  She offered to change it to one pretzel, but it wasn't a big deal so we kept them both.

We both ordered a variation of the philly chese steak sandwich.  I guess I shouldn't have expected much, but the steak was heavily seasoned with pepper and not the most tender meat I've ever had.  We also ordered bbq sauces and buffalo sauces on the side.  I was a bit surprised that they charged us $.50 per sauce.

The waitress was with us constantly, but not too much.  I would probably try this place again, but more likely with buddies as opposed to my wife.  Not a bad place.

Stopped in for breakfast.  Super hungry. My cousin and I decided to order a few items and share "family style." Our menu = zucchini soup, avocado toast, ricotta toast, potatoes, bacon and a blueberry lemon scone.  All delicious!  Plates are small so if you come here with friends and can't decide what to eat I recommend sharing.  It's a decent amount of food and you don't get stuffed.  Avocado toast..good. Ricotta honey toast...good. Potatoes...good. Cappuccino...good.

I work downtown and this is ALWAYS my choice for the best coffee downtown to get me through the shift! They always take care of me as a local. I love Mike's!! Also, of course the homemade ice cream is unbeatable

Take care here else your car may be wrongly towed.  Restaurant is located in strip center of multiple businesses sharing a common lot. Apparently a dispute between tenants has led this owner to tow cars, in spite of the fact that their are no signs reserving or restricting parking to certain spaces for certain businesses.  Led to an expensive morning for me.

This place is great. I feel like Philly has the whole spectrum of seafood (ranging from pretty mediocre to incredible), and Tuna Bar definitely falls on the latter side. Tucked away next to the Delaware River, this place is a great place for hanging out with friends, going on a date, or just grabbing a drink. My friend and I got multiple sushi rolls, and drinks as well. The cocktails are stellar as well, and they complement the dishes perfectly. It's not the cheapest meal, so I would plan accordingly before you start ordering everything on the menu (and trust me, you will definitely want to)

I had smoothie kings in other locations out of Arizona and I always enjoyed them I was excited to see that they were opening one not too far from where I live it took me a while to make it over that way but I'm so glad that I stopped in tonight on my way home from work I had the Caribbean Way and added frozen yogurt it is delicious, for my mother I purchased a Greek yogurt pineapple mango I had a sip and that will be my next one that I get next time.
Some might find that they're a little pricey but it's well worth your money especially the one that's the Caribbean way because it is actually a meal replacement smoothie, and trust me I would rather spend a little bit more for a smoothie that's going to be a meal replacement and keep me full.

Gross. Nasty. Freezer burnt. Lazy workers at night time. Smelled like cat urine through the sticky air. I feel like need bath. Over priced. Workers were talking smack about the customers in ears reach. Never again.

Rob was absolutely Fantastic. I can't begin to explain what a phenomenal Job he did, I am just so blown away. We searched for 6 months for the most perfect DJ for our wedding. We wanted to find someone who had experience, was charismatic, got the crowd up and moving, and can drive the wedding. We had invited 150 people and we needed someone who can entertain all those individuals. We asked friends and family and he came highly recommended from my husbands friends that just got married. Our initial meeting just blew me away. He asked all the right questions, asked for a detailed itinerary to go off of. He even spent two full hours one day meeting with us to go over the itinerary step by step and adding his thoughts and experience for smooth transitions. (I don't know anyone that would do that) The way he took charge at my wedding just completely blew me away! All my friends and Family are still talking about what an amazing DJ he was and how he got everyone out of their seats. Being in his spot was no simple task, I honestly can't thank Sierra Pro Events/Rob enough for the amazing job he did. Thank you for making our day so perfect!

Brunch in the Big Easy!  There are so many spots for brunch but this aesthetic is BOMB. SUPERRRRRR cute. The food matches the ambiance!  Shrimp and Grits, duck leg and waffle, steak and eggs... You really can't go wrong. $25 Bottomless mimosas during brunch.  (P.S. Texas, please take away the anti-bottomless mimosa law ). If you're in NOLA, especially with a group (we had 9 of us) check out Copper Vine! AMAZING! Joseph will take great care of you.

I feel like I got ripped off.  They talk a nice talk but when it comes down to it, they don't deliver.  My car was supposed to be fixed to turn in- a lease.  Well, the bumper was missing the luggage strip, the front still had dents & paint missing & I was quoted 1,000 but charged almost double that.  1800. Good luck with these guys. Really, I mean that. Good luck!!!! Maybe their practices work out in Camarillo where they're from but, I sure hope they raise their standards here because I don't think Santa Barbarians put up with that second rate nonsense (bs)
We tried several of the dishes.  Nothing great.  Very bland.  If you just need some overpriced, untasty, sustenance, this will do.
No stars. Refused to let my service dog in yesterday. Rude welcome. Why won't this establishment follow laws and not ruin my family get together??? Do not support this restaurant.
Too many flavors, so little time! WIsh I could have tried them all but had to settle on one since the prices were a little steep for multiple scoops. Great place to stop for dessert!

If you can get past the uniforms, this place has GREAT food, cold beer and awesome service. Seems like what we all want in a restaurant, isn't it?  Try it 

We just keep coming back
Thanks so much for the birthday meal!!!  Lauren took such good care of us! And so nice that waitresses remember us and come over to say hi. Makes us feel special. Good job Sam.

so i've called before to inform management that there are FREQUENTLY many boxes from their restaurant in the parking lot of my apartment buildings. (due to the fact that the back of their building is right next to my parking lot) i often have to gather the boxes myself and move them to the dumpster to avoid damage to my car and others. 
i've noticed this issue occurs because instead of putting their empty boxes straight into their dumpster, they throw them out the back door until someone decides to get around to it. and by then they've probably lost 10 or more boxes that are now scattering about with the wind in Ardmore. thanks for polluting our neighborhood Ardmore Pizza.

This was absolutely delicious!!!!  I had the itali-bano which is Italian braised pork, prosciutto cotto, deli pickles, and mustard aioli.  It was soooo good and needed absolutely nothing else.  It was also HUGE, I could not eat it all.  It doesn't look that big when you get it, but then it's like that never ending plate of spaghetti (o:  I am happy to see they will be coming back to my work as I think I want to try the Italian Beef and Parmesan Truffle Fries over the next two visits!

I paid my credit card on time w/ only a $8.99 balance, paid in full.  The next bill I received doubled that, they claimed I owed a late penalty fee.  Here's the thing, I paid it one time - MY time Pacific Coast Standard Time.  THEY credited it their time, making my payment late.  

I've had their credit card since 1998.  I won't be doing business w/ Chase ever again, this is just one of several incidents.  Bad business losses business.  Greedy ass company.
Just stopped by for pastries for breakfast. Super nice people and very dog friendly. Will definately be back.

The place is fun but the food is just okay. Definitely just more so bar food. We've had multiple different things there and I really wouldn't say there's anything that I go back for but the environment is a good time.
Great place to kill an afternoon! Lots of booths and great dealers. When you walk in, the new stuff is to the right, we go left.
The ice cream was amazing. I had the Tennessee fudge. The ingredients were fresh and delish. We loved it. The staff was loads of fun.

There is absolutely nothing I've had there that I didn't like. That's a really rare thing for me. I like disliking things. Even the things I know I don't like that other people have offered me have been not hated.

The downsides of this place are it's crowded, the one entrance one exit ends up being a choke point at times, and there are a conspicuous number of tourists with luggage that wander in and take up a lot of space. Not sure why that is.

Get what you desire here, don't try and count calories, it's not worth it. Your ice cream dreams are just a foot away from you, give in to your inner fat kid. You may regret it later, but you're not going to regret it then.

Not your typical breakfast experience. Unique menu options, beautiful presentation, and high quality ingredients. Place you dream of coming back too. On the pricier side. 

Con: wish napkins were more available. Could be uncomfortable waiting with your mouth dirty to ask for them.

Best BLT (with Burrata Cheese) I have ever tasted!!
I care a lot about sandwiches, and Helena crushed this one.

Sourdough was magically toasted and did not scrape but kissed the roof of my mouth, with all of the flavors between this beautifully fermented bread singing together in harmony.
Wildly impressed and will be back for more!!

I ordered a caesar salad, a square white pizza and a square plain with bacon. All were delicious! Best pizza I've had from Main street in a long time since Caputo's went out of business. They have a large menu with sandwiches and other food too. Definitely try it out! It said you could order online but it wasn't working when I tried so I called to place my order and picked it up. Keep up the good work!

This place is literally the worst customer service. They messed up my order then were very rude telling me it was my fault for not checking before the delivery guy left.... which i did and he told me to call! SO GLAD they are a-holes and rude since it helped me find way better  places to eat. Ardmore pizza, just another mediocre pizza shop except rude employees. PASS.

Have been here for both brunch and dinner! They have unlimited mimosas or rose' for brunch! The food is not heavy and very delectable! Try the duck leg and waffle for brunch and seafood bouillabaisse for dinner! For appetizer try the crabmeat deviled eggs! Haven't tried the wine on tap, but the sangria was good!

Don't waste your money here! Take it to Olive Garden where their food is actually worth the money! About 20 bucks for the most bland pasta I've ever had and absolutely like 3 pieces of chicken, also bland and My fries were cold and soggy. I was super excited to try this place and I should've just burned my money instead. $28 down the drain for the worst "Italian food" I've honestly ever had. Olive Garden is slightly cheaper and taste delicious.

Came to visit my friend always looking for a new spots to try Helena caught my attention and we came to try... I got the spicy fried chicken very delicious and the chicken was soo crispy on point and the bread so soft and fluffy . The smashed potatoes with the spicy ketchup was good too. This place did not disappoint. Cute spot

My wife and I had 7 items. Next time it'll be 14. So dang good. Server Sam was most gracious, especially when my card was declined because it was deactivated. That's skill! Jess and Trey are doing exciting things in this town and my tummy is thankful.
The food was great and fast service. Jayme was my server, she was very funny and a attentive.

Terrible! No customer service what so ever. We sat and waited for an order to be placed. They never answered with the button pushed. We said something to one of the car hops and said that one wasn't working.  No sign placed on there. He didn't offer to take our order or any help what do ever.

Worst Denny's I've ever been too, mold all over the side of strawberry's. Ordered biscuits and gravy and it tastes like the gravy been sitting all night, disgusting.. the server Trinity was soo rude made it seem like she did something to my food.. I'm sorry but if your life is so horrible you have to take it out on innocent customers at work that just want what they pay for,  you should get a new career and keep whatever problems you have at home.. this place needs shut down and the health department needs to come check more!!

I spent an hour here and only got through 1/4 of it! Basically, this place is huge. 

The old-crap lover in me was thoroughly satisfied, and I saw lots of mid-century modern pieces, which is my favorite. 

The aisles can be tight, so navigating a stroller through this place can be tricky. It's best to just not bring kids here, because there are so many fragile things at kid-eye-level. 

At the front of the store is an eating area with table to sit at. There are small snacks to purchase -- chips and cookies and whatnot.

Do not get a credit card with this company unless you want to be charged for items not knowlingly agreed to by client.  The website would not allow disputing the charges online.  When calling to dispute the charges, it took a long time and representative was insulting.   I was thinking about setting up a checking account and savings account with Chase, but after this experience, forget it.  BEWARE!!!!

Went to Green Pheasant last week to entertain clients in from Minnesota.  I had been prepped by a couple of my colleagues that the food was "life changing" and, I am pleased to say, that they did not disappoint.  Between the 5 of us, we ordered probably 15 different small plates and **every** one was exceptional.  In particular, the Spicy Crab Noodles, Wagyu Steak, and Gyoza were excellent.  Our server was outstanding and very informative.

Amanda was fantastic! I'm from the restraint industry and can find flaws pretty quickly but this visit was great. Part of the atmosphere is an Italian song performed a capella by one the three hostesses. And I was told they come sing at your table if you ask.

We usually love this place. Sunday night, not so much. Not many people in to eat but plenty of staff. 
Several things on the menu were either not available or the wait person came much later to tell me they ran out of something. They put Italian dressing on my husband's salad along with a side of Ranch (which is what he asked for.) My daughter's order was wrong so they comp'd us on that. The food was not as good as we are used to. Keep trying guys, we'll see you in a few months.
This was by far one of my favorite restaurants in Nash! The atmosphere and food were amazing. Will be returning on my next trip.

The worst $140 (for two), I've ever spent in a restaurant. Small plates indeed. The website makes the place look glamorous and beautiful, but we were shown to an area, upstairs, that reminded me of an employee break room. The $28 sushi was good, everything else was tiny, bland, or just plain not as it was described. A $16 plate described as pork was actually peppers. Pretentious, underachieving and overpriced.

We walked over to Mike's after our dinner at Etch based on the excellent reviews I saw on Yelp. The girls behind the counter were very helpful and generous with the samples. 

My husband got the homemade chocolate ice cream in a cake cone and I got the orange sherbet in a cake cone too. Both our ice cream were delicious. Perfect ending to a perfect evening.

After a long night of dancing we were sooo hungry!!! thankfully DeSandro on Main was still open! We always make sure to stop here because of how fun the staff is. They joke with us and always make us some great pizza. The other night we were feeling hungry but healthy, so veggie pizza it was! There wasn't any pies out so they custom made us a fresh one. He loaded it up with all the veggies even though it was a few minutes till closing. They have a huge selection of seating outside and it happened to be a beautiful night. We got to enjoy our huge veggie pizza pie under the moonlight sky. Thanks DeSandro on Main we loved it!

This place is so close to my apartment, so I thought I'd give it a shot. They're always around at brew/beer festivals, too! 

I decided to go because I wanted to try the place out, and they also were having free stand up comedy on Friday! 

I can't give this place a full five stars, because it just doesn't have that atmosphere where you feel like you belong or fit in. I think it's partially because it's not as "homey" as some of the other breweries in town. I tried one of their brews, the saison, I believe. It was good, but nothing to write home about. 

Their staff was extremely helpful in getting me and my friend chairs to sit as the comedians were on. It was a good experience, one that will have me coming back some time in the future.

The food for the most part is really good. The beer is very cold and the bloody Mary's are the best around. The staff is friendly and knowledgeable of their restaurants menu. 

Unfortunately several times after being seated the waitresses are slow to even take a drink order. When I come in without friends the hostess looks irritated I don't want to sit at the bar. 

I'll still patronize Twin Peaks. Great seating and there is always something on the TV.  Plus the Bloody Marys.

LOVED this food. At there St. Patrick's Day (who knew you could get good Irish food at a Greek Restaurant). Good service. I had Pete's Favorite Greek Salad and it was so huge. A bit pricey at $10.99 but it really was great.

I would definitely go there again.

Amazing experience at this beautiful new addition to the downtown dining scene. The host was warm and seated us immediately, manager checked in to make sure all was great, and our server Lauren V was one of the best we've had in town. Extremely knowledgeable, and every single recommendation she gave was fantastic. The spicy crab noodle dish was the highlight, and the broccolini and chicken gyoza were fantastic as well. For a refreshing, light dessert, the blueberry mochi was delicious, and the tempura fried chocolate cake was rich and indulgent. Drinks were thoughtful and unique and a perfect compliment to the meal. The gin and ginger cocktail (golden boy, maybe?) was my favorite. Can't wait to return and try more!
Had really good food and adult drinks! Our waitress wasn't the nicest. Since we are in a pandemic they had to break our friend group up and do 3 and 3 at a table!
Pleased with our experience. Good food reasonably priced. Friendly service and live music was excellent. We'll be back.
