We ordered pastrami sandwich, it's salty & less pastrami and this very expensive banana bread without a single walnut. Not worth the wait

This is only my second time here. The food service took an hour and 10 minutes. When my food did get here my girlfriend didn't get hers so by the time I ate my food it was cold. Service manager Teresa took care of everything and apologized for their service tonight. Andrew at the bar was great and took good care of us. Due to the customer service by Andrew and Teresa, we will be return customers.

Dropped in to pick up a salad and decided to build one of my own.  Picked everything and the server tossed it for me (big plus).  Took it to go so it was in a plastic bowl with one of those really hard to remove lids (I guess it's not spilling!).  Salad was just good, not amazing.

I really tried but don't get the "a-peel" of Caviar & Bananas.  First off, it's all metered parking or pay for the covered garage next door. So lunch with a friend ended up costing $8 to park. The space is large and open, filled with light and multiple places to sit.  There are three stations to order food along with to-go items and a small market area. We arrived before 11:30am so the first station was serving breakfast along with coffee & teas. I assume it would have a lunch menu after 11:30 but didn't check before I left. The other two stations make salads or sandwiches. There's the option to order from the menu or make your own, pretty standard choices and most things on the menu contain meat so not a lot of choice for vegetarians.  I decided to go with the ricotta toast.  To me the bread is the foundation when ordering toast and it can make or break the meal. This toast was two standard slices of bread from a grocery store loaf, so nothing special at all. Topped with ricotta cheese, pistachios and honey, it was filling but that's about all I can say. My lunch companion was equally as unimpressed with her egg sandwich. I ordered a hot tea, which was the standard tea bag in a paper cup of hot water. I assume the attraction here is the location, making it a place for surrounding business people to walk to for a quick meal. Definitely no reason to drive out of your way for a cafeteria style meal. Not a top banana and don't even get me started on the caviar 'cuz there's nothing fancy about this quick casual restaurant.

Ok this place is a little tough to get to since it's in the heart of downtown Nashville- we went on a Friday night- needless to say there was no place to park- so we circled and one ran in! Well worth it!! This was the best ice cream I've had for quite some time- the staff was friendly and helpful- grabbed our treats and was out in 10 min! Creamy and had a great flavor!
Definitely would go back next time I'm in Nashville!

We have been three times....the food has been perfectly prepared.   the flavors have been perfect with each dish.
The Steamed Pheasant was bland for us.
Last night the daily fish sashimi, crab noodles, mushrooms, & skirt steak were all perfect.
The wait service has been perfect for each visit....
Thank you for an incredible addition to dining in BNA.

Cute little hole in the wall on South Street, delicious and affordable albeit limited seating. Not to fret, there is the option for takeout and its just as good! Dare I say this is better than Hmart? For under 10 dollars I am not sure there is a better alternative for bibimbap in Philadelphia. Would definitely recommend!
Shay installed a few deadbolts and locks around my new house and did an exceptional job. He also offered top of the line locks at very reasonable prices. Highly recommended!

A true hidden gem! This sports lounge is located INSIDE the Advent Health Center Ice rink! Who would have thought?! We came in on a Friday night and there was live music in the corner and plenty of TVs showing an array of games playing. The lounge is on the second floor of the rink and you can see the rinks down on the first floor which is really cool. They have a full bar and excellent food! Staff was friendly and always had a smile. I ordered a sangria and the Buffalo chicken Mac and cheese. It came with garlic bread and was full of crispy chicken and scallions. My date got the BBQ bacon burger and said it was delicious! Will definitely be back when I'm back in the area! (PS-I hear they even have brunch!)

I would just stick to their bakery items. My husband and I were craving a burger, so we split one. They did cut in 1/2 but didn't bring us a extra plate. It was ok because after one bite I couldn't eat it. Drenched in mustard. Well done no flavor (except mustard). Burger was 2 skinny patty's.

Another great Wawa. Wawa is known for its above '& beyond abilities to serve people better than another gas station. Wawa is more than that. The store is clean and well kept. Products are where they're supposed to be on the shelves. Wawa has great subs too. You're able to customize what you want on the sandwiches and if you want them hot or cold. Great place.

First off let me say , thank you for being open ! The night was perfect from the warm bread to our great service. Alex our server greeted us the minute we walked in and made us feel welcome the whole time. This 5 star review is for the service , don't  get me wrong the food is very good but Alex went above and beyond . Thank you and we will be back .

Let's start with service - poor service due to their lack of friendliness and manners. The waiter had a very gloom face and seemed to be impatient when we were trying to order he was trying to rush us. My Dinner with three other Colleagues felt like a fast food restaurant quick eats and go. Nothing great about this place.  

Food was not that great. I ordered 2 different kinds of sushi rolls. 

Let's just say I won't be back here note suggest this place.

I scream, you scream, we should all be screaming for Mike's Ice Cream! 

Some of the best ice cream I have ever had! We were in town for 3 nights, and literally stopped at Mike's every night. I mainly stuck to the Cookies and Cream malt shake, but the others in my group were more adventurous than I and tried everything from the Nutterbutter to Chocolate Peanut Butter cup. You, seriously, couldn't go wrong with anything on the menu. 

Lines varied quite a bit during each visit, but the employees kept the line moving so even when we were almost at the door, we didn't have to wait much longer than 10-15 minutes to get our ice cream. It was also really well priced for such delicious ice cream!

I have the Chase Sapphire Reserve Card, which has a $550 annual fee. I am never late on a payment and use for personal and work so spend $100K+ a year on this card. I used to be a huge fan and brand ambassador for them as their travel site is wonderful. Then I became sick during Covid-19 and missed some flights to Europe. They put me through absolute HELL to reimburse me for these flights. They made me go the doctor TWICE in a global pandemic because they were not satisfied with the doctor's note I got on my first visit and insisted I use their specific form. (Unbelievable). I spent hours and hours on hold, filing forms, going back and forth and finally after nearly two months of follow up and blanket rejections of my claim I called, waited on hold for an hour, and threatened to take them to small claims court. I am still waiting to be paid. I was a customer for 5 years but after this experience I am switching to AmEx.

Wow!!! One of my top three new favorite places to eat in New Orleans. Very great ambiance with vintage/earthy accents & decor, wine on tap, self-serve popcorn and amazing service. What more can you ask for?! 

No complaints regarding the food, our server John made great recommendations: Toast of the day with salmon dip, bread pudding and the charcuterie board paired with some wine. 

Def will try more next time and recommend to all of my friends and family :) perfect for group dinners or even a date night!

A great, curated selection of premium, high quality men's goods. It was one of the best selections across the board that I've seen. The only reason it doesn't get 5 stars is their return policy which created a negative first impression for me. The whole shop is full of high quality goods meant to last, but they do not accept returns. I was shocked. A lot of the brands being sold have incredible warranties and it feels like the shop missed an opportunity to partner with their customers in that regard, instead just a big printed sign making it clear returns are not accepted and exchanges are a nuisance.
The best ice cream my fiancé and I have ever had!!! And very reasonable prices. Best flavor is blackberry cornbread

The only 5 star worthy place I've been in Nashville on my 4 night stay. Loved everything about it- from the super friendly staff to the cute parlor decor. We got the brownie sundae and it was not only delicious, but giant! And not too expensive for sharing- I think about $5. You get three big fat scoops of ice cream with it. We picked Tennessee fudge, butter pecan, and moose tracks- are three were super amazing and the brownie was warm and delicious- tasted pretty close to home made. The samples they give you here are huge too.
We also went here in the morning on a different day during our stay and ordered a cold coffee drink which was super creamy and a great start to the day.

This surprise gem inside the hockey rink is always amazing. Their wings are so unique and to die for. Their kettle chips drizzled with balsamic and blue cheese are amazing and the Tampa eggrolls are like a Cuban sandwich surprise inside of an Eggroll.

Beth-El is a horribly dysfunctional place not conducive to spiritual worship. Newly arrived in St. Pete, I contacted this temple. I zoomed a Fri night "Kabbalat" service during the month of April. It did NOT include L'Chor Dodi.  The Cantor, also Adult Education Director, a senior citizen, was asked to say the candle blessing for Shabbat. She looked surprised, said it, then said, "Im glad I remembered it." 
      I inquired about excluding L'Chor Dodi. The Rabbi emailed me to say that they have a very short Fri service (none on Sat morn) because members "had a short attention span." "In April they had added a prayer to it so they had to cut a prayer out." Are these people so ignorant, they do not know the significance of their act for a Fri night service?
      I volunteered to participate in Adult Ed, also run by the Cantor. I was informed that their next speaker would be a Police Chief talking about "Profiles in Courage" (the JFK title). I wrote her saying in the context of what is going on in the country, I found this topic choice to be "strange" and wondered why it was chosen for Temple. She responded with a terribly nasty, personal and slanderous attack against me. I reported this to the membership administrator who did nothing.
      If you are new to this area, avoid this place. I found a magnificent synagogue elsewhere in St. Pete, with a fabulous scholarly and personable Rabbi, a fantastic Cantor, a loving and welcoming congregation and am happy I shopped around. However, I never imagined a dysfunctional place like Beth- El, nor such a nasty response to a prospective new member.

I've heard of this place but haven't had time to check it out until now. The barista who helped us was incredibly nice and was Merriam-Webster's definition of great customer service. She was super friendly, told us all about the menu as first timers, and personally brought our to-go drinks out to us. 

They serve Frothy Monkey coffee, which is a great business, and I ended up getting the honey latte. I was sorta missing where the honey part came in, but nevertheless it was still a pretty solid cup of coffee.

If you want bad service and an assistant manager who does not care, go to Dennys on US 31 South. The young lady who served us didn't care one way or another if you were there or not, and trying to tell the assistant manager, well let's just say she doesn't care either. Never going back.
Only came for drinks and dessert but the Banana Fosters was Amazeballs!!!!! Service was amazingly too!!!!

It's a shame that this is the only location in the Nashville area because this place actually has cute stuff for kids. And my friend had her baby registry here so I was kind of forced to come here (refuse to pay for their ridiculous shipping costs online). However the people who work here are the RUDEST people I have ever come across in a long time. I had to walk around the store for a good 10 minutes before I had to ask someone to help me (since no one offered). And when I did ask someone (Gigi) to help me print out the registry she told me she couldn't help me and that I would have to go to the register at the front. The register where just one person was working and there were mobs of moms and their kids waiting in line. So I went back to Gigi asking if there is any way she can help me and she begrudgingly told me that she only does monogramming and really can't help me but sighed and tried to figure out how to print it out. And then when I asked her if she could help me find any of the items on the registry, she really got annoyed. God forbid you do your job and try to help someone look for one item. Finally someone else ended up helping me which I was grateful for but just not sure why it took so much time and effort to do one simple thing. Will not be returning.

Tuna Bar has great quality sushi. Their sashimi always is well prepared and tastes very fresh. I also really enjoyed the brussel sprouts and Gyoza appetizers. Its a step above most places in terms of quality. And, the restaurant is very classy - almost a swanky vibe.

Also, they have some really cool Tea Pots, if you order tea to finish off your meal.

Four stars based on price (I feel like everything is $1 too expensive). But, worth it.
make their own bread thats the secret,, my fave is roast beef sandwich albeit its all good some of the best sandwiches in usa

Cozy relaxed spot with good coffee. (5/5 green stars)
Plenty of indoor and outdoor shady seating and decent WiFi make this a good place to work. Nice music playing, from Beach House to Grizzly Bear. Great coffee - no pour-overs, but their drip coffee tasted fresh. It's from the Dart Coffee Co. (new to me) - lightly roasted Peruvian beans. Decent value too - I had a coffee, bagel with cream cheese and tomato, and muffin for about $9. Coffee refills are free, so I had a blueberry scone ($4) to go with the second cup ;) I have mixed feelings about their pastries. They all look good, and while the bagel tasted good, the muffin and scone were bland and both were a touch overdone. The muffin was listed as grapefruit poppy seed, and while the texture was good, there was no grapefruit flavor that I could detect. It was a Monday - perhaps an off-day?  Would recommend it for the coffee and ambiance, and I think the bakery side has potential - their baguette sandwiches look great.

I'm also giving Helena Avenue Bakery 5/5 "green stars" for social and environmental impact, based on these reasons:
* Their coffee, from Dart, is certified fair trade and organic. 
* They use organic flour for baking, sourced from Central Milling
* They have ceramic cups and plates and metal utensils for eating in-house.
* Items like sandwiches have just a simple paper wrap.
* Even items that come in packaging (like house-made pickles) they have made fairly sustainable choices (cardboard and PET). 
* Cold drinks cups are compostable, although hot cups and lids are not. 
* Water is available in little glass jars. 
* The support some local charities and events such as bike to work day and Heal the Oceans. 

Find out more about green-star ratings at Green Stars Project dot org. 

PS: The address is a bit confusing: if you approach from Anacapa Street, make your way past The Lark and you'll find this bakery next to the SB Wine Collective. They share the same space (so you can have wine with your bagel instead of coffee, if you so wish). It's easier to find if you approach from Helena Avenue.

Friendly and reasonably priced...this is some really good ice cream!

Honestly, it reminded me of Dave & Andy's back home in Pittsburgh with the light and crispy waffle cones and extremely rich ice cream.  We all enjoyed our chosen flavor and there were many to pick from. The servers were uber friendly and although there was a line, it moved along quickly. 

We were lucky enough to get a table by the window which was perfect to people watch inside and outside onto the strip which is very lively. 

The fact that this reminded me of home in Nashville was a win for me. I can't wait to come back to visit. Best believe I'll be stopping here again!

New Orleans is world famous for its legendary cuisine and hospitality. However, over the last decade, post Katrina demographic shifts have threatened to erode these traditions. As someone whose family hails from the area, I have high standards when it comes to food and hospitality. I was pleasantly surprised by the excellent service our party received at River 127. Restaurant manager Byron Cerre, and our server Jonathan, catered to our large party's every need, with the kind of hospitality NOLA is legendary for. If you want to relax, and have a perfectly blended sazerac, some truffle fries that will make you slap your momma, a cheeseburger from heaven, and smoked scallops that will turn even the staunchest vegan out, go to River 127. Byron Cerre, the king of hospitality, and his restaurant krewe will make sure you are well taken care of.

Not only is the beer kept below freezing, but the food is fiiire. Staff were sweet and absolutely gorgeous! My first time going but my husband went all the time in  Michigan. He got the chicken tenders and I got the Philly. Would definitely recommend and will go back soon!

We were very disappointed. Our server was clueless, rude and lazy. She was much more interested in a table of 2 guys next to our table. So much so that she sat with them more than once for 10 or so minutes at a time while we were there. The TV's looked like they had a bad streaming connection rather than satellite. We asked if there was something wrong or that could be done they said ,"oh, sure!" And nothing happened. They "couldn't find" any red wine when we asked for a glass after waiting 20 minutes on that response.  We literally bused our own table to an adjacent one because when we mentioned that we were done with our meals she asked if we wanted dessert!  The food was at best average. No reason to go back.

Ordered beef burrito bowl with extra salsa and avocado. Instead of extra, I got specifically NO salsa or avocado. I assume they either don't know what the word "extra" means or were deliberately trying to annoy me.

Quality over quantity of reviews. Don't let that turn you away from making this your new sushi hang out spot. Easily one of the best places you can get on good quality sushi for a ridiculously low price, during happy hour. The atmosphere has a chill ambience, even though it makes you the dining experience of a high end restaurant without the price tag.

How is it that I have lived in Indy for three years, written copious reviews (for restaurants on Yelp and beers on Untappd) yet not written anything for one of my top breweries, hell, my top businesses in general, in the midwest??!! I should add a disclaimer; I rarely hang out at Bier. I like the people and the atmosphere, but the beer is just too good, and I'm afraid said delicious beer will cause me to drive back home drunk! So, I nearly always get growlers, bullets, and/or cans to go. The mix-and-match cans option is a huge plus because, like Central State and some other local breweries, Bier is good at having a mix of house favorites and new experimental beers in cans at any given time. Standouts include PDG (a perfect pale ale), their ESB (which is unfortunately getting harder and harder to get since it is so coveted), Sabbath (a black Kolsch), last year's Marzen (the best canned Marzen on the planet), their legendary pumpkin ale (the best I've ever had), and a variety of other Belgian-style ales (they don't do exclusively Belgians, I just happen to like Bier's take on Belgians). I haven't even had their most famous beer, Sanitarium, but that's partially because I don't like boozy, barrel-aged beers (and also because it sells out so fast). This is one of the best breweries in Indiana, and likely the whole midwest. No flights, but they'll let you taste until you find something you like (which won't take long if you are a beer lover). They are also really active in the community and do countless fundraisers. I'm down to my last month in Indy, and this will be one of the places I miss the most!

PS: Little known fact: their 2015 (or perhaps 2016) biere de guarde (a French style ale) is in my top three beers of all time, maybe even #2!

So glad something finally opened on this corner and what did looks so much better inside. The room has a great flow to it and the art on the walls compliments the place well.  The beer list was better than average and the menu was interesting.

Unfortunately there were some things that we really didn't like: the beer list has no prices nor does it specify what is on tap and what isn't. This made the final bill shocking as I didn't expect a PBC bottle to cost $8.99+. The tap list was illegible from the tables and the waiter suggested I go look at it to see what was on it. My flatbread came out over cooked and cold. Our waiter, while he tried and was nice, wasn't very knowledgeable about the food or beer.

2.5 stars overall. Going to give it one more chance since it's so convenient but hope to see some basic changes to tighten up the experience.

Walked here during the week to get my lunch. I got my lunch to go, so that and COVID-19 safety precautions made up the bulk of my impressions.

You enter the restaurant through the courtyard, which is a decent size for the CBD. The existence of a courtyard is especially noteworthy in pandemic times - some people want to avoid dining indoors - and the fact that it's shaded is major bonus points.

I placed my to-go order with the host and then sat in a corner to wait. There was a table with wipes and sanitizer by the door, and all the employees seemed to be properly wearing masks. There wasn't anyone dining in, but I got there right as they opened, so it was still early.

I was brought my drink immediately, per my request, though they also offered water while I waited. My food was ready about 15 minutes later. I got the Pick 2 combo of crawfish grilled cheese and sunflower arugula salad, and along with the standard utensils and napkins, they included 2 packets of alcohol wipes.

The crawfish grilled cheese was great: thick, gooey, and packed with flavor. I'm not normally a salad fan, but the arugula salad was pretty good too, and I'm glad I got it to balance out the richness of the sandwich.

Food was average.  Beer selection decent.  Service above average.  Beer was definitely cold....love that.  Probably try the wings next time, Nashville chicken sandwich was more like a buffalo chicken sandwich.

Lots of TV for watching games, etc.

I honestly come here because it's so easy to walk from my house. But honestly I like their food as long as you get the greatest things from them: cheesesteaks and pizza... I am pretty set out to try their chicken alfredo as I don't make any pasta dish at home, as a way to avoid overloading carbs. I can get out of hand. And their plates look fairly portioned for me, the carb-monster haha.

Great ingredients, unique flavors and the kids even enjoyed the honey ricotta toast! 
Worth checking out!

Best iced vanilla latte I've had in my life. Friend ordered their biscuit sandwich and donuts and said it was the bomb, it looked amazeeeee. Would rate five stars alone just for the latte. 

Worth the price. Plus it's very cute and industrial-chic on the inside for all the trendy peeps.

Manager is a complete loser, total simp flirting with high school girls, food is absolute trash, the only thing I will give this place is that it's convenient if you are at the rink. But honestly just order from the snack bar down stairs at least it's what you can expect for a snack bar.l

I am so pleased we chose Copper Vine for our first meal out/anniversary dinner. The decor is pretty and comfortable. The staff was friendly, all wearing masks and gloves, and people were appropriately spaced apart for social distancing purposes. We started with the crawfish beignets- absolutely delicious and my favorite part of the meal. We then shared the fig flatbread, wagyu burger with Brussels sprouts, and mushroom pasta. Everything needed some salt, and the burger needed a little more condiments. Other than that, it was delicious! I would absolutely come back :)

Helena Avenue Bakery is a must-visit for those looking for a great breakfast place in Santa Barbara. Not only is it in Downtown Santa Barbara, but it is located in the trendy FUNK ZONE close to the wharf. Really, you could start your day here and walk to a whole lot of points of interest from here.

The egg, ham and cheese in a biscuit breakfast sandwich is so hearty and filling that you could split it into two, if you like light breakfasts, and be good to walk around for several hours after.

The biscuit is so buttery and flaky. The pesto sauce was so good. The cheddar was sharp.

The heirloom tomato galette, though not as heavy in the tummy is still large and filling.

They also serve very good espresso coffees and teas.

Outdoor dining was available - when it was allowed. Masks are required.

Street parking is plentiful in the morning, not so much in the afternoon.

Helena Avenue Bakery shares their space with a wine tasting shop. So the space is a bakery in the morning and a wine tasting shop at night. Great concept!

Also, there is a doggie bowl of water provided for your four-legged friends/kids.

I really wish I had the opportunity to go again during my trip here. When I come back to SB, I will sure try to come early so I can have breakfast here.

Terrible service and food was bad.  They sat us in the lounge and table was far from booth seats. Ordered the prosciutto grilled cheese. The prosciutto was hard and crunchy and barely one bite of cheese

Was our first visit to Copper Vine after I had been eyeing it down for some time, and it was just as good as I had expected. Food was delicious, our server Christopher was excellent. Great cheese board and brussel sprouts! We will be back!

We took a group of nine, including a 3 year old and two babies, last night for dinner.  We had a really good time, the food was tasty and the staff was professional.  I have read the other reviews and have to wonder if they went to a different restaurant.  Maybe there have been some changes made, I am not sure.

I had the grouper special, it was really good and came with a topping of steamed spinach.  The Greek salad was fresh and well dressed.  We also had the saganaki appetizer, it was nice and large and tasty.  The pita was hot and crispy.  My mom ordered the greek sampler appetizer and it was really good.  Everyone seemed to enjoy their food, even my picky toddler.  She had chicken fingers and they were not greasy or over breaded.

We did not experience any of the staff drama discussed in earlier posts, nor did we find the place full of hoosiers.  Then again, maybe I am a hoosier in denial.... lol.  It had a good mix of older patrons and a few young couples.  The bar is separated by a wall, and there were some groups in there having drinks.  Overall, a  pretty normal crowd for a Monday.  It is not an upscale restaurant, nor do they pretend to be upscale.  It is a comfortable neighborhood eatery.  They are putting in a patio area that looks like it will be nice once it warms up again.

We will definitely be back.  Our food was hot, tasty and prompt.  Our drinks were refilled often and when we asked for more pita, it came out fast and hot.  Only reason I didn't give it five stars is that I have only been there the one time, so it is hard to claim perfection.

I went here for a celebratory dinner with my stepmom and this place was absolutely amazing. 

The ambiance and decor is unparalleled. Lush green velvet everywhere, high ceilings, origami centerpieces hanging above the bar. 

The food was absolutely marvelous and subtly balanced Southern and Japanese influence. We had the mushroom dish, the walu, the spicy crab noodles, and the whole trout. 

The mushrooms were divine. The walu was so delicate with just a little spice. The spicy crab noodles had the best slightly chewy texture, the crab itself was a very fine texture and flavored the noodles, and it had just the right amount of heat in the back of your throat. The trout was amazing because of the salted crust, the meat just fell off the bones. We made little buns with their upscale cole slaw and it was jaw dropping. 

Such a delicious evening that I will cherish always.

Very pleased with Chase customer service.
I was a few days late paying my bill- found it under some papers on my desk. I went online to my account details to find out how much I was going to get wacked for being late and could only find the 39.00 late fee posted.
I emailed Chase about not finding any more details on there site for the interest I was going to be charged for being late. The previous day I made a 10K transaction on the card and feared that I was going to get charged back interest for that purchase also. I hate nothing more than paying interest on a bill I pay in full every month.
To my surprise I received a response crediting back the late fee and any interest.
On average you see more neg. than pos. on most businesses so I felt obligated to praise Chase for doing the right thing.

Been a usual to this place for about 4 years now and I believe that customer service is not getting any better.

A couple of weeks ago I took my dad so he would know a different place for beer and wings and it was a little disappointing.

I love the ambiance of this place, the design and decoration but if you don't get seated at the bar or the big tables you won't get the attention you deserve.

So, it was just the two of us but we were not asked to be seated at any of the two bars and instead taken to the low tables at the right wing of the restaurant where I could tell families were placed.

I'm not a restaurant manager and I know organization is a big part of this but if you're a customer and waitresses are wandering around and you can't find yours if you ask the first you see for hot sauce or the check the least you expect is being told that she is not taking care of that table and wait.

Anyway, boneless were good, and tasty, too bad summer shandy was not available but we liked our food.
this place is trash. takes forever to even get acknowledged and the service is insanely slow

I'm not a coffee coneiseuer to say the least, so I can't rate the finer points of the coffee - but what I will say is that the decor and ambiance of this little spot is fantastic. Other than music that is a little too loud for that atmosphere it was really nice.

As for the coffee - I thought that was really good too.

I grew up in Alton.  Tony ' s was one of the nicest restaurants in town when I was a kid.  If we went for a special family dinner,  we would dress nicely,  and the food would be good.  

My family and I went last night in an effort to celebrate being together for Christmas.  There were 8 of us,  all adults. 

We arrived and were seated at 6 pm.  Our drink order was taken.  Six waters were brought for the eight of us.  Our ordered drinks arrived after 6:30.  Three of eight drinks were wrong.  It took another 15 minutes to get this corrected and the two additional waters.  

We finished our drinks.  No additional orders were taken until our food arrived at 720, 80 minutes after we ordered.  

A second drink order was taken then. We all ordered the same thing to make it easier on the waiter.   These arrived some time later.  

The food was not good.  "The New Edition" was flavorless.  The pepperloin kababs were soaked in butter and nearly inedible.  

What was particularly galling about the experience was the service.  Our waiter was nice but incompetent.  The head waiter walked by our table multiple times,  could clearly see our empty glasses,  and never approached us.  The owner did as well.  

It's safe to say that we have written this restaurant off of our list of choices when in Alton.

Overall it was a great experience even during this pandemic. My court hearings were postponed multiple times and the whole ordeal lasted 6 months due to the pandemic for a traffic violation that happened back in February. There was nothing that could be done but to just be patient and wait it out. Elliot always kept me in the loop in what was going on "behind the scenes" and kept me informed of any new information that he came across. Very professional, knowledgeable, laid-back, and easy to talk to. He will do whatever it takes to get you the best results for your particular case and always before going any further in the case, he will always ask for your permission so you will never feel pressured or obligated to do anything you don't want to do. At the end of the day, I am glad I was patient and waited it out with Elliot because I did get the result that I wanted. Due to the pandemic, all our interactions happened over the phone and have not met him personally. I would definitely hire Elliot again if the need arises. Thank you Elliot!

What an awesome addition to old city! By far the best restaurant in the neighborhood. Amazing attention to detail from plate presentation to flavors on the plate. Prices reasonable. Great cocktails! Can't wait to be a regular!
I've used this company twice so far for different properties and both times Shay arrived quickly and got the job done in a timely manner. Great service and great prices. Highly recommend!
Went there on a first date. Random old lady bar winch gave a racist welcome to my date. Never coming here again!

Yum! Yum! And a great view from the top!!! Our server was awesome (wish I could remember his name) and the food was great!!!! 
4 stars cuz no place is perfect! And we walked lots of stairs for an empty room when I would have been fine on the patio or bar! Next time I'll just say something, they seemed very accommodating 

Go here for a nice dinner!!!
Would not accept a valid government issued military ID.  Would not recommend.  Very disappointing.

Came here with a large group of friends after eating at the Italian market and was fairly underwhelmed. It was jumping with people and they were showing sports on the TV which made my husband happy but I found the atmosphere to be lackluster. Also there are two bathrooms but one was out of use which made for a very long line. One thing to note - - if you forget to bring wine to your BYOB in the Italian Market they sell it here!

Came here for brunch with a bachelorette party. Made an online reservation and got seated on the beautiful, picture perfect balcony. Our server greeted us and asked us if we had been here before-we haven't-and then he ran through the menu and several of the popular items. He was very helpful answering any questions we had and offering suggestions. We all ordered coffee, which was amazing. We ordered crawfish beignets and lump crab deviled eggs, both which were great and not items you can find everywhere, so definitely recommend but you only get 3 each. For entrees, we got the crawfish grilled cheese (so so good), apple fritter french toast (so decadent, ate it for two meals), fried chicken sandwich (messy but good), lump crab benny (amazing), and the chicken and waffles (good, cornbread waffle was a different texture but not bad). Service was great and atmosphere was +++++

if not for Wawa, I'm not quite sure I would have survived my first year of college.

HOAGIES!  Being able to walk into Wawa at 4 am during finals week and grabbing food to go is definitely a check-plus in my book! Yum...I could do with some food right now.  The other sandwich counter food is worth checking out as well!

Okay, so there have been a few iffy moments.  There was the time where the sandwich counter didn't have lettuce for a while. (What? That's like, essential!)  Then there's the lack of drink and milkshake tops, which is annoying no matter what time of day.  The workers are a tad bit on the lazy side... 

Wawa is one of those things that college has addicted me to.  It's right up there next to caffeine.  But seriously, those milkshakes have pulled me through hard times!

Viva la Wawa!

5 stars for food, service, and ambiance. Tracy, our waitress, was absolutely wonderful. All of her recommendations were spot on. From wine, food, dessert to champagne-she nailed it! Loved it all. 
My steak was so tender and perfectly cooked. All of the garnishes paired very well. 
If you come here ask for Tracy to be your waitress. She's fire.

Mom and I have been trying different restaurants for the past few weeks in order to support the community. Copper Vine was this week's lunch date. It was incredible! Justyn was our server and he was so nice and service was on point. Thanks, justyn! The food was really good, too. I was starving so we started with the crab topped deviled eggs and truffle fries. They were both amazing. Then we got the lunch special and as soon as he described that cauliflower soup, we were both sold. Thanks for the great lunch, y'all!
My partner has been trying to get me to try Ardmore Pizza for so long now and I finally have and it is AMAZING. I will definitely be going back more often! Great price point too.

AVOID THIS BANK.

The worst security/fraud system I have ever dealt with. Absolutely horrific. I can't count how many times my family and I have had fraudulent charges on our accounts over the years. Every single time we've complained to the Chase fraud department they've given us the classic runaround responses. Rude and extremely unhelpful. 

If you value your money and credit I suggest choosing another back immediately.
Good ice cream place located downtown Nashville. Very good flavors and lots to choose from. First visited here 8 years ago. The family and I was very  satisfied and had a good time.

Hot summer day in Nashville and ice cream sounded like a great idea. They have so many flavors to choose from! You can get your original vanilla or chocolate ice cream, get a little adventurous and try a cheesecake or chocolate infused with a bunch of other stuff ice cream, or go all out and try their bacon ice cream. The line might get long but you'll get to the front pretty quick! They have ice cream experts lined up ready to take the next person's order so you'll be next very soon. All the workers there were nice. They seem to be a close bunch of workers, almost like family. It makes you appreciate small and local businesses like Mike's Ice Cream especially in a big city.

This place is a joke. We had an abysmal experience because of the "management".  Our party of 8 had come together because of a death in our family and were were treated horribly.  The manager, gestapo, Führer, whatever you want to call her is clearly on a massive power trip and feels that covid has made her more important than she will ever be.  We came in the door and asked for a table.  She proceeded make us wait an inordinate amount of time while she stared at her iPad as if trying to find us a table in an establishment with only 4 occupied tables.   She then rattled off the mask rules in a condescending and insulting tone and when we asked for clarification of her less than standard rules, she abruptly shut me up and held up her hand to stop me from speaking.  We were taken to our table which was a picnic bench style and outside.   There were 6 in our party and we were expecting 2 more.  When we got to our outside table, we took 2 chairs from a nearby empty table in order to accommodate our party.  Our server told us that the rude, power hungry manager said we can't use those chairs because the table was reserved.  There was no reserved sign on the table and the entire time we were there, not only was no one ever seated at that table, no one was even seated nearby.  Our remaining 2 party members arrived and were told not only could they not enter the establishment but they could not sit with us because the rules prevent more than 6 people at an inside table.  Again, we're were sitting outside.  Either This place should not be in business or the "manager" should be forced to take training classes in the HOSPITALITY industry or be fired.  We will never come back here again and will tell everyone we know NOT to even bother coming!

0 stars if I could. The worst! Don't get chase credit cards.  It took 1 late payment after many years of me paying my card each month in full for them to report me and my credit score to drop from 800 to 750. The late payment was due to an error. My app was telling me I had 0 balance and it was only 1 month, not over by much. The chase specialist I talked to said that if payment is not received in 30 days it triggers automatically an alert, a bad mark on your payment history in the credit score. He said that they are not going to call each customer as a curtesy and he can't do anything about it. 

Folks, just AVOID CHASE. We can only stop big money, big banks, from treating us like this if we collectively at a grassroots level do not tolerate bad behavior. It took me years to build a good credit score, and right before making a big purchase, a house, these people ruin it just like that with their smart algorithms.  Extremely disappointed!! This has never happened to me with other credit cards. I am a responsible person and for them to ruin my score so easily it is just awful. No apologies either. They are not helpful at all over the phone. 

This could happen to you. Stay away from chase credit cards!!

It's a little embarrassing the quantity of breweries I have been too. But considering Tyler and I make it a habit to visit one brewery in every city we visit we have developed a little bit of a brewery snobbery. Bier hits all the right notes with us and checks off all the boxes! This place has that neighborhood hangout feel with eclectic seating and a great casual patio. They are dog friendly and the staff are extremely people friendly. When you walk in it can be a little intimidating because everyone else seems to know what they want. But spend two seconds with the staff at the bar and the chalkboard that beautifully displays their current taps and you won't be disappointed. I have not had a bad beer here...ever. So be adventurous and ask for help if you need it. Also they have board games and live music on certain nights so if you want a low key night out this is your place!

Mother's Day Nightmare

I should have heeded the other poor Yelp reviews that I had read & selected a different restaurant.  If you are contemplating going to this restaurant with children; please note this review as a cautionary tale.

Reservation was at 2pm & we were seated promptly & the table selection was perfect as we were placed in our own little section away from the rest of the crowd (this was a nice touch).  Everything went down hill from here.  We put in the kids orders (2 macaroni & cheeses, 1 crabby patty & 1 chicken tenders) within 10 minutes of sitting down.  An hour later, after 3 prompting conversations with our nice enough waiter; the kids' orders finally came out.  This was a consistent theme throughout the experience; nothing came to our table without continued prompting & near begging.  Our 2 appetizers came out 1.5 hours after sitting down.  Finally, our 3 entrees came out; nearly 2 hours after sitting down.  Again, nothing came to our table until I requested/complained/implored the waiter to please bring something to the table.  

The food varied; most of the plates were pretty good, grilled salmon, crab cake sandwich, lobster blt tacos, & calimari; however; the east steamer pot; both the crab & mussels must have been sitting & over-steaming; just as we did the same....the crab & mussels were completely overdone & was a similar experience to chewing on your tongue.

There was nothing noted, offered, or provided by anyone at the establishment; except a brief apology to the tune of; "sorry for the wait" from the waiter.

This place is amazing. It's very clean and the service is fast. The ingredients are always fresh and I can rely on this place for a breakfast, lunch, or dinner on the go. There's a lot of variety and it's in a great location.

I would like to start off by saying the food and service were decent (3 stars)

Now on to the terrible experience. We had a group of 10 people who came to watch the Stanley cup finals. We all ate and drank for the first two periods of the game. Just before the third period we were told a ufc event was about to be televised and we needed to pay "the cover" for said event. We told them we were here to watch the Stanley cup finals and not the ufc. We were told we had to pay "the cover" or leave despite the large amount of money we had already spent. We cashed out and went elsewhere to watch the game. Last time I will attempt to watch a game here.

The menu offers a variety of dishes, as well as the wine menu. Our dinners were delicious (I ordered the shrimp scampi.), very flavorful.  The entire meal from the appetizer to dessert was delizioso. Staff was friendly.

Wow, it's unbelievable how this place can have an average over 4 stars... I find that suspicious.

Walking in to what is marketed as an "Italian Market" would make one excited with anticipation... sadly, a very dull/dreary and pathetic attempt. Two sad grocery shelves with products no one would want and very minimally stocked. A tiny little poorly appointed dining area, and tons of case line, with pre-prepared foods, deli type foods and baked goods. A big counter for sandwich/sub making... and while there, that's all I saw them sell, I think maybe their main attraction is fresh baked breads for the their subs. 

Several of us ate their Lasagna (with meat sauce... seriously, just meat over top?!?)... not that flavorful or good.  Also an alfredo sauced cheese tortellini with chicken... had a strange spice and was watery... not good. Salad "dressing" was the best item we had. 

Bakery area... cookies "looked" good... sadly they seemed old, flavorless and had an aftertaste that made us realize they absorbed and picked up the odors of the business itself... YUK!!! 

Overall... I'll NEVER return and do not recommend... sorry.

Stopped here Saturday November 10 prior to the Mavericks concert.     Very trendy decor, staff very pleasant, and really interesting cocktails.     The food was great, we had the Wedges for a starter, nice dish with the added carrots and onions.   We shared 4 entrees, all were excellent.  We'll be back, a really nice experience.

What an epic bummer! Such a devastating let down to be given dish after dish of tasteless uninspiring dishes. It's actually quite a feat to make six dishes in a row taste like nothing. I mean nothing. No taste, no flavor, nothing. 
How sad. The interior is beautiful and our server Josh was lovely however to pay top price for probably the most tasteless meal I've had all year was the most epic bummer of 2018.

I will echo what I said during my review of The Cat Cafe on Whyte and point out that it is nearly impossible not to give 5 stars to a place that helps find homeless fur babies loving families.

The admission is a few dollars cheaper than the one on Whyte but your also only getting one drink here as opposed to as many as you can drink during your visit. The drinks here are great though. The chai latte I had was far better than the watered down junk I used to get at Starbucks and who would really expect a high quality drink from a place where the drinks are not the main focus? It was a great surprise!

The cat room is really cute and homey although admittedly a bit small. My friend and I were the only customers for the hour that we were there though and it was so nice being able to love on all the cats and not have to deal with a horde of other patrons attempting to get their attention. I think the staff love on them quite a bit as well. All the kitties we visited with seemed very well socialized and not at all skittish.

All in all it was an awesome time and I hope to visit and have many more here at Paws.

My wife and I had a great meal with friends Friday night- delicious, interesting food at a very fair price. Cool vibe and friendly staff! Highlights were the shishitos, broccolini, spicy crab pasta, and the ikinari steak. Look forward to our next visit!
We ordered on uber eats and it was awful. They didn't send us our entire order, it was overpriced, and the food was terrible. 10/10 recommend finding somewhere else to eat.

Always a disappointment. Keep coming here because my dad used to like to eat here. But I've been coming in sporadically for the last year, trying something different each time and every time I'm more disappointed. This was the last straw. Ordered a steak cooked medium (in the hopes it might come med rare)  with veggies and potatoes. The steak is charged in one side, soggy on the under side and rare in the middle. Veggies are beyond over cooked and soggy. Potatoes were hit with a hot pan for color and undercooked. I have not eaten more than one bite of each. 20 min into dinner and I had to flag the waitress down for a refill on my iced tea. Does she ask why my dinner is in touched? Nope! My kid finishes her ravioli and I'm asked if I want a to-go box. No thank you. Then she notices. Service lacking and food to match. Manager comped the meal and offered to be our server and cook next time. Sorry, my time is Lee joys to me and I do t think I'm willing to give it another go. But I will spend it writing this review to save you all the disappointment.

What a sweet spot to grab ice-cream! There were a ton of flavors to choose from and several different cones to match. Not feeling ice-cream? They also offered a variety of coffee options as well as shaved -ice. The line was super long, but they moved us through pretty quickly. The ice-cream was SO good and flavorful, and the portion was on the generous side for sure. It was definitely worth more than the mere $3 and some amount of change!! The seating area was crowded, as there are only a handful of tables to sit at. A couple people were camping out and monopolizing tables while there friends stood in line. It would be nice if there was a "no ice cream - no table" policy. In fact, we were able to finish our ice cream completely before one of the camping groups got there ice cream. We could have easily sat at their table, eaten our ice-cream, left, and given them the table back - all before they even had their own ice cream!

Best kept secret in the riverbend. The staff here are more than happy to help and answer your questions. I was looking for a particular item and they were able to assist me right away. The store itself is clean and up to cdc standards. Always parking available. Id recommend stopping in and saying hi to charles. 10 out of 10

Casual laid back vibe, but also very loud, so if you're planning a romantic date, this is not the place. Food was good, gumbo with boudin, amazing! And the roasted beet salad was delish. Flatbreads were fine, just not any wow factor to them, we tried the duck confit and margarita one. Be warned, bread pudding is Huge! We had the cranberry orange one, and it was hot, super orangey and yummy! The wine and drink pours are stingy, which surprised me, given the cost. Our service was fine, I found myself wondering a few times where our drinks were, but it did get busy at the bar, so it may not have been his fault. Overall, I'm torn on whether I'd go back.

So...tired...need...coffee. That was me heading out for a night out on Broadway, and every coffee place was closed. Reading the reviews, it sounded like Mike's Ice Cream knew how to get things done and was open late. Sadly, that wasn't quite the case as the girl behind the counter didn't know how to make a cortado. I explained it, and she pulled it off more or less. The coffee was good and was just what I needed, so I won't fault them too much. I guess I just got a less experienced barista. And in fairness, they typically are just scooping ice cream and not making off-menu coffee drinks. Man it was hard to not order ice cream based on the reviews. Next Nashville trip!

I've always loved the Macaroni Grill and their food. My most recent experience there was extremely sub-par. I was grabbing food togo and the manager came up to me saying that because they were short staffed, "they were not really concerned with those things."  (Meaning to-go orders)
I understand Takeout orders might not be as important as guests dining in, but all customers should be treated the same if we are expected to return. 
Didn't enjoy my experience here and I felt I was a burden because I was picking up rather than dining in.

This charming location is breakfast lunch only. The open air courtyard style location is shared with another business. I walked towards the counter to look at the breakfast menu sometime after 2. There was a large sign that said it was closed but I just wanted to look to see what type of baked goods they may have for tomorrow morning. The young person behind the counter was sweeping, didn't look up, and with a kinda irritated tone declares they were closed. I said  I saw the sign but was looking for tomorrow. She tells me "you'd be surprised how many people don't read the sign" with yet another dose of attitude and still not even looking at me. 
So I say well ya know, where I come from, people are greeted when spoken to. She finally looks up and says she did t appreciate my sarcasm. I told her it was more of a life skill I was sharing but ok. Needless to say, I will not be visiting this adorable bakery for breakfast tomorrow. Mostly because I didn't see any baked goods anywhere and I didnt want to ask. Bummer

Great place for sushi! I usually go for happy hour because I think normal prices are a little high but the quality and taste definitely make it worth it. My favorite is the spicy salmon hand roll but you can't really go wrong with anything on the menu! Happy hour is 5-7pm. On Wednesdays they have happy hour along with $5 hand roll special.

I'll start off by saying I only went to brunch. The atmosphere and the decor was nice. Very nice outdoor patio but for the fall. The three stars however are due to the small portions relative to the price. Plate sizes were a lot smaller then we imagine. I had the crabcake Benedict which was only one crabcake and one egg on top of potatoes. Taste very good but again size made the difference. My friend had the steak and eggs, steak was very very small and over cooked to his preference, which he stated at the time of ordering. But I am willing to give them another shot for dinner.

Came across this place during our visit from NJ. We were craving korean food so why not? The place is a bit hidden with the rest of the stores so it may be hard for others to spot it. It's located upstairs and I really enjoyed the window view from the seats! We ordered the octopus stone bibim + mushroom tofu soup (medium). The octopus stone bibimbap was good. The side dishes were honestly too salty so didnt really touch them. It was super hot that day so i advise them to get an AC because customers are most likely going to be sweating while eating spicy hot food. Other than that, not bad!

My wife and I spent three days in Nashville in a food and booze coma and we both agreed that our dinner at the Green Pheasant was far and away our best meal. Things got off to an inauspicious start as we barely made our reservation and the host staff gave my wife a hard time about being alone as I refused to pay the going rate for parking nearby or the posted valet price ($5 self park is available, oops missed that). Once we finally got settled in, our server took over and he was outstanding. 

We ordered a bottle of wine and a number of dishes to share. Everyone raves about the spicy crab noodles and for good reason. Ours could have been a touch hotter in my opinion but once I had that first butter savory umami bite I couldn't part with it. I would come back here often just for this dish alone. We also fell in love with the Tebasaki gyoza. At first when they brought it to our table we were confused as we expected some traditional dumplings, but when our waiter explained how the dumpling filling is stuffed into the chicken wing we raised our eyebrows a bit, took a bite and were astounded at the taste and experience of such an innovative concept. It's hard to surprise me with food and yet this did. My wife still talks about this dish and for good reason. Mindblowingly amazing! We had the broccolini and shrimp dish as well which was fantastic, but compared to the other dishes we ordered, was not in the same stratosphere. Great but not innovative or life-changing. We had the cheapest steak on their menu, which in hindsight I wish I would have insisted on the wagyu or something, but my wife devoured the american steak and claimed it as her favorite steak for some time (I assume that excludes my weekly sous vide offerings). I found the steak befitting of the other dishes and the exquisite ambiance. As much as I enjoyed it, I would def order the crab noodles and gyoza again, but would be interested in trying a different steak next time. 

The restaurant is gorgeous, elegant and stately without being pretentious or overstated. We would definitely return regularly and I know if I were ever in the doghouse, a visit to the Green Pheasant would be just the ticket to get me back in my wife's good graces. Highly recommend.

I will never eat Northeast Philly sushi ever again. It doesn't even compare to Tuna Bar. I sat at the bar and tried the Rittenhouse Roll. Spicy tuna, cucumber, avocado, kombu soy wrap, lobster tempura, and a truffle masago sauce. It was absolutely delectable. This is the holy grail of sushi. My mom ordered a happy hour saki which is graciously overpoured. Her spider roll was also to die for. Definitely a sushi staple in the city.

Visited Mike's because of reviews and ice cream craving. Service was knowledgeable and friendly, and I got to taste everything I wanted. Once I had my scoops, I enjoyed them, but oddly found it wasn't as melt in my mouth incredible and I expected. I opted for Tennessee fudge and banana pudding, which were good, but wish I had chosen the blackberry cornbread and pumpkin pie, both of which had fun textures and good flavor. I would try the other options nearby before returning. The ice cream is good, probably top 15%, but not top 5%.

***avoid this place 0 stars*****

Ate here today ordered pasta salad and an appetizer. Our waitress was amazing her name is Katie she is very attentive kind and helpful.

Ordered pasta to go with Italian sausage the cook forgot the sausage then we asked for it to be added and the cook added the sausage on cold almost a frozen cold we complained and the manager was extremely rude explained they're busy. Busy and slow is one thing throwing cold sausages on a warm to go dish is unforgivable.

Manager needs to go she can't manage and has a very bad attitude. People behind us were complaining because of slow service etc.


The vibe in the place from workers was no one wanted to work there we watched the cook grab her stuff and run out.

Avoid this place not worth it!

The manager comped our entire meal and still I don't feel that was even good enough it was such a disappointment in so many ways.

Katie is the best thing at that place and I hooe they appreciate her! 

Do not waste your tome or money going here unless they get better help and an new manger
also forgot to mention  no coffee/tea maker in the room

We were with a party of 11, five people got there food within 20 minutes the other people had to wait 30 additional minutes for the food to arrive and then 2 dinners had to go back as they were cold. After dinner was over we asked why there was such a delay, the waitress said sorry the tickets got mixed up and that happens sometimes, ok. We paid our bill including dessert for 6 of the people, when the manager asked how everything was we explained what happened her response was well you have already paid so I can't refund anything now, but I can give you dessert. Everyone that was eating dessert had already paid for their dessert. Horrible service horrible managers, would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.
The duck was amazing and the champagne was priced fair which is hard to find in the Quarter. My husband  had the white trout and enjoyed that as well. Who dat!

Every single thing I have had here I have loved! The churro donut, pesto asparagus salad, chocolate zucchini bread, peanut brittle cookie, chocolate chunk cookie, espresso, and so on. My all time favorite is probably the chocolate zucchini bread as it is so dense and flavorful while also tasting fresh and light on the digestive tract. The chocolate chunk cookie is a close second.

I haven't had many savory options here as they are pretty darn pricey for the portion size, however the couple I have had have been mighty tasty, fresh, and packed with the perfect combo of flavors. So in a sense, yes it's expensive but you are really getting what you pay for. They have many breakfast options that are served until 11 am then the lunch baguettes and side salads take over. 

Personally, I'd recommend this spot if you are looking for an artisanal breakfast with craft coffee and quality foods and/or sweets. It's also a nice spot for those wine tasting in the funk zone and want a little snack-a-roo between tasting rooms without walking too far and/or eating too much. 

Food is tasty, staff are kind, and the environment is adorable - The only downside to this spot for me is the prices. It would be a full 5 stars in my opinion if things were just a little more affordable. I'd also enjoy if they had a little more lunch options that didn't include so much bread in them or paying $10 for a few bites of delicious greens instead. Wraps would be awesome! Overall though, tourists especially, definitely check out this bakery at least once and try a quality baked good!

I can't even review the food because we never ate. My husband made reservations through Open Table for last night. We took an expensive uber ride into Philly and when we got there a sign was on the door that it was closed for Lunar New Year. I respect the holiday but why were we 1) able to make a reservation and 2)no one called or texted to let us know it wasn't open. I know restaurants sure want to know if patrons aren't going to show and we would like the same courtesy.
If you want whiz on your steak, maybe keep looking.  A lot of meat, and it was good but the photo is a lie.

Found this cute wine tap bar while visiting New Orleans last month.  This is my second time here and I love it even more than the first time.  

Drinks to order:  Cucumber Gimlet and the Sangria Roséé is one to die for.  

Venue is modern but still has that New Orleans feel.  Great location and amazing patio.  5 stars!

Relaxing Ambiance. Jazzy Aesthetic. & Wine On Tap... What else does a girl need! I really wanted to get dolled up and enjoy a nice vibe. I had the opportunity to have dinner here and it lived up to all of my expectations. I booked a reservation through OpenTable. Upon arrival, our table was ready as soon as we walked in!
Our server Chris was phenomenal. Since this was our first time, he took the time to thoroughly explain the menu offerings. Also, he had great wine recommendations and allowed me to sample them but fully committing. 
For my entree, I tried the new cornflake chicken sandwich and it was delightful! I highly recommend this place for brunch with friends or date night with bae!

Cool space! They have computers and a stage and board games! Stopped in just after opening and the Owner made all of our drinks! Very solid London Fog. Also told us stories of how coffee shop culture in Edmonton has changed over 30 years. Worth your business and your time

We are so happy we found Mike's Ice Cream. It is so fresh and delicious--no ice crystals in any of the flavors. We tried Chocolate Peanut Butter, Tennessee Fudge, and Mint Chocolate Chip. I was hesitant to try vanilla with fudge throughout--TN Fudge. I'm not a fan of fudge marble. The TN Fudge was amazing. What they didn't tell me was the fudge was FUDGE like you could buy at a candy store spread throughout the vanilla ice cream. Will go back when I'm hungry for amazing ice cream.

We had a wonderful meal here with attentive service. The food was all really flavorful--my favorites were the spicy crab noodles and the broccolini. A great place to come and share plates with everyone. We will absolutely come back.

I bought a 15-treatment package with Bala Better Health to treat my thighs. I'm a pear shape and no amount of working out has ever truly helped to tone my legs. I can honestly say that I'm nearing the end of my treatments and for the first time since college my cellulite has gone away significantly. I've become too self conscious to wear shorts for the past handful of years and it looks like this summer I'll finally be able to...thanks to my girl Allyson at BBH! Thank you, thank you, thank you!
Absolute delight from the atmosphere to the divine food. Very welcoming of dogs and very good service.

Last Tuesday (1/14) I learned that our Chase Mileage Plus Visa had been compromised. The Chase representative I talked to on the phone said that I would receive a new card the next day (Wednesday) by UPS. It is now the following Monday (1/20) and still no replacement card. This happened about a year ago with the same result, so why don't their representatives just say "we're too cheap to use express mail for someone who charges $100k+/year on their card." Why lie about it?

Joe's Pizza provides late night food when you need it most.  Located on N Dale Mabry, they cater to the crowd partaking in the strip clubs, but with drive though pizza it definitely beats the usual fast food late night options.

Joe's pizza is NY style, so expect a slice you can pick up and fold, with a nice crunch to the crust.
This is a great addition to the Irvington community. I buy things for my husband, then steal them to use myself. Looking forward to knocking out some holiday shopping here.

On our way to SLO we were starving so of course I went on Yelp to find our first stop on our adventure. So glad that we stopped here! Walked in and found a nice open space with plenty of pastry options to please anyone, plus a few breakfast options. Well, let me tell you, nothing here disappointed. The person taking our order was patient and helpful and the blueberry lemon scone and fresh squeezed OJ was the perfect beginning. Then we got our breakfast sandwiches and boy oh boy were they top notch! The biscuits were so fresh and the flavors blended perfectly together. If you get the chance stop by and grab a pastry to go and/or have a breakfast sandwich that is filing, but doesn't make you feel stuffed!

This is a gem of an ice cream shop/cafe, their menu is varied and balanced. Their ice cream is fresh n creamy! They carry some of the best flavor combinations for ice cream I've seen yet! Their milk shakes are divine! During winter they have traditional hot chocolate and offer exotic variants: Hawaiian coconut HC and Swiss white chocolate HC amongst some. The cafe offers fresh coffee and espresso beverages. This is the perfect place to top off the evening for a sweet conclusion.

Fine for what it is. A chain. Had very limited time, so chose this because we were already in the parking lot. Seated immediately. Kind and engaged waitress, Jennifer. Bread warm, a little overcooked, but rosemary flavor was nice.  Took longer than expected for a lunch order which was too bad. Thank goodness for the bread. Half order of butternut squash pasta with quite good if too rich. The calzone substitute was something I will not order again, not offensive though. My partner's soup and salad were definitely adequate. And bottomless.  No IPA. Overall a decent mass market American restaurant experience. Under $30
Now open on Tuesdays with $8 growler fills. What a deal!!! Dogs are allowed in the beer tasting area. Be sure to sign up for their online newsletter to get the latest scoop and happenings with Bier.

It had only been a few weeks since my last visit here, but I had the night to myself and decided I felt like traveling to Tuna Bar for dinner.  I'll admit to being a creature of habit, so no one that knows me would be surprised that tonight, absent the prodding of my wife or friends, I ordered items that I had before.  

I started with Grandmom's Wonton Soup because I needed something soothing.  I believe I tasted a very slight hint of vinegar in the broth.  I'm not exactly sure what it is, but whatever it is, it provides a modern flare to the broth, to go along with the delicate and very tasty deconstructed wontons.  The dough used for the wontons is extremely light, and the sausage is more significant with great flavor.  My second course, the Wok Kampachi Ceviche, was not only as delicious as before, but this time the kampachi was a more generous serving than my earlier experience.  

Rather than a number of smaller dishes, tonight for my third course, I decided to order a larger entree.  The Salmon Shokiyaki proved to be just the right choice.  I like my cooked salmon to have a warm pink center, yet a slight crispness on the outside.  This dish was perfectly done with a warm pink center, slightly crisp, along with a glaze on it that I think may have been miso based.  I'm not sure about the glaze, but it doesn't matter because I'd order it again anyway.  

Between the food and a sampling of a few sake's, it was a great way to spend my free time.  At this restaurant, the only other thing I really wished they served might be an assortment of robatayaki.  Are you listening Ken?

They have very high quality homemade ice cream with tons of flavors. I really liked the blueberry cornbread flavor. The shop is near Broadway so you can get ice cream before bar hopping, super convenient location!
No hitches, pleasant staff, clean rooms, good internet, comfortable beds and free breakfast.  A surprisingly good stay. Kudos to an outstanding front desk staff (Sean, Richard, et al)

I am baffled to read all the 5 star reviews, if I could I wouldn't even give it a 1 start. This place is very nice inside and reading the reviews I expected a good meal. 
First, we ordered Gyoza for appetizer and it was awful. It was like eating a day old gooey pocket of fish. I told the waitress I was in the mood for ramen and she recommend the "most traditional" which was the shio wontonmen. I can't even describe how tasteless this ramen was, it had no flavor at all. It was cold noodles in a watered down wonton soup. I didn't finish either one, got our checks and left. 
The host gave us a "parking validation" that took off .54 cents from the price of the parking. 
Will I go back?
No thanks.

While taking a morning bike ride along the beach and into town we stumbled on this super chill spot. Was great for a lazy breakfasting morning with my best girl friend and enjoy the slow morning start with good coffee and excellent food.

We stumbled upon this little gem off the beaten path about a year ago...and we keep going back.  They keep some of the same types of staples (try the Weizengoot) and rotate in seasonal and special beers too.  We recently had the Pumpkin Ale and the Autumn Saison -- both really tasty.

The initial cost when purchasing your very own growler seems a bit steep, but just remember -- you can bring that dark, curvy, beautiful glass jug back in and fill it with 64oz of delicious liquid courage any time from that day forward... even on Sundays.  Heck -- especially on Sundays in Indiana. 

Rumor has it that they are closed on Mondays and Tuesdays and only offer pints on the weekends.  Maybe we are just lucky and always hit it on a day where pints are available?!?  Also have heard the food trucks are only available when pints are.  Hmmm... I need to buy a lottery ticket with my luck so far! 

A growler refill costs 12-14 bucks, depending on the variety (the Pumpkin is currently $14 while the staples are $12).  The only thing is -- you cannot drink from the growler on site.  They also offer a smaller glass to-go bottle called the "Bullet" (32oz) should 64oz seem a bit much.

Another bonus is that they have had a different food truck parked outside each time we have gone.  They have ranged from gourmet Mac-N-Cheese to Some Guys Pizza (the Greek was uhh-mazing), to comfort food (fried catfish, pulled pork).  A nice addition when the munchies strike and they don't mind if you bring it inside to enjoy with your pint.

There are comfy couches and a TV -- looks and feels like a little community living room in the middle.  There are also tables to sit at and the restrooms are clean.  You can even buy cute/funny TShirts should you choose.

My advice: 
1.  Get your complimentary samples when you arrive -- 3 per person or 6 samples total for 2 people -- so bring a friend and share the wealth.  
2.  Pick a pint to enjoy on site.  
3.  Take a growler to go.  
4.  Repeat.
Delish!!! Worth every calorie!! Can't wait to go back. We had multiple Items and the coffee was great.

Nice change watching a live hockey game and enjoying some nachos in the restaurant upstairs at the hockey rink.  The service was good and the nachos were excellent my husband had a flight of beer - IPAs and he enjoyed them. The atmosphere is good for families.

Amazing white chocolate banana pudding ice cream!!   Will go back just for that before our trip is over.  Tried the blackberry cornbread and that was also good.  Kids has a great time taking pics with the displays in front as well!
The Brussels sprout sautéed perfectly, with the surprised sweet and salty twist. The amount of the vinegar fulfilled the taste buds, will definitely recommends.

This place is in the Westin hotel 
Up on the 11th floor 
Amazing view !
I had the burger, it was ok 
Drinks are pricey but good and it is a quite place to get away from he crowds

I literally came here twice in one week because I wanted to try more things on the menu. Everything is DELICIOUS. My personal favorites are the Walu and the Tuna appetizer. Expect to spend some money on this food but it will be worth it!

The words "Very Professional" and "Organized" are what you want with a DJ. It's a flaky and flighty market with so many freelance DJs out there with nice business cards, some impressive equipment, and a nice smile...but they are trying to be Deadmau5 or Skrillex, not a real DJ. 

We tried TKO on a recommendation, and it was a good one for sure.

We got a professional DJ with a great attitude and a warm dance floor feel. He played our music, and made sure we were good with any odd requests by the guests or unplanned additions. He kept in touch and made us happy.

These guys and gals are top notch and ready to work for you. They did a great job at my wedding, showed up on time, and perfected the mix of blending in and keeping it going. I would definitely recommend them to anyone and I will use them again I'm sure.

Mike's is a nice old time looking spot in the middle of busy Broadway Avenue.  There isn't a lot of room inside to sit and eat, and on a hot day you will want to squeeze in there to finish your soda or ice cream.  

A bit of a smaller draw is the Java bar that is also inside.  Small soda stands and ice cream joints like this have a real hard time surviving in today's high-rent world, so supporting them makes you feel as good as the feeling in your belly when you are done eating there.

Seated on the back patio, we had heaters to warm us up on a cold winter night... I loved it! 

Anyways, drinks: beer selection is weak, but I went into this understanding this is a winepub so no need to dock points there. Additionally, I was still able to find a great beer to satisfy me. We also ordered two carafes of wine which was top tier.

The food! Bacon wrapped dates were incredible and rich, the burrata and eggplant caponata was bright and light and paired with some fantastic bread, the LA crawfish grilled cheese was also rich and quite tasty while paired with a side of Cajun carrots that were unique, truffle fries were your run of the mill truffle fry experience, and the cornflake chicken sandwich was uhhhhh bland and not seasoned and the only bad part of our meal.

Pros: our waitress (I wish I could remember her name), the decorations, music, outdoor patio, the burrata and eggplant caponata, wine selection, the zony mash sour beer I settled on

Cons: that poor chicken sandwich

Closing notes: absolutely will be back, as I already have a list of new menu items I want to try

What has happen to this place? I should have opened a jar of spaghetti sauce at home and bought Trader Joe's meatballs. It was awful. My lobster bisque soup tasted like it was cheese soup. Our waitress forgot our ice tea, forgot I wanted more olive oil for the bread, and never offered parm cheese for my husbands spaghetti. I was so disappointed in the food, I use to really like this place

Not sure about Copper Vine yet.  This was my first visit and the food was ok (a solid B+).  The service was great and the atmosphere was very inviting, but the food didn't quite hit the spot.  Granted we were some of the first customers in the restaurant this morning and there were a couple of larger parties already seated for brunch.   So, I don't know.   We'll try them again for a dinner service and see.  Hopefully this was a one time situation.
I bimbimbap that was already mixed, loved the flavor i just added a little bit of soy sauce because i like salty thing but I highly recommended.

As a true antique freak, I've been to hundreds and hundreds of malls around the country, and this is up there in my top favs. Really good quality booths without being so overly curated that prices are outrageous. In fact, I bought WAY more than I anticipated because my items were so affordable. On top of that, the staff is friendly and super helpful. They even, without being asked, carried my stuff to my car for me. This place is a must stop. I'll be back for sure!

Toby did such a fantastic job helping me buy my first home years ago. I chose to work with her again on the purchase of my second home and subsequent refinance. Toby and her team are knowledgeable, professional and an absolute joy to work with. I highly recommend Toby and Premier Mortgage Resources!

I barely ever right reviews but it seems like this place is new so it doesn't have too many reviews yet and guys...this place is AWESOME! Very inexpensive and so delicious. I got the chicken, shrimp and steak hibachi and it's SO much food for such a reasonable price. It's so tasty that I can't wait to get it again.

I have been here twice...once to carry out some of their fresh bread for a friend's wedding and once for a scone with a dear friend going through a break up. The bread was delicious and the scone wasn't dry like a lot of scones I have tried.  The counter help was cheerful. I want to go back and try more items on the menu. The whole area makes you want to go back...
