Overall, I can tell why this place is jam packed at all times! It is certainly on my recommendation list and "return to" list for my next trip to Nashville!

Horrible customer service.   I just spent an hour on the phone with them, being shuffled from one person to another, and they still did not find me the right person to speak with.   It is either incompetence, or a deliberate attempt to avoid dealing with problems.

Great spot! I would come here with friends! Everyone is very friendly and I appreciated the staff being so helpful and checking in often on my table! The outdoor area is beautiful and everything I ate was great! Cool place!

I hate to leave bad reviews... I believe in giving the benefit of a doubt, but I have to review with honesty. The atmosphere is cool.. Really cold beer.. AWESOME!!! TV's at the urinal... Burger was good. Now comes the bad part.. Two of the party had order screwed up. The food came to the table piece meal and not at once or even close to being within five minutes of each other.. Come on ... It's freaking burgers, fries and run of the mill bar food. To have 10 minutes lapse between orders arriving.. Jeez!! Had to ask for refills of beer, sodas... Then you waited for 10 minutes for the refills!! All in all... Fair food, nice atmosphere, my feminist daughters were appalled by the Hooter esque dressed waitresses, crappy service... Two stars!

My husband and I really enjoyed this place, we received fantastic service from Hector, The house and caesar salad was very tasty. We tried the traditional pizza, the crust is  thin and airy, the cheese and spices just the right blend, although we enjoyed the pizza we both agreed next time we would ask for extra sauce. The  Roman Forum is a great place for families, they have a huge play room for small children with easy viewing with long glass partitions. We will definitely be back to try perhaps one of those Specialty pizzas!!!

If you are the parent of a toddler, like brunch and drinking while you brunch, and want to hang out with your friends who are also toddler parents, this place is a must in your Philly rotation. The giant indoor play area is ingenious, and the brunch food is better than it needs to be- the chicken and waffles are my personal fave. 

You do need to supervise your kids while they are playing, but I think that's the case whenever you're out and about? 

Appreciate the close proximity of the bathrooms to the kid area, and the chicken coops near the parking area- there's also an old/out of service fire engine near the parking area as well.

Busy little ice cream shop off the broadway
Tourist area. Lots of flavor to pick from and decently priced. It was yummy.

This WaWa usually stresses me out, the space is so small, and usually filled with college students who are always in the way or rude Penn/Drexel employees. You can tell good customer service isn't a priority (or at a majority of the wawa locations in Philly). I only go into this location out of convenience.
Great ice cream! A treat to downtown broadway. Nice place to cool off and get a break from the heat outside. Cherry vanilla ice cream was delicious!!
Great atmosphere, great food, good service, it will be perfect if they use glasses instead of plastic cup for cold drinks even with the customers dine in the store, let's protect the earth together!

About Chase Credit Cards:  Good luck if you get one - you'll need it.
After 2 years of having a Chase credit card I decided that I wasn't using it much and decided to cancel the card.  I notified Chase that I was cancelling the card.  They did not cancel the card.  For the next few months I got a bill that had an unsupported charge.  The section of the bill that I used to get that showed the specific charges had been omitted but the total bill had increased from zero to over $600.00.  

I wrote the company and asked for the itemized bill so that I could see what charges they were referring to.  They not only didn't do this but their letter to me said it wasn't possible for them to identify the charges and their sources.  I refused to pay them anything until they documented the bill(s).  Then they sent in a derogatory report to the 3 credit bureaus.  This violated the Fair Credit Billing Act in three different ways.

At present, I am preparing to submit my case to a class-action litigator law firm so that they can stop Chase from bothering me and any other innocent parties who are being swindled by Chase.  

Do yourself a favor - get a credit card from some other bank.
Get there early! There's a line! Amazing pastries. Pass on the egg and cheese. Good coffee.

Toby and team were incredible to work with! I just completed my second loan (a refi) and had the same great service as the first. Toby is incredibly knowledgeable and gave me a sense of peace throughout the process. Speaking of process, her team is on it! From documents and contracts to tracking me down for signatures, they were always a step ahead. Thank you Toby Team and Premier Mortgage! I would highly recommend working with them.

WOW this place is incredible. My mom and I went for our first dinner when visiting New Orleans, and at the end of our 5 day stay and a LOT of food, we still said this was our favorite meal. 

Great atmosphere and the walls are filled with really cool art. Also, the tap wall was really different and great- I wish I could have tried more wine!

When we went we just shared a few appetizers so that we could try more things and it was so fun! We tried the goat cheese + fig flatbread, salmon toast, and the pork belly & corn fried oysters. The oysters were soo tender and to die for.

Don't skip this place! Anywhere we travel I have to taste the local ice cream places. This place is delicious. The ice cream is creamy and full of flavor. I had the black cherry, Tennessee fudge, chocolate, and blueberry cheesecake and all flavors was amazing. The black cherry was my favorite.

Abby Rappoport helped me achieve a long lost sense of health. I was suffering from debilitating insomnia due to a very stressful job and family requirements. She also was able to get me through a bad bout of bronchitis. 
She is professional, thorough and clearly seasoned as a healthcare provider.
I highly recommend Abby if your situation needs caring attention.

As someone who works in the service industry this totally bums me out! The veggie burger was dry and over cooked. The small charcuterie cheese only literally came with 4 pieces of cheese and was all thrown on a box with 4 slices of bread and 5 grapes! It cost $18!!! There is absolutely no reason with the amount of people that we are able to serve in the service industry right now that something this sloppy should be happening. We should be sending out perfect orders every time and making sure that people want to come back. I  I literally spent $55 and didn't eat any of it except for my four slices of cheese! Total overpriced bummer! To further add insult to injury the delivery guy brought me a hot can of soda and left my order in front of Someone else's door even though I left specific instructions on where to meet me text me when they arrived. I wish I would've spent my money somewhere else.
Good food and great service. I have no idea what these bad reviews are about. Give it a try...support westbank restaurants!

If you like Red Velvet cake, definitely try their Red Velvet Ice Cream.

It has chunks of cream cheese icing and cake in it. The ice cream is smooth and not too sweet. The Pumpkin Ice Cream is tasty as well. It was creamy, smooth, and there were pieces of graham crackers in it. 

At around $3 for a small cup, they are very generous with the serving. The employees here are friendly and quick. There is quite a bit of seating available as well. 

Mike's is a great place to visit for a cool treat.

Took over 45 minutes to bring our food out. My boyfriend's pasta looked like it was under the heat lamp for a while it wasn't even that hot when it arrived. Asked for the steak to be well done and still had pink in the middle after a bite. They could have just brought my boyfriend's food when it was done and notified us that the steak was going to take a little longer. When we got our food my boyfriend and I had lost appetite from waiting so long. Plus not to mention there was no more than 6 tables being used with three serves and 2-3 cooks.

Cheese Steaks

Very friendly service, smiles and manners, nice shop and everything smelled very good.

I had a cheese steak on garlic bread, prov with fried onions. The small is big and priced right! BF had a more ambitious steak with wiz, red sauce, mush, peppers and onions. He was 100% satisfied and the sauce was very tasty.  

The shop doesn't have seating so make sure you call in for pick up or delivery.

Highly recommend!!

* great place for special occasions! *

i was here recently for a friends birthday, and it's a great place to go to to celebrate! it's very nice and fancy, and the food and drinks are pretty good too. the price point is a bit high, so i personally would only go here for special occasions 

i split a charcuterie board and rose sangria with the table, and the my were both delicious! the 3 meats, 3 cheeses board was *just* enough for 6 people and had some really tasty meats and cheeses. we did have a cheddar that was super sharp, and i think that was the only cheese that didn't get fully eaten 

the rose sangria was delicious! it came with a lot of ice though - like A LOT - probably because they want to give you less alcohol... it was super good but about 65% of our pitcher was ice, which is not so good

i got the croque madam for my main dish, and it was good but the ham and sauce were both a little too salty for my taste personally. but i had a bite of my friend's wagyu burger and it was so so good! cooked super well and also very well seasoned

so imo the dishes are hit or miss, the charcuterie board was great, and the drinks are kind of a rip off but they're tasty if you're willing to pay!

To me, 4 stars seems about right. A bit higher end in the quality of the sushi here and food here, but prices overall are a bit higher than many places. Overall, given the higher quality, I don't mind that too much. The atmosphere and service are both pretty nice, with a pretty neat space that is decorated nicely. Servers were able to answer questions that I posed.

Haven't tried the whole menu yet, but can recommend a few things. Overall, I like the hot entrees a bit better than the sushi and the cooked food is quite good in general (and mostly reasonably priced). Sushi is a bit on the pricey side, but nothing crazy for the quality. Having said that, I think the sushi at Kisso down the street (will review soon) is just as good, if not better. But this is a more fun place to go, so the jury is out...

Appetizers: Tuna Tartare ($14), Creamy Rock Shrimp ($12), Pork Gyoza ($8), Chicken and Shrimp Dumplings ($8), 

Soup: Grandmom's Wonton Soup ($7)

Sashimi: Toro (fatty tuna-$12), Hamachi (yellowtail-$8)

Traditional Rolls: California ($6), Real California ($9), Spicy Salmon ($7)

House Rolls: Peppered Tuna Roll ($9-favorite roll here); Dragon Roll ($12)

Special Rolls: Fishtown Roll ($17), Sindy Roll ($16), Old City Roll ($17-very good)

Hot Entrees: Salmon Shokiyaki ($23-outstanding), Bone-in Strip Steak ($36-outstanding), Lobster Fried Rice ($16), Mai Fried Rice ($14-outstanding), Stir Fried Soba Noodles ($15)

Amazing! Fantastic!! Delicious!!

Had the housemade bread with ricotta and a chopped salad. Both were delicious!! Thank you for amazing breakfast in SB. 

Will be back.
So so good! Went there twice in our 4 day stay. Highly recommend getting one of everything!

Not one of the phone numbers listed on the website or on Yelp work for this restaurant.  The website to order food to go doesn't work. Dont list it as an option if you dont intend to use it or make it available.

Good place to stay and when we came in  and  Lisa's Xu  Husband  Jin Wei  that is friend  my mom  had to pay our check in since the Family  got there first  while we got to carry an elderly which  is Lisa's Mother and the grandma of April Xu and Katherine Jin  in our car to the hotel after we pick Lisa's Mother at Lisa's House in Fresh Meadows and after we  eat lunch in Philly Chinatown and explore the area . We were put on the room in the first floor by the elevator side since it was for the mom of Lisa Xu and  Grandma  of two daughter April Xu and Katherine Jin that can' walk and using a cane to walk.  We got two Rooms with a bathroom  and two bed   and we were not across from each other and it  the other room was the near the hotel room that was across from us but it was  located one door down from the room that was across from us. There is a sofa Bed which is a pull out bed that can be turned into a bed and can turn back to a sofa. Nice breakfast area and we get to order  Dominos Pizza which was advertise on the front of the  hotel  room key card. There a TV in Lobby and this the only Marriott Hotel company  I stayed  at. I stayed at different hotel in 2  different area of VA
Good place for cocktails. Never eaten the food but looks good. The bartenders are friendly and it's usually easy to get a spot at the bar.

I thoroughly enjoyed this place. My son chose it for a dinner date to somewhere new and I was pleasantly surprised. The outdoor seating is impressive as it has the feel like you're elsewhere, not in the CBD. The food was phenomenal with the exception Rolf the French Shallot soup which was oddly thick and served at room temperature. We had a great dessert and the ambiance was lovely. Going back with friends soon.

So just did the delivery route off of Uber eats and was kind of disappointed. Not surprised for I'm always a person who believes what you order in-house is not the same love as they send out. Tonight that was proven once again. 

My expectations were set on a 4 star and better rating meal delivered. For the reviews on here were great from my fellow Yelpers. Unfortunately, you can't believe all that you read. Will say in their defense that they do not have control of the Uber drivers. For this, our food was warm and not hot enough. 

Our meals of choice for this evening were for the Mrs. I ordered her the blackened shrimp lettuce wrap. She loved it and my wife is very hard to please so kudos to the chef at the Top Shelf Sports Lounge. For my boys simple and a basic rice and beans. Nothing fancy about it they were okay with it but not the best rice and beans they had. Lastly, for myself, I ordered the Thunder chop chop bowl which I wanted to love. But due to a sufficient amount of burnt rice in the dish, they fell short of receiving my love. 

Definitely willing to try them again this time in-house. So until I make it over there this rating will stand. Everyone deserves a second chance to prove themselves. Till we meet again Top Shelf Sports Lounge.

The kitchen manager refused to admit that the pictured chicken sandwich was burnt. She took the position that she didn't know why I was wasting perfectly good food. Maybe she didn't know what burnt means. Maybe it's a deeply personal and subjective question?? The BLT had good ingredients but there was so much grease on the bread I couldn't taste anything else. The turkey sandwich was good.

Very good !!! 10x better than Benihana's I would recommend!! The yum yum sauce is also amazing .  definitely a new spot of mine I love it & it is very good priced I paid $29 for 2full meals and crab Rangoon.

This was my first brunch dining experience since COVID & I must say I felt comfortable. The staff were wearing mask, super friendly, & they don't bring menu's they have the barcode where you can scan on phone & it brings up the menu for you! Super cool! The tables were sanitized & spaced out a good bit! 
I ordered the Crawfish grill cheese & I was not disappointed! It consist of crawfish, mustard remoulade, roasted tomatoes, & aged cheddar on sourdough bread. I just wish there was a bit more crawfish but it was super delicious. Love their fries! 
I also had the chicken & boudin gumbo & it was really good! P.S. They have bottomless mimosa's! 
Can't wait to be back to try more!

I had so much fun! I've never been to a trampoline park. I'll definitely be returning! The staff is super nice and helpful. Filling out the waivers was easy and quick. I love that they have nonslip socks (for $2) so you don't slip around on the trampolines. They have foam pits, basketball, dodgeball, and so much more. 
I recommend coming here!

Yum. Great farm to table restaurant all the flavors pair so nicely together and are really well thought out and super healthy too! Also love the little patio you can sit in. The coffee is good and fruity
Dish Delish!  This is such a great place.   The egg sandwiches, cinnamon buns and challah french toast is perfect. Coffee is great too

I'm so perplexed reading over the widely divergent reviews on this place. This was our experience:

The waiter was great. 

The food was very bland, very boring. We both ordered pasta dishes. My companion's comment was that while it was not exactly bad, it was tasted pretty much exactly like the quick spaghetti we make at home with grocery store pasta sauce from a jar. Why bother going out for that? My dish was much the same - not bad exactly, but certainly not good. This is not a place we would go back to.

My favorite go-to Chinese bakery for roast pork buns, egg custard buns & tarts, and fried pork dumplings! I especially love coming here in the morning because I get to see/listen to the old Chinese men in the back talking/gossiping about the latest news (old people are so cute!). 

Pros:
-- Cheap prices! Almost every baked good is under $1
-- The ladies who work here are so friendly and always smile
-- Very consistent with almost always getting "fresh out of the oven warm" baked goods
-- Get to practice my Cantonese!

Cons:
-- Very small place, so not much moving room
-- Not a place to go to sit down and do work

Sent a message about a car key replacement. Was sent back an generic message and was asked to call in. I called in the next day and was told that he will reach back to me. Never got a call back. Went to the dealership instead and got it done in less than an hour. 

Maybe he didn't want to provide the service and could have told me instead of keeping me waiting for days for a call.
Lydia and Rachel, are the shit.  This bar is instagram super beautiful but also will take care of your alcoholic taste buds. Cheers, get your ass here

Allison is amazing at Bala Better Health!!! She is always happy to help, very knowledgeable and makes the experience fun! The location is super convenient to get to... Tons of parking! And the office is cute, clean and welcoming. I definitely recommend Bala Better Health as the perfect option for some extra help towards your health and body goals!

The ice cream here was great! It was open late so I wandered in at 11 pm to get my ice cream fix. Tried the superhero flavor and it was really really good! The service was great as well. Definitely come here for your ice cream fix!

Let me start with the goods, the associate who welcomed us into the store was very nice, helpful and extremely pleasant. But there's where it ended, he proceeded to dump us on a new hire, which I normally wouldn't have a problem with but she was sooo new, like second day new. She continually had to ask questions and rather than someone coming over to help here, they answered her questions from across the room while eating hoagies. It left me with little confidence that my glasses were going to be correct. 

I purchased a new set of prescription sunglasses that turned out pretty good, so I am happy with them, its my regular glasses that they really goofed on. I have a pair of glasses that I love and I got them about a year prior at a different Lenscrafters location and rather than spend the money on a new frame, I had them just replace the lens. When I picked them up everything seemed fine but over time they got looser and looser and when I tried to tighten them, I found out that they somehow bent the arm. The screw will no longer attach into the frame, of course this was long after the one month warranty expired. Needless to say I wasn't really happy with their handiwork. 

I know these places have a terrible turn over and I don't think I will be shopping there again. Next time I will be looking for a locally owned store with a bit more attention to service and their craft.

I had my reservations about this place. I only went two times before this last time and I had all mixed feelings about it. My first time was amazing. My second time was not so great but I did get a cute birthday pic in the bathroom. And what is brunch without a selfie in the bathroom? Am I right people??

Anyways, I met up with a friend from out of town at this place and was super excited. Of course, I looked up the menu that morning and decided what I would get. You also have to decide what you and that person can share too (foodie tip: if the person you go to lunch with doesn't mind splitting things, then do it!) Get separate plates and go ahead and cut things down the middle. Usually their sandwiches already come cut!

We got the lump crab deviled eggs, LA crawfish grilled cheese, the goat cheese and fig flatbread, and the soup of the day. It was alot of food but so good. HIGHLY recommend the LA crawfish grilled cheese. It comes with fries that are just too good to pass up. Also, ask to sit on the patio. If you make reservations, give them a call and see if they can sit you in that area or the balcony. Cute pictures for days and all the vibes you need.

I applied for a United Chase Bank card after some of my United miles expired and in doing so they would be reinstated. There was a 30000 miles benefit deal for applying for the card so I did so. About 10 days after I had applied for the card and been approved I received a mailed offer from United for 50000 miles for the same card! I called Chase and explained that I would prefer to have the 50000 mile benefit card. The customer service rep was very nice and emailed my request to his supervisors. Today I received a letter from Chase that they would honor the 50000 miles offer- given I meet the requirement of spending $2000 on the card over 3 months instead of the $1000 requirement to get the 30000 miles over the same time period!!! How great is that?? Got to hand it to Chase and United for being standup and really being customer friendly. When was the last time a bank did this for you???

I want to support caviar & bananas since they have reopened but unless you happen to be walking by, parking is incredibly inconvenient. I paid $12 for a decent salad, $4 for an iced tea, and $4 for parking. They don't validate parking and the garage charges $4 for 0-60 minutes. Even if you want to pop in and grab a salad or sandwich, it's gonna cost you $4 extra. Not worth it.

So there seems to be some a few mixed reviews on this place and I honestly can't see why. It's a beautiful restaurant, the food and service was great and their specials were amazing. The ambience is perfect for a date night. We ordered the brussel sprouts which were nicely charred and doused in sweet and salty sauce, and the tuna tartare which isn't a super unique dish but it was done very well and it came with rice crackers to serve as a vehicle for the tuna. We also went with some happy hour rolls of spicy tuna, salmon avocado which were $5 each then a peanut avocado roll as well for $6. The peanut avocado roll is so simple and so good. I actually ordered a second one I liked it so much. I've had spicy tuna at more places than you can count, and this is exactly what you want when ordering spicy tuna. You can tell a restaurant knows what it's doing by the rice. Tuna bar knows what it's doing. Again, these aren't super original, but just done very well and a bit more refined than your typical fusion restaurant. We finished the meal with some Mochi for dessert that had 3 flavors and they were all delicious.

Since there's a lack of happy hour info on Yelp, here's the down low on their happy hour. This could be the best happy hour deal in the whole city. It's Mon-Fri from 4:30-7. Drink options are: one sake (mine was only $4 and poured traditionally overflowing into a masu box), one house red and one house white wine for $7. We went with the white and it was pretty good. You have the options of 3 beers, Kirin, Kirin Lite, and Orion for $5, $4, $4 respectively. Then there's one rotating house cocktail for $7. The night we went, it was a gin martini made with craft vermouth which is a ridiculous deal for just $7. Judging the way they handled the sake alone I'm sure their bar program is excellent. I will return to confirm this.

Happy hour food: 3 rolls for $5 each, Spicy Tuna, Spicy Salmon, and Salmon Avocado. There's also chicken and shrimp dumplings for $7, edamame for $4 and shrimp and oysters for $2 a piece. 

Bonus tip: (as far as I know) every Tuesday is Tuna Tuesday. Spicy tuna rolls are $6 all day and tuna tartare is $7. Every Thursday is Toro Thursday. Negitoro rolls are $7 all day. 

Just come try this place for a happy hour, you'll never want to leave.

This is a busy spot right off Broadway. I ordered a single scoop in a cake cone of chocolate peanut butter. I was excited because it was homemade but it was a very lackluster flavor. Wasn't really chocolatey and were ribbons of PB like their usually is in this flavor. It was just okay. Maybe i just picked the wrong flavor.

My favorite brewery in Indy! Bier has a unique coffee-shop atmosphere that makes you feel welcomed as soon as you walk inside. The best part about Bier is that it's dog-friendly, making it my go-to cold weather watering hole. Great to stop by after picking up the dog from Puppy Playground across the street. They've got live music, euchre night, and the best fortune cookies to munch on while you drink. They rotate their taps often and have a little bit of something for everyone. Definitely worth checking out!

I had high expectations based on all good reviews and I wanted to try some pastries and breads there.  I got there around 11:30am on Wednesday.  The order line was long, so I waited for 10-15 minutes to get closer to the counter to see what kinds of pastries and breads they had.  They were almost empty.  I saw a couple cookies on a plate and a couple loaves of breads on a shelf.  That's it.  I was very disappointed.

Beautiful decor, delicious food and friendly, prompt service! Have been here twice now and both visits have been outstanding. We have ordered from hot dish side both times. We could eat the rock shrimp all day!!! The dumplings, rice and noodle bowls were also outstanding.  Can't wait to return.

This restaurant is located inside the AdventHealth Center Ice rink.  However, it is a full service restaurant with bar and the menu is fantastic.  Not your typical burgers and fries (even though they have that!).   I love their wings (all the flavors) and anything with their pulled pork.  I've had almost everything on their menu and nothing disappoints.

Sitting on the patio is definitely the way to go. Came with my husband during Covid and sat on the porch. Atmosphere was perfect!  I had the beet salad and red drum. Absolutely amazing!

I highly recommend and would come again!

This is the best jump place in the Treasure Valley. It is super clean, open and well lit. The staff is helpful and always available. They often offer fun ideas to the kids. We love their Toddler Time during the day because it allows my preschooler to jump without fear of large, gangly tween limbs. I have used them for several Meetup events and they have always been accommodating and kind. They even threw in free socks for the kiddos!

I rented a bike for 2.5 days and after first day, bike was having issues. I called them as soon as I got into town and stopped in the following morning. The guys at the shop were very helpful and gave me no grief. We swapped bikes and I continued on with my vacation. The experience was spot on as was the customer service. I enjoyed dealing with the guys there and look forward to renting from them in the future. Thanks for everything!!!

Very tasty bibimbap in a cozy one man shop - the ingredients are well prepared. The process is a bit confusing because you're not sure if you just sit down or walk to the register but I always recommend going up to order and he will serve you. The beef bibimbap was very satisfying and delicious. Perfect for when you don't want to eat anything heavy but still want substance.

We came for happy hour and got lots of amazing food on the happy hour menu too! First of all, the service was ON POINT! The waitress was very sweet and the food came swiftly . Did I mention the happy hour sake ?! Omg it's actually two pours in one ; it comes in a sake box filled with sake. We got the entire happy hour and it was DELICIOUS! Very fresh and not over the top with sauce . The roles were light rice and a great amount of fish for happy hour ! We live a block away and we will be back often ! We are so excited to have a good sushi restaurant around the corner . Life is good. Ask for Jenna the server. She is amazing .

In the midst of Covid-19 angst, having really good food delivered helps one to cope with the daily stress of it all. Last night I decided to try a new UberEats offering, Copper Vine. The menu via UberEats is pared down from what I see on their main website. Not sure if that's an app limitation, or just an inventory issue when I placed the order. In any case, what was offered seemed very appealing to me and my family. We ordered two of their take on the Impossible Burger, their Waygu Beef Burger, their Copper Vine Cuban sandwich, and the Baby Herbs Salad. After placing the order, my wife and I went back to the distraction of streaming TV. After probably 20 minutes or so, I got an alert from my UberEats driver that there was an issue and he would be delayed. I called the restaurant and was told that the chef wasn't happy with the presentation of one of my entrees and was remaking it. I thought to myself, "Wow, perfection during a pandemic. That's a good sign." ... and I have to say I was more than happy with the food. When it did arrive a short while later, my family was more than happy with the quality and presentation of the food. Everything was top notch and delicious. 

If you're looking for your next meal in lock down, you really should give them a try. 

Thanks, Copper Vine!
Been going here for years! Amazing food the Italian sub could feed four! Everything is fresh and the owners are always there and super nice and attentive

This place works for anything. After work happy hour, date night, family dinner, before or after a visit to the dome, or just when you need a glass of wine. Located on Poydras there is street parking and a park mobile lot behind on Okeefe. Reservations help but are not required. They have a wonderful lush patio. Indoor seating is nice with several different setups on the first floor, as well upstairs dining, and small second floor balcony searing. They have many wines on tap and you can choose a flight (smaller pour/reduced price), half glass, full glass, etc. They also have a nice list of bottled wines. Happy hour is Monday - Friday from 3:30 - 5:30pm, $5 glasses of our Signature Red and White Blends, 1/2 off bottles of any wine on tap, and snacks starting at just $5 and as always complimentary popcorn!

I am a big fan of diverse ice cream flavors, and this place definitely has that. If you are cold and not necessarily feeling a frosty treat, they also have different hot chocolate flavors from around the world-the Italian hot chocolate is amazing, by the way! The staff were friendly and willing to go the extra mile to ensure that we were enjoying our coffee. I do wish that they had more outlets so that I could work and enjoy a treat, but it is still a cool place nonetheless.

I didn't even go in to spend time with the cats, I just popped in to check out the wears out front and it was well-worth the trip! 

First, the hot chocolate and whipped cream was one of the best I've ever had. Second, the hipster cat sugar cookies, (from their Back to School collection,) were both adorable AND incredible. If I could buy them by the dozen, I would. (I'll have to go to Milk and Cookies Bakeshop on the southside to do such a wonderful thing!) 

While there, I dropped a pile of cash on things that I "needed" for myself and my cats... cat nip bubbles, a fleece toy, stickers, buttons... Oh boy, I could have purchased even more, but, well, responsibilities.
The food was delicious! The crawfish grilled cheese was excellent! The service was great, too! Really nice and always made sure we were satisfied. And the atmosphere is so cute

Best things about this place are the toilet seats and ambiance. The toilet seats are heated and are Japanese luxury seats with duvets and such. Service was slow. The table wasn't greeted until maybe 15 minutes later, & I asked where our server was. Server seemed annoyed by me when I would ask for something. Guess I was deemed needy, but she was away for long periods at a time. I added lobster tails to our dinner for $10 each. They were the size of a shriveled shrimp. I guess I got what I paid for, but I can get a full lobster tail somewhere else for like $25. The NYE dinner was alright. Wouldn't pay $85 a person here again though. Wagyu wasn't that great, & dessert was just a bunch of mochi that I didn't care for. Serving sizes are tapa sized portions. Even for the entree. My boyfriend was still hungry so I ordered a pizza from Gino's East to be delivered to the house when we left here. I'd go back here for drinks and the fancy toilet seats, but that might just be it.

If I'm driving to Philly for some cheese steaks from NYC, I know I have to go to St Honore Pastries for some egg tarts. I guess with everything going on with the pandemic, I thought the staff would have taken more precautions.  I didn't realize it at the time, maybe I was just too eager to have some egg tarts, but the lady that took my order used her hands (without gloves) to get the egg tarts instead of tongs.  Am I being overly paranoid?!?  I mean, I've been to Chinatown and Flushing in NYC, so a woman using her hands to get me a bao isn't out of the norm but that was before Covid.  If I had to rate the egg tarts (yup, ate them waaaaay before I played back the experience in my head) and cha sui baos, I'd definitely give it 5 stars but because of the lack of safety precautions, had to bump them down to 2 stars. Oh, the store hours aren't correct on Yelp, I made the mistake of going at night (before closing time) and they were already closed.

Today I finally get to experience Romano's Macaroni Grill! And it was yummy-good! Our server was super sweet and nice; she made us feel very welcomed (Sam).
Usually when I feel like having pasta, Olive Garden was quickly my go-to, but this place is pretty different so I'll definitely come try this place again!

Pretty dope. Craft beer, good food, kids playground, and Nintendo emulators. We Ordered the chicken sandwich and pull pork one. The pork was better. Ordered fries and Mac and cheese for kids. Mussels were good too.
Order the breakfast sandwich with avocado. I've probably had it about 20x. To die for. And an affordable price considering the area.
Great food for a good place and the house blonde was fantastic. Any place with asparagus is a great place. Alyssa and Bree were both wonderful and attentive.

We went to Gilley's for an afternoon fun. We found couple of items and decided on one item. 6 cups and a coffee mug tree. We just wanted the cups and not the tree. Eventually, we started to venture more around the mall and all of the sudden we were being rushed out the mall. They were closing and they were announcing we will be closing every five minutes. Who does that?  So we decided to go up and pay. We were greeted by a gentleman name Jeff. So, we ask if he can call the owner of the booth and ask if we can just buy the cups and not the tree. No we will not do that, so we said obviously he doesn't want to. He got snappy with us and ask if we wanted the items or not. We said, we are not arguing with you about it. So he said, if we call the owners, we will be doing that all day. We are not about to do that. This is the only antique shop I have been to that does not want to barter. Anyways, he proceeded to be rude. So we paid for our items and he packaged them up and handed it to us and said here you go.. No thank you, no have a nice day. Dude, you need to go and learn CUSTOMER SERVICE. This is the second time we have been treated badly by the employees at this establishment. We will not be coming back and I encourage others not to do so as well.

I LOVE this spot. Absolutely one of my favorite brunch spots in Santa Barbara. Everything that I've had here has been phenomenal and their food is so well plated! I think my favorites are the Green Eggs and Ham and the Granola Bowl, but it's hard to say because it's all so good!!!!
Super cute setting, nice outdoor tables. Service at the register was friendly. Cold brew was sooo good as were the sandwiches we got. Will most definitely be back.

Me and my Black friends went into this establishment and we were greeted and seated immediately and then 1 minute later we were moved to a different seat because of no reason really... we were seated a total of 10 mins no waiter the moment a group of white women walked in the were seated immediately and greeted immediately and served their water immediately. MIND YOU THERE ARE 4 DAMN WAITERS STANDING AROUND HAVE A FULL CONVERSATION LOOKING AT US LIKE WERE FOREIGN. Highly upset with their service.! Please do better or at least train your ignorant employees to know black people aren't foreigners! Tf! 


But watch the moment another group of black people walk in after this review their going to act waaaay better. 

THE DAMN PLACE WAS BASICALLY EMPTY!

I cannot rave enough about Ardmore Pizza. Not only is their pizza amazing, but the owner is the nicest man alive. My fiancé and I were stranded in a near parking lot with a dead battery, and he left a busy operation to jump in his truck and come give us a jump. His kindness saved the day and I couldn't be more grateful. Finding a local business owner who truly cares about the community that he/she serves is a rare gift and Ardmore Pizza is home to one. Now go order a pizza and support an awesome business!!

This is one of my favorite cafes to get a super filling and delicious salad and I'm a huge sucker for clean, spacious and classy aesthetics. My mood instantly lifts when I come here - everything is just so pleasing to the eye and taste buds. 

There are 3 separate sections in this cafe: beverages, sandwiches and salads. I've only ordered at the salad bar so I can't speak for the others yet. It's SO good and I've noticed that the majority of other patrons order the salad too. I get the BYO salad for $13 and they give you a huge portion so it's def worth it. I love how they chop up the salad in front of you which makes it taste so fresh and also easier to eat. 

I've seen people read and work here so it can be a nice study spot. There is AMPLE seating!

Great service! I got rear-ended on a Sunday, so I waited to the next day to call a couple of auto body shops. One of the body shops failed to pick up my call and did not respond to my voicemail. I understand the Coronavirus may have impacted them. However, that's where Iron Body's competitive advantage kicked in. I got a satisfactory quote that same Monday. By Friday of that same week, I drove out with my repaired and washed car! I said it's okay if I don't get it until next week. I understand a lot of work and time goes into car repairs. Regardless, I drove out within the same week as a happy satisfied customer! Highly recommend!

I received very good customer service so that made my experience better. Their tenderloins are strange. They're not like us Hoosiers are used to. The breading is too thick and they slap a slice of american cheese on it. It just wasnt what we would think of as a tenderloin. I took a few bites and boxed it. I thought that if I took it home I could doctor it up somehow. It was gross. 

I've had other meals here that were pretty food. I think they should personally take the tenderloin off the menu if they're not going to do it right. I have never had a bad tenderloin. I didnt even think it was possible.

River Crossing B&N is my favorite Indy bookstore because I always find something special there, it's neat and clean, and close to my home. 
This store is well stocked and cozy. 
However, last night in particular, I was very impressed. I went for Kimberla Lawson Roby's book signing. The staff was wonderful. They did the best they could to accommodate the readers with chairs and a round of sample cinnamon dolce lattes, it was nice.

Great service and very knowledgeable servers.  Server recommended a Seaglass Pino Noir which was excellent.  Menu seemed limited but we ordered the Margherita Flatbed for a light snack.  More than enough for two people.  Atmosphere was very laid back with both indoor and outdoor seating.  Definitely will return.

Met a friend here recently for dinner.  They put a huge tent up in the parking lot for outdoor seating.  We sat down and were waited on promptly.  Got our drink order, drinks showed up quickly.  We ordered, I got the shrimp scampi appetizer, and my friend had a salad.  Scampi was perfect, my friend said her salad was real good.  We ended dinner with a couple of glasses of wine.  It was a nice evening that night perfect to sit and have a glass or 2 of wine.

Dr. Michael Adam's is a kind, compassionate and gentle dentist. He stays on top of everything and a perfectionist. Last year he saved my 89 year old mother from losing all her teeth. It was numerous visits and each everyone she was pain free and "zero" issues. I am currently seeing him to replace 3 thirty year old crowns. I am one of those nervous nellie's when having even a teeth cleaning- but it is truly pain free! Dr. Adams personally called last evening as he did with my Mother last year to see if I was ok. 
He is in practice with his lovely wife. They truly treat you like family as are very accommodating. He also has full time lab next door.

We've been meaning to check out Craft Hall since its new Dog Park Beer Garden installation. Currently, this is the only beer garden in the city that has a dog park so we were really excited to see what it has to offer. When we arrived, the dog park looked pretty crowded so we decided to grab a couple of drinks in the outdoor dining area.

There were other patrons dining outside with their dogs and it was a nice environment except for the occasional loud motorcycles on Columbus Blvd.

My husband placed our drink orders and a dog biscuit through contactless ordering. Our order arrived not long after. The drinks were all right. The dog biscuit was huge, which was great, but it was so hard to break into pieces and chew that we decided against giving it to our pup.

We also noticed many small shards of broken glasses on the ground in the outdoor dining area. A dog could easily have stepped on it and gotten hurt. My husband and the family from a neighboring table picked up the pieces of glass and removed them from the area but I'm very upset about this.

I really want to like Craft Hall but I don't think we will be back.

I have been looking for a good veterinary center for a while. This place is about an hour drive from my house. No regrets. The place is clean and well maintained. The staff is courteous and patient. And I know, I am not the easiest person to deal with.  Dr. Tanya Thies is very professional and attentive. She does not use "scary tactics" to push unnecessary procedures, like every other place I have been to! She takes her time to do the exam and listens to what I have to say. Very recommended.

Just visited this shop for the first time today. He has lots of great items, including a good selection of beard care products. I really like the exclusive "Deviant" beard oil. I will definitely be back soon. If you're looking for gifts for a man, this is a great place to start.

Horrible. I go out to eat quite a bit and this was one of the worst experiences I've had overall. The wait to order drinks, order food, get food, all of it was a very long time. And they weren't packed, just generally busy. We are talking 15 mins to order drinks. Then after that I got my meal finally. I ordered the pot roast. There is usually some fat in the meat- that is to be expected. There was only 4 bites of meat. The rest was fat. I'm going to have to go get something else to eat after this because I don't want to eat $15 slimy fat.

I looked all over downtown for a non-alcoholic frozen, frosted or even just regular iced lemonade because I was dying of thirst and it was just simply not "five o'clock somewhere" yet. Mike's was the only place to come up on Yelp for having virgin lemonades but the second I got there and saw all the amazing ice cream orders I immediately changed my order to a root beer float. 

Turns out it was National Root Beer Float day anyways so #Winning on my part. They make the soda there in shop with syrups, I believe, and their ice cream is locally made. I got the Caramel Cone in my float and man was it perfect. It was a very generous scoop with such thick consistency that even the carbonation couldn't puncture. I would 100% order again. Next time around I'll try an orange soda with orange sherbert as someone in front of me ordered that and it sounded/looked absolutely fantastic. 

Mike's is nationally famous for their ice creams being featured in People magazine and on Rachel Ray. They are known for their legendary blackberry cornbread and having the widest variety of coffee and espresso drinks in downtown Nashville. They also do brownie sundaes, milkshakes, coffee shakes, banana splits, and sorbets. The staff are super cool and the line moves fast. Everything is well priced, there's space inside for groups and it's definitely a kid friendly spot. Would highly recommend!

Super cute place. Come early because when it gets busy it will take 20-30 min to get a coffee. Ordered lox bagel and the salmon was super sparse. For 12 bucks I usually get a bunch of salmon. Super cute date coffee place. If you are coming to eat and get coffee for value it's not great. They could add another cash register and staff on Sunday. That would help a bunch.
Literally my favorite restaurant in Tampa. Food is AMAZING and resonably priced. Drinks are pretty good but really expensive tho.

I was nervous to try a different sushi spot than my usual favorites. I was right to be nervous. The sushi was very underwhelming. It tasted like suburb sushi at city prices. The drinks were amazing and the ambiance of the restaurant was nice, so if you wanted to come here for drinks I recommend it. Unfortunately there was nothing special about this sushi at all. For $180 for 2 people I expected to have a better meal.

I was happy that Tuna Bar had indoor seating as an option! Everything was nicely spaced out and clean! Our waiter was very friendly even though our rolls seemed to take a long time coming out. The miso soup was Luke warm but good. The rolls were delicious! The speciality rolls were creative and yummy. The King ghidora roll was by far the best! Slightly spicy and super fresh! Tuna bar is a great spot and I've been several times- last night wasn't their best but the rolls are worth it!

Yum yum yum! Where to begin?! Blueberry cheesecake icecream is by far my favorite. The seasonal pumpkin icecream was best I've ever had. Their specialty got cocoa is great and I'd recommend the Hawaiian kind. You really can't go wrong with any of these homemade treats!
We love everything about Top Shelf.. The food is amazing and the bartenders are STELLAR!!! Give them a try!!!!

This place is a hidden gem. I was walking through the front door and saw these flowers on the right side that I've never seen before, pretty cool. The breakfast sandwich is really good. Everything is homemade and hearty. I had a mocha which was smooth and hot.  

While I was enjoying my breakfast, it's neat to see the bakers through the windows working away..

Stop by for a treat.

Went here for lunch. I had the Italian sub.  The price and the service was good. The bread had too much flour on the top. It tasted like you were eating raw flour.  The inside of the sandwich was good. The bread ruined the whole sandwich. I will try the chicken salad next. I saw this and it looked good.

My friend and I originally came here to attend a "Ramen Off" but after seeing that "cheeseburger ramen" was being served we decided to skip it and just eat at the restaurant. The event was held upstairs, and there were plenty of open tables on the dining room floor.

We got there at 5:10 and were put on the waitlist for the Ramen off. At around 5:25 we went up to the hostess stand (there were 3 hostesses) and asked if we could be taken off the list for the event and just dine in downstairs. The hostess asked us to hold on a "moment" and she would seat us. 20 minutes rolls by and it looks like she has no intention to seat us. I asked another hostess who said she couldn't seat us until the person who controlled the seating was back and she was currently on the phone. Again, at least half or more of the tables are open. Another 10-15 minutes till around and that second hostess seats us, in the back of the dining hall, without any apology or care we had to wait for over 30 minutes to sit. I also didn't understand why we were seated in the back when there were plenty of open tables in the front of the restaurant. 

Our service was decent but I felt like she was in a rush. I understand it might have been stressful because an event was taking place upstairs.

The cocktails are good depending on what you get, but I don't know if they're "$14 good." 

The food we ordered was the Tuna Tartare (it was excellent, and my favorite), the Shumai dumplings (my friend liked these, I didn't care for them), the hash browns (these were also very delicious and a nice spin on a traditional American food), and the spicy crab noodles (also pretty good).

All in all, the food is good, the restaurant is beautiful, but for me I appreciate an overall experience and if I feel like a burden to the staff I guarantee you I won't come back no matter how good the food can be. 

Also the heated toilet seats were nice...

Oh and we left the restaurant at 7:00 pm and got a phone call that our table for the Ramen Off was available. We would have had to wait 2 hours and we got there 10 minutes after it started!

This is my new brunch spot! Came here with a friend on a beautiful Sunday afternoon. Had the bottomless mimosas (get it with grapefruit juice) Brussels sprouts, crawfish beignets; our main entrees were the Croque Madame and the Jumbo Lump Crab Benny. Everything tasted great. Presentation is beautiful. Service is top notch! Tiki was our server. She was so sweet and helpful. Copper Vine is a Instagram influencers' 
D R E A M! Plenty of places to take great pictures for the Gram. ESPECIALLY their gorgeous restroom.
Awesome ! Place is great .. it's a destination point in Ardmore for fantastic pizza, cheesesteaks , hoagies and more !!  Highly recommend !
Great place for healthy take-out food. The bibimbap has great ingredients, great taste without being over-salted or over condimented. This feels like Korean home-made food.

The best mocha latte ever... no one can do better!!! Came for a light lunch and the ricotta toast was exactly what I never knew I needed in my life. It was perfectly sweetened with honey striking a balanced between a sweet and savory snack.
Amazing. I love the heat slash poutine. Delicious. Great place to eat and watch local hockey.

Stopped in here for lunch and was pleasantly surprised. The food was delicious and their outdoor seating is beautiful. If you come you have to get their jumbo lump Crab meat deviled eggs!!! The gulf fish was also delicious - I really enjoyed its preparation. The staff is all very nice - my waiter recommended this cocktail and I wasn't disappointed; however they couldn't really give me a read on the menu as apparently they haven't tried much on it which was disappointing to me.

Everything was good. How about we start there.

Beer: 22oz of Yuengling. Check!
Appetizer: Fried pickles and Queso. Double check!
Entree: Four mini cheeseburgers with onion and pickle. A very delicious check! And fries? Check that off too!
The birthday celebration song and dessert: Check!

There was a very VERY pregnant waitress on the table next to us, which was somewhat off-putting, but I think my entire group got over that pretty quickly as the drinks and the food hit our table. The fried pickles and queso were out super fast. The beer lagged behind but you know the bar gets busy at a place like this. We had enough time to do some damage on the appetizers before the entrees hit the table. 

The theme of the restaurant is fun. The food is good. I like this place.

Nice arrangement of TV's, but the food and drink prices are more than I would like to pay. Take away their hook and it's a run of the mill joint.

The bartenders aren't interested in talking to you, if that's what you're wondering.

BAP is great home Korean cooking. The owner is courteous and kind. I'm partial to the vegetable and tofu bibimbap, which always contains a fresh array of veggies with a perfectly cooked egg on top. If I lived closer, I'd be here more often. The cinnamon tea is also delicious! Eat here!

Chase has the WORST customer service. They restricted my daughters account because a check "might be" fraudulent, which left her unable to use her account.   ANY OTHER banking institutions who would just not Release the funds until the check cleared. It's called a pending transaction. I talked to 3 different people that ALL gave different answers. Not only that, she didn't have access to the money already in her account. Any other bank would just not release the funds instead of taking the money out of her account because a check might not be good. I made her switch to BOA.

We just had lunch for 3 and it came to $78! My kid had lobster bisque and french fries. I had the mom's ricotta meatballs with spaghetti bolognese and a salad. And my husband had pasta milano with broccolini. And we ordered bruschetta for the whole family. My spaghetti was oily and had basically no meat sauce and the meatballs just tasted like oregano and nothing else. It was disgusting and inedible. My husband's pasta was flavorless. You could not taste garlic, cream, mushrooms or tomatoes. Again all you could taste was oregano! The pasta was very al dente and overall it was just Bland and disappointing. The broccolini were raw and had no seasoning on them whatsoever not even salt or butter or anyting! The only thing I actually liked was the bruschetta which I added a balsamic glaze to. The fries were fine nothing special, the lobster bisque was okay. Save your money there's way better food elsewhere! I've never had spaghetti that was inedible before.

Ordered a chocolate milkshake! It had a lot of flavor and didn't taste too chocolatey. The place offers a lot of different flavors for ice cream and the service is friendly. I wish I tried a few samples of the flavors they offered.

A great first meal in NOLA.  I don't normally eat much French food so I relied on my server's picks and they were spot on. The restaurant has more than 30 glasses of wine on tap--I went with three half glasses: the Malbec, Zin, and Albariño were all $4-$5 each for a small pour and I'd get them again as I thought they went well with my entree, esp. the Albariñoo. Bouillabaisse was excellent--the sauce was light and buttery and was the perfect complement to the seafood. My server's rec of the buttermilk cake was perfect.

I will be in town all week for a conference and am sure I'll be back.

One of the best ice cream ever! Not too sweet, rich in flavor! We do usually try to stay away from sweets but we were absolutely glad that we had both ice creme and mango smoothies!
The young people worked there were polite and pleasant too.

This is a nice Marshalls, and it is pretty new. I love looking through the clothes, clearances, house decorations, and dog aisle. 

You can easily shop in this area with Bealls Outlet, and Ross being in the same area.
Food = tasty and quickly prepared.  Beverages = good beer selection, large pours.  Interior = clean and very open (great sight lines).  Staff = pleasant, helpful and nice to observe (as expected).
The food is so good. Full bar with a variety of high end liquors and sakes to choose from. Can't wait to be back!

Wow this place must be good with a line out the door!  They state it's homemade ice cream and the anticipation was increasing as the people were walking out with their ice cream cones in hand. Even on a day where the temps were near 50 the place just lured you in on many levels. Waiting in line for 25' left me to wonder if it will be worth it and let me tell you folks it was. 
There are a few tables inside to sit and enjoy your treat but they are snagged up before people get their cold treats. They do not have tables or chairs outside so it's pretty much walk and lick once you get you order. 
The price isn't that bad. $3,60 for a single scoop but it's generous.  They have a menu board for you to look at while in line and if they run out of a flavor, which happens a lot when standing in line, it is immediately deleted from that board. So don't get your hopes up that you will get that blueberry cheesecake flavor. They have the standard flavors and then they have their own concoctions. Once at the counter you do realize you pay extra for everything. Come 30 cents, waffle 99 cents etc. they can do shakes floats boats etc. you can also taste test flavors if you're not sure. Sorry there aren't any soy based flavors so for this lactose intolerant sweetie I wasn't able to get any.  But my daughter did. She chose the standard cookies and cream and cookie dough. I did taste the blueberry cheesecake and it was the creamiest and cold just the right hardness ice cream I've ever had. You could tell they have perfected the art of ice cream making. My daughters visual had huge chunks of Oreo and cookie dough packed inside the luscious creamy ice cream. 
They did sell other things like coffee and fruit shakes but I didn't see one person walk away with those in hand. In fact the coffee is kept in a carafe and you get it on your way out. So there isn't a great deal of selling other menu items going on. 
I would recommend stopping here anytime you're visiting. It is worth the wait and the price is pretty good. The staff is also very friendly and they have patience with the masses. Now go enjoy that treat.

Loved this place! Firstly they let us  bring our dog inside on a cold day which was nice of them. The coffee was delicious and their breakfast was so good. We got the granola and ricotta toast. Both were big servings and hearty. Both delicious. We will definitely check this place out again. They have communal type seating inside and separate tables outside. Highly recommend!

I got food poisoning from this restaurant.  I ordered a turkey burger with avocado, spinach.  Two hours later I'm in the bathroom.  I ended up in the hospital 5 hours after that from sickness and dehydration.  I spoke to owner wanted to claim no responsibility but wanted to give me a gift card for my troubles.  I said no I want you to pay my hospital bill!  Don't go there unless you want to get sick!

This place was recommended to me from a group of friends that (now used to) go here. If you want to get "sold" and ripped-off, visit this place. If you walk in a few minutes to when Happy Hour ends, you won't get served until after Happy Hour is over. Then you're going to get upsold on items thinking they are provided as a courtesy to make up for not overriding the Happy Hour pricing. They got our money in the short-term, but we won't be back.

It's was first time with friends.
I had a mezacalito was ok .
Eggplant mozzarella was awesome.
I had a pesto was ok bread was cold and hard.
Wasn't busy.
Bartender she was focused on only front guest.just looking us when we need anything.
Value was ok.
Experience was ok.

Heard great things about this bakery. While on a weekend in the Funk Zone we decided to grab breakfast here. I wanted to try the Green Breakfast Bowl but they changed their menu and it was no longer available. I opted for the Santa Barbara bowl with no regrets. We got it to go and it was delicious. The veggies and mushrooms were sautéed nicely and paired well with the poached egg and French feta. It was a refreshing and healthy breakfast. I would grab this dish again. Banana bread slice as also moist and yummy.
If you want to be a bad girl eating chocolate...then eat the best! Made on the premises and doesn't get any better! Sweet Things is top in my book!
I've hated on this sonic location before, but to be fair, I actually had quick and very friendly service this time. Maybe they it's a fluke, or maybe they have changed things for the better. Good job
Stopped in for ice cream. Ordered coffee and wasn't very flavourful.  Sat outside which was comfortable spot.

My friends and I had dinner at Doc Mc's last night. We went around 8-ish, it was pretty packed inside. The food was good but took forever to come out. I had something from the March mussel madness menu, one if their march specials I guess. It was pretty good, although one of my friends ordered scallops and we didn't think it was good. Needed more flavor. My other friend ordered their lobster ravioli, it was pretty good but the portion is so little along with the scallops. The drinks were good! I had orange crush. Overall, good was average. Raw clams were excellent and fresh. The orange crush was good. Waiter was nice and attentive. :)

Best dinner we had since we have been intown this week . From The rosemary bread and olive oil, to the best chicken parmigiana I have had in a really long time and we ended with chocolate chip cannolis. Kudos to Travis our food server that tied it all together and made it a great evening!

Fantastic Japanese restaurant downtown. Lovely atmosphere, great drinks and the food was lovely. Try the crab noodle dish. Wait staff is excellent, knowledgeable, and helpful in guiding you through the menu. We'll be back!

This place satisfies the nostalgia for Old New Orleans cuisine and atmosphere in perfect balance with a desire for the fresh and creative flavors so many ambitious local chefs are doing now.  We shared a bottle of wine and the perfectly prepared Brussels Sprouts with garlic aioli and ordered the freshest, most flavorful and not over seasoned ratatouille and bouillabaisse as our meal.  The only thing I can think to say I would have preferred is more broth in the bouillabaisse and a bigger spoon. Located in what used to be Maylies on Poydras for nearly 100 years, Copper Vine offers great wine at reasonable prices and the service is second to none.  Grace was our server and was an absolute delight.  She was not only hospitable, charming and knowledgeable of the restaurant, food and libations but she was also very well versed in the chefs and food scene within 30 miles of the Metro NOLA area.  On your visit to Copper Vine, it is worth asking for Grace to be your server.

For a local groomer, I like K-9 Groom Room. I give 3 stars for the building and 4 stars for the service.  Here are some of my thoughts.

Pros:
Did a good job
My dog is happy to see his groomer when we enter the building
Groomer plays with my dog
Price is economical
Friendly staff

Cons:
The inside isn't lavish
Close early during the week

Wonderful bakery! Little bit of a line getting in but well worth it. I had the "special" of green eggs and ham. The biscuit was incredible and would happily buy it separately and the rest was great. My wife had the avocado toast with cucumbers which was light and refreshing. The only photo we captured was of the drinks after we devoured our food.

First off the greenery in their outdoor seating area is amazing! I was with family on a trip when we drove by at 2am. I knew i would have to try them before we left. With an EXTENSIVE wine selection I with the Bordeaux and my sister the Albariño. DELICIOUS!

I found that the "sharing is caring" approach was the best way to enjoy all of our meals. We started with the truffle fries (TO DIE FOR) and the tuna tartar topped with caviar #YUM! As main course items we chose the gnocchi dish with crawfish+andouille sauce  and the ancient grain + sugarcane salad! After a weekend of indulging in fried goods Copper Vine provided a refreshing meal packed with FLAVOR!

If you're ever in NOLA give them a try! Our waiter was even kind enough to provide us with activities/things to do in the area that was rain proof... we decided to travel there with a tropical storm passing by

I Have not been here in so many years that I forgot what kind of fun stuff is in the store. I generally bring my son who likes to look through all the clothes travel accessories and candies. I have always found great bargains because I go for the more unusual items such as fresh dates 1 pound for $3.99. I also enjoy all of the imported candies they have bought some chocolate from Italy, honey from Germany and fresh fruit preserves from France. I also find they have great deals on their clearance area when I'm looking for bathroom rugs etc. The store was clean well laid out not to shoveled it all and chock full of merchandise. There was no lines at the check out Friday at noon the ladies were chatting we were having a great time. There is no senior discount at Marshall's for anyone who's interested. I found the employees to be friendly helpful and accommodating. So I will be back for more holiday shopping!

Hard not to give this place 5 stars.  Service was excellent.  All the food was full of flavor and presented very well.  We thought we would leave hungry but that wasn't the case.  Very filling food.  Pricing was of that of top quality food and service in downtown Nashville.
The only thing that kept it from getting 5 stars.  Parking cost $$ for valet.(everywhere I go in Nashville there is no charge for valet even downtown) also you have to have a cc to make a reservation, also the only place I have had to do that.(not a fan of either)

Support this business! I grabbed 4 pastries here to taste and they were all awesome. The woman who runs this plan was so sweet and kind to me. I regret not trying the cheesecake they offered!! Luckily, everything I did grab was awesome, and I got to share it with my friends who also loved them.

We've stopped going to Ardmore Pizza altogether. We don't know if there was a management change or what, but the quality of everything has gone steadily downhill over the 4 years we've been ordering here. The burgers that used to be so delicious are now dense bricks that are less flavorful, the cheesesteaks once packed with meat are now scrimpy, and the pizza was just meh; the fries are still good, though. We're disappointed because we liked this little shop so much and prefer non-chain shops, but it's not worth the cost and the disappointment to try again.
One of my favorite brewery and tap rooms in Indy. I love the relaxed atmosphere and that I can bring my dog.

I'm always on the hunt for good local ice cream when I visit a new city and Mike's was just was I was seeking. 

The ice cream flavors are offered are a little unique, but not too out there. They also have all of the standard favorites. Pricing was reasonable, a single generous scoop being less than $4. The shop offers other goodies like milkshakes and sundaes too. 

I went with a butterscotch ice cream since that isn't a flavor I see offered often. The ice cream was creamy and delicious with the perfect amount of butterscotch swirled through the ice cream. My husband had a peanut butter flavor that he raved about.

The actual shop isn't anything to write home about. It didn't feel particularly clean and only offered about half a dozen tables. The service was quick, but not overly friendly. Even with that, we loved our ice cream and would return.

I normally wouldn't review a chain, but after returning to this concept after years it's wild to me that there's enough of a following to keep this place going. We came in on Memorial Day to a dead restaurant, which was surprising. 

Our service was exceptional, but the food was forgettable and overpriced. I ordered the spaghetti and house-made meatballs and the better half got some rigatoni dish with a cream sauce and chicken. The fresh bread that used to be good absolutely sucked, and the calamari was whatever. Had it not been for the gift card I'd have had no reason to come in, and I certainly have no reason to come back. Butternut squash ravioli for $21?! That's hilarious.

For the prices they're charging, you can get far better quality food from local establishments.

GOOOOD ICE CREAM! Currently visiting Nashville & will have to stop @ Mike's again before the end of the trip. 

Any place that makes their own waffle cones is excellent in my book. 

Many, many flavors, huge scoops, and good prices for what you get!

Hi to whoever is listening!!! JUSTIN & DEREK are AMAZING! We received such awesome service and the food was freaking . You have to come here!! The staff is just so friendly and welcoming & the set up is absolutely perfect. We were lucky enough to sit on the balcony during peak brunch time with a perfect view. It doesn't get any better than this!! Seriously. Forget all those restaurants at the French Quarters (except Corner Oyster Bar and their fried Oysters) and COME HERE! You will not regret!!
Great service, great wine and delicious food. We went there before seeing a show at the Saenger and it was perfect! Will definitely be back!
This was the worst dinner I've ever gotten from a restaurant. It was like all they did was pour tomato juice over some vegetables and spaghetti. Never going back here.
Delicious food & great service. Peppered tuna, yellowtail & chives, and the Rittenhouse were our favorite rolls. Highly recommend !

Bartender was great. Chatted us up.  Had an AMAZING cornflake chicken sando with housemate it at least locally sourced pickles, sliced okra, and onions.  Came with a smart arugula salad with fresh shaved parm.  Delightful.

NOTE: I wrote this review a couple months ago, and like an idiot, posted it to the wrong Tony's restaurant. So the menu item reviewed may or may not have the same impossible qualities today. 

This is where I received what will forever be known as "the physically impossible sandwich"... and it sucked. 

I ordered the meatball sandwich, just looking for something simple that's impossible to screw up. How can you screw up a meatball sandwich? Well, these knuckleheads found a way. 

On the plate placed before my lay two large meatballs, a bowl of sauce and two two-inch thick slabs of bread... OK, so what the bejesus am I supposed to do with this? There was no sandwich, but materials to assemble a sandwich... but that would be impossible. If I assembled said sandwich, the sandwich would be like 5 or 6 inches thick. 

My wife suggested cutting the meatballs into quarters to reduce the potential disaster ratios that lay before me... Didn't work. Still two thick for any human without a disjointed jaw. Hmmmm... Maybe open faced?... no, too messy and the meat to bread ratio was still off... Maybe try to cut the bread length wise? Now we're just getting silly.

So, after 10 or 15 minutes of trying to figure out how to eat the $9 sandwich that wasn't even a sandwich, I came to grips with the fact that the reason my non-sandwich sandwich was not served to me as a sandwich was because it was physically impossible.

How do we even define what a sandwich is? ... I'm not going there. 

So, I ate the ingredients separately - and it was mediocre at best. Worst was the bread. Incredibly bland and dry. I commented to my wife that it could make decent home insulation material. 

My wife had lasagna and suspected it had been frozen and microwaved.

All said and done, our bill was like $40... for two pieces of bread, two meatballs, two beers, and microwave lasagna.

And that's not with the labor and frustration of me contemplating "the physically impossible sandwich.

Mike's ice cream is a great spot on Broadway to get ice cream, coffee, or even a snack.  The shop has a small area inside with only a couple of tables; most people just stop in and get their ice cream treats to go and then walk along Broadway with them.  Mike's is an old fashioned ice cream shop so they do milkshakes and will make you a specialty flavored soda. 

I like stopping in because the shop is cute, and there is never usually a line.  The coffee is decent and the ice cream is good too!  I like the good old fashioned chocolate. But, I usually just go here for the coffee. They have a coffee club so if you are a regular you get a discount!
The food was good but the service was terrible. The female staff was downright rude. I am a tourist and want to warn others before they get what I got: the feeling that I wasn't welcome.

We made this reservation last minute and completely lucked out. The crawfish beignets are amazing and should not be missed. Our server had fantastic wine recommendations. The gulf fish amandine was really, really good. The (dessert) beignets and bananas foster were the absolute highlight of the meal. The wine selection was fantastic. The half glass option was so great so we could enjoy the perfect pairing with each course.
The sandwich's was good had it a couple moths ago .. Thinking going today since I'm in town.

I've driven past this Marshall's a few times in the recent past, so I decided to pop in on the way home. The asiles were wide and clean, and yes, it's filled with Christmas merchandise already, but what a fabulous collection. 

I found KT Tape - something I didn't think I'd find there. I found Hawaiian Black & red salt, a cool journal that will make a neat gift for a friend, and a few other things. Over all a productive trip shopping.

My wife and I were in town just for the afternoon and were looking forward to eating at Helena and doing some exploring.  My wife ordered the Hot Chicken Sandwich which was amazing.  I ordered the Burrata BLT which unfortunately never came.  I wasn't all that hungry and so once my wife was finished I went to the cashier to ask for a refund as we wanted to keep moving.  The staff were mortified, offered me anything I wanted from the cabinet and gave me a complete refund which I was uncomfortable with as I was happy to pay for what we had eaten.  This is a review to highlight how to win customers when something goes wrong.  Needless to say we are more than happy to visit again when are back on the west coast.

Great place for a quick stop for some good bibimbap!
I had the beef bibimbap. It tasted good! The egg was a little overdone and it was a bit cold (not served in a hot stone bowl) but overall, it was delicious and at $8, it's awesome for the price!
The service is very friendly!
Food is fast, cheap, and delicious.
I will definitely be back!

Went here when we were int own visiting family. I'll be honest, I didn't have high expectations and was pleasantly surprised. Our waitress was very sweet and accommodating. While I've definitely had better cosmos in my life, they had a decent drink selection at very reasonable prices. The bread basket was delicious, filled with warm pipping hot bread. Got the mussels appetizer which was great - tasted fresh and was smothered in a delicious white wine broth. I opted for the crab cakes which were full of lump crab meat and not a lot of filling. They were fantastic. It came with mashed potatoes and veggies, as well as a tasty, basic starter salad. The folks at our table ordered chicken piccata, scallops, a seafood pasta - everyone seemed to really enjoy their meals. The prices were very reasonable and the staff was friendly and attentive. There was also live music, even at 6pm on a Saturday. If I was in the area again, I would return.

Our server Toni was AWESOME! She did a great job recommending different items from the menu and was also super personable. I would highly recommended Twin Peaks on 82nd Street but even more so, request Toni! Wonderful service!

The pesto spinach pizza pastry was so darn good. Sharp cheese accompanied by pesto packs a flavour punch. The pastry was buttery and crispy on the outside but soft on the inside. Felt like I had moisturizer on my lips after eating the thing but I do love me some grease so I wasn't at all put off by it. Lol

Also picked up a loaf of the organic bread. It was so yummy when toasted and smothered in peanut butter. If it hadn't have been so good I might have tried it just as is. Sigh

I was blown away at this spot I googled.  I have never had such an amazing everything bagel with smoked salmon.  The pickled onions were nothing short of amazing.  The whole thing melts in your mouth. My companion had the avocado toast which was delicious as well. So rich and creamy. The addition of feta cheese made it super decadent. It was enough for two. The bread was amazing. A bit hard to cut with a regular knife but nice and crusty

Chase Bank - Delaware
Posted: 2009-06-27 by    marge11
CHASE Creates Pandemic with min payment increase
Complaint Rating: 
Chase has just started a new PANDEMIC for 850, 000 cardholders, myself included. Starting Aug 1st minimum payments will increase from 2% to 5%. This more than doubles the cardholders monthly payment and there is NO opt-out offered. Even though Chase testified before congress that they do offer...
Comments  United States  Credit Cards
On December 14, 2010 I attempted to purchase a Christmas gift for my wife, but my Chase VISA card was rejected. When I called Chase I was told that I exceeded my credit limit.I knew that my limit was approximately 16K and that I had just paid $5800, which would have allowed my extra purchasing power.
After speaking with a customer service person who was rude and ignorant, possessing no listening skills, I spoke with a supervisor, Brandon *******, who also tried to explain the reason for the reduced limit.
For the 10th time, I told him that I wasn't calling about that, and I did not care about the reason.
My complaint was that I was not notified that my credit limit was reduced. Mr. ******* said that I would be notified in a day or two. Eleven days before Christmas you take my ability to purchase gifts away from my without advising me. This must be a violation of some standard.
Oddly enough, today (December 20, 2010) I received the notice (copy enclosed).
You can be assured I'll be closing my account.
Steven of Howell, NJ Dec. 21, 2010
Ive been buying shells from these guys for so long now they are basically family. They never nickel and dime me. They take awesome care of there clients!

Terrible service... Was so looking forward to another furniture options after entering an item listed 5 times I was told I read it wrong had to walk the manager to the sign them they still got the pricing wrong... I guess their stuff is nice though.. Good luck and have your battle hat ready they will beat you to death and argue with one another..
