I would recommend validating with the customer on what their seeing. There is a lot of price discrepancy between in store and online but when the tag in store says something and you aren't sure look. Instead of immediately stating something completely different.

Delicious espresso.
I ordered my usual short breve latte not filled all the way to the top. 
He even said decaf needed to be compressed harder to get the flavor right. Bravo!

Bottom Line: Chase does not support its customers. Had a trip scheduled for June 2020 and had given a downpayment to a merchant to secure the booking. Due to current events we had to cancel the trip. The merchant was unwilling to give back the downpayment even though we were cancelling two months in advance. Their refund policy was very clear if we cancelled a week prior we were due a full refund. I initially disputed the charge with Chase. The merchant asked us to drop the dispute so that they could refund the money. I called Chase and asked if it was OK to drop the dispute - they said yes that was Ok. The Chase representative said it the merchant still did not refund I could re-dispute the charges. Once the dispute was dropped the merchant was still not going to give the refund - they tricked us. I contacted Chase and they refused to re-dispute the money. We were lied to by Chase. I want to warn others that Chase does not protect its clients. I would highly recommend that you never get a Chase credit card - they do not support their customers. I am now responsible for over $1000 in charges that I should not have to pay because Chase does not support its customers and also lies to its customers. I will never work with Chase Bank again.

This bakery is in a cool arts complex area with a few other restaurants and bars (we came to this same area for dinner the night before at The Lark). Very cool Santa Barbara feel. I had the Farmers Market sandwich (add ham) and he had the taco. We shared the amazing challah French toast (only avail on weekends). The baked egg sandwiches are huge. We loved the outside patio and it's of course dog friendly. 10/10 for us. The espresso
Machine was down which gave me the opportunity to walk to a coffee shop, Dart, down the street.

We stopped by Mike's to cool off after sitting in the sun at LP Field all afternoon. It was the perfect post-game spot. Surprisingly, we didn't have trouble getting a table, and the line to get ice cream wasn't very long. It got longer while we were sitting there, but seemed to move quickly. At $2.99 a scoop it isn't cheap, but it is a generous scoop (the scoop pretty much fills an entire cup). I got the Red Velvet Cake which was perfect... it even had bits of red velvet cake swirled in it.  The people who work here are very friendly (I'd even say flirty) which makes it fun also.

I love that the flavors are either homemade or locally produced.  There were a lot of interesting flavors like maple bacon, which I unfortunately was not daring enough to try.  I'm sure that everything is good, and I only wish I lived closer so that I could go back and try them all!
Absolutely perfect in every way. Love their manu and all the different options and sections. Coffee was great too! Space is very vibey, modern and bright.
Top notch cocktails but disappointing food other than the black truffle fries.  I had been really looking forward to this but will only go back for drinks in the future.
Amazing ice cream!!! Very generous portions. Lots of flavors and variety ( shakes , sundae, scoops)
The fried chicken sandwich with bacon and honey was really good!  Sweet, savory and crunchy.

First time going for brunch. Service was good, keep the mimosas filled. Food was good as well. However, the shareables were very small portions. I got 3 pretty small lump crab deviled eggs for $8......yeah. But the cornflake fried chicken and waffles did satisfy

Do not use your Open Table coupon at this restaurant. Better yet, avoid this restaurant. Mediocre food with service to match. The deal was supposedly a $60.00 meal for $30.00. Had we ordered it  off the menu it would have cost us $35.00. They also overcharged us for wine. What a rip-off!  We have used some of these restaurant deals before and never had an experience like this. A rude manager didn't help the situation. There are many good restaurants in West Chester; this isn't one of them. Maybe the oysters are good, but the "$60.00" dinner wasn't. Go to Gilmore's if you plan to spend $60.00/person.

I absolutely adore sushi! (My friends even joke that if they find out I'm having a bad day or in a bad mood just bring me sushi and all will be good again.) So I'm always excited to try out a new sushi place; however, I have to say that Tuna Bar was just average {I would give 3.5 stars if Yelp let you give .5 stars!} The sushi was good and extremely fresh but I just wasn't amazed by the flavors like I hope to be when ordering Speciality Rolls. We ordered the J&J, the Old City (does not come looking like the picture shown on Yelp; it is all flat) and the Fishtown rolls. The Tuna tartare appetizer is delicious though so I would 100% recommend starting with that. The staff is very attentive and the atmosphere is great so I'd suggest it to others in the Old City area but there are much better options in Philly!

Our dog had the BEST dental cleaning last week!!! Plus, a special shout out to Andrea & Dr. Thies for all TLC towards our furry son!!

And we have to mention Dr. Kusiak --- our dog receives fantastic regular care from this top doc!!

It took us years to find a fantastic vet when we moved to the area. If you want your furry children to get love, superb care then this is the place to come. You are always greeted with a smile. And the office staff are always kind & friendly & helpful.

The entire place is exceptional & trustworthy!!

This is honestly my first ever Yelp review but I was treated so well here I felt compelled to tell others about it. Got delayed in Philly and was stuck in an airport hotel and had to get out for a bit. Despite being from out of town I was treated like a local. Food was better than it should be for a sports bar but even more impressive was the service. Had 3-4 different people wait on me during my time here and if anything they were too attentive which is obviously an oxymoron. If this place was in my neighborhood I'd eat here once a week. Whether you're in town for 1 night or live close by give these guys a shot.

The waitresses are usually great. But management is not. They cater only to white customers. You hear nothing but country music and rock and roll. There are times when there are literally 65-70% black and Latino customers and all you hear is music that caters to whites. There have slowly added women of color to the team of waitresses but they don't seem to stick around very long. One night, my friends and I came in for fight night and the place was jammed packed. They took our money at the door and there were no seats available for us to sit in. So we had to stand and hope that four people would leave so that we could be seated. Managers were rude when we asked about it. Probably because there were cops with them that were working in the building that night which is not surprising. We finally spot a table of four leaving and then four guys that had just walked in the building and who just so happened to be white men hurried up and sat at that table and we told them that we were there before they were and management told us that they were there before we were. We knew this wasn't true but it put us all in a potentially bad situation. We are not trouble makers but we were very angry. Especially since all they had to do is write down names at the door and keep track of tables. We saw a waitress arguing with another group of black men for the same reason at the same time and they told us the same thing had happened to them. The point of this review is this: Far too many times black people are treated as if their money is different. The music reflects that and the service does as well. We need to have our own establishments but the city wouldn't allow this to happen due to the "good old boy system with land and properties". We are forced to go to places like this to have a good time when we really don't want to but where else can we go? Shame on Twin Peaks.

Meh experience and food. Something has changed about Romano's in the past couple of years and the food made me regret the visit.  

The spicy meatball appetizer arrived about 5 minutes after ordering and was in a bowl with some bland meatballs hiding under crushed tomatoes.  It was not spicy by any standard.  The entrees arrived 5 minutes after the appetizer.  The penne rustica was ok but the prosciutto was without flavor besides a little saltiness, a gray color like anchovies, and dry and chewy like beef jerky.  My wife gave her mama's trio a 5 of 10 with the chicken the best of the 3 choices.

The waitress visited 4 times: at the beginning to take the appetizer order, to take the entree and drink order, to ask about boxes at the end, and to leave the card receipt.

When the itemized bill left the table, it didn't come back.

No bread ever came.

Another "sports bar" that can't figure out what it is: a sports bar (it has gobs of TVS with sundry sports playing);  a horrible "music" bar (indeed horrible "music" was playing so loudly that you couldn't focus on the cold beer, sports, or girls); or a bootie bar (several of the waitresses were more interested in working the Customers, than waitressing. Several were sitting around jabbering. ).
They used to have several good choice menu items. Their meatloaf was quite good - gone.
I had 1 beer I ordered before I realized the extent of the changes. Probably won't be back.
Went on down the road.

Not what I was expecting at all. And extremely disappointed. I was pretty excited to take to this tour and learn a little bit about some ghost activity and history of the graveyards. I had a lot of friends recommend a graveyard tour for those reasons. Most of those were during the day time and I was in the area for work. The bus and tour guide was nice. The pickup location was convenient. However, this was definitely more of history guide than a ghost history/ sightings and stories. Only about 2 ghost stories/ history on a 2 hour narrated bus ride. The visits to the gravesites were cool and we got to visit the hurricanes Katrina memorial as well. Biggest reason I rated this tour so low is because of the people. They were ALL SO DRUNK. Because they allowed drinks on the ride and it was a 930 tour I did, everyone was so wasted. They were obnoxious. Had to make others wait for a unplanned bathroom stop because they were so wasted. Then to top it all off there was a verbal nasty fight between some passage we because someone stole their seat. They were being verbal on the bus and talking crap to each other when we got off of the bus for the tour stops.  Extremely inappropriate and I was surprised the tour guide did not address the situation. It was really bad at one point and he did not follow through and send them home on a Uber like he said he would in the beginning for not following the bus tour rules. I would not recommend this tour to anyone.

Recently got a pizza and Caesar from here.  Prior experiences with sit down service in their old location were awful, but the take out pizza and salad were really delicious.   Hope the higher quality continues.
We are from out of town and we had a terrible experience with the staff.  The service was terrible.   I would not recommend this place to anyone.

First time here since when it was the old Yards, and boy how they've changed the interior. The public space now expands the whole length of the building. There's plenty of seating, lots of table games, not as many board games. It's good to hangout, especially bringing kids because there's a huge playground inside. The food was decent... small portions. Also there's chicken cages across the street... not sure what that's about.

Quite frankly, I had to dig deep to come up with 3 stars today. I've lived in PA for 6 years and Doc Magrogans was my first favorite spot for seafood. Wednesday are all you can eat crab night and I cleared my calendar just for that!! I was sooo excited!!

For an appetizer my daughter ordered the Little Bitch oysters, which she said were WONDERFUL! (I don't eat them so I'll take her word for it) but things went downhill from there. The crabs tasted as though there were boiled in plain tap water, no seasoning, no lemon juice or salt, NOTHING! When I mentioned this I was rewarded with a cup of dry Old Bay seasoning.

 We didn't bother w seconds but ordered the apple strudel for dessert. Of course there wasn't a teaspoon of ice cream to be had.we were brought sliced apples wrapped in phyllo dough, again with minimal seasoning or flavor. 

The server and manager were nice, but even after a discount, this was a epic waste of $50. So disappointed. But on the upside, Dia Doce is around the corner... I can get something yummy yet!!

My first and second experiences ordering the hair were great and the quality was exceptional.  However, I can't say the same about my third experience as it was a nightmare.  I placed my order over three weeks ago and still no curly hair.  The only time I can get someone to pick up the phone to talk to me is when I pretend I'm trying to place a new order, this company obviously cares nothing about returning customers.  Oh how I wish I had NEVER told anyone where I got my hair from and how happy I was with it,  I never would have been a part of them getting additional sales if I had known this is how I would be treated after being a loyal customer for over three years.  This is IT!  I'm officially going to find another product that I like well enough because they keep their promises.  I'm really disappointed in Diamond Hair and will never recommend them to anyone again'

Wow! This  restaurant you can  eat meal, drink beer and watch live  hockey game at the same time.  "Top Shelf Sports Lounge is a 2,500 Sq ft. full service, high energy restaurant and bar that position on the second floor in the dead center of the Florida Hospital Center Ice Facility"  There  are happy hour deal for certain beer and appetizers.
The menu was well designed. They   cover everybody's old time favorites- BBQ , burger,  sub, taco , chicken wings and the  trendy Poke bowl.  We tried their chicken wings, tuna bowl and they were delicious . It was fun watching sports programs from TV on the wall as well as the real hockey game down at the rings. Their glass wall overlook the two ice skating rings that on  Friday night the  high school hockey league was playing.  
Good service, cool ambience and yummy food, this is a sport bar not to miss, specially hockey fans!
Stood at the door for 10 minutes on a visibly slow night while servers/bartenders talked at the bar.  Food is usually good but service was bad tonight.  Left won't return

Unfortunately, I had to give it 3/5 because of the fries and the shrimps. They were just too salty. 

The pork belly and fried oysters tasted unexpectedly pretty good together. The sweetness from the cha siu complimented the oysters. When you eat any type of seafood, there will be this fishy taste to it. Due to the bbq flavor from the cha siu, I didn't taste any fishiness from the oysters. 

The herbed mushroom pasta only came with a poached egg, so I decided to add the shrimps for some protein. Big mistake. I love salty food, but the grilled shrimps were just too way salty. The mushroom pasta itself tasted delicious. Maybe that's why I should not add any extra topping. 

The tequila mule was really good. I love cocktails that do not just straight up taste like alcohol. If they put too little alcohol, you won't be able to smell it. If they put too much, then the alcohol taste will be too overwhelming. The tequila mule was just perfect. It was sweet, strong, and ready "to kill ya". 

I will definitely come back for more drinks and to give the food menu another try.

I paid $250 to have 2 keys and 2 keyless entry remotes made for my Ford Escape.  2 weeks later, both of the remotes stopped working. I replaced the batteries and they still did not work. I called Shay to let him know and he gave me instructions on how to "reset" them, but that didn't work as well. Since then, I've called him at least 4 times to schedule a time to come into his Northern Libs location and each time he has said that he would call me back. He never has. In fact, the last time I called, he got angry at me for "waiting so long to get back to him"!

This is one of my top places to eat in Philly. To give you a sense of the quality of this restuarant, my first visit here I was given complimentary dishes by the chef. Prices are a little expensive for the amount of food, which used to make think I would be hungry after eating here, but after ordering a roll or two of sushi I was surprised by how full I got (so full that I couldn't even finish my appetizer of fried oysters). The food tastes delicious, would definitely recommend the sushi (my go to is always spicy tuna).

I love the children's museum. It was very fun going there. Everyone that went with us had an amazing time too. We have gone there many times. Everyone loves it. The adults and the kids can have fun there. If you want family bonding time, then this is where you should go. Children love using their imagination here. Every time we go here we always select a date to come back again. We can't wait for quarantine to be over so that we can go back!
My first time at smoothie king and the girl was rude she seemed like she was in a rush poor customer service!

This place is wonderful date spot! The decor is well thought out with a sense of modern elegance that can be fun and also intimate. I came here for lunch to try out the menu. Although I was craving for dinner menu items, I could only order the lunch menu at the time. The staff is patient and helpful throughout the dining experience from being greeted at the door to the end. I tried the tuna tartare, teishoku kushiyaki set, and also a drink. The tuna tartare came with crispy rice on the bottom and was a bit pricey for the amount and quality/flavor. It wasn't what I had imagined besides two little bites for this dish. I enjoyed the teishoku sets because I like variety. It came with a warm little cup of miso soup, a daily side, rice, and tsukemono. I wasn't very fond of the pickled cucumbers, but the grilled shiitake mushrooms and eggplant were my favorite. The presentation was great, service was great, drinks were refreshing, but I definitely have to come again to try more items. I would definitely come with a group of friends and order a bunch of small dishes to share and just enjoy the night with the amazing decor.

We went to The Green Pheasant with plans to eat ramen. It turns out they only do ramen at lunch. We mentioned to our sever that we would plan to go to Two Ten Jack for ramen and he went out of his way to call over and get us in line, saving over an hour of time for us. This was unbelievably kind and clutch - shout out server Jason. We didn't get to eat at Green Pheasant and but they have earned lIfelong customers with this kind gesture. 12/10 would recommend. If the owner reads this - please pay your man Jason (dinner from 1/25/2020)
Quality food at good prices. Nice staff. Always had a good conversation while ordering. Open late. Suggest steak and fries.

Our friends raved about this new restaurant in town so my boyfriend and I went on a double date here with them. Upon arriving, I was impressed by how modern and chic this place looked - honestly not what I expect when I think Japanese restaurant. Love all the high glass windows all around that allow you to see in. 

Food was amazing. Loved the Fried Brussel Sprouts that were seasoned with sesame oil and miso - nice Asian flare. Tuna Tartare was good and had lots of avocado. Kobe Beef Spring Rolls (it was a special and I just had to try it) had a decent amount of meat in them and came with a dipping sauce.

Grandmom's Wonton Soup - our friends raved about this so we each got a bowl. This is FuZhou style - I laughed when I read it on the menu because I am from FuZhou and this is a traditional soup that my grandma would ACTUALLY make for us eat all the time at home, or you could buy it for like less than a dollar in noodle shops. It was funny to see it being served at an upscale place like this for $8 bucks. It was delicious nonetheless and a nice warming appetizer.

We ordered a bunch of sushi and rolls afterwards and they brought it out all together on a huge wooden tray for us to share (presentation def did not disappoint). Our server was incredibly sweet and very present - she made sure to keep the drinks and food coming. Overall, it was a memorable meal and a perfect spot for date night!
This is bibimbap like my Korean grandma makes it. I highly recommend. Excellent food. I also had the yukaejang and that was yummy too.

Cute little nook to grab a coffee and quick breakfast. Multiple parts of our small order were delivered incorrectly, so not really sure how attentive the staff was taking our order and it was not busy at all. Food was tasty and coffee was yummy. Located in a great spot for hoppin around wine tasting after you fill your tummy.

Full disclosure, I haven't tried their food, just their happy hour wines. Their patio is so cute, lots of greenery, plenty of parking outside (metered) and service is always good. The happy hour has $5 glasses of wine (red, white, rose, orange). I think they also have some small bites on happy hour.
Miss these restaurants on the east coast! Had a great meal and enjoyed the food again! Thanks!
My 1st time coming here. Not great. Don't think I'll be back. Slow service, food was just ok.

Young man taking orders was handling the money as well making the smoothie, cross contaminating, other young man was wearing his mask on his chin while the third came from the back eating definitely not trying to come back to this location

One of my favorite breweries in Indianapolis! They serve great beer all year round (especially during the fall when they bring out the pumpkin ale) that they have something for everyone. The special kolsch and the weizengoot are two of my top faves for year round beer.

The taproom is super welcoming to humans and fur babies and sometimes on Friday nights they have a comedy show that is free to attend. No food here except for some chips and pretzels but you can order in if you would like. No surprise that they have many awards on the wall. Shows they are consistently good. Outdoor area in the summer and plenty of parking. 

I plan to revisit this place often!

More family friendly than I was expecting. Packed restaurant at 7pm on friday night but we only had to wait 10min for a table for 4. The service was excellent and our waitress was on top of it. Water glasses were never empty and beer refills were brought in a timely manner. 

On to the food...mozzarella bites appetizer was by far the hit at the table as well as the chilled beer. The burgers were just ok and the BLT with tomato soup was the hit for the entrees. 

Don't let the full parking lot fool you there is plenty of room in side for everyone.

Solid corner bar/restaurant in South Philly zone.  Owned by the family that owns Ralph's, across the street.  Beer is fresh and cold and service at the bar is friendly.  I sat at the bar and ate dinner and watched the Phillies on a sorta quiet Tuesday evening.  The food is good - not great - and not quite (but close!) to equal in taste/quality to the price.  I've been there a couple of times now and will definitely be back for a cold draft beer, friendly service and possibly, maybe, if-I'm-feeling-it... the food.  

Thanks!!

Adorable items but my significant other and I were treated like absolute crap here. We had just come to the mall from playing with our son at the park so we looked a little windswept and were wearing casual attire. From their attitudes I could tell they thought we weren't worth the time or acknowledgement. We stood by the check out desk waiting for over 10 minutes for someone to acknowledge us so we could ask for assistance...we had store clerks look straight at us and walk on by. I finally told my boyfriend that we will go somewhere else where we are not being flagrantly ignored and we walked out. There are so many other nicer establishments where the customer service exceeds this place by leaps and bounds...why waste any time here?

Having lived in Philadelphia, I've pooh-poohed so-called Philly cheesesteaks all over the Midwest.  The ones served at Twin Peaks aren't *really* Philly cheesesteaks, but they are still a damned good sandwich.  This place gets another full star just for having Brittany capably working the bar.
Christopher was best server I've ever had 10/10!! Amazing menu knowledge and made experience so much fun for everyone.

Been here lotsa times and always had the round Neopolitan type pie. It is a first rate NY pie. The square Sicilian pie however is a horrible doughy nothing. Way too high , barely any sauce and the thinnest layer of cheese. This was not good. Stick to the Neo slices and forget the Sicilian, and yes, I'm a NY native and also a pizza snob.
The four stars are not for the Sicilian. The best Sicilian I've ever had was a small little place in Commack, NY (on Long Island) called Pizza D'Amour and Caserta's on Federal Hill in Providence Rhode Island.
Locally Jet's Deep Dish come closest.

I am so grateful for Adams Dental!! Dr Adams is kind and caring and Michele is wonderful to work with. As far as as Heather, the beat cleaning I have ever had. Somehow the entire staff made a "dentist appointment" something to look forward to, not dread. The only reason I only gave 5 stars is because 10 stars wasn't an option.

To the manager or owner whoever reads this I love your restaurant it's absolutely fabulous but when there are customers in the restaurant trying to eat do not paint inside it was so nauseating I threw up my food and had to leave please be considerate towards customers and don't do this again thank you so much
Amazing food, great service. Luigi the owner greeted with a warm welcoming smile. I definitely recommend. I will be back. Fresh
Ice cream was delicious. We had a Tennessee fudge and Toasted Coconut, very creamy, coconut was refreshing. Atmosphere was not very welcoming or clean so I can't give them a 5 star.

Wow!!
 What a great experience that I had here. I went into Iron Horse to get a quote for a small accident I got in, Chris the owner was extremely helpful and kind. He pointed me in the right direction, I felt so taken care of. I would highly recommend coming to this shop!! Chris saved me a ton of money and I am so grateful!!
Ordered the chicken wings.  They were hot, fresh, and super crispy. Drenched in a honey sauce, that surprisingly, tasted good on the fries that came with the wings.  Fantastic!
The chicken and waffles were so tasty! I loved the rosé as well!! The outdoor seating was a plus because the aesthetic was what me and my friends were looking for.

This place is a Tampa classic. The Cuban sandwich was on point.the breakfast was another winner. I enjoyed also the devil crabs. Appreciate the reasonable prices, can't wait to come back and have again.

The wait can be long but the food was absolutely amazing! The steak and mushroom appetizer (forget what it's called) is sooooo delicious. Christopher was our server and he was very informative and friendly.

This place is a joke. We had an abysmal experience because of the "management".  Our party of 8 had come together because of a death in our family and were were treated horribly.  The manager, gestapo, Führer, whatever you want to call her is clearly on a massive power trip and feels that covid has made her more important than she will ever be.  We came in the door and asked for a table.  She proceeded make us wait an inordinate amount of time while she stared at her iPad as if trying to find us a table in an establishment with only 4 occupied tables.   She then rattled off the mask rules in a condescending and insulting tone and when asked for clarification of her over the top and above standard rules, she abruptly shut me up and held up her hand to stop me from speaking.  We were taken to our table which was a picnic bench style and outside.   There were 6 in our party and we were expecting 2 more.  When we got to our outside table, we took 2 chairs from a nearby empty table in order to accommodate our party.  Our server told us that the rude, power hungry manager said we can't use those chairs because the table was reserved.  There was no reserved sign on the table and the entire time we were there, not only was no one ever seated at that table, no one was even seated nearby.  Our remaining 2 party members arrived and were told not only could they not enter the establishment but they could not sit with us because the rules prevent more than 6 people at an inside table.  Again, we're were sitting outside.  Either this place should not be in business or the "manager" should be forced to take training classes in the HOSPITALITY industry or even better, be fired.  We will never come back here again and will tell everyone we know NOT to even bother coming!

my family really enjoyed our breakfast from Helena ave bakery.  

We got the salmon bagel/ the breakfast sandwich and the yogurt for the little one.  everything was tasty.  
the egg however on the breakfast sandwich was more like a fluffy egg , 
its a little different but still delicious.
Made the trip downtown for some ice cream. I thought the ice cream was very good. We had 2 cones, 2 sundaes, and a milkshake. The Tennessee Fudge and the Rocky Top Road were our two favorite flavors.

I had such a good time today at Copper Vine. This felt like such a down home visit. The vibe inside is like a cafe with great food and our waiter, Dor, was amazing. My party really enjoyed the bottomless mimosas and the food was heavenly. Everything was timely and on point, I really really enjoyed my visit.

Went around noon on a Monday and there were only about 4-5 tables having lunch. Sat at the bar - ordered the greens as an appetizer and the moonfish skewers. Very clean flavors, definitely on the subtle seasoning side - but all well prepared and healthy.

I've been doing business with them for years. They've been handling all of our fleet needs for over 10yrs flawlessly! Repairs, parts and installs all are done with care and very fast. Thank you AZ Truck outfitters.

Taylor took care of us tonight, she gave great drink recommendations right from the start, and told us about the 2 house beers, which were both great. Super sweet and attentive. The appetizer sampler was perfect for me because I wasnt that hungry. Will definitely be back!

Okay, every time my brother and sister in law come into town they want to eat at Tony's in Alton. My brother in law is hooked on their Peperloin. My sister in law is crazy for the pillow shaped raviolis. I ordered the pillow raviolis and was happy I did. I loved the sweet tomato sauce on the raviolis - yo die for. My wife is crazy for the lasagna, and ordered one to take home. Keep it up Tony's.

PROS:
-Service is excellent
-Place is immaculate, new, contemporary, and has a good vibe
-Perfecttttt lighting for 1st - 4th date with someone
-Wonton soup is unique and tasty
-Sashimi is excellent

CONS: 
-Cold
-Tuna Crudo is too salty
-Slightly overpriced for the quantity
-Music doesn't really go with the decor (music in the bathroom is fun though)
-Menu isn't exciting

Disappointed

I made my reservation for a party of 6 two months ago after hearing incredible reviews from co-workers and friends. I was eagerly anticipating a first class experience, an upscale version of another local favorite,Two-Ten Jack. Unfortunately, due to the restaurant management's incompetence and extremely rude and unprofessional attitudes, I left this establishment very disappointed. 

Our reservation was at 7:30pm, and when we arrived, the hostess informed us that our table "was being cleared now" and to take a seat at the bar for a few minutes. After a quick bathroom break, our party ordered a round of drinks from the bar to help us maintain our patience as the minutes melted off of the clock. After 20 minutes of waiting; I approached the host to inquire about the delay in seating. The response was gruff, he rudely informed me that a previous party was still closing out at the table and we would have to continue to wait. I then asked if he would comp our first round of drinks; and again the response was rude and unprofessional- "It's out of my control....Sir!" the manager exclaimed as he shook his head and walked towards the kitchen. 

My party and I continued to wait; ordering a second round of drinks while the waitstaff struggled to get their act together. 50 minutes later, at 8:20pm, the manager finally moped back to the bar; mumbling as he led us upstairs to a completely different section of the restaurant. Before we headed upstairs, I asked him what he would do to help rectify the situation. "The first round of drinks is on me, but I will NOT cover the second." Ridiculous.... 

Once we were seated, I must confess that the remainder of our time was quite enjoyable. From our friendly waiter, Spencer, delicious small plates, and smooth Japanese Whiskey- the second act of the night met my expectations. The heated toilet seats were also a big hit with the ladies. However, none of these positives could cleanse my palate of the sour taste left over from the management's poor demeanor. We shook our heads as we departed; disheartened. I truly believe that the Green Pheasant could fly high with the best of them, as long as it's management stopped clipping it's own wings.

Toby and Sharan were a huge help for me to buy my first home. They were always on top of everything. Whenever I have a question or concern, they are always easy to reach out to and responds back quickly. I'm very thankful working with such great people. I highly recommend if you're looking for a lender who will provide you with great service!

I don't post much but WOW. I had to give this place major props after tonight. We went for dinner but got there early (6pm) so we got to take advantage of happy hour drinks and sushi. We got the oysters from the happy our menu ($2) per oyster and So. Good. We got 4 between the two of us. We also got the happy hour spicy tuna roll and spicy salmon roll. Again, really good. 

From end regular menu-make sure you order the Brussels sprouts (some of the best I've had in Philly) and the shishito peppers. We also got the peppered tuna roll (good, but not my favorite). 

The sashimi was so fresh (yellowtail and king salmon). We'll definitely be back. Service was amazing. Ambience was on point. Food was exquisite.

I got referred to Nifty by Enterprise bc I didn't have a round trip ticket at the airport. I LOVED the service that I got with Nifty- I was picked up from the regular rental area and the process was simple and easy to get through.

Not really sure about this location. I use to come here as a kid and I just ordered a root beer... that's it.... took about 15 minutes for them to take my order... and 10 minutes to bring it out..... not sure how you get a cherry coke confused with root beer... but I'm so thirsty I'll drink it anyway... no telling how a food order would go, so I won't chance it. Ima go next door to the gas station to get a root beer now.

Avoid this place......no customer service. Will not respond toy concerns. If they cared they would be responding to my correspondence. Food was mediocre at best and service was average at visit. But the the lack of response to my feedback is disconcerting!!!?

How do I say this....when I was a boy I did childish things.  As a man I find this place challenging to patronize.  Now this is coming from a former young man who loved Hooters for the....mmmm "food".  That was in my 20s.

I now have a 20 and 30 year old kids.  I went here to meet some friends.  I find this place cheesy with the ladies playing to the "child" in the men who come here.  The food is average, service is average and the quantities of food is average.  Nothing was subpar but guess I've matured.  Good place to watch sports but the "hooters" thing is just played out.  However, I guess it isn't played out as the place was full of "bros" with baseball caps on backwards and regulars whom the ladies knew.  Kind of sad actually.  Typical bar food but good layout for watching sports.

Food is good and portions are decent, but drinks and food are pricey. $15 for a cocktail full of ice? And glass sizes are small. Waste of money. We're nashville, not New York. Chill on the price hikes.

We've had good meals here in the past. Tonight doing curbside was a disaster, which is a shame because so many other restaurants have gone out of their way to do a good job and be thankful to those who are keeping them open. Tonight, our calamari appetizer for which we were definitely charged was not included. When called about it the response was "oh we don't have any calamari". Ok, but why is it still on your menu? Why did you charge me for it? Why was there no explanation that it was not included? And why did I have to call back and ask what happened? Then my wife's vegetables were not included and she was given a caesar salad instead, which she can't eat because she is lactose intolerant. And then my build your own pasta did not have the bolognese sauce it was supposed to have nor any sauce for that matter. The explanation when I called back was that I could drive back 15 minutes to the restaurant to get sauce if I wanted. No thanks! I won't be back! You lost a good customer that you've had for 15 years. Poor product, poor service, poor handling of a disastrous experience.
The double cheese burger alone might be worth the long trip here. The atmosphere was also very inviting. The eggs tartine , bacon biscuit and banana pudding were also delicious! Outstanding bread

Went for breakfast on a weekday. 10 minute line to order. Ordered breakfast and coffee. They ran out of orange juice so that was not going to happen. Had to ask for the table we found to be cleaned. Got our breakfast, which was good (had the ricotta and strawberry toast). Didn't get our coffee and went to the counter to ask. Was told they were "working on it". Was more than halfway through breakfast when the coffee finally arrived (not lattes or other expresso drinks, just plain coffee). Asked for cream and sugar and was told "we're out of both". How does a breakfast restaurant that is surrounded by other co-owned restaurants and 2 blocks from a supermarket run out of orange juice, cream and sugar?

When you first walk in, your greeted immediately and with a smile.  The food was amazing, I had the hangover hamburger and i highly recommend it. The service was out of this world right along with the food. It was a birthday special that I  got to come here. No matter what you order, the food is amazing.

Wasted almost 2 hours over a month tracking down missing reward voucher from Chase Marriott Credit Card.  In the end, the explanation I received made sense, however, the attitude and flippant tone by "Freeman" from Chase and "Ron Moore" at Marriott was unnecessary and demeaning.

Oh pastry shop, how you now disappoint me! I've been here often and they have always stuck with the moto "We only use fresh fruit. We don't have powder stuff here." And now, what happened to you?!?! You stooped to the level of some other tea places that use powder. YUCK!!!!!! And it's not even blended good either. It taste gritty and just plain disgusting. After making it, I noticed the funky looking color and asked if this was fresh. "No, it's powder. You didn't ask for the fresh fruit one which costs more money." From all the other times I have been here, you have never given me a strawberry drink made of flavored powder. Who even asks for a fruit drink made of powder??? Also, my sister ordered the thai tea. It did not taste fresh. :-( When my family wanted a good bakery, I was so happy to introduce them here, but then all this happened....shame.

And the pork buns aren't as good either anymore either. It was stuffed with tons of onions when before it was stuffed with a balance of meat and onions. Are you cutting back on quality bc of costs?? I rather pay a lil extra money for your old quality then you trying to cut cost and making your products non-edible.

I thought I found my new bakery, but my search continues....

Food was delicious! I got the Farmer's market breakfast sando with pepper bacon. 

The sandwich was light yet filling and the bacon was so crispy and peppery! Got regular drip coffee which was good.

4 stars because of the long line to order and food took a while to come out. Plus there is limited seating.

This is the best ice cream place in Nashville by far! Two of my favorites are White Chocolate Banana Pudding and Tennessee Fudge. They have so many great flavors to choose from. They also have great coffee. On top of great beverage and ice cream flavors the customer service is excellent!

Horrible experience, will never return or recommend this place to anyone.

We came in on a Saturday and the place was nearly empty. The website specifically says, service animals are allowed with proper documentation. As soon as I entered with my service animal the general manager, JOSH, ran up to me and my group and refused service. He told us that service animals are not allowed by the company. He was rude and uncooperative. We came in with our family of 10 with small children and we were asked to leave.

To be honest, it felt as though there were other things at play here, more than Josh's lack of knowledge regarding service animals and the law. This was one of the worst experiences and we will never come back again.

Great atmosphere, cool people and excellent beer! This place is super human friendly and an overall fun place to relax and enjoy an adult beverage! We have really enjoyed the live music and delicious food truck grub too!

I've ordered takeout twice from here in the past few months. The first time I called, I placed my order with a woman. After I read my order, she asked if there'd be anything else, I said it would be all, then she hung up on me. Hmm.. weird, I thought. So I go in to pick up my order, which (my fault) I didn't double check, and come home to find multiple items missing. I call back to make sure I wasn't charged, since I didn't receive an itemized receipt, and the same lady answers. "Okay well I didn't hear you," she says after I explained the situation, and hangs up on me...AGAIN. Thankfully I wasn't charged. So, I figure, she had a bad night, whatever. 

So then last night, I decide to order takeout again. I recognize the woman's voice immediately, so I go ahead and place my order, once again she gives me the total, I say okay, she hangs up on me without reading back the order or telling me how long it'll be. So I call back asking how long it'll be, "I don't know, 20 minutes?" HANGS UP. At this point I'm wondering if I even go pick up the food, but I think to myself whatever, the Mac is good. So I go down to pick up my food, and a woman brings it out to me. Low and behold, it's the same woman that on the phone, AND she's the manager! I felt less crazy after reading the other reviews, it seems her attitude and knack for being unprofessional is a normal thing. Good pasta, doesn't make up for the bad service.

After reading the reviews, I knew I had to stop at The Green Pheasant while in Nashville. Fortunately, my flight back to New York got cancelled allowing me one extra night to dine in the Music City. My girlfriend and I got seated without a problem on a cold Sunday January night. We didn't have a reservation, and the restaurant was almost empty. Maybe it was due to the weather? We both commenced with old fashioneds to warm us up, and that was one of the better things we had. To start, we ordered the broccolini appetizer with hot rock shrimp, cornbread, sudachi, shoyu. The fusion didn't work well for me at all. For our main, we shared the spicy crab noodle with crab butter, sweet red crab, tobanjan. And again, nothing to write home about. The creme brule definitely takes the cake here. All in all, it was okay but a little disappointing after having such high hopes.

Wonderful establishment. I've frequented their other locations, but this one is by far my favorite. It's close to my home and they have a wide variety of products for almost any need you may have. Kai is especially knowledgeable regarding the products they sell. She spent time explaining all the different products I was interested in, plus she was happy to engage in some friendly chit chat. It's just a great place overall. :)
Their food and the service is great. I ordered the burger platter and you can taste how all the ingredients. Definitely try this place for yourself

Spent the morning on the patio in the sun working remote. The coffee was good but the ambiance was better. It was very relaxing and the other customers were all doing the same thing. The only downside is there are no outlets inside or outside.

Came here for my sisters birthday with a party of 6. It was pretty good! The edamame and Brussels sprouts were great appetizers and we got a few rolls to share. Good spot for a nice and light bite while in the area. We also got some saki to start the night and it was really good!

I have been to Copper Vine many times before and there are so many things to boast about as the entire experience was to die for. I would recommend getting a reservation because every time I have been, they have been extremely busy, and especially with the cooler weather lately and their patio being so lovely, it will stay busy. They have an entire wall of draft wines which is a very interesting concept, and though I am not a huge wine fan, I can see how people would be extremely enthused. The patio is gorgeous with a lot of plants and it feels as if it is in the heart of the city with the nearby buildings and bustling street. I highly recommend getting the fig and brie cheese flatbread, the 3 cheese gnocchi, or the crab deviled eggs as the appetizer. For entree I got the Crawfish Grilled Cheese with a side of fries, and my friends got the Wagyu burger with the aragula salad. For dessert we got the Rum Bananas Foster, I believe. Overall, the experience was fun and different and our service was amazing, especially for how busy they were!

Roast is a fantastic alternative to the chain coffee shops that dominate the downtown core. I went just after the coffeehouse had opened, so their espresso bar had yet to open, (it is functional now,) so I treated myself to one of the many fresh smoothie options on the menu. And how fresh! You don't get the feeling that you're drinking some powered icy-milk solution from a chain-shop here -- they use real fruit (albeit possibly canned? It didn't matter to me... it was tasty!)!  The baked goods are just as delicious; on-par for price as Starbucks or Second Cup, but bigger and fresh-tasting. 

Plus, the the location is huge! It looks fantastic, and I hope to have small work meetings here in the future!

Amazing sushi in a cool space. The sushi bar is the best place to sit. There's mirrors above the chefs so you can watch them making the sushi. Good cocktails and definitely worth traveling to a somewhat sleepy part of town. It is a short walk to old city.

Hot and cold lattes and Chai, ice cream shakes and malts, and of course ice cream cones. The ice cream is homemade! 
The pralines and cream malt was thick and creamy, delicious. 
Will be back to try another flavor.
Soooo good! We loved this cute little bakery. The ham buiscuit sandwich was our favorite!

Let's consider this restaurant to be a cup of black tea, and... I'm not a fan of BLACK TEA... So really this place AIN'T MY CUP OF TEA. 

Tony's has heavily dated decor and a cigar soiled smell that was completely unappetizing... Perhaps they should bottle up the smell and sell it to those trying to lose weight? 

The food was below average too, only further putting the kibosh on my appetite. I ordered the salmon with a double side of vegetables and a salad. The salad was 100% iceburg lettuce, which is fine because I love the crunch-factor... But I was so very disappointed with my entree, no crunchy iceburg could make up for it. The salmon was HORRIBLY COOKED and I could tell they simply took a pre-frozen piece of fish from an individually sealed package, threw it on a griddle and called it good to go. When it arrived in front of me, I was heavily disappointed to see a HUGE FISH COOKING FAUX-PAS.... The salmon albumin all over my plate! I would have also been disappointed by the tiny serving ($17.99 a plate) but I could certainly not stomach more than what was given to me. 

As for the other dishes, I heard nothing but NEGATIVE comments (one dining companion even imitated what Gordon Ramsey from Kitchen Nightmares might say, it was hilarious but ANYTHING BUT complimentary), aside from the RAVIOLI apparently being fantastic, but if that's the only item that's good on this huge menu, it's definitely not worth trying out. 

The reason for the 2 star rating is because I came to this restaurant with a party of 15, half under the age of ten, and we only had ONE SERVER who never once got flustered or annoyed by our crazy commotion! 

Clearly his cup of tea is dealing with large parties at Tony's... Someone fill up his mug... That is... If you're going to Tony's more for social purposes as opposed to eating.
I totally enjoyed my lunch at Copper Vine. Dusty was my server and he was awesome. Dusty recommended the Creole Tomato Sandwich with Grilled Chicken added. Let me say, bomb.com!

Our God Daughter pick this restaurant for lunch after her graduation from Loyola this past weekend.  The five of us were blown away!  Our server John Paul (JP) added so much to the occasion.  Four of us ordered the cornbread waffle with fried duck, powered sugar, Tasso gravy and were completely blown away!  As an extensive traveler I have had many awesome dinning experiences and this one ranks among the top.  Thank you JP and Crew for making this special event one to remember.  When we are in NOLA you can be assured that we will be back.
We got an amazing price and great service. Really appreciated how nice everyone was, how convenient their service is, and for a really low price. Thanks guys!

I came in on March 11th because I needed a gift for my best friend and of course a bookstore is the best place to get one. I had 2 different ideas in mind, both cookbooks, so I figured in the name of not wasting time I would head directly to customer service. They had both in stock and the employee guided to me the cookbook section and helped me find the books. When I was checking out the employee was super sweet, made some small talk and even complimented my shirt.

I do prefer small bookstores usually, but Barnes & Noble was so convenient and the only other bookstore in the area didn't have what I wanted. I do appreciate how large the store is because it allows them to have a boatload of books it stock, but the downside is if you don't know the layout you almost have to go to customer service to be guided to what you want.

It is nice they have a cafe but all Barnes and Noble cafe's are basically the same and they didn't really stand out as better than the rest.

Ambiance is nice, it is very modern and trendy. The menu is a little plain, not a lot of variety in choices and prices are higher than elsewhere. I would have liked to see more nigiri platter or chirashi/don type choices. That said, the Sindy roll was probably the only roll worth coming out of the way for. The appetizers were just okay.

I had a charge placed on my card that I did not approve. The only assistance I got was that the company billed the correct amount They said I owed. I was told to contact the merchant who they had been told would not respond to my calls or letter. I do not consider this any service. This was a southwest credit Visa card. Beware and do not expect any help on unapproved charge.

My friend and I went there for the first time today and it was AMAZING!!! From the Rose' Sangria to the Bread pudding it was excellent. Shoutout to our waiter John, we felt so connected to him and he had really great recommendations. Can't wait to come back!!!
I was anticipating the opening of Tuna Bar and went here right after it opened and had some amazing rolls. The place has a very nice atmosphere.

The CHASE Amazon Rewards VISA card sat in my drawer as it was the tool used to derive  the Amazon Prime shipping-- I don't keep balances on revolving credit. In fact, I forgot that I even had anything "CHASE." I received  payment reminders in my spam, along with a dozen other CHASE phishing scams... This morning,  I decided to open up one of the emails, and it stated a $42 payment due (actually $25, plus late fees, etc). I discussed with staff over the telephone and they wouldn't waive the fee. I immediately cancelled the card and called AMAZON  to simply deduct their annual fee from my personal debit card.  I had a squabble with CHASE back in the 1990s. I'm not a fan of this bank. Their well-crafted (but corny) tagline/slogan: "CHASE, so you can..."  simply promotes consumers to live beyond their means, saddling themselves into debt with them until eternity... Moral of the story: Amazon Prime = GOOD, CHASE = BAD!
Ridiculous 45 minute wait (after you purchase) to scoop ice cream (blue bell that you can buy at your local grocer) into a cone. You're doing it wrong and you get an F!

This place recently re-opened. I really liked it before but am now less than impressed. Menu is completely changed and parking isn't validated anymore! With parking not validated, it made my already overpriced salad become even more expensive. I probably won't be visiting often like I used to before. Parking is already a pain in Midtown and that garage is already a mess. Until they figure that out, I don't think it's a place you must visit.

I had a Chase Business Visa credit card for over 6 years. Recently I was on a trip overseas and I had a contract with a shop to deliver some goods (camera eqipment) to me that he did not have it in stock at the time. He ran my credit card to put a hold on my funds until delivery. I never signed anything. I obtained receipts that cearly showed delivery date, and terms of sale as: paid on delivery, all signed and dated by seller. Turns out seller and shop was scam and items were not delivered. I immediately contacted Chase with an FCBA dispute following all guidelines. I submitted all my paperwork including the invoices I got from the store, and all other information related to the sale. Chase replied a month later saying they could not help because merchant is unreachable and they could not recover the funds. I explained that under FCBA this was not really my problem and they had to protect customers from unauthorized and illegal transactions. They sent me some generic letters claiming they could not recover the funds from the merchant and that they do not really follow FCBA. I notified BBB and CFPB and I am in the process of filing a lawsuit against them.
Stay away from Chase credit cards as they offer zero protection. They throw all federal laws and regulations out the window. If your car is lost, or if some unauthorized transactions are ran, you are on your own.

Bala Better Health is extremely professional and it works!  I had both the Lipo Laser and the Radio Frequency.  It takes a few sessions to kick in; however, it really works. You need to be watching what you eat and continuing an exercise regimen but it does work. 
Allison and Theresa are both fantastic. They put you at ease immediately and are very accommodating. They Kate very knowledgeable and easy to work with. 
Give it a try!
JCT

We booked our company Christmas party here last Saturday, December 8th. Huge mistake. Our party was for 20 people. They had our table set up in a separate room with another group which was fine, plenty of room. The first mistake they made was allowing us to order direct from the menu. In our past experience at other restaurants, we have been given a limited menu which allows the kitchen a better opportunity to get everyone's food out in a timely manner. When we arrived our table was set up but had no menus on the table and no waters. Our waiter came over to take drink orders and everything seemed like it might start to be normal. He left with our drink orders and drinks slowly made their way to our table, still no waters or menus. Everyone immediately ordered a second drink because the first drink took so long. Finally, menus arrived...still no water and no one asked if we wanted water. I noticed that our waiter was basically by himself to handle our entire table. Again, at other restaurants, we are used to having 2 or 3 servers handle our large group. We ordered appetizers, again they slowly made their way to the table. We ordered our main courses. Entrees started to make their way to the table and it quickly became apparent that only half the table received their main course. The waiter came over and stated he messed up and lost half our orders, he took the orders a second time for those of us that did not receive any food. Again, these orders slowly made their way to the table and they were still missing 5 people. We sat down at 6pm it is now 8pm, two hours in a 5 people didn't have their food. The waiter and manager came over this time to ask once again what we were missing. 3 of the 5 ordered again, myself and one other guest decided not to re-order. I have worked in the food & beverage industry and have had many group gatherings at restaurants over the years and I have to say that Macaroni Grill was the least prepared to handle a group I have ever seen. When companies like ours plan these parties it is usually once a year and it is an important event to show our appreciation to our employees, to have it go so painfully wrong is not only upsetting but unacceptable for a restaurant like Macaroni Grill. One server assigned to our table, no menus on the table, no waters on the table, our guests having to go to the bar to get their own water and drinks, missing food orders, 2 hours into the party and guests still without food. This says to me very clearly that Macaroni Grill is improperly managed and they do not have a clue as to how to handle a group party. The manager ultimately took 25% off the bill and the waiter removed a couple of wines and coffee, none of which made the evening any less intolerable. As poorly as our group was handled they should be embarrassed that they charged us at all.
We stop here every time we're in Nashville and miss it when we're gone! They have so many flavors that are all so authentic. They are all so good!!

Top Shelf Sports Lounge is a bit of a hidden gem. You would not expect great food at an ice arena, but they will check all your expectations right into the penalty box. They are a bit hidden in the upper level and they are open during regular hours even when there is not an event.  For the most part unless they are busy, you can just walk through the arena and get a bit to eat.  

I tried the tuna bowl and Havana bowl, both tasted excellent. The tuna bowl has slices of seared blackened tuna and the Havana bowl has mojo roast pork.  Prices and quality are great. Some menu items such as the bowls are fairly healthy others are more like pub food. They also have burgers and Poutine, a delicious Canadian dish with french fries cheese curds and gravy. I have not tried the poutine, but look forward to next time!

Went here based on good reviews.  Stood in line, but the que was a bit long so decided to order online and pick up.  According to their site it said to walk straight to the register when it is time to pick up your order.  There is no signage inside to this effect so I asked a server that was walking by what to do.  She told me to just wait until the cashier was done with their customer and to cut in front of the next person in line.  Mean while another person with an online order walked up on the other side of me and asked someone else for her order and she got it straight away.  When I asked the same person for mine she to me to wait.  I had to ask her again after waiting a few minutes and I could see that mine had been sitting on the counter.  She finally gave me my bag, but then forgot half of my order.  I had to go back and she gave me another piece, but I was still missing one.  Long story short this place is unorganized and their egg sandwiches weren't worth the hassle.

Toby and team are our #1 choice, always. They are efficient, professional, effective, clear and honest. She helped us buy our home 18 years ago. After 2008 we went to her to refinance. She helped us work through our totally 'under water' loan. Then, we just refinanced again in 2021.  I trust her implicitly.

Ok - First the lady behind the bar was perfect.  Kind and professional.  I had French onion soup a tenderloin kabob and some pasta with scallops.  The French onion soup... it had a piece of processed white cheese on top..... wtf!!!  I would expect this at McDonald's  or Taco Bell if they had it....   ok the kabob.  It was cold!!
The scallops way over cooked.  Honestly, I have never had exceptional service there. Always slow. And now that I have thought about it.  The owners need to spend more time there. My dinner tonight was pathetic. I am done with this place. Too many chances and too many let downs.

i went on a sunday morning around 9:45 and waited 30 minutes to order. the staff does not mask or wear PPE and there is no social distancing. the utensils were left on the side of the restaurant for customers to get themselves. pretty much ZERO COVID SAFETY PRECAUTIONS. the food is a bit overpriced for what it is. we ordered 1 mild fried chicken sandwich on brioche, 1 breakfast sandwich on a buttermilk biscuit, and 1 side order of crispy potatoes with chipotle ketchup for ~$33 before tip. i highly recommend the chicken sandwich!!! crispy with the perfect amount of jalapeño jam to balance it out. the breakfast sandwich came with a large brick of egg that i personally was not a fan of. it was too big that you could hardly eat it as a sandwich. we ended up deconstructing it and eating the biscuit with a side of their heavenly blueberry jam. the potatoes were nice and crispy but nothing outstanding about it. 

best thing about this place: fried chicken sandwich 
worst thing about this place: no health precautions

Only bad thing I have to say was the wait was longer than I would've liked. Service was rushed trying to get through all the people, but great ice cream!! Definitely filled our late night sweet tooth. We got the white chocolate banana nut with coffee and it was awesome!! 12/10 would be back, just hoping for less of a line.

Do you know how hard it is to find decently priced Dolsot Bibimbap?! Why does this city insist on $16 rice and vegetables with the possibility of meat? BAP, you are truly a gift from heaven for a girl trying to survive. From the sleek, barebones menu to the presentation, to giving me the option to add as much gochujang as I want at my table, to taking credit cards, I am so happy this place exists. Now, it was pretty empty when I went, but it seems like they are surviving from Uber Eats. 

My -only- critique is that dolsot bibimbap is better with a raw egg rather than pre-fried, so I'm going to try that special request next time I stop by. Other than that, the staff is very friendly, the atmoshpere is pretty cozy, and the food comes pretty fast. 

But I would recommend you skip on the pajeon: it's not that great and it's all about the stone rice bowl burning your mouth for an hour.
delish!!! Would recommend pork gyoza, tuna tar tar, old city roll, hurts, and the broad street. Normally wouldn't go for a roll w out rice but didn't miss it in the broad street. Will be back!!

Continuing on with the culinary tour we had dinner this evening at Copper V. 

Thumbs up to the white sangria! Crawfish beignets were also a highlight. I had gnocci and enjoyed it, along with truffle fries. Generally most of the party enjoyed dinner and the space was great for a larger group (8 of us).

We had not been out to a restaurant in some time, and decided to try Macaroni Grill. we were nervous, but our server, John, was the best. He told us what they were doing for our safety and was patient with us. I so appreciate that he was this attentive to us and made our first experience out a very enjoyable one. John is a true asset, an on-point, professional waiter. Bravo.

This place was right next to our hotel and had a great assortment of coffees and teas. We were impressed with the decor and feel of the restaurant. Food was a good portion and we shared a lot of different entrees! Had a wonderful time!

Super friendly staff, good beers and a nice spacious spot. Last time we were here I had a strawberry beer that was awesome but when we came this time it was out. So I tried the granny's house and it was good. Nice spices. And the Belgian triple and wow. That is a great beer. Smooth and sweet. Great location too. It's also nice they have food trucks most weekends. If you follow them on socials, they post them in advance!

I have ordered from Hibachi Express twice now and both times were consistent. I called my order in, they said the food would be ready in 15 min and when I went to pick up my order it was nice and hot. The chicken fried rice is tasty. I like putting the yum yum sauce on it! The second time I got the veggie hibachi with extra cabbage. I ate that for two days lol, it was so much food.  The speed of service makes this a great place to go to for lunch break, and for the quantity of food and prices this is a great place to order dinner for the family!

BLUF:  I would go back in a heart beat for the food. 

I know it is a wine bar but I'm not a wine connoisseur. I got a full glass (5oz) for $12 and I think it was their cheapest. It was good but I can buy an equally satisfying full bottle for less. They had a couple beers but they were common beers for the city. My lady got a cocktail (the Smokey?) which was very interesting and very good.  

The highlight here is the food. I got the crawfish grilled cheese which was very rich and pretty good. Fries were great. Lady got the fried chicken sandwich and it was unreal. Makes Chick-fil-A/Popeyes seem like a bag of fried trash. It was awesome and huge. We also got the pork belly and oysters which was great. 

We finished with the chocolate-butter creme broulate (I can't spell) and it was awesome.  

Service was great. 

Go for the food and sneak a bottle in.

This company is truly a piece of s***. "Customer service" is brain dead, apathetic. No listening
 communication, comprehension, analytical, or critical thinking skills. They could be replaced by machines and artificial intelligence.

Yes artificial stupidity would be an improvement.

Stll cannot access my credit card account online due to Chase IT glitches . . . . Despite  enduring 3 days and 2 hours of incompetence and being hung up on. To think I closed a Chase account 10 years ago for bad service just to give them another chance. Close your accounts and put them out of service. I'm closing mine.

Love the food and atmosphere at Green Pheasant. There is some great variety to the menu, as well as the different sections of the restaurant. I'm excited to try some of the other options next time we visit. Definitely try one of the dumpling options if it's your first time.

I was a member of the Chase credit card sense 2003, but didn't use it much because unpleasant experience in the past. The past month I made a large purchase on the credit card, and had to dispute the transaction. On June 1 I faxed a request to open a dispute, and have a proof that the fax went through. On June 6, I contacted customer service, and was informed that they didn't receive the fax. The same day I sent a message through Chase's secure messaging with the request to open a case, and received a response: "We received your dispute for a transaction on your credit card account. We're working on it now, and we'll respond to you with a phone call or a letter through standard mail." On June 15 I contacted Chase customer service, and was informed that dispute case wasn't opened, and dispute department never received my email. Chase bank is the most unprofessional and inconsiderate business. I had more problems with them then with all banks combined. I would NOT recommend to open Chase account.

We decided to stop into Gilley's on our way home from DePauw Nature Park. I was shocked how big the main building was, I was not anticipating that much space to go through. There were a few very friendly staff members walking around ready & willing to help. I interacted with 2 of them and they were both very friendly & helpful. Even though there was a lot, actually so much stuff! I wasn't able to find anything in the areas I collect which mostly entail Native American items (jewelry, pottery, fetishes). I believe they had a good selection items and the prices seemed reasonable. After we left the main building we went to the barn but I asked at the counter regarding my area of interest and the lady working at the counter could not recall that any of the booths carried any. Because we were already tired from our hiking and then touring the big building we left. They had a fair amount of cars in the lot yet I didn't feel it was too crowded inside. The employee in the main building said business had picked up
significantly since reopening after the Covid closure (more than prior to Covid). She has worked there for 6 years, she said business seemed better than ever.
Received confirmation of my order at 5 pm, charged, and by 7 pm still no delivery. Dealing with some very hungry, upset kids

service was attentive and great accommodating to our needs. Decor was really nice, a wood finish and a bar. Presentation of the food was neat, however, 3 stars because it just didn't taste that good. The slices of the fish were healthy portions, but there was something missing, like I've had it somewhere else before. When I grade sushi, the first bite has to give me that "oh, this is good and the taste is different..." This place is great for a date because it's got a dimmed ambiance and sometimes I'm looking for a nice place just to talk.

Horrible service and so-so food.  The server didn't even take app plates away. We stacked our own plates and they stayed on table while we ate. And, the cocktail was horrible. Big mistake coming here.  Too many good places to eat in NOLA.  Why did I eat here? Group dinner. We made rezzies and it still took a very long time to be seated. Bottom line: skip this place.

Such a long wait time on a Wednesday morning. Maybe it's worth it if you eat meat, but I was here for a company team brunch and there were literally 0 vegan options. Of course I found something to modify - a broccoli salad, which was basically just a bunch of broccoli florets and some sunflower seeds and vinaigrette. I don't understand how in 2021 you don't have a single vegan option outlined.

The banana bread with peanut butter  (The Elvis)  is to die for! Must have ! You will not regret it!

Green eggs and ham sandwich had a nice kick to it that was very surprising but also very appetizing.

First come first serve seating so if there's a long line, make sure you grab your seats!

Came all the way from New York to get my nails done after quarantine. These ladies are not only
Professional they are extremely generous and so kind. The greeting I was welcomed with was absolutely amazing. These ladies are such gems and their nails are gorgeous. Very clean very friendly everything you would want in in a nail salon. They run New York Into the Ground

I love this bar!  I've been here twice, not during peak bar hours so I'm sure it's even more fun at night, but both times I've been I left wishing it was closer to where I live. 

The first I came here was for a quick drink to kill time before my reservation at Ralph's (which owns this bar).  The bartender was super informative, even giving us tips on what to order at Ralph's since it was my first time there as well, and the drink I had was delish. 

The second I went was this past Sunday for some food after bike riding. It was still brunch hours-I got the eggs benedict, my boyfriend got their special cheesesteak omelette, and we split the sausage and pepper spring rolls.  First off sausage and peppers is one of my very favorite foods so to see them offered in a unique way was really cool and they were really good. My eggs benedict was good too, but my boyfriends cheesesteak omelette, topped with their homemade wiz sauce, was beyond.  Both brunch entrees were served with spicy potatoes on the side which were tasty too. We had a different bartender this time and he was just as friendly and helpful as the one we had the first time. 

I've been here twice and I can't wait to go again.
Tyla and Teresa were so awesome tonight, so nice and the food was super yummy! Will be returning!

After having several pasta dishes and sandwiches delivered from here, this place is just OK.  Nothing to rave about, nothing really special but not terrible either.  Just kind of meh.  If anything too much bread.  I have not been inside but will update if/when I do.

I had a Groupon to use and when I went to my appointment the Esthetician Jodie explained to me because I have a pacemaker it would be unsafe for me to get the procedure done. I was going to be refunded from the groupon and Jodie I had talked about some nutritional questions. I'm not a very techy person and she showed me pinterest which had a lot of resources for what I was looking for. Keep in mind she didn't get paid for any of this and customer service was exceptional. I would go there for services. Thanks Jodie!

I've called twice today just to ask a simple question. Both times I was immediately put on hold and left to wait longer than " can I put you on hold for one moment "? I guess they don't really want my business

Came in yesterday for an early dinner and was pleasantly surprised by twin peaks. Lindsey was our server and she was awesome she made some recommendations on a good beer. As a girl I didn't know about going in this place but the food was awesome and the service was fast! The manager even stopped by to ensure my boyfriend and I had a good meal
Went for lunch and sat upstairs on the balcony. The food was AMAZING, the drinks inventive and delicious, and the service was 20 out of 10.

Secura? Sacada? I'm not sure. But you know who I am talking about. She was very rude to regular customers and gave them  a lot of attitude. It was out of line and it made me and everyone I was with not want to go back ever.. She said she was better then the job anyway so that might be a reason why she was so rude and didn't care how she treated her customers. I am so disappointed and can't believe you have an employee like her. Everyone else was so nice except her. She acted like she was the boss. I recommend any place else besides your pizza place. FIND ANOTHER COUNTER GIRL.

So this is going to be one of those places that polarizes people. Especially in this part of town. Some people have to understand what it is Craft Hall is trying to accomplish. This is young family experience during the day, and large group gathering place by night. This type of venue is not always accepted in this zip code. But I'm telling you, this is not a tourist trap and is a genuine establishment. It is also surrounded by some very tough competition with restaurants and bars in Fishtown and NoLibs. I have a pretty high standard when it comes to food and drink and I'm going to say outright that I like everything that is the Craft Hall concept. There is one issue, and that's the pricing of food. Cutting to the chase, here's what to expect:

Before you even get inside, there's one seating area where you can bring a beer or food outside, sit along Delaware ave and hang out next to the chickens and rabbits in their coops (you can't pet them but you can watch them hop around). It's slightly removed from the rest of the establishment but it could be a nice thing to do with kids if the weather is nice. It's quiet and doesn't smell like a chicken coop at all. I love all animals, so I think this is cool.

The Space:
As you walk into the enormous space I notice that it's air-conditioned very well. This was a problem in the space when it used to be Yards brewing. It's an old building, which I believe to be one of the last remnants of the Jack Frost Sugar refinery (someone fact check me?), and it would get uncomfortable at times. But the temperature inside was nice even on a 90 degree day. This converted warehouse is split up between different seating areas. One section has a number of couches to kick back on. Another is filled with high-top tables and a traditional L-shape bar. Towards the back there are low-top tables, a ping pong table, cornhole and a shuffleboard table. In the furthest corner separated from rest of the room is the playground and kids area. Beyond that through a single door on the back wall, is more outside seating that borders but is fenced off from Delaware Ave. I'd like to note that the playground is very separate from the bar area. I wasn't tripping on children while drinking my beer. I was also surprised that the noise level is reasonably quiet and pleasant. Aside from a twenty-something jokingly playing the baby shark song on the communal piano behind me.

The Food and Drink:
So Craft Hall hosts the Mainstay Independent Brewing company started up by former brew masters of Slyfox and the late great Saint Benjamin's Brewing. I'm going to say that if you think their beer is bad, you are just simply wrong. These are some of the best German style beers I've ever tried from an American brewery. And I've tried A LOT. They brew primarily classic German styles. Don't get me wrong, these styles aren't always user-friendly, but they have a great assortment here that should fit anyone's tastes (both hop-lovers and hop-haters) if you learn about what you're ordering. You might just have to ask the bartender a few questions and sample some first. The King Laird Hefeweizen is one of my all-time favorites now and is definite crowd pleaser. The food seems to be New American and comfort foods with some BBQ sprinkled in. They use Lost Bread Company bread for everything, which speaks for itself. The food is excellent and the only reason this place did not receive 5 stars from me is because the food is very expensive for relatively smaller portions. For this reason, I come here all the time now, but for the beer and atmosphere. It's odd to me about the pricing of the food because the beer and cocktails are very reasonable. You can get pitchers of many of their beers for $18. To-go pounder 4 packs are $10. Growlers of their flagships are $13. Why are hush puppies $10 and a tiny asparagus salad $12? I get snacks like the bread board or the pretzels but I usually don't eat a meal here. I love the menu but the pricing is just a little off for an order-and-take-a-number kind of place.  

The Service:
