Bartenders were very cool. I talked quite a bit with a few different bartenders and they were all friendly and all knew what they were talking about when it came to food and drink. Like I said before, this place is an order-at-the-counter and grab a number kind of place, so it was nice that they all took time to talk to me despite being busy. 

The Overall:
I really like this place. If they were to adjust their food pricing on some items, I think I would happily update to 5 stars here. I would like this place to succeed, so hopefully this review clears up some misconceptions of the place. Comfortable seating, great beer, fun games, cool bartenders, decent food. Bonus points for chickens. Built for the young family outing, group happy hours, Sunday fundays or a beer after a jog along Delaware Ave. Just understand what it is people come here for and you'll really like this place too.

Worst experience I have ever had with a credit card in 40+ years.  Online system for payment doesn't work.  Had active external payment accounts which would not work when trying to pay my bill.  Sent numerous messages and never got instructions that worked.  Called the number I was given for tech support and was told it wasn't the right place to call.  Given another number...same thing...wrong place to call.  How does this bank keep functioning??  Wasted so much time.  I only wish I could give 0 stars...

this place is so cute! i wanted to eat in the outside area with the plants but it was really windy that day so my friends and i opted for inside seating! it was kind of a small area, but it felt so spacious with the open windows and the natural sunlight everywhere! even the bathrooms were aesthetically pleasing.

i got their flatbread, and my friends and i shared the friends and brussels sprouts. it didn't seem like a lot of food but by the time our flatbreads came out, we were almost full from just sharing the brussels sprouts and fries(it was a group of four people)! everything was really good, and i enjoyed my meal! 

will definitely come again, i want to try lots of other dishes that they have on the menu!

Beautiful look on the outside and inside. Lots of greenery and plants hanging outdoor! It's a very popular happy hour spot with wines on tap at the bar. Don't expect to get great seating service especially if you do not have a reservation.. there was a bit of a line and we asked about seating at the bar.. the host didn't seem to care about it so we just grabbed a drink at the bar while waiting for our table. Luckily 2 people left the bar and we were able to snag some seats. However, the bartender was nice. We came in only to grab a drink and an appetizer so we got the brussel sprouts because we saw they looked delicious while walking past a table. They were made perfectly being well cooked and soft while crispy and charred on the outside. The parm cheese and the garlic aioli topped it off. I absolutely recommended definitely getting the brussel sprouts for sure. My husband ordered a cocktail that was basically a Manhattan but it was supposed to have coconut syrup but they ran out of it which was unfortunate. Their wine list was pretty cheap but that's me speaking coming from Seattle.. $12 for a 5 oz pour of the rose. #roseallday

This place has a great Yelp reviews, but after having dinner here I would not give it four-star at all.  We ordered the Daily specials of Shrimp Pancake and Japchae. The Pancake served with six tiny slices at $6.95  was pretty pricy and could not really taste any shrimp inside. Japchae does not have any protein and it was priced at $9.95. The rest of the party ordered Beef Bibimap, and it was decent. 
Overall, the food here was over-prices for what they served.

This is my favorite pizza joint. All the food is delicious except the large pizzas.  They are ok but I get 2 small ones instead.  Yum so good. They are very efficient and they have a fast and good  delivery or pickup. Not the cheapest but the best!

Tried to exchange with receipt shoes bought within their exchange policy and could not get the price we paid for them. Terrible policy and customer service. Ms Bailey B. is not up to par of keeping customer satisfaction up either. Just lost a customer who shopped here for years. Shame on you

Food is good, typical chain menu with their twist. Customer service is good. If you go definitely ask for ty's section. She is the best there, always friendly, always on the spot with a refill, always making sure everything is good and you don't need anything else.

Loved the vibe of Tuna Bar, which had a bit of zing that carried outside to those of us dining al fresco on a windy, October evening. Overall, the fish was fresh and tasty, though I would have liked a little more flavor on some of the specialty rolls.

We started with: (1) Grandma's Wonton Soup (traditional fuzhou style pork wontons, scallions, celery), which was delightful--a very gentle broth and ghost-like wontons floating therein; (2) Pork Gyoza (kurobuta pork, scallions, ginger, pan-fried), which were nicely crisp, flavorful, and served piping hot; and (3) Wagyu Beef Spring Rolls (onion, ginger, cabbage, scallions, mustard sauce), which included some delicious beef, however, the beef overwhelmed the rest of the spring roll.

We rolled on with: (a) Yellowtail & Chives house roll (avocado, chive oil), my favorite roll of the evening--that chive oil gave it a certain special something; (b) King Ghidorah specialty maki (spicy tuna, shishitos, hot sesame oil, topped with yellow-tail, jalapeño, tobiko), my second favorite roll; (c) Dynamite White Tuna house roll (spicy walu, crunch, shishitos), my third favorite roll; (d) Fishtown specialty maki (shrimp tempura, avocado, jalapeño, topped with tuna, salmon, yellowtail, spicy aioli), although this roll looked like it would have the most flavor, it didn't deliver on its looks, tasty, sure, but not my favorite; and (e) Eel Avocado classic maki.

The service was stellar and I appreciated the wider-width sidewalk permitting outside dining to be away from the flow of pedestrian traffic. Will return to check out the indoor dining vibes.

I live fairly close to here, but don't come very often. The staff is ok but there have been a couple of times they were hurrying me to make a selection. They do have a good amount of beers to choose from and they taste great.

My daughter and son stopped by for dinner and loved their waitress and dessert! They say that Tina, their waitress tried to fix the problems and very nice! My daughter's soup wasn't even hot and my son's pizza wasn't cooked or made correctly!  I guess they will go to Olive garden! They might go back for Tina!

At first blush it seemed like an excellent addition to the old city restaurant scene.  Unfortunately the restaurant has zero customer service. They'd rather argue with their customers than provide a dining experience that matches the prices.  Yes the prices are expensive... and the food isn't extraordinary... for example the wonton soup taste like it is drenched in vinegar....  I'd recommend taking your hard earned money elsewhere... Especially since ownership believes their clientele is beneath them....

Dillon was an amazing waiter, I ordered the Gumbo and the deviled eggs, I'm still
Confused as to why I was served 3 deviled eggs. My count can't be that off?! I'm missing an egg. Two eggs cut in half is four deviled eggs. My gumbo lacked rice!!!? 1/3 slice of of boudin link that's crumbling does not Substitue rice at all. Add it!
He wouldn't let me park my bicycle in the store despite the fact that the store was completely empty. It's overpriced highly caloric candy in a cup masquerading as health food.

Wow! I did not expect to like, let alone love Copper Vine. I was a bit skeptical when I heard that it was wine on tap and thought that it would be like WINO, downtown. Cooper Vine is super chill and has a restaurant vibe to it, because it is a restaurant. I went for a work event and we had a private space upstairs. We ended doing a 4 wine flight where our servers brought unmarked bottles to the tables and we had to guess which wine we were consuming. 
Half glasses start off at $4-$5 and most bottles range from $36-$54 with wines from the east coast to the west coast and your usual South American, European , and South African wines. 
What I did not expect was to love the food. It was sooo good. We started off with french fries, deviled eggs and Brussels sprouts, which was absolutely divine. The Brussels are fried then baked and served with grated Parmesan. They were sooo good that you did not need the sauce that accompanied the sprouts. We also had a few different flatbreads which were all delicious! My favorite was the pulled pork flatbread with caramelized onions. 
The staff all seemed to really enjoy their job and were super helpful and friendly. My group definitely wanted to come back again for brunch, but rest assured the brunch menu will be available within the next couple of weeks and they will be available for brunch on both Saturdays and Sundays. 
In addition, the bathrooms were clean and I appreciate them providing paper towels instead of a hand dryer.

I don't usually take the time to write a review, but the service at Iron Horse Auto Body in Santa Barbara was so great, that i just had to! Craig was super nice to work with, and they did a great job repairing damage to our van's front bumper. My husband is disabled, and they offered to drop off the van at our house when the work was complete. Great quality and great service, I highly recommend Iron Horse Auto Body! And what a cool name...

This Wawa is very convenient for Penn students and people who work at the medical school. Like most Wawa's, it offers a lot of coffee options (most of them are the cheapest in University City) and food options.

This is usually my goto place for late night eats since it is normally fast, cheap, and consistent. What I will say is during busy times it can take a while for your food to be made, so it may not be the fastest option all the time.

Recently, they reorganized the place so there is more room for people to stand when waiting for orders. This definitely opens up the space that can filled with over 3-4 dozen at a busy time. 

Tips;
I also love coming here when they offer free coffee or discount their hoagies. You can always find out what their discounts are by looking at the signs at the store fronts.

I stepped in for lunch and the place had two other patrons.  Bathroom floors were extremely sticky and didn't appear clean for a place that just opened an hour prior.  Strike 1

I went to order their main featured burger off the menu, but they were out of the cheese for the burger.  Strike 2

I ended up ordering a "Specialty Sandwich", the Chicken Inner Harbor -Boneless Chicken Breast Sauteed in Olive Oil w/Garlic, Roasted Peppers, Sauteed Spinach & Smoked Mozzarella.  The bottom of the bun was completely soaked, Chicken was very bland and it had a hint of Smoke.  The spinach was probably the only decent part and you could detect slight garlic.  $9 was a bit on the high side for what you get.  Fries were $1.75 additional.  Strike 3

$8 for a 10oz pour of craft beer outside the City is on the high side as well.  

Hard to excuse a poorly made sandwich at all, but when only three people are in the establishment during prime lunch time with a whopping three food orders, that's pretty bad.  The server was a nice young girl and that is why there's an extra star. I'm one for giving a place a second try, but I'll pass and spend my money elsewhere.  Definitely a reason why only two other people were in your place at lunch.  Yikes

They will screw you over with their defective products!!! Poor customer service! DO NOT BUY THEIR MINK CLOSURES!!!! It has shed sooooooo much that I have a HUGE bald spot in the middle where the part is. I look like a fool and am so upset! I contacted them and of course they tried to blame me saying I must have colored it or did something else to it. As God as my witness, I did NOTHING to this hair but have it installed. Since I got the hair mid Jan., they said it cannot be returned. But who will know how hair will hold up until it is installed and worn for a while? They guarantee their product, except when they must replace or refund for poor quality or defective. While they are making all of this money, many of us, their customers, are screwed in the ass without vaseline. 

I must admit that the hair was nice initially. I noticed . the shedding right away, but hoped and prayed that it would not be too serious. Now I have a useless and defective BALD closure!!! What am I supposed to do with this bald closure that I now have. I spent too much money for this. I am still waiting for them to do something, but it has been well over a week since I heard from them. Why is it that no company will stand by their product. As soon as something goes wrong with it, they disavow. I have PICTURES to show you what I am talking about. I am going to post the pictures here. I am just tired of these companies charging an arm and a leg for what they really get for free from the millions of Indian and other Asian women who donate their hair for religious purposes. I may be a lone voice crying in the wilderness of the billion dollar hair industry, but I will keep speaking on this. If I only change ONE person's mind about buying from this company, I will do it!!! Once you buy...you are on your own! If you want the pics...email me at blackrubinesque@gmail.com and I will gladly send them to you!!!

I have been a Chase Credit Card/Marriott Rewards card holder for many years.  I made a mistake when paying my bill through bill pay.  Adding an extra ZERO resulted in a large overpayment.  The customer service has been less than satisfactory.  Every person I have spoken with has a different way to resolve the matter, yet nothing is resolved.  This has turned into quite the night mare for me.  Very very dissatisfied with the customer service at Chase Credit Card

In the midst of the pandemic, my wife and I have been supporting as many of the restaurants as is possible for us. So far, we've ordered take out twice from Copper Vine.

The first time, we ordered their jumbo lump crab deviled eggs, steak frites, and shrimp and grits. Our second order included their fantastic deviled eggs, Wagyu beef burger, their Cuban sandwich, and a couple of draft beers consumed while we waited for the food to be prepared.

Both orders were promptly and exactly prepared, nicely packaged, and delicious. They also included 20% off on food, and 50% on beer.

We shall return!

Bar One was truly outstanding, I cannot wait to come back!

I came here with some friends on a Saturday afternoon for brunch, and every element of this restaurant was perfect.  The service was impeccable.  The wait staff were so attentive, my glass was never empty.  We all had these delicious "Flintstones push pop" drinks , you must get one!  It is a mimosa with a scoop of sorbet, the ideal brunch drink to wash down all of the great food.  

The food was to die for.  The pickle back wings & waffles dish was my favorite.  The marinade and seasoning of the chicken is one of a kind, combined with the sweetness of the waffles, HELLO flavor explosion!  The avocado toast was also tops. Avocado, egg and Texas toast...perfection.  Another stand out was the Tiramisu French Toast, this is what actual dreams are made of.

I loved the overall ambiance of Bar One.  The art in the restaurant (and in the bathrooms) are really cool.  I wanted to take home one of the pieces hanging in the ladies room!  The music they were playing was awesome, everything from 90s alternative hits to Jay-Z.

Thank you Bar One for an amazing experience!!

The portion is generous vs other places in SB downtown. The fried chicken sandwich is a must try. We also ordered Elvis (banana breads) which is very interesting with peanut butter and bacon. Smokey salmon on everything bagel was ok.

Overrated. Got the avocado toast and it wasn't even salted. Honestly, I make better toasts at home.. my husband got one of the sandwiches and they were so dry he didn't even finish it even though he was really hungry. 2 stars for the atmosphere because it was cute inside and out. But the long lines to order and the mediocre food is what won't have us back anymore. There's better places in sb..just my two cents.

A Funk Town anchor for sure. When we stopped by we took notice of all the cyclists and strollers who were meandering into the restaurant. It's in a cool industrial warehouse and has a very urban hip feel and vibe. 

They have a mix of outdoor and indoor seating but based on how busy this place was on a Saturday morning, THEY NEED MORE SEATING! Be prepared to get territorial and fight for seating if necessary.

The biscuits were delicious as were the breakfast sandwiches that I ordered. The buns were sooooo soft. Who doesn't like brioche? The only item I'd suggest steering away from are the grits. They had a very vinegar taste to them. I'm guessing that's their take on grits but no one at our table was a fan. 

Definitely recommend stopping by even if it's just for a quick grab and go coffee. Super cool spot.

Helena Bakery is on a decline. Their pastries have become soft and dense, their breakfast plates inconsistent, and they have unforgivably decided to store their, what would otherwise be excellent, sandwiches in the refrigerator - effectively destroying the freshness of their hand made bread. Overall their food has lost balance and focus. I suspect this is becoming an upscale tourist trap. It has location and design but has lost a significant portion of its substance. Step it back up Helena. You're slipping!

I was very disappointed in this place. Dylan was our waiter about an hour ago and he seemed fairly pleasant but not very attentive or understanding. While some of the food was decent, a lot wasn't and the service was pretty abysmal. 
We weren't told bottles of wine would come in an already open reusable bottle from a tap. I would think that there would have been a spiel like "have you dined with us before? No? Well just to let you guys know all of our wine is on tap and not from a bottle...  blah blah blah"
We ordered wine and apps and got the apps before the wine. We were 100% done with all our appetizers before our server came back to take our main order. We tried to tell Dylan the red wine was un drinkable while he was taking our main orders and he said he would come around when it was our sides turn to order, but then practically ran away without giving us time to bring it up again. When we told him a second time and he seemed snarky. We all ended up ordering soup for our mains because we had such a long time after completing our apps we weren't really hungry anymore. Good for us (because we would have over ordered) bad for him (because his ppa went down and way less of a tip.) When our mains came two of us were splitting the poutine (cochon au lait debris fries) and while the plate was scorching the food inside was luke warm at best. We would have brought it up but he never asked if the food was good. He was MIA the rest of the meal (not that he was very present to begin with.) Or even friendly when he was present. Oh and eventually our other wine came but that took forever too. It was also very hard for us to get gross dirty plates taken away from the table. The French shallot(onion) soup had decent flavor but it was a tiny little dollop of cheese (not your normal smother in cheese and then baked French onion soup) floating on a Very chewy stale piece of bread that I couldn't cut at all.  Three cheese gnocchi was good. Although pretty watery and he didn't bring a spoon until I flagged him down about 10 minutes later. Over all not a fan. There are Many better places in town.

My wife and I just moved to the city after many years of visiting and this is the first time we experienced this pub. 33+ wines on draft, a very nice space with beautiful decor. Patio to die for, great food and friendly staff. This is now in my top 3! You must go try it.

Amazing! We loved it! The place was packed! Started off with the nachos, which were delicious and came with homemade potato chips with a yummy sauce and mojo pork. I had a bowl with rice and shrimp that was amazing, came with an amazing sauce on there and it was the perfect amount of spicy and had amazing flavors. My boyfriend had the brisket bender, which came with mashed potatoes and kale, which he loved. We talk about the next time we can go back all the time as we live about 30 minutes away, but loved it so much! The menu has some incredible options and I doubt anything ordered will lead to disappointment!
Great service. Took the time to explain options and the best camper shell for me. They stock the popular models but I special ordered mine and it was a 3 week delivery.

If you really want to meet mean people, you should visit this UPS Store. I think in their interview process they look for only one quality in their employee i.e rudeness. The owner, the staff everyone is so mean and hostile. I just asked to see if they pasted the return label correctly or not and the lady at the counter got all ballistic on me saying' you should have better pasted it on your own'. Gee if I am paying for the service I sure would want to make sure that things are done properly. 

P.S. Always bring sealed boxes because you will not want to be charged 75cents extra for every box that they seal(this store's policy) and better not ask why they do so because the owner will jump in and get all angry and hostile towards you. Thank you UPS for ruining my day!!!

It's a solid bakery on this side of the high way. We got ricotta toast and the green egg sandwich. Both are very delicious. Since it's first come first serve, you may need to wait in line for a bit. It's totally worthy it though. They also implemented measures regarding Covid. The outdoor tables are not as densely packed as some other restaurants. Definitely recommend!

My husband and I had to provide a family dinner for 18 people yesterday.  We are between houses and staying in an AirB&B, so we decided to have the meal catered.  This was an amazing and wonderful experience!  I ordered the catering online (https://macaronigrillcatering.olo.com/) but then was able to call and speak to the manager a few hours later to confirm everything.  The food was ready when we arrived to pick it up, all packed in a sturdy box for transport.  The salads were cold as they should be, and the entrees were hot!  The food was delicious and got rave reviews from everyone.  The staff at this Macaroni Grill are exceptional.  Thank you!!

It was nice to come back to Bier Brewery after a year absence from Covid-19.   Before the pandemic hit, I would come here to Bier Brewery quite often for beer fests and their special release beer events.   Bier Brewery has a wonderful craft beer selection such as their South Simcoe IPA and their PDG pale Ale.   The redrum beer is supposedly very good as well,  but have not tried it yet. The Brewery has been around for quite a while and it is nice to see that they are still going strong during this pandemic.  I look forward to when they start having events again and we can taste their new releases,  because they produce wonderful new beer each year.  The Halloween release beers were the reason to come to Bier Brewery,  so I am hoping this will be resurrected by this next year. It is worth it!!

went there this afternoon and quite frankly had an uncomfortable experience. Calamari was really nice. Perfectly cooked and flavourful, the chili sauce with it was a nice blend of spice and sweet.The Gyro meat was dried out and not very flavourful. The waitress mixed up our sides, no big deal. The decor was a mix of cool looks that put together did not mesh. The Carpet was incredibly dirty and was not helped by someone I presume is the owner vacuuming as we were eating. I really half expected Gordon Ramsay to show up to fix the place

Food was very good. Even with their limited menu. The buffalo chicken tacos were very good.  The salsa has good flavor too.   Our waitress Jackie was terrific.  Super sweet, friendly, knowledgeable about the menu.   She was very attentive, and even with her mask on she was smiling as she brought us our food and drinks.   We will be back.

If you employ a 'market concept ' restaurant then organize it better. There are three separate food spots but you can only order beverages from one. So, stand in line for coffee and beer, then another if you want sandwiches. The food is okay but not worth the order hassle. On top of that our order was forgotten so we had to alert the manager. They did take care of us but it is not worth another visit.

As bad as I want to give this place 3 stars, I added an extra because of its potential and me being willing to give it another try. 

Came to Copper Vine for Sunday brunch. Love the ambiance here and the patio area! My expectations were high as I've greatly anticipated dining here for quite some time. Our waiter was very knowledgeable about the menu, took his time to explain things, and made quality recommendations. For an appetizer, I had the filet mignon brochette as the waiter suggested; it was fantastic! It definitely set the bar. While waiting for our entrees (yes, my friend and I both ordered 2 entrees, don't judge), we occupied our time indulging in the bottomless mimosas which were also great. 

Entrees: I had the chicken and waffles as well as the crawfish and andouille gnocchi. The chicken was really good and paired well with the gravy that came with it. However, I was greatly underwhelmed by the waffle. It was super thin and crispy, almost like a wafer. I prefer thicker, more fluffy waffles. I ate the chicken and played over the waffle for those reasons. As for the gnocchi, I was not impressed at all. It was disappointing for me. My friend also got the chicken and waffles in addition to the Apple fritter French toast which said was phenomenal. 

Next time, I'll have a better feel for what to get!
Had the spaghetti with meat sauce. Flat out terrible!  The ceasar salad was ok but not enough dressing.   Probably won't go back.  I think fazzolis has better spaghetti.

Came here with my wife to watch the Lightning Game for the first time and what a really nice facility! Great atmosphere and A+ costumer service! We also found out that Top Shelf has the best chicken wings in Town!!! Their Garlic Parmesan and the Asian Sticky Sauce are to die for! Their fries were also delicious and it looked like nothing we ate there was fried but instead either baked or Grilled like the wings were. For dessert we got the Funnel Fries and again they hit this dessert out of the park! Great Food, Great Drinks, Excellent Staff and perfect place to go watch any sports game. Highly recommend. And once you are done eating you can go downstairs and enjoy some ice skating or even just go watch some Live Hockey!
Little Girls that work there absolutely not friendly and not professionals. Very rude if you ask some simple questions.
Love their coffee and vibe. The breakfast food was awesome as well. The outdoor seating area is super nice and feels very calming. Big interior as well.

Nice variety of wines at very reasonable prices and the bartenders very knowledgeable and assisted me in making some great selections.  Quite busy but the service was on top of it.  Cool classic old school building in cbd - easy walk from fq.

Love this spot. It's underrated and always low key. Which is my kinda place. Beer is good and staff is always really friendly. They're dog friendly too which is always a bonus. They have free events and everyone is always laid back!

I was really looking forward to a meal here cause I LOVE brisket! The black pepper rub was too overpowering for me and that's all I tasted, not the brisket. The Mac n cheese looked perfect but did not have a lot of flavor. Same thing for the corn bread, looked good but was dry.

This place is awesome great customer service the people who deliver our food is always polite,friendly,the young lady on the phone knows my address and the floor we live on and their food is delicious........

Great new trampoline park in Boise and closer than any of the others in the valley.  I have taken our boys, twice now, for Friday Night Friendzy and they have had a blast both times!  
The staff is AMAZING!  Very helpful and accommodating, when we came in with a large group of 7th graders for one of the nights.  Plus I noticed there are a ton of staff members, throughout the park helping kids out and encouraging them!  I have found the Friday Night Friendzy to be one of the best deals, out of all the parks in the area and last nights BOGO 1/2 off was a good reason to get them out of the house.

I was a little skeptical Because I never got a facial fillers before however Dr. Adam made me so comfortable and my results were awesome . I am a 41-year-old African-American woman that take care of her skin however I had some med facial issues with aging and decided to give it a try , I will recommend Bala better health If this is your first time getting facial fillers

The food and service were excellent! They had tempura mushrooms that I will dream about and the fig and goat cheese flatbread was outstanding! I asked for the lightest rose they had, which was the Angeline and it was excellent. We also had the Brussels sprouts and fries, which were amazing as well. I don't have anything bad to say! Our server, Justin, was very informative and so much fun! I can't wait to go back and I will definitely ask for him again. If you are wondering, definitely go and try it out and ask for Justin!

Trash. Just came here Christmas Eve for lunch, the hostess turned us away saying no more guests were allowed; they were booked. There were sooooooo many empty tables my bf & I just looked around  thinking "really"?!! I wouldn't recommend. Idk when certain New Orleans' restaurants became so pretentious & bougie but I won't be visiting Copper Vine ever again. Customer service has been lacking in our society today & this place definitely confirmed that.

The food is ok, nothing special. Everything has a jalapeno associated. The reason we go so much is because of Ajna. Hard to find a better server in Indianapolis. Great personality, great customer service and your drink is never empty. If you're going all to suit in Ajna's section.
Pretty good. 4 stars because this was my first time having bibimbap. But I have become a fan.
If you can get past the uniforms, this place has GREAT food, cold beer and awesome service. Seems like what we all want in a restaurant, isn't it?  Try it
It was good for the downtown Nashville area. They have tons of flavors but the staff said the most popular flavor was Tennessee Fudge. It was pretty good. The single scoops are huge.

We went to Macaroni Grill in Seattle and we had an unpleasant experience. We figured we would give the one in Reno a shot and it was just as awful. Seems like it's Macaroni lost their customer service values. When I called to make the reservation the man who answered the phone was unenthusiastic you could tell he did not want to be there and did not want to help. When we got to the restaurant we were seated. Our server got to our table and nothing special she asked what we wanted to drink and if we were ready to order. We asked for some bread and she said that it wasn't ready. She then came back 10 minutes left and said someone beat her to the bread so she had to wait for more. We finally got out bread about 5 minutes after that. We ordered Fettuccine Alfredo with Shrimp and Buffalo Chicken Parmesan. It took quite some time to get our food. It wasn't busy or anything either. The food was okay. Definitely not a $20 plate, you can get similar options at Olive Garden that taste better and cost less. When we were done we gave the server our form of payment and she took and came back with it 10 minutes later. Which is a long time when someone has something as sensitive as a card. She came and said sorry for the wait and said that she forgot our boxes  because she ran into a friend who was giving her a hard time. We received our boxes and left. Honestly, I wouldn't go back. Menu isn't the same, taste is okay, and most importantly the service is terrible there.

Ordered a Zin and fig and goat cheese pizza. Very tasty. My daughter had the burger. She liked it. I enjoyed her chips and garlic sauce that came with her burger. I could not stop eating them. In better weather I would like to sit outside. The outdoor seating looks very pretty and relaxing.
Went to Mikes twice while in Nashville. Both times the ice cream was delicious and fairly priced. I highly recommend the red velvet cake.
Love my decaf cappuccino with almond milk every morning! I have it in a huge mug! Great pastries and bagels! Beautiful location and friendly staff!

First off, I'll have to admit to having a bias since my wife and I frequent their sister restaurant in Maple Shade called Yokohama. That said, Tuna Bar is a tremendously hip new addition to the Philadelphia restaurant scene. The food is of excellent quality and presentation, while the restaurant is chic with a New York City vibe. 

I actually ate there two nights in a row so that I could get a true taste of the cuisine.  The Wok Kampachi Ceviche was excellent but my favorite was the Scallop Crudo.  You should try Grandmom's Wonton Soup, which is a creative new rendition of the old time favorite that I highly recommend.  I even had my favorite roll, the Sindy roll, which I eat at the Maple Shade location. It was delicious as usual. 

Though Tuna Bar may borrow some rolls from the Yokohama menu, make no mistake, the food at Tuna Bar is original, upscale, and very creative.  The menu is evolving as it is perfected, and getting better by the day.

Chase freedom card has lost my goodwill. They have proven to be unreasonable regarding a credit card dispute. Why bother using a credit card if they don't have your back? I used Airbnb and had as awful experience. When I disputed 4 nights of my 10 night stay, chase told me they never consider a hotel dispute as valid, unless you leave the hotel. Now how is that possible when you have prepaid the bill on full and there are no other places to stay on a holiday weekend at the last minute? Chase's rules are that the customer is never worthy of a reimbursement even if the Airbnb is unclean, has no WiFi and does not offer the amenities as marketed. I also spent time and effort printing and mailing screenshots of my entire exchange with the Airbnb landlord and lots of time in the phone with chase. After 15 years with chase freedom, I'm finding a new credit card.

I ordered their Mink Straight Brazilian hair and I love it. I used their bundle deal and got four (4) bundles and a frontal. The hair was beautiful and THICK. I just wanted to run my fingers through it all day. I'm not a weave person and treated the hair soooo badly. I flat ironed and curled it everyday (not needed but I had back to back events and wanted it to be perfect). I've reused this hair plenty of times and it's still like new.

I should add that I needed my package by the end of the week. I relayed that message via email and then again over the phone. Customer service was very sweet and shipped my hair out that same day. I hope they keep that same energy moving forward because they are awesome!

If you happen to stumble into Twin Peaks expecting an otherworldly encounter with David Lynch, you're probably going to be disappointed. 

On the other hand, if you stumble into the brand new Indianapolis location of the Texas-based chain of "breastaurants" called Twin Peaks hoping to enjoy some good eats, good drinks, and scenic views, then you'll likely be incredibly happy. 

Founded in 2005 in Lewisville, Texas, Twin Peaks opened for the dinner hour starting on 12/8/14 at the former Loon Lake Lodge just East of Castleton at the corner of I-69 and East 82nd Street. 

With its servers all wearing the trademark Twin Peaks cleavage and midriff-baring red plaid tops and khaki shorts, the concept behind Twin Peaks may sound familiar but this variation on the familiar theme is far less kitschy and far more personable than other similarly themed restaurants.

The easiest way to describe Twin Peaks is sports bar meets hunting lodge meets bevy of beautiful women. For those who remember Loon Lake Lodge and its abundance of hunting-themed decor, it makes sense that Twin Peaks choose this spot as its first Indianapolis location. The restaurant has multiple truly accessible parking spots and a set of rather light doors leading into the larger than you expect restaurant. As they just started serving dinners only on Monday of this week and open for regular business hours starting Saturday (12/13/14), the spirit in the restaurant was festive and friendly with multiple staff from the chain's Dallas area headquarters on location for training purposes. Thus, you get greeted at the door by enough beautiful women to make you dream for weeks. 

I worried a little as I arrived as the first bar area and first couple dining areas feature high-top tables/chairs that aren't wheelchair friendly. There's no reason to worry. Twin Peaks has multiple areas that are wheelchair friendly and I had no trouble navigating the restaurant (and was encouraged to do so). 

The menu consists of mostly American fare of a South, Southwest, and Heartland flavor with burgers, chicken, appetizers, a few other sandwiches, and a handful of meals. There's a large alcohol menu, of course, and a couple of desserts. There are two main bar areas, at least 3-4 larger dining areas, a small area known as the "man cave," and there are wide-screen televisions throughout the restaurant and in the bathrooms!

I ordered a concoction known as the Smokehouse Burger with "fire fries" for $10.95 plus another couple bucks for my usual iced tea. I tend to be a rather simple burger guy and this particular burger was a bit out of my comfort zone. This may explain why I didn't find it completely satisfying. It tasted a tad underdone. It included cheddar cheese, red onion, BBQ sauce, bacon, mushrooms, lettuce, tomato, and pickles. The burger was easily my least favorite part of the experience, though I'd still put it in the 3-3.5 range. The fries were perfectly seasoned and stellar. The iced tea was also perfection and I did receive my usual refill. 

The highlight of the entire experience was Amanda, and not just because she was beautiful (though she was). She was attentive, personable, outgoing, and just seemed natural. She also scored points for sitting down to talk to me, not just because it's really hard to sit in a wheelchair and have a normal conversation with a skimpily clad young woman but because being at wheelchair height causes the neck to constantly have to stretch and it's nice when someone meets you eye-to-eye. Unlike that "other" chain that comes to mind, these young women all seemed comfortable with disability and Amanda, in particular, seemed natural and at ease (NOTE: I did learn she has a brother who is deaf. I'm sure that helps). 

While it was a little slow during the 5pm hour in which I arrived at Twin Peaks, I was impressed with Amanda's personable nature and ability to talk about work, disability, sports, food and, yes, even what it's like to work in a place with an outfit that would make most of us blush. It was refreshingly awesome and, to be honest, not what I expected when I entered the doors. 

The service was stellar. The food was good, though I'll likely stick to my comfort zone next time. The decor was warm, inviting, and wheelchair friendly. The views, as their slogan notes, definitely scenic. While I do lean toward the shy side, I think it's human nature to appreciate a little extra attention and, as Twin Peaks notes on its website, the Twin Peaks girls offer an abundance of "girl next door" charisma and playful personalities. 

What can I say? Welcome to Indianapolis, Twin Peaks!  For more information on Twin Peaks, visit their website at http://twinpeaksrestaurant.com

My new favorite sushi place in philly! So I agree with some of the other reviews, it is VERY hard to find amazing sushi in Philadelphia. It's just difficult to come by, while this sushi was not the best I have ever had, the experience was five stars. 

First, I love the ambience. This is a place that suits many occasions, first dates, get together with friends, lunch with a coworker, etc. I would say definitely more of an intimate setting, I came here with Megan F. for a lunch during a work break! Such great vibes. Love the bar area and full length windows, just adds to the ambience! 

We tried their steamed chicken and shrimp dumplings as an appetizer and for rolls we split the J&J roll, peppered tuna roll, and the east roll. The east roll is just your standard salmon sushi roll, nothing too crazy.  The J&J is a great roll for people trying to transition into the sushi eating world of actual raw fish! Loved the seared tuna on the outside. Hands down, our favorite was the peppered tuna roll! I'm a spicy tuna roll enthusiast and I decided to switch it up with this roll. I have zero regrets, a definite must try and great chance of tuna palette.


Overall the place and the sushi varieties are very modern, definitely worth a try if you're near this area of philly!

Went here for a night out with my roommate. Awesome vibes right from the start.

We got lost finding the entrance so we called inside. The host gave great directions and even said "are you in the black jacket? I see you!" So sweet!

We had a reservation and got seated right away. The indoor is absolutely beautiful! 

I started off with a cocktail (could not remember which one) and we split the tuna tartare. We also got the pork gyoza to split. Both were AMAZING and we tore through them in probably minutes. 

I ordered a wonton soup as a starter. By the time our entrees came it had not, so I asked about it. He said they were out of wonton soup (weird) but it was also 10 pm, so it was fine! 

For our main course, my roommate got shrimp tempura and I got the fish town roll. I was not expecting that much heat, so be careful!! I ended up taking the jalapeños off but it was still delicious! 

After that, I had consumed quite a few drinks, and was getting drunk hungry. I last minutes ordered the fried rice with the egg on top. Amazing!!! Satisfied every craving! I even left with some to go (that I finished before I went to bed )

Will 100% be back soon!!

My team and I were trying to find a nice spot for lunch in for our last night in New Orleans. The ambiance was spectacular I enjoyed the apricot mock tail which is also in the photo. Really enjoyed the food would definitely go back if I am ever back in town!

Also had the gnocchi au gratin and brussel sprouts, no photos but definitely also recommended

The food was okay, not what I was expecting but the customer service was phenomenal. I probably won't go back here just because I didn't care for the food but hey it wasn't that bad to give them a one star.

Vaguely remember coming here when the bar went by a different name, but glad to see it now operating as a solid happy hour spot.  Decent discounts on drinks, and a fairly varied food menu for happy hour, too.  Was here on a Tuesday, and was impressed by the solid crowd that came in for trivia, as well.

Jennie was awesome to work with, even as a renter. My husband and I came in with different and somewhat clashing priorities for our next rental. We were all over the map with price and location. Although we have a dog, we still insisted on looking at places that were not dog friendly. Even after being turned down from an application because of our dog- Jennie was still willing to show us around more places.
She thought of reasons why certain places were not the right fit before I did. She never made us feel like we were being too picky. In the end, we are so happy to move into our new home. Thanks, Jennie.

My mother and I just left the store, while checking out our cashier was extremely pushy when trying to sell us your credit card. We declined multiple times and she kept at it. 
Please retrain your customers on selling them to customers. If the customer says no then that's that. Also do not argue the effects it has on the customers credit score. 
On another note please clean bathrooms.

We had eaten here years ago when it first opened and in a moment of weakness thought it would be a safe quick choice . It was a Tuesday night and maybe a 1/4 full if that . We waited a few minutes to be seated , that was ok . The hostess seated us , presented the menus mentioned some specials , all fine and normal . After a awhile a waiter showed up , not sure if it was his first night or he just sucked as a waiter . He fumbled through trying to sell us wine then needed to collect the glasses on the table and take them away all before taking our drink order . Later he came back took our drink and food order . After awhile he brought the drinks , super watery weak ice tea , said he'd be back with the bread . Later he brought the bread . Much later the bread was gone the weak tea was gone , no sign of the waiter or the food . I was fumbling in my wallet to leave some cash for the tea so we could go find some food somewhere else when the food came . The food was hot but unremarkable . Eventually, the waiter came by again , we had stacked all our dishes on the table and were ready to see if the hostess could get our check . He took the dishes and asked if we wanted dessert - we aren't young and don't want to waste the time we have left waiting,  we said no and asked for the check . He left and didn't bring the check but started serving the booth behind us . I heard a raised voice and turned to see an attractive young woman reading him the riot act "......to go box , unacceptable service , manager " . We started walking to the front to see if the hostess could help , he quickly brought our check . We stood while he ran our card . Another waiter asked if everything was ok , my husband said no the service sucked . That waiter wanted to get us a manager but we just wanted it to be over . We won't be back and I have such buyers remorse , wish we had just gone to Del Taco across the street.

Consistently delicious and friendly spot for breakfast. Considering it was Saturday, the line was fairly short and there were plenty of outdoor patio spots. We had the chicken sandwich and the market bowl, both of which were perfect. The outdoor patio is beautiful and dog friendly.  Love!

I went here for the first time a couple weeks ago! I loved it so much that I would definitely go again! I had an amazing server who actually took her time to explain her favorite wines on the menu and why! Everyone was spread out safely too! The food was really good also!

Most of Nashville's new restaurants, while quite good, are not that different from each other.  The Green Pheasant is different.  Japanese-  But far from your average (or even above average) sushi restaurant.  Expect truly interesting, even strange, dishes with SUPERB flavors.  Subtle or powerful depending, light or rich, depending on the dish-  the food here is truly remarkable.  And, you will find dishes you likely have never experienced, (but are worth the try!!) as well as some to please the less than adventurous eater.  If you have never had Japanese wagyu beef -  it's is rare to find it in the US and is considered some of the best beef available in the world.  I'm not a sake fan-  (even cold sake, which is THE thing now) but they have trained sake specialists to help you select!  The wait staff was super knowledgeable, friendly, and helpful.  
The decor and atmosphere is wonderful, with tables having a good amount of space between them so there is some privacy.  In short-  try this place!!!!

Copper vine is a beautiful wine bar in the CBD. I have been there countless times for happy hour--where bottles of wine are half off and have thoroughly enjoyed the duck fat fries. They also have a beautiful patio with greenery that is great to sit under and Instagram worthy. 

I hadn't gone to copper vine for any meals until my fiancé order brunch for us during Mother's Day weekend (i just became a dog mom) Just wow. It came with pain perdu,chocolate ganache,cane syrup, sweet cream, strawberries, blueberries, oranges, bacon and candies pecans. It was honestly to die for!! We had so much left over for the next day as well. Run to copper vine and order a great brunch to-go!

I have been here before and it was good. Great experience.


Last night my family & I went out to eat, 
First we got served bread that tasted/ felt like it had been sitting out for 3 days.. next we ordered the spinach artichoke dip that was served cold..
We had the mushroom arancini crispy on the outside frozen in the middle...
I had ordered for my main meal mashed potatoes asparagus and broccolini, the only thing not cold was the asparagus... I'm extremely disappointed with this experience.  
The cheesecake even had a weird taste to it, somewhat of a  metal flavor... 
never going to this place again...

Copper Vine is a modern vibe Downtown. New Orleans is beaming through the traditional French Quarter French Doors, however, the dining room and courtyard add flavor. Service was great, as expected. I ate once before at the bar before but have returned with my fiancée. We came during Coolinary month and Copper Vine's selection didn't disappoint. We shared the appetizer and dessert. This isn't a traditional New Orleans cuisine, but you can certainly taste the influences. Flavors are a bit more light and fresh rather than spicy and in your face. The chicken and boudin gumbo appetizer was not mom's gumbo, but pretty good. Paige got the Wagyu burger while I got the Gulf Fish Bouillabaisse. Both great. The Strawberries & Cream Bread Pudding was GREAT. I'm pretty sure it was garnished with champgne strawberries. Those were a dope touch. While a little pricy, it's a nice change of pace when you feel like being downtown but out of the noise.

Tuna Bar is a modern and sleek restaurant.  This may be an odd observation but I felt like the lighting was perfect because it wasnt too dark or bright. We opted to sit at the beautiful bar. Our server was very friendly and provided great recommendations.

We started with the Creamy Rock Shrimp which was lightly battered. The gochujang added a nice mild spice.  The shrimp was okay, nothing to write home about. We also had the Tuna Crudo which was way bigger than we anticipated. 

We opted to try several rolls: salmon avocado, Sindy, Rittenhouse and the unagi sashimi. The sushi and sashimi were beautifully presented on a wooden board. Sindy was my favorite roll as it was super light because it didnt have rice. We noticed the salmon may not have been as fresh as the tuna that day. Overall, it was good though. 

We kept it simple with drinks and had sake and Japanese whiskey.  Can't wait to go back and try some cocktails!
Great new restaurant in New Orleans. This place has an awesome atmosphere and great employees. Our server John was very attentive, helpful, and friendly. The food was also delicious. We will be back!
Survey and review has been filled out at your website.  We will see what happens from here. Hopefully it gets better there.

This place offers a simplistic and straight to the point Korean bibimbap experience. The food is fantastic, prices super reasonable and service very fast. And the best part may just be the owners who may be the most pleasant people in the city. Highly recommend checking out BAP.

Full recharge was superb, angel food w/ sugar and milk substitutions was sensational, and the woman who served us was a delight! Rarely get a smoothie out and about, what a good morning for the drive-thru! Thanks everyone!
What a cute spot! We came here for wine tasting before dinner reservations but will be back to try the food because the ambiance was awesome and so was the service.

This is one of the worse credit card companies that I have encountered. I recently opened a credit card account with them through Amazon.com. I had a balance of about $127.00. When I checked my balance online, I found that the payment was due the day before, so I took the option to pay online. I was immediately hit with a $25.00 late fee, which is about 20% of the balance. The payment was a day late and I have an excellent credit rating with over 40 years of credit history and no defaults. But that makes no difference to Chase. Very different from all of the other financial institutions that I use. I then called to close my account. Then I receive another statement for $1.79, even though I paid the balance, in full, as shown on their website. This is not a customer oriented company. There are many other to choose from who will treat you like a human being.

Worst service ever. Quoted one price over the phone, was charged incorrectly. Fought with the manager about a refund, even after we offered to send it all back & he wouldn't accept. Do not order from here!

This place has excellent food and a great atmosphere. I have ate almost everything on the menu and it never disappoints. Ybor Egg Rolls and wings are awesome, Power Play bowl is an excellent healthier option. They also have a full liquor bar, and numerous wines and craft beers on tap! Staff is friendly and service is great. Awesome spot for a quick lunch during the work week. I eat here at least once every other week. Ask them about their rewards program!
Amazing, the one thing was it didn't have toro.  Would come again!  Loved the tuna!  Amazing place all around! The drinks were great too!  Tuna bar is a good place.

Worst customer service!!! Never shop here! Your better option if you really NEED something from Famous Footwear is to go to their Kirkwood location. There BOGO offer is more like a BOGUS offer! The manager, Bailey, was extremely rude!

This new kid on the block is killing it. Tucked behind Cutlers and Fig Mountain is this perfect brunch spot. From the moment you enter, you know it's the new Santa Barbara on full display with a cafe in the front and wine bar in the back.

The pie is the star of the show. If you do not have the pie, have a breakfast sandwich and fruit galette, if available. Also be sure to leave with a loaf of bread. Everything is fresh and scratch made and recommended. The sandwiches are big enough for two people to share and come with some house made chips. 

The are open for take out. Be sure to wear your mask and be prepared to safely wait. You will be glad you did! See website for hours.

I went there with my uncle and grandma on Sunday. Our server Aaron was awful. My grandma ordered a BLT with onion rings & was brought a hamburger & fries. He made no attempt to correct the order. We had to repeatedly ask for refills. Not to mention, their cook never showed up for his/her shift so the manager was having to cook in the back. They were turning away people at the host stand. Overall, horrible experience and very poorly ran.

My family went to Coopervine Restaurant for lunch on Christmas Day.  We were seated by the door as a party of four.  We ordered our food and my daughter, who sat in the chair closest to the door had placed her new purse on her chair back. While we were sitting down my daughter went to look for her purse and it was missing. We immediately checked to see the location of her I phone and it was going down Rampart Avenue. We informed the restaurant we needed to leave in an attempt to recover the purse and her new I -Phone but we had to wait to pay the check. Our food would be packaged to go.  We were unable to Lacaze the phone since the phone was turned off and we returned to the restaurant to file a police report.  The restaurant has a camera and we were informed that the on duty manager didn't have access to the camera and we would have to wait until Monday. As of today we have not received a copy of the tape nor has the restaurant called us. So I contacted the restaurant and spoke with Derick who is the on duty manager. He informed me he was unaware of the incident and would inform his GM to contact me.  It's amazing the restaurant no only failed to communicate to staff to avoid future occupancies, but they totally dispelled the incident. Clear message that customers are not valued but if you are a victim of a crime on their premises, they are unwilling to assist you.

Copper Vine is not taking the necessary precautions for Covid! I called to reserve an outdoor table for 4 and was told they would be able to fulfill my request. Fast forward to the next day...I arrived and lo and behold there wasn't an outdoor table available. I didn't want to inconvenience the others in my party, so we agreed to sit inside. At first, there appeared to be adequate social distancing. BUT no one inside was wearing a mask or required to wear one while not eating. About 30 minutes later, the place was well over 100% capacity. There were way too many people in there and no one was masked, except me and another at my table. Most of the staff had on masks, except one guy who stood by our table for a loooooong time talking to another employee. I was really uncomfortable. 

Now on to the food. I ordered the Cuban sandwich. It was big! The pork was delicious but the ham could have been better in my opinion. Overall, I'd give the sandwich a 3.5. I upgraded my fries to the truffle fries. They were good but I feel I only got enough to go with one half of my sandwich. My friend had the ancient grain and sugarcane salad, add oysters. It looked delicious and she said it was!

We decided to pay using the QR code on the receipt. After submitting payment, we realized we didn't have the option to tip. Upon looking at my email receipt, I noticed that Copper Vine took it upon themselves to add a tip at the rate of their choice. I did not like that and it should have been communicated to us ahead of time. 

Will I return to Copper Vine? Probably not! This was the first restaurant I chose to eat in since Covid started and I feel they failed tremendously from a safety perspective.

I went with a group of ten ladies on z weeknight. I ordered the chicken small plate at $22. I disliked it and asked the waitress to box the remaining in case somebody in my household would like it. Half the table wanted to share plates and half the table ordered a solo plate for themselves because we did not want a large meal. The restaurant was not able to accommodate this when it came time to billing. So those of us that ordered one item as an entree were not able to get our own check. Nobody in my household like the chicken dish so not a good evening for dining out. The valet parking was a fixed $12 per car.  We were in a beautifully decorated private room.  The group was largely not overwhelmed with the flavors and their menu selections.

If you are looking for sensuality in life, this is the place with every bite you take. The first bite, is like a romantic kiss, the second and third keeps you on a blissful adventure. Enchanting atmosphere along with a wonderful staff.
Perfection.  Shhhhh, keep this hidden gem a secret, the local vibe is special and a must while you visit or live here in SB.

We had a reservation for 7:30 and they were unable to seat us. There were tables open for parties that had not arrived and they refused to seat us at the open table as the party which had yet to arrive had more people. We waited 45 minutes WITH A RESERVATION; the management and owner were extremely rude and unaccommadtibng. After having us sit outside in the cold 45 minutes, we decided to leave and will never return.

Went to Copper Vine tonight, my first night in New Orleans at the recommendation of a friend. Our server John was super personable and helpful finding me a great glass of wine.

We ordered duck fat fries, and a few flatbreads to snack on. Everything was delicious and was served quickly. Hope to come back sooner than later.

Came here after walking around the Saturday arts market and it did not disappoint! We shared the turkey sandwich, which was huge! All of the ingredients were fresh and their house made potato chips were so good. The place is also a wine bar with many selections to choose from. Would definitely come back to try more food on their menu.

This place is a SCAM. A bait and switch. I found this place via Groupon and purchased 4 full body lipo treatments for $100.  I purchased the Groupon with Bala Better Health because of the reviews. These reviews are fraudulent. Firstly they don't answer their phone. You have to communicate via text message with a robot. Their customer service is horrible. I came into the office and met with Adam L. Wilkes. He asked me what my problem areas are and said the Groupon offer is just to get people in the door. He said normally you'll need about 16 sessions to see results. He said it costs $1200 but he could break it down into monthly payments. I pad 405.60 that day on top of the $110 I paid via Groupon. I was spectacle but Adam Wilkes guaranteed me that it's best to do 16 sessions.  I scheduled my first appointment the following week. When I came in for my appointment no one was at the receptionist desk. I went to Adam Wilkes office and he said do you have an appointment. I told him you scheduled my appointment last week. He quickly claimed he remembered and brought me into a room. Turned on Alexia and told me to lay down on the table. He started placing these plastic pads on me and put glasses on me and said I'll be back. No one came back . I was in the room for about 35 min. The procedure was suppose to take 20 min. After waiting for 15 I removed the pads myself.. When I came out of the room Allyson said did you take the pads off yourself? Yes Adam didn't come back for me. I don't believe Adam Wilkes is an actual board certified doctor.  I immediately asked for a refund. They gave me a refund and then charged me 25 days later for services I haven't used. I didn't even use the 3 remaining sessions from Groupon. 

DON'T TRUST THIS PLACE. THEY JUST WANT TO TAKE YOUR MONEY

What a great shop. Ashley helped me pick out different candies for a candy buffet for a surprise birthday dinner I was throwing. She was a pleasure to work with. The candy was a big hit at the dinner. Thank you again for everything! - RJR

Great service! My server was perfect. I had the chicken sandwich but with a twist it had puckered okra on it which really made it stand out! It was also filling I couldn't even finish My salad! Over all 10/10 and heads up the bathroom is gender neutral

If I could give this place zero stars I would, one star is too many. This establishment is definitely not family friendly, upon arrival the girl working was wearing a shirt that was completely see through, to the point where I could not only see the outline of her nipples but the full coloration as well. It bothered me so much so that I had to ask if such attire is acceptable to which she replied by accusing me of hitting on her. I've never been so embarrassed. I do not/will not recommend this shop to anyone and I will forsure stay far away from this business. She should be ashamed of herself.

The space is very nice and open. We went on a day where they had a party and it was in a separated space but still open. There's a play area for the kids and it's nice. There's the climbing/slide space, a seesaw thing, some kind of old carnival ride piece that the kids can open and get into (my girl's favorite space), video games on part of one wall. We sat outside to eat. The food was ok. 

I really like being able to go and sit and grab a drink while the kids play.

Delicious breakfast ! Get here early or the line will be out the door. The bread is perfect w a slight crunch and soft middle.
Enjoyed avocado toast w poached egg. 
Also their iced and hot coffees are excellent!

Highly recommend !

I've had this pizza at work more times than I can count. Reliably mediocre at best.  They are open later than most of the dining establishments in the area which is a perk. The benefit-to-carb ratio clearly see-saws flat in one direction.

This place has become mediocre at best. I cannot comment on the restaurant as we did delivery but the food did arrive hot. The chicken Alfredo had almost no sauce and the chicken was so dry we couldn't even eat half of it. The grilled pork chop had good flavor but the sauce was flavorless and the risotto was dry and over cooked. This used to be a great place on a Saturday night but now it just feels and taste like Italian "fast food." Sad really.

Tried on a whim and was fabulous! The Gorgonzola pizza was amazing. We had the lamb shank and fillet with mushroom sauce. Both were great. Kids love playing in the playroom. Wait staff was nice and helpful, manager was around to check on food/service. The only thing out of place for all this fabulous food and service was the decor. It was very "food court"ish. I almost didn't stay when we walked in, but something smelled amazing. You would expect a more private seating set up like chili's or red lobster. But whatever, the food was awesome and I don't care. I will be back!

This place is a great casual breakfast spot. You order at the counter and they bring your meal to the patio tables (outdoor seating only due to COVID-19). Their avocado toast is fantastic with cucumbers, feta cheese, and poached egg. I also got a fresh loaf of their pistachio and sour cherry bread, which is fantastic and we're still enjoying. I would definitely return here when in Santa Barbara.

I wish I had a 6th star to give to this place.

The scones were light and moist yet hearty and the cinnamon roll was made of some of the most delicate pastry that was in no way too buttery. We had a scone sandwich with bacon, vine ripened tomato and herbs that would satisfy anyone's need for something savory and solid.

Only downside was the coffee. It was fine but not up to the same standard
How in the hell do you run out of fish during lent!!!!!  Won't work with me for a meatless option. Usually a great place, not this time

Stopped in to Copper Vine on a whim our first night visiting NOLA and was incredibly happily surprised! Everything was absolutely perfect! Drinks were on-point, all food was fresh and delicious, service was excellent! We will absolutely be visiting again while we're here this week and would highly recommend to anyone visiting NOLA!

Small ice cream shop, had to wait in a small line but it moved quick enough with the friendly and efficient staff. Lots of flavors to choose from in a variety of cones or bowls. Mix and match your flavors and try a couple! I went with the salted caramel in a waffle cone. It was soft and smooth and delicious! The waffle cone was crisp and flavorful.

The saleslady sold my daughter dry rotted point ballet shoes. I spent nearly 200 bucks in the store that day! My 16 year old daughter was beyond excited to finally be en point and over the moon for her FIRST pair of point shoes.  Only to be told they were dry rotted, sample shoes that were mishapen and certainly not NEW. They are unusable! Spent another 200 bucks on another pair from a different store today!  
Is getting rid of inventory so important that you would manipulate and lie to an eager 16-year-old girl ? Just to make a hundred some odd dollar sale?
Dr. Dianne Surovcik 
Dmarino@mscorp.us.com

I've come here before but truly enjoyed Adrianna Girl of the Month 2018!! She was quick, pleasant and made sure we had everything we needed! Last time we had to wait quite a while and she truly redeemed that! 

We will be back, Love the mules and food!!

This place is huge and has plenty of parking so that if you make a purchase, you won't have to haul it very far.  This was my first time visit, so after entering the spacious lobby/checkout area, I chose to go to the right to check out the "Decorator Mall" side of the place.  Here was a variety of knick knacks, wall hangings, and seasonal items to add a bit of style or flair to your home.  The aisles were clear, but I did need to say "excuse me" to get around clusters of shoppers who tend to forget anyone else is browsing.

The other side of the place (even larger) is the Antique Mall.  This was a little less organized, but manageable.  Here were more collectibles and antiques than I saw on the other side.  Some of the stuff made me scratch my head why it was there (an empty Sun King can for $3?), but other items looked like the type of stuff you could pick up for your collections.  Lots of dishware, books and music sources, and quite a bit of nostalgia items that I remember (mid 20th century items), but not in the best of condition were noticed.

Plan to allow yourself plenty of time to browse since just the walking will take you awhile even without stopping to snoop.

Review #1958
Beat ice cream I've had in a very long time. All homemade. Waffle cone was delicious.

This is a fabulous auto body shop: efficient, honest, fairly priced, well-run. Their quote for a minor bumper/reflector light repair was literally half what I'd been quoted at a disorganized, untidy competitor. The work was beautifully done (better than my car looked before the ding) and on time. Chris was terrific and updated me during the repair. The front office staff was professional, friendly, and helpful. Five stars all the way!
Not impressed.  Veal very salty. Slow lunch service. Probably not a spot to return to.

Had lunch here for the 3rd time yesterday and highly recommend the experience.  It is a perfect place for a quiet business lunch.  Very comfortable seating, and great, unobtrusive service.  And for me, the food has to be great & interesting, and Green Pheasant scores highly here too.  I have had the Karaage (Japanese fried chicken) each time.  It melts in your mouth, and even though it looks like chicken nuggets, the flavor is tremendous.  I recommend eating it while still hot, as it just tastes better before it cools.  I have also had the gyoza, yakisoba, and tuna tartare.  All were very good.  Small plates is the way I like to eat, and this place fits nicely into that ability to try different things, and not get too full at mid-day.  I need to get here for dinner next.
One of the best ice cream shops I've been to. I tried the red velvet with a waffle cone. It had real chunks of cake in it. Simply delicious!

Fantastic service and great food. I was very impressed by this place. Ordered the Impossible Burger and Brussels spouts. Even tho I've had the Impossible Burger before? This was by far the best. Served with grilled onions and seasoned well. No way a meat eater could tell the difference. The sprouts were so yummy. And the wine was top notch. Definitely recommend!

My bf took me here for Valentine's Day and wow, he did good!! We sat at the sushi bar and watched all the yummy sushi being sent out . Eventually decided on the old city roll (the one that everyone gets). It has rock shrimp on top of the roll, which was very pretty and tasted good, but nothing special. Next we got the dragon roll, which was by far my favorite!! It was bursting with flavor and we ended up getting a second dragon roll at the end of the night! We also did the spicy salmon and eel avocado, which I'm happy about. Overall, service was super fast!! We ordered 4 rolls and it came out in what felt like less than 5 minutes! And then we ordered one more roll and that was in front of us in about 2 minutes. Incredible. I also loved the ambiance- very intimately lit and makes for a very cute date spot!

I reserved a table for a Saturday night dinner for a bachelorette group. When I made the reservation I asked about vegan options because I didn't see anything on the menu. The person who took the reservation assured me there were vegan menu items so I assumed the menu online was outdated or didn't have all items listed.

When we arrived at the restaurant, I was disappointed that our vaccine cards weren't checked- there was no request for anything like that. We waited for a few minutes in a lounge area near the bathroom before being seated, and were seated pretty quickly after that. We placed drink orders and then a lot of time went by while we waited to order appetizers. I eventually had to get up to ask someone if we could place an appetizer order. 

When ordering dinner, I asked about the vegan options. The only menu item that is vegan as-is was a bowl of olives. Our server said there were no vegan options. I asked her if she could check with the kitchen because the person that took the reservation was very reassuring about vegan items. She came back and said they could do a vegetable plate with "what we have in house." When I asked, she said it was carrots and green beans. I asked if there were possibly grains or beans in addition to the veggies? Nope. Just two veggies apparently. I let her know how disappointed I was she was defensive and not apologetic or kind about it at all. I would have expected more from a restaurant that has a chef in-house, especially when it was not busy in the restaurant, and because I had called ahead. 

I ended up getting a salad without bacon and cheese (of course it is the same price without those ingredients - hello vegan tax!) and having some fries left over from our appetizers. It reminded me of the early 2000s when fries and a side salad were the only meat-free items I could order at most restaurants. 

The best part of my meal (aside from spending time with my friends!) was two wonderful glasses of wine. The food and especially the service was so underwhelming. I have previously really enjoyed sitting outside on the patio with my wine, but I just don't think I'll be back after this.

As soon as you walk into this place the smell of chocolate will hit you. It smells so good! If you like fresh chocolate, this is your place! They also have a nice selection of other candy. The jelly bean wall caught my mom's attention right away. She got a huge bag of it with different flavors. I got a piece of m&m bark. My sister got a piece of the Oreo bark. We also got 12 pieces of chocolate. I can't remember the name of them but some had carmel inside and some had milk chocolate. The next time I come here I will definitely get a chocolate covered pretzel.

Abby is an absolutely amazing acupuncturist.. She understands the body on all levels; physical, mental, spiritual, and emotional.  Ive never felt like someone understood me  so well on all aspects of my being.
Her background in movement arts shines through in her effective helpful hints on stretches and exercises for musculoskeletal problems. Without even needing to say everything that is wrong, Abby's sharp diagnostic skills gets to the root of your issues, and I walked away every time feeling lighter, more balanced, focused and rejuvenated.  
In addition to acupuncture, her herbal medicine skills are far superior than any I have experienced before. I loved using her herbal prescriptions throughout the week, while looking forward to the next acupuncture treatment, and felt like they were highly effective for things from anxiety/tension to headaches and insomnia.
Its too bad for me she decided to move south to Los Gatos, but I will definitely stop by any chance I get. Los Gatos is lucky to have her!

This place is definitely good!! The aesthetic and vibe here are on-point. Bar is super cool, drinks are good, happy hour is cheap. We got a bunch of apps and some happy hour wine and it was good. However- service is definitely subpar. This place has the venue and menu to earn a 5-star rating, but the bartender and servers and short, a bit sassy, and not very helpful! 

Bottom line: almost everything is great- except the $20 cheese/meat board. We received *literally* two pieces of cheese. I asked about it and the bartender awkwardly pawned me off to another employee who didn't know what to say, so they just named the meats and cheeses placed on the board to add in some filler words. They give you a small portion of meat and legit two slices of cheese and then throw on a bunch of random leftovers from the kitchen. They definitely make a big profit from these cheapo boards- beware!

I am giving this restaurant an excellent rating: because of our exceptional  meal service.  Solely: in our opinion because of our waiter:  Colyn, who
was attentive, in his close attention to details.  Gave us information about the menu, that in all these years, was our best dinner at RM Grill.  He made it very clear.  Our food was excellent!  He was so impressive and is one of they're main assets. Very sharp.....   {We did miss the fire roaring in the fireplace and the pizza oven burning away, which truly adds to the atmosphere of the whole dynamic.}  However, truly understand the possible financial overhead dilemma for restaurants going through all in the past couple of years.   We were looking for the G. Manager Torre'. Anyone know what happened to him?

One of my husbands favorite places in the world. It's like Disney to him.  I get bored after about 10 min. If there is a book I want I just order it on line. We were in today killing time and I thought at least I can get a Trinta Black Iced Tea at Starbucks. Well that got shut down...they don't take starbucks cards or use the app since they are part of the book store. Insert sad bored face!! I also don't care for the new layout.
Sharkys use to be a great bar, horrible service and they treat military guys horrible.
Amazing food , amazing ambiance, and amazing service! Our server John did a great job and made our experience that much better.

Perfect environment/ atmosphere!!!! Very quaint & a relaxed atmosphere!!!! Be sure to ask for J P on your visit... very informative & very well knowledgeable of the menu items/selection! They even offer complimentary popcorn w/ 4 different seasonings!!!! The Shrimp Grits WILL NOT DISAPPOINT!!!!

This is usually my go-to restaurant, but EVERYTHING was off today. Two different tap beers were skunked and finally found an ok pour with a Lite. A Gay Street Lemonade was super sweet and not its normal taste. Ordered edamame and it came already shelled with no seasoning on it - it's always been in the pod before with sea salt. Finally, our mahi tacos and the seared ahi tacos were crazy dry (over cooked) and tasteless. I got extra wasabi and sauce but it didn't help. I'm not sure why, but something was really off today. I hope to see a big improvement in the future!!!!!

Love love love this place on a beautiful sunny day! The atmosphere is everything! Whether you're sitting on the patio or on the balcony you'll have a great view! I've come here for brunch, lunch, random times just for drinks and I'm never disappointed! This is always somewhere I recommend when people ask me where they should go to grab a bite when it's nice weather outside. Copper vine is a staple for the city!
Amazing service and great food! We had Angela as our server, and she was fantastic and gave great recommendations. Will be back for sure!

Stopped by for brunch on a nice sunny day.  Order several raw ouster which were delicious.  N my gf had a bloody Mary with shrimp and she said that was on point.  We both had a pasta dish which was delicious.  The bartender was helpful and service was right. I don't have anything bad to say about my visit.

The Mothers Day Brunch was simply fantastic!!  I enjoyed the Bottomless Mimosas, which I highly recommend!  It's served with champagne in a glass w/orange juice on the side so you can mix your own perfect blend.
