They give you a half scoop of rice like your being rationed and the soups were horrific, so thick, salty, with no vegetables to speak off.  the Egg flower soup had no egg in it, and a Bright yellow color like they use food coloring!
Twin Peaks is your typical guys bar, way above Hooters, and on par with tilted kilt.  The thing that puts it over the top is the ICE cold beer served at 29 degrees.

This animal hospital is so caring and compassionate to people and their kiddos.  Dr Tanya Thies has been my vet for 15+ years, and I know if something is wrong she'll know just what to do....I trust her with  my 15 year old dog and he loves her. The start are very and accommodating. Would recommend highly!!

If you guys close at 11 on a weekend.  Maybe you should change the hours on here to the correct ones.  Got there at 11:30pm and she tells me there no longer taking orders. But then turns around and takes another cars order.  Will be calling a manager in the morning Bc they didn't answer my call tonight.

I've been addicted to shopping at these stores as of late. I really enjoy browsing their tea and makeup sections. I've found so awesome name brand stuff rather cheap. They aren't the most organized of these stores and perhaps not the cleanest so it's definitely not my preferred store. However I do like coming in to browse and kill time. Masks required and social distancing markers throughout the store. Barriers installed between the registers and they call the register number when they are ready for the next person for checking out. They do wipe down the counter and card machine before the next guest.

We had a large group of 11 people, so we were able to try almost everything on the menu, and I would definitely eat it all again. Some standouts: sunomono, broccolini, curry udon, tebasaki gyoza (so crispy!!), ikinari steak. Everything was so flavorful and we were all so pleased with everything by the end of our meal. Leave room for dessert! It's definitely worth it! And on top of a delicious meal, the restaurant is gorgeous!

Update: 

Finally got around to visiting for brunch a few weeks ago and it did not disappoint. We were able to sit in their cute courtyard and enjoy the nice weather. All staff were masked and the tables were decently spaced out. 

The brunch options were most pleasing; it was a little hard to choose. We decided to start with the jump lump crab deviled eggs which were light and a great way to open the meal. The crab was fresh and it was a great twist on a classic favorite. For our meals, I settled on the Apple Fritter French Toast and my friend got the Cochon De Lait Benny. 

That french toast? *chef's kiss*. The bread was thick and held up really well against the caramelized fruit and syrup. The pecans offered a nice crunch that broke up some of the richness of the dish. If you're into more sweet/dessert-style brunch options, get this! I wish I could have eaten more but I didn't want to overstuff myself. The Benny was equally as delicious. I loved that their take on it with using a grit cake instead of an English muffin or biscuit. The pork was tender and flavorful and the greens were rather tasty for a restaurant. 

Our service was awesome! Our server, Justin, took really great care of us. If you're ever in his section, please show him some love!

Got the smoked wings, they were delicious...the "blazing" sauce definitely needs to be amped up a lot, couldn't even get my eyes watering.
McKinzie at the bar was terrific.
Great patio, wine and food! Will for sure be back to try more dishes on this amazing menu. Happy hour 3:00-6:00 and a dog friendly patio with great service!

LOVE that the old Maylie's space has a restaurant that is as beautiful as it was... OK Maylie's (which closed in the 80s was kind of run down but it was still beautiful and that wisteria vine was gorgeous in the spring). Definitely a 5 star space especially considering the last incarnation that was here.

My review is for the brunch menu only. The menu was interesting and had some variety to it. The winner was the dutch baby pancake... that lemon curd was to die for. Even my friend who isn't into sweet breakfast was swayed. One friend had the crab cakes which she said were good but was raving about the duck fat potatoes underneath. The other friend had the couchon and grits. And I had the smoked salmon and egg. So here's the thing each of our dishes had a poached egg and none of the eggs were poached properly. All the yolks were set and for one of us the yolk was set but the white was somehow undercooked. It was weird. 

For my salmon dish, it was tasty and the salmon was well cooked and not overly salty, but the hollandaise (of which there was maybe a tablespoon) was only on the egg, when the salmon could have used the moisture. I think the dish could be excellent with a bit better plating and egg cookage. 

Our drinks were tasty (mimosas and an old fashioned). And they were offering a Veuve special which we did not participate in. One of my friends has been to their happy hour and said it was great but they don't have any information on that on their website. 

Service brings this above a 3 since our server was hustling especially after the restaurant filled up by midday. They've only been open since September so I hope they find their footing.
We had the Banana pudding and Berry and cornbread ice cream, these were awesome! Cool place to sit and people watch.

I'm sure the bartender is selling drugs. She does not want to get you a beer. I think her name is Lisa she drives a black Jetta. The only reason I know that is I saw her seller selling drugs in the parking lot across the street. Avoid this place unless you want drugs.
Service was not the best for the price of the tab, but a pretty interesting place to go to! The inside looks amazing

We needed a quick bite before meeting up with friends, and Helena was walking distance from our Waterman Hotel.  My Americano was a great pick me up, hot and smooth.  I got the biscuit with lavender jam and butter.  The butter and jam taste a bit sour and unfortunately the biscuit was cold and dry. I did not know this til we were eating it down at the beach.  

But - the life saver was definitely the breakfast sandwich in a soft brioche bun.  It has the thickest and fluffiest baked egg in the middle with 
a big slice of bacon. It was simply delicious! They also had a other pastries and sandwiches we wanted to try however just not enough time to come back with our friends' weekend destination wedding.  But to our happy surprise the newly bride and groom catered from Helena for our weekend farewell brunch. We got to try everything else and more!  The chicken sandwich, the Elvis style banana bread, the avocado toast, and the cinnamon roll. The cinnamon rolls was bit thick and dense, but everything else was delicious! Whoa, a breakfast at Helen's will keep your stomach very happy for sure!

Got the Chase Freedom Card after I saw Kara's review. $200 back if you sign up thru Bankrate.com. Only a hundred thu Chase's site.  1% back on all purchases 5% back on gas or groceries or whatever the category is for that month. The card is very easy to use and manage. A mobile app to keep on top of balances, friendly customer service, just very pleased so far.  No annual fee. I pay off my card at the end of the month so I don't keep tabs in interest rates but I'm guessing they are high.
Amazing. Wow! Soooo goood. If you are downtown you must stop by. They have a wide selection of sweets but the ice cream is some of the best. They have a great selection.

The hotel is nice. The staff very friendly and helpful. The rooms are a bit small I don't care for the yellow huge from the paint on the walls and the yellow light bulbs. I preferred a white light. The room was clean the breakfast was good nothing over the top. I do recommend more options for people who don't eat pork. My only problem was the bathroom had old dead mats killed everywhere from the wall to the ceiling. No one clean that and the tub look a little suspect.

We've been a month away but the crew remembered us (haha we are hard to forget). I asked our waitress why the crowds were small with pandemic lifted. The food is great, prices in line, staff is exceptional (that crack got me a free bowl of soup!!!). She didn't know. She was thinking the same thing. Within minutes 20 people walked in the place. 

It's obviously not a secret. We all know it's huddled in with barnes and noble but I never see them jammed to capacity. Thank you. I hate to wait and this has been our best experience in Italian since coming to north Nevada!
06/01

They never reached out to my grandmother while she was in an assisted living home even as she turned 100! Then when she died they fun raised off her passing. She and her twin sister were both generous donors. Unfortunately the plaque they put up misidentifies one of their gifts. No one seemed interested in getting it corrected. They have a large art show annually that's a big fundraiser. They once had a very nice cantor. Need to do a much better job on outreach and community support and involvement and focus less on fundraising and being insular. That's my 2 cents. Be Loving.

Loud, over-priced, very slow service make for a lousy dining experience especially when there are two better options within a couple of blocks. If you want trendy with people looking down at their phones this is the place for you. If not, Tomo and Kisso are a much better experience.
Worst coffee I've ever had for a price $2.50 higher than the almost adjacent Starbucks. A passable but overpriced omelet though.

Unreal and incredible food. We did 4 apps and the skirt steak along with the yakisoba. Flavor in everything was perfect. I wished we weren't in a hotel for the week and we could have taken left overs! 
Highly recommend.

Very good environment . Amazing place to relax while getting your nails done. I definitely recommend this place . There's no pressure on you no rushing everyone takes their time on you and make sure that your having the best experience
Only place in Tucson to rent a Harley from and was not disappointed! Took care of us and even set us up with a great deal. Bikes were in great shape and had no issues. Highly recommend this place.

Came here for brunch w 5 others. We weren't tended to right away which was kind of annoying bc it seemed like there were several people down there that could've helped us but anyway we were eventually seated upstairs which we didn't mind. Our server Chance was probably one of the best servers I've had. My friends did the bottomless mimosas and I swear their glasses were never empty at any point...

For food we started off w deviled eggs, Brussels sprouts, duck fat fries, and fried oysters w pork belly. No complaints with any of the appetizers we got. Everything was seasoned well and the garlic aioli the fries and Brussels sprouts come w...SO good. For my entree I got the fried duck and cornbread waffles omfg the duck was so juicy and a lil spicy. Loved that they blow torch the rosemary it comes w and the rosemary infused gravy was amazing as well.

Worst customer service.  They sent me on a wild goose chase between United, Customer Service, Client Services, and Recovery.  I wasted my time for 5 days with over 100 calls due to disconnects without them ever calling me back to pick up where we left off.  Nobody picks up the number (800-432-3117) listed on the support page that hangs up without any message or option to leave one.  

To make matters worse, they insist on asking for my social security number in public settings even when I request they ask each digit in a non-consecutive order in order to protect me from identify theft.  However, 5 supervisors refused this simple request to write down 9 digits and then type it into their system by saying they can only hear the number in consecutive order.  Unlike other financial institutions who verify my identify through the phone number that I'm calling from and my voice, Chase is behind the times.

What kind of customer service is this?  None!  That's why I'll never use Chase cards again!
For a bakery they didn't have any baked goods!  This was our first time eating out since Covid and it was a big disappointment

They are still open and fully stocked during this pandemic! :) Stopped by on a Saturday mid-day and they had everything. The lady who helped me at the counter was very friendly. She informed me what pastries just came out fresh. (Their egg tarts are very popular by the way.)

Other times that I've come here, they've sold out on the pork scallion roll. I was so glad to see they actually had some when I stopped by!! Finally got to taste it and I was not disappointed. The bread is so soft and tasty. It has the light taste of pork and scallion. I honestly expected a little more scallion to be in it, but it still tasted delicious. For those not familiar with this kind of roll, forewarning to those who don't like mayonnaise: it has a mayonnaise-like spread inside. I personally think it enhances the roll.

I also tried their roast pork bun for the first time. Do not miss out on this if you like roast pork !! This is a great combination of sweet and salty. The bun itself has the sweet topping and it's filled with the roast pork inside. I regret not buying more than one, especially because it's so affordable. :(

If you're looking for some cheap and delicious asian pastries, definitely stop by here and check out what they have. I'll have to try their desserts next!

Reno location-- poor ...It's not the food, it's the service and management.  Last time I went there on July 10, 2021, I walked in at 3:30pm -there was no hostess, just one female waiter. The place had two customers. The rest of the place empty like 50 open tables--yet she informed me it would be a 45 minute wait!! What? She said "we are understaffed and one of the chefs just quit!"   Ok I said then put a closed sign on the door and reopen when you get your S... together!  For a well known chain, this is just horrible management!
The coffee and pastries are excellent. The staff is friendly. The location is very clean. Great decor. The only down side is parking is limited in the area.

The best breakfast in Santa Barbara. The bacon is perfect, the breakfast sandwiches were gourmet with carefully crafted ingredients that explode in your mouth. The biscuits are enormous with homemade lavender jam. We came for breakfast two days in a row because it was so good! The staff was so friendly and helpful.

Will never take my pets there again.  They did not follow instructions when told to groom a Husky who was a little matted on her belly.  My husband told them they could shave her belly ONLY if they HAD to.  When I picked her up they had TOTALLY shaved my dog except for her head and tail.  It was the middle of November  and she looked like a monster from a medieval movie!  I was furious and my pet was scarred for a long time.
Good homemade  ice cream.  You can really taste the natural flavors. Blueberry cheese cake was very good. All in all, great ice cream!

The hostess greeted us warmly, but the waiter treated us so cold that he completely ruined the dinner. When we ask him questioned about the rolls, he answered with unmistakable contempt, very short and quick answer, no smile, aloof. We were shocked. We won't come back.

I do not understand the 5 star reviews. We really wanted to love this place. The restaurant is beautiful and the concept is admirable. However the food is very disappointing. 
We started with shishito peppers which turned out to be the best of what we had tonight. Good but not so great I would return just for that. We had the tuna tartar which had a decent flavor but was warm and chopped up so much that one would wonder if they were trying to hide that they were using poor quality tuna. Imagine room temperature cat food on top of warm rice cake. The whole thing did not work. 
Then to the entree. The steak was good but salty. The spicy crab pasta which is their signature dish came out cold and way after the steak. When we told the waiter it was cool, we were told it was because the noodle was rinsed and would never be piping hot. I'm sorry but a bit warmer than cold doesn't cut it. This was also very salty and I was told it was because I asked for spicy and they added chili sauce. Really?  The chef does not know how to make things spicier without making it so salty you can't eat?  So to save time and by this point my husband had already finished his steak so I asked for some plain hot noodles to be added. 
They brought some dumplings while waiting which was a nice touch but please don't bother ordering. They are less than tasty. 

Finally the noodles came out and they added garlic butter which made the plain pasta salty again. JAPANESE FOOD DOES NOT HAVE TO BE SALTY. 
By now we were ready to get out of this pretentious place. The bill came out and they had charged us 14 for the noodles. So they charged 26 for salty lukewarm entree that was not edible as it was, then charged 14 more for what I had hoped to be warm plain noodles. So basically we were asked to pay 40 for a mediocre dish. We complained and they took it off the bill but that should have never happened. 

My prediction is that the place would not survive if they do not improve the quality of their food. You cannot survive on looks and cool vibe alone.

Heat came on every 15 minutes with a load roar making it impossible to sleep. More annoying was standing in line to check in, behind couple with so many questions regarding directions. Ordinarily this would be fine, but we stood there as apparently new, concierge/hostess was being observed or trained by a supervisor looking over her shoulder. My hands were full with bags and coats so I eventually sat down on a divan while my wife remained in line. What a waste of our time. Supervisor could have been checking us in. Trainee's supervision should not have trumped my check in. Let them supervise and train on their time; not mine. Otherwise the place was clean and new. But they really need do work on that loud heating system. At about 3:00 in the morning we turned heat off and huddled closely. Choosing sleep over warmth. And there were no extra blankets. It all made for an irritating experience.

Absolutely amazing. The service was great. Every server we had was so friendly. The wine was delicious. The French shallot soup was out of this world, and the best I have ever had. I got the mushroom pasta with shrimp, the small portion was perfect. I have 0 complaints. We even made reservations for the wrong night and didn't realize till the last minute. We called and they managed to work us in. I was in town visiting a friend, but when I am back I will definitely be coming again. My friends I'm visiting will definitely be returning.

What an awesome store for dudes! My man does not like shopping, and frankly, didn't even want to go in here, but once in, he found a number of things he really liked. This is like a finely curated museum of quality manly goods. And certainly, high quality items you aren't going to find in just any ol' store. Lots of hipster stuff, sure, but also stuff for my executive board room fella. He loved the crisp jeans and a number of the shirt lines, as well as some of the Italian shoes. Bravo, J.D.

I can't believe what a truly terrible experience this was all the way around. I am still reeling over the awful brunch my fiance and I has this afternoon. The fish dish was entirely flavorless, "charcuterie" salad was basically uncooked bacon that was slimy and cold and the deviled eggs were so bad, I ended up coming home and making my own. To make matters worse, the place was crawling with bachelorette parties which totally crunched the vibe and when the manager did come by and basically made me explain why I wasn't eating the salad, he didn't even bother to apologize. Instead he said "oh, you don't like MY pork?!"... I was blown away after having that experience discussing it, he didn't even bother to take it off the bill or bring over a glass of champs to apologize, as it was flowing down the gullets (for $20 bottomless) of everyone in the joint. Extremely overpriced for the less-than-flavorful experience and wouldnt come back after that. Oh yeah, and the waiter tipped himself 20%, which is typically what I would tip except sort of presumtive considering we went without waters or drinks for long lulls and watched a beer sit at the bar for over ten minutes. So watch the tab process. Or take my word and just don't go. There's too many other good restaurants in New Orleana.

This place was amazing!! The ambiance was amazing. We sat at the bar because we didn't have reservations. The craw fish beignet were top tier and so filling. The chicken sandwich was probably one of the best we have ever had. Also enjoyed the mushroom pasta. The bartender was amazing.

Yummy yummy in my tummy. Bibimbap so delicious, give me more chances to eat these dishes. Veggie, tofu, chicken or beef; dang these bowls good beyond belief. The veggie pancake is worth a taste, get over there and try it, make haste.

We were all in the mood for good seafood and Doc Magrogan's did not let us down!

We ordered the calamari, New England chowder, and fresh Oysters for appetizers. The chowder was one of the best I've tasted- ranking among those tried in Boston. As for the main course, we ordered the lobster roll with fries and Oyster Po Boy with fries. Both were delicious! 

The service was great. Also, the atmosphere was very relaxing in the outside seating and we were able to enjoy the food in beautiful weather. 

The only downside would be the dessert. They only had various mousses to offer. I was hoping for other dessert items other than mousses.

It has reopened.  Parking is a problem many times. 
No weight scale in the front area of the store.
We had an wonderful lunch outing today. This Denny's location always has great service, their facility is clean, and the food is always cooked to perfection.

Have been in the store and called on multiple occasions. I always find someone that is willing to help and point out helpful features I just would not have thought about as a first time mom! (To be). They have been so helpful helping me pick things that will compliment the room and look good together, from design of where to put things in the room to paint color and shades for the wall and rocker fabric. Mac has been great as well as multiple other associates. Highly recommend.
The manager Emilio cut us off after 1 beer. Stay away from this place. Food was decent, but told us we could only order 1 beer.  Terrible place to stop after a Pacer game.

Great concept but needs some work for sure. 
1) The menu is insanely expensive. Our sandwiches were pretty basic and came with zero sides--on average, a sandwich costs $15. I should have just ordered off the kids menu which at least includes fries. 

2) Tables by the play area are only high tops. This means the chairs are too high for small children to comfortably and safely sit. Babies in high chairs look absurd as they are so low compared to the adults and thus don't have any table surface for eating. 

3) Service needs help. The waitress wasn't familiar with the menu and then messed up my order. 

4) Play area is pretty cool. Definitely much better for walking kids who need less supervision. 

All in all, it's promising. I won't be running back but it's better than nothing. The space is large so I hope they come up with creative events,
revisit the menu, and rethink some of the table choices.

Is there anything not to love about a margarita truck? Their margs are incredibly smooth, like the perfect melted adult slushee. And their tequila is good quality, you don't overly taste it but you definitely feel it melt the long day away. I got the half and half of lemon lime & peach, I loved the details of the rim being half and half too - you get bonus points for that one. 10 out of 10 - would recommend.
Service and atmosphere are great but the food was awful! We ordered several cold/hot options and all left hungry and disappointed. Definitely not worth the price!
Nailed it. Great breakfast spot and super cute. I loved our visit here. Everything was taste. I want to come back again and try the other things on the menu.

Met my cousin here tonight for dinner. We got seated and waited on right away, we started with a glass of wine, she had Cabernet and I had a pinot gregio. I ordered the lasagna and my cousin had the pepperloin with salad and baked potato. Of course the pepperloin was cooked to perfection.  She said the Caeser salad was good.  My lasagna was really good, it was a huge piece, ended up taking some home for lunch tomorrow, great flavor lots of meat/Italian sausage throughout, and we were served bread and butter with our meal also.  For years the food at Tony's has always been top notch and this meal was no exception. Of course I'll be back.
Very quick and fast installation when I replaced locks on my new house. Would definitiley recommend.
Great Sunday Brunch with the best service! Our waiter was attentive and the food was delicious.
I yelped a lot of places to visit in Nashville and definitely enjoyed going to Mike's delicious ice cream please check them out when you in town

I love its atmosphere! It was stylish. I had a cup of ice moca and one chocolate croissant, which were delicious! I sat near the outside, but it was nice temperature, so I could focus on my task. I wanna try different dish next time. One thing I wanna demand is I wanna it to clean the desks up because crumb of left tends to be left them.

My complaint drew a wonderful, gracious response from the general manager.  A good apology and a willingness to correct the problem means a lot. Everyone has a bad night. Thanks for being attentive to this customer.

A jewel of a cafe and bakery we found on our last day. Definitely seemed popular with the locals which we try to find whenever we travel. The morning bun was tasty and crispy and the coffee was good. Neat space too.

We stopped in after a day of shopping and our bar tender chance was amazing. He went above and beyond with recommendations about food and wine. He was such a sweetheart. He truly made our day and we hope he does amazing in nursing school. I cannot recommend this establishment more. Such An a amazing time! Chance was just the best!!!!

This is how my experience went..... first I order my drink which took 30 minutes to come, by the time the waitress showed to take my order I had been sitting for almost an hour. It took an additional hour for the food to come, by the time it did I had finished my drink leaving me nothing to have with my meal because it took an additional hour for my second drink to come. By the time my second drink arrived my meal had gotten cold because I was too thirsty to have finished it and was waiting on my second drink to arrive. The only thing that came at a decent time was my check. If you have a lot of time to waste sitting around this is the place for you.

Do not use this company.  I had a perfect payment history with them, a 804 credit score, and had used only $5k of my $30k limit, then out of the blue they raised my interest rate to 22%, from 14%.  What gives?  I closed the account and forced Chase to settle for payment of the principal, no interest on the account - but it took a year to do it.

Had a fantastic experience with TKO this weekend. Chris, our DJ, was so professional and had the dance floor packed. A little bit of drama with the hall was quickly taken care of and Chris never stopped smiling. Great and will recommend in the future. Thanks Chris

overpriced mediocre food and rude mediocre service. we waited 50 minutes for one of our dishes while the other was delivered after 20 because it was forgotten (had to ask waiter twice). would not go back.

This is my favorite place to go! Besides having GREAT beer (my favorite being the dandelion beer), this brewery is so welcoming and cozy! My husband and I bring our son with us every visit because there is a fun, educational sensory room that he loves to explore in. He also loves the chalkboard! We as a family, are so thankful for this brewery in our community! I wish I could rate it 10 stars !!! If you love beer, GO! If you love good people, STAY!

Very cute aesthetic and spaced out tables inside. Cute little patio we didn't sit out on because of incoming rain. Very good happy hour deals. Got a wine flight and beer flight for good price and found one of my new favorite beers! Lavender spritz was really good as was the rose sangria! We were told the debris fries had been recently added to the menu and they should definitely stay because YUM!!! Loved the brussel sprouts, def a big portion to share. Flatbread was nothing special but I really want to go back for a dinner because if the apps were any indication, dinner will be just as good. My waiter was so helpful helping me pick out the drinks I wanted to try

Good enough to go back twice in one trip. 
Sampled the Nutter butter, Tennessee Fudge, Three Berry Sorbet, Chocolate Peanut Butter Cup, and a couple more. 

Ended up going with the Tennessee Fudge and the Chocolate Peanut Butter Cup, but all of them were delicious! I would have been satisfied with any of those flavors!

This place is HORRIBLE. It is so sad how downhill they've gone. The food is not fresh at all, I have no idea how they can call themselves gourmet and the employees do not care that they are giving you a half filled sandwich with week old chicken salad. The kale salad could be sitting there for three days and they would still serve it. The breakfast wraps are served cold and with a microwaved egg. All of the ingredients in the salad bar are not fresh. I am scared to order any of the meat because it looks so suspicious. I don't know how they get away with serving the food that they do and it's unfortunate because the food used to be great, but now I always feel sick after eating here.

I've been on a search for a good, under $20, pasta option for a little while. Bar One isn't it.

     Let's start with what it is, though. Can you go have a beer with your friends, and watch a little of the game? Yes, you definitely can. Do they have a beer list which comparable to other crafty, Philly spots? Yes, definitely. Is it crazy expensive, or crazy crowded? Nope...it's ostensibly a neighborhood bar.

     By no stretch of the imagination is it an Italian restaurant. Frankly, I'm not sure why Bar One even bothers to pretend it is such...perhaps the neighborhood, or proximity to the market...but at any rate, fine Italian cuisine it is not. Excited to try a new spot, stopped in on a brisk Friday in November and, ordered the cavatelli with Gorgonzola sauce and sausage. The most notable issue was that there was no sausage. Strike one. I could not identify the flavor of Gorgonzola in the pale grey sauce either. Let it be know that I love blue cheese, and a little goes a long way with said ingredient; it's a strong flavor. This, however, tasted more like a bland rue. The pasta itself was stuck together in clumps, which made me wonder how it was prepared...pasta doesn't do that in a sauté pan.  It was thoroughly underwhelming. 

    It's also worth mentioning the staff...or at least one bartender.  My gent was fine. He seemed to have a little trouble getting around, but was courteous enough, and managed my order with no issues. There was another, much ruder, gent who spent the evening - or at least the time that I was there - trying to recruit customers into belittling the other bartender (the one serving me). "Can you believe he has a degree in music?!?!...in MUSIC?", he asked me with his absurd Thomas Shelby haircut and manicured beard. "Who does that?!?", he continued in his effort to impress himself. I absolutely did not take the bait; nor did most of the other customers, in what I can only expect was everyone trying to extend common kindness to a man just trying to do his job. 

     Let's have a reality check here. 1. Publicly belittling others lacks both character and professionalism. Full stop. 2. I have a degree in music, and what has been (so far, thanks be to God) a lasting & rewarding career in the Arts. So, what was meant only as unnecessary posturing between staff members, deeply offended your clientele. I chose not to engage the argument, because that is in no way what I'm looking for in a dinning experience...an argument with an arrogant, yet poorly-informed bartender. The phrase "service industry" springs to mind...SERVICE...since we like to repeat ourselves. In conclusion, the food was edible but not good; yet it was the utter pretension of Mr. Shelby which will ensure that I will neither spend another singular dollar, nor recommend Bar One to any of my friends or readers. #Service

Trying to satisfy that perfect level of garlicky and just the right consistency white pizza craving... just when i thought I might strike out, I struck gold.  The only problem is it's the perfect size to eat it all...

Today I was on the phone for 2 hrs. with the Credit Card Benefits Dept. and The Chase Ultimate Rewards Dept.  I kept being transferred back and forth, and even to 2 supervisors who couldn't answer my questions.  I am simply trying to get miles returned to my acct. due to illness.  Does not seem like a hard proposition...

Still unable to do it... tomorrow I will try again...

1st. time here for lunch, . The hostess & waitress was very good, I was seated in the area I asked for, waitress was on point. I got excited to see chicken & waffles on the menu so I ordered it. It came with 1 large waffle & 6 small chicken strips looked good, it went down hill from their, the chicken strips was a half chicken breast cut into small strips noooooo.. seasoning not even salt, the waffle outside was nice and brown & hot the inside was ice cold it is served with a to-go pack of syrup (McDonalds type) the cost is $10.00. sent it back & ordered something else. I have been waiting 15 minutes and the manger have not come to speak to me. I opted to order  the stuffed catfish... O my it's frozen fish or Swai not LA/ MS or no other fresh catfish it's awful. I'm out of here & will never return. I arrived @ 1:00 and the place have 3 other guest. Let that be a Red flag. Don't open a new restaurant and think the community will accept poor quality food.

Super cute bakery and breakfast spot in the funk town district of SB. They have a super open indoor area as well as a great patio area with outdoor seating. Their pastries all looked amazing but we went with the blueberry lemon scone (cinnamon roll was a close contender) to start and it was up there with the best scones I've ever had. There were actual blueberries inside and it was fluffy with a hard outside, 5/5. For our meals I got the yogurt bowl with blueberries and their homemade granola which I was a huge fan of! It was also a pretty hearty bowl so was filling. My friend got the avocado toast which was also delicious, fluffy bread with feta cheese and a good portion of avocado. Overall, great ambiance and loved all the food we tried!
Love Tony's!  Great food and service.  Love it!  Pepper loin is my favorite.  Great ceaser salad.  It's a family favorite for us.

Amazing service great bottomless options and THE FOOD omg so good.  Took a little while to have the food come out but the sangria and mimosas were great and everyone loved the food. And not an understatement the food was amazing definitely worth checking out

If you are in the market to outfit your truck this is the place to go they have the best products and the customer service is the best their installs are fast and perfect. They stand behind all their products. Dave and Kim will take excellent care of you and make sure you get everything you need

This place is always busy on Broadway. It is open late and has a large selection of ice cream. Mike's also serves hot chocolate and pretty good coffee. I had a latte with a gorgeous design. The latte was really good. This is the perfect place to get warm with a cup of joe in the cool months or get cool with ice cream in the warm months. The staff is super friendly and this is a great place to strike up a chat with out of towners.

Buffalo Mac!!! Need I say more? 

Okay... their other food is delicious too!

Beer is cold, atmosphere is pleasant and the staff are super nice!

Buffalo Mac with grilled chicken is the bomb!

Did I mention the Buffalo Mac???

The lines are super crazy long, all the time. The smoothie I got was really good but the men who made it didn't seem to be in a good mood. The line is out the door at all hours of the day so just a fair warning! The ice cream flavors are super eclectic and there's always something to choose from.
Beautiful space with great unique eats and coffee. Will definitely be back. The salad was fantastic. Beautiful, fresh coffee. Had a great chat with one of the staff members. Bravo.

If you're a tourist and spending the weekend in Santa Barbara, I'd recommend to give this place a go for sure. If you're a local, then not so much. This place falls under the bracket of expensive but great quality. We ordered an avocado toast, a salad bowl and mocha, all of which were pretty good but a tad too expensive for our liking. We still had a wonderful time primarily due to ample seating, great service and the ability to find a parking spot in close vicinity

This place has great sandwiches, specially their Italian.  Here is a quick tip if you decide to try out their italian sub, get it without the dressing, because it becomes a mess with it, I ask for mayo on mine but if you like your sandwich messy ignore my tip.  Now I want to talk about freshness, because this place has the freshest tasting lunch meats and cheeses I've ever had.  Their mozzarella is incredible.  Also try their pasta salads, they are excellent, my favorite is the macaroni salad.  As mentioned in earlier posts, the value in this place is almost unheard of.  Giant sandwiches for what I consider a very fair price.  Do yourself a favor, skip Subway or Quiznos or any other chain sandwich joint and try the real thing.  This place also has a full deli and they have some Italian groceries.  They also serve some classics like lasagna.

I had breakfast here, this morning and it was delicious. They have you so much food, I didn't eat all of it. 

Many selections to choose from and friendly employees. I chose scrambled eggs, fried fish and grits. 

I will definitely visit again.

This place is delicious in the way it taste and looks! The menu is always changing which is fun. I went with a group of girls and we ordered almost everything on the menu. This place is all tapas so if you are hungry and want to eat quickly you'll have to be patient. It's best when you can just enjoy the food slowly. There were moments that I tried something and I wanted to stop time- it was a burst of flavor in my mouth. My favorites are the tuna tartare and the lobster dumplings. Order a little at a time and see where the night takes you!

Great little coffee shop and added bonus - cats!  There's tasty treats too along with some neat cat accessories to look at (like local fleecy cat toys). New to the shop is cat yoga (Aug. 28 register through humane society) and retro video games on Wednesday's (4 - close). Great news that there's been a lot of adoptions lately so there's only a few in the shop right now. 
If you're thinking of adopting, they have a great room to interact with the cats. The place is like a giant cat play room. Including a huge castle, shelves for cats to climb on and even a cat sized hamster wheel. 
Owners are super friendly, as are staff. Willing to answer any questions you have about the shop, the cats (current and past) and the adoption process. Plus darn good coffee. I'm not in the area very often but glad I stopped by tonight.

We were not able to get in on a Saturday or Sunday... So I'm only giving the review based on the people in line, of which there were many. We will try it again when there's less crowded probably during the week. I love the setting and look forward to eating there sometime soon. The ambience is fantastic. Look forward to eating there next trip.

Food was all delivered at different times from appetizer, to entree, to desert. Steak was WAY over cooked, tiramisu was unlike anything I've ever eaten and just not good. In a city full of fantastic places to eat this one is over priced, under-good, and I would avoid it.

Kudos for being open in the snow. This is my second time here. I pass it by on my way home from work and frequently tell myself that getting takeout is not a good idea. I've only had the beef bibimbap and it leaves we very satisfied. The food is made fresh and full of flavor. I would like to try the japache next time. Craving some beef after shoveling my car. The owner is super friendly and it's so nice to have this place a block away from my house.

Went to have a nice dinner tables were crowded server mixed up sweet tea with unsweet my 32dollar redfish had sauce on potatoes not my fish was looking forward to a good place to eat on the westbank  guess I have to cross the river for a 150dollar meal
The scenery is just as amazing as the food!!  My sister and I enjoyed a glass of Sangiovese and a blend of Grenache/Syrah/ Mourvèdre

Having never been here before, my family decided to check this place out. We walked in at 7:15pm on a Thursday night and there were maybe 5 full tables in the whole place. After ordering we didn't get our food until 8:30. 
And between that the guy dropped off salads, and went away again. No words, no drink refills, nothing. 
After an hour and fifteen minutes of waiting for our food we finally got it. It was decent, but definitely not worth the wait. We then waited for him to come back and take our dessert order, which took another 30 minutes for "eh" dessert. But since it was my step grandma's b-day. her dessert was free, which was nice. 
During this 2 hour meal we were sitting on the worlds most uncomfortable chairs. Everyone's body ached after sitting in them for so long. 
Long story short, the wait is long. It's nice to linger when you're having dinner with family, but AFTER I eat! I was so hungry, and the wait was just terrible. There's no reason it should have taken so long on a quiet night. I'd hate to see it on the weekend!
Oh so yummy! This place is amazing! I highly recommend making reservations and sitting outside! Also, don't skip the starters they are amazing! The service, atmospheres, and food are all top notch!
Went with grandchildren last week and was so impressed with the renovations and additions, I purchased a Family membership!

Dealing with Chase credit card customer service is a horrible experience. I've dealt with customer service representatives, account supervisors, senior account supervisors, and credit bureau specialists. They all gave different advice on how to handle my problem. From not paying the bill, to overpaying the owed amount and waiting for a refund. Every time I called I had a lengthy conversation about what was going on, they do not listen or make notes on the account about what is going on. They promise call backs with voicemail, but do not call back.

4 stars only because I was only buying coffee today, but I'm sure I would give 5 if my experience was broader. What a cool place! The coffee was excellent, service was excellent. They also have salads, sandwiches, sweet treats, beer, wine. I wish I would have found this gem earlier!!

The grits were incredible, along with their tasty wine and beer. Have the pork chop for dinner! John was our waiter the first time we visited, and he was very attentive, friendly, and knowledgeable of different wines.

They a beautiful outdoor seating area, perfect for a couple looking for a nice dinner or brunch away from the fracas of the French Quarter.

This is my childhood target. Pretty solid place. Came back to town and visited and it was slightly messier and dingier than usual due to the Valentine's display right in the entrance. That said, this is still a target and has lots of schlock for sale.

The pizza is fine but their new app to order it is terrible. Apps are supposed to make things easy. Their new app makes it impossible to simply order a pizza. When I finally got to the order screen there were a total of four extra fees. No thanks.

Don't order delivery. They stated that the food would be delivered within the hour. After an hour of waiting, I called back and was told they were waiting on a driver. Don't promise something if you can't deliver on it.

I was surprised how all the new buildings popped up so fast. The newly decor had me giddy from the get start. I was wasn't sure where to start. I just stopped in to kill some time while waiting for our table next door at Nada. 
Definitely a cool spot for a meet up or luncheons. 
I couldn't stop thinking that I needed to try something. So, I decided to come back the next day to try a few of their pastries and ice coffee. 
Large Ice caramel latte gave me that booster kick. Had me wanting to run a marathon. 
Talking about a large chocolate chip cookie. This place sells a cookie larger then your average cookie. Strawberry cinnamon roll was a disappointment it was very dry and crumbled. Coconut macaroon was toasty good and rich. 
Don't forget parking garage 1 hour Free! Get your ticket validated.

I think I am a fan of Copper Vine. Our firm orders from local places daily, and I ordered the Wagyu Burger. It was pretty damn good. I think it would have been better if I had BBQ sauce, but that is my personal preference.

I have never been to the actual location, only ordered delivery; I will absolutely order again. I must have eaten the side before I could take a photo. the only thing I remember wondering was why there weren't fries as a side option. It could have just been the app, though

Three of us, all first-timers, came in here for Happy Hour, and we all agreed Copper Vine is a winner. It's classy without being snooty, fun without being so loud you can't hear across your table. Our server was friendly, knowledgeable, and not afraid to tell us his favorites.

We all took a different approach to drinking; I went with their happy hour flight of house white, rosé, and red, and liked them all. Another tasted two reds and chose the second. The beer drinker did a beer flight, which meant three 12-oz pours, instead of the five or six smaller servings I expected. 

When the beer drinker spotted the duck debris fries, he looked no further. I, on the other hand, agonized between several things before going for the crawfish grilled cheese sandwich on the advice of our server. I loved it! It oozed with cheddar and cream cheese, the crawfish, and tomatoes on perfectly toasted sourdough. The brussels sprouts ($2 upcharge from chips or salad) were delicious as well. My second and third choices, cochon de lait Cuban and Creole tomato sandwich, I'll leave for other visits!

While in town on Thanksgiving, we had underestimated the wait times at the casino buffets.  Around 6 PM on Thanksgiving Day driving down S. Virginia, we saw Macaroni Grill was open for business.  No wait and the restaurant was about 50% full.  Scored a table and ordered fried calamari, pizza, chicken marsala and several pastas.  Food was great but we did not receive the calamari appetizer.  Our waiter heard us mention this to another server and he jumped into action!  He found out another table was delivered the appetizer and they ate it!  By then, we were not as interested in the appetizer.  Our waiter took the appetizer off of our bill and then scored us two free desserts.  It was a cool gesture and really ended our dinner on an up note.   I had some hesitation in the past about going to a chain restaurant, but this really turned me around.

Copper Vine is a great place for date night or even just a fun night out with friends. Everyone had on a mask and there was great distance between tables. I went on a Saturday afternoon and sat at a high top table by the bar. We were supposed to have one server but they never came to our table so another waiter, Nick ended up taking our initial orders. The other person still hadn't come so Nick ended up being our waiter for the entire time. I've been to this place more than 5 times but Nick was by far the best waiter I've had here! We had about 4 different wines, all which were great, and price point wasn't bad either. I had the crawfish beignets and my bf had the banana foster rum cake that had just been added to the menu. He raved about this dessert for the next two days. Both were very very good and exceeded our expectations. All in all we will definitely be back and we hope to have Nick as our waiter.

Everyone can find a flavor here that they love. I chose Blueberry Cornbread. Go for it! I would never dream such s creation would be so delicious. 
If ice cream is not what you are after they have a selection of coffee as well. My Mike liked Mike's!

My wife and I went Saturday as it was highly suggested by friends of ours. The place was busy around 6:30 at night which was a great sign. The service was incredible. They were very quick and attentive. 
The food came out quick. Very good portions and incredibly prepared. The servers were quick to refill drinks and very on top of things. 
The Poutine "Canuck" was very good. As we were there more people were coming in. 

Highly recommend!!!!

I was excited to try the nutter butter ice cream and it was so good. The girls working tonight that helped us were friendly. The reviews about the place being dirty are totally legit. Dirty napkins all over the floor and spills just waiting for someone to slip. For the price of the ice cream they should make sure the dining area is presentable.
This is one of my favorite ice cream places in Nashville.  They have really good, quality food. Even though the restaurant was super gross, the ice cream partially made up for it.

Absolutely horrific first experience! DO NOT spend your money with this company! The processing time is 5-7 business days  AFTER they take your money! Placed my order 10/22/17, account debited 10/23/17, called about continued "Processing" time on 10/31/17 and spoke with a very cynical and unsympathetic representative who stated that there was an unexpected delay that they were aware of as of 10/29/17 with no intention to contact me until END of day 10/31/17! She also did not have information as to when I could expect to receive my order and mimicked my disbelief. This tells me that they clearly do not carry a stock and act as a very expensive third party importer! I will be filing a dispute with my bank and NEVER ordering from here again!

Me and my girlfriend came here for a romantic dinner and it was an okay experience.

Firstly, the server forgot to bring the soups out. I only got to ask where the soups were after she had placed the entrees down. She had mentioned to us that she was serving many tables. Maybe our server was in a bad mood or she was being overworked. However, my seating area was near the kitchen and I watched as servers either stood around or complained to each other. I got the vibe that no one working there wanted to be there or be bothered to give a good eating experience. 

Another example of the service was when I had asked the server if she could put my gift card code into the check. She said she would ask. After desert, when the check was given, she completely forgot to ask about the gift card. The matter was resolved but it does make me question if anyone working is paying attention. 

For the food, it was pretty tasty. The bread was good and I appreciated the olive oil and balsamic vinegar mix. For an appetizer, we ordered the caprese salad which was the nice ratio of tomato to mozzarella. For my entrée I ordered the Cafe Milano which was also yummy. The ingredients such as the mushrooms tasted fresh and the chicken was well seasoned. The tiramisu was really good  and I'd come back here only to eat that. 

I want to mention that you are paying for the ambience of the establishment. The food is marked up by a lot which I would not mind if it weren't for the sub par service and atmosphere as mentioned earlier. I do not recommend this place unless you are really craving an expensive tiramisu. If so, get it to-go.

Stopped in for a quick drink, got attitude from the hostess and it was anything but quick.  I had stayed at the Westin on a previous visit and had enjoyed the service.  Since I was in the area and on vacation I thought I would stop by, guess not...

Good place for drinks but not so much for food
I ordered the smoked and grilled wings the dry rub was over rubbed and the sauced was just not good 
I ordered the mini apple turnovers which were not cooked when they served them to me,
If you want a drink and watch sports great go there 
If you want to eat a decent dinner don't waste your time

Went to a wedding this past weekend. Terrible DJ skills. Requested a song twice never played it.  DJ could not keep a crowd going. Most of the songs played you couldn't dance to them. I wouldn't recommend.

This is the worst credit card my family has ever dealt with. It was the evening of the 24th, and I had forgotten to pay my husband's card. I ran over to the computer at 800pm and paid(it was a Thursday night). It said the payment wouldn't post till the next day. I figured, okay, there will be an interest charge but I don't want to tell my husband (and bother him to call in) that I paid late so I will just pay the fee. The next month when I went to pay I saw they tacked him with not only a 33 interest fee but a 30 late fee as well! All for paying a few hours late! I didn't want to bother my husband so I will just pay all the fees, plus the whole balance, and everything will be normal the next month. It wasn't! They tacked him with another 20 interest fee!! This time I had to bother him to call in about all this, so he called in, and they refused to refund the 20 fee!  I had something similar happen with my other card (a different company), I've called in, explained and they refunded the fee right then and there!! I tried to contact the CEO to just explain this all and see about getting some money back but he doesn't have an email or phone number posted, go figure!! He probably doesn't want to deal with upset people like me. I don't recommend this card to anyone!!
Don't be surprised by the clean service and keeping with all the current guidelines with face-masks and cleanliness. Brittany and Mattice have got it handled and are very professional!

My fav Bibimbap in the city! I never had bibimbap before coming to this place, and now I'm hooked. They don't have a lot of choices on the menu, but the items they do have will not disappoint. Never too busy, great food.

I, a customer of United Airlines Chase Credit Card, am obligated to pay yearly fee of $95. Among of other things, they promise to give me 2 United Club passes, which I was told I should receive 4-6 weeks after my card anniversary. 9 weeks after that I still did not have them. Called the customer service and told them that I will be travelling soon and wood like to have these passes before leaving. They said that they can not expedite shipping unless there is 30 days or less before my travel. 

    Called again couple of weeks later (3 weeks before traveling). They promised that with expedited shipping I will definitely receive the passes to be able to use during my trip.

     3 days before traveling - no passes and now there is no time to ship them in time here in US. I asked them to send to Japan, where I am going so that I would be able to use it at least on my way back. Talked to 3 associates, stayed on hold multiple times, 1.5 hour later (NO) results: 

 they can not ship passes to Japan,
 they will not compensate me for my wasted time and  inconvenience, nether for not delivering the product that I pay for (yearly fee) in any way: 
no extra passes, no extra miles, no waiving yearly fee. 
How is that of a service? Is this the way to treat your long time loyal customer? And really, in this time of virtual communications, there is no other way they can communicate one of their own clubs, so that they would allow a customer to use it? Appears the little piece of paper with some magic number is still holding the power, and is more important than decent customers service.

I just recently learned about this restaurant. It doesn't have grill like other hibachi restaurants have, but the food is delicious. I got steak, chicken, and shrimp, the only thing I don't like is you have order veggies separate coat $1.00 for each option. I got order of crab Rangoon (they were ok). The staff is friendly, lots of parking, and following CDC guidelines. Also the yuumyum sauce is ok, I've had better!

First off I have a Chase Southwest Airlines credit card that I've had for several years. I've had no problems with. I typically pay off the entire balance of the card each month I use it.  However, while booking a Southwest flight on the Southwest's website, a Chase offer for $200 off for opening a new account popped up. Since I had thought about opening a new account with better perks and taking advantage of the $200 off for the 4 tickets I need, I clicked on the link. I received a message that the link would not go through, I tried a few more times unsuccessfully. I went directly to Chase's website to apply and was immediately (within 2 seconds) approved, (yes Chase I have excellent credit that's why you immediately approved me). So I call Chase to see how now I can take advantage of their promotion. The first person I spoke with said the $200 is not offered on this card, but 40K points is after the first $1k of card usage. Frustrating, but ok I need the tickets, so how do I utilize the card to take advantage of the 40k points? She says you can use the digital wallet. I ask how do I do that, she says, "well some people get the digital wallet and some don't" OK how do I get it? I understand you cannot give me the entire card number, but surely someone can help me and why do some get the digital wallet and and others don't, can you send me the digital wallet. She says not I can't it's out of my control. I ask to speak to her supervisor. He is an absolute ahole. Says what the rep said is absolutely correct, that I should have clicked on the link, to what I said again the link did not work. Rep said some get a digital wallet others don't, again I ask for the digital wallet, he says I can't send it you will have to wait 10 days for the card. We went around and around a few minutes about the lack of connecting to the link provided on Southwest's website; and the digital wallet before he says there is not digital wallet!! What your rep said it, he said it and now no digital wallet? I explained I need the tickets to get family here for a funeral service. He says why didn't I use my other Southwest card? Huh! Because I wanted to use the promotional offer, an offer that is not exactly what it was promoted as at that! My Gawd!  Chase you make sure your promotional links work, better train your employees and the supervisor definitely needs some customer service skill training as well as how your credit card offers work. He apparently does not know since he kept  changing excuses of why he cannot help. He apathetically said well, there is nothing we can do, do you have any other questions for me. I hung up on him So basically I see it as Chase running a bait and switch with their promotions. I will be contacting the FTC, Federal Office of the Comptroller, Federal Reserve and any other regulating organization.  
UPDATE: I called the corporate office who sent me to the escalation department, who sent me back to Chase Credit card where I spoke to who I think was a manager named AJ. AJ was much more pleasant to speak to. He said he read the notes from my call to the two imbeciles and apologized, what the two failed to say is the digital wallet is Apple Pay or comparable on Android. Instead the imbeciles acted as though Chase sends an email with a digital wallet as in an online or temporary card. He provided me with my full card number but not the exp date or security code. Something the imbeciles did not do even after just like for AJ I provided my SS# (which I am uncomfortable doing) so they could access my account.  AJ said I should be able to get the Apple pay with only the card number. He was wrong about that, it can't be done.  I'm back to square one, but at least AJ knows how to communicate. 
Chase still needs to fix their links, stop with bait switch tactics and address their staff training particularly of those who are supposed to be customer service supervisors.

A bit of a miss. It started prior to visit with excessive text reminders of my reservation to then arrive and find the restaurant nearly empty, only 4 tables occupied. Greeting felt a little pretentious. Fortunately, the waiter was friendly and had good recommendations for sake and food. The walu dish was incredible, served sashimi style with bergamot ponzu and radish oroshi. Light and fresh! I followed that with a fan favorite, spicy crab noodles. This dish was also delicious. Surprisingly, the kinoko mushroom dish was a big disappointment. The broth gave the dish a dirty taste. I only took a few bites. The server that cleared my table saw the full dish and didn't show any concern that it wasn't eaten. I've had better dining experiences in Nashville.

It was very good! A classic  when you go to Nashville! It was very busy when we went and unfortunately we had a group of 13. We did snag a seat in the front. The service was great and so was the ice cream!

This is my second time coming to Twin Peaks Pretty cool place the waitress are very nice This place almost remind you was up at Hooters the food here is good first time I got some chicken tenders and shrimp and an on recent visit here I got the breakfast burger and a loaded tater tarts for a fire

This place is a little further from all the action of broadway but well worth the extra blocks. Small plates allow for multiple types of delicious food. Everything we ate was fantastic (Japanese waygu, pheasant gyoza, crab noodles, chicken wings, etc). And they have. Nice selection of alcoholic choices as well.

Amazing flavors!! We love unique places and we weren't disappointed. Service was great, he coursed everything out perfectly, yummy cocktails and delicious food made our last night in Nashville even more memorable. Highly recommend the spicy crab noodles, kinoko and the salmon.

This place is FANTASTIC.  I called them day of to make an appointment for my dog who had an eye infection and they took me right away.  The girl on the phone was very friendly and helpful, and when I got to the vet, everyone greeted us very warmly.  They were so kind and really loving towards my pup.  We were in and out of there quickly too.  I just moved here from California, and knowing that I have great people here to care for my dog is one less thing I have to worry about.  Thank you Indian Walk Vet!

First off let me say , thank you for being open ! The night was perfect from the warm bread to our great service. Alex our server greeted us the minute we walked in and made us feel welcome the whole time. This 5 star review is for the service , don't  get me wrong the food is very good but Alex went above and beyond . Thank you and we will be back .

A pretty space in the heart of downtown.  Food was interesting but did not blow me away. Service was excellent, and the Japanese whiskey drinks were great. Even with plentiful ordering of shared entrees and dessert, I found myself hungry soon after dinner. A return visit unlikely.

I love the interior space, it's super cute. I love the idea & the menu layout BUT ...NO GLUTEN FREE?!?!?!??? So confused.... you don't need to have 100% gluten contamination free offerings to cater to many many people who have less severe allergies. I am a celiac but I can eat something made in the same space as gluten.. I can eat fries from a frier that has had gluten in it with 0 problems. Many MANY people are the same. I cannot however of course eat bread or a biscuit etc made from wheat flour. I wish they catered to help us gluten intolerant out a bit more... just more GF options on the menu would help

Tonight was one of Bar One's opening night offering free apps, 10/21. It was crowded but that's expected when a bar is giving out free food. I was able to try their chicken and waffle, buffalo chicken pasta, lamb slider, and pork and Buffalo chicken spring rolls. They were all fabulous. The food is really amazing here. Think Bar food with a classy twist. They had live music (one guy with a guitar playing covers) which had a good vibe setting the mood all night. Their draught beer list comprises mainly of local craft brews. They had 4 big screen TVs showing the sports game. This is a new age neighborhood bar that I will definitely come back to. Definitely glad to see a new bar at this corner.

I think this may be the first Yelp review I've ever written but it needs to be said.  Went at 6:10 tonight and walking up to the door, it looked like it was closed.  Every chair in the building was already upside down on the tables and it was empty, but the sign on the door said open until 7pm on Sundays so we tried the door.  It was unlocked so we went in.  I ordered a salad and my wife ordered a wrap.  We went to get drinks and the only three LaCroix cans on the shelf were all dented and should be thrown out.  The restaurant was too dirty to eat there so we left to take it home.  We checked out for $28 for a wrap and a salad and then were hit with a $4 parking charge to get out of the garage after 15 minutes.  We tried this before they closed the first time and we've tried it again after it re-opened and we just don't see how they will stay open for long.  A place like this needs it's own parking lot to pick up carry out food and it needs to give the appearance it's open until it's time to close.  A good model would be Eatzi's in Dallas.  We wanted to give this a second shot but there won't be a third try. Very disappointing and over-priced.

Diane, what happens when you mix Julee Cruise with Hooters? Well, then you get Twin Peaks. I also heard that gum you like is going to come back in style. Sure, the Black Lodge didn't serve drinks in little girl-sized or man-sized, but we know Laura Palmer would have picked man-sized like we did. 

We'll see you again in 25 years.
Used Uber eats to deliver to our hotel. Service was timely and good food. Excellent shrimp and grits.

So I had the kushiyaki for lunch (pictured).  It was amazing.  The grilled mushroom, eggplant and avocado was very tasty, cooked just enough and was the perfect proportion.  

As for the sides, the miso soup was good as expected.  The kimchi was perfect.  Some spice and proportioned perfectly.  

The ambience and this place is really special. It is quite relaxing.  There is something artistic about the entire place, including the preparation.  I will visit this restaurant again.

It's nice to have the option to eat at an Asian restaurant in SoBro however the menu is limited. You can order from the Cold and Hot menu but there aren't a lot of choices on either one. The food is expensive and our dishes were bland. The food and drinks are expensive. The food arrived at our table without thought, so we received a hot dish at the same time that we received a cold dish. We stood at the bar another day and the hostess kept badgering our group to move even though the restaurant was empty at that time. She was fairly obnoxious. If a bar doesn't want patrons to stand it can provide more seats or extend the bar seating into the restaurant area. The restaurant makes more profit from its drinks than its food in any case. On the bright side, the commodes are wonderful and are like the commodes one finds in Japan. Perhaps patrons can imbibe there....
At Downtown Nashville. Long lines all day. Creamy ice cream! Try the dark chocolate waffle cone!

Just finished our dinner and heading home and had to write my review. I would never go to this restaurant again nor would advise anyone to go there. We were party of 5, our waiter was one Of the rudest cocky guy that you may have ever seen. He gave us attitude right from beginning. He never told us that our sides were extra that was separately charged he led us to believe that the salad was offered with the entree until we got our check and realized that it was extra. My husband had a question on a pasta dish and he was rude.  I asked for water and he takes my glass inside the kitchen (whatever for) and comes back with half glass of water. I wish I had caught his name so I could call the restaurant and tell them about our experience. The food was okay nothing special.

I really do not feel like a valued customer, after 8 hours on the phone and a refusal to change my ticket. My flight was purchased via Chase Reward powered by Expedia. 
According with DOT.GOV, the way this ticket was sold (hiding the actual carrier operating the flight) is illegal.  As per your convenience I already filed a complaint with the DOT, you are welcome!

Code sharing is fine, but selling a ticket on an airline and having it code shared with another, then code shared three times more, then subcontracted after the carrier went out of business without any way of me knowing it at the time of purchase is not. 

Which airline is operating your flight?
Sometimes when you book a ticket, the airline that you purchase the ticket from will not be the airline operating your flight. Airlines often partner with each other so that one airline markets a flight to consumers (displays a ticket price and sells a ticket) while another airline is responsible for operating the flight (flying you to your destination). When airlines engage in such an arrangement (code-sharing) they are required to clearly and prominently identify the airline that is operating the flight(s).  During the booking process, this information must be clearly and prominently displayed on the first screen that appears following a search for a specific itinerary. Airlines cannot provide code-share disclosures through roll-overs, pop-ups, and hyper-links. Airlines are also required to clearly and prominently identify code-share partners in all advertisements and on ticket confirmations following the purchase of air fare.

Ardmore Pizza is my old faithful. I have been ordering out food from here since I was old enough to pick up a phone and make a call. I consistently order the buffalo wings and some variation of their French fries. (pizza style, curly with bacon and whiz, etc) and I am seldom disappointed. This place has a decent cheesesteak and burger to boot. The pizza is very good, the pepperoni is always crisped perfectly and the price is right. I have rarely strayed from my "go-to" items so I can't speak for the rest of the menu but over the last 15 years, I haven't had many complaints.

I had the seafood salad, dressing was just ok and it was a bit bland.   My husband had the eggs lafitte from the brunch menu,  again it was just ok.   We ordered the mac- n-cheese which was boxed so $6 is too high.   Timothy was our waiter.   He kept forgetting creamer for coffee then took forever just for a 2nd cup.   He then automatically put on 20% gratuity.  The service wasn't good.   We used to work in restaurants so to have gratuity at 20% for a party of 3 adults and 2 toddlers was unnecessary.   It's very unlikely that we'll return.

Front desk, housekeeping, the ladies that prepare breakfast, everyone working here is wonderful 

The regular rate is a bit expensive. I stayed for about a week. 

Their gym is decent, about half the size of a regular room. They have an indoor pool, cucumber water, water fountain, and always available coffee/tea/hot chocolate station. Business center in the front, ample parking. Their laundry room has one washer and one dryer and is coin operated. $0.25. 

Their breakfast is just amazing. I love it. They have 2 kinds of Chobani yogurts, 3 different yoplaits, skim or fat free milk, 3 kinds of cereal. Apple juice, OJ, cranberry cocktail or water. 

Protein: either turkey sausage or pork sausage. Or one of the former and bacon. Cheese egg omelet or scrambled eggs, hot sauce, salsa, cheese. 

Breads: breakfast breads like pound cake cliches, English muffin, toast, bagels, cream cheese, peanut butter, jelly, honey. Waffle maker/syrup. 

Oatmeal and fixings. 2 kinds of fruit,hard boiled eggs, apples, oranges, bananas. 

Their housekeeping staff is working nonstop. I see them working all of the time! They do a good job of maintaining rooms. They always make it a point to stop by rooms to clean and will leave a note under your door, if you have your privacy door thing on.
Amazing. The service was great. The food was spectacular. We tried about 5 plates and the brownie dessert. Everything was delicious.

One of the best sushi places in Philly especially in terms of the freshness of the fish that they serve. They also have very authentic tasting pickled veggies as a  side to the sushi dish. The service was just as great

Located right on Broadway, Mike's is an easy stop mid honky tonk hopping to satisfy your sweet cravings. You may just bump into one the many celebrities who frequent this spot when they're in town too! 

The place is darling and has an old school, fountain shop vibe. It's on the smaller side so if you see a seat, grab it fast!

Lines can be long, but they move quickly so be ready! 

A standout, must try flavor is definitely blackberry cornbread! I mean, where else would you try such a thing but in Tennessee?! I see they make this with a variety of other berries as well! Cool!

It is such an awesome option for food and to not have to leave the rink. I'm always skeptical of "rink food", but this place smashed it!  We had a kale salad, burger, quesadilla, and kids chicken tenders. All tasted phenomenal. Great service and great pricing also!
delicious! came on new year's day and they were very busy but the food was outstanding, friendly staff and great atmosphere.

After seeing and tasting Bier brews on various local tap menus, we visited their 65th street brewery/tap room on a brew bus tour, located about 10 minutes from Broad Ripple.

The tap room has a fun, relaxed vibe and their chalkboard menu is always filled with fun and detailed art (check out their Instagram page to see!).  The tap room is dog friendly and you can bring in your own food as well! (During the day, and until 6pm, try Moveable Feast right next door!)

Lately we've been going every Wednesday for trivia night, when they incidentally also offer $4 pints of all of their beers. They also host some other game nights during the week as well.  Their brewing awards speak for themselves and they have a solid selection and variety of beers for all tastes.
Very friendly helpful service.  Installed locks on two of our box trucks.  Affordable service.

I ordered the beef and meatball pho & two egg rolls. 
The broth for the pho has lovely hints of anise that perfume the noodles. It is balanced, not too salty, not too sweet, not too unctuous. They had the usual condiments (sriracha, hoisin, maggi) available at the counter if one wanted as well. 

The egg rolls were good, mushroom and pork flavored I believe. My only complaint would be that I wish they had nuoc cham instead of spicy mayo to dip the egg rolls in.

Great service and great location. I love the outdoor patio area on a nice summers day. My husband and I enjoyed the Rose sangria since the beer taps where down, and my husband raved about the grilled cheese and tomato soup for the rest of the day. My prosciutto flatbread was also excellent and we couldn't have picked a better place for a quick lunch during work.
A must when visiting NOLA. I love this place- love the food and the wine (it's on tap and so cool to get a flight of whatever you want). The service is amazing and so is the atmosphere/decor.

Steak was superb.. never a problem with food. It's always delicious, but tonite, our service sucked! Young man with a man bun was polite but we had to beg for refills and when he finally did not bring the second glass of wine I told him to forget it. You know the service is bad when your waiter apologizes all evening. TONY, please do something!

Cat cafes! It's all the rage. I have no pets and thought it would be a cute way to spend an hour! You pay for the time you spend in the cat lounge (up to 2 hours) and the price includes a coffee (or hot beverage). The cafe area is a large and inviting space you would hang out whether there were cats or not. There is a viewing window into the lounge so you can watch what's happening in the cat cafe and view the pics of the cats in the lounge before you go in. They also keep count of how many cats they have re-homed and they were up to 31 cats.

The owners were both there when I went in and they clearly have a passion for great coffee and rehoming cats! If coffee isn't your bag - they sell Cally's Teas and three spacial blends they made just for them.

The cat lounge itself is clean and well arranged with a few chairs and loads of nooks for snoozing cats, a castle climbing frame and loads of shelves for cats to climb and hide out. One cat, Homer, was particularly friendly and came out of a corner to strut around the room and get in on some of the action from cat lovers in the room. There is also a member of staff in there helping find cats and tell you a bit about them and their personality. It's really well organised. I'm looking forward to going back.

Eating here was by far one of the best dining experiences I've ever had. I knew that the minds behind Two Ten Jack next creation would be even more incredible. The food was truly magical. It was really hard to keep from ordering more and more food.

Visiting from out of town and noticed this restaurant as I was walking around. Thought I would enjoy, but I thought wrong. Terrible and unfriendly waitress. She took my drink order and never came back. She walked past my table to check on other guests but never acknowledged me. I had to ask another waiter to get her attention and she still never came back to take my food order. Terrible customer service. I believe if my skin color was different then I would have received better service.

Talk about curb appeal! We had walked passed this place before and had put it on our foodie list. Next day, we came for brunch. My only regret is that we had not gone sooner on our earlier trips to NOLA! Instagram dream to say the least. Presentation is very easily overlooked many times but not at Copper Vine and the flavor profiles were just as good. We had a wonderful spread of Tomato Basil soup, Beet salad, Crab Cake Benedict, Brussels Sprouts and Biscuits! The Beet salad is a must. Shout out to John S for keeping the vibe more enjoyable and relaxed!

This is such a great concept for a cafe. All cats are up for adoption through the Humane Society. They hold events there as well such as cat yoga and birthday parties. Follow their Facebook page for more information on the current cats they have there. Also there is pictures and profiles of each cat at the cafe. Great for all ages animal lovers. So many amazing treats and drinks with cute cat names to make it that much more fun! The staff is super friendly and accommodating. The set up is so amazing with a cat castle for you and the cats to enjoy!
