Wonderful atmosphere, social distancing in use. Great food. Had the cheese stuffed raviolis with butternut squash topping. Friends loved there cheesecake deserts. Our waitress Tina was fabulous!
This place has really good food. You gotta try it. Will definitely be coming back. Hibachi chicken and steak was delicious

This was our first visit and we were extremely impressed. I had deviled eggs that were to die for and my entree was pasta with wild mushrooms which I added shrimp to. It's small so definitely reservations but highly recommend
The best pizza place on the main line. They do a great job with my allergies every time I order. Highly recommend.

I locked myself out of my room which had all my study material and everything I needed for my two finals tomorrow. I was freaking out and found AM&PM's number and they were so friendly and came pretty quickly! Shay was super nice and unlocked my door (which was really hard to do because I have some weird type of lock and it was installed upside down). So grateful for their efficient service! I'd definitely recommend them. :)

Don't come here if you're in a hurry. Obviously the waitresses are not hired for their speed or their waitressing abilities. Food was average,  typical bar food. There were 12 of us celebrating a bachelor party and the waitress totally screwed up the bill and it took a half hour to get it straightened out and get our bills paid.  I ordered a glass of white Zinfandel and twice the waitress came by to say they're working on it and 20 minutes later she finally came by and said they couldn't find it. LOL not sure what that meant.
Clean, nice atmosphere, great service and excellent food and cocktails.  I've never been disappointed.

I want to make sure everyone knows just how good and accommodating the service was here first and foremost and not to take attention away from how great the food was.  We made reservations for 8:30 and our table was a little behind so we headed to the bar for a pre dinner cocktail.  Sake on tap is pretty cool and in my opinion a great drink to order before and with dinner here.  My date had forgotten her id....on her bday...and after she returned the bartender bought her a drink.  Didn't have to just did it out of kindness and made sure to get it to our table.  Thank you Mike!  The hostesses at the door kept us informed and were very polite when our table became ready.  Our seat was in one of the crushed velvet booths and was comfortable and could easily sit 4 just as comfortably to share all of our dishes with.  The food is served tapas style and arrives quickly to your table.  Our server was well informed about the menu and all employees were eager to share personal menu favorites as well as popular patron choices.  The okonomiyaki, spicy crab noodle and ikinari steak was our favorites out of the 4 plates we ordered and plenty for 2 people.  The fourth dish was the tebasaki gyoza not my style but was still very flavorful and with a crispy outer crunch.  I was surprised at the check expecting it to be more for a night out but was very affordable for a beginning of a fun date night!  We are excited to go back and try everything on the menu and I would love to come back for the lunch menu.  

A few tips:
1. Don't eat all day before you go,  you will want the extra room!
2. Everything is unique and delicious don't be afraid to explore!
3. The miso butter on the steak is very good,  we mixed it into the hot      plate with everything but next time might try it on the side for dipping.  It wasn't bad but I think we overpowered the other flavors with all the butter.
4. Repeat, don't eat before you go!
5. Bonus Ascend is right across the street.

Tasty food with fast, friendly service.  I tried the french toast for the first time this morning and it is no doubt THE BEST french toast I've ever had.  The deli salads are fresh and yummy.  How do they make the veggie sandwich so delicious???  The gluten free muffins with almond milk latte are a part of my daily ritual.  Its a classic, traditional bakery but you can get healthy, veggie & gluten free options if you ask for them.
So good! Quick service and good value for the price you pay. $6 for a huge sundae would get you a small scoop of ice cream at any of the other ice cream places in the area.

Small, lowkey place to get a good Korean meal for a reasonable price. Very clean place as well. With so many unhealthy/cheesesteak options around on South Street, we really appreciated all the veggies and the kind staff!

This may be my new favorite place in the world!!  I got invited to the Christmas tree lighting event last night.  My biggest concern for craft Hall was that it is kid friendly.  My pure genius Craft Hall moment was when I saw the indoor playground for the kids was away from the general population.  Pure genius!!  Craft Hall has something for everyone.  Indoor playground, church pews, fire door tables, bar stools, thick leather chairs in the living room area and a wall of past presidents portraits and stories.  Almost forgot that patrons can watch the Craft Hall bakers make fresh bread and rolls.  Bonus viewing, the brewers are hard at work in their space right next to the bakers.  The food looked amazing.  Last night having another beer instead of the Tuna Melt seemed liked a good idea.  I have serious Tuna Melt remorse this morning.  Craft Hall is my new favorite place in the world.
I bought a tiny little cinnamon bun for $5, and I think that is a little bit pricy for a local to have to pay. I'm sure the food cost to make  that item was not more than 70 cents.

Hi, I'd like literally everything in this store. 

Seriously, if I had some serious cash in the bank, I'd purchase nearly every item in this store...if the size would fit my small body type. 

Honestly, this place is exactly what I'd like my apartment to look like. Woodsy, rustic, with a touch of urban. It appeals to the eyes, but even more the other senses, especially smell. The smells inside the store and the other products are my type of body products, spot on.

The biggest concern about the store is the price tag on most items. But, look at the quality and where it comes from and you can reason the price tag for a nice "treat yourself" moment every now and then. 

I particularly loved looking through the tons and tons of items throughout the store - body products, cologne, hair and beard grooming, clothes, shoes, bikes and gear, and the list goes on and on. 

If you're in the area, make the trip and give it a shot. They have a nice "Sales" section too if you don't want to break the bank on some of the other expensive items. Even if you're not in the area, stop on over. You won't regret it!

Ice cream joint in downtown Nashville!

They have an array of flavors from Chocolate Chip Cookie Dough, to Banana Chip, to Maple Blondie Walnut, & much more.  They also serve a variety of hot chocolates from around the world which were cool, especially for a chilly, rainy day.

They are very generous with the scoops of ice cream!  For a small, I got like 3 scoops!

Nutter Butter:  Sweet & creamy, thick chunks of cookie.
Generous portions, ordered a double and should've stuck with a single.  Blackberry cornbread was delicious.

Yummy! With all the rage these days about fro-yo and specialty ice cream flavors, it was refreshing to go to a good old ice cream shop where no one worries about fat content and goes for the real stuff. I had the nutter butter, which had chunks of the cookie and I loved it! Not too sweet, perfectly balanced and so delicious. Pair with sugar cone, for sure. The superhero was a fave among my group as well, with it's bright colors, who could resist? Everything about this place is comforting, nostalgic and delicious. We sat inside because it was snowing outside in March, no joke. But that didn't keep us from enjoying some ice cream. Great treat!

I have 3 credit cards with Chase and have been a customer since 2011. I have never had a late payment and have never had a single credit limit increase in 5 years!!!! I have well over a 700 credit score and thought it was more than reasonable to ask for a credit line increase (cli). So, I emailed customer service -since there is not a automated online system to request a cli - and my Amazon credit card was increased within a few days. The other two credit cards were denied weeks later. Their explanation was I had 'too many credit inquiries and newly opened accounts within the last 2 years'. At this point I'm shocked...I have credit cards with almost every other credit company (Capital One, Citi, Discover, Barclays, TD Bank, Bank of America, and Amex), and not one of them denied me for that reason if they denied me at all. 

So, I think there must be a mistake. See, in addition to there not being an automated cli system, each request is a HARD HIT on your credit report. So, not only did they deny me a cli on a 5 year old account -with no balance- but they also added three new inquiries which negatively affects my credit score for 6 months and remains on my report for 2 years. 

I was surprised, insulted, and dumbfounded. So, I emailed them back and nicely explained that this was very unfair. To not only add hard hits to my credit report but then reject me, for a harmless cli. They then said they would review everything again and I was hopeful. Well lo and behold, I get a email and letter stating they refuse to give me a cli on either card...Even after I asked for a second time.

The food was good, portions generous enough to take some home.  My father, lady and I all enjoyed the Italian club, and were satisfied by the quality.  No fault of the restaurant, but there was a large strand of the meat that I can only describe as a large vein-like rubbery piece, that strung through the last half of my sandwich that made me quite nauseated and unable to finish. The other two were perfect, but I'm not so sure I can stomach another Italian sandwich for some time.

I'm a fan of Macaroni Grill.  I frequented it more in my pre-Yelp days, mainly because I once had a credit card that would give me points and I would trade all of my points in on restaurant gift cards.  Conveniently located on South McCarran and South Virginia, there is plenty of parking.

My "go to" dish is Shrimp Portofino: sautéed jumbo shrimp, capellini, spinach, mushrooms, garlic, pine nuts, lemon butter  It is actually quite good and the bread that they serve is really good.  The service here is great - people are very friendly and they will keep loaves and loaves of bread coming if you ask.

I usually eat during the "off hours".  I eat dinner pretty early if it's going to be a large meal, so I have encountered the restaurant when there were a few patrons, but not when it was overly crowded.

Tip:  Regarding the Steak & Greens salad: 5 oz. sliced sirloin, baby kale, spinach, radicchio, arugula, crispy prosciutto, gorgonzola, crispy onions, balsamic herb dressing.  The balsamic herb dressing can be overbearing, I usually order it on the side.

Good chain type restaurant that modernizes and brings up the economy in Reno!
Nice place for breakfast, good variety of food. One thing which was a bit strange - cutleries were not properly washed, I tried several before I found a clean one.

Banking is what you make of it. I have been a Chase card customer since 1989. It has evolved from a free Visa to a fee bearing Sapphire preferred. I have been a Chase customer from 1988. I was a personal banker with Chase 3 years ago. Now, I am a businessman with business accounts and Chase business credit cards.

This morning I called regarding a late fee of $39.00. I had transferred the full amount of the statement. However, the due date was Sunday, 8/05/12. The transfer happened on 8/06/12. I called and was promptly refunded the late fee. Efficient, quick and easy.

I thought that this would be THE place to go for ice cream in Nashville until I went to Jeni's (see my review).  But, Jeni's is not on the main "strip" and Mike's is, so if you are in City Center and want ice cream, Mike's is the place to go.  

A lot of homemade flavors, and you can even get old-fashioned egg creams!

The store can get crowded, but the wait is worth it.

We had the fried chicken biscuit with jalapeno jelly, which was fantastic.  The jelly packed a nice kick to complement the chicken and biscuit. Also, the peppered bacon was thick and flavorful. The BLT was excellent with a great piece of break. Finally, the french toast was good and sweet. If you want to control the sweetness, just ask for the syrup on the side.

AMAZING!!!! Everything is so cheap! I got the egg tart, neapolitan, and "cupcake." The place smelled bit weird when i came in, but that was fine since i wasnt planning on staying there to eat. Neapolitan is perfect combo of sweet and crispy. It's not crazy sweet like others with icing on top. The cream in between is also not that sweet, tastes bit like whipped cream, but the pie is AMAZING. The "cupcake " is like spongy soft angel/pound cake which is what i was expecting. Egg tart EXCEEDED my expectations the crust was to DIE for and it actually tasted like an egg tart not a tart with yellow cream in middle!!! COMPLETELY recommend this place
Staff is always very friend and the food is AMAZING!  Great prices and large selection!  Fun theme nights, trivia, games, perfect for the whole family!  Highly recommend!

Before I start with the compliments, I have to say one thing... Y'all have to get locks or vacant signs for the bathroom doors. I love the unisex idea but I would like to use the bathroom without a fear (which came true...) of someone walking in. Let's do better. (This was September 13, 2018. Hopefully, they've updated since.)

Besides that annoyance, everything was great! The food was delicious. The decor was gorgeous!  The staff was accommodating​ and friendly.  I was there on a busy night and my drink order was lost in the shuffle but it was understandable and the problem was taken care of promptly.  I would definitely go back!

My friend spotted this place from the road and we were intrigued. We love hibachi and the idea of getting it quickly to go was enough for us to give it a shot. The prices here are great and the quantities are huge which is perfect because hibachi is awesome reheated. I had the chicken hibachi and I added zucchini and onion. The veggies were soooo good! Everything was honestly perfect. If this place was closer to where I live I guarantee I'd be a regular but even so I will definitely make the trip back up here for this. Their ginger sauce is delicious and I also really loved the cabbage that comes with the meal. The whole meal only took 7 minutes to wait on! I wish I could prep a meal this good at home that fast haha. Overall I am impressed and this is a great spot for a meal after shopping at Costco or castleton mall!

It's rare to have a perfect experience at even the best restaurants but that exactly what we had last night.  Service was effective. The restaurant was comfortable and interesting.  The food was outstanding.  Lobster shomai was so memorable.  The wagyu beef was perfectly cooked and presented and the spicy crab noodles were equally great.  We are from Atlanta so can't get back anytime soon but we will be there again at some point.  It's worth the trip!

More like 3.5 stars but because of good service I'm upgrading. Went in for dinner and ordered the Japanese pickles and Chirashi.
While the pickles were ok, I was disappointed with the quality of fish. Some small and bigger cut pieces to start off, but the moon fish was really chewy and I had to tell them about it.
They offered to redo the entire dish only to come back with the same issues. Sounds like the chef doesn't care that some fish cuts shouldn't be served like this.
Anyways, for dessert I had their tempura chocolate cake: rich, sweet and not too oily, so it was quite good.
Overall not impressed.

What a lovely place! We had the cauliflower which was great! The waitress appeared to working on her own so at the beginning was a bit standoffish but she settled down after a while. The chicken and waffle was great!

Was good, a little hyped up though. I got avocado toast that I probably could've made at home. The muffin and biscuit were INCREDIBLE though. coffee was great, thanks to frothy monkey. Would go back, but have had better.
Had a great lunch with the girls at the bar today. (Brittany and Mattice) The pot roast was excellent too.

Store has ok merchandise but the return policy is awful.  Girls working the counter seem to be more interested in FB and IG than helping customers.  I tried to return two hats without a receipt (after Christmas, wrong size) and was told no receipt, no return.  Took the lady's lip and showed up the next day with my receipt to only get store credit (because that's all they offer).  

I used the store credit to buy a shirt and some kids clothes so I wouldn't have to go back and I won't go back until they improve on their customer service and change the return policy.  

The return policy is and I quote, NO returns after 30 days, NO returns/exchanges without a receipt, NO CASH BACK, and you have to take the attitude that goes along with it all while the cashier updates their FB status.   

The no cash back part is a big sticking point, stand behind what you sell and don't hold your customers hostage by only giving store credit.

Very good food but SMALL portions.  Like...really really small.   The seating is also very uncomfortable- both outdoor & indoor are cheap metal chairs.   
They've got a good thing going in the kitchen but the portions should be doubled... then I'd give 5 stars.

I received a surprise this morning when I found that I had an $85 fee charge for a card that I didn't know had a fee attached. I don't remember when I applied for the card although I must have applied for it somewhere along the way since I had the card in my possession. When I called to inquire about the fee, the agent admitted that the $85 charge was probably "buried somewhere in the small print of the agreement." Then he told me that since my fee was due tomorrow, I would have to pay the fee even though I was calling to cancel the account. I call that a number 1, Grade A rip off. I will never stay at another Marriott owned or affiliated hotel or motel. Marriott AND the Marriott affiliated card with Chase JP Morgan Bank just lost a customer forever. I am guessing I was lured into applying for the card through some slick promotion. The fact that the agent admitted that the fee would have been hidden in the fine print is beyond the pale. Can you tell that I am peeved about this? Because I am. I just kissed $85 goodbye and got 0 value from it.

Always have to find and try ic cream wherever we go. Today we tried Mike's. The place has coffee drinks of all descriptions and a huge selection of homemade ice cream flavors. I tried a sample of the blackberry cornbread ice cream - I may go back for that - but got a scoop of the white chocolate banana pudding flavor. It was delicious!  Mike's was a good choice for a mid-afternoon treat!

I usually love this place. The wings are fantastic and the beer is super cold. We visited after not being here for months.  The service was horrible.  Actually sat down and was not even recognized for 20 minutes before us flagging down a server.  She said she would help us even though this wasn't her area.  Every drink,  napkin, water and request required us to flag down another server.  Manager came over after requested, but did nothing.  Won't go back.

Went on a Monday night and the waitresses were all beautiful. I had a peaks sampler and all the food was good. My waitress was named Deena and she was great. Told me about the local beers on tap and happily got me samples of them. The Old Fashion I had as desert was outstanding. Served with an ice ball and made to perfection. Highly recommend this Twin Peaks.

Food is awesome and probably one of my favorite places but for some reason they are open to 2am on weekends but refuse to serve food past 11pm? Doesn't make any sense so if u get off work at 11 don't bother trying to get food on your way home
The website even says last call for food is 1am! But they wouldn't let us order bc it was past 11

I have been dropping off packages at this location for years and have never had one problem. They are always fast, efficient and friendly! This location is also very convenient. What makes this so easy is having an account and printing out labels from home and just walking in and dropping off. Even if there is a line, you just set your package down and leave. This was extremely useful during the holidays. You can also buy packing materials too! I appreciate the quick in and out along with friendly service!

Mike's is easily my favorite Ice Cream shop in Nashville.  It has only one serious problem.  IT'S DOWNTOWN.  No reasonably sane person would come downtown just to visit it.

Nutter Butter Ice Cream? Yes Please.  Peanut Butter Cup Ice Cream? Even Better? A large selection of the Ice Creams are hand made on site and you can taste the difference.

I guess ultimately its a benefit to my waistline that I can only come here on rare occasions with family or friends when I am downtown.

If you pass by, be sure to stop in!
Bad service, pastry old and cold. Rude employees. Order was delayed and no communication with cashier and kitchen

This place was excellent. I'm not usually a huge fan of small plates, but the portions were reasonable for the price and quality. Everything was absolutely scrumptious. The atmosphere and service were top notch. It's a great place to go with a small group. 

I highly recommend the lobster shumai and filet mignon with miso butter. Yum!!!

The Castleton area is rather lackluster in terms of bars, nightlife, and places to hang out and grab some drinks with friends. So when my friends decided to go out for a pint before an event on Friday, Twin Peaks seemed like the best (and only) choice. I'm not a huge fan of "titty restaurants" like this to be honest because I hate that an establishment's theme is around women wearing revealing clothes as they wait on you. It seems rather sexist. But, that's just me being a prude. I'm also not a big sports bar person, as I find all of the TVs to be rather distracting for good conversation over dinner. But, Twin Peaks wasn't that terrible.

Our waitress was very friendly (and not just for the sake of garnering more tips). She legitimately seemed like a nice gal. She wasn't quite knowledgeable on all items on the menu though. Even if your serving at a place that's not a 5-star restaurant, you should still be able to recommend a few things off the menu if you can for the benefit of your customers. She also was a little slow to get to and from our table with our drinks, which I found odd since we were seated right by where the waitresses request drinks of their bartenders.

As for the drinks, VERY sweet. I ordered some kind of boozy lemonade off their drink specials menu, and it was mostly simple syrup/sour mix. Maybe this makes me a functional alcoholic, but I like to taste a little nip of the booze in my drink and not just sweet and sour. I had a taste of one of their house beers (all of which are themed with some kind of lumberjack name) and it was decent. Not anything to go out of your way for, but I could definitely tell this was more of a beer joint than a mixed drink place. Perhaps the bartenders are used to pouring more pints than mixing liquor drinks for all the men coming in to this watering hole.

The food was decent. Twin Peaks definitely redeemed itself in this area. I had some of the mozzarella bites to start, which were quite tasty -- lightly breaded and fried with molten cheese in the center...you can't go wrong with these. I also tried a few bites of the blackened fish tacos -- also very decent with a tangy chipotle mayo that came on them.

After our event, we ended up coming back to Twin peaks for another round and some of the gals came and chatted with us at our table. It was a nice distraction from all of the TVs that were vying for our attention in the place. I can't say that Twin Peaks will be my regular watering hole, but it is convenient, not terribly expensive, and they about the only interesting bar in the Castleton area with PLENTY of seating for a group.
Great pizza overall one of the top pizza places here in Tampa FL. . Really enjoy there food. Would come here again. Their pizza is supper huge!
I had the sunflower arugula salad and added crispy oysters. It had a great flavor and I was definitely satisfied. The ambience in the outside patio was beautiful. Lots of greenery and hanging plants.

You will be impressed with everything created by this bakery. Pastries. Coffee. Breakfast. Lunch. Desserts. Breads. 

Here you'll find the expected with special touches (salted brown butter cinnamon roll) as well as creative offerings (Elvis style banana bread.) Breakfast or lunch, the sandwiches are excellent too. And don't leave without a loaf to-go; we're partial to the sourdough or cherry and pistachio, which has the same sourdough base. 

Don't hesitate, just go; open daily 8 to 2. 

The Helena Avenue Bakery is reason alone to move to Santa Barbara.

Boobs with a side of terrible food!  Visited for lunch with a table full of military and veterans and we were treated bad from the start.  We only came to eat and were treated like we were there to look and slap asses...  food was slow out the door.  Service had to be sought after. Drinks weren't staying full...  it was terrible.   Probably great to grab a beer and watch a game.  Just have low standards and expectations.

This place is awesome! You just have to meet Bob!!

I've stopped in a few times for coffee, and always ended up in great conversation with the owner. His coffee is smooth and delicious, and well priced. Both his turkey sandwich and Thai soup are above average, at below average prices!

As other reviewers have noted, Bob does host a lot of live music, but I've never attended in the evenings. His Cafe is a hidden must go lunch spot in downtown Edmonton. The atmosphere is casual, chill and relaxed. He offers board games, internet access and a wholly warm atmosphere.
Ardmore Pizza is a local slam dunk. Tasty food with quick delivery. My only gripe is that their largest pizza size is 14", but size can't always be everything, the flavor more than makes up for it.

Went to Helena Avenue Bakery during a visit to Santa Barbara.  Heard from all the Yelpers that this is a great breakfast spot and they were correct.  

They have outside sitting and were constantly cleaning tables, which made my party feel very safe.  

For breakfast, we had the privilege to try the Breakfast Sandwich on Brioche and the Fried Chicken Sandwich (new on the menu).  We also had the Savory Galette.  The sandwiches were very tasty and great for breakfast.  The Savory Galette had tomato and cheese inside and hit the spot.  We also had an Americano and Matcha Latte with Oat Milk.  

Overall, great breakfast spot and would love to come back again

If you know me, I LOVE iced HK-style milk tea... a lot. I used to frequent Zhong Gang, but it has been very, very inconsistent - too much half and half, not enough syrup, or not enough ice. 

My new favorite HK-style milk tea is from here. $1.50 for iced. It is consistent most of the time. I like to ask for crushed ice, but there's just too much clumped ice leftover... most likely because of the cold weather. Maybe it will be different when the weather gets warmer. 

Definitely recommend their iced HK-style milk tea and HK-style iced tea!

Okay, so after a couple of trips to this place over the last few years with less than stellar service (one guy was really just sort of gross with a runny nose and no idea whatsoever what he was doing), we have been back twice within the last month and had wonderful, professional service both times.  Carl especially was great and exemplified exactly what customers expect from a T-Mobile employee.  Thank you Carl!!!

I had trouble placing the stars on this one because I actually love going to Roast, and enjoy it quite a bit. It is beautiful, tastes great, and is welcoming. BUT and this is a very big BUT for me. I understand that this business is new, and it's busy so I have given it some grace in that regard towards the issues I have concerns with but after happening to me on 7 different visits now I have to say I'm fairly dissapointed. 

Whomever is in charge of doing orders for Roast really needs to figure out how to order in abundance or order more than they normally do or whatever it may be. I have gone there on 7 different occasions to order different drinks each time and I am always told "sorry we're out of this, or we're out of that" Thus forcing me to order a drink I could get anywhere and was really less than thrilled about trying. Especially when it's a feature drink that you read on their FB page and decide yum! I'm going to go try it out and both times you visit during that special they are out of it. I once tried to get their Powered Chai literally 4 days in a row and they were out the entire time. Which was fine because I understood that they were new and the order had to come in and they gave me the option of trying their tea based chai. The time after that it was Pumpkin, the time after that it was the Apple Juice (out of Apple Juice?) 

I do love the atmosphere which is what keeps me going, and the drinks taste just fine, the desserts are delicious, and the service has been great, but the order issue is a serious bummer and definitely has me wanting to take the trip downtown for coffee meetings with clients less and less. 

Has the potential to be awesome though if they could get that glitch cleared up :)

I wish I would've read the overall rating before deciding to get take out. 
Just to get to the point. I ordered curbside and my calamari was cold, rubbery and most prices were BRICK hard. So I threw it away. I also order shrimp Alfredo.. and they didn't give me any utensils. 
I also REALLY like how a tip is included in the total price, unless you opt out. A TIP FOR WHAT? COVID has mad customer service even worse. What am I tipping for?! I paid $34 dollars for an entree and appetizer and it was BS! You also aren't serving me. I will not go back!

Went for a late lunch. Husband ordered a salad. He didn't like the dressing that came with it but the portion was huge. I ordered the lobster bisque. The portion for this was small but tasted good. Their bread today was so good. We had 2. Their appetizers of Brussels sprouts is my favorite. Our waitress Katie was amazing!! Drinks never went empty and she checked on us often. One of the best service we've had.

Tried to come here on a Sunday afternoon to have an early dinner with out of the state family and was rudely told that it was 21+ always unless with a parent/guardian. It was 5pm on a Sunday, I never had this issue elsewhere before. So we had to take a tired toddler and trekked elsewhere because my 20 year old cousin couldn't get in. I understand the 21+ rule after 9pm but not during the day. And if that's the case, it should explicitly be said on the site.

The CBD is pretty dead, but Copper Vine is poppin' and deserves a visit! The atmosphere and ambiance is top-notch, the decor is beautiful and welcoming. I also am one of those people that pays attention to the music played, and they were playing ODESZA - aka my favorite electronic duo ever. Music was on-point with the vibes. 

Service was AMAZING! Our waitress (I forgot her name) broke down the menu to us and was very detailed in her descriptions. 

We ordered the cheese & charcuterie board (blue cheese, Brie, & a cheddar I think), the duck debris fried and jumbo lump crab deviled eggs. The debris fries were delicious, and you can't go wrong with charcuterie. The deviled eggs were good, but $8 for only 3 and barely any crab, so I'd pass on these next time. 

We didn't get any entree plates, but there are plenty of small plates & apps for the table to share and for everyone to try a bit of everything. I heard the LA crawfish grilled cheese was good and hope to try that on my next visit! Overall, really really amazing restaurant that I look forward to experiencing again.

I really love this place. When we were in California earlier this month, we drove 90 min out of our way to eat here because we loved it so much the last time we were in Santa Barbara. A lovely place, great bakery and coffee, lovely food, friendly staff - one of my favorites. You should check it out.

I have had several experiences with this spot and none of them were this horrible but I don't think I will ever return. I had dinner there with friends and family to celebrate a birthday. We had a reservation at 7 for ten people and we were not sat until 7:30. They didn't seem super busy but I have worked in the industry before and I know that sometimes parties take longer than usual and things come up. Not a huge problem. HOWEVER, when we were seated we got our menus ordered a bottle of wine (that came out very promptly, thank goodness) and two appetizers: bruschetta and artichoke dip. We didn't get our appetizers until 8:19pm. After waiting forty minutes for our appetizers we were finally able to order our entrees which also took forever. I don't remember when we ended up leaving but it was way too late and after 9:15pm and several of us were not satisfied with our meals and didn't even eat them but at that point we just wanted to get out of the restaurant and never return. 
Throughout our meal there was a lot of apologizing and blaming the kitchen and the chefs but with all of that blame I was surprised that a manager didn't come check to see if everyone was okay. That wouldn't have helped the experience because I won't go back but usually if there is that much wrong with the kitchen someone will come out and apologize or comp an appetizer or SOMETHING. 

Anyway, long story short, the whole thing was really weird and way too long. The food is way too expensive and mediocre to justify the price and wait when you can just get some pasta roni for $1 at the grocery store.

Everything we ordered was just slightly off of the mark. We came around noon and they were already out of most of the items in the pastry window. I wanted to try a jalapeño cheddar scone but they were out so I settled for the blueberry. It was good, a standard scone but nothing wrong with it.

I ordered the squash salad as my main dish and my friend got the avo toast sans egg. She really enjoyed hers but it is difficult to mess up avo toast. I have heard from several people that that is their go-to at this place so I may try it one day.

My salad was so so salty. I can't even remember what the rest of it tasted like because I was overwhelmed by the salt. Not sure if they seasoned it too heavily or if the dressing was too heavily salted but I was disappointed as I couldn't taste the squash or squash blossom flavor, or anything else in the dressing. 

I wish that I'd ordered something else. Overall, I would come back for a pastry maybe but probably not a sit-down meal. They don't have a ton of options and they're all pretty expensive. I also wish they'd stocked the pastry window more heavily as they were open for a few more hours and it was mostly empty. Not a bad experience but not a great one.

Service is terrible (Carmel location).  We went tonight (at 6:00 pm) with our two children for the first time.  We  walked in and there was no "seat yourself sign".  We waited for a server, but no one came.  Lady bar tender saw us but did not acknowledge us.  My husband walked to the bar and asked if we had to seat ourselves.  She said yes and pointed to the section we had to sit in because we had kids with us.  We sat down and took a couple minutes to look at the menu (very limited) and then went to the bar to order.  The same bar tender lady said "oh, I'm sorry, the kitchen closes at 6"... Wow, you didn't think to tell us this when we came in and had to ask if we needed to seat ourselves (wouldn't that make you realize we had never been here before?).  We will not be coming back and will take our business elsewhere!

good coffee and even better food! both toasts were delicious. recommend the breakfast sandwich and the potatoes for something savory. the bakery is gorgeous and the vibes are great. need to show up earlier next time to get a cinnamon roll!

Great hole in the wall on South Street. A few dollars to expensive for my chicken meal, but it was still very flavorful: sweet, tangy, and spicy (the bowl was missing some crunch, however). Good combo. Chicken meat was processed, so that was a shame. And there probably wasn't enough sauce. But as I was thinking--this is a little overpriced and lacking in a few areas--I had gobbled it all down. Actually delicious, even though it could be a bit cheaper.

By far the BEST indoor park in the Treasure Valley. 
A very friendly and professional staff. Reasonably priced snacks.
And the cleanest and very best layout with a variety of activities for all ages.

Walked in around 12:45 because they are open until 3 am. Excited to get a drink or two in, until they refused my passport. Their policy is that they "can't accept passports". A bar/restaurant are supposed to accept them and I was shocked that they didn't.  I've been using my passport to get into places for months. So I showed my i'd, which was expired, but that's the reason why I used my passport. They couldn't accept that either. There were about 5 people in the place. Take the business, it wouldn't hurt.
Copper Vine is hidden gem located next to the French Quarters. The food was very refreshing and healthy. Great spot for lunch. Highly recommend the courtyard sitting area.

I frequent this location often with my club Indianapolis Crafting for a Cause.  We meet ever other Saturday and Wednesday in the café area.  All of the employees have been courteous and do not mind when we push several tables together for our group.  We are usually there for about two hours and many individual from the group purchase items from the café.  One of the most popular items that we tend to get is a pretzel.  I am a fan of the pizza pretzel.  This location is always clean and well kept.  I have also attended several Harry Potter events and the staff was open to hearing all of our feedback from the first event and made changes to the next event.  The second event was a lot of fun for my running group and we were even able to participate in several crafts.  Staff has also been helpful when trying to locate specific item and always offer to order if it is not in stock.  While visiting this location I have seen many other groups and individuals using the café or other seating areas throughout the store.  It is nice to still have a local bookstore where you can go and spend time.
Love the atmosphere. Coffee is pretty good. High prices, but I pay for the experience.

We stop by at Twin Peaks on our way to Indianapolis to watch the U of L and Purdue game. This was a cool place. It is a sports bar  that had waitresses that are dressed in Specialty little outfits kind of like a checkered shirt with shorts on it kind of fit the outdoor theme of it it was very like Cabela's meets Hooters is the best way I can put it at Giant TVs everywhere the bathrooms were phenomenal they had like TVs right at each year and I really enjoyed that bathroom so huge! And I mean huge just when you thought that a bathroom couldn't be that large it is. It kept going on forever. But I really liked it was nice clean establishment they had my favorite beer on tap Oktoberfest by Sam Adams it's available August through October and the waitress Jasmine was excellent very nice sweet girl no complaints there I got chicken tenders and fries and a order the side of their Blazin sauce that is supposed to be extremely hot and it was hot I compared to like a blaze and saw set BW3's and I really like that Jasmine the waitress said that they were opening up Twin Peaks hopefully in Louisville soon which I would enjoy that because it was a cool place and if they had it in Louisville I would definitely go so I hope the owners are twin picture reading us and they are going to open one here that would be excellent for the five stars definitely want to go back definitely recommended good sports bar and look forward to going back
Friendly staff! They made extra chocolates that I wanted to purchase right on the spot!

Picked this place for my best friends birthday dinner because of its sister restaurant Two Ten Jacks reputation. It's UNBELIEVABLE! The ambiance is, as my friend said, "the absolute cutest" with shiny wallpaper and heated toilet seats. And the food--goodness gracious, the food. We went nuts with the appetizers. Lobster shu Mai, pheasant dumplings, moon fish ceviche, oh my! The entree is one of the best I've had in a while. If you don't try the wagyu beef and spicy crab noodles, you're not really a good fan. Don't worry, I'll be back.
Amazing food. Fried chicken and bacon biscuit sandwich is out of the world. Full of Flavors
We have been members since 2010 and consider the temple our family. They have gone out of their way to make our fixed faith family feel welcome and loved.

We went through Expedita to rent a car in New Orleans and our Lyft driver dropped us off at downtown Niffy.  I was a little concerned at first since the shop didn't look like the "average" rental car lot, but the two female customer service representatives inside calmed my worries as they handled us with ease, efficiency and care.


I highly recommend using Niffy rental car.
Best ice cream in Falls Church!!!! Their food is pretty good too! Their fries are perfect!

I highly recommend this place! I usually have the cheeseburger with fries although I've tried a few things and everything is so good! The management is friendly especially Paul. I sat with Ashley R today and she was perfect! Very attentive!! I recommend checking this place out and asking for her.

We came for the frozen rosé and it was okay but not really worth the stop. We picked up a prepared hot chicken salad to take with us and it was subpar. Overall if you don't stop by you didn't miss much.
One of the best Deli sandwiches in pinellas county. The large Italian is big enough for 2 people. Love this place.

My first time visiting the location but Not my first time at Macaroni Grill, I think Macaroni Grill use to be great but I understand now why so many of there locations have closed now. 

Wine...
I had a glass of the house red and it was not very good, there are many inexpensive wines that taste decent but this was definitely not it. I ordered the Italian Chianti for my second glass.  

Food...
Ordered the Pollo Caprice and was disappointed. First it was salty, the mozzarella was salty, the arugula salad (was very very small portion, about 1/4) was salty & the grilled chicken breast was not only salty but rubbery, it was obviously cooked from frozen and had fake grill marks. Definitely not worth $17, go through any drive through for a better piece of chicken for 25% the price!

Service...
Was quick and friendly, I only have positive comments for the service. 

My wife and I use to love Macaroni Grill and I wondered why I've seen so many locations shutting down, I was in Reno and saw this location was open and decided to stop in for a nice meal but was disappointed and feel like I was ripped-off in the process, so now I understand why there're going out of business, and why I'll no longer be a patron. 
I recommend going to Carrabba's Italian Grill instead!
Minor taillight swap was completed the next day after calling in and took only 45min as promised. Look no further this place is the spot in SB for ANY auto body needs.

I really really wanted to like this place.  They came to our Food Truck Friday.  Let me pre-qualify myself on VN food...I've been to Saigon 12 times and have a spouse born there.  The pho broth didn't have much flavor or aroma and the beef was sliced wayyyy too thick.  The sandwich had Chinese-style BBQ pork and cucumbers.  Didn't taste any pate.  The roll was decent.  Chicken wings were excellent....I really don't get the fries and ketchup, however.  The chicken strips were clearly store bought.  Egg rolls were better than most, but they put turkey inside....that is clearly a first.  They were doing booming business, so all good.

If you are a food blogger, Instagram queen (or king) or an aficionado of all things trendy and cool then C&B is your spot. C&B is a specialty market and cafe which started in Charleston, SC and I've not seen anything like it in my time in Nashville. The interior is immaculate from their perfect displays of pastries and sweets to pre-made salads and wines. Whether you are there to shop, eat or drink you will be impressed by the novelty of everything in C&B. 

The place--
It took me a few seconds to orient myself settling my eyes upon the different stations available to order food. Did I want a salad, a sandwich or to grab something to go? It was a bit much to take in at first then I appreciated all the choices. When I was waiting for my order I was thoroughly entertained. Although I got my order to-go since I work nearby I would think it would be fun to dine in as well. 

The food--
I ordered the Tennessee Trio sandwich ($10.50) which had porchetta, pork belly and bacon jam along with cheddar, pickled sunchokes and arugula on a ciabatta roll. The flavor was all there and it was a very filling sandwich. The porchetta was a bit too crispy for me and the sandwich was a little too rich for me to order it again but I did like it. I got a bag of Zapp's New Orleans Kettle Style voodoo chips ($1.95) and a small blueberry hibiscus iced tea ($2.60) to go with my sandwich and my total was $16.44 which is a bit steeper than I want to pay for a sandwich, drink and chips but for a splurge every now and again I suppose it's okay. The iced tea is not sweetened at all in spite of the blueberry I picture being slightly sweet naturally, this was not at all. If you want a little sweet I would suggest putting some sugar in before sitting down. 

The service--
My drink and sandwich took only a little bit to order. It can be a bit off-putting to have to go to two different counters to order but it didn't take much time. The front register for the barista will check you out if you get anything from one of the back counters. 

Overall, this is a place I'd meet a friend or perhaps treat myself for a nice lunch. Otherwise this is a bit too trendy/pricey for every day dining.

Best food in town! Jackie was friendly and service was fast! We ordered the barbecue nachos as an appetizer, they were very large and very delicious. Gerald stopped bye the table to check on us and was very friendly as well. We will definitely be back.

Could not rate it lower than 1 star.      My family (6) and I went to this restaurant today and they HAD NO MENUS!      How are 6 of us to order food from a borrowed phone?     Trying to read a full page menu on a 2" x 3" screen is OUTRAGEOUS!      What moron thought this one up?     If you want to read a big menu on a small screen please allow an extra 30 minutes to try and scroll over the menu.   GO SMOEWHERE ELSE!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Great fish quality with prices that are a steal. Beautiful warm atmosphere with very at tentative wait staff. Our waiter apologized for the food being late and gave us complimentary edamame and miso soups. The chirashi bowl had over 20 pieces of fish and the variety was great. Definitely savored the fattiness in the tuna sashimi. Would highly recommend this place! Good job Sushi Hachi!

I was in Nashville recently for a company trip, and heard good things about Mike's. As such, I decided to try it out when I found myself on Broadway.

Ice Cream:
This place had a pretty good selection of flavors to choose from, and from  what I've heard, they change flavors quite a lot (probably due to some seasonal flavors?). I taste-tested a few of the flavors, and got myself a double-scoop cone with Tennessee Fudge and Loaded Caramel.

First off, they give you HUGE scoops of ice cream. Usually, two scoops is a lot, but I didn't expect to get scoops that completely dwarfed the cone I was holding them in by so much. I was pleasantly surprised.

Second, when it came to the flavors I got, the Tennessee Fudge was amazing. I have no clue what they do with it, but that was some of the best ice cream I've ever had. The Loaded Caramel, meanwhile, was also very good; maybe on par or a little better than the Sea Salt Caramel that I've gotten at Salt and Straw.

I didn't get fancy with the cone I got; I just ordered a sugar cone. So, I don't think I can really review that part, but the main attraction would be the ice cream, itself, anyway.

Overall, it's some of the better ice cream I've had in quite a while.

Rating - 5/5


Service:
Not much I can really say here. The people who served us allowed us to try out the different flavors they had, and gave us our orders without much hassle. Basically, they acted in standard fare for a typical ice cream shop.

Rating - 5/5


Value for Money:
Perhaps this is slightly influenced by the prices I've seen in Seattle (where I currently live), but Mike's Ice Cream gives you quite a lot of ice cream for the amount you pay. Of note, for a double-scoop, I paid around $5, and got more than I usually would at places like Salt and Straw (which costed me way more for something similar). Furthermore, flavors like the Tennessee Fudge, alone, make the price worth it.

Rating - 5/5


Overall:
I've been to several ice cream shops in Nashville during my stay (places like Pied Piper Creamery, Jeni's Splendid Ice Cream, etc). Of them all, Mike's ranks as my favorite. I'd definitely recommend checking it out while you're around Broadway.

Rating - 5/5

We got a cheese pizza and a calzone last night. WHAT HAS HAPPENED TO ARDMORE PIZZA?!!  It was terrible. A small pizza is now equal to a personal pizza anywhere else. The calzone was made with hoagie ingredients. I got a piece with nothing but three full round to tomato slices, not cheese nothing else. My next slice was three huge pieces of green peppers and a huge mound of ricotta cheese nothing else. The ingredients were huge and lumped together. If you got one ingredient on this slice you got all that was on the calzone. The put a lump here a lump there and another lump over there.  The worst calzone I have ever had. The small cheese pizza was no better. My kids wouldn't even eat it because how burnt it was. NEVER AGAIN!  I'm done with them. They were great for years but we live in a pizza Mecca. Why order junk when there is great pizza on every block.
Sorbet was not too tasty and my cake cone tasted stale. Customer service was great even though it was super busy... Line moved fast.

I was at the Indianapolis, in Twin Peaks on 9-12-2018 to just get away for a little bit it was the the 1yr passing of my wife Barbara from cancer I Was there for the lunch break I was greeted by ty which i later found out it short for tyler she could see that there was something wrong she talked to me for a little bit and then i gave her my order she had other customers but it seemed she would come over just to see if i was ok I have been to Twin Peaks alot of times but ty made me fill at ease just sitting with me and talking she gave me a hug and told me to come back even if i was just getting a beer and wanted to talk. the 35 or 40 minutes i was there talking to ty helped me through the rest of the day.

5 stars ALL AROUND! The sushi here is amazing. The quality and the taste are superb! Not to mention it's a good looking restaurant with some pretty cool decor and a great ambiance.

We started with edemame, tuna tartar, tuna curdo and seared tuna salad. They were all amazing but my favorite was the tuna curdo which is basically thin slices of raw tuna in a delicious sauce. Order this app it's incredible.

Moving on to the rolls... We had the old city roll, white dynamite, peppered tuna and some yellowtail sashimi. Let me repeat the quality of fish they serve he is the best I have had period. All of these rolls were extremely tasty but my favorite was the peppered tuna! It comes with an amazing wasabi drizzle and the tuna is pepper crusted.

We also had a few Sapporo beers and the ladies had cocktails the geisha and the I'll see you lata. They said the cocktails were Great!

We had such a good time and enjoyed the food so much that we told the owner it was the best sushi we ever had. We are visitors from NYC and tuna bat does it better than any of the upscale sushi spots we have been to in NY. We have even discussed going back to Philly just to have dinner at tuna bar again. Absolutely love this place! Best meal we had in Philly by far!

The Sushi here was the best sushi that I have eaten in a very long time. We got three types of specialty sushi rolls and a dozen oysters (the west coast oysters were the best). Even their drinks were delicious! The only reason I am giving them 4 stars instead of 5 is because the wait time for our food was a bit long. Nonetheless, when I am back in Philly, I will definitely come back here!

Just amazing. Had lunch with my daughter and everything rocked. The deviled eggs were perfectly spicy and I loved the "Green Vine" - plant based burger. This burger is absolutely meaty and delicious. Loved the Brussels sprouts too. Can't wait to try it again!

I went on a Monday evening for happy hour, and couldn't decide on what to drink or eat, there were so many good options. I finally settled for the Flight Club Flight which is a sampler of a red, white and Rose' (it didn't disappoint). For food I ordered the Brussels sprout, tuna tartare & caviar, crawfish beignets, and black truffle fries all of which was amazing. The crawfish beignets are very rich, creamy and cheesy... it was a bit much for me but nevertheless delicious!

We had an outstanding meal at the Green Pheasant on Tuesday night this week. I went in with high expectations and they were exceeded. 

We started with the Broccolini (shrimp, crumbled corn bread, and broccolini). The broccolini was bright and crisp-tender. The shrimp were perfectly cooked. It seemed like an unusual combination of flavors and textures but it totally worked. 

We also tried the Shumai starter (dumplings filled with lobster and shrimp and sitting in a ponzu sauce). They may have been my favorite dish of the night. Perfection. 

For our larger plates, my husband and I shared the ora king salmon and the spicy crab noodle. The salmon was outstanding. It had a crispy charred side that tasted like cotton candy (in the best possible way). The salmon was served with bok choy which was perfectly cooked and paired nicely with the salmon. The spicy crab noodles were absurdly delicious as well. We fought over every last bite. 

As a party of two, this ended up being the perfect amount of food for us. We were full when we left, but not stuffed. 

Green Pheasant is great for date night or girls' night out. It's also perfectly positioned if you are headed to Ascend. We were on our way to a concert and could literally see the entrance gate from our table.

I have been passing this place for a while so we decided to pop in. Sitting outside on the patio is very inviting, cozy and it reminds you of being in the tropics, except for the traffic noise because it is located in the CBD. I am in love with the outdoor eating patio. The crawfish beignets are delicious.

I ordered 3 sandwhiches that were incorrect and poorly made . So I had my daughter try and return the sandwiches and get the money back or at least remake the sandwhiches .They refused both .The sandwhiches was the worst sandwhiches I ever seen .I told them light mayo it was slopped on both side of the bread .I said lettuce n tomato.the lettuce was old and the tomatoes was obsolete .so my daughter called and said they was being rude I talked one of the workers who wouldn't do nothing .we returned the sandwhiches that I paid for didnt get a refund or new sandwiches what company does that you would think  you would go out ur way or at least
make customer happy but I guess not at Charlie's market I want my money back or I will write review everyday tillyou reconcile the situation
Food and coffee were excellent. Service was top notch. Would highly recommend to friends.

Excellent customer service and workmanship!  Craig called daily to keep me informed of progress. Estimate was one dollar less than insurance agents quote. The whole process was uncomplicated and consistent with his word.

I don't get the hype. We arrived for our reservation right on time and were sat immediately. Waited... and waited. Told the hostess no one had come by after 15 mins. Finally a server arrives and we are all set to order. We get the chicken wing "dumplings", lobster dumplings, edamame, salmon dinner and infamous spicy crab noodles. Chicken wings were certainly creative just not tasty - all it tasted like was fryer. Lobster dumplings were too buttery and we had about one each and left the rest. Edamame was fine, steamed with salt, nothing distinctive. Salmon was very tasty but almost raw. The noodles everyone raves about were good,  not as spicy as I would have loved. All and all a mediocre experience. Too many choices in Nashville to ever go back.

Great happy hour spot!  Enjoy the outdoor patio on a nice day.  Wine flight added to the happy hour.  Brussel sprouts were excellent.  I would make a reservation - nice atmosphere and good bang for the buck!

The breads were SUPER SOFT. The egg custard in both breads were on point. Whenever I go to Chinatown, I always stop by at least one local bakery. The breads are so cheap and packed with goodness. There wasn't much variety around 4pm. I was hoping for more savory choices. But this is a great snack stop.
Excellent, Excellent, Excellent! Italian food at its best. Be patient for the food. A little under staffed. Worth the wait. Plenty of time to relax. Excellent, Excellent, Excellent!

What a wonderful experience I had today at Sweet Things. I haven't been in the shop for sometime. I was looking for Christmas gifts and I found several plus treats for my family.

The shop has a large display case filled with all types of chocolates, truffles, covered pretzels and nuts, toffee and more. Everything is made right here at Something Chocolate.

They offer custom gift baskets, offer pre-made collections of chocolates and I found fun Hot Chocolate Bombs. Just add water or milk and place bomb in cup where chocolate melts and mini marshmallows float to the top. Their great Christmas gifts for the kids. There is a large jelly bean wall with so many flavors if you have a piñata or gift bags/jars to fill with candy.

Intermixed throughout the store are adorable cookie jars, coffee cups, dishware, pillows, serving platters, signs, dish towels, greeting cards and a section for a child's birthday.

Today I purchased Christmas gifts, greeting cards, Christmas decorations, hot chocolate bombs, candy, toffee and a phenomenal caramel apple dipped in dark chocolate.

The owner was extremely helpful, had excellent suggestions and super friendly. If your looking for excellent chocolates or cute gifts pop in and browse.
Great atmosphere, great steaks! The pepperloin is my favorite and never disappoints. Always a good experience when we go here.

Absolutely incredible. My now-fiancée and I went for brunch the morning I proposed (about a month ago), my efforts at getting a reservation at one of the major brunch players having failed. 

Well, I've never been happier with failure. The staff was welcoming and friendly (and didn't know the occasion, so they weren't playing it up). The food was some of the best I've had. I would give up every Seattle brunch spot to have Copper Vine closer to home. 

That morning we had the Brussels sprouts, the Apple fritter French toast and the cochon du lait benedict. All were pure heaven. Even though technically not part of the proposal, I can promise you this food makes it into every recounting of the story. 

We told my sister and brother-in-law they had to go the following weekend and then I went once more before my flight the weekend after that. You better believe Copper Vine has made the list of places to go every time we're in town and we've recommended it to everyone we've found out is heading to New Orleans. 

Thank you, Copper Vine!

Not great, not bad.  I ordered the beef dolsot bimbimbap.  Skip the dolsot if you are expecting the rice to get crispy - it doesn't.  Small portion, light on the meat, but it tasted okay.  We ate in, but I think due to this damn covid thing, we didn't get any banchan.
If I came back here, I would probably go for just the veggie bimbimbap - a better value for the money.

I came here with my fiancé and two kiddos under 5. We came during the Oktoberfest festival. What appealed to us was the family friendly aspect of this brewery. There was a lower side with an indoor playground, like 20+ high chairs, and a TON of families; Walking in you wouldn't notice it because it's towards the back and the noise level doesn't affect the rest of the brewery. Our kids had a ball and we were able to enjoy ourselves without worrying if we were being nuisance to surrounding guest. Our food orders were brought up promptly and the quality was great! It was walk up to the bar service and everyone was very friendly. Parking could be slightly sparse but I noticed a lot of families ubered or walked from neighboring neighborhoods. They also had a small I've recommend this brewery to friends traveling with kids because it's rare to have somewhere so accommodating to families. After looking through their social media I noticed they do a lot of family friendly events and I love that! I will be back when visiting Philly !farm type petting zoo area with chickens and rabbits which was really cool for the kids. I hope more places adopt this to suit families.

One of my friends suggested this restaurant for a Saturday brunch.  It is right off of Poydras, and I had never noticed it.  We sat on the garden patio, which completely hides the fact that you are sitting on a street corner. Plants completely envelop this patio, and it is incredibly beautiful and pleasant.  

We visited during coolinary, so there was a special coolinary menu you could order off of if wanted (you could also order from the normal menu).  I chose the french onion soup, croque madame, and the dessert beignets.  Every single item was delicious and decadent.  The beignets were the best I've ever had - they are light, airy, and puffy on the inside instead of heavy like they are at Cafe Du Monde.

There is a clean bathroom "suite" right inside the door, with unisex enclosed bathrooms.  This is a little weird but works out fine.

Paid street parking in front or paid parking lots near the restaurant.  Bus Stop one block away.

I'll definitely be back!

I rate them 10 stars! I came in asking about getting rid of few scrapes and scratches on bumper. They said to wait until something bigger happens, e.g. dent, before repainting entire bumper. But they said they would be happy to try and make bumper look better with buffer. The service writer and techician looked at bumper and determined where to buff. Voila! 10 minutes later the scrapes and scratches were gone! I have no idea how they did it but they did, and it was much better than my amateurish touch up jobs. And best was they did it right then and there! Can't say enough about their professionalism and customer focus. And best of all--they didn't charge me! Needless to say they won lifelong customer.

I love the aesthetic in this restaurant! They have a small outdoor patio covered in vines. The decor isn't your typical New Orleans decor. They also have a room upstairs that's available to rent for parties. These fries don't even need ketchup or aioli. They're literal perfection and dream worthy. They have a great drink selection! I went for lunch and had a few glasses of white wine - so refreshing! Definitely check this place out if you haven't yet!

Not sure what happen. I have order a taro cake from this place 4 times and each time it was delicious and fresh. However, the fifth time, I ordered a 12inch taro cake for my moms birthday it was bad. The cake was order on a Friday, picked up on Saturday, and party was on Sunday. I had put it in the refrigerator immediately after coming home with it. The taro fulling of the cake was sour and tasted very odd. They must of used old taro or just completely messed up the order. I was and still am embarrassed and disappointed at the cake because we had 20 guest and we served bad cake at my moms birthday party. I call the bakery immediately and they did refund me my money, however, the party was somewhat ruined and literally left a bad taste in my mouth. I will no longer recommend this place nor will I return to purchase anything from here anymore. I wish I can give it zero stars.

If you are at this establishment during the summer or early fall you must try their frose! It is Devine but seasonal. One of the last places in the city with all you can drink mimosas. Food is great and atmosphere is fabulous. The balcony is a great spot for cooler days but the outdoor seating is so nice for weather that needs a little more shade.

My friends enjoy this pizza place more than I do.  My preference is Eagle Pizza because comparatively... The sauce is a little bland and the crust is missing that fermented flavor that I seek in a good crust.  Cheese is of good quality but overall it isn't enough to save the pizza.  One positive is the top their pizza well.  All of the side orders are solid... never had the steaks or hoagies so I cannot comment.  Overall I'd say Ardmore Pizza is A-OK, but it isn't my top choice.

Well, what can I say. Not sure what was happening tonight, but Lordy everything was wrong. Ordered loaded pulled pork fries and asked for no pickles or pico and yet it was covered. Ordered a Philly cheesesteak sandwich with no onions or peppers and had to send it back. Ordered a pork tenderloin and it came out raw!!! Ordered a chicken Cesar salad and everyone else was almost finished eating by the time we got it. I just can't believe we spent $100 for our family to have dinner and yet we left hungry and unsatisfied. Do not recommend this place.

You know how some restaurants are known for food that strays from their "core"?  Like the bakery in Media that's a gelato Mecca?  Or the gas station in Malvern with fabulous chili?  I call these "Say What?" places. Ardmore's addition to this phenomenon is Ardmore Pizza's hamburgers, club sandwiches, and fresh salads.  Yes, fresh salads at a pizza place.  Delivered.  All of these items arriving quickly, well packaged and, in the case of the burger, still warm.  Bonus is that they're all quite good! 

Our personal favorites are the bacon cheeseburger, the roast beef club and the chicken Caesar salad.  

So when you're craving a decent burger, basic salad or sandwich but don't want to go out or wait forever for a 3rd party delivery service to deliver at best lukewarm food (including lukewarm salad ewwww), give Ardmore Pizza a shout - or order online.  Enjoy our contribution to the "Say What?" community.

I got food poisoning from this restaurant.  I ordered a turkey burger with avocado, spinach.  Two hours later I'm in the bathroom.  I ended up in the hospital 5 hours after that from sickness and dehydration.  I spoke to owner wanted to claim no responsibility but wanted to give me a gift card for my troubles.  I said no I want you to pay my hospital bill!  Don't go there unless you want to get eix

You didn't give me a gift card I didn't want a gift card.  I wanted my hospital bill paid.  Why would you offer me a gift card if you feel like it wasn't your fault.  Food was mishandled that day, I'm sure of it.  Many servers were very busy.  I am sure that the proper procedures weren't being used.  I was sick from YOUR RESTAURANt no where else.  I also wasn't the only one who got sick.  I'm just the only one with guts to say something. 
Sorry is not enough!  I missed two hockey games ( was there from out of town for my son's hockey tournament) spent over a day in bed and went to the hospital and got a large bill even with my insurance which is extremely good and expensive every month.  And I'm sure I will get more bills.  It's not fair!

Had never been to Copper Vine for brunch, but they accommodated a large party of 9 for a special occasion. They initially had us placed at separate tables, but the manager quickly rectified this for us. I had only been for dinner and the brunch menu had a lot of the same overlap of some items. 

The duck debris fries are a MUST GET. they were devoured immediately. The flatbreads are also a great choice! I wish I had stuck to getting some small plates as my entree because the crab Benedict just didn't really do it for me. There was no flavor/spice in the tomato-sherry Holland size and just was a really bland dish unfortunately. I tried the waffle with the chicken & waffle and it was tasty, so maybe I just picked the wrong dish. 

Definitely won't fault them for that, but just a heads up for those planning to visit CV for brunch in the future :)

Craft Hall is a huge venue great for big groups looking for a casual drink. During COVID-times they have spaced out tables appropriately and I'd make a reservation if you're planning on coming here. On the menu, they have a large selection of beers of different styles and a number of food options. I tried one of the beer flights and was impressed that I enjoyed every beer I had selected. My friends were also pleased with their beers and their moscow mules. I didn't try any of the food myself but my friends said their choices were solid bar food. 

Overall, this is definitely a fun place for a big group looking to drink some brews!

Delicious! Just moved to the neighborhood and so happy this is nearby. Their sushi is fantastic (I love the Rittenhouse roll) but their non-sushi fare is just as good. Wonderful wine selection and incredibly friendly staff.

I took my Danish friends here since they came to visit Philly. Convenient location for us who lives in the old city. The atmosphere and the service are always nice. Food is good. Mr friends said it was the best experience they had. So I am satisfied. Thanks, Tuna Bar! I think their food improved after covid. Since I lived in Japan half of my life and another 10 years in nyc, I won't say it was the best of the best. But for Philly, I say Tuna bar passed the test:)

This place is seriously a genius idea and I'm not sure why there aren't more establishments capitalizing on parents with kids! Life doesn't end when you start a family and become parents. Most people would rather not pay a someone just so they can go out and grab a beer and a bite to eat!
This place has a huge indoor pirate ship structure that our 6 and 4 year old loved- they happily kept themselves occupied for a hour or two while we sat and relaxed and had some cocktails! We noticed a ton of play dates happening with other groups and will do this in the future with our friends! 
The menu was select albeit a bit pricey for bar bites, but the food was good- they did a nice brunch selection though!! There are TVs over the bars that you can catch the sporting events- I got to check the score of the US Open while I waited for our drinks this summer! There is a section with a foosball table and corn hole and another area for old Skool Nintendo games- a couple of the controllers were faulty but neat concept nonetheless- behind the pirate ship there are mini rock climbing walls that are perfectly kid sized- the irony is that we spent money at the Real Rock Wall next door only to have them go as high as the wall here! Rookie move! There is a big outdoor patio area and even a pettIng zoo of bunnies and chicks! Our littles  loved climbing the fire truck out front too!
All in all, a great place to gather families where there is something for everyone

Nice quaint little hole in the wall for the basic Bibimbap or jap chae. Extremely small menu but overall quality was okay. Portion size it was filling not over the top but enough to be full. 

Price was moderate. Shrimp pancake, beef Bibimbap and soondobu soup was about $36 for the two of us. 

Normally the Bibimbap is separate and I would mix it myself but in this case they mixed it for me before I got it...so it'll get an average rating...

Stopped by here Friday on a whim after checking out the art galleries in the area. Was able to sit at the bar due to a wait for tables but understandable. The bar is made out of pieces of wood that kinda scream Fixer Upper is on the DVR. The vibe of the place was urban and perfect for its location. For apps we ordered the Roasted Brussel Sprouts. Tuna Crudo, Miso Soup and the Pork Gyoza. 

The Miso was $6 bucks, when I asked my companion was it $6 bucks worthy there was a reply of lacking flavor but the size was equivalent to 2 $3 bowls somewhere else. 
The Brussel Sprouts: Now I confess I hadn't had brussel sprouts since at least 12 and that pushing it but I decided to step out of my comfort zone and try them roasted instead of boiled and I am now a fan. The sesame oil was perfect and they were charred just enough to elicit the flavor of the sprouts to be slightly sweet.
Tuna Crudo: My companions loved this dish and advised the truffle oil was slightly overwhelming but delectable.
Pork Gyoza: Always good and great with the left over truffle oil

The perk of sitting at the bar was watching the chefs make the rolls and trying to figure out which one was ours. There is a mirror above the bar and more than once did we find ourselves staring at what was going on. We ordered 4 rolls to share: Fishtown, Old City, J&J and the Real California. The J&J was my favorite the shishito pepper would kick in right at the end for a spicy finish. The Old City looked to be the most popular coming off the bar and it made sense - its a instagramable plate in its own right and has a good flavor combo. I initially ordered the Fishtown and depending on what piece of fish you got on top kinda determined if it worked in my opinion. We decided to try the Real California roll for fun and honestly I could have done without.

Overall I liked it and would try it again. I do wonder if they are going to rotate rolls to keep it fresh.

I love this place....Tucked into an elbow of Lower Merion, this wonderful BYOB is meticulous in its presentation of authentic Roman dishes. The four quintessential Roman pastas are there: Bucatini alla Gricia, Spaghetti Carbonara, Spaghetti a Cacio e Pepe, and Amatriciana (that the owner calls Matriciana). I chose the bucatini matriciana and it was a beautiful melding of sweet, spicy and savory tastes..as authentic as it comes. In addition to the pasta, no one does artichokes better (a family recipe with specially-sourced artichokes), and the Supploni al Telefono (ostrich egg-sized fried risotto balls with fresh mozzarella) we're also a special treat. The heart of the place is it's owner, Luigi, who entertained at a South St (now closed) and West Chester (still going well, run by Luigi's wife) location before opening up this jewel in the middle of the pandemic. If you love Roman style Italian cuisine, it's hard to do better. I'll be going back a lot.

This is the second time I've been to this location. I ordered a Veggie slim in trim w/ extra ginger, collagen and immune support added. I normally go to the location on Broadway which is more consistent w/ the consistency in regards to texture of the smoothies. However this location has consistently served smoothies that aren't completely blended leaving granules of the contents visible and chunky. I can feel the texture of the additives in my mouth and on my tongue. Think, taking a drink of your smoothie and finding a unblended chunk of "sand" in your smoothie. The texture is just not good. I'll stick to the Broadway location.

Update: I went back, they made it over. Was much better.

After hearing a steady stream of constant raves about Roast, I went out of my way to get there this afternoon. I can say with certainty that I love the atmosphere. The lighting is perfect, the place is huge, and there is a lot of seating - and of many different kinds, from tables and chairs, to comfy chairs, to sofas. I spent some time walking around and saw a good selection of loose coffee and tea for sale, pastries in the display case, and the wine and food list, which was not huge but decent. As for me, I took advantage of a free coffee offer this week and tried a medium roast. It was good, but did not knock my socks off. Still, just the fact this is an independent, local, non-chain place with a great vibe is enough to keep me coming back to try an espresso drink.

Customer Service for Chase card services is non-existent. There is no live person to assist - I've tried every number that was provided and you are basically looped back to the automated call in.  That would be okay if your issue or question is addressed on the choices offered.  The other options provided refer to the website  - which I have had problems navigating.  You can also email but you need to be able to sign in to access - which is one of the problems I'm having. Absolutely ridiculous. I am trying to stop unauthorized charges on my card but have been on a frustrating loop with Chase.  While I understand there may be problems on their end with COVID-19 but it would be helpful to the consumer to have other options to contact Chase.  I have had their card for over 20 years but this may be a sign to cancel this card and look for another company to deal with.







I

Loved this place! Beautiful little wine bar! I was visiting NOLA and we ended up coming here twice during our vacation. I really appreciated the diversity of the wine list and the food was top tier as well! We loved the fact that we could order 2.5 oz pours of wine which allowed us to try many more wines. Great Vibe! I definitely would recommend!
Wanted to add that it is in a convenient location to kennet square restaurants and long wood gardens.

Loved copper vine! So yummy and the cocktails were great. I got the sage something 10/10 recommend! For food I got the chicken sandwich, very good! It was great for my friends birthday dinner! Loved the area and the decor of the restaurant!

While walking around downtown I kept seeing people with ice cream cones and I was jealous. Then we found a pretty big line to a small shop... it was the source! Mike's Ice Cream.

This place is almost like an classic ice cream parlor with classic flavors and that classic 1950-1960s atmosphere. A lot of the flavors include regular flavors like strawberry, rocky road, and cookies and cream, as well as more unique flavors like Tennessee Fudge and red velvet. Other than scoops and cones, they also offer sundaes, milkshakes, smoothies, and coffee!

The shop has a good amount of seating but it seems somewhat limited with the long lines wrapped around the store and outside. However it was quick to pass through and walking around and eating ice cream is much more fun anyways. Prices are cheap as well! This was a great sweets option in Downtown Nashville.

So the address is 131 Anacapa, but technically the bakery is closer to another street... Helena Avenue, whaddayaknow? If you see a restaurant called The Lark, keep walking past the patio seating until you see the Santa Barbara Wine Collective.
