Most recently we were here on a Thursday and there was supposedly a happy hour on the lychee martini that featured the drink for $5. We were told when we sat down around 7pm that the happy hour was still going on and we could order the martini with the discounted price, which we did. The martini was delicious, however, when we went to pay the bill, our drinks were listed as full price and the same waitress we had since he beginning of the meal told us that we ordered after the happy hour was over. Therefore I would say the service we received was not the best...

Overall I am hesitant about coming back here, especially because Kisso and Tomo are two other great japanese restaurants within a block radius.

The food and service here is always great, they have some of the best wings around! I also enjoy the Havana bowl, black bean hummus and the nachos! The funnel cake fries with a side of ice cream for dessert is a good dessert to share with the kiddos. You can't go wrong with anything that you order from here, but do yourself a favor and make sure you try the wings! My son plays hockey but sometimes I find myself just wanting to go for the food, who cares about the hockey!  J/k

Needed to have an electric keypad lock installed (Schlage). Shay provided a reasonable quote ($110) and while I was flexible on date of installation, he was able to fit me in his schedule the day after initial contact. While he arrived an hour later than the appointment, I was fine with that. However, that's where the positive review ends.

Hopefully, he was just having a bad day but he basically came in, installed the lock, and IT DID NOT WORK. We tried to figure out what was wrong with it and he suggested that it was due to a defect in the lock itself (I had just bought it from Amazon a day ago and this was not my first time hiring someone to install this type of lock). He did try to see what was wrong with it at my request but seemed that he didn't want to be here or cared that the lock that he installed DID NOT LOCK OR UNLOCK. I then called Schlage's customer service and he seemed to be in a rush to get to either another appointment or just somewhere else even though he was only here for ~30 minutes and came an hour late. He just told me to stay on the line with customer service and that they could fix whatever was wrong with the keypad and then he left. I have never experienced this type of service where a locksmith does not properly install a lock and just leaves and tells me that I can call him later after I'm done with customer service to provide him my credit card info for billing.

After 30 minutes on the phone with Schlage's customer service and using my regular screwdriver to take apart the entire lock, customer service instructed me to re-put the lock together and tried to determine the source of the problem. Turns out that the AA batteries were put in incorrectly (+/- on the wrong side). After having fixed the keypad and lock myself, I called Shay to let him know that customer service had helped me fix it and the source of the problem. He did not seem to care at all. I still paid him the $110 because a contract is a contract but feel like this was the worst service I have ever had. I manage rentals on the side and am new to Philly so this was my first time hiring someone in the local area.

I will never use this service again and could have just done this on my own had I realized that paying an expert who doesn't care about the actual job, in this case, was a total waste of time and money. I don't mind the attitude or impatience but I don't understand how someone can just leave in the middle of a job unresolved and still only care about getting paid and being out of the place in 30 minutes.

While I can't complain about service. As we had very good service, and being Thanksgiving evening,  I felt a little badly for the people working. Food was ok, chicken scallopine was a little dry. But flavorful. Moms rigatoni tasted really sweet which didn't settle well for her. Calamari was forgotten and nephews pizza was late due to overcooking. When you really look at it,  this was the best alternative to not having reservations on Thanksgiving and coming from out of town with a large group. For that we're grateful. We left with full stomachs and happy that we were together for the holiday.
I am extremely disappointed with their business practices.  When I got swindled out of almost $3000 after booking a trip through Booking.com,  Chase Amazon refused to reimburse me.

Tucked away on a side street right next to Great Fermentations. A really cute place to take your dog(s) and maybe even a date! I forget what it was called, but the last time I came they had a really good amber ale. Unfortunately it doesn't seem like they bottle it, so I settled for their DFG and PFG, both of which are delicious and refreshing AF. 

If you don't come here for the beer (but really why wouldn't you) at least come here for the puppers!

For me, Tony's is not great, but not poor either...honestly, right in between.  Best place to sit in Tony's is in the bar area...smaller menu, smaller portions but just as good and much more casual.  It's kind of our go-to when we are out without the kiddos.  I will say, I've never felt comfortable taking my very well-behaved 3 year old there.  We always get funny looks from everyone.

This review is mostly for the salad station. I eat here at least once per week. I really love the Asian salad. The employees that work at the salad station for lunch are always attentive, friendly, and happy to customize the salads (add avocado, dressing on the side, etc.). Overall, the store is beautiful and bright with a great atmosphere. 5 stars!

Craft Hall is really interesting. It's a gigantic, family-friendly brewery with a pretty complex restaurant concept. All of the bread and desserts are baked onsite via Lost Bread Co. The menu features a lot of great snacks and sandwiches, though not many healthy options. I've tried the cheese curds, wings, fries and italian market panini. All were absolutely delicious!  

The beverages menu offers a lot to drinkers but not much for non-drinkers. I've personally tried their ginger beer, which is on tap (it's great!) and virgin bloody marys (their mix is made in-house and it's delicious!). I'd really love to see some creative NA cocktails, though! For the drinkers, there's a ton of beer, plus some wines, hard seltzers and cocktails. Only a few of the cocktails are made with local spirits (shout out to Philadelphia Distilling and Manatawny Still Works) and it would be cool to see more Philly representation on that list. 

For someone like me, aka, not a kid person, Craft Hall is kind of a hard sell. This place was without a doubt made for families. It's truly a genius concept! On my two visits (so far), there were multiple children's birthday parties. That said, the space is so large that even adults-only groups can likely find some kid-free space near the front bar. 

This is my spot for hanging with friends who have kids and my go-to recommendation to parents who want to get out with the little people for a while.

Loved the area & ambience, super cute. We only got to try one item but will be back for sure.
The Smoked Pastrami Reuben on Seeded Rye was delicious. It was a good portion & tasted really good. We split it. The mustard was a bit too much for me & burnt my nose. My husband loves meat and he said he wishes it had more meat it in. The side salad was very nice & refreshing, with great dressing.

Our server was awesome! The ambiance is great and the location is conveniently in the CBD which makes it a prime spot for tourists and locals alike. 
The appetizers were good and perfect size for sharing for our large group of 6 but nobody was crazy about their entrees but would still recommend for drinks and apps!

Whenever I end up at this one, I always wish I'd just gone to the one on 38th.

The staff here is really nice, so it's tough for me to be this critical.

But, the bottom line is that they're frequently out of stuff behind the deli, they're often understaffed behind the deli, there's a lot less selection here than the one at 38th, and almost every time I come here, something I wanted or needed was not available.

There have been times - not even that late at night (let's say 9:30 pm), where I'd be on my way home, and I'd stop in to get a sandwich. The sandwich would take 20-30 minutes because there's only one guy manning the deli and tons of college students getting study orders because that's what college students do.

Maybe it's just me and my set of experiences over the last couple years. Hope it improves because the 38th location is out of the way for me any time I'm not at work.

I tried they're famous "The Elvis," and it was delicious...the first three bites. After that, I was kinda done. It's a little too rich but it is super yummy. 
If anything, definitely try their baked goods. Their breakfast was okay but their cinnamon roll was : crumbly, sweet, flaky, buttery. It was incredible. Wish I would have gotten some

I love this place. The food is excellent. So I don't know what happened but we went and today was self serve. Ok but they added a 20% gratuity for self serve but didn't when we had a waiter. What's with that?
Excellent food and ambiance. Tracey was a phenomenal waitress, knows all the dishes and wines. Will definitely be back.

On July 16, I did an online balance transfer for 3000.00 from my account in Chase to my account in Citibank.
The money never made it to Citibank, I own Chase 3000.00 now.
I've called and called and called. They told me to wait. Waited and waited.
On October 26 they told me the money made it to a payee and I need to work with Citibank if the payee is not me.
Citibank says it's up to Chase to straighten this out, they initiated the transfer.
I finally get a letter from Chase (image attached). As you can see, the letter says the money were given to a payee whose account ends with 3027 and if I have a problem I should talk to the payee.
The payee, the 3027 account, I need to find him and confront him about my money.
That's what Chase did with my 3000.00. They're done now, and I owe them 3000.00.

Okay, I have to admit that as far as breastaurants go, Twin Peaks has got it going on way over the talent Hooters is pushing these days.  OMG!! . 

Now to the dining experience - my buddy and I ordered onion rings and fried pickles to start. They were pretty good. Only issue is they don't give you a menu. You have to "scan" their bar code symbol with your phone camera to access their menu. Ugh. 
I kept thinking what would my 88 yr old mother do since she doesn't have a smart phone. But then I suppose she wouldn't be a patron at this establishment. 

My friend ordered the Mom's meatloaf  which is his go to meal here. I made the never ending mistake of ordering the chicken fried steak. I will never again order chicken fried steak outside the state of Texas. I don't care where you go - Texas Roadhouse, Charleston's, Twin Peaks, they all use the same food vendor which gives a chewy cutlet that sits heavy in your stomach. NEVER AGAIN!!

To wash everything down I had 3 beers. Heinekens. The first one was on tap but didn't taste like Heineken so I switched to bottles. Meh.

The highlight of the night was arriving at 7:30 to watch the Colts game and at 8:15 we were informed that because there was a fight on that night each patron would be assessed a $5 cover charge. F that!!! We complained and were getting ready to head over to Ale Emporium when we were informed that due to numerous complaints the $5 fee was waived. I'll probably go back at some point if for no other reason but to enjoy the Peaks. But it'll be a cheeseburger rather than chicken fried steak!

One of the things that makes me most happy about living in Indiana is that there are so many great independent breweries in this fine state. Bier Brewery is one of these great breweries. And I came across it by happenstance: I was assigned to pick up an item that they donated to a fundraiser. (Note: They donate to fundraisers! That automatically elevates them several levels in my mind.) I didn't even know these guys existed prior to this. They're located in a nondescript strip mall near the railroad tracks in a sleepy neighborhood off Allisonville Road. You could easily drive pass them. I almost did!

Anyway, they sell cold beer here, so you can pick up a six pack (or two, or three) on your way home. I grabbed a six pack of their seasonal Dankzilla, a red ale that's citrusy and bitter in the best way possible. They also sell growlers to go. 

I'd like to visit again and enjoy a pint or two while sitting in their fine establishment. I'll have to come back!

I was excited to see Tuna Bar open in my Old City neighborhood. Adding a Japanese restaurant to the neighborhood seemed like a great idea even though I'm not a fan of sushi. I hoped it would also have food for non sushi lovers and thankfully it does. 

Upon walking in i noticed the restaurant has a nice warm modern decor. I ordered a bunch of items with my dinner companion and we shared. We ordered dumplings, edamame, lobster fried rice, shrimp tempura sushi, and bone-in steak. The dumplings were good, but not as flavorful as the best dumplings I've tasted. The lobster fried rice was the standout. It's a large delicious bowl, with enough lobster to actually taste, and you have plenty to take home at the end. The steak was a perfectly cooked and juicy medium. But it was a fatty piece of steak. I had to trim some of the fat myself, which was slightly annoying. But once the fat was trimmed I was in steak heaven.  Remember, I'm not a fan of sushi but I did enjoy the shrimp tempura sushi. Guess I can like sushi as long as the fish is cooked. I also had a rum & coke, which was mixed well but missing the lime. The bar probably focuses on fancier cocktails as opposed to the old classics. 

Tuna Bar is a welcome addition to Old City.

Ricardo's is a fairly typical Italian-American restaurant. I enjoyed my pasta here (Linguine Louisa) as well as the Ceasar salad. I'm glad I opted for the small portion of pasta because I don't think I could have eaten the large portion, and at $7 the pasta was a steal. 

However, I was disappointed with our waitress. She was friendly but too informal, and she knew absolutely nothing about wine. When we asked her to recommend a bottle of red wine for our table she said something along the lines of "I have no idea... I'm a beer drinker... I'm going to send over our sommelier... however you pronounce that word! ha ha." So, the bartender came over... (bartender = sommelier?) and we told her that we wanted something on the lighter side that evening, to which she responded "Oh, a Pinot Noir." That was surprising to me... I love Pinots but don't consider them a first choice for something "light." We settled on a Sangiovese.

I recommend the staff acquire more knowledge and experience with wine.

The food at this little Italian BYOB is excellent! The chef Luigi is outgoing and fun and clearly loves his craft. I've had the lasagne, eggplant parm and cacio e pepe and all of them were just tremendous. The artichoke appetizer is incredible. If you love genuine Italian, this place is spot on.

Ate Sunday brunch with a few girls while in NOLA for a bachelorette party and it was AMAZING!  We shared the Brussel sprouts (snack) and each had an entrée. The Brussel sprouts were sooo GOOD! Perfectly crisp  and I'm still dreaming about the garlic aioli sauce

We all ate off of each other's plates and they were all very good!! Lots of flavor.
FRIED DUCK & CORNBREAD WAFFLE-- huge waffle!
The CRAB CAKE BENDICT-- recommendation came from our server and it DID NOT DISAPPOINT!!
& the SHRIMP & GRITS-- so yummy. Our only complaint was that the shrimp in the shrimp & grits was a little undercooked. 

We choose to add the bottomless mimosas option for $25 each and we all thought that was a great idea! It was nice because we were able to switch up what kind of juices we wanted with our Champagne each time we ordered a new drink! They also let us take a to-go cup 
Would love to go back and try their  dinner, but would 100% recommend their brunch!!

My girlfriends picked Top Shelf for dinner on our June 2021 Girls' Night. Though I thought this was a really random choice, the location is fairly convenient off of I-75 and an easy spot to meet since we were coming from different directions. Because this Friday night was also Game 7 of the Lightning series vs the Islanders, one of the girls made reservations for us.

Parking was insane! It seemed like a skating session was ending but people were lingering; eventually I found a spot after about 10 minutes of circling. By the time I made it up to the second floor & found my girls, it was several minutes after 7pm and they already had a table & drinks.

I'll note now that our server was incredibly attentive. Even though the restaurant was packed & very busy, she checked on us frequently. Once I arrived, she was quick to come over & get my drink order. And when another girl arrived, our server noticed almost immediately & again was promptly at our table.

One of my friends ordered the Ybor Egg Rolls to share and they were amazing! I definitely could've made a meal of this appetizer. They were fun twist on the Cuban sandwich flavors we all know - incredibly tasty & generously filled. The same friend also raved about the wings she'd ordered (& has ordered on prior visits) but I'm not a wing fan so I'll just share that she loves the wings & highly recommends them. 

I ordered the Brisket Bender Bowl and LOVED it. The mashed potatoes were not overly garlicky and the brisket was super tender & flavorful. I was eating on this for days!

So, yes, Top Shelf is not obviously located, and is slightly more challenging to visit, but they have some really great food. I was drinking Bud Light with dinner on this night (pacing myself), but one of my girls enjoyed a cocktail & another had a sangria. No one was disappointed. This was a great spot to watch the Lightning game with my girlfriends but I doubt we'll wait until hockey season starts again to return!

If there's one important thing my mom taught me it's that there's always room for ice cream! One of the most iconic things about Mike's is definitely the location, in beautiful downtown Nashville. With country music blaring and tourists walking around, it kind of almost feels like home! Once I walked into Mike's the place was packed, and the weather, chilly as ever! Seeing as I was only spending a few days here, I had to go big, triple scoop for $5.50!

Here's the flavors I got:

Red Velvet Cake (4/5):

Chunks of red velvet cake, and the color of the ice cream was a dark red! Something out of a Dr. Seuss book almost! What I loved most about it was the fact that the pieces of cake inside the ice cream were delicate and not dry. Actually pretty moist in combination with the ice cream!

Tennessee Fudge (4.5/5):

Come on now, we're in Nashville, I can't NOT get Tennessee Fudge! Almost like cookies and cream, but the pieces of cookie were bigger and tastier! It was rather delicate on the pallet, and definitely fulfilled my needs as a person with a sweet tooth!

Caramel Cone (4.2/5)

Little chunks of caramel lodged into the ice cream along with a good amount of caramels drizzle, this one was definitely flattering! 

Overall, sitting at Mike's and staring out of the window, it kind of reminded me of a scene in movie. Country music playing and tourists walking by and looking at the various amazing places that make Nashville - well, Nashville. Music City, it clearly holds the title for a reason, and everything here screams life and music.

First time at twin peaks and I was pretty pleased with my experience. I was not really expecting much but was pleasantly surprised by the size of the establishment.. this place is massive. Me and a friend decided to sit at the bar where we were served by two very friendly waitresses. 

I ordered a tall modelo to drink with the chicken ranch sandwich (crispy chicken) and a side of buffalo. The sandwich was actually super fresh and tasted great. My friend had the meatball super which he was not so crazy about. Overall this place seems like a good spot to come get a beer and have some appetizers. Would probably go back to watch a game sometime. Total bill came out to around $30 after tip.

Yum! My sister and I were hanging out in downtown Nashville on a 90+ degree day when we passed Mike's ice cream. The aroma is impossible to resist. 
The line was long but moved fast. 
I got two scoops - banana pudding and fudge covered Oreo while my sister got the nutter butter - I can honestly say, I don't know which one was better all three were delicious. 
This shop is located on a street with lots of boutiques, restaurants, and bars with lots of live music. The street was crowded - but we went on a Saturday during Labor Day weekend. 
The prices were reasonable and everything is house made. Lots of parents and their children - it's a good family location. There also seemed to be a lot of people on dates. 
It's a fairly big shop with lots of tables and seating.
Loved everything about my experience here. I had multiple technicians assisting me with my service, they took their time, and did an excellent job. Such a relaxing time for a tired mama!
I usually get seated in Jackie's section and she takes great care of me. I recommend the mozzarella bites & avocado smash. And the Thai Chili sauce is awesome on the chicken tenders.

Tyla is amazing! Made our first time such a great experience.the food was delicious! The lobster bisque. With a hit of Tabasco and salt n pepper. You have to try it! Tyla service is phenomenal. Recommend great wine! Her service as a whole was above and beyond. I'll be definitely be having her as my waitress next time.

Went there last month.  The server said without reservations (for 4 people) it would be 15 - 20 minute wait, we said no problem, we will wait at the bar. I checked with the server twice to see if she forgot about me.  She said I was the first on the list.  Long story short, we waited 1 hr and 45 minutes before I asked to talk to a manager.  The manager was very curt and said, follow me.  There was never a Sorry mentioned.  I followed up with an email to them and HAVE NOT RECEIVED A REPLY!  The food and the waiter were mediocre.  I would recommend staying away!

This is a Target is one of the smaller ones in Tucson and very basic, but it is generally well stocked and clean, which is something that I cannot say about some of the other locations in town. 

I wish that the staff did not rely so much on the self checkout line at night. I had twenty plus items in my basket during one visit, which made using the self checkout cumbersome.

The baguette was AMAZING and some of the best bread I've purchased in SB! I also got a side of the scallion butter (in the refrigerator) which was also really good. Would definitely go back and order those two items.

I also ordered the fried chicken and biscuits but I wouldn't recommend that. The chicken was overcooked and over seasoned, and the overall dish was too savory for my preference. My friend ordered the French toast, which I had a bite of, and it was good as well!

I would recommend the baked items and the sweet brunch items but probably not the fried chicken and biscuits or the other savory brunch items.

I just don't know where to start!
This food experience was by far on the top of my list! Let's start what I liked- the exceptionally awesome energy as soon as you walk on from the Hostess.... You can tell a lot by an establishment by how happy the staff is! That leads me to our server, Ashley! She was one of the nicest servers ever! 

We ordered The Ybor egg rolls- Get them! It tasted like an upgraded Cuban Sandwich... I say upgraded because I don't like Cubans at all! They managed to elevate the flavor to taste like a fine dining experience! We also ordered the Cobb sandwich and added grilled shrimp

Insert Chef's Kiss!

The prior reviews raved about the wings but we were not particularly a fan.. they were pretty big and the appearance and texture didn't look all the way cooked. I've had this style before and not a fan of a "wet" wing. Next time I'd love to try the Poutine- one of my fave dishes but no time or room this time.

Can't wait to go back again!
If I could give it zero stars I would give them zero stars. Walked in waited for about 10-15 minutes to just be told that they don't have enough people to serve us, so we were refused service.

The food was delicious and they had a lot of gluten-free options because they offer gluten free biscuits. The biscuits themselves were a tad dry, but I was just happy to have them so no complaints here!! They also offered gluten free brownies when I went but I'm not sure if that item is always available. They offered outdoor seating which they disinfected after each attendee, and their hot chocolate was yummy. Definitely would recommend them, especially if you're in Santa Barbara and looking for a gluten-free breakfast at a cafe.
Helena Bakery was one of our favorite places to bring our family over the last few years. The quality of the menu, food and service fell during COVID and unfortunately has not recovered.
Great hot dogs very divey atmosphere.  Good quick simple meal.

The raw oysters were really great. However, we really were looking forward to and went there for the lobster rolls. The lobster rolls were good For flavor and the roll was good but the amount of lobster was really disappointing and much less than expected or for the price ($22). They could of been more generous and made it great but skimped out on the meat!

Tonight, my friends and I went to Copper Vine and it was really amazing. From the beautiful views in the courtyard to delicious wines; this was really a great dining experience. Not to mention, our waiter John was so awesome!!!! He definitely added to the entire experience. He's was very knowledgeable about the wines and everything on the menu. He was so attentive and literally was there for everything we needed! Such an amazing dinner.

Like the atmosphere, staff was nice. Mashed potato's were good yet the ribs were tuff as nails. Looked like u was sawing threw bone, yet hacking into meat. Maybe next time try the wings. Slaw was good tad to much pepper.

I can see why mikes is busy and they get high reviews. The ice cream is incredible. They have a nice long list of flavors as well as milk shakes, sundaes and soda floats. The raspberry cheese cake flavor was phenomenal. It had layers of flavor with the raspberry jam, cheese cake bits and the vanilla ice cream, just heavenly. Love the cone sleeve you get so your hands don't get sticky. When in need for a sweet treat go straight to mikes it rocks!

Had a FANTASTIC meal at copper vine! I have heard so many good reviews about this place, I made a reservation ASAP! Our reservation was ready right when we got there and we sat in the upstairs dining room! Not very loud and a great view! Their menu was so hard to pick from! My party ended up sharing a bunch of appetizers since we couldn't choose just a few! 

1. Tuna tartare and caviar- amazing! My favorite appetizer out of all 6. Flavor is amazing and it spreads so easily on the crackers! Love that it comes with avocado on the bottom! 
2. Pork belly and corn fried oysters- loved these so much! Flavor was great and loved that they came with blue cheese crumbles and ranch! They come in an order of 3, but the ones we got were quite small. Taste was amazing though! 
3. Bianca flatbread- so delicious. More on the plain side on the flatbread options, so we decided to add charcuterie! Definitely added flavor to it! It was cheesy and delish! 
4. Bacon wrapped dates- I love seeing dates on a menu, I was excited to see them served at copper vine. They were warm and delicious! The syrup on top really made them worth it! If you don't like dates, I would still try it! The bacon flavor really changes the way you will think about dates! 
5. Burrata and heirloom tomatoes- literally mouth watering. My second favorite thing and maybe even tied with the tuna! The burrata and tomato mixture was just so good. The cheese was so creamy and the tomatoes had so much flavor. It came with crispy pieces of bread that made the whole burrata experience! 
6. Gnocchi Au gratin- this was good but very heavy. When it came out, it looked like baked Mac n cheese! I like that the top was crunchy and the inside was creamy. This app will fill you up fast if you have too much though! 

Of course we did pair some wines with our apps, and they were so good as well. If you like sweet drinks, their sangrias will be perfect for you! Otherwise, they have a huge wine list!

What happened?  

It's been at least 5 years since I've eaten here, and while it was never my favorite it was decent to occasionally very good.  I only went back because it was a lunch date with my little sister and she picked it out (even though I suggested other places, she likes "italian" food and wanted to try this)

I realize everyone is cutting back these days, so I wasn't surprised to see they no longer had fresh cut flowers but other than that the interior was as I remembered it.  Still cozy and lovely with the dim lighting and spacious seating.  

The menu looked different from what I remembered, and they were featuring a promotional tapas for 2 menu.  1 tapa (appetizer) and 1 entree pp.  These were generally the cheaper menu items, but still a savings of $2-$6 pp if you were to order an app and entree each.  I think there was a selection of about 6 different items on each section.  They were out of the only entree that appealed to me and would not make a comparable substitution.  I wanted the chicken and mushroom cannelloni but ended up with a grilled chicken breast with angel hair pasta caprese.  My sister chose a creamy rigatoni dish with chicken.  We shared the goat cheese stuffed peppers and the zucchini fritto.  

The portions were large but the food was disgusting.  The zucchini fritto was paperthin slices of zucchini breaded and fried.  There were burned bits and other bits that were doughy and clumped together.  It lacked flavor and was greasy.  The peppers were interesting, tangy pickled peppers stuffed with cream cheese and heated then topped with fried bread crumbs and balsamic glaze drizzle.  I think they would have been much better served cold.  My sisters pasta was a giant bowl of rigatoni in a watery sauce and slices of chicken breast that look like the type of pressed chicken you get in school lunches.  Even with a lot of added parmesean cheese it was very bland.  My dish was a tough black charred chicken breast (again, tasted like formed chicken)  a glob of solidified angel hair pasta with a few cubes of mozzerella all melted together with wilted basil (I'm guessing my dish sat under a heater for a while).  The arugula salad it was served with was mostly spinach, again wilted with a dab of garlicky pesto.  I had literally two bites of food before I pushed my plate away. The chicken was dry and tough and tasted of salt and char, the pasta tasted of salt and old tomatoes.  I did enjoy the warm bread.  

Aside from terrible food, my final gripe is a petty one.  My sister ordered a peach lemonade and I ordered an "italian soda" which was soda water plus the same peach syrup in my sister's lemonade.  These beverages were listed together on the menu (no price listed so I assumed they were overpriced).  They were $3 each, but what annoyed me was that I asked for a refill and was told the soda did not have refills, but the lemonade did.  My soda came in a tall narrow glass packed with ice and could not have held more than 4 oz of liquid in all.  My sister's lemonade was a 20oz glass with about 1/4 full of ice.  I could understand if they opened a fresh bottle of pellegrino per soda, but this was just soda water from a soda gun so I don't see why it would cost more for refills?  Or why it wasn't listed separate from the free refill drinks like tea and lemonade?

I was walking by and I saw the ratings I said after the big Philly steak cheese it will be interesting to have something sweet and cool. So I got my coffee scoop which was huge in a sugar cone. I couldn't finish it. But it was really good and has a lot of juice in it, not dry style. Very entertaining Street..

Fantastic atmosphere, enticing menu, and super convenient to State St.

The egg and bacon sandwich was a beautiful concoction to behold, though the eggs could have used some seasoning (any seasoning - even chopped fresh herbs would have been awesome).  Next time I'll get the enormous cinnamon roll, which was a glorious sight to behold!

I'm not a big fan on chain restaurants but I have to say their 5 for $25 is an amazing deal. It really should be called $25 for 2 fat guys or 5 teen age girls for $25 .. Although the later is probably not appropriate for obvious reasons.

Two small loaves of bread, a heaping serving of Caesar (which was actually invented in Tijuana, but that's another story) and a big thing of pasta.. For $25? How can you go wrong?

My location in Reno uses Doordash and was here in less than 40 min. 

It's filling and enough for a leftover lunch the next day. 

Is the food 'authentic' Italian? No. Is it delicious? I thought so.

The deal is only valid Mon-Thur but your lazy butts should be cooking on the weekend during the pandemic anyway so no excuse.

And for you Karen idiots that reviewed this place during lock down I say.. 'Idiots have a way of getting what they deserve'.. I'm pretty sure Buddha would have said that had he known a Karen.

Although the appearance of Helena Avenue Bakery is certainly consistent with the typical rustic/wooden/modern farmhouse cafe vibe, please don't come here expecting a dainty meal! 

I ordered the breakfast sandwich on a biscuit and it was no piddly little McDonald's sausage biscuit. Each "half" is basically a giant one on its own, sandwiching a THICK square baked egg, cheddar cheese, and THICK crispy bacon. I realized that in order to physically take a bite, I had to remove the top biscuit (very buttery and flaky by the way) and eat it open-faced. This sandwich made me feel extremely well-nourished. 

My friends and I shared a cinnamon roll which was also THICK. It's a huge cube and the icing/cinnamon was generous and well-distributed. 

Great spot for breakfast and it's fun to watch the hustle and bustle of the back kitchen while you're eating!

Looking for a cute brunch date with your gals and a nice patio? Copper Vine has it all! Can't forget the cute bathroom pics either. Their backdrop is beautiful. 
Booked this place two weeks in advance for a party of 9 on Open Table (love restaurants that use this platform)! Gave this place 4 stars because the food is good, but nothing crazy! Our waiter was amazing. Food came out really fast and they kept checking up on us. Always a plus for us, especially a large group of 9! The crawfish beignets are bomb. Have to get this! I had the LA crawfish grilled cheese, I liked this a lot as well. The lamb appetizer was very flavorful and really good. The crab Benny was okay. Truffle fries are a must here as a side. If you're looking to get a cool drink, I would recommend the frozen Sangria. A pitcher if you're feeling it! Overall, great experience, good time with friends and the staff is great! Can't beat the outdoor patio. It gets hot quickly in NOLA weather but worth it in the spring!

I love the idea, but not the execution and what that idea actually looks like...  The draw for me was a playground combined with a bar.  What could be bad about that?  I can have a beer or two and my 2 year old can burn energy on the pirate ship playground.  

A few problems.  First, the beer wasn't very good (didn't have any food) and until they refine their brewing, they need to offer at least a few other local brewers' offerings.  Second, somebody is going to get hurt.  There is just too much glassware and areas where kids can fall (adults were not even honoring the no glassware on the pirate ship sign).  It really is just a matter of time.  As another parent put it, "this is my nightmare."  Third, many of the older kids (6-8) ran amok unsupervised creating problems for younger kids (for a while older kids took over the slide by only going up the slide...).  I might have been there on a particularly rowdy afternoon, but as I said above, it's just a matter of time before someone gets hurt. 

And, while I'm not a playground lawyer, I don't think their no glassware on the pirate ship signs will save them from liability.

First time visit. Everything very good.

Peanut avocado rolls - good but wouldn't get again
Cooked:
Creamy rock shrimp - would def get again
Wentz/Hurts Rolls - would get again because I don't eat raw and there's not too many cooked rolls options 
Wasabi fried rice - we split between 2 people and it's hard for me to have wasabi but I managed to enjoy enough of it. It's light but you still do feel it in your nose. 

Has raw fish so I did not try but am told they were very good and they looked very good to me. Wish there could be cooked fish versions:
Old City rolls
Geisha rolls

Very nice restaurant setting. Too cold though because of the fans above. AC was already on so not sure why the fans were needed. Very good service and everything prompt. Food was also quick to come out. Pricey though, for two people this was about $100. Can't dine in too often, we'll probably do more takeout of smaller orders. But highly recommend this place if you want to go to a nice place with good food and good service. Totally worth it. They have good standards.

Caviar & Bananas is a great place to grab a healthy breakfast and probably lunch. The inside is light and bright and there is an awesome patio outside overlooking 21st ave. I had the fried egg and prosciutto sandwich and fresh fruit. The sandwich was great but the cantaloupe in the fruit mix was quite hard. My husband got the BELT and parmesan potatoes. The sandwhich was also awesome but the potatoes were a little weird tasting. I didn't get a mimosa but the people around me who had one looks quite pleased. I will grab one next time around. 

The parking in the attached garage is free for one hour with validated parking. This is a perk considering if you go to nada next door it's $3 an hour.
We were here with friends to see their kid's play hockey and had a few drinks and apps at the Top Shelf. Apps were really good, egg rolls, tuna, quesadilla.

I passed by here from the south side and was surprised I had stumbled upon a meeting the staff was just beginning. I was troubled because it was the second time I had stopped by to fill a growler and it isn't often misfortune strikes consecutively.

Luckily, Jerry, one of the employees at Bier shuffled me in the door and was happy to oblige. I was  referred to Bier by a friend who described their beer as the Lamborghini of beers.

Sure enough they were right! I had stopped in to fill a growler of their Pumpkin Ale for a friend...which was good...and ended up getting a growler of their Autumn Saison...which was equally amazing.

The Pumpkin has a rich taste with a very nutmeg finish...the Saison a taste of roasted goodness almost like a perfect cup of coffee.  To put it plainly, these beers are good'er than hell.

Anyone who reads this should give them a try, I highly recommend them and will go back for sure!
I love this place, the food was great we came in for lunch and Troy is awesome as ever. Every time we dine In they treat us like family.

We love it soo much here the food is always  delicious and the food never disappoints. the manager Troy is always delightful and keeps us laughing we feel like we're at home. When my family and I come in they know the food/ drinks that we like. Also when you sign up you get a coupon every week so that also keeps us coming back

Terry Lugar responded promptly and arrived precisely at the appointed time.  He correctly diagnosed complete failure of our Bosch washing machine as the result of motor graphite brush wear and spent over a half hour describing our options (replace brushes or replace machine) and their cost.  I valued his insights and went with the cheaper brush replacement.  He ordered the parts and returned two days later (again, precisely on time) to complete the repair.  Machine is running fine and there is a 90 day warranty on the repair.  I highly recommend him.

My mother and I went to the Italian Festival last Saturday, as I work in the area. There was plenty of food, family, music, and vendors. 

I wanted to try a new place with great food and service. As always, I read the reviews and pick my spots. So attempting to visit Bar One was not out of the ordinary. Well, as we walked through the festival, we saw a young lady passing out flyers to everyone. To my surprise, as when we got closer, she looked us in our faces, and turned around...mine you, there was no other individuals close to her to pass out the flyers, then us. At this point, I replied that maybe the business that she was representing had an exclusion policy. At that point, an older gentleman standing near her, heard the remark, apologized, and passed us a flyer. 

To my surprise, the flyer was from Bar One! At that point, we continued to walk to the end of the festival, and I was still interested in visiting Bar One. After reaching the end of the festival, we turned around and began to walk back. As we neared the Bar One vicinity, another gentleman was now passing out the flyers. As we approached closer to go near the front of the Bar One, the gentleman did not look at us to give a flyer to either. It was obvious that this second time within a 45 minute span was NOT an accident. We simply didn't fit the identity of their clientele. Point taken.

Bustling little hole in the wall place. Many, many homemade ice cream flavor options, coffees, milkshakes and more. 
There was a line, but it went fast.
Limited seating, but people ate quickly and seats cleared. 
Flavorful and delicious treat, while in Savannah. Just go :)

If you're looking for creamy ice cream to combat the humid, hot weather, come to Mike's Ice Cream. Such a refreshing and much-needed dessert to munch on during our exploration of Downtown Nashville after dinner.

Sadly, they didn't have the containers for sundaes, so we weren't able to try their banana split and also no samples available to test different ice cream flavors. The inside wasn't terribly packed with people, but we didn't feel comfortable sticking around once we got our ice cream.

+ PARKING: Since Downtown Nashville was pretty much dead due to COVID-19, it was extremely easy to find STREET PARKING right across the street from Mike's.

+ FOOD: The ice cream is all hand-made here at Mike's and they offer everything from ice cream scoops on a cone to shakes to ice cream sodas. Their flavors aren't really as wacky as I've seen from some artisan ice cream shops, but interesting enough to put a twist on classic flavors.

We went with your classic STRAWBERRY ice cream and a new-to-us TENNESSEE FUDGE ice cream scoop in a cup. The strawberry was so good! This isn't just your basic store-bought strawberry pint variety. The strawberry ice cream at Mike's comes with generous chunks of strawberry and I swear our ice cream took forever to actually melt. But that's maybe because we gobbled up all our ice cream too fast. It was so smooth and amount of ice cream in their scoops is generous! The strawberry paired really well with their Tennessee fudge. The Tennessee fudge is supposedly their best-selling flavor and it's a vanilla-based ice cream with ribbons of chocolate fudge and chocolate chunks mingled in. Not too rich to the point where my teeth ached, but just enough chocolate to satisfy my craving. The bits of fudge were delicious and I liked how we accidently ended up with a neapolitan ice cream combo with our two scoops.

We were also able to snag some Goo Goo Clusters here! (As if we needed more sugar in system)

+ PRICE: Competitive and even borderline cheap for the amount of ice cream they pack in their scoops. Most artisan ice cream shops I've come across would charge the same price for 2/3 the amount of ice cream Mike's gives you. For two scoops of ice cream (large), they charge about $5. What a steal!

Overall: If you're in Downtown Nashville, give this place a try. I highly recommend their ice cream and it'll keep you cool. Classic flavors and offerings with a little modern twist.

The food and ambience are good. Everything is fairly priced. The serving staff frequently checked in on us to see if we wanted anything else. 
Will go back again and would recommend this place to a friend 
Verdict:3.8/5
John was an incredible server who set us up with a great wine selection and was super personable. Will definitely be back soon.
I just drove across town to eat here and the restaurant is almost empty at 6:14 on this Monday evening.  They said it will be an hour wait because there are only 2 cooks in the kitchen.

My favorite food truck! Their margaritas are so good! The lemon lime I had tonight was just as good as the mango one I had a few weeks ago. Love that they change the flavors! The guys who run the truck are super nice. Worth a trip to Feed the Camel to just have one of these margaritas!

We had the most superlative experience at chic Copper Vine last night. It started a few weeks ago when requested space for a private party with 25 people within a certain budget. Not only did Mike speedily respond with the friendliest invitation and enthusiasm for our event, he kept up that standard of communication every time we emailed asking for this or that small tweak as our final guest count kept wavering and the party's dietary restrictions filtered in. He provided a quick solution at each turn. 

The food and drink menu choices he offered blew me away with the variety and creativity. Terrific balance of regional specialties and nouveau cuisine choices. I was able to make selections to accommodate all of our known food issues among guests while having a spectacular menu. The contract process was smooth and split up into two payments which made spreading out the cost very convenient. Furthermore the contract was very clearly spelled out and perfectly aligned with my own math, no surprises! 

The service itself was unparalleled. Antonio and Dylan meticulously made sure no one's beverage was empty. They accommodated ad-hock special requests (no mushrooms on one, allowing another guest to order something not on the pre-arranged menu) with cheerful professionalism. With each of the 4 courses, it seemed as though we were all magically served each plate at once. They made sure my mom - the guest of honor - felt honored without provoking any fear of a humiliating public fuss over her birthday. These gentlemen have mastered their craft. 

Onto the food! MY LORD AND ALL THE SAINTS IN HEAVEN was the culinary portion of the party beyond. Beyond what? Everything, that's what. Course 1: We started with caprese skewers - perfectly proportioned with just enough balsamic glaze to pop the flavors of the basil, cheese, and perfectly ripe pretty tomatoes. The goat cheese fig flatbread was another masterpiece of balanced flavors and texture. Course 2: The gumbo was flavorful, obviously made with a rich roux, but light enough to reasonably be a mere amuse-bouche leading up to the stars of the show. However my favorite was the arugula sunflower salad. It's bright citrusy front notes perfectly transitioned into the fresh peppery notes and cool texture of the arugula. Course 3: Wild Shrimp and Grits. Utterly swoon worthy. The alternate Herb-roasted wild mushroom pasta served with a sous-vide egg that upped the intensity of the creamy velvety delightful texture was sheer brilliance. The only reason I didn't finish mine was anticipation of Course 4: Bananas Foster Rum Cake. I swear you will never experience it's equal anywhere else. I'm still fantasizing about it a day later. 

This was truly the event of a lifetime. Every detail was thought of. They care the took to elevate my mother's birthday celebration into an elegant yet festive and intimate epic experience my family will remember forever deserves a loud round of applause. I wish I could nominate them for whatever the equivalent of an Oscar would be in their industry. 

The very last touch of the evening was discreetly  presenting me with a substantial card stock version of the personalized menu cards as my party was saying their goodbyes before dispersing home across the country. This extra touch perfectly personifies the care they poured into every detail, making what I'm sure was epic behind the scenes work seem effortless to us.
Some of the best sushi I have had in the city. Well priced for good quality sushi, not boney. Also their brussel sprouts are OUT of this world. Great date night spot as well as friends night out!
Food is just bad, they don't require mask wearing, service is terrible and the play area is unsafe. All around disappointed.
Delicious green egg sandwich. Great breakfast with quality ingredients. The funk zone during week is so much more pleasant than on weekends. Peace & quiet vs overcrowded craziness.

Great breads, cookies and cakes. Great service, and the owner who works on Sun. always has a friendly smile to greet you and make you feel welcome. Also sell moon cakes for the Autumn Fest. and New Year cookies. 2 of my favs are the butter buns and the green tea roll cake.

If you all use Chase or you are considering this bank- I highly recommend you DO NOT use Chase. It appears that their fraud department is highly flawed in many ways. In September 2018- I reported fraud as I got an alert for nearly $3,000 at Saks Fifth Avenue. I was supposed to receive a new credit card in the mail, but it never made it to my home. 

As I filed the report- chase took care of the transaction and removed it from my account. However, this FRAUD transaction reappeared on my bank account on November 28, 2018. I called chase and spoke to several reps. They had then accused me of actually making this transaction and said "no offense, but then why did you ask for 2 new credit cards". I had THEN explained that me new credit card had never been sent, so I had to cancel that one and then order a new one . ALSO another FLAW from Chase end.

With that being said- I sent a picture of my ID with my signature because they stated they found a receipt from the store with a signature on it and want to ensure that it's not my signature.

I then replied asking if they could take off the charge until they got the results on the investigation, but stated they could not. So not only did they not follow through with getting all of their evidence before RE-CHARGING my account- they had no solutions except for saying "just don't pay it".

ALSO, note that my credit card is due in TWO days, so I asked "if I don't pay- will you guys cover the interest that you will charge me for not paying". The rep stated, "no sorry". 

I have been a member of Chase for 10 years and I have NEVER owed any interest or have any overdue payments. My husband and I collectively have 6 accounts with Chase and will close all of them out because Chase is not customer oriented.

I hope you all close yours, too !
I don't care about the fancy hip scene. I just appreciate the good sushi prepared at proper temperatures.

Quite disappointed.  Food was overall fine and I was able to eat it, but nothing special at all.   Latte was not good.  Got breakfast sandwich, salmon bagel, and biscuits. All were average at best.  Service was quite poor, told server that there were no clean utensils and he just blew past me.

Friends and I had a blast for bottomless brunch on a Saturday early afternoon. As soon as we arrived, we were brought upstairs and seated close to the balcony. The lighting was gorgeous, as was the moody decor in the room. Our server Antonio greeted us promptly and was a delight!

We ask for menu recommendations, and learned that you truly could not go wrong with anything you ordered. We were told that bottomless brunch was available for $25 per person and that each person needed a meal in order to be served. That worked for us because it was exactly what we planned to do. We were brought small carafes of orange juice and cranberry juice and Antonio filled our glasses with champagne.

To eat, we shared the black truffle fries, bacon wrapped dates, crawfish beignets, and bianca flatbread. For our mains,  a friend and I shared the crab benedict and apple fritter french toast. The bacon wrapped dates were incredible, and we were able to add an additional piece to make it 4 instead of the 3 it usually comes with. Others tried the Ancient Grains Salad and the Shakshuka. Everything was a hit! 

We did not feel rushed to leave, and continued to pick at our plates while we chatted and drank our mimosas. Since our table was 6 people, there was an 18% auto-gratuity added to our check with the ability to tip on top.

What a great spot for a bottomless brunch!

We came here for the first time in 2017 & our minds were blown by the gluten free biscuits. Next SB visit in 2018 they were no longer on the menu so we gave up all hope. Then recent visit in 2021 I decided to check out the menu again & GF biscuits are back!  So obviously that was our first breakfast of the trip. They are still the best GF biscuits we've ever had but they are not as good we remembered from 2017, were a little dry. Still definitely on our SB must eat food rotation. For the gluten-y menu, I love that they use locally milled organic flour for their breads & they have sourdough bread.

Excellent: drip coffee, house made chai latte with almond milk, sourdough bread, GF brownie - one of the best GF brownies ever, farmers market bowl
Great: avocado toast, everything bagel 

Expect a long line on the weekends but it moves pretty well, the staff is efficient, & it's worth the wait.

30 minutes for a to go cappuccino?  This is absurd.  One suggestion for a more efficient way to make coffee and get it out to your customers is not to fill up multiple to go orders before bringing them out to the customers.   By the time I was able to enjoy my first sip it was luke warm.  Will not be coming back to this place ever again!

Ordered a chicken parmigiana sandwich.  They asked if provolone was ok.  The cook and most of the staff had masks around their necks but where not really wearing them.  The overall condition of the restaurant was dingy and the sandwich was not great.

I feel like there's no in between with sushi restaurants-  it's either your go to questionable delivery place for a $10 3 roll special, or it's high class fish with high class price tag at a place like Tuna Bar. 

The Bar in Tuna Bar is on point- I loved my first cocktail- The Picante (a mezcal drink with grapefruit and jalapeno), but the second cocktail was odd- wasabi and cucumber just tasted like someone blended a cucumber roll, and the wasabi chunks at the bottom were weird.

The Tuna in Tuna Bar is on par with Morimoto, Royal Izakaya and and Double Knot. Beware of the specials though, those prices add up! We had a 3 piece fatty tuna special for $21 and 2 piece yellowtail for $20. That's $41 for 5 pieces of fish. Coulda had 12 mediocre takeout rolls for that price, so it's hard to wrap my head around. But it was really good! They also had some fun looking fancy rolls and we tried the Fishtown Roll -with jalapeno and assorted fish wrapped around shrimp tempura which was very good.

We also enjoyed some apps and sides- the bang bang shrimp, brussel sprouts, lobster fried rice (large portion), and the wok fried crudo were all very good. Before we knew it our check was about $100 each. Not sure if there was dessert, since our waiter just brought the check and rushed us out a bit....

The place was busy on a Thursday night, despite it being in a bit of an odd location). The waiters seemed a bit stressed and the area they had to navigate was so narrow they seemed to constantly be excusing themselves or squeezing past each other. Hopefully they'll get into the groove of things as time goes on.

Next time you're looking to sit down and really enjoy some melt in your mouth fish not being delivered in under 35 minutes for you to watch with Netflix with, definitely try Tuna Bar!

Fantastic breakfast spot. Their bread is magic.  
Breakfast sandwich is delectable.  
Biscuit and citrus jam a treat.
Cute bakery with good coffee and delicious pastries. Counter people are super nice. And for sure get the olive oil cake! We had it every morning of our trip!
This time I had breakfast taco and it's fantastic! The food, ambiance and staff are all a joy. Every time we're in Santa Barbara, this is our go-to breakfast place.

Vietnamese Food Truck was a super perfect dinner for me tonight! I saw they were in the nearby neighborhood today, & I immediately went online to order.

Since it is a chilly winter night, I knew that Pho was perfect for me. I ordered the beef and meatball pho and it was a great amount of meat to noodle ratio. It was super tasty. 

I also ordered the bbq Pork banh mi. It had tons of flavor with it and the bread was a nice texture, not too hard and still nicely toasted.

Lastly, I ordered the Vietnamese wings with fries. The flavor is good for the wings and the fries were okay, they are the skinny ones. That was my husband's order.

When I ordered it online I received an update through text of when it would be finished and I drove across the street to get it. So super simple and convenient. 

I'm super happy to have their leftovers tomorrow!! So so good.

Thanks for coming out to the area! So nice not to go far and leave the neighborhood!

Yaaas hunny, Girls' Night Out/Date Nights/Winos UNITE! We just got a serious upgrade hit the CBD and it is LEGIT! 

My party of 4 had a 6pm reservation for Saturday night. Taylor was our server and she was the bomb.com. She recognized my party had a lot of catching up to do and gave us plenty of time to decide on drinks and food without becoming impatient. 

We started with individual 8oz carafes and as the night went on, opted for the bottle of the nectar of the God's aka the Grenache Rose on the menu.  One guest in our party had a couple of Sazeracs followed by some Crying Eagle beers (he's an Eagles fan, so it fits, ha!)

We ordered shareable apps: the charcuterie board (is it a GNO if you didn't have a cheeseboard?), brussel sprouts, and duck fat fries. All yum! For dinner, my gals ordered the margherita flatbread, the burger, and I had the club sandwich. I'll embarrassingly admit that I can't recall how it was because I was *turnt* but, I'm sure it was delicious! 

Service was top notch! In addition to Taylor being our main server, we had other staff bring our food, clear plates, refill waters very promptly. 

Our bill was..well, reflective of a good time. Pro tip: try to convince yourself to start with the bottle instead of ordering individual glasses.. you'll get there eventually, and it'll probably end up saving you a few $$. 

This place is so very Instagram-worthy so get something set up soon! I can't wait to go back!
Great breakfast spot - everything made fresh and the coffee was also very good.  The egg sandwich was amazing as well as many of the fresh pastries.

In 2002 when I was in high school I came here with my family and the service and food was the worst experience I had in my short life.  I hadn't been back due to my dad swearing he'd never go back and I followed suit.  Since then I have traveled and eaten all over this earth and experiencing MRE's that were better quality than the food.  Today 07/01/2020 a friend offered to buy me some food from here with some gift cards she had.  The food turned out about as good as it was in 2002 and I would still prefer a pork sausage and gravy MRE to the food at this restaurant if the food was free it would still be over priced.  I have had frozen chicken fries and expired beef jerky that was better than the steak they made.

This place was unbelievably awful. After waiting over and hour and 30 mins to get our food we were delivered dry flavorless food. The chili looked like diarrhea, the Stromboli was burnt, my canoli was sour, and fries were cold. This place should be closed down. Very disappointing and very lousy. Just like my friend Cj.

Chase is terrible, also they are involved in the drug trade and human trafficking of minors. Never ever ever bank with chase. They are evil and they disregard the African American community. Also, please next time you're in there take notice that everyone in there is heterosexuals. Funny huh? Coincidence? No. They openly discriminate against homosexuals with sheer immunity because of their involvement with selling children to trump. It's a fact that John Pierre Morgan was a creep and he used aborted black slave children to make dumplings.

So I read all the reviews and I finally ordered via Uber Eats. I love the house wings! They are famous wings! Best I have had in Tampa Bay Area. I got the Hat-Trick appetizer and it was enough for two meals for me. I enjoyed the chips and the ybor roll was good I just prefer the wings. Kudos to the chef and staff at Top Shelf. I plan to visit in the future or order from Uber Eats again. Lastly, Lightning Strikes Twice! Go Bolts!

Helena Avenue is a great bakery that has amazing breakfast. The line gets long on the weekends and they sell out of baked goods fast so get there early. I've tried the egg and bacon biscuit sandwich, the mortadella egg sandwich, the grit bowl, and a variety of baked goods (cookies, bread pudding). I highly recommend the egg sandwiches. It is order at the counter but there is a lot of seating. Go now - you won't be disappointed!

I want to start off by saying this place is really cool and the food and beer was delicious. My 3 star review is due to frustration. I went yesterday with a group of people, it was the first gorgeous day so I was looking all over for places that were dog friendly so we could sit outside with our pup. On the website it says verbatim:

"Q: CAN I BRING MY DOGGO??

A: Your pup is more than welcome to join you for a pint but they'll need to stay in the outside seating area. Only service doggos are allowed inside."

I called numerous times to double check but the phone number sends you right to a voicemail box. Regardless I figured since the website explicitly says dogs are allowed we should be okay. So we load everyone up in the car and take the 25 minute drive. When we arrive I go inside first to see how to get to the outdoor area without going through the bar because of the dog. The bouncer asks me if it's a service dog and I said "no" and he told me dogs aren't allowed. I explained to him what the website said and how we were just going to sit outside and he tells me "this is a people establishment". It was veryyyy frustrating. I understand dogs not being allowed inside and I even understand restaurants and breweries not being dog friendly, but maybe if you're NOT dog friendly, don't say on your website that you are ... anyway so I had to leave everyone there, drive my pup back home the 25 minutes then turn around and come right back. 

Good food, good beer and cool atmosphere but I guess don't believe anything on their website ...

What a delightful place for a Saturday morning brunch. My friend and I were so pleased with every bite!! The lox on everything bagel was perfect...every topping was tastefully placed. The breakfast sandwich...love when it's easy to eat and not falling apart. Our lattes were delicious, too. We wished we ordered more to take home. The line is long but moves quickly!

O M F G

Amazeballs.

Easily the bestest ice cream I have had in years. 

It was a Loaded Caramel and it was soooo good. So good I didn't take a picture, I just devoured it. Besides, a picture would not do it justice anyway. 

Too bad there isn't a 6 star rating.
Visited for the first time last week, and we will definitely be back. Outdoor patio is lovely and lump crab deviled eggs and Brussel sprouts were standouts! Service was efficient but not rushed.

The bakery was very simple and didn't have many items out on display but the woman who helped us was very nice and friendly. We bought two pork buns and a milk boba/tapioca tea. The tea and the buns were both very good. We asked that the buns be warmed up and she quickly obliged. We ate them as soon as we got back in the car.

Fresh, homemade ice cream!  This place is definitely worth a stop. They offer approximately 30 different flavors of ice cream as well as various flavors of hot chocolate. Several of the flavors are unique -  blackberry cornbread, loaded butterscotch, Mr Goodbar as examples. 

I chose the chocolate overload and chocolate peanut butter cup. Both were fantastic!  Fresh and smooth. 

You have the option to order ice cream in a cake cone, dish, sugar cone, waffle cone, or dipped waffle cone. There are also shakes and sundaes available. The team was very helpful in finding the perfect combination for you!

Today I had an experience of terrible customer service. Miguel was helping us at the counter to buy two items--a sweater and a jacket. The jacket was from a circular rack with a very large red placard labeled $30. It was black and they were three other black ones on the rack. However it did not have a $30 sticker on the tag like the same jacket in other colors on the rack, but there were the same black jackets hanging on the wall that were not on sale.  We thought there was a good chance it was not $30 so when I walked up we told him that we got it off the $30 rack, but was it really $30?  My daughter was prepared to pay the $60 price, but we wanted to clarify. He stepped out from behind the counter and looked over at the rack and said, " oh, those jackets are just starting at $30." It didn't look that way from the big sign. That was probably not true, But an associate probably just put them back on the wrong rack after emptying out the changing rooms.. I said "OK, but that is misleading so maybe you can ask someone to move the other black ones up to the wall for the sake of other customers. "I think this offended him because at that point he turned away and would not look up and did not respond when I said again, "it's just kind of misleading."  Then I was sure he was ignoring me because he wouldn't look up at us, so I said his name from his name tag and I asked if he heard me. At that point, I definitely was verging on being rude myself, but I was so shocked that he was completely ignoring me as a customer service person at the counter of a retail store that I couldn't resist asking him if he heard me. And I wasn't asking him to honor the lower price at all. Anyway, the experience was very strange, and I definitely do not want to shop there anymore because it felt very disrespectful. Miguel needs some serious customer service training.
I had an amazing black cherry and chocolate raspberry truffle milkshake! The other 2 adults had a single scoop on a cone.

Teresa and Alfredo were such a joy to be around tonight. Their service was phenomenal and we couldn't be happier with the wonderful conversations and food we shared tonight! I highly recommend coming here for a nice dinner! 
Request Teresa and Alfredo to wait your next meal!

Super friendly staff and fantastic ice cream. Atmosphere was good. LONG line, but that's always a good sign you've found a good place. We were originally going to Legendary Milkshakes just up the road, but the lines were so long and the prices were so expensive, that we changed to Mike's ice cream, and it was a GREAT decision. The prices were 50% less, and better reviews.
Terrific experience!  Fast and affordable.  Got the job done right on the first try.  Very professional.  I would definitely recommend.

Overall solid food. Hat a couple of hit a misses here but overall good here is good. Wings and burgers and GREAT! We had the nachos this time which was disappointing. They were somewhat cold and the brisket was tough and lacked flavor. The quesadilla never disappoints. Warm okey gooey cheese and the chicken is tender and juicy! Beer is ice cold here so be prepared to be refreshed!

So much fun! We stopped in here for a bite to eat at Happy Hour yesterday and I'm so glad we did. I had the charcuterie board and the most beautiful and delicious drink I've ever seen. It had lavender in it but I don't remember the name. The staff was attentive and on their A game the entire time. I would definitely recommend.

We came to Tuna Bar early on a Friday night and they started is at a cozy table by the wall immediately. Service was good and everything we got (listed below) was delicious:

Avocado sushi
Sweet potato roll
Broad Street roll 

The house special for happy hour was $7 which is amazing and it was a Pomegranate  cosmo, which wasn't too sweet at all.

They ended up needing our table though right after we had paid, and what makes this place 5 stars ++ for me is that they offered to move us to the bar and give us another round of drinks on the house for moving. I've never experienced that and it just made the act of having to move so much more pleasant. 

The service was just really outstanding, the food was great, and the drinks were delicious.

Nice to see something with food taking the place of happys. Clearly good place to try for wine enthusiasts, but they also have good mixed drinks

At a recent visit, got a ruby soho that was amazing. Got a second for a friend, also amazing. Then we ordered a second round, but guess the bartender changed and got a completely different drink. They tried again, but wasn't the same as the first. Not sure what happened, but there is some variability based on bartender I suppose

I've been to a lot of breweries and a lot of taprooms and I can say that this may in fact be my favorite one. I love walking into what can sometimes be calming atmosphere and sometimes a loud, fun atmosphere. There is a somewhat homey feeling to it with the large couches and wooden tables and chairs. When it is full, you will usually end up sitting next to someone you've never met, which makes it great because you are all there for the same reason: BEER! and usually can start some conversation.

Now lets get to the beer. I have not had a beer there that I did not like. From the PDG to the ESB, the Kolsch and the Weizengoot, it is all great. Wednesdays are pint night, and they have euchre night on Thursdays. One of the best parts is that you can bring your dog. We were a little unsure of bringing ours until we walked in and found 5 or 6 others in there all enjoying this selves. It's a great place for the whole family (adults and dogs, no kids obvs since it's Indiana).This place is a must for anyone big into craft beer.
Thank you to our server Kate . Couldn't ask for a better person very sweet , kind and a good listener
Excellent Service and Communication.  Easy to schedule.  Great work. Good people.

I love sushi and I kept hearing up Tuna Bar from friends so you know I had to check it out. I had a little trouble finding the entrance but it could have been because I was freezing and has almost fell 2x on black ice. The restaurant is quite small and quaint and dimly lit. It's very cute and definitely to my liking aesthetically. We started with the creamy rock shrimp which was yummy but wish we had a bit more portion wise for the two of us do share. Then we got 5 different kinds of sushi to try out from specialty rolls to the basic spicy tuna. They were all good, nothing crazy. Great drinks too!

The crispy roast pork is SO GOOD and lowkey it's 2 little buns stack next to each other for the price of 1. Amazing amazing and can't recommend enough.

When I got there ~2 pm the bun I got was warm!

Go to spot in old city. Always fresh and pleasant ambiance. Ordered 3 rolls (the dynamite roll, the spicy salmon roll and the fishtown roll) between my sister and I and enjoyed all of them. Their standard roll prices are reasonable between $7-9. Speciality on the other hand a bit pricey. The fishtown roll was $17, although it was incredible and would definitely order again.

The current covid situation: QR menus to scan on your phone. Mask needed in order to enter the building for restrooms. One thing I wish they would have done is QR payment like some of the other restaurants in the city. Hope they at least clean the check/credit card holders!

Everything was delicious! Ordered a sake flight along with the wasabi fried rice and rock shrimp. The rice was amazing, flavorful & the crab was perfectly cooked. Staff was super accommodating! My water cup stayed full & someone was always nearby & available for our random requests for extra places & cups to split dishes. Had a great overall experience
Cute place with some good options . Entrees but crack mode but the starters were decent, drinks looked pretty good but I am 13 so I couldn't get one.

This was my third time going to this Twin Peaks location and I have yet to be disappointed. The food is always good, the services is great and the beer is greater! They have awesome drink specials most days of the week and their food is well priced for the amount that you get. 

We walked in and got sat right away, the last time I went it was a Football Sunday and we were still able to be sat promptly. This time our server was Jayla and SHE WAS ON IT! She was a great server and was very attentive to detail. I got the Avocado Smash Burger with a side Caesar Salad. This burger was cooked perfect and their candied bacon -- I believe they are known for it -- was my dessert. The side Caesar comes with a lot of dressing so I would suggest you get it on the side as you can always order more. We also ordered an appetizer of Loaded Fries - Hickory Smoked Pulled Pork and they were phenomenal as well - you caught a subtle hint of hickory in each bite.

Overall I would definitely recommend trying this place out if you haven't and I will definitely be going back soon!

West Chester is full of good restaurants, don't bother to stop here.
Two of four orders were mixed up.  We asked for one to be corrected, "Oops,Sorry!  We will have it in 5 minutes."  It came in 15.  We let the other misorder slide, big mistake.  The salmon was fishy, the shrimp were small and over cooked, and the scallops were like rubber.  While two people were eating their entrees a desert tray was offered to the other two diners, Then, the power went out and the fire alarm went off.  That was beyond their control, but they told everyone to ignore the alarm?  Oh well, it was a night to remember!

I made reservations and when we arrived there was a sign that said take a seat anywhere (I even waited and wanted to speak to someone because i had a large party and wanted to sit where I was supposed to. It got crowded after two hours and other patrons came over and tried to take our table and I explained we had both (party of 8) and then a worker came over and asked if we had reservations I said yes then another worker came over and asked what the name on my reservations was and I told her. I was not happy because even if I hadn't had reservations I had been there with a large party eating and drinking for two hours and told to sit anywhere even after I had made reservations. I really love this place and everything else about it so was disappointed by this treatment

I stayed here on several nights per week a 3-month work assignment. What a wonderful hotel. Breakfast offers something for everyone and is complimentary, the beds and rooms were consistently fresh and clean, and the staff is incredibly polite and professional. They really decorated for the Christmas and holiday season which was a little piece of home away from home and much enjoyed. I highly recommend staying here if you are in the area - you won't be disappointed.

4.5 stars. I had dinner last night here for my birthday and it was delicious! I would recommend making a reservation though, especially on the weekend. Our reservation was at 8:30 and our table wasn't quite ready yet when we got there so we got a drink at the bar while we waited. Our table was ready about 15 minutes later at 8:45, but it was worth the wait because they seated us on the first level at a little booth with plush velvet, super comfortable!

Side note: do not forget your ID especially on your birthday! I'm embarrassed to say that I made this mistake (I had switched purses, it's a girl thing) so I had to run home to grab it. So it was fine that our table wasn't ready right away. And the bartender was so nice and felt bad that I had to run home he ended up buying my first drink! I believe his name was Mike, super friendly and great bartender. 

There was just two of us and we ordered 5 dishes which was the right amount of food for us. They are tapas style and made for sharing it seems. Our food also came out pretty quick. We were full by the end but not busting at the seams. They bring each dish out as they are ready instead of bringing it all out at once which I like so you're not waiting for a long time to eat. 

We started off with the wedge salad. It was skewers of lettuce with a ginger dressing on top. Fresh and tasty, although maybe a little pricey. 

Next we had the Okonomiyaki which was delicious. It was a crispy savory hashbrown type pancake with sauces and toppings on top. Highly recommend!

Then we had the Tebasaki Gyoza. Do not be fooled by the name, it is not a gyoza. It is actually a deboned chicken wing stuffed with a mixture of shrimp. There is a chili sauce for dipping. This is probably unusual for most people. The outer crust was super crispy which I loved. It had also come out super fresh and hot. A sign it was made to order and hadn't been sitting for a while. My boyfriend was so so about this dish, but I really liked it. So it depends on the person. 

After came the spicy crab noodles which had come highly recommended. It was very saucy and rich. It wasn't as spicy as I thought it would be although there was a good amount of crab in there. I would recommend mixing it up before you start as all of our crab and stuff had kind of settled towards the bottom. I didn't end up loving this dish as I had thought I would. The flavors were a bit muddled and maybe a little too rich for me. 

Lastly, we had the ikinari steak. It's American skirt steak on a bed of sweet corn and onions with a generous scoop of the miso butter. It was cooked perfectly medium rare and came out on a sizzling skillet. So for those who don't like their meet too rare, it does continue to cook a bit after it comes out. The steak was super tender and had a sauce on top. For me it could have had a little less sauce so the steak could shine, but still delicious nevertheless. It was a little difficult to eat the corn with chopsticks though haha. I could have asked for other utensils, but I didn't want to be "that person."

Overall it was a great experience. The decor instead was beautiful, with a mix of mid century furniture and more luxurious touches like the velvet booths. Everyone we encountered was friendly and our server was great, very knowledgeable and nice. Would definitely come back to try the other dishes.

I don't think I have been literally injured while eating a sandwich. I got the BLT, which while having a delicious combination of thick bacon, sweet tomatoes, and cheese, was ruined by two slices of sourdough bricks.
