The bread had been nearly saturated with butter then over toasted, making it as rough as sandpaper. I had to stop eating the bread half way through.  When I got back to my hotel, I pressed a white towel against the roof of my mouth and it was spotted with blood
Cant get enough of this place, generous portions of rice and protein for a reasonable price
This place is amazing!!! Beautiful inside and out! The service was exceptional! The food was so good and the drinks were great! Love the vibes of this place!

I love this place! Whenever I go it's never busy, but I swear the sushi is amazing. So fresh and so yummy. I will say, I do wish their happy hour options were a little more extensive there aren't many items to choose from, but overall I'd recommend this restaurant to any sushi lover for a lunch or dinner!
Nice and clean rooms. Rooms are small though and have to unplug the lamp to have a free outlet by the bed. Pretty loud AC unit and road noise but I'm not picky.

Great ice cream selection! I got the blueberry cheesecake and caramel cone. The waffle cones look fresh and smelled great! They are not sampling at this time, but you can split flavors for a scoop! The staff was friendly and efficient. Would recommend!

Great restaurant with EXCELLENT service. Our girl Lauren V was top notch. Little things make a big difference. They automatically put us in a booth with our Resy reservation. The staff inputs drink orders on iPads so they'll be ready ASAP, before they're even done explaining the menu. I appreciated how our food recommendations were not automatically the most expensive item. The staff was even thoughtful about recommending clean plates and new chopsticks. Food was excellent, but the service was what sealed the deal. Will definitely be back!

They closed a half an hour early smh. Terrible customer service, all I wanted was a damn smoothie after I grinded at planet fitness across the street (love you PF). Do not go to this smoothie king unless they change their hours to later or else you will be highly disappointed and depressed.

The United Presidential card is inferior on points and services except for fact it allows access to the United Club, a perk not important during Covid days  It is costly-- $400 a year

The bank does not support its customers well with credit card disputes (unlike AMEX)  When I signed up for the card I was told cancellation of hotels and airfare would be refunded in full  However when a hotel merchant refused to reimburse me for $1900 during state induced lockdown from Covid, Chase did not help  They did not force the merchant to pay me back, nor reimburse me themselves   Apparently, the refund policy was not in force for Covid, a retroactive decision that stretches legality  On smaller issues like when I was charged for gym membership that I could not use, Chase again sided with the merchant  

On top of all this, Chase made it difficult to get resolution for the disputes, especially the hotel  It took a year to finally bring this to a close  You need to constantly pester them
Relaxing atmosphere. Respectful of Covid precautions. Delicious lunch! Highly recommend!
I had never been to a ''Twin Peaks'. Food was good. We had "Yvette" as our waitress. She was super nice and very cheerful. I'd come back.

Went here and don't think I will come back. Pizza was not authentic, very small pie and the cheese tasted tangy. 

This pizza is very comparable the frozen 365 Pizza you can find at Whole Foods. The shape and taste are identical.

Tuna Bar is an awesome new addition to the Old City neighborhood! 

The decor at this place rocks - the space is bright and airy and inviting. It's brand new, so it's clean and beautiful. 

The service rocks- all of the servers were super friendly, and the bartender was great. We had a tasty gin cocktail with orange. 

The food was all pretty good. The seaweed salad was decent, can't say it was particularly standout. The sushi was all tasty- fresh and presented beautifully. The crispy fried shrimp bites with tuna and caviar on top were my favorite dish - YUM. Also reallllly enjoyed the tuna tartar. 

This place is awesome- definitely worth a stop in when you're in the area!
Shay is AWESOME. He arrives quickly, communicates effectively, prices reasonably and ALWAYS gets the job done. I have used his services on many occasions and I would never call another locksmith.
We come here ALL the time.  Food is great! Todaywe haf Bri, she was a very nice young lady.

Was at the Penn Vet Hospital on a Sunday, limited food places that were convenient. Grabbed two custom hoagies, both shorti's ham and cheese, one with American, one Cheddar, lettuce tomato and Mayo. Easy enough? Not for the lazy sack making them. Cheddar on both, no Mayo on either. Not devastating but annoying for such an easy order. NE Philly Wawa's are much better!
Great swiss roll cakes! The pandan flavor is delicious. The cream is so thinly rolled in, just the way I like it--aromatic yet fluffy and light.

Pints served on Fridays and Saturdays!
Otherwise, this is a tasting place only. 

We came by on a Saturday -- the Saturday before St. Patrick's Day to be exact. How brave of us! There were party buses out front, but we were not deterred. The space is nice and has plenty of walkway room and some seating, so it never felt packed. The brewery was well-staffed so we didn't wait long before our tastes. 

It isn't the kind of place you want to go and hang out for a LONG time, but it's a nice stop through for something to do one afternoon and to sample and buy some bullets of Indiana suds.

First time in Santa Barbara and we came upon this cute spot! Our family has a lot of dietary restrictions and our server was so knowledgable and helpful guiding us through the menu. Highly recommend! BIG THANKS TO PAIGE FOR THE OUTSTANDING CUSTOMER SERVICE you really made the experience for us
So yummy! My husband and I came here to take a break from the chaos of Broadway. Good portion and yummy waffle cone

This place is on a level with Olive Garden or eastern TGIFridays in terms of menu, atmosphere, and quality. The prices are even in line with what you should expect from the Fridays/O.G. Big difference is here they give you crayons so you can doodle on the table while you wait on the next round. I don't doodle. I take colouring very seriously. Don't seat me without a minimum of five colours. Joking of course; I bring my own.

The wait staff is friendly and very efficient. They should crayon their name upside down on your butcher paper. If not, ask them to. It's different and fun.

The wine selection appears to be pretty decent, but I'm not really a wine guy. They see me coming and immediately pull the alcohol glasses from the table. They have a killer ice tea, however!

One disadvantage of aging is limited income. It makes dining out a challenge. The Macaroni Grill folks send us email coupons twice a week. Many times a BOGO. It's a great way to try different dishes and not pay full price. 

Personally, I think they have an exceptional Chicken Parm. The Spaghetti is great, too. The meatballs are a bit spicy so I don't order it very often. I absolutely refuse to come here and not split the Crispy Brussels Sprouts with Mrs. E. I think they add some secret concoction to make you crave them. A-D-D-I-C-T-I-N-G!!!!!! 

It's Italian and that means you're paying more. But they provide a gorgeous atmosphere and very hospitable people. John is one of the best and of course Troy, the big dawg whose name is on the door, is happy to meet you, anytime. 11/19

Wow- we tried Holly nails on a whim, and what a pleasure! The women working there were SO lovely, and the services were fairly priced and they truly take care of you.
Very happy with our nails. Will be back!

Male cashier real rude. I came in yesterday and a young lady helped me out ordering since it was my fist time visit. She asked if I had any allergies and explained what the sandwich came with. Today, April 2 came back for breakfast before I headed back home and the male Caucasian cashier not helpful at all. I let him know I wanted to order my San the way I ordered it yesterday and his reply was "I WASNT HERE YESTERDAY!" You kidding me??? What a yerk! He didn't bother asking or helping out. Last time I come here. He needs customer service training. If he were to be fired I'd come back. Great spot but awful service from this cashier.

My husband and I have decided to have our lunch in this establishment, it's been quite awhile since last visited this restaurant.  The Maitre D welcomed us with swarm smiled and immediately seated us on a nice, cozy window booth.  The restaurant ambiance created a romantic old world feel.  Our friendly server Julian was accommodating and very thoroughly presented us their luncheon specials including their limited time, best flavors of the harvest season menus.  I have tried their Shrimp Portofino and my husband choose their Chicken Alfredo both were very tasty  we accompanied our meal with their raspberry ice tea.  The quick lunch was very refreshing and added more energy for our hectic afternoon errand.  Looking forward to visit them again this coming holiday when families and relatives comes to visit in town.
We are big fans of Tuna Bar, especially for a quick and quiet weekend lunch. Their fish tastes super fresh and their sushi rolls are amazing.

First time here. First impressions: This is a fun place. Lots of TVs, very casual atmosphere. The waitresses were wearing less than I expected but they were very classy. Everyone seemed like they had a great personality. Our waitresses were so attentive and helpful. Shout out to Jackie and Azlin for making it a great date night! The food was amazing. We got the chips and salsa to start. The chips were warm and the warm salsa was so good. I could've drank it. Entrees were the chicken fried chicken for the hubs and the billionaire bacon burger for me. His CFC had a good jalapeño cream gravy, more smokey than spicy. My burger was fabulous. The bacon and pimento cheese made it! The fries were hot and seasoned well. We will be back!

One of the best breakfasts I have had in YEARS. Biscuit and blueberry jam are things I still dream of regularly, my daughter loves her bagel. Staff was so friendly, and there were lots of nice people and dogs on the patio. Great vibe inside. My breakfast sandwich was phenomenal, I can't wait to come back!! Chai was also killer.
Staff 10/10, food was FABULOUS! The Cochin fries were SO GOOD, do yourself a favor and try those!

TERRIBLE! Waited over 50 mins for food and left after asking for our money back. After 40 mins we asked about our food, it was sitting out (for how long we don't know). They said it would be right out. After 10 mins nothing. Went back in, food still sitting there looking horrible and congealed, they still wanted to serve it to us, so we asked for a refund. Couldn't understand why the staff would let it sit there as other food was going out. Tables were dirty, we asked twice to have it cleaned. The outdoor space being neglected by staff, old food on the ground.

I have 3 credit cards with Chase and them inconsiderate numb nuts decreased all my limits on all 3 cards, now instead of 55% usage it's at 95% credit usage so now when they report to the credit bureau I have maxed my cards out and my credit score will decrease considerably. During a pandamic when everyone is struggling this is what they have the balls to do, I have not asked them for a deferal and I pay my bills on time on each credit card. I will not use there credit cards ever again and I'm going to close my 2 checking accounts and when these cards are paid off I'm going to cut them in a million pieces and send it to Chase inconsiderate A_____. God don't like ugly so they will get what's coming to them

I love love love the casual atmosphere, friendly service, and solid sweet and savory food selection at this adorable bakery...

I recently spent a long weekend in Santa Barbara with my family and close friends that are renting a house in the area for the month.  Helena Avenue Bakery was the first place we went upon arrival and the last place we visited before our drive back, and I think we stopped by once or twice in between as well.

Some of my favorite menu items from all of those visits:
-Avocado Toast
-Turkey Sandwich
-Kale Caesar Salad
-Homemade Potato Chips
-Hummus and BabaGhanoush

We also purchased some fresh sourdough and country seed bread loaves to-go.  (They will slice it if you ask as long as it's not so early that it's too warm out of the oven to do so).  My kids had their donuts but didn't love them... I think they looked better than they tasted.  I also had a fabulous Americano with almond milk.

Shout-out to Lauren who didn't lose her cool as my husband and I visited first thing on a Sunday before our drive back home and kept adding on to our order.  First it was just coffee and bread, then we decided we needed a sandwich and salad for the road, then we ordered donuts, chips, hummus, etc... Thanks Lauren!

Hope to visit again on future visits to Santa Barbara, and hopefully do a wine tasting with you as well!

We had a new server on a very busy Saturday night, and we were a large group. He wasn't able to remember our orders or able to get orders in at the right time. My sister got the completely wrong meal. The scallops were completely over-cooked. And we told the manager, and her way to fix it was to give us more scallops. We didn't want more food; it wasn't right the first time! But she still did nothing to amend for the many mistakes. I will never eat there again or recommended it to anyone.

This place is great for a classy lunch/dinner! It's located near downtown New Orleans so parking may be tough, but there's a parking lot behind the restaurant with decent pricing during the day. They are requesting proof of vaccination for sitting inside.

We ordered the truffle fries and the oyster appetizer. For entree we got the wagyu burger and the berry salad. Everything was amazing, very well cooked, and extremely filling. Our server was great and checked on us frequently. 

For drinks I got the Amaze-Mint mocktail. It tasted so good! Highly recommend it. Overall this is a great restaurant to go check out. I'll definitely be back soon.

So many flavours and super cheap and delicious. One scoop was around $4 and the one scoop was really the equivalent of a half pint. It was HUGE. 

We got the following:
-Strawberry sorbet - light, refreshing, not too sweet and perfect for the Nashville heat
- Black cherry - there were cherries in every bite, they do not skimp on the ingredients and it was creamy and so rich
- Blackberry cornbread - chunks of corn bread and blackberry jam made this so delectable. It was an original flavour and the combo was perfect. Think peach cobbler but even better!

We tried Jeni's in the same trip and all three of us preferred Mikes over Jeni's.

This was the first time I ordered from this place. I ordered a small specialty pizza and a regular cheesesteak. The cheesesteak was very mediocre, and they delivered the wrong pizza. When I called and asked them to make it right, they offered to bring a new pizza or to take $5 off the bill. I told them that I'd like for them to remove the pizza's charge from the bill - they were unwilling. Perhaps I was nitpicking here, but nevertheless I did not have a positive experience, either with the taste of the food or with the customer service.

BEST MEAL OF THE TRIP!!!!!  I have been to
New Orleans over a dozen times, eaten at many restaurants, and NO ONE compares to this place. The atmosphere was fantastic! Our choices were white sangria, truffle fries, Brussel sprouts, for and goat cheese flatbread, and crawfish grilled cheese. Everything was better than the next thing. I have suggested this place to every single person who has asked me for a restaurant recommendation. I could eat that grilled cheese every single day.

Booked based on location and will return based on the food! Nice selection of wine and cocktails. Our server was very engaging and knowledgeable about the menu. We started with a charcuterie board which I highly recommend. 2 of us chose the seared tuna salad, one had the quail and boudin and another had the ratatouille. We were all pleased with our selections. No one had room for dessert but there were several that sounded delicious!

Stayed in 316 for a week last month on business. It was fine, though expensive for the size. Returned for a rare overnight with my wife and got 305.  $200 for the room which faces the freeway. The windows and HVAC unit let in so much road noise, we were woken up at 5:30AM and couldn't get back to sleep.  HVAC unit was also rattling, which only added to the frustration. VERY disappointing beginning to what was supposed to be a special day.  Maybe it's fine for some people, but I won't be returning unless I am guaranteed an even numbered room facing the parking lot or Marriot finds a way to block out the traffic noise on that building.  Hope this is helpful.  Comfortable bed, good breakfast, bad coffee.
I am an ice cream lover and this place just blew my mind. Their Nutter Butter is the best ice cream i have ever tasted. Totally worth it and perfect spot by Broadway.
Ok sushi, nice date night ambiance and drink list. Definitely overpriced though. I would suggest Kinme instead for a sushi fix.

Lovely little coffee/breakfast/brunch spot on State Street in Santa Barbara. We went to Helena twice on our trip. It was one of my favorite places! They make their own bread and pastries, and source all of their ingredients locally. My favorite was the Wildflower Honey Ricotta on their homemade sourdough with local strawberry jam. So simple, but you can really taste the quality and freshness of the ingredients, and the care that goes into crafting their breakfast and brunch options. Cute outdoor seating area with plenty of seats (they have indoor seating too). Drip coffee is really good too for the price! 

From left to right: Ricotta Toast, Breakfast Sandwich, The Elvis, Fried Chicken Sandwich
Great water pressure with the sinks in the bathrooms . Great amount of soap dispense in one pump. Felt very satisfied

Great selection! I love the Starbucks area in this store. I also really like the layout and all the space of this location. The staff is always friendly and helpful. The reward program is great and I love the promotional offers they have!

Used a Groupon. Alyson is very personable 
On their photo they show a sleek device but in reality they use a wooden slat device with some sort of electrical which is used fir a few minutes over your abdomen. 
They also tell you that the 4 visits are only a beginning and that dozens more are needed toads a difference. 
What a sham.

Great spot for breakfast or brunch. It's walk up order and seating can be tough when it's busy but food is good. We had the breakfast sandwich avocado toast, cinnamon bun and biscuits with jam. We did not order but received the French toast on accident. They said to keep it and it was also very good.
Tony's restaurant keeps improving with great Italian food, great service and great atmosphere.
Rude customer service. It seems like they don't care about customer satisfaction at all. I miss AMEX customer service. It is too bad that only chase has united airline card.

This place is PHENOMENAL! My friend and I were greeted by Andrew when we drifted over to the sandwich area. He recommended the best sandwiches (I got the Cuban and my friend got the TN Trio), and he did not steer us wrong; they were delicious! He came out to our table and chatted with us about the concept behind Caviar and Bananas, then offered to give us a tour of the place. Since we were short on time, we settled for a tour of the desserts area. We asked for his recommendations on desserts, and he pointed out his three favorites. We each selected something, and he personally took the time to package our selections, then sent us on our way with the desserts on the house. The atmosphere here is AMAZING! We fully plan on going back this week! It's like a bit of NYC is here in Nashville. It really elevates the area and is a fun place to grab a bite to eat! Thanks, Andrew! You are super classy! :D

I actually came here to get some catnip wine for my cats. I wasn't planning on staying--I'm afraid of falling in love and bringing home another cat--but I just couldn't resist. It was raining and snowing outside, and a chai latte with several furbabies to cuddle sounded just right.

The staff was super friendly and helpful. The cat room was nice and clean, if a bit small.The cats were so sweet and adorable, but I won't be adopting any. YET. It's tempting. There's a little grey tuxedo who looks like she could be Spartacus Jones' baby twin. Cloud-something. She's a cute little squeaker. 

What can I say? I'm pleased with the staff, the cleanliness, the cool variety of products for human or cat, and the kitties are the very best part. I'll definitely be back!

After a 6 hour flight from Chicago, Colyn has shown exceptional customer service skills. He was an absolute delight and treat. He was informative about my vegetarian tomato bisque, and everything else the table has ordered. I am blown away by his kindness and care towards his customers. Amazing, recommend this place 10/10. 
If you are lucky enough to get him as a server, then treat him the same way he treats you. 
Thank you so much 
#firsttimeinreno #colynisthebest

I love seeing how Indianapolis is growing with young small businesses popping up all over the city. One of my favorite growth spurts has been in Irvington.  Little by little, businesses are starting and in this area there are several artists, designers, and photographers.  This men's store is one of those places.

It appeals to the urban hipster look.  Men with beards and buns.  It has some great products and the gentleman's jewelry section is very elaborate.

The only thing I didn't like was that the owner was on his phone the while time and didn't look up to say hello or ask if I needed help or anything,  When its a big business I expect this, but a small, locally owned one, I want it to feel more personable.

I always find myself here if I end up walking around Broadway. It's open late. Usually busy with a line out the door but it moves quickly. Staff is always friendly and let you try as many samples as you want, but please be courteous to the people who are waiting behind you. Ice cream is rich and creamy. They have an evolving menu with lots of unique flavors. Blueberry cornbread is definitely a must try, as everyone else has mentioned. The waffle cone is handmade and delicious. Their coffees are decent. Definitely worth stopping by if you're in the area.
Cute hidden gem! Came here for breakfast. Everything is fresh and delicious ( the biscuits are so yummy), great open atmosphere, and wonderful customer service.

Such a cute location! We visited this spot two morning in a row. The first morning I got the breakfast sandwich and the second I got a Santa Barbara bowl and added bacon. I favored the sandwich over the bowl. The brioche bun was amazing. I like that they have oat milk as a milk substitution and lots of seating.

We had delivery from here and was not really impressed. The negatives were the fact that the dinners did not come with salad or bread. Average pricing for dinner is about $20 per person and just includes main course. We also ordered caprese salad which was good but only came with 3 small sliced tomatoes. Chicken parm was good but nothing really special. Too many other good Italian restaurants in Reno and probably would not eat here again.

Great place but we had to wait in line and finding a table wasn't easy. For us it was well worth it.

We ordered a bunch of items and everything was very tasty. Latte, cinnamon bun, etc were all very fresh. Will come back when in town next time!

We loved our experience at Copper Vine! Though we were a little bummed we weren't able to sit on their gorgeous patio. We offered to wait for it, but they told us it was booked, though we also had a reservation. We forgot to take picture, but my husband and I shared 5 appetizer which we all equally delicious. We got Deviled Eggs, Tuna Tartare, Bacon Wrapped Dates, Brussels Sprouts, and Black Truffle Fries. My favorite was the tartar, and my husband's was the bacon wrapped dates.

Ordered a pepperoni pizza, Buffalo chicken cheesesteak and mozzarella sticks. The order took over a hour to deliver on a Sunday. Also the pizza was burnt an greasy to the point that a refund should be in order. The Buffalo chicken cheesesteak had blue cheese pieces in it which isn't correct an came undercooked. The mozzarella sticks weren't cooked, just thawed from the freezer. The food was horrible I'd recommend never ordering here. 
Bravo in Havertown makes better food an is cleaner overall

I love their food here. The indoor service is great and the curbside has thrown me a few curve balls but still has been great. I will say that there were a couple of things that have gone wrong and it wasn't me being a Karen it was actual things that went wrong but both times they apologized profusely. One of the times they actually called me and I hadn't even really complained that they called and apologized like crazy. So this is what I think. We are in 2021 and right now people just prefer to throw each other under the bus and walk away and think as long as they blamed it on somebody else that it's going to be all right. They don't do that here. They fix it. And like I said I wasn't being at Karen and trying to get them to do something that wasn't correct or anything. I actually left and just was accepting things the way they were both times but they made them right without me complaining

THAT is the kind of business that I appreciate and will continue to solicit

I'm kind of surprised at all the bad reviews here. We went last Friday night, and it was not very crowded. I would guess that has something to do with the bad reviews?  The service that we received was top-notch , warm bread right away to go with the house red wine. I love the fact that they leave the bottle on your table and you drink on the honor system. We ordered an appetizer which came quickly along with more bread. To be fair yes it is a chain restaurant and the food was fair not amazing but everything tasted great and was served hot. We gave Mitch over 20% gratuity because the service was so good and he seemed happy to be at work. The tiramisu for dessert was a huge portion and tasted great.
Okay.. absolutely delicious! I had the Santa Barbara bowl and it was soooo good! Great coffee, great atmosphere, would for sure come back!

Went on a Saturday for brunch. The hostess greeted us and informed us that it would be a slight wait but we chose to sit at the bar instead. There is outdoor and indoor seating. The ambiance is beautiful and casual. It has the feeling as if you are eating in a garden minus the flies. 
For a drink I ordered a frozen Rose' it was good because I am a light weight but to others it may taste like a strawberry flavored icee. The drink was very beautiful when it arrived with a strawberry and cucumber for a garnish. 
Appetizers, we ordered pork belly, carrots, dates, stuffed beignets. The pork belly was delicious! The carrots could have used a little more time roasting as they were a bit crunchy. I didn't try the dates, they were wrapped in bacon. 
Entree I orders the lump crab Benny. None of the flavor actually stood up. The biscuit did not taste fresh and the egg didn't really have flavor. I also opted for the egg to be scrambled instead of poached. My friend order the fried chicken sandwich, the slaw really brought out the flavor in the sandwich.

Mike's is a staple and legend of the main drag in Nashville. They used to be on Broadway, but have expanded quite nicely over on 2nd. Great selection of ice cream and a must-stop for a visit downtown.

This is the worst bank to ever bank with. The in person customer service is always good but that on phone customer service lacks everything it need to have in order to be productive and produce a satisfactory out come and their online/ app is the same disgusting level as well. I'm shutting down all my accounts. The fee gouging is horrible. Im over it. NEVER EVER AGAIN!

NOTE: I would rate this place 3.5 stars but Yelp doesn't give 0.5 stars.

This place is a very small restaurant with very limited menus, but as an one-time customer, there were definitely enough choices to choose from. I got the vegetable bibimbap. The food came very quickly and even though at first glance, it looked very little, it was actually quite filling. There was a good ratio of vegetable to rice and the sauce was definitely a good kick of flavour. The staff was very nice. 

The only downside was that it was pretty expensive for just one bowl of rice. I know it was a bit cheaper than other places that serve bibimbap by around ~$1-2 but there were no side dishes served at this place, which I thought made the price not as worth it even if it was cheaper by a bit.

However, if you want a quick bite, this place is the one for you.

NO WAY is this a 4+ Star restaurant.  Five of us with a reservation on a Saturday night.  It was 6pm we were on the early side they weren't slammed yet.  Appetizers took forever. Crawfish beignet were fine a little stringy, considerable filler.  The carrots were fine too. Black truffle fries were crap.  Heavily doubt that the fires were made in house.  It would legitimately would have been better to doordash fries from McDonalds or Wendys to get a better quality fry with "truffle" oil on them.  

We got three salads that were fine, but WHY o WHY did they think it was OK to drop the entree's on the table about 90 seconds after the salads arrived.  That is a cardinal sin of table serving. Stacking freshly prepared food in front of a diner and forcing them to choose: 1) let something get stale or cold, 2) make a fuss and ask them to take it back (it's just going to sit under a heat lamp) if you make them cook it fresh, then wait 30 minutes while the rest of your party eats uncomfortably.  TWO of us had salads before our entree and be both had hot food crowding out or place setting with a full salad sitting in front of us. 

The Gulf Fish Almondine was truly weird and worse for it.  Fish almondine should be cooked in a pan with a butter sauce -- or broiled or baked -- with a garnish of almonds.  I understand artistic riffs on this that can still be excellent.  But if you promote yourself as a seafood town because you're next to the ocean, why would you create a fish almondine that has a HARD, THICK batter that totally overpowers a delicate protein like fish?  It made no sense and the crust really took away from a nice piece of fish.  It says "champagne cream sauce"  Delicate, right?  NOWHERE on the menu does it say that this dish with a classic name was not going to be prepared classically and have an unacceptably thick breading on it.  

honestly, if they hadn't rushed the entrees on top of the salad or at LEAST apologized, I would have gone another star.  But we did everything right -- made a rez, waited patiently when things were slow, didn't raise hell with awful service errors -- and they did too many things wrong.

This is my favorite bakery in Chinatown! It's my go to spot at all times.

I love the egg tart, pineapple bun, and milk tea there. The staff are so nice and friendly. Once you walk in they will greet you right away. When I walk in they already know my order.

After 6 o'clock, they have a special for buns - 2/$1. It's what's left from the afternoon. The buns can sit overnight; I normally eat it right away as a snack or eat it for breakfast the next day. 

Definitely recommend this bakery!

By far the worst hair I could ever buy. I bought 3 bundles of mink curly and it stinks like corn chips the curls fell out once I washed it, filled with fiber hair, the cuticles are not aligned and it looks like dog hair after it's dried. Terrible and a waste of money- spent almost 300 on garbage-'cause that's what I did through it on the garbage where it came from. Bunch of crooks !!!

Busy place and now I know why! It's a great place to get your breakfast/brunch.

Ordered the green eggs and ham and it was actually quite filling. The square egg was fluffy and soft. Brioche bun was delicious and has a slight crisp which I loved.

The nice surprise was actually the sourdough bread with olive. It was about $10 (or $12 I can't remember). It's actually sour but not to the point that you get a bitter aftertaste. It's so clearly hand-made since the air bubbles inside are uneven. The bread has a nice crisp on the outside and it's very soft on the inside. Also quite chewy! I rarely taste such darn good sourdough bread...I hope the overhyped LA bakeries can take a lesson from Helena Avenue Bakery. 

Definitely coming back if I visit SB again in the future!

We came out tonight after 3 long months of quarantine.  It was wonderful to be served again.  Good customer service, albeit a little slow. The meal  was very tasty with exception to the sand in 2 of the scallops in our dish.  Otherwise it would be 5 stars.
Yes yes yes. They even make salad taste good! Immaculate atmosphere perfect for a date night!! Great drinks and awesome location so you can go walk around town afterwards!!!

Do not purchase this tour. Our guide spoke too fast and did not care if he was not understand because he had a time line to adhere to. He was rude and disrespectful to handicapped brother. My sister tried explain but he told her my brother would not be able to do parts of the tour even if he had a bicycle rider to assist him. This tour is not handicap friendly. The tour guide was not knowledgeable about his information and told me that we were disruptive when we asked a question with our hand raised! He told my sister that he could and would kick her off the tour. Congratulations you did just that but now I hope everyone will never buy for this tour group again.  If you do please be aware they are not handicap friendly.

Awful Service!
Went on a Saturday evening, sat at the bar to have drinks and two apps. Finished our first round of drinks took 15 minutes for the bartenders to ask if we needed another round (there were 5 people at the bar) ordered two appetizers and it took 40 minutes to bring one out and then be told that they were out of the other appetizer...will never go back this was the second chance at the restaurant.
Food was delicious. The burger and ahi tuna bowl is what we had.  Very fresh  Bring a jacket. It's cold.

I absolutely love Copper Vine! It's definitely my new favorite spot. I love the ambience, vibe, decor, food, and the happy hour is pretty legit! Half off wine bottles and flatbreads!!! I love the concept of a wine pub, because we already have a ton of beer pubs in Nola, so a wine pub is refreshing. The wait staff is awesome! I have been two times so far and everything is consistent. I've tried the grilled vegetable and magherita flatbread. The Brussels sprouts and truffle fries are great! I tried the chefs special the first time I went, the dish was a grilled rum infused watermelon, topped with a flash fried soft shell crab with a side of fennel and arugula spring salad and a sweet chili sauce to add a little kick to the dish! I highly recommend you check out Coppervine of you're in the area.

We arrived at the end of happy hour and the hostess told us there was 6min left and then when we sat down at the bar the bartender told us happy hour was over. We told her the hostess just told us there was 6 min left. The bartender made a total face and looked over to the hostess and sighed Ok. We then got attitude from the bartender for the rest of our time there. To the point that we decided NOT to order dinner as the bartender ruined the atmospheres so we decided to leave and go somewhere else. No Bueno. I don't understand why a server would have an attitude with patrons when their tips rely on it. Maybe it's an attitude of they are due it because they work at a nice place. Pretty soon they won't have any repeat customers. We didn't get her name but she was good at making drinks but BAD at customer relations. Be careful. Places that the staff have attitude ruins the entire meal.

Last Tuesday 7/11/2017  order chicken strip dinner . I asked for tatter tots and got french fries instead, The Texas toast was not toasted except a little on the edges. there was suppose to be a onion ring and that was not included.  I asked for ranch dipping sauce but do not know what the hell that stuff they gave me was. It came in a little cup, was hot as in heat, and had not flavor to it . The chicken was dry. I called and email Sonic. I wanted  to give then a chance to respond. I have not hear anything back from them  I could deal with may be one screw up but the whole meal was wrong beyond messed up/  I did not have tie to take it back.  I threw away my money. The did not take long to get my food to me but nothing was good about it

I love this place! I live in Tampa but it's worth the drive to get here! The staff is so sweet and always attentive! They have a HUGE selection of colors, which if you become a regular is always nice to have! In addition to gel, they also have the dip powder as well. The quality of work is fantastic and I'm never unsatisfied with my nails! Diamond does my designs and she's got such a nice steady hand which always has my designs coming out fresh and on point! The massage chairs are wonderful and comfortable to sit in. They always have a video playing to watch as you get your nails done. The salon is very clean and meticulous. There are different levels to the pedicure, and my favorite is the magic hot stone spa. Expect to spend an hour or so here as they pamper you! There's soft soothing music in the background which keeps the atmosphere relaxed and calming. If you are looking for somewhere new to try I say give this place a try!

Tuna Bar was high on my "to visit" list until COVID hit but New Year's Eve gave us a reason to order a ton of fancy treats for delivery to feel at least a little celebratory at home. 

Loved: Lobster Tempura Roll, Wagyu Spring Rolls, Rock Shrimp, Chicken Karaage, Toro Sashimi, Spicy Scallop Roll 

Pretty Good: King Crab Salad

Not The Best: Raw Oysters

Great:  the cookies, and other baked goods.  The cookies are about the size of your head and thick.  They are three bucks, but probably the size of 3 regular cookies, easily. The mint oreo chocolate cookie was quality.  The chocolate chip cookie was a close second.  

Good: Sandwiches.  My french dip sandwich was a 5, but my wife's salmon sandwich was a 4.  It was a bit "fishy" and the salmon was chopped up and a bit under seasoned.  The strawberry cake was a bit underwhelming, as was the peach carrot cake. 

Look good, but we didn't get it:  the salads and coffees. 

It's a neat place and worth a visit.  Almost 5 stars, but I think ultimately it's hit and miss.

If you are looking  fir a good place to eat, go somewhere  else. The new manager is very rude and doesn't  know what she is talking  about. She should not even be working.  She tells lies to the customers and her employees.  This place  is heading  for there doors to close with her in it. I work in a preschool  I will tell ALL the family's  to go somewhere  else. You just lost most of Reno.
Amazing restaurant. I love sitting at the courtyard, the food is always on point too. The dessert is amazing make sure you get the bread pudding!

Service: 5/5
Food: 5/5
Atmosphere 5:5
Value: 5/5

Total: 20/20 

Man, I don't usually give a perfect score but I couldn't find a negative thing to say! Service was great, food was amazing and we sat outside in the cool NOLA breeze. The decor of this place is chic and hip but not overdone. The food is surprisingly inexpensive and they even took our picture. Next time I'm in NOLA this will be my first dinner stop. Oh and truffle fries are a must.

Let me start this review off with Benihana's be ready for some competition.  For the price and especially the big portions it is simply amazing . Me and my husband use to enjoys Benihana's but I think we like hibachi express better . The portions are huge and it is filled with tons of meat . I got the chicken steak and shrimp hibachi with a side of broccoli , it literally took me three days to eat it . The homemade yum yum side is too die for . We got a big side sauce so we can enjoy it at home also . My husband got the special fried rice filled with chicken steak and shrimp . He loved it he loves fried rice and he said it was one of the best fried rice with meat and vegetables that he has ever had , they only complaint he had was that he could have ordered more vegetables in his rice like a broccoli or more mushrooms . We will defiantly be back it was defiantly worth the money , I will be a hibachi express fan and loyal customer for a LONG TIME

Such a cute vibe. Perfect breakfast spot! 

Ordered: almond chai, cappuccino, breakfast sandwich, smoked salmon on everything bagel, sourdough bread with strawberry jam 

Love the bread and cafe drinks. The outdoor courtyard is nicely shaded and surrounded by plants. We took a 5 minute walk to the beach boardwalk afterwards. I recommend stopping by!

This is the place to come and browse at all the books, magazines
and even cards for that last minute birthday card.  Good selection
of journals as well.
At the cafe end you will find people reading, on their computer,
having business meetings, having interviews, small book clubs
and ladies knitting.  It is a relaxing area that everyone can enjoy.
Can't do without Barnes and Noble!  And if you don't see the book
you want - order it and have it come to the store...another way for
you to find more books or a cup of coffee with a nice cookie!

Had a wonderful dinner here this evening with family. Even though it was a little busy, we were greeted and seated within minutes for a party of 6. Other then plates being dropped on the floor around us and lighting being a little on the dark side; the service was pretty good...thanks Devin (server)! 

The chicken parmesan dish was really good although the angel hair spaghetti had a little spice to it which is due to the onion powder, black pepper and cayenne pepper. If your not in to spice then you may want to substitute this with something else. 

On the drink venue, the pomegranate and rasberry ice tea was really good but I will skip the black berry ice tea next time due to it's lack in flavor. 

And last but not least, the New York cheese was amazing in taste but the slice size was surprisingly a little on the small side in comparison to our dinner portion size but that slice didn't stand a chance :) The tiramisu was also amazing in taste and it's portion size was impressive compared to it's cheesecake neighbor... I've tasted quite a few of these cakes and this one is by far on of the best... Until next time...
Came here for our anniversary dinner, reservations through open table. Service was accurate and comforting, food was awesome , Luigi is very professional and attentive, will be back soon
Very cute little spot run by a hardworking old man with authentic beep n bop with good gochujang sauce.
I love everything I have ever ordered at Tony's. My favorites are the pasta and steaks. My wife loves the salads,  especially the ceasar.

I loveeeee the outside seating at Copperfield, they have alot of plants and greenery along the walls thats gives it a nice warm welcoming aesthetic. That day I ordered a crawfish grilled cheese sandwich which was sooooo delicious. I ordered a whole sandwich which next time I will get a half because it was honestly ALOT for a sandwich. I love crawfish and grilled cheese so the combo was perfect. We also ordered a rise sangria now that drink was ok, it was very light in taste and almost tasted watered down. The drink is the only reason I would give this review 4 stars because it was watered down. The waiter was very speedy and checked on us alot. We made reservations there but didn't really need it because they weren't busy but I definitely suggest reservations just in case especially with everyone having covid restrictions and rules.

Previously working for a Wawa in New Jersey, I find the deli service to be rather slow. The three times I have gone I have waited for at least 10 minutes for my sandwich. 

I like the new paninis that are offered, but I wish they were more customizable. For example, if I want to make a custom panini I should be able to put pesto on it, since that is an option for pre-made paninis. 

The store is clean and the checkout lines are pretty fast. Also as with all Wawas there is no surcharge to use the ATM, which is clutch since I have Chase Bank.

One thing that I noticed that I find uneasy regarding the composition of the store workers is that the workers are all people of color, but the store manager is white. To me, this subconsciously reinforces traditional race issues in our society between bosses and employees.

Don't be fooled by the location of this restaurant- the food here is outstanding. It is located on the second floor of AHCI ice skating rink and is definitely worth a visit whether you plan on skating or not. We were in a group of 5 and ordered various dishes and each were fantastic. We started with the sampler platter as an appetizer which came with Ybor egg rolls (one of the best things I had there- can't miss them), wings and home made chips crumbled with bleu cheese and balsamic. We also tried the brisket quesadilla, brisket poutine, brisket bender bowl and ahi tuna stack. Everything definitely exceeded our expectations. Service was also fantastic. Definitely check it out.

After weeks of waiting I did get a credit for my meal. Unexpectedly they gave me a FULL refund. I was only expecting half the money for the food that was missing. Thanks. The management stepped up and did a good job. Hopefully this error doesn't happen again.
Great flavors and large scoops! I tried the caramel waffle cone and raspberry white chocolate cheesecake. They let you try the different flavors at the counter also
I've been coming here after work for food and drinks at least once a week lately and it has been amazing every time!! Laura is great!
Best ice cream I've ever had. The strawberry is absolutely fantastic. One scoop is huge and not even 4 dollars. If you want ice cream, go here.

So glad we decided to eat here.  The location was easy to get to.  The place had great ambiance and the music will surprise you.  However, the best part was the food and drinks.  I had the apple old fashioned and not only did it taste delicious, it packed a punch.  My hubs had the Port Orleans Beer and it was light and smooth.   We ate the Crab Deviled Eggs and the Oyster and Pork Belly Apps....YUM!  Best Oysters I've had in a while.  For main my hubs had the Cuban w/fries.  The fries don't even need ketchup that's how good they were.  His Cuban was better than many others we've tried.  I had the fig and goat cheese flat bread with duck confit.  I remembered after I started eating that I'm not a fan of goat cheese but it definitely didn't stop me from eating it, that's how good it was.  The only bad thing was we couldn't eat every bite, we were stuffed.  Go check it out, do yourself a favor and make a reservation.

If you're looking for the best baked goods in Santa Barbara, then look no further than Helena Ave Bakery. I mean, the baked goods are stupid good. 

In my three day visit to SB earlier this year I dropped by this place on three separate occasions because it was so damn tasty. Over the course of my visits I had the bagel, ham and cheese croissant, the pretzel and many delicious coffees. Oh yeah, you can get a great cup of joe for two bucks! How bout that!? That's unheard of in the Bay Area...

They are also serving up some warm breakfast meals if that floats your boat. I didn't order any but, they looked delicious. Also, if you're in the area for the surrounding tasting rooms they have some great sandwiches to go. 

Check. Them. Out.

Great place for a local hang out, watching an Eagles game and eating great food. The staff was wonderful and on point!

Loved my clams and spaghetti!

My husband and I have eaten here twice. We Love the food!!!! You walk in and it smells amazing. Food and service is great! Both times I'm amazed at the price!! Compared to olive grader this place is a no brainier!

Small business with amazing food. If you like Crab Rangoon, you know the vast majority of places make them savory. Very, very few make them sweet. I haven't had the sweeter ones in YEARS. Well Hibachi Express makes them like God intended. A mouthful of sweet cream cheese and crab instead of hot onions. I would go here just to grab an order of Crab Rangoon. The rest of the food was super delicious and generous portions. Service was also great!

I ordered pizza on a Friday night, so I wasn't surprised that the wait for delivery was an hour. When the pizza was 30 minutes late, I called to find out how much longer and was assured it was on its way. About 15-20 minutes later, the pizza showed up. The delivery guy apologized profusely. I assumed that the shop had been slammed and my pizza was just late getting out the door. But based on how cold it was, that wasn't the (only?) case. 

Pizza flavor was slightly better than just okay. Crust was better than most that I've had since we moved here two years ago. We may try them again to see how good it is when it's fresh and hot, but not anytime soon.

I bought a full lace wig from this company and it's the worst wig ever the shedding of this wig is horrible also the back of the wig is bald the wig is not recommended for people with low hair line the wig has a lot of flyaway hairs for the price I paid it was not worth it I paid $375 for a 18 inch wig and the sad thing is that I did a review on the website to warn people and they didn't even post my review beware another thing I have to say is that the wig fit like a helmet there no side part of middle part 
I plucked and it still look bulky and the lace was every short

Mike's is a staple and legend of the main drag in Nashville. They used to be on Broadway, but have expanded quite nicely over on 2nd. Great selection of ice cream and a must-stop for a visit downtown!

Recently, they bested the trendy "new Nashville" scene big time:

We decided not to invest time in a massive line at a half-empty Legendairy Milkshake Bar, so we opted to pop around the corner to the Nashvegas ice cream O.G. - Mikes. Violet worked her magic after I challenged her to show them up. It was delicious, and I've even named it for them: The Mug, the Myth, the LEGEND. (See what I did there?)

This place could only be 5 stars with the help of Teresa and Tyla! Yes of course the food was great but Teresa sat us down and made us feel like old friends right away. Made our dining experience top notch! Tyla was the best server I think I've ever encountered in Reno! She was so patient with my questions and gave great imput on her favorite dishes. She was quick and so friendly and even though she had a mask on I could tell she was smiling. My night was made, food was delicious, and I felt as if I made new friends! Definitely definitely will return!!

My husband and I wanted coffee and dessert so we went to Mike's. There are so many hand dip ice cream flavors to choose from. I got cookie dough because I'm basic, and my husband got caramel cone. Sooo good! I do not have a finely tuned coffee palate or anything as a disclaimer - but the coffee was good. We sat on the stools inside and people watched while we enjoyed our late night snack.

OK so it must be hard to find a replacement for a sick call when you are in the middle of no where. The day of our check out the lady that ran the breakfast for us the previous three days was not only in charge of breakfast but the entire front desk area and checking out the weekend crowd . That poor lady needs a raise!!

This Fairfield Inn was running great room rates during my fiancé's mother's birthday weekend so we planned a trip out to Longwood Gardens to take her there to celebrate her 70th. 

The staff here was pretty fabulous in putting up with our pesky questions. We have to give a shout out to Sean at the front desk who took care of us like a concierge.

I'm a germaphobe and travel with my own sheets...just in case, but I didn't need to use them, the linen was fresh and the bed felt and smelled like I was sleeping on an Snuggle fabric softened sheep! Thank you Yelp for your recommendation of requesting a room on the parking lot side! We did not hear any noise at all from the freeway at night!

Breakfast is built into your room rate and the spread could feed a football high school team. We also meet fellow Hawaii travelers at breakfast, what a small world! We really liked the 24 hour coffee and tea station in the lobby however there seems to be some kind of competition with the trash among employees to see of how long it can sit out and how many pieces of trash can pileup on top of it without toppling over.

My only complaint about the property was that the pool and hot tub area could use some cleaning love and the weight room scale was very broken, unless I lost 43 lbs...yeah I found my justification to EAT more!! Unfortunately that wasn't to case but if your visiting Longwood or from the Philly/NJ/ Deleware area and want a close vacation, this is a great lodging option!

I actually attended Tony's for a rehearsal dinner. It was decent. I have never been there for dinner. The food was good, but not hot. The space upstairs for the private rehearsal was nice, however, they did not have wifi so the slide show had to be show through hot spot. Service was okay, I really didn't see any waiters until it was last call. I am probably going to try Tony's for dinner, but I am not in any rush.

I went to Macaroni Grill at about one-o'clock. The place was not busy at all. Our waitress  Jayme , helped us with all of our questions. We had a BOGO coupon for the three-course lunch. She gladly accepted our coupon and then we placed our order. I ordered the sausage and pepper rigatoni and my daughter ordered the fettuccini gorgonzola. The bread was delivered promptly and was delicious and warm. The waitress  made us the olive oil and pepper dip which was delicious as well. Our first course was a mozzarella frita with marinara sauce. The cheese was warm and crunchy. The next course was a Caesar salad with croutons and cheese. The salad was very delicious as well. Next came our main course. The rigatoni was better than the fettuccini, but both were delicious. The service was fast, they accepted all our coupons, and the food was delicious and in big servings. I would recommend coming here and trying the three-course lunch!

This place is a local hangout that reeks of wanting to please you. The tender, Paul, couldn't have been any nicer when he contributed to my delinquency and gave me whatever I needed, including some tastes of some foreign hops. Although 15-20 minutes from my airport hotel, it's a beer guys and gals hangout.
Even better, Alyssa, the waitress, couldn't have been any better. Her expertise of the menu guided me towards one of the best meals I've had this month, gobbling some Shrimp Lujon that could have been on Top Chef. Thanks Alyssa. You and Paul showed me how Philly treats guests. Will be back"KC!!!

The outdoor seating here is very cute, part covered and part in the sun. The inside was nice and you can tell it's definitely a different place not during COVID. We tried two of the breakfast toasts and they were good, but a bit too sweet. Unfortunately the coffee tasted burnt and it was difficult to get down.

Delicious bread and breakfast sandwiches. Their croissants are very good, love the spacious location shared with wine collective and the water pitcher is great as well. Keep up the great work! A definite positive addition to the SB community.
Food, Service and Cleanliness were all exceptional! I ordered the breakfast sandwich, a side of potatoes and 2 danishes to go. The best food I ate my whole time in Santa Barbara.

On a recent visit to Santa Barbara, I wandered into this bakery. It was not really visible from the street. But as I was walking to explore nearby shops in this trendy area, I saw people walking out with coffees and baked goods. 
So down this little side street I went and found this cool bakery. It was an unassuming space that was converted from a factory or warehouse. Lots of tables inside and out. 
I ordered the avocado toast at the counter and took a seat in their cute partially shaded patio. It was mashed avos on a really thick 2" piece of bread topped with sprouts crumbled feta, sunflower seeds and light seasoning. I know it doesn't sound too exciting but it was one of the best avo toast I've had...thus this long review. The bread was slightly crunchy but soft as you bite into the seemingly-way-too-big toast. It was filling and satisfying. I would have bought some other baked goods to go but they were closing before I had a chance. Get there before 2pm ya'll. Definitely coming back for more.

We had a very nice dinner sitting outside last night. The server was very nice and attentive. We both ate steak which was cooked perfectly. We both ordered the Caesar salad and potatoes that were delicious. I had a Sierra Mist and he had a beer.  We love this place and will return.

Oh my, what a gem.  Our second night in the City and we were already learning how friendly NOLA is, but our waitress had to win some award!  We weren't in need of a huge meal, but wine, soup, salad and flatbread was just the thing.  It's a lovely place inside and so much larger than we expected.  We didn't make the Happy Hour when we wanted to try the wine flight, but really enjoyed our dinner there.  New Orleans is filled with restaurants with such great ambience and beautiful dining and this place would definitely be on a "come back to" or "recommend it" list!

If I could rate lower I would. For one they thought me opening a credit card was fraud somehow so they declined it. They then said that if it is not fraud that I must contact them.... They provided no contact info so I resorted to calling any sort of random customer service number which of course diverted me to other random departments. The phone number that you would assume, card applications hotline, wouldn't give me a representative without putting in a credit card number.... See how that doesn't make sense. When I finally figured out the proper phone number to call thru a rep at some random department, I was unable to get ahold of someone for days. Never talked to a human. Couldn't reach someone. Always a wait "GrEaTeR tHaN 50 mInUtEs". I applied for a discover card and got approved quickly. Chase can take their customer service structuring and leave it to a glue eating kindergartner, I'm sure that kid could figure out how to run customer service at this company. Better yet maybe he would do the smart thing and liquidate the organization and donate it to brain trauma foundation. I bet they ask you for shoe size when applying for a loan.

Absolutely amazing!!!!! We had our heart set on another location, the wait was crazy. We went to Mikes instead, best choice ever! Everything was amazing, we ended up visiting twice on our trip to Nashville! My favorite - espresso milkshake - with white chocolate mocha. This is a must when visiting Nashville, I need to find something like this in CA!

We are in town visiting for a few days, and my fiancé found this spot for breakfast this morning. The space is amazing, light airy and beautiful. The staff is friendly and efficient. We ordered at the counter, then found a table. I had the salmon bagel, which was delicious with whipped cream cheese and fresh dill. My fiancé had the chicken sandwich and it was amazing. Definitely one of the best breakfasts we've had in a while.
Great sushi and great atmosphere. The food has great flavors, we loved everything we got. The service was also amazing. Can't say enough about this place

This place is in a great location. Too bad that's about all it had going for it the evening I ate there.

This restaurant, like much of St. Louis is going for a classic elegance. Unfortunately, this place falls far short and is extremely average. Everything from the decorations (imagine faux finish walls that change colors every 5 feet, perhaps trying to mimic the colorful facades of an Italian village but really just invoking a circus tent) to the humdrum (and very pricey) wine list shoots for the stars but like the Challenger barely makes it into the stratosphere. In fact I might go so far as to say if you're looking for Italian you'd be better served at the Olive Garden, where they at least offer fresh ground pepper or cheese for your entrees and salads.

My meal was plain Jane. I was looking for something light and healthy. Almost everything on the menu was advertised as served under a beure blanc sauce or a cream based sauce. Therefore I chose a seafood pasta with tomato sauce. Expecting some hearty prawns and delicious fresh vegetables, instead I got a mash of overcooked spaghetti with pasty sauce that tasted like a reduction of Chef Boyardee. My boyfriend had the house special, a $25 risotto that tasted like Uncle Ben's, but worse. 

Thankfully, the evening was not a complete waste as I boxed up my spaghetti, brought it home, added some wine, vegetables and fresh parmesan cheese substantially improving the meal. Perhaps before you consider eating here, you should think about cooking for yourself or going to the Olive Garden.

Had a great brunch experience at Cooper Vine. This was my first time visiting and our waitress Lindsey was so sweet and helpful. I have to admit they have so many great appetizers choices it was hard to choose.

However, I ordered the CV signature margarita for my cocktail along with the LA Crawfish Beignets per Lindsey's recommendation, and they both were soooo delicious. I was a little skeptical about the beet mixed with the margarita but it was hands down one of the best margaritas I've ever had. So handcrafted. My cousin also ordered the Brussels Sprouts and Cajun Carrots and they were delicious and flavorful. I've never enjoyed having veggies as an app before. For my entree, I ordered the Jumbo Lump Crab Benny and they did not hold back on the jumbo lump crab meat there was more than enough for each bite. My cousin ordered the Gulf Fish Amandine and wow what an entree it was. I had the chance to taste a bite and let's just say I will be ordering it the next time. 

Overall, I loved the entire brunch experience. The atmosphere was perfect. We were able to sit outside amongst all the many plants in their beautiful courtyard and the bathroom was also picture worthy. Great experience, and I can't wait to go back!

I love stopping in this store to see what cool stuff they have.  

The staff is really friendly and helpful.

It's not a huge store but they do a great job organizing so it doesn't feel like it's overcrowded with stock.

I'll definitely be back.

Fantastic food, eat here.

We were in town for three nights and ate here twice, having the avocado toast both times. The bread was so crunchy and just perfect it called us back.  Each time we had the drip coffee that was hot,  well balanced and flavorful.

We also had a blueberry scone and a lemon raspberry poppyseed muffin that were yummy. The strawberry yogurty yummy ness thing on that great bread was a little too sweet as we combined it with the blueberry scone but chalk that up as a rookie mistake.

This was one of the best meals I've ever had. We had the burrata, cheese plate, steak and mushrooms, sprouts and gulf fish amandine. Everything was cooked perfectly. Great selection of wines. Our server Camille did a fantastic job!

Overrated. I'm guessing people are more taken by the fact it's the only ice cream there and it's "local". It wasn't bad it was just overhyped. I didn't feel like any of the flavors were really bursting.

Made some last-minute reservations to eat here with my wife. We like a Friday night date with the kids off skating. We had Purchased the gift card for Costco so it's like having a 20% discount. Macaroni Grill is a bit expensive, however the food quality has a high standard. 

When we arrived, it was kind of strange because the place was deserted. The waitress/hostess that greeted us was very friendly and sat us immediately. She was friendly and professional. The only concern I have is that she wore an extreme amount of perfume. It made me gag when she came by the table to ask us for drinks. Also, when she brought the bread and olive oil, the bottom of the bread was rockhard. The top was soft however we could not cut through the bottom without a saw. Our server care of this immediately. It was kind of hard to taste the bread with the perfume wafting around us. 

The price has definitely increased as the bottle of wine was quoted at $48. I remember just before Covid being here and the bottle is $32. So I asked for a wine list. She said they did not have one but she knew everything about the wines. Luckily I had an old picture of the wine menu and showed it to her. She went to check the prices and then quoted me $38 for a bottle and apologized. It is somewhat difficult to not have the ability to look at the list of wines and their prices. Especially when you were quoted $16 more than the last time you visited.

What we ordered:

Drinks: went with a bottle of wine. My wife likes sweeter wines so I ordered a bottle of Reisling (Chateau St. Michelle) 

Lamb Shank 
Steak and mash
Grilled asparagus 

The food is extremely good. The lamb shank pulled apart with a fork. The steak was cooked perfectly and had a great flavor. My wife really loved the style of mashed potatoes. For a side of asparagus, it seemed a bit small. But it was definitely cooked nicely.

I do hope the waitress reads this review and adjust her perfume. With a sidenote, if you wear the same perfume over and over, sometimes you get desensitized to the smell and you have to apply more so you can smell it. Overtime this builds up and the result is suffocating for others. 

Other than this, it was a nice visit and we will return.

We don't eat at a lot of chain restaurants, but we were dropping the truck off at Best Buy for an install, and Romano's is in the same parking lot so...
Seating was plentiful and spaced out well. Our server was really friendly and suggested the current wine special which was a bottle of cab for $10! Okay, it was a deal we couldn't pass up and the wine was actually pretty decent. 
A kind of ciabatta bread with balsamic and olive oil was brought to us and we tore up pieces to enjoy. Soft, tasty and went nice with the dipping oil and vinegar. 
We ordered Mac n cheese balls and bruschetta to share as a starter. We enjoyed both but I particularly enjoyed the bruschetta. A bowl of sauced chopped tomatoes to dump on some really soft delicious slices of baguette. Yum. Mac n cheese bites were good as well with a nice crunchy exterior.
My wife and I shared the shrimp portofino and both the shrimp and pasta was cooked well. My son ordered calamari and it had a nice light crisp and was a good portion for being a starter dish. All in all, we really enjoyed our visit!

ABSOLUTLY TERRIBLE! Opened an account online with Disney World incentives, Well I made a deposit and then 3 days later my account was locked. I called and was informed that I had to go to a local branch and show 2 forms of identification.  This would not have been an issue except the closes branch is 94 miles from my home. They would NOT allow me to scan my ID's (driver license and Military), then told me my account would automatically close in 10 days if I didn't go to a branch to verify my identity, and my deposit would be sent back to me in the form of a check within 6 weeks. Okay, so the bank needs me to identify myself and my address with 2 forms of identification, but will send me a check for my required deposit to a non verified address? This makes ZERO sense.

The divey-ist of dive bars. Terrible music, unfriendly service (heard our server go on multiple aggressive rants to herself), overall sad crowd. I'm also not sure how the attached picture qualifies as a receipt.

I rarely write reviews, so this is saying something. I reached out to Helena Ave Bakery SEVERAL times to set up a catering order for the morning of my wedding so my bridesmaids and I would have coffee & breakfast. We were getting ready blocks away so it seemed like the perfect idea since I've tried their coffee & food before and really liked it. I called a few times over several weeks and kept being told the manager would call me back. They NEVER called me back. I even emailed 3-4 times and never received a response back. This is completely unacceptable service. Luckily we went with a different bakery in town. DO NOT USE HELENA AVE BAKERY FOR CATERING/GROUP ORDERS.
They refuse to answer the phone, then complain when people call back. You go in and try and order and they are so rude that you don't want to even place the orders
What can I say? It's ice cream. Many flavor options. Hits the spot on a hot day in Downtown Nashville! Minimal seating available inside.

Ordered an iced chai latte for myself, an iced matcha latte with almond milk for my mom and then a blueberry scone for us to share. It took a while to order since it was busy and then even longer to get our drinks and the scone, but once we did we enjoyed it all. The scone had lots of juicy blueberries in it and was covered in a light and sweet frosting. 

As I was waiting I noticed most people were ordering brunch and eating in the bakery's outdoor dining area, but there were also plenty of people stopping in to just buy a loaf of bread.

Tried going here today. Looked up hours and updated information in multiple areas on the web and all give hours indicating theirs open. Drive from Fernley and there's essentially no cars in the parking lot. Tried calling to no avail. The answering system offers take out or reservations and no one answered that either. Finally went in and it's empty aside from two staff who say they open at 4pm. Would have been nice for a more upper scale restaurant to update their online information or voice recorded message indicating they don't open until 4pm. Brewery next door is popping.

I'm giving it one star now because of how unorganized this place is, it is SO poorly managed. We LOVE their food and location however the management needs major organizational skills and HELP!!! From the single cashier which made our wait longer than necessary (30 minutes just to order) to the fact that they got our order wrong and then when we tried to correct our order after waiting for 50 minutes, they sold out of the item we originally ordered! Also when we were finally able to order we were told that after waiting 30 minutes in line we had to take our food to go because there weren't any tables available we pointed out that some of the tables were leaving shortly  and they told us that we could not have those tables and the people behind us had priority over those tables. Have you ever heard of something so stupid? Get a manager and pay them to manage this place!

Sandy Hester was our tour guide and she did an awesome job keeping the group intrigued. She was informative with a witty sense of humor. Even in the 85 degree, no shade, she kept us entertained. Very knowledgeable about the history of the cemetery and New Orleans. Highly recommend her as a tour guide!

I wanted to take the opportunity to thank Troy Crisco and the good folks at Romano's Macaroni Grill. They did their level best to deliver a quality product this past year of pandemic. 

Quarantine carry out only, reduced seating and delivery shortages are just a few of the many challenges they had to overcome. But they managed and are walking tall as a result. 

A great menu, a beautiful atmosphere and a fabulous support staff that takes care of all our needs! Hell, you can even learn a little Italian speak while you wash up! I just wish we lived closer so we could visit more often. 04/21

The Old Yards Brewin Co., is now home to the Craft Hall. Reservations were recommended, but they had enough seating to take walk ups. Parking they have a small lot off of Poplar Street or you can find street parking when construction is not going on.  

We had outdoor seating, we chose outside the tent because it was a beautiful Sunday afternoon.  Waiter was very attentive, as we glanced over the menu on our phones. Beer is brewed by Mainstay Independent Brewing Co.  I had a double IPA and a Session IPA, both were very tasty. Also split an order of Brisket Poutine with my dining companion.  I was skeptical at first, but it was a great snack to share, the meat was tender, and the fries were crispy, the cheese curds were the best i ever had. 

I would definitely visit again as most of the amenities inside the Hall were closed due to covid. The Food & Drink were very reasonably priced as well. An overall great experience.

I don't visit the North side very often and I try to avoid bar/restaurants so I was seriously surprised how much fun Twin Peaks was the first time I was there. They have a very normal menu with a few stand outs but the quality of the food is great, the amount of the food for the price is excellent, let's be honest the servers are worth the price of admission, they aren't just cute but seriously professional and knowledgeable. My waitress was named Miranda and she was great! She knew the menu well and had a gorgeous smile. She was very attentive and quick to serve. I have since made a few visits and will definitely be returning more in the future. Whenever I visit the north side with friends, I recommend Twin Peaks for the tastes and views.

BOTTOM LINE: eat here! Short menu with reliable reliable tasty Korean staple dishes. The owner is so nice and thoughtful and I'm so glad we are close enough to eat here at least once a week! A total understated find for south street area Asian food!

My fault - locked myself out so I called these guys based on the great reviews. Said they would be here in 25 minutes. After 50 minutes I called back and after another 5 minutes they called back and said it would be 15 more minutes...25 minutes after that, still no locksmith. So...if you're locked out don't call these guys...they are completely undependable. Fortunately a neighbor came home who is clever with tools. I would give 0 stars if that were an option but alas it isn't.

Update: I cancelled the service (and received a text confirming the cancellation)...but the locksmith then called and said he was "3 minutes away". I told him I had cancelled. Fifteen minutes later he calls and says he is in my building. I told him AGAIN that I had cancelled. He wouldn't leave...didn't seem to understand the word "cancelled" nor the phrase "we made other arrangements". He finally left when I threatened to call the police. DO NOT CALL THIS COMPANY IF YOU ARE
LOCKED OUT!!!

The salty fudge ice cream at Mike's is incredible. Just get it. The red velvet ice cream was tasty but I'm over red velvet-flavored stuff generally. It's a subtle flavor in its original cake form so I don't know why I'd expect it to jump out or taste better in denser mediums like ice cream. Try something else, even if you're from above the Mason Dixon line and feel obligated to try anything with "red velvet" in the name. I hear that can take you to dark, dark places...

I'm going to be contrary now and state that nothing red velvet-flavored is all that special except for red velvet cake. 

The texture of the ice cream was quite good. I got two scoops on a chocolate chip cone, which actually seems to be a rolled, dense cookie instead of a traditional ice cream cone. Cool.

I'm going to be contrary AGAIN and state that I was hoping the chocolate chip cone would be a traditional waffle cone with chocolate chips. How awesome would that be?

I appreciated that the cookie cone remained structurally intact. They'd put a plastic guard around the cone to keep melted ice cream for getting all over your hands. It seems that they'd factored in that Mike's is a heavy tourist draw and that people would be walking around while eating their ice cream.

I'm going to be contrary AGAIN and AGAIN and say that I appreciated all the tourist-driven innovations but Mike's was not worth $6 for a two-scoop ice cream cone. It felt a bit like extortion, especially when phenomenal places in NYC, SF and Boston charge less for three scoops. I typically abandon my sense of value when it comes to ice cream and I still felt offended.

The pricing would not stop me from coming back to Mike's on subsequent trips to Nashvegas. It's quite good and so conveniently located that it's hard for me to say no. Mike's is great for that very specific ice cream craving that comes when you're indulging in tourism in a party atmosphere in a hot city. It more than does the trick and far exceeds the quality of most places that exist to satisfy that need. If you're looking for real quality though, I hear it's best to wait for Jeni's.
Anytime that an ice cream parlor makes fresh waffle cones right in front of you, you know you are in the right spot. Delicious ice cream and even better cones! Love this place!

Terrible experience. Do not book a party or make a reservation at this Macaroni Grill. My daughter booked a college graduation  the party for her daughter and they gave the room away to another party that walked in off the street the day of the party.  Several people  had come in from across the country people to attend what was supposed to be a joyous occasion turned out to be sad and disappointing. They put at separate tables by the front door. The servers did their best to make it a good moment but management should be fired!

My TOP Brunch pick here @coppervinewinepub 

I am not a Brunchologist but I looooove the brunch hereThe vibe and space are perfect for after work cocktails and bites, date night out, weekend brunch or a @saints pre-party! Did I mention bottomless mimosas? I actually met the Chef at @libertyskitchen event at @aceneworleans hotel the other night and she was so nice. I love her cooking style-Caribbean, Southern and Cajun, using staple ingredients found locally. 
 
I can't take my eyes off the beautiful outdoor courtyard. 

They also have a beautiful indoor and rooftop area to sit and eat. 

I got a taste of everything. I really enjoyed the Crawfish Beignets, Jumbo Lump Crab Benny, Shrimp & Grits, Creole Shakshouka and the Chicken.
Pretty great ice cream! Definitely recommend it! Especially on a hot day , it hits the spot!

The sandwiches are always messy but I ordered a BLT toaster and a cheeseburger meal with a shake, the ice cream machine is down which is understandable but for them to serve me this sandwich like this is just ridiculous! I will not come back here because I didn't feel like they were even being respectful when taking the order. Yes we're all busy and yes it's a start to a new year, but y'all need to chill. Way to have a fast dinner! NOT!

My sister, from New England, got on line to find a place that would deliver food to my house, that would serve a lot of people. It was because of the death of my beloved wife. Zio's came up.
