Lucky us. They delivered a lasagna that weighed a ton.(Slight exaggeration), along with the antipasto, bread, and dressing was fantastic. The next weekend, on Sunday, we were having a celebration of life. A lot of people came into town. When I say a lot, I mean a lot. My wife was from a large Italian family. Late on the day before the celebration, we contacted Zio's to see if they could put together a tray of Italian cookies. On such a short notice, like 30 minutes before they closed. they put together two large trays of the cookies, plus another huge tray of their wonderful lasagna. They stayed a little later than their normal closing time, just to be the kind of business that we want everyone to be like. Zio's, you are the tops in my book. Want a great Italian deli? Zio's is the place for you.

Until last night I didn't realize you could fumble pizza this badly. 
The pizza was bad. Not sure if it's an ingredient issue but this is the first time I couldn't finish a small pizza on an empty stomach. Also My order was incomplete. So I paid for items not provided :/. Lesson learned. Sorry I absolutely do not recommend the place.

First off, this is not the place to go if you want a more upscale and/or healthy pizza.  This is better-than-average, local pizza parlor pizza.  Like another reviewer said, it's a good place to go when you don't want to cook.  

I've ordered pizza here MANY times and they've always gotten it right.  The quality, as I said, is better than average and consistent.  And the staff couldn't be more pleasant.  I enjoy giving this place my business.

Just don't go into it expecting anything gourmet, for that I recommend Jules on Lancaster Avenue.  Other reviewers mentioned Felicia's, which I think is awful and in fact wrote a review of my experience.

Simple little ice cream shop - although they do sell drinks too!

I had a scoop of their Nashville fudge - chocolately and creamy.  Hit the spot for a late morning treat!

We've been having bad luck with a lot of Japanese restaurants but we had the most amazing meal here at tuna bar! We had the tuna tartar, miso soup and crispy shrimp as appetizers. The tuna was very fresh (finally some fresh fish!!). The rolls we ordered (fishtown, dynamite, yellowtail&scallion) were great -- our favorite was Dynamite. 
The yuzu cocktail was amazing we'll definitely be back :)

Good bakery items and coffee, we especially liked the cinnamon rolls . May have to go back for banana bread and PB.  Service was not particularly fast, not the place for breakfast if you're in a hurry

7-22-2021 1:30 pm lunch.  Entrées and desert excellent, portions big, ambiance nice , service was great.  Parking lot was empty, we were not sure they were open.  Had eaten last month back at the Olli G - (you know where) at Legends, and we were very unimpressed.  By comparison,  Macaroni Grill hit it out of the park.  They even offered seconds on salad and focaccia bread, but the initial serving was plenty large enough.  Very pleased.

The absolute worst. The owner has NO customer service skills. She is rude, offensive and cuts off customers as they speak. She has no respect for her customers or the hassles they've had to go through with orders that were taken incorrectly by her or her staff or because there is such a LONG backlog. Never would I recommend this place. Sadly, because it's a uniform outfitter she can monopolize. I will be looking long and hard for a new uniform supplier - even if it isn't local - because Educational Outfitters is the pits. Stay away - FAR AWAY! Support businesses with kind owners that value all of their customers

Amazing!! From start to finish my server Courtney made my visit absolutely perfect. From entree recommendations to pairing wines, her knowledge was limitless. Her passion and bright spirit made our experience at copper vine that much better! The food, the atmosphere, and the service was outstanding. Definitely try the smothered rabbit and mushroom fricassee and Brussels! I will definitely be recommending copper vine to all of my friends and family when they visit New Orleans!

So, full disclosure, I haven't visited the tap room in person, but have enjoyed many of Bier Brewery's creations at events and in cans!  With the ongoing covid 19 pandemic, I'm enjoying food and beverages from local businesses at home these days.    I enjoyed a PDG pale ale with takeout fried chicken tonight and had an amazing meal.  It's a good hoppy selection but isn't jumping on the bandwagon of "extreme hoppiness" if that makes any sense.   In other words, it won't overwhelm food.    They carry the PDG at Market District if anyone is looking for it.    I really do hope to visit in person once this way too long pandemic is under better control!

This spot has good food!! I ordered the hibachi chicken and shrimp combo with zucchini and onions on the side! It so good. We only waited about 10 minutes. The only thing was the lady who took our order was a little impatient and kept asking did we want anything else while ordering. Good food for less than half the time at a sit down hibachi !!!

I rarely leave reviews but felt the need to for copper. Collin in the front was so nice and patient with us, even calling to let them know we were coming late. Their wine and drinks menu is by far one of the best in the city! Camilla was such an angel and let me try two different white wines before ordering. Food, atmosphere, and service was all around great. Would definitely recommend this place for a date night or even to just come in and try different wines. It was reasonably priced as well! Thanks copper vine for a great date night. :)

We had our school year-end party at Tuna Bar and it was spectacular.  Service was great even though we were a large group, but the best part was definitely the food.  Everything was super fresh with good options for vegetarians too-- my favorites were the brussels, nigiri, and crab rice.  Drinks were fire too.

Everyone really enjoyed it, we will be back.  Shout out to Ken (amazing chef), Tina (manager), and our bartender -- didn't catch her name but she was top notch.

Yesss, the bakery is open and with my favorite worker lol. After months of no Asian pastries, my husband and I ordered a dozen of goodies to ourselves. We miss the egg tarts and buns. Yum, so happy they're open and cravings satisfied for sure.

Roy's Appliance responded quickly to a dishwasher problem I was having and showed up on time! Terry was very professional explaining what was wrong with my dishwasher, made the repair(s) needed without scratching my new floor. Also price was very fair. I highly recommend using them.

D. Gardner

This was the first we dined outside in serval months and it was wonderful. The staff was kind and helpful. The food was so fresh and delicious! We loved it! If you're in the area, make a point of spotting by, you won't regret it.

I went to Tuna Bar last Thursday and enjoyed my experience. The restaurant is still fairly new, so there were a couple of kinks, but nothing that should keep anyone from booking a reservation and trying it out. 

Do book a reservation. We were glad to have one as the restaurant filled up completely within a half hour of our arrival. Servers seemed to be a little stressed and we had to flag our server down a couple times when we needed something after our initial order.

I typically stick with wine or vodka martinis when I have sushi, but after tasting my friend's cocktail I ordered the same. It was a mezcal drink with lime and jalapeño syrup that was absolutely delicious. My friend later ordered a gin martini with wasabi - the taste was really fresh and interesting but the wasabi wasn't mixed in well and she encountered a few larger nuggets which made the drink a little weird. 

We ordered several plates and highlights for me were the lobster fried rice, crispy rock shrimp, fishtown roll and one of the specials of the day, some fresh yellowtail, which was absolutely incredible. 

If there is dessert on the menu, we wouldn't know, because our check was dropped without us even asking for it. Not exactly the warm vibe I'm expecting when spending upwards of $100/person. Hopefully, the restaurant is simply going through the stress of opening. I'm looking forward to another visit after they have had a bit more time to get things running smoothly.

Man posing as manager is horrible. I came and waited almost an hour after ordering a single meal on a Saturday morning. I was aggravated but chose not to be rude. The server was super friendly. She explained that she was alone. She thanked me for my patience. She gave a coupon for free meal on next time without any complaint or comment from me. I thanked her and left. I returned to receive meal. The lady over intercom stopped my order to come out and see coupon. She placed my order but said she'd have to ask the manager. He came out to inform me he didn't have the coupon in his store and wanted me to know he was on the look out for people with stacks of them to get free meals. Terrible experience. Like I'm out to steal a $6 meal. Horrible service. Don't bother. If you love sonic, go elsewhere.

Love New Orleans. Just so many great places to eat and this place was bomb with fantastic service by Justin. Had some oyster dish that was just superb and want more. I don't even like blue cheese but it works in this dish. Had the crawfish beignets. Great. Bacon wrapped dates very nice. Ordered gnocci and loved it. Great flavor and mix. She had some pasta dish. It was all so good I forgot to take photos before eating things. The beignets are light fluffy and disappointing there aren't more :) great ambiance. Will be back.
Loved everything we got here! We split dumplings that were delicious & a tuna flatbread app. One roll we got was lobster tempura in a truffle sauce. The drinks were also great!

This is my first time coming here and aside from the lovely atmosphere outside and in what is there not to live about this place. Our server was excellent and made amazing recommendations for starters as well as entrees. The Filet Mignon Brochette was exquisite and highly recommendable as a starter. Highly recommend to first time NOLA visitors as well as anyone looking to try something new in the city. Great experience and definitely will be back for more

Caviar & Bananas offers a distinctive food experience.  i call it a type of urban market.  walk into a nice coffee bar, then walk through the beautiful desserts, pass by wines , variety of cheeses, walk pass unique market products, then order   a personal specialized salad, or over to the deli market for a custom sandwich and/or lovely freshly made deli selections.  watch the bakery at work.  your choice.  drop in yourself or meet friends, its set up for either.  i'm heading back soon....................

Finally got a chance to check this place out for an early dinner on a weeknight and I loved it! I was really craving sushi so when my girlfriend recommended this place I was totally into it. I definitely did not expect to have a new favorite sushi spot!

When I say early dinner, I'm talking 5pm which means we made it just in time for happy hour. Their happy hour deals include wines, one of their signature cocktails (I believe it was a whiskey cocktail on the day that we went) and a select few bites. Although we passed on their drink specials, we did order their $6 dumplings and a spicy salmon roll. As for drinks, we both ordered off of the cocktail list. She got the Shiso Picate which comes with mezcal and jalapeño and I got the Winston's Heat with gin, wasabi and cucumber. We both loved our drinks - so much so that we were happy to get a second round!

Aside from the happy hour food that we got, we also ordered the fried Brussels sprouts, Tuna Tartare, and the Fishtown roll. The Brussels sprouts came in a fairly large bowl and were fantastic. I'm a huge fan of Brussels sprouts and and these were some of the best I've had in Philly - and trust me I've had my fair share! The tuna was a choice my friend made and it was also very good. Lastly the roll we got was so delicious and very filling! It was loaded with shrimp tempura and fish. 

The restaurant is very pretty, clean and spacious. Staff was attentive and checked up on us frequently. 

I can't wait to drop in to Tuna Bar again soon when the next sushi craving hits!
We walked by this place& decided to give it a try. We ordered avo toast and challah french toast! Managed to snag a table outside. Great food!!!

The restaurant was very slow, 2:00 in the afternoon. Only 3 table was occupied, and  still we, (8 of us) with reservation, had to to wait 18 minutes to be seated.
The food was coming out very late,  by 2 plates,  at the time and long wait in between. Grated cheese wasn't offered at all.
Very disappointing, since I thought they need business but not showing any appreciation.
The food was tasty though.

I had order some hair and still haven't receive it I been trying to call the company no answer I tried email I still haven't got my shipping date I bought hair from them once before and it's good hair but as of right now I don't know what's going on and I'm pissed !!
The food here is actually pretty good, but the location seems a little weird.    It really feels lime a mall food court place that was transported to a seedy strip mall.

I don't know how many people have owned this location but it seems to close and reopen every few years. This incarnation has been open a year maybe two. Decor is much more upscale then previous. I believe they may have a bigger selection of chocolates ( I'm not sure if they are all made in house or not ). Much bigger selection of gift items then previous. I purchased some sugar free chocolate today for my cousin, so I can't review the product. Masks are required and employees had them on. I got a friendly greeting upon entering and was thanked at check out.

We came here last year during GenCon and had a great time.  The view was great, the food was great, the drinks were great, the service was great.  This year, the food was lacking in flavor and we had a trainee who didn't know how to speak to us and who didn't get all of our order to us.  The view was still nice.  Won't go back next year

Way too bougie with everything. Spent $200, left hungry and stopped at McDonalds on the way home. I get it's tapas style and to share but these plates were 1 bite per person.

Wedges were just a normal salad just on a tooth pick.
Chicken wings only has 3. Charged $5 for 1 additional so that each person in the party could have a bite.
Gyoza was decent but nothing great

Would not recommend

We are staying near the airport and we went out for some supplies and goggle nearby restaurant and found 39 North Taproom & Grill . The food and drinks was great But the STAFF was Better !! We would eat her again when in the area...

Unimpressive overly-Americanized greasy pizza that resembles national chain pizza such as Pizza Hut. The place's most redeeming quality other than late convenient hours is that it is better than Marrones up the street (a one star pizza). You're much better off going to Felicia's brick oven pizza a few doors down in the Party City parking Lot and paying the extra $2 for much better quality authentic pizza made by a real Italian. (or $5 more for the pomodoro, their #1)

Thank you for accommodating our party of 12 last minute! Our waitress Tyla was wonderful. Despite being understaffed (and the restaurant was practically empty on a Saturday night, which was eerie), food was mostly served in a timely manner.

Visited Santa Barbara a couple weekends ago for a girls trip and this place was a real treat. Cool interior and a great selection of actual breakfast items and pastries. Plus, I'm a stickler for hot coffee and there regular drip was great. The first day, we had the ham and cheese croissant, the quiche and a peach tart of some sort. We each had our favorites, but mine was definitely the peach tart. The peaches were so fresh, crust so flaky it was perfect. The second day, my friend got the quiche again and I had their everything bagel with cream cheese and added tomato+capers+red onion pairing for only $2.50 more which I thought was reasonable. While the bagel was more on the flat, airy side instead of think and chewy like the east-coast bagels I like, it was still insanely delicious. They don't skimp on the toppings and the onions were so tangy it was just perfect.

This store has everything for the Nevada Wolfpack fan and not everything is blue!!  From scrubs to scarves, hand warmers to swim suits. They have glasses, jewelry, and noise makers and so on. Sizes range from new born to XXXL. They even have things for your four legged friends. 

Ladies be aware they are JUNIOR sizes so if you are a medium don't let the fact that you'll need an XL bother you!! 

They also have some Reno Aces gear. The staff is always friendly and willing to help.  

GOOOO Pack!!

"GOOGLE*Zhang Liang" fraudulent vendor (look it up) showed up on my credit card statement in January and February seven or eight times.  
I disputed them.  
I contacted fraud and security department.  
I got a new card.  

The moment I verified the brand-new card, I had a brand-new pending transaction from the same fraudulent vendor.

Chase could not correct the situation.  
I cancelled the card.  
They lost a 20 year loyal customer today.

Simply one of the best service experiences I have had in a long time! 
Knowledgeable, friendly, honest and efficient!
Fixed a Viking Cooktop gas leak and fixed a vibration in my oven that had been driving me crazy for years! 
He wasn't phased a bit ! I highly recommend their service.

We ordered here from Uber Eats, and paid extra for the priority delivery. Our food was 130 bucks for two sandwiches, chicken picatta, a flatbread and a pickle plate. For what we got, it was a rip off! The food was decent, but not great or even good. It was food. This is a picture of the pickle plate at 8 bucks. I understand that with Uber, presentation isn't a thing but seriously? 8 bucks for this. I stopped caring and ate my dinner. The chicken was salty. The Parmesan cheese on the salad was cheap and so nasty I didn't eat it. The best thing was the pickles, all .25 cents worth. I will not be ordering from or ever dining in this place. Save your money and eat somewhere else.

We stopped in to check out the "sale". Apparently, we walked in at the right time because it was the end of summer sale. YAY!!!

Everything was scattered everywhere so it was hard to find sizes, but when I did, I walked out with 4 dresses and a top all for less than $30! HOLLA!!!

The dressing room employees were not very friendly, but when I went to check out, the guys who rang me up were super nice and even made convo. Super nice. 

Great location on State Street where it neighbors other clothing stores.

The food was great there are so many great options with the build your own pasta. Also pass me more of that fresh bread with the olive oil.

Don't sleep on the chocolate cake, there is no better way to finish off an amazing dinner.

Very accommodating (even with kids) though I'd recommend sitting outside if you have antsy ones. Decor is modern, bathroom is nicely decorated and clean. Outside area is funky and cool with lots of greenery. For the food, we had a charcuterie board with 3 cheeses, all delicious. The rose sangria was a hit at the table. For entrees we had brussels, pork, salads, and chicken pasta. All so yummy! Highly recommend! And the staff was very friendly and helpful!

How lucky we were to be directed to this restaurant by the woman at the front desk of our hotel.

One night in New Orleans before catching the train back to California.  

Small plates so we could have a sampler of tastes.

Grilled octopus 
Roasted Brussels Sprouts
Ancient Grains salad
Beneighs for dessert!!!

Good wine. Terrible happy hour.

I went for HH a few days ago and was informed that their HH only included half off full bottles of wine and half of glasses of their house white wine and red wines... Nothing else. No cocktail or food specials. I've never seen anything like it.

With so few options, I did take advantage of half off a bottle of their white blend wine (which is usually $45 but $24 on HH). Crazy right? I've never seen a bottle of white blend wine that was $45. Even $24 for a white blend on HH felt like a rip off.

Here I am holding for customer service; the recorded message says the wait times are greater than 30 minutes!  And all this wait is just to have my negative credit card balance transferred back to my bank account.  For some reason that I can't explain, this is not something one can do through the online account.

How sad for a nation that invented customer service that it's doing everything in its power to do away with it...

The owners do a great job with this place. It is clean, well lit and managed well. They are always friendly and helpful. Bought some great mooncakes for the Mid Autumn Fest and were reasonably priced. My 2 favs are their butter buns and steamed buns - best in Chinatown. Also they have a good selection of cakes, buns and cookies. You gotta try their custard cakes. There are like 8 or 9 bakeries in Chinatown. This one is at the top of my list.
Delicious food. The waitresses were so nice and friendly. Atmosphere was like a sports bar. Very clean and fast service.

My first time using Grub Hub via Yelp, to place an order for pickup.  The sandwich was made exactly has ordered and ready before the allotted time.  The staff was busy with many orders so I'm glad I cut line by ordering on-line!

Quick service- 4.5 is legit rating 
Fantastic environment to grab a bite to eat- overlooks 2 ice rinks- plus TVs for sports watching. This place should be fantastic when hockey season gets in full swing.
Food
Poutine choices as a good hockey rink should have! We had the OG poutine which gets a thumbs up- but as the food critic children reported..... 'not as good as the ski mountain in Canada' (duh....)
Healthy choices too which was delightful- tuna bowl with cabbage, edamame, rice and other yummy things. Kids burger was thick, juicy and the French fries have some kind of amazing salt mixture sorta like crack.
Drinks
Full bar, beer sampling option 
Wednesday night trivia 
Drink specials all nights of the week

We will return 
Probably upgrade to a 5 :-)

We ended up at Tuna Bar on a whim during the Natural Products Expo East convention last week. I have a bunch of food allergies and they handled them with great care and ease! The fish is so incredibly fresh and melts in your mouth. It was so good that I ended up ordering through door dash a few days later - that's twice in four days! Highly Recommend!

I ventured across the river today and made my way to an old favorite I hadn't been to in years. They recently changed buildings and I was excited to see the new place. I was seated in the bar area which I don't particularly enjoy due to noise and foot traffic. I ordered a 12oz filet, I wanted the 8oz, but it was only $3 cheaper. I ordered it cooked medium with Oscar topping and steak fries. The house salad was bigger than I remembered with the same sweet salad dressing I love. The steak took awhile to come out. It was cold and cooked rare. The "Oscar topping" was an uncooked crab cake with three dried up pieces of asparagus thinner than a green bean. I only ate about half the steak. There were only about 12 fries on the tiny plate. They were served burning hot. It took about 10minutes for them to cool down and by that time I had lost my appetite. I ended up eating snacks in the car on the way home. Total disappointment.

So good. We went in for lunch, staff let us in 5before opening. We decided to sit outdoors since we went with a baby and didn't want to disturb people lunches inside. 
Drink wise I only had the mojito, Which was really good.
I wish the eggs had a bit more crab in them but they were good. 
Pasta omg! Delish! Egg cooker to perfection, al dente pasta, creamy sauce, seasoned very well. 
Bread pudding enough for 3-4 people. Comes a la mode-not pictured.
Definitely will be going back.
Overpriced for what you get and the layout of the restaurant is confusing. Everything is served in plastic containers with plastic ware, even if you dine in. Seems very wasteful.

Best sushi in Philly - by far. Great food, service, and space.  

This is a great addition to old city and philly in general.

For our first time in SB, we saw good reviews for this place, menu sounded good, and it was close to our hotel. We ordered a breakfast sandwich, yogurt&granola, and then a lemon-poppy muffin from the display.

We ordered, found a seat, and then when we got our food - the muffin we ordered didn't arrive. When we went back to the cash register, the woman said they ran out... but it was in display when we ordered. We figured, since it's a bakery, that more would be made? She seemed unordered and just said they ran out. She asked if we wanted a refund, but we had to go back to our table and get the card we paid with. Upon returning, had to wait in line again to get the refund. It was kinda frustrating bc we had to do this before eating our food. Also, hard to find clean utensils. 

Other than that, food was good and other staff members were very helpful. Still a good option for an affordable breakfast in the area!

CONSUMERS BEWARE!!! Chase closed my credit card account on May 31st without any notice! They didn't even bother to notify me after the fact! I was left to find out on my own when I received an email from another company notifying me that my automatic payment was denied. Frantically I logged in to my Chase account to find out what happened and to my surprise my account was closed. I immediately called Chase to find out why they closed my account, thinking it must be a mistake, and was told I would need to call back in the morning to speak with a supervisor. I spoke with a supervisor this morning and the only reason he could give me for the closure was "it was in the best interest of the bank at this time" meaning either they weren't making enough money off of me or they no longer wanted to honor the terms of my contract. I've had the card since 2007, use it frequently, have always paid on time, my account is in good standing and I only had an approx. balance of $700 (which is now paid in full). All my other accounts with other banks etc are also in good standing and I have good credit. I also checked my credit reports to make sure nothing fishy was going on there. I'm in shock that a company as big as Chase would treat a long time loyal customer this way! I received absolutely no notice before or after and was left hanging out to dry. They just lost a 10 year customer for life!!!
The lady at the counter was very pleasant. I was on the hunt for the best big combination steamed buns (Baozi). It was good, but the bread to filling ratio needs improvement.
Customer service is amazing at this location and so are their smoothies  very recommended shout out to the smoothie maker Oscar he was very helpful

I was there the week before last and feel compelled to give a terrible review. I ordered the duck/boudin gumbo and it was a greasy salty mess. Just awful. My friend ordered the tuna appetizer and it was slimy. We were so disappointed. The atmosphere is charming and great though, and the wine flights are fantastic. I'm sorry I have to leave a bad review about the food though...

Very dissapointed. Despite all the great reviews here I did not have a good experience. Needed an ignition lock cylinder replaced in my car. Was told at 9 am someone would be out by 1. The locksmith called me at 12:30 and said he was 45 to an hour away. Didn't show up until after 2 o'clock. I was charged $325 for the job, which is ridiculous but I was stuck and had to get the car off the street, which I think he knew that. And he left my car a complete mess. Make sure to get a ball park price, from this company.  I was quoted $150-160 for this job but the other company couldn't get to me right away. Had I known I would have waited.

The parking lot to this establishment is often filled to the brim! We decided to swing by during lunch hour as there were not as many cars in the lot. We were immediately seated, the decor, a bit outdated, quite possibly the same decor from the prior owners, that is not a fact though, as I'm not certain. I was curious to know what the lure of his place was and I quickly came to learn what "Twin peak" was all about just by looking around. I would almost say that it is a modern day Hooters but I probably shouldn't count them out yet because they are still up and kicking he-he. I could not help but notice that the majority of the patrons were men, mainly older and middle aged. The uniforms were very skimpy shorts and very revealing tops. The women are beautiful, I can't help but to believe that they are very careful and particular during the interviewing process. Our server was delightful. She Was able to answer questions regarding the menu, even stood around and made small talk, very nice. On to the food, and I already checked out the menu prior to our arrival and I knew because I was keeping ut keto that I was going to try the smoke chicken wings out, my love wanted fish and chips, but the chips to be replaced with onion rings,  my side was green beans but I didn't realize that it had pork in it which I do not eat so I passed that on to my honey and he said that it was not a stitch of seasoning on it. My wing portion was as expected, however what we were not expecting was for my honey to only receive one piece of fish. We asked if that was the regular portion size and was told yes. This lunch was pretty expensive for what was received, we had no business stopping in the first place but we could not avoid it because of the type of traffic they receive, the curiosity piqued our interest. YOU DON'T DO HERE FOR FOOD that's for sure. With that being said we will not be returning.

Quality Sushi in Philadelphia wasn't always easy to come by.  A lot of options, not many good ones.  That's changed in recent years, but I've been loyal to Tuna Bar since they opened.  The atmosphere is nice (not gimmicky), the service is superb, and the food is top tier.  I typically stick to their Maki and Specialty rolls but the appetizers are all wonderful and the quality of their fish selection is up there with the best in the city.  Look to spend around 90-160 for two if you dine in, though I do tend to over order (and this is without drinks).  Great date spot as well if you're into that sort of thing.

The SB farmers market bowl tasted pretty bad. It was literally a bowl of raw spinach two eggs and majority mushrooms. I am very disappointed to say the least. However, the crispy potatoes and the coffee may be a redeeming factor in my decision to return. Nice staff too.

I can't express my love for this place enough. I hadn't had much bibimbap before I moved to Philly in 2016 and lived across the street from here for two years. I initially saw the place was highly rated so I went to check it out and what's not to like? Rice, choice of protein, veggies, fried egg, etc... it's a healthy and complete meal. Since I've left Philly, I haven't found bibimbap anywhere else in the US that's been as good. It's genuinely exceptional, whether you opt for the stone pot (dolsot) or not. 

But the real kicker here isn't just the amazing food- it's the man behind it all. Francis is special- he's a great chef but an even better person. By running this restaurant, he's helped put his daughter through college and grad school, and supported his family altogether. I'm so happy to see all his hard work paying off! After over 3 years of not seeing each other once I moved, he remembered me as soon as I walked in today. 

Bottom line- if you're looking for the best bibimbap on the east coast, look no further than here. And if you love great food made by great people, this is the place for you. To Francis (if you see this), keep being a role model my friend!

Paid $6+ for a small smoothie when there was a deal for a $5 medium. They didn't bother to tell us even though it was obviously our first time there and then they wouldn't give us a refund when we found out. They finally agreed to make us a medium and it took forever to make. I highly recommend going to Jamba Juice instead.

horrible, so these people spammed me with 5 letters in the past 6 months and made me go provide proof of my social to branch [nearest one is 1 hour a way each way] , after i did all of that they did 2 hard credit pulls on my credit and declined my application !!!! after messing up my credit and with 770 beacon, i simply cannot fathom what kind of terrible bank this is!!!! , will never work with this circus again!!!!!!! 0 stars and absolutely trash of a bank!!!

Absolutely love their mozzarella sticks I go there just for that LOL I went there recently for outdoor dining and it was really nice the server was amazing food was served hot and it was nice to have a little bit of normalcy in our crazy world right now

I haven't received the hair as yet, this is my first time ordering the Peruvian wave pattern  and I'm uber excited! I've ordered the mink  Brazilian in the past and it has been the most durable and lovely hair I've ever purchased. I ordered it in July and I have dyed it 3 times and it's still beautiful! I had to write this review because on Wednesday (today is Thursday) I was so  frantic I would not receive my hair in time for the holidays so I called the store in Indianapolis and the woman in the store was beyond courteous and looked out for my package and I got the shipping email within 24 hours! Thank you so much and I'm so excited to receive it and do a thorough YouTube review!

I had the most lovely time at the Macaroni Grill because of our wonderful server he was a tall young gentlemen with blonde hair. However it was obvious to me that the older female manager named Trena was terrible toward her employees and guests, I have never seen such terrible management! Although I thought it was a pleasant time due to our service, the management will never make me come back ever again! The gentlemen in the suit walks around like he owns the place aswell! Terrible!

May 11, 2019 Saturday - 2:30 PM for a drink
3 adults

Atmosphere - NA stars
Food - 5 star
Service - 5 star

Background - I have been following this truck for a while via Facebook.  So when he said that he was going to be at the Riverfest and that I had already this event in my plans I was excited.

Atmosphere - I am not rating this as it is food truck, but a very cool one.  

Food
  Drink - First round we all tried the lemon lime margarita.  This was an excellent choice.  The second I tried the strawberry mango margarita.  I enjoyed the strawberry mango but the ladies tried mine and both agreed it was a little too sweet for them.  Third and fourth rounds they only had the lemon lime.  I think they could add an option to the menu of an additional shot of tequila to your margarita.

Service - The owner and father were super friendly.  Bonus they had a card swipe you can use your credit card.

Future - I went there four times this day, so yes I would go back.

I debated between Mike's and a popular milkshake place and decided to go to Mike's based on comments about the freshness of Mike's brownies. 
I ordered the Brownie Sundae (with Rocky Top, Vanilla, and Cookies & Cream) with the works: whipped cream, freshly toasted peanuts and cherries on top. The brownie was warmed and yummy, once I was able to reach it underneath the HUGE scoops of ice cream. :)
I could only get halfway through my dessert. Not to worry, my husband enjoyed the other half.

I met a friend here for a meeting last week after work. I have to admit, I thought this was another place (on Binford) and got a little confused, and didn't even know this place was here. Sure, I've heard of Bier Brewery before and I have had their beer at other places, but this was my first trip to the brewery.

Sits on the corner of a strip mall with limited outdoor seating out front. Lots of places to sit inside though, including some big tables, small high top tables, and a bar in the back corner. Very relaxing and casual and stuff stuffed above the restrooms and in every nook and cranny. 

Specials most evenings. I arrived during their growler fill special, although I just stuck with a couple of pints. They were advertising their pumpkin release while I was there, so I'll have to stop back in for that.

All in all, a pretty good place with great beer, casual environment and very friendly staff.

My significant other and I visited on 12/17/19, our last day in New Orleans.  The establishment was aesthetically pleasing, but the food was also great. We both had the baby herbs salad with shrimp.  There were quite a few shrimp in the salad, which made me happy. However, what truly excited me is that the shrimp is wild caught.  Our server was Steph (not short for Stephanie).  She was pleasant, engaging and very attentive.  We truly enjoyed ourselves and the food.  We'll definitely be back.
I love this restaurant it is the best and you can't beat the price !!! My favorite is hibachi chicken and shrimp !!

i heard so many positive reviews about helena ave bakery but it fell short of my expectations. i came in on a saturday morning and shared the green bowl, the red bowl, and french toast with my boyfriend. i opted for the green bowl because i thought it would be a healthier option but it was drenched in dressing and super salty. the red bowl was good but nothing amazing. the french toast was the biggest disappointment. i'm not sure if it was a different type of french toast but it was very thick and not sweet at all. the service was okay; we had to clean our table ourselves as no one came to clean it. i don't think i'll be returning again given there are better brunch places around downtown santa barbara.

Bier is solid all around. Their beer is some of the best in the area and the environment they have screams of coziness. One of the most underrated breweries in Indianapolis, Bier provides one of the finer experiences in breweries, so please check out this homely feeling place soon. Shout out to the hop gummy series!

I am NOT a beer drinker and I usually stay away from breweries like this because of uncomfortable seating (I'm a BIG girl)... WELL, I really LIKE this place! (Though I have a terrible headache, I'm just not use to beer)  Bier is very cozy, very relaxed atmosphere. I understand totally why this is a favorite local spot! Only single bathrooms that are right in the seating area, but very clean. The decor of the place is award winning medals and trophies I will definitely spread the word and I look forward to another visit! Thanks

My wife received a card from Amazon, issued by Chase... and because she rarely uses it, she missed making a payment for 2 months... once she noticed her slip, she quickly called them and made the payment of $13... which ended up being over $40 after the fees they charged. The person who took the payment assured her (after she specifically asked) that this would not affect her credit score! that she should not worry... well... my wife's credit score (which was 835!!!) went down to 740!!!! Yes, it is still a good score, but she didn't get to that score by not paying on time, or not paying at all... she has worked VERY HARD to get to where she is (WAS) on her credit rating, and I think it is very UNFAIR that she was penalized so much for such a minute overlook. So after finding out her new credit score, she called Chase! and was told by the customer service rep. that there was nothing he could do... when she asked to speak to a manager... he said (in a jokingly tone) that "she won't be able to do anything about it either"
I have advice her to pay that balance off with them, and/or transfer the very small balance to another card... and NEVER use Chase credit cards or deal with Chase bank! That is not good customer service! That is NOT how you keep clients happy! But judging by all of negative reviews here, I doubt someone would read this or care enough about the reviews to do anything about it. 
You have been warned! Stay away from Chase!

Just had our first, and certainly not last, sushi dinner from Tuna Bar. Awesome food! 
Very fresh and tasty. I highly recommend the seared Tuna or the Brussel Sprouts. Cooked to perfection. 
Simple California rolls are delightful!
We did takeout, but if you're considering dining in I would definitely make reservations.

I've been to coopervine many times but today was a great experience. I don't know the name of a girl as she never introduce her name at the bar who was a lady bartender today at around 3pm but she was very great, good convo, excellent service, my drinks were chilled had like mint 3 martinis, perfectly made, sent my truffle fries back as it was warm not hot at all but she fixed it.
Your french toast are always best.
I always like the vibes there but today was way better !!

After dinner last night, my friends and I needed something sweet before heading home for the night. Our server recommending we go to Mike's. We were at the Hampton Social so we walked from there to get ice cream. They have over 30 flavors of homemade ice cream and trust me, none of them disappoint. The staff was friendly and very patient when it came to 7 girls trying to decide what flavors we wanted. 

I ended up going with a two scoops in a waffle cone, one scoop of pistachio and one chocolate overload. First of all the portions are huge!! I should have stuck with one scoop but I couldn't pick just one flavor of course. The pistachio was delicious, prefect flavor and super creamy with little bits of pistachios. The chocolate overload was good, I will probably do the cake batter next time in place of the chocolate, but I'm for sure sticking the pistachio. Their waffle cones were also delicious and fresh.
This place has pretty good food and the customer service is really nice! Would come again!

This is the best place to go! I travel 30 minutes from willow groove and it is worth it 120%! Allison is amazing. She is extremely kind and makes you feel really comfortable from the moment you walk in. Besides the great results she has given me from my chin sculpting, I couldn't imagine any other beautician working on me! Look NO further! This is the place to go hands down

I haven't been in this building since it was Yard's and ended up here for the first time after a Mad Hatter's Gin & Tea Party last week. 
There was a nice selection of beer and great food menu. It was a busy Friday night but the staff was friendly, our food came out quick and the fries were hot. 
Fun place and great location. We'll definitely be back.

I've had credit cards with Chase bank since 2007 following the institution's takeover of Washington Mutual in 2008. Last month I discovered the secondary credit card attached to "my" Chase credit account (issued in my grandson's name) was "missing" after the child's wallet was confiscated (later returned) by the Encinitas sheriff's department following a still pending dispute. Upon discovery of the missing card I immediately called Chase and "cancelled" the old card and was told (per website instruction) to notify ALL existing merchants if the billing information were to remain the same. (New account number issued/balance forwarded but old account closed for "security" reasons. Simple enough, you would think? But apparently this is not the case.)

When reviewing my Chase account on 12/12/2017, I noticed a new charge for $39.99 (posted by LA fitness--my grandson had signed up for reoccurring billing prior to the credit card account being closed and balance reassigned) prompting me to file a single charge dispute. Two days later, another charge by LA Fitness (Encinitas location) ($19.98 also not authorized) was posted to which I called to file a second dispute. 

When I called Chase I was put in touch with the institution's fraud department (both calls routed through India call center) and was told the charges were related to the previous account (even though the account had been deactivated, closed and reassigned) and were therefore "authorized"! (What?! And by Whom?) When I explained that no new information to authorize billing had been forwarded to LA Fitness and that the new charges reflected since new account issuance had been reassigned were not authorized the representative could not understand! 

Ten minutes later I called Chase back (800-945-2000 ext. "0") and asked for the newly assigned account to be placed on a temporary hold until the matter could be resolved. I reemphasized my reasons for WHY I was disputing both charges and informed the India consultants that I would be doing so in writing once Chase forwards the paperwork to explain why.  Pending HOW Chase handles this dispute will determine what action I follow up with, which could include taking this matter to federal court! (Since it's the banking industry and because it affects the general population it's seems fitting at this point.)

While I'm waiting for a response from Chase anybody have any suggestions as to why Chase - or any credit card company for that matter - would take on other businesses contractual obligations and without both parties first consenting let alone being informed ? Is that even allowed?  F.Y.I. Amazon won't do it - their call center is also based out of India - so why would the banking industry take such a risk?

Check back..... I'll post updates or modify or change the 1 star review as events unfold....

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Update 12/19/2017..... Called JP Morgan-Chase Bank USA N.A. fraud department yesterday and the problem was "instantly" resolved. The man on the phone pulled my account (with my permission) and immediately understood and transferred me to someone to reverse the unauthorized charges. They put a block on LA Fitness vendor and made sure my accounts were safe and not subject to future charges.

Should you ever encounter difficulties or not be able to resolve a problem from Chase's India based customer service location I suggest calling the USA number (1-800 -432-3117).

Thank you gentleman working in Chase's Fraud department, I appreciate you looking out for my best interests! 

(F.Y.I. reason upgrade to 3-star review - first experience 1 star, updated experience 5+ star = 3+ stars.)

Ardmore Pizza is usually our go-to place for cheesesteaks, burgers, and fries.  The food is consistently good; which is why my experience tonight is so disappointing.

I ordered a large fries and an order of clam strips.  Their fries are usually so amazing that I won't pass them up.  Crispy on the outside, creamy in the middle.  They are french fry heaven.  I'd been thinking of branching out and trying something different, so I ordered the clam strips which were on the appetizer menu.

When I placed the order, the man at the counter asked me if they were the appetizers and I said yes.  He told me he'd ring it up as a platter and that would save me a little money.

And THAT was my mistake.  I should have said, "no thanks," because that platter didn't save me any money at all.

I live a short 5 min from the store.  When I got home, I opened the container to find the fries sitting on top of a salad.  Let's forget that I didn't order salad.  Salads are cold.  French fries are hot.  Dumping hot fries on a cold salad does what to those two foods?  It turns the salad into slimy, limp, warm slop.  It also made their normally crispy fries WET and limp.

As if that weren't bad enough, the clam strips weren't strips. They looked like overcooked little balls and they were all over the fries and the salad.  All of this was in a styrofoam container that was all wet inside from the steam build up.

That entire box was $9.25 + tax of inedible crap and went right in the trash.  

Fine.  Lesson learned.  Next time I want fries, I'll order from the appetizer menu.  And I'll pass on the clam "strips" and stick with the two items I know are fantastic: the cheesesteaks and the burgers.

(For the record, I'm not new to "platters."  What's different here is the fact that the cold salad was in with hot food. Platters I've ordered elsewhere include salads in their own containers. This is restaurant basics 101:  serve the cold food cold and the hot food hot.)

I first went to Tony's as a child, with my father, who was a friend of Tony.  Tony would let me come behind the bar and serve myself a pop from the soda gun.  Good times!   Tony and Edie Ventimiglia visited our family in Monterey, CA several years later and it was a joy to see them again.  Now, over 50 years later I'm looking forward to visiting sometime in the near future and I'm certain the food will be amazing.  I can't wait to rekindle that family connection!

It was a little confusing but the brewery and Craft Hall are the same-- Craft Hall is the restaurant portion. There is limited parking in a small lot across the street or metered parking. I got a flight to try 4 5oz beers on tap. Their limited options was a little disappointing! My favorite was their porter. I also got the warm pretzel with spicy mustard and pimento cheese because it looked so good from other yelper's reviews. They must've changed their menu item from then because the pretzel I got looked completely different. The cheese wasn't in the pretzel, it was a dip and possibly fake pimento cheese because it just tasted like spicy cream cheese. I do love their huge space and bench seating. There's also an entire table of board games to pick from!
As the reviews state, you would not expect this to be as good as it was. We had a great time watching and eating, our server Matt was awesome!

Me and my family have been coming here ever since they opened and we LOVE it! But I do have one complaint on the door it says "mandatory face mask" however many adults and children are just walking around with absolutely no mask on and no one said a word. They need to start actually taking the masks seriously and staff should be telling them no service w/out a mask or don't bother putting it on the door‍.Other then the mask the food and service was great!

Absolutely fantastic! Huge portions at an Excellent price. Prepared and delivered very fast for the amount of food I ordered, which was a pretty big amount! Highly recommend it and I will definitely be ordering from here again! Thanks!
Had high hope's and hungry for pasta, but alas it disappointed, mediocre dry pasta, weird tasting tomato basil soup but the kicker was this tiny dessert for 7.50

Dined here with reservations on a Saturday night with my boyfriend. We were seated immediately and was given a heater (since we were sitting outside and it was cold this weekend). We ordered apps and they arrived quickly.  The sushi was taking a bit of time but it was so worth the wait! The sushi was fresh and the rolls were so good! It is a bit pricey but the service and quality of food is nothing less than phenomenal!
The Avocado Smash Burger is amazing! The service is not lol. The beers are freakishly cold! Worth the trip if you don't mind waiting around.

A hidden gem of the Chap. The wings are amazing and depending on the bartender you are in for a good drink. The food comes out prompt and hot and the customer service is always good. You can bring the family or pop in for a quick date night. Don't forget you can always skate the night away down stairs .

This wasn't my first time to Tony's and definately will not be my last.  As always, I start off with the pepper jack cheese cubes which are breaded and deep fried.  I honestly could eat them as the meal they are so good.  Draft pints were on special for $2 each so I of course had a few to along with my meal.

For the main course, my wife and I ordered a pizza with pepperoni and italian sausage.  This was my first time ordering a pizza at Tony's and I was impressed.

The service was good and the prices were great.  They always seem to have some good deals going during the week so don't wait for the weekend to go!

Tko was fantastic!!! They had people up and dancing and I was in a sea of giggles and smiling guests most of the night. They didn't even mind having to be a little flexible with our timetable when we detoured a little on the way to the reception so we could stop and take pictures with the grooms dad in the hospital so as to make sure he was included in our wedding! Very affordable too!!Highly recommend them!

I really enjoyed my brief visit to St.Honore Pastries. I'd originally planned to go to one of the newer spots but I've been here many times and knew they wouldn't disappoint me. I wish the rest of the city was like Chinatown that place is always jumping it feels like NYC. 

Service 4.5/5
The counter lady was all business but the two people in front of me were elderly and I thought she could have been a little gentler with their cake box. I'd a feeling there was an actual cake inside and the man commented to me that "this is a peaceful place," right before she slammed his cake box on the counter. Now he epitomized customer loyalty but I could see (though he didn't say it) he didn't feel appreciated by the counter lady. A loyal customer is special and should be treated accordingly. 

Ambiance 3/5
I've been here before it's not peaceful. But I enjoyed the people watching. There are usually senior citizens sitting together watching the news in Chinese with a cup of coffee or tea it's lovely to see them. And even better b/c the scent of coffee wafting through the cafe/bakery smelled divine. I didn't order it though b/c I'm a habitual insomniac so no caffeine for me after 2pm.

Food
Egg tart 3/5
Though it was delicious it was way too sweet for me and i love sweets. The tart crust was perfect but the egg custard was too sweet. I won't order it again although it was very creamy and otherwise cooked perfectly.

Rainbow cake 5/5
Not too sweet - it was perfect and just the right amount of frosting. The sponge cake was moist and had the right texture. I basically have the pallet of a little kid so if i see rainbow sprinkles i say yes please.

My check came to $2 so I highly recommend you make a visit and try different items b/c at those prices you can afford to take some risks !

We usually come here on a thursday late afternoon when the crowd volume is just right. We came this past sunday and it was PACKED. Firstly, I had no idea they offered an AYCE buffet brunch for $40 including wine, beer, and some specialty drinks. That's not a bad deal. I didn't opt for the buffet  brunch because I wasn't that hungry, 

I wound up getting the burger and fries combo which is always pretty good here. Mind you I just said I wasn't that hungry and barely finished my food. My wife ordered the sauteed mushroom melt and hers was so big, we could have split that instead. 

Overall, I will definitely just stick to Thursday mostly because as much as I love the kids play area, I could see my daughter was overwhelmed by the amount of kids and didn't have as much fun which is half the reason we come, but that's nothing the business can control. Thursdays seem to be a sweet spot, but that brunch will definitely be explored one day soon!

TGP has two stand-out features: Ambience (Read date night!) and rare ingredients. 

Compared to other haute cuisine restaurants, there are few of this grandeur. It is mid-century, dimly lit, with grand emerald green velvet seats and walls of the same color. It's going to give date night spots in town a run for the money. The vibe is upscale with house lounge music (loud and could be toned down). Plus, the serving ware is gorgeous. The dish added to the beauty of the dish. (I dunno how I felt about wooden chopsticks, though. It's definitely more practical, but did take away from the elegance). So just for the ambience TGP deserves more than 5 stars. 

TGP has a well curated menu. There is plenty to choose from, although vegetarian options maybe limited. They use fine quality ingredients like Jidori chicken, and mushrooms too fancy to google (kidding!). Also, there isn't sushi, ramen or yakitori for dinner. The portions are small, sharing size, but given Japanese cuisine is all about clean light and bright flavors, those elements alone will satisfy your appetite. The menu is divided into Cold and Hot; within the hot, light to heavy dishes.

The Sunomono: To dumb it down-fancy poke. To elevate it- fresh, cooling, and edible flowers. The moonfish is gorgeous and the coolness from the cucumber ironically punches through. 

Tebasaki gyoza: You haven't had chicken wings like this before. The inside is filled with shrimp. I don't know where the croissant is, in the filling or the crumb coat, but either way, stuffed wing like no other. Delicious, light, juicy and crunchy with an element of surprise. The sweet chile sauce seemed like the regular kind, I couldn't tell if it was house-made. 

Ikinari steak: Don't let the size fool you. It is rich and a very heavy dish. Comes out in a sizzling skillet. A huge dollop of miso brown butter, looks like gold and feels as rich, makes the steak outstanding. The skirt steak is cooked to perfection-  medium rare, tender juicy and a delicious char and asian flavor. The caramelized onions and corn really compliment the richness from the butter and sauce. Great fusion. 

Fried Tempura Chocolate Cake: I am not a big fan of the chewiness in mochi, so I went with the extreme opposite: texture bomb! This is a molten chocolate cake fried in tempura batter with dulce de leche sauce, with a side of ice cream, topped with sauteed puffed rice. So you have the ooey goeey, the crispy, crunchy, hot cold, solid and liquid.  Decadent, much? Most definitely. 
In spite of the multiple textures, it felt one note- very sweet. I wish they had some salt or citrus to cut the richness. 

Granted, I have not had enough Japanese food of this kind to compare so I may not be the best judge. I think the food is delicious and of high quality, but I just wasn't wowed by the flavors. It was an elevation of the quality and ingredients of the familiar asian flavors.

They have midday and lunch offerings too which would be great to try out. Prices are comparable, portions depending on the item maybe on the smaller side. 

The service is great. We actually went with the recommendations of our host who told us about the dishes. There is ample seating. 

The reason I was a little annoyed, I picked the wrong premier parking garage downtown (222 parking is the closest to TGP) and by the time I walked over to catch the midday menu, with ten minutes to spare till dinner at 5pm I couldn't order off it. So although the midday is till 5 it isn't. But I agree that's me being pesky. 

Nonetheless, next time. TGP is a great addition to downtown. The upscale Japanese food makes it very unique. And it is a very promising restaurant.

The name is a perfect description of what you'll find here. Half of the store is filled with numerous types of candies, nuts and chocolates. The dark chocolate covered pretzels were my favorite followed by the drizzled pretzel. The chocolate was rich and creamy covering a fresh, crisp pretzel. Perfect spot for filling candy gift bags, Piñatas, wedding candy tables or just snacks as you drive by. 

The other half of the shop feels like a disconnect located in a candy and chocolate store. Regardless, they carry some cute, some useful, some bitter, some sweet gifts and gift cards. Honestly I'll didn't see anything on the gift side to bring me back however the chocolate side will see me many times in the near future.

Loved everything about this restaurant, the service the food and the delicious cocktails and selection of wine! It was really cool to be able to order half glasses of various wines to enjoy with your meal. No complaints at all and surely to come back!

The ice cream was so good and it was too hot, and I forgot to take a pic of my ice cream  but I had the double peanut butter fudge  
It was super good! I also has an iced coffee with double espresso and that was great!
Great baristas and you can sample as much as it takes you to make up your mind, which I did for a while. 
Because when it's hot, you can't make up your mind on something cold as fast as you would when it's not hot, proven fact per my own realization. 
Just get yourself some and you'll love it!

COPPERVINE! One of the new places you're probably hearing about from wine lovers. This place is still fairly new, and right now, it's being talked about by a lot! My friends and I wanted to try this spot during the Mardi Gras week and see what it's all about. 

The place looks great! Just right on Poydras, this place has a pretty fair selection of wines to try and food and snacks to munch on! The place inside was packed, and for some reason, their upstairs rooms were not open that day, so we had to sit outside during the night. It was fairly cold, and disappointingly, there were no lights outside and no heaters. However, the outside looked great and the soft chairs were pretty comfortable to sit on and relax. A lot of us ordered different wines and mixed drinks. We also ordered Herb Roasted mushroom pasta, Short rib, Wagyu Burger, Duck Fat Fries, 3 Pork Bellies, and a Smoked Salmon. 

First off, I could appreciate the selection of wines they had to offer, not bad at all. They also had a "Flight" option where you can try a small amount of 3 different wines. What shocked me was that these wines were sort of expensive. The server that brought out the "Flights" for my friends got a lot of the wines mixed up and was confused on who ordered what, sort of disappointing. As for the food, most of it was pretty lackluster, but not bad. The Duck Fat fries were $8 and it was nothing more but fries with a little cheese on top. EASY pass. We ordered 3 orders of the Pork Belly, but the dishes were inconsistent. My dish in particular was surrounded by a sauce while the other 2 didn't. I didn't know what the dish was supposed to look like. The Pasta was overcooked and lacked some flavour. The short ribs were nothing more that just shirt ribs to be honest. Lacking in flavour and just pretty underwhelming. If the burger did not have the Wagyu name in it, I would've just thought it was a regular burger, which it pretty much is, again, underwhelming. And finally.. that SALMON was $16!! The salmon was TINY and it came with about 5 pieces of small toast to share. Again, pretty standard, yet , EXPENSIVE.

Overall, this place isn't bad if you wanna come has some wines and snacks to eat and have some cheese plates, however, you're gonna spend a good bit. Nothing impressive for my first trip, I don't think this place would come across my mind again unless someone suggested.
Everything here was delicious. The matcha and chai lattes were very light. The Elvis banana bread with peanut butter and bananas was heavenly. The fried chicken sandwich was so good too.

We stopped by yesterday and was helped by a lovely young lady by the name of Bella.  It's one of the best experiences I've had at this location.  She was genuinely kind.  You can tell she loves working at this location and it shows.
Food was terrible, wings undercooked, and the service was even worse. Waitress got our order wrong and even charged me for extra sauce that SHE had gotten wrong . Never returning.

Best fresh sushi we had yet, and nicely presented. Server was great, always within reach if something is needed. Nice atmosphere, except for Race St noise, and we ate inside. Street parking in the area is tight, and free on Sunday. Not hectic like Tomo which has no ambiance,  and is like eating in the middle of a fire drill. Wife's glass of wine was pricey, $14. Nice beer from 2SP. Will be back.

This is a well organized and super interactive trampoline park. It's super fun for the kids and it has a ton of different areas for kids to run and play. It is also safe which is nice, the kids can run and play and do their own thing and as a parent I could wander around and watch my kids have a blast. Only draw back is the price. It is expensive for an hour of jumping and having to buy socks is a pain. It's clean and the staff are friendly.

I love old fashion ice cream parlors so this was a must when we were in downtown Nashville! The ice cream has a rich decadent texture that you can only get from homemade ice cream. There is always a long line, but the service is great so the line moves pretty quickly.

I woke up early this morning and decided to watch the sunrise at Stearn's Wharf. Upon leaving, I remembered that this spot was within a block of the pier. After hearing several of my friends rave about this place, I figured now was as good a time as any to give 'em a try!

It was just past 7am when I walked in. There was one couple seated, but the kitchen was teeming with staff baking away! What a cool sight! The restaurant appears to be shared with a winery; the venue was spacious and well-decorated! Though there only appeared to be a few dedicated parking spaces, I had no trouble finding a spot close by. 

The staff were friendly and the menu was vast. I ordered a mocha and the ricotta toast and they were both out of this world. The mocha was one of the best I've ever had, and the toast had the perfect blend of sweet and savory  atop a hearty slab of bread! They went together so well. What a treat!

Today was my first time here but certainly not my last. I've attempted to come in the past only to be greeted by a line out the door. As I was leaving, a group of 10 walked in. The place is totally worth the line, but be like me and come super early to avoid it!
We have went to Toby two times now  amazing person Great Office ,  able to help up both time I recommend her and her office to amyone

The food is usually good, went today and someone was cooking with sandals, no hair net or gloves. Opened my food when I got home and found hair in my box. Called to complain and they refused to give a refund. Will not be back. Unsanitary

I really wanted to love this place but I was disappointed by the beer and patrons.  It had lots of pretentious frat boys and gaggles of children. I think it's trying to please  every demographic so that might be be problem. It's got beer, food, large bar, lounge area, dining area, outdoor tables, large flat screen TVs, table tennis, outdoor seating, corn hole, kids area with tetherball, video games, jungle gym. 

I tried the Bemuse Belgian beer. They served it in a plain cylindrical glass with a 10oz pour and charged $6. It looked like I was drinking out of a hotel cup. The beer was very clear like a Pilsner. The taste was slightly bitter with a metallic aftertaste. It was drinking-able but not something I could seek out again.

You should definitely try this place out.  I'm still on the fence about it. It might be your go to place to take your kids so you can turn them loose on other patron (free daycare) or bring your bros to watch b-ball and talk about your Lamborghini or just sit outside and enjoy the soft breeze and road noise.

Chase has to be right up there with wells fargo when it comes to being straight forward and honest. I was on the phone over an hour just trying to get answer to a simple clearing question I had for my account.  It was frustrating trying to get a simple answer, they refused to give the simplest of answers.

Finally A manager/team leader only identified by Terrie, supplied me with the information.  Chase bank is much like the far right winged confuse, redirect and place blame on others. By-far one of the worst banks to deal with on a CS level.
Wow amazing homemade ice cream! Recommend the Merlot Chocolate, Red Velvet Cake, Blackberry Cornbread, Blueberry Cheesecake, & Tennessee Fudge! All delicccioussss!

I do not know how they get much less the 5 stars as our meal were almost perfect as I had the broiled Sole 13$ which had a wonderful sauce and would of been a perfect 5 star but they serves spaghetti in a red sauce which I did not find a good paring so next time I remember to ask for an alternate. The other dish we had thought was perfect the gorgonzola filet 20$ which had a seasoned roosted Potato's cubs which were some of the best I ever had the Filet was very tender good size and prefect med rare.

I ordered through Uber eats from this place
I ordered a burger and a poutine dish they call the "Canuck"
I specified in my instructions to not add salt to these fries(picture shows what I said)
Upon getting the order and taking a fork of the Canuck I found that it should be called THE OCEAN. Instead of No Salt it was more like they added extra salt. It was way beyond anything edible.
I filed a problem report through Uber eats but haven't heard anything.
A gave two stars for the burger, which was ok but for what was paid nothing was worth the price.

This is based on my visit there about three weeks ago on a Friday evening. I had been here one other time, on a weekday afternoon, and I was the only person there. But my experience overall was consistent with my more recent visit.

Bier has been around a while. It started out pretty small and was basically available just on tap at a few restaurants around Indy and at their tasting room, which had very limited hours. Their having decided to can and distribute their beer has probably really helped, and they've slowly gotten a little bit bigger over time. 

I like their beer. I've never tasted anything by them that knocked my socks off, but their quality control is very good and they do a few creative things, especially now with the hazy IPA craze. But their stalwart staples such as Weizengoot (a hefeweizen that is my favorite of their beers) are very strong.

The taproom itself has a roped off area out front with some seating, and there's more seating inside, all tables socially distanced. There is a small counter area where you order. They have maybe 10 beers on tap at any one time, all theirs as far as I saw. They also have a carryout fridge. The folks at the counter were super friendly and wore masks at all times, particularly when cleaning tables between customers.

The taproom does not serve food but they welcome you to bring your own. I'm not sure about pets, as I didn't see any there. I'd imagine they'd at least be welcome on the patio area out front, weather permitting.

In the end, Bier is probably not going to be a splashy name in town like Sun King is and isn't going to demand that kind of attention. But their beer is quite good, and I think if they had more resources (or ambition? I don't think it's fair to judge on something I don't know for sure. Some craft breweries actually don't want to be big and notorious and prefer to stay smaller) they'd be one of the heavies in the state as far as the top breweries go.

One of the best ice cream places in town. Definitely recommend to stop by especially when you don't want to take your girlfriend to shop at $399 per pair boot store. Or you are coming with kids and can't go into any bar in this area.

I tried the loaded butterscotch and pistachios ice cream. Pistachios tastes ok. The loaded butterscotch is really good. It super sweet with a bit hint of salt. Pro Tip: ask for a taster (or ten) before finalizing your decision. 

They all taste good but don't overdo it.  One scoop per person max! I got two scoops which is only $4.95 + tax. And I felt like I'm walking on the cloud and totally get sugar high afterward.

Great atmosphere, but extremely overpriced and overhyped for the quality of the food. $17 wagyu burger, taste like regular ole angus beef. $29 for the black drum fish, my hubby said it was good but it oddly didn't come with a side. I got a regular margarita which was great while he got the "Gentle Sage," which was also good. Service was great, just sad that the food wasn't to my expectation.

We lost our only daughter, Brooke in 2013 to a drunk driver, she was an Organ Donor. We went to the store because our friends' daughter (same birthday as Brooke's) is starting UNR in the fall. 

I cannot emphasize how it warmed our hearts when the store offered a 15% discount to organ donors! 

We ended up spending $400+ & it was worth every penny! We love this store & appreciate them for acknowledging organ donors!

GREAT BREWS!!!
This place isn't always the first place folks think of when they decide to visit a brewery in Indy... but it should be!! It's on the outskirts of town, but well worth heading over to! They have some wonderful mixes/brews... and their many awards prove it! 

It has a nice sized tasting room that is comfy welcoming. Not to mention the ever changing chalk board with some awesome art work to fancy up their list of what is on tap. 

GREAT place and wonderful people!!!
Highly recommend!

I was in the area and saw a sign that said "bakery" and I had to stop! I love trying new bakeries and this one did not disappoint! The guy at the counter was friendly and helpful. I like the industrial chic vibe. I got a pretzel and it was perfect. The color was dark golden brown (just how it should be) and just the right amount of salt. A true pretzel. Not like some doughy mess you'll find at a cart in the mall. Also, it came with a hot mustard that will make your brain burn in a good way!! I love it!!! I'll be back with beer.

I came here last night for my friends birthday - a group of 4 girls all together.  We were really excited to come here because we've heard the buzz and we were not disappointed!  The space is awesome - a mix of retro 50s diner/with modern and sophisticated touches.  It was so quiet - I think because it's so new.  We were the only ones in there from 9:30PM on.  The staff and service were fantastic.  Our waiter, Brion, was attentive to our needs and quick to provide recommendations (which turned out incredible!).  Ken Sze, the owner/executive chef also came out towards the end of our meal to make sure we were happy and satisfied.  We chatted with him on our way out and he was very pleasant!  

Onto the food!  We had a number of appetizers.  We tried the scallop crudo on recommendation and this was one of the best dishes of the night.  This MELTS in your mouth.  You must have this.  We also had the pork gyoza, creamy rock shrimp, mai fried rice, and wagyu beef egg rolls.  All were delicious and would highly recommend.  The wagyu beef egg rolls were on special but I asked that they put it on the full menu when it is released!  

We got 4 sushi rolls- the Old City, Fishtown, Spicy Salmon, and California roll.  All were absolutely delectable - super fresh, and really flavorful.  We finished off with ice cream for the table - the chocolate and the green tea.  So rich and creamy!

Overall, our experience was awesome and this is such a great addition to the Philly sushi scene.  I will definitely be coming back.  Hoping Ken will release a tasting menu soon!

I have had pretty good experiences here. I love the bread they bring you at the beginning of the meal. Mmmmm it trumps Olive Gardens breadsticks completely!
Personally I like to do the "Create your own pasta" option. I feel like I am pretty damn good and putting flavors together, and basically I just know what I like. But if I don't get this I go for the pasta milano, which is quite tasty.
My friends and I have used this place for group meals a lot and it works out very well for that. Everyone can munch on bread and sip on a drink while waiting for the others to join.

I go there at least once a week when I crave Korean food! Bi-Bim-Bap has always been one of my favorite Korean food and I'm so happy that this place is near by where I live. Service is really quick and the owners are very kind! Mainly the food is very good. I tried their chicken and beef bi-bim-bap and they are amazing! I also had their yuk gae jang, seafood pancakes, and jap chae and they are all good! Highly recommended! Def a hidden gem!

Love this place! Love the concept, the food, the quality, size. Only negative is the TINY garage and only one free hour of parking. It's becoming increasingly harder to find parking in Nashville, especially in this area. I try to go early to avoid any stress in finding a spot. Also, the garage is TINY!!! Not sure what they were thinking when they made such small spaces and low clearance.
Anyway, on to the food. I've now had several salads and desserts. Everything was great, but the show stopper is the Far East salad. I'm not a vegetarian, but I do love fresh veggies on a salad. It's wonderful! The sesame peanut thai vinaigrette is sinful, so I get mine on the side to not overindulge. Fresh fresh fresh ingredients and you can make up your own salad. I love the concept!! One of these days I'll try the sandwiches, but there is so much to choose from here, you just pick your station. There is a wine cooler, to-go food and a dessert case. The large cookies are good, but some of the desserts were super sweet. I'm sticking with my salads! YUM!

I have had their margaritas from the Feed the Camel event and Food Truck Friday. Great flavors, great product, great customer service! I cannot say enough good things! If you like a margarita (with a definite kick of tequila) try them out!

We love a cute/tasty bakery! Was passing by & stopped to grab a coffee but the pastries were too good too pass up!

I got the Bacon Egg and Cheddar Sandwich, Americano & Chocolate Croissant. There is a line sometimes but who can help but line up for this spot. It is a little pricey but overall delicious.

Deiced we would finally try the food at Doc's since we have lived in West Chester for two years and yet to eat there. Headed in around 8 o'clock , hostess was really nice got a cozy table in back where it was nice and quiet. After a 9 hour day at work the one thing i wanted was a pint of Guinness and that's exactly what i got! Beer selection was decent, nothing crazy but they had enough.
That night they where running a special on "FISH BOWLS" which in my opinion is just watered down flavored liq in a cheap plastic bowl that is just the most annoying thing to walk around with. But if you are a freshman at W.C.U. and or a chick that wants to get "Wild" on a sugar high, its something that you might enjoy. 
So onto the food. I started off with there Fried Fresh Buffalo Mozzarella which had to be some of the best Ive ever had. I assumed that the "Buffalo" was for the fact that there where pretty large. Come to find out they where made with Buffalo milk. Main course was Doc's Signature Burger, nothing out of the ordinary just a delicious burger with fries . My girl friend went with there Steamed P.E.I. Mussels. From what she said they where delicious except for the occasional grains of sand! 
All in all a great restaurant, does start to get loud and over crowded after 9:30 but that's like most places in down town West Chester.
Best challah in . . . well, anywhere I've been outside of Europe and Israel. Don't tell anyone. ;-)

I really, really, really like board games. Some people (who? who?) might say I'm a bit too competitive and refuse to play board games with me anymore, but those people obviously don't "get" board games.

The folks at River City Games totally "get" board games. They carry basically any kind of board game you might be looking for -  party game, logic game, kids game, anything!

And this place isn't just board games, it's croquet, darts, pinball, pool tables, all kinds of games big and small. There's even a tiny hallway for practising darts.
