Friendly staff were helpful, knowledgable and enthusiastic. A great little spot that I think a lot of people don't know about, but should!
This is my favorite bar. The staff is friendly, the food is great and the drinks are priced extremely reasonably. Their specials are great every day and we love the $3 shot shelf!

They are great. Expensive. But really good.... 

There delivery had been on time and they don't do anything you wish expect them to do.

The pepperoni pizza is delicious and probably the best thing in their menus.... 

Nothing else I've tried stands out, but the pizza is better than good enough.
Great food, great service. Simple and accessible menu. The specialty is in mixed rice dishes.

Great to see an H&M open up down here.  I was visiting with a friend, and I took him and his girlfriend to help him pick out some new threads for an upcoming trip to Italy.  I had to use a gift card that I got from a Bay Area store as a freebie they were handing out that day and this was the last day to spend it.  I found a purple blazer there that would be great for parties, but they didn't have it in my size.  Settled on a plain black long sleeve undershirt that's my favorite thing to wear under my official black short sleeve polo at work when it's cold.  They didn't have as many low cost or clearance items as the Bay Area stores I like, but it's a big, clean, organized store.  Again, great to see one down here!

The spinach salad was amazing, with a vinegar based dressing, walnuts, and mandarin oranges...just like home made...and service was prompt, very friendly, and appropriately frequent.  Seating was immediate, amazing for good food at good prices on a Friday eveningThe lasagna was generous, creamy, and thoroughly heated without being burnt on the surface.  .  My wife had Penne Primavera...adn it wasvery good...with copious topping ...it was not all noodle!  My son had Michelangelo Penne...and the serving size was mroe than generous.

We enjoyed the meal.  And, the fresh rosemary bread served before the meal was also amazing!

I picked up tofu bibimbop to go, and it was pretty good! Very healthy, good sauce. I would say half the dish was rice, so I would have preferred additional veggies. Apart from that, it was tasty! I wish they had spicy pork bibimbop! They take credit cards now too.

Nice place with a cool concept. Unfortunately, I went during lunch and it was pretty packed, but that's not a bad thing and in no way reflects negatively on the establishment. I got the Seattle Ceasar salad (I know, not very adventurous, but it sounded good), it was tasty and I liked it, though I would have liked a little more Salmon in the salad. The group I was with had good things to say about their food, so I'm guessing all the food is pretty good and next time I'll try something different. Personally, I'm not crazy about standing in line to order, then walking to another area to pay, then sitting down to eat, the format seems too 'fast food' for such a nice place, but that's just my opinion. All in all, I enjoyed it and will more than likely return again.
Great flavors. I got Tennessee fudge and Nutter Butter. I love finding huge chunks of cookie in my ice cream. The nutter butter tastes exactly like the cookie.

I received a great big bowl filled with fresh vegetables, spicy sauce, and a perfect over easy egg. Extraordinarily quick service, under three minutes to get my order. It's a great place for a quick healthy bite.

I got an exam and a cleaning. I was there from 9:30 to 12:00, which might seem like a long time, but it was awesome. Everything was explained in detail, and it was easily the most thorough and enjoyable (yes, you read that correctly) experience at the dentist I've ever had. Each person was incredibly upbeat, friendly, and knowledgeable. The Dr. spent extra time with me explaining everything and answering all of my questions, as did the hygienist.  I have to go back a few more times for some...ahem...work.... (oops!) but I am looking forward to it and I know I am in the best hands possible.

I shop at this store at least twice a week.  The staff I have dealt with have been very courteous and polite.  I use the self serve almost all the time with no trouble.  The deli department is sometimes busy, but quick.

Oh heck yes.
Great service, great flavors (I got moose tracks... vanilla with I think fudge swirls and chocolate chip chunks), great texture, and decent pricing.  I liked the traditional layout of the shop, too.  Definitely give it a go if you're in town!

Visited here on a late Friday night for some late night pizza. The pizza is simple delicious, I had a cheese slice and dressed it with parmesan cheese and  red pepper...simply delish! The crust is garlic flavored and flavorful. I highly recommend visiting here for late night snacking as they are open late.

My wife and I had Zios catered at our wedding & let me tell you EVERYONE LOVED IT! All of our guests couldn't stop talking about how good the food was.. Upon setting up our order the staff handled everything to perfection, Ralph is the guy to talk to about setting up your wedding and/or event! He definitely made it a lot easier. The food was delicious, we barely had any left!!! P.S the chicken tortellini is AMAZING!
I am one of the biggest Smoothie King fans and am ecstatic we got one close.  BUT, this has to be the slowest store.  Has to be.  I struggle to go back because it takes forever.

Was walking down Broadway and couldn't help but to notice a long line of people, so I had to see what it was about. ICE CREAM It was perfect for a hot day of walking. There was not many flavors to choice from, but what they had were original. The ice cream was wonderful, but the portion size was small for the money. The only ice cream place I saw on Broadway. f

Bad food & poor service.

These chain restaurants must all have the same consulting company because they all have the same routine going on.  Elaborate theme oriented exterior that tries to be "fun", brightly colored laminated menus, ridiculous themed interiors, nearly identical websites, signature appetizers, and terrible food.  

Jimmy Buffet's foray (cash  grab) into the restaurant racket boasts cheeseburgers.  They are not bad, but in the end the industrial nature of the restaurant cancels out the positives.  My burger was juicy and cooked as I requested but did not come with what the menu said it would come with: jalapenos, sour cream, and pepper jack cheese.  Instead I received some sort of chemically altered dairy slab, No sour cream, and pickles.  

The food was just not discussion worthy.  

Our server must  have been playing hide  and seek.  Annoying.

The interior is pathetic for all but individuals below the age of 20.  The bar has a fake straw roof to give the impression you are on the beach.  Only you never feel like you are on the beach.  There are fake tiki torches all over.  And the kicker!  Nothing but Jimmy Buffet songs played non-stop!  Proceed with caution, Mr. Buffet's repertoire can cause side effects such as nausea, irritable & loose bowels, severe psychosis, and permanent neurological damage.

It's the average type of neighbor pizza place that has better than average neighborhood pizza. It's not great, like some of the upscale pizza places here in the city - but for the burbs, and 8 hungry guys during our weekly poker game night it does the job just fine. And it's not that greasy. The Greek and the Hawaiian are some of our favorites. The delivery is always very prompt.

CLEAN, EFFICIENT, PROFESSIONAL... 
That is this store. And speaking of professional,  I dealt with Rob over the phone who works in the deli, and he was absolutely the most attentive person that I've dealt with working for any Publix deli. I found that my sandwich was flawless. 
THANKS ROB. 

NOTE: If you can beat a Boar's Head sandwich, then I need to be made aware of it.  I really don't think that that's possible. Jimmy John's? Subway? Firehouse? Nah... I'm good right here at Publix.

WHY I DROVE TO THIS STORE:
The store at Regency Park and Ridge as well as the store at Little Road and Fox Hollow and the store on US 19 in New Port Richey all closed at 9. Perhaps I will become a regular Shopper at this location simply based on their hours.

Pretty cool place and a super helpful staff.  They've usually got at least 8 different beers on tap and rotate them every week, so there's a pretty good chance they'll have something you'll like.  Price is a little more than the other breweries in town, but they work on a much smaller scale.  The 32 ouncers that they offer come in pretty handy since they have such a wide selection.  Definitely worth checking out.

I had my first egg cream here, and unfortunately for my waistline... it will not be my last. Those egg creams are good. Too good. 

Quaint and relaxed, feels like an old-fashioned ice cream parlour. Loved the murals! Mike's Ice Cream Fountain is so cute, can I put it in my pocket and bring it back to Chicago?

Craig and his brother were top notch all the way through the process of repairing my car.  I had obtained three different estimates all which were quite different in the repair amounts which confused me.  All the others were 20 - 50% more cost and the scope of the work was also a bit different. The others were Precision and Anacapa as i recall.
Craig delivered as promised on time..and the car looks great.  He also gave me a huge discount at Enterprise for rental during the repair. Good to know a body repair shop in town with a professional who can be trusted.

Great place! It's a wonderful unique experience where you can sit down with a delicious drink and also watch and play with cats, all with their own individual personalities it's a truly entertaining experience. The owners and staff are superb in their knowledge of their cats and have helped find homes for these adoptable, lovable cats many times over. Wide variety of beverages to choose from and tasty treats to try, I have always been greatly satisfied with all of the drinks and treats I have had here, they also have all sorts of cat merchandise to buy. You can tell the owners have put their hearts into their business which is run very well, they also have a variety of theme nights from yoga to games night. Check this place out! You won't be disappointed.

Had high hopes, but it was just ok.  Had the signature green eggs and ham breakfast sandwich and it was a little bland.  Wouldn't order it again.  Also took forever to get our food...it wasn't busy so that wasn't the reason.

Portion size was also small especially considering the prices were pretty expensive for just sandwiches with no sides.

Service was friendly and they had a nice, funky space.  Hoping they can expand their options...maybe add a couple pieces of fruit to go with each breakfast option???

I have tried ice cream at many places in Chicago, and none has ever tasted as good as Mike's Ice Cream. I got 2 scoops of cookies and cream and I was full after 75% of it. It was super delicious times 100. The best I ever had. I suggest you buy the 3 scoops and share with a friend because it's plenty! 

The place gets super claustrophobic on weekends. There is very minimal seating, and when you sit in the middle, you are surrounded by other tables and the people waiting in line. I'd suggest you get the cone/cup and walk around and eat it. There are two tables against the wall past the counter that are less claustrophobic. 

I'm going to stop here every time I visit Nashville.

I understand Bar One's attempts to change the traditional Italian food into bar food but a lot of it didn't make sense. 

The Good - Let me say that I would RUN back for the french onion soup mussels, they were absolutely delicious and full of flavor. My favorite part were the french fries at the bottom of the bowl that were soaked with the french onion broth. 

The service! Each waiter was extremely attentive and nice, never had to ask for anything as it was already taken care for me.

The drinks were delicious as well! would come to drink rather than eat. 

The bad - the kale calamari salad. The calamari to salad ratio was way off, less calamari, more lettuce. The calamari it self was over salted and heavily coated. 

The Mafaldine pasta - was WAYYY under cooked, I like my pasta al dente but this was still raw. Also the pasta is way too large to have small pieces of shrimp and asparagus with. Again, this dish was over salted. 

In all, I would come back if improvements were made. I want to see this restaurant do well! Great location, and the place is cool.
This was the best ice cream in the city, I can't wait to come back tomorrow for another waffle cone! Every flavor I tried was incredible!

Cute bakery/wine tasting venue in Santa Barbara. We were after a quick bite before a walk and we got our fix. You can find bagels,pies,sandwiches,soups,salads and croissants. Ambiance is chilled out,dogs are allowed and you can sit inside or outside. We had the gruyere pie (subtle tastes, not salty and you can have a salad side with it), a chocolate croissant (not bad!),coffee & latte (good!).

I spend a lot of time traveling and rely on Yelp when I'm in on the road.  However, I NEVER rely on yelp for new places.  I'm glad I stick to that policy...or else I never would have tried the Village Tap Room.  I've now been there three times and I really think this is a great addition to B-Ripp.  Service has been excellent every time...Cameron is outstanding!  I don't remember the names of the other two servers, but they were very good.  24 beers on tap is plenty, especially when you have great diversity...which they have!  I haven't seen Bell's Hopslam anywhere else??  The pretzel bites are great (think Hop Cat..they seem exactly the same).  Wings and Brisket sandwich were good bar fare.  My buddy enjoyed the puffy taco.  I'll definitely be a regular.

I'm originally from Los Angeles, so I am accustomed​ to eating amazing Korean food from K-town. 

This place hits the spot whenever I am craving for bibimbap​! I always order the chicken bibimbap​​ on a stone plate; it's just too good! It's a mom and pop shop, so the owners are always there whenever I come in, and they are honestly the nicest people ever! I always order the same thing, so whenever I walk in, they already know what I want! That's what I call some loyal customer service. 

I 100% recommend trying this place out if you're in the mood for bibimbap!​​

Oh, Bier Brewery, how I love thy Sabbath Black Kolsch!!! It is malty rich with the right touch of bitter and a gorgeous carnel-y black color with a beautiful head when I pour it in my glass. Picked up a growler Friday and not even ashamed to say I finished it all by myself  this afternoon. Deliciousness. So wish I could buy in cans. Keep up the fantastic brewing. Can't wait to see what ales come next. ((Nope, not an IPA fan, but your ESB is quite good).

Denise went out of her way for our Aspie. The food is pipping hot and fresh. I missed this place because I used to go in the Bay Area.

We went on Wednesday and Saturday for a double birthday bash before the rush. There was no wait time and I love the ambiance.

Best waffle cone and best ice cream I've had in a long time. Simple, but original flavors with perfect texture and taste. The waffle cone had just enough cinnamon and sweetness. Staff was helpful and ET me sample just about every flavor. Wish I lived close... LOVED the place.
This place has amazing breakfast sandwiches (biscuits are the best ever) and the coffee is just as good!

The start to our experience here was not great. I called ahead to find out if there was valet at the restaurant in which I was told yes there is. This was great bc we didn't have to pay for uber etc. so when we arrive to the valet stand there is no one in sight and a line of cars parked on the street. Essentially no where legally for us to park to wait for the valet. When we see the valet run up I got out to hand him my keys hoping he knows better than I where we can park our car and he can take it from there. He snaps at us he's swamped and that we need to legally park and to pay a $12 fee for the valet before he can help us. I understand he is working alone on a Saturday night but the attitude was unnecessary. We ended up parking in a garage right down the street and The green pheasant validated it, I feel for the guy but he could have been more pleasant and apologetic. Two people working the stand could probably solve the problem. Then when I arrive my friends I'm meeting are waiting at the bar explained we couldn't be seated until everyone arrived. They'd been waiting at least ten minutes bc of the valet situation and we let the hostess know we are all there and she forgot about us. We reminded her promptly but we didn't feel like we got a warm welcome. Everything was exponentially better once we were seated and welcomed by our waitress Lauren, who goes by L2. She was warm and informative. All the food we ordered was delicious. If I were to rate this place based on the food and Lauren's service alone it would be 5+stars! I definitely would recommend this place to friends but I would tell them either uber or skip the valet all together and park in the garage and have the restaurant validate the parking. The crab noodles were amazing, but there wasn't a thing I tasted I didn't like!

Visited BAP for.the first time, as I love this dish and usually get it from another restaurant. I had high hopes based on the reviews. Here is the verdict-gross. The chicken didn't resemble chicken and the vegetables were bland. The best way to describe the chicken would be slimy....almost like it came from a can. Maybe the food used to be good and the quality has declined. Don't know. Couldn't even eat it.
Food was great. The girls outfits were disappointing  i was expecting to see some big honkers ):
I love their pumpkin beer, great atmosphere, lots of quality beer, friendly service, and professional. Interesting place just of Binford

This place is so much fun to visit - regardless if you are a serious collector of something (Trust me they have it here) or if you are just a wanderer - you will find something. The store is broken into multiple sections and the area to the right is your more "modern" decor - farmhouse items, candles, etc. To the left is your classic antique dealer. Many of the dealers have a certain theme to their booth so if you are looking for glass, you'll find that. Books/records - there is a dealer for that too. 

Be prepared to spend some time here (2 hours?) if you want to look at it all. Also - they do have soda and snacks for sale at the front if you need refreshment. Also - don't be afraid to ask for a better deal - it is an antique shop. Finally - if you see something you like - they will hold it up at the counter for you while you keep shopping! 

Bonus tip - if you normally carry a big purse - leave it at home! Some of the spaces are tight and you don't want to knock it over!

I've been following these guys for the last year through Facebook. Glad to see they are finally open and so happy we got to visit! Beers are solid! Flight presentation is unique! Servers are very helpful, attentive and friendly! This is in an old bank building so decor was very unique! Loved it! 
You can bring your own food or order from nearby restaurants for delivery!  We will be back!!

I like Mike's.  There is always an assortment of interesting flavors.  I tend to be drawn to the more unusual ones that you don't most other places.  Some flavors are better than others, but really I think that's a personal preference issue.  So far my favorite is the banana pudding ice cream that I had maybe a year ago.  Yesterday I opted for the key lime pie based on the Yelp reviews, and while it was ok, it wasn't anywhere near my favorite.  I walked away thinking I should have tried the red velvet.  But, that's the risk you take unless you continually order the same flavor.  And, with so many options, where's the fun in that?  

I would echo other reviews and say to stick with the "square ice cream bins" as those are the homemade ones.

Great spot off of Poydras to hit up before or after a show/game/event at the Superdome or arena! Tremendous wine list by the glass with draft wine at the ideal temperature for red or white. The bartender was full of great suggestions and led me to a fantastic Cabernet blend by Italics and a surprisingly smooth and drinkable Petit Syrah. 

Definitely set up to promote conversation with large tall top tables and a comfortable bar area complete  lots of lush plants to make it feel more intimate. Appropriate lighting and volume level to ACTUALLY HAVE A CONVERSATION AND NOT BE ON YOUR PHONE ALL NIGHT. Imagine that ;)

The food was reasonably priced and pretty tasty and actually came out quickly (even though they warned us of long ticket times in advance due to a computer glitch). We got the goat cheese and fig flat bread and the deviled eggs along with the tomato soup. The tomato soup was by far my favorite - acidic with just a hint of creaminess to even it out and a ton of garlic. With a slab of bread, it would have been heaven on a slightly chilly night. The deviled eggs had great mustardy flavor, but not the best value on the menu for $8 for 3 - there was supposed to be some crab as well but it was pretty minimal. The flatbread was tasty as well - nice thin yeasty crust with a bunch of goat cheese and a fig drizzle but I would have liked a little bit more accoutrement on top (Maybe some veg, arugula, fig pieces?) even though I enjoyed every last bite.

Check Copper Vine out for lots of good wine and some delightful snacks!

The lady on the counter looked like she did not want to do business at all, her face was very unpleasant. I went to this store specifically to get their egg tarts cause they WERE delicious. Now, not anymore. The fillings had watery texture instead of the creamy taste they should have. 

I also ordered "honey citron tea" which the sign said $1.25, then the lady charged me $1.50. I positively thought they must have changed the price. As I went back, she got my order wrong and gave me "honey ginseng tea" instead. Ugh. I also bought a slice of tiramisu cake, and it was ok, not too sweet but I hardly tasted the coffee at all.

I will not be back.

Great place to host a birthday party. We have been to Craft Hall a number of times and decided to host our daughter's 1st birthday party here. We have hosted a number of parties at various venues in the city and this was by far the easiest and most enjoyable one (for us) that we have hosted. Event planners are easy to work with, they are very accommodating, food display was great, the open bar was easy to navigate for guests, parking for guests was accessible and easy, things for adults and children, and overall very friendly staff. Special thank you to Alison, Josh, and Frank!

booked a jet blue flight for 4 via rewards and impossible to book seats near each other, jetlue wants $50 per ticket to take over third party reservations and chase can't do anything......just great service, not, from both chase and jet blue!!!

Wandering around The Broadway during the day, stopped in to Mike's Ice Cream on a whim and it was one of the best decisions I made all day and during my trip to Nashville. Tried their White Chocolate Banana Pudding and it was some of the best ice cream I've ever eaten in my life. Despite this mash up of flavors, it was not overly sweet and each bite left you wanting more. UGH - get yourself some of this amazing ice cream when in Nashville ya'll!

A group of us came in last night to celebrate my wife's birthday. Our waitress Christina was wounderful. She gave us a great experience. There was a delay in the kitchen, but she was on top of everything. I would recommend her section, she has a welcoming personality. The food was delicious and we enjoyed the happy hour at the bar.
My favorite chinese bakery. I love their buns. And their eggtart is best in whole Chinatown

Just visited Mike's Ice Cream while on vacation and it was amazing! Walked into the shop with my girlfriend while touring through Broadway and immediately were greeted and welcomed in. 

I asked for a sample of the Tennessee fudge which they said was their most popular and once I tasted it I knew it would be my choice. It was perfectly creamy with small hints of chocolate fudge and pieces of some chocolate that added an extra layer of texture for a delectable bite! 

My girlfriend asked the server she didn't know what to get between the a coffee milkshake or a frozen cappuccino and then suggested she order an espresso milkshake and you could pick any ice cream flavor you wanted. He throw out a few suggestions and my girlfriend decided on the mint chip. The result was a perfect blend of both worlds that was perfectly balanced with the undertone of cappuccino and yet a refreshing hit of mint. 

For both our desserts it only around $10. Gotta say, great service, great ice cream and a great deal. On top of that the inside was clean, decorated nicely and easy to walk through. Would definitely recommend!

This place was a beauty to behold. We fortunately snuck in just ahead of the 9am crowd! The breads were being made fresh on site and were so fun to watch the bakers at work. The staff was so friendly and the food was great! I only took off one star because they need more seating- there were people standing around holding plates of food - not really fair to take a star away though because it is obviously a sign that people love the place!

Saul our server - great job - ran us through the specials - was informed on the wine list. Split a Caesar with no complaints ( you know sometimes servers roll their eyes ).
Order a simple Tormaresca Puglia for dinner a fruity white wine - perfect slightly chilled but not served in an ice bucket.
Entree was a shrimp portofino - light sauce, pine nuts with little button mushrooms and shredded Parmesan. Delicious shared by two and a Tiramisu for dessert , sorry it was empty, but our service was fantastic!!
We will return!
No better or worse than a Subway.  Maybe a little worse.  Convenient location, though.
Please re-open. I am lost without you. The Italian is the light of my life. I feel like I've been dumped.

Ordered the classic beef and meatball pho and it was delicious. I'm usually partial to the meatballs but THESE meatballs had so much flavor. Definitely keep an eye out for this truck. Also not over priced.

Waaay overhyped. Tapas style (they say). Seems like a poor excuse for TINY dishes. Had several (5) dishes and all mediocre. Stuffed chicken wings with shrimp toast was the best and that was just ok. Spent $100 and left hungry. Poor service. This is a definite no.

ABSOLUTELY RECOMMEND, don't even waste your time with anyone else.  We inherited major oven issues missed by the inspector in our new home and it wouldn't heat up.  Our appliances are all Fisher & Paykel, so we worried about finding someone who was certified to work on them.  We were so overwhelmed with issues during that first month and I was so frazzled Terry was such a blessing, his calm demeanor and the way he explained everything made it all seem tolerable.  
He spent over an hour and totally took our range apart to try to find the issue and discovered the faulty thermostat.  Our drawer dishwasher was not working either, and he helped us to realize that it was just so filthy from the previous owners and just cleaning under the bottom plate would most likely take care of it (and this was the case) 
The thermostat came in promptly and he was able to repair our range so we could use it,we were so grateful.  Now, here's what drives it home.  We were having issues with getting reimbursement from our Home Warranty company (I know BIG SURPRISE) I had just given up.  Terry's wife Jackie who had already been so very helpful, took it upon herself to speak to Fidelity and clear the whole thing up and I am now getting a full reimbursement beyond the measly $300 promised by the warranty!!!!  I not only recommend this company, I say your daft if you go anywhere else!!!!  Thank you Terry and Jackie, your a Godsend and we LOVE using our NEW OVEN!!!!  xo

Excellent way to spend an hour and a half before a concert in downtown Nashvegas. I'm not ashamed to say that we needed to be schooled on how to read the menu and placing our order. Alex was a pro and recommend the "crowd pleasers" as well as his favorites and reasons why. He also asked us to pick two to three things at a time because as soon as the chef prepares each dish, it is brought to the table immediately. Thus, this was the pattern we created. Order eat, order eat, repeat. 

First up was the wedge salad with ginger dressing, fried oysters and the broccolini with bite sized shrimp. Just as we finished these scrumptious plates, we proceed with our next order of spicy crab noodles (be prepared to have a new addiction) and lobster dumplings. As our fork touched the desert plate on the last bite of a caramelized ginger creme brulee, we had come to realize that we experienced something truly special on a simple Tuesday night. From start to finish, The Green Pheasant impresses. Put it on your foodie bucket list pronto. 

Tip: before ordering, sit back with your wine or cocktail and watch what comes out of the kitchen. This is what we eventually did- telling Alex "we want that" or "that looks amazing, bring us that". The visual presentations were eye catching.

First time at Helena Ave Bakery this morning. It has a trendy ambiance and kind staff. I had the huevos rancheros - I was skeptical because it was served on bread, rather than tortillas. Still, it was tasty and the salsa was outstanding. I followed it with a morning bun (be sure to ask for it warmed), because breakfast desert should be a thing. Only downside: small portions for the price point, but would still recommend.

Came for a 50th birthday party on Saturday evening. This place used to be great!  Had high expectations for this place, how ever those went out the window. 
We came in at 630, they said the bread was not ready yet. How is there no bread ready at 630 on a Saturday night?  The bread came out after my meal arrived. The people bringing the meals out looked less than happy to be working that night. 

It took forever to get salads out to our table. I had to ask for fresh ground pepper and parmesan cheese.  I asked for a second salad it took 20 minutes to get a salad? The waitress said they were behind. 

The cheese was not even fresh grated, she brought a plastic container out with cheese that looked like it was pre packaged.  The waitress said I guess this is how we are doing it.  They used to grate fresh Parmesan cheese for your meal. 

When my spaghetti came out it was lukewarm not even hot.  The meatballs were ok, but lukewarm inside. 
My wife's pasta arrabbiata sauce I could have feed to my 18 month old daughter no flavor or spice whatsoever. 
Then on to the chocolate cake. It used to be so good here! Wrong! It was dry and cold. 

Our waitress was great, but you could tell the place was severely short staffed.  It was hard to get water filled and ask for cheese and pepper on my pasta.  

We will not return again and the 8 people with us agree it was a bad experience.
This pottery barn is consistently understaffed and their computer system is constantly down. I have never been in and out of here in less than an hour. Too bad it is the only one in Nashville.
A good bar and grill. Craft beers and good burgers. The staff is welcoming and friendly.

Best place to order food from if you're ever in the Manayunk area. Great prices even better hours, lots of late nights where I've ordered here at midnight or 1:00 in the morning. Desandro on main is by far one of my favorite places.

I've only been once, but had a great experience. I went for happy hour with a few friends. I like that they do happy hour at the tables as well - so much more comfortable when there are 4+ people in your party. Their happy hour food specials are great - three types of rolls, and not eensy ones either. The four of us split seven rolls and two bowls of edamame between us, and I was pretty full. We also got two rounds of sake, and the total was about $80 - not bad at all. They also had a happy hour cocktail (sounded too sweet for me), and wine, not sure about beer. But I'm glad I went with the sake - maybe a bit kitschy, but I love how they pour and let the excess spill over into a box. The server was very polite and helpful even though we were probably not making his life easy (not all arriving at the same time, not ordering all the food at the same time, squeezing in a second happy hour round, etc.). He also was helpful when explaining what foods were good for gluten-intolerance.

Went in here and it was empty and the people working were so rude. Every time I asked a queue in they responded like I was an idiot and bothering them. Just one example. - "Is this my coffee?" "Yeah that's why I said your name". My friend ordered a coke and they never got it for her and then glared at her when she asked for the drink she paid for. Terrible customer service.

What an amazing little tucked away bar/restaurant! We have kids in sports but not hockey. We came in to just enjoy the food and drinks. The food was amazing, drinks were delicious and Kali at the bar was top notch! Added bonus, we got to see the kids practice and they were amazing. My husband said, "I think we found our new bar hang out to watch games." YES!

My new favorite sushi place in Philly! Great atmosphere and food. I tried their Tuna Flatbread, two specialty rolls-Cindy and Geisha, and Green tea lava cake. Everything was outstanding. I will be definitely going back there to explore more menu!

Great service and amazing food!! The staff is super friendly!
Went with my 3 kids and wife and we had a great time. I had the avocado toast and was really good!

Went in during a weekday right after the lunch hour (about 2p) The place had about 3 tables occupied by customers. We were told it would be a 15min wait. Puzzled at why the wait if there was barely anyone in the restaurant we started calling around to other restaurants to check their wait time. The hostess heard us and offered us complimentary drinks while we waited (that was nice) We were finally seated and the waiter informed us that they were short staffed and that he had to give his cooks some time to catch up. Fine. We ordered fettuccini with creamy garlic sauce and the butternut squash tortellacci dish. My fettuccine was ok. Sauce was a bit too thick and clumpy, under seasoned, and it was room temperature.  The tortellacci dish and it was not good. As you can tell by the picture, it looked like the dish was cooked in a pound of butter. It was greasy. The butternut was undercooked and it lacked salt. We were starving so we were really looking forward to eating these tasty dishes that we had there a few months back. We were very disappointed this time around. I shared with the waiter our disappointment with the butternut dish and he took it off the tab even though my husband ate half of it (he was very hungry). We appreciated the waiters willingness to listen and try to make things right but we will not be returning to this place.

Melanie was awesome! We brought a large group of 20 in for dinner 8 kids and 12 adults. She had everyone with drinks and apps right away. Great beer selection, ice cold and nice variety. I had the Philly steak Texas style and loved it. I'd go back anytime.

A relatively new addition to the neighborhood located near the casino. It's a spacious brewery with a small parking lot in front and additional parking in lot A of the casino.

Walking in, there's a ton of seating on cozy couches or regular high top tables. What's unique about this place is that it has an indoor playground, so it is kid and adult friendly!

They don't do table service so you have to order everything at the bar, but there is a large food menu with the usual bar fare (pizza, sandwiches, fries) with about 10 beers, 5 wines, 5 cocktails and a cider choice. 

The beers and ciders were pretty good, and the food was fairly average. Our group ordered fries, pizzas and some pulled pork sandwiches - nothing stood out too much. I did enjoy my unfiltered cider, which was a tad too sweet but still good.

It's a great place to go for a casual hangout for multiple people, and a unique spot where you can bring your kids and still have a beer.

We ordered takeout this evening. I got the Thunder Chop Chop bowl, my husband got the wings with House Sauce, and my daughter got the chicken tenders. This is our third time ordering here and it feels like every time just gets better. My husband actually said that these wings were the best wings he has ever eaten, period. HE HAS NEVER SAID THAT. EVER. And this man eats wings. A lot of them. Highly recommend, you won't be disappointed. Hats of to the chef, you're amazing.
I love this place! Great spot to watch the game or just hang out with friends. Three pool tables, free shuffleboard and darts.  Daily food and drink specials too.

Blekh. Painfully sweet and tough ice cream. 
Also, extremely rude service. 
We were a large group of people getting ice cream and we were all tasting. I was holding other peoples spoons aswell. I asked for I think the 4th tasting ( since they all sucked, I couldn't decide) he said he's not going to serve me because they only allow five tastings. I said I haven't done five yet. That was besides the point, he was rude, and ruined our fun. 
Funny thing is he wasn't even serving me this other girl was. I ended up getting what my husband was eating and it was.. gross. 
Two of my friends felt sick after the ice cream too ( just too damn sweet and stale tasting)
Excellent food and customer service. Food is soo delicious. The fig and goat flatbread to die for so is the Brussels sprouts. I had the fried chicken sandwich and it was so good.

Who doesn't like homemade ice cream!? They have lots of flavors to choose from and you can sample them all. The thing I was most excited for, was their chocolate chip cookie cones. I have never seen these before and I was very curious to try them. 

I got the coconut ice cream, bc coconut is my favorite. Theirs was pretty good and I loved the crunchy texture of coconut flakes throughout the ice cream. I ordered mine in the cookie cone. I can imagine making a cookie cone would be complicated, you have to make it hard enough to hold ice cream and tight enough to not drip. The cookie cone was a little hard to bite and I did not particularly care for the flavor. I wouldn't not get it again, but it was fun to give it a try! I would definitely come back for more of that coconut ice cream!

Copper Vine is a lovely restaurant and wine bar located in downtown NOLA. I went in the middle of the afternoon for happy hour. I had some wine, duck fat fries, and brussels sprouts. The fries were extremely decadent and everyone should be sure to order them. The brussels sprouts were quite good. They were nice and crisp with shaved cheese on top and a garlic aioli for dipping. I make a point to order brussels sprouts at most restaurants I go to. These two dishes paired nicely with my glass of red wine. Service was quick as I was one of the only people there since I went at an odd time. I would like to go back & sit at the lovely outdoor patio that looks like a garden oasis in the heart of downtown. They also have free popcorn!

Called to make a reservation and ended up being kept on hold for so long I eventually just hung up. Decided to just walk in and was able to be seated. Took almost an hour to get our food (three meals). Two of the meals (both pasta Milano) had almost NO chicken, both dishes were about 98% pasta, 1 percent mushrooms and sun dried tomatoes, and 1 percent chicken. Almost $80 for three meals and one appetizer. Really disappointing. We are trying to support restaurants during the pandemic but won't be back here anytime soon

Would 100% come back here. We had reservation outside, then it started to rain and we were accomidated quickly with a table inside. Our party of 6 found multiple things on the menu we wanted to order. Everything we had was great. Just enough food to fill you up. I had the lump crab Benny. Atmosphere was great. I loved the architecture, vintage vibes. We came here for brunch, I would love to come back here for dinner.

Yum! The vibe and the food were delicious. Don't be discouraged by the line since it moves quickly. We got the green eggs and ham, savory scone, cold brew, and mimosas! Their patio is delicious to sit at and enjoy the food!
Mike's is a nashville staple! The service is always great and they have over 30 homemade flavors. I hadn't been in a really long time, it was nice to go the other night and get a waffle cone!!

I stopped in here on a Wednesday at 5pm with my kiddo and wife. We thought there was table service, but immediately saw about a dozen signs saying otherwise. The next thing we noticed was the size of this place. It is HUGE! You could easily have a wedding here. 

After looking around for a minute, we noticed the kids play area, which is mostly why we decided to come here. Upon further investigation, we realized it was more suited for older kids, but it was still a good mix of things. Climbing structures, slides, a pirate ship, games and swings. 

We walked over to the bar and ordered some food. I got the BBQ wings and a cheeseburger, the wife got a tuna melt and we got the kiddo a burger. We walked around the play area a bit while we waited, and in probably 15 min or so, the food was already at our table. 

I'm jumping right into the food here because we all know that's the most important part. The wings were good. Really good. Super crispy, hot and with just a little sauce, the way I love them. The French fries that came with the kid's burger were also hot and crispy with just enough salt. If we had just gotten those 2 things, this place would have been an easy 5 stars, but that was not the case. 

The burgers were very well done, thin, unseasoned and were most definitely frozen prior to our arrival. Sorry, but throwing on a bunch of lettuce, a LOT of mayo and 5 pickles, PLUS a pickle on the side, does not mask the taste of a hockey puck. Also, the pickles are bread and butter pickles I believe. No one likes those. My wife, who loves pickles, actually spit hers out. Later after we had finished eating, I also saw a man at another table spit a chunk of his pickle out as well. It was a sad day for pickles. 

The tuna melt, which my wife barely touched was not great either. The tuna, even though it was flavorful, was cold, the bread was soggy and someone just threw on a piece of cheese, put the whole thing under the broiler for a second and by the time it reached the table, the cheese was already room temperature. There was also a lot of relish on top of the whole thing, which made it prettier, but didn't help overall. 

This place is good for a quick bite with kids in tow. I would not recommend coming here if you're looking for a nice dinner. Have a beer, have some fried food, let the kids run around and you'll be more than satisfied.

I love this place especially since it's it's right in the middle of the Funk Zone! I've had many of their different coffee and tea drinks here that never disappoint!

This past week I came here with a friend to grab a small bite and to get some work done. I walked in and was greeted right away. While I was trying to figure out what to order the girl at the counter gave me some suggestions as I didn't know what I wanted to order. I ended up going with an Iced Chai Latte and the whipped ricotta and seeded honey combo toast.

The Iced Chai was delicious as always! Came out first which was nice. They soon brought my toast over and I fell in love with it. I loved the whipped ricotta and seeded honey toast!! It was SO delicious! I don't know why I never had tried this earlier. The toast had the perfect amount of cheese and honey. The ricotta tasted so fresh probably was the best I've ever had. I love the seeds in the honey as well. I'm going to ask them next time I go what kind of seeds they are so I can try to make this kind of honey at all.

Everytime I come here I always have an amazing experience! Great service and delicious food! What else do you need?  I can't wait to come back soon to try the cinnamon toast as I've been told it's as amazing as the ricotta toast! :)

Everything on the menu is absolutely incredible, I suggest going with a large group so you can try as much as you can. The cauliflower and salmon were both outstanding, both recommended by the waiter who was knowledgeable and professional -- even sharing cultural context and traditions. 

Park in the deck and get it validated, and they have a coat check as well.

I've been meaning to give this place the full treatment for a while. It finally happened yesterday. 

I didn't come in with high expectations. Bars on Mac Dade Blvd aren't always known for food quality. I was content with a simple sandwich and a beer. 

The menu itself is rather basic. It's heavy on sandwiches, appetizers, burgers, and cheesesteaks. But yesterday they had two items on special that caught my eye. The French Onion soup and New Orleans chicken sandwich seemed like a good combo. 

The soup surprised me. It had a nice amount of cheese along with good flavor in the broth. My expectations suddenly were raised. 

The sandwich was huge. It was overloaded with chicken and cheese and had a great Cajun bite to it. Most importantly it was juicy. Grilled chicken sandwiches often dry out. This one was perfect. 

I came in thinking I would get a pretty basic lunch experience. I left feeling like I ate something pretty special. Kudos!

My poor angel kitty has been suffering with terrible over grooming habits for almost a year now. I have taken him to multiple vets and all have left me with no good treatment plan and brushed off his issues. I decided to give Indian Walk a try, Dr. Eslin talked to me for 45 minutes and helped me to understand the THREE treatments she wanted to try for Milo and listened to all my concerns without making feel like a crazy cat mom! A week later, my sweet boys hair is finally growing back and all of his cuts & sores have basically disappeared. He is so much happier, and it hurts me to think I put him through so many unnecessary vet appointments when one appointment at Indian Walk solved all his issues. We are bringing all of our pets here from now on, can't say enough good things.
Great experience with wonderful ambiance and location. Chavez was so gracious and gave great suggestions on food and wine.

A cute place to dress up and get dinner! Though the menu is pretty pricey, everything we ate was on point in terms of seasoning, texture, all of the above. I had the Wagyu burger and I highly recommend the truffle Parmesan fries. Their cocktails/mocktails are also good but still, v pricey. I'd give this more of a once-in-a-blue-moon special occasion kind of restaurant! Loved the atmosphere and the bathrooms were so well designed. You do have to pay for street parking unless it's after 7pm.
We went to this cute place last weekend with our kids, all the food was delicious!! We tried the fried chicken sandwiches, the egg sandwiches and the cinnamon roll!!
Huge, clean trampoline park with lots of options for jumpers. We stopped in here while on vacation and my kid had a great time. Friendly staff and good prices.

Asked for oval nails got rectangular this was for my wedding they looked ok but she made my thumb extremely sore for a couple days.  Then she kept speaking in Chinese and laughing and pretty much admitted it was about me and my maid of honor.  I will never
 return.

The review of two Mortgage Companies 
(A cautionary tale and why staying local is key)

Sorry if this is a little long winded but I have to give high praise to Tina Burney of Premier Mortgage Resources here in the Treasure Valley. I don't write reviews on goods or services unless they are really bad or really good. And now The Rest of the Story....

I decided I wanted to go from a 30 yr fixed to a 15 yr fixed and pull some cash out. Having been a mortgage loan officer and California real estate licensee for 20 years, I know the business. And because of that I know that my situation with my  finances, credit, stability, etc is what we used to refer to when I was in the business as a "slam dunk" deal.  I decided to contact my current mortgage holder, Freedom Mortgage for this need because I had been with them for over 5 years. What a mistake that was! Long story short, Freedom Mortgage company was inept, unprofessional and non-communicative. After 3 months of playing with this company, I ended up e-mail blasting 15 top level executives to include the CEO to try to get some action. They still could not pull it together!

A friend of mine told me his son had just had a great experience with Tina Burney at Premier Mortgage Resources so I called her. After talking with her, I decided to pull my application from Freedom and to reapply with Tina. I found her very professional, knowledgeable and fast! On May 6th she took my application. On May 8th she had an approval pending the title report. We signed our docs on May 22nd and the deal was funded, recorded and wire transfer in the bank was complete on May 28th. So what Freedom Mortgage couldn't get done in over 3 months, Tina Burney got done in 22 days start to finish! 

Bottom line is this. If you want your loan process to go smooth and fast, go to Tina. And no I do not get any kickbacks for this! She is just that good!

Loved this place! With great outdoor, indoor and bar seating, 30 wines on tap (yeah you read that right), super friendly staff and tasty bites - you won't be disappointed. We were there for lunch but once we got to looking at the small plates, we realized a sampling was gonna be the route we were going to take (and it was a good decision). 

Here's what we got:
Jumbo lump crab deviled eggs ***
Brussels sprouts ***
Black truffle fries ***
Filet mignon brochette **** (drooling now)
Tuna tartare **
Crawfish grilled cheese **** (ohhhh myyy)

You see all the stars. Need I say more?

Absolutely horrible. Made an appointment for them to come out Saturday at 9:30 AM. They were a no call no show. We followed up with a phone call requesting a call back and didn't hear back. They are unprofessional and do not respect your time.

In trying to give my parents a break from paying for costly brunches, I compromised and took them here to buy costly toasts. We ordered a whipped ricotta toast, cinnamon toast, and bacon egg sandwich. Each was delicious, and I especially loved the whipped ricotta and seeded honey combo (ricotta toast is the new avocado toast, you heard it here). The multi-use space has a hip, open, industrial vibe and the outside space is intimate and dog-friendly- a huge plus for us wannabe-dog lovers who voyeuristically watch your dog and wish it was our own. Aaaaanyway, definitely come here for brunch bites and coffee.

Great place for all not just the techies  we love the place and highly recommend it available 
Helpful and organized

You should know this review is poor not because of the quality ice cream, but because of the rude man who gave me my ice cream. The place was crowded and it was hard to hear (which I'm pretty sure violates COVID guidelines nowadays) so I couldn't hear my order be called when my cone was ready. After other people asked if it was me I rushed to the counter to collect and apologize when the guy just rolled his eyes and said "fucking pay attention." It is 4:34 on Sunday 18, 2020 and I just left there. The managers should know who the culprit is. I just hope his attitude is adjusted and he becomes more understanding towards customers in the future, because I am not a happy customer...
The menu and atmosphere has been so carefully curated with nice size portions. The drinks were unique, complex, and not inundated with sweet drinks. Looking forward to my next visit!

One of my favorite downtown locations!! Homemade ice cream, and great coffee. I work downtown often, and usually have to get out & treat myself to an Espresso Milkshake, highly recommend cookies'n'cream with espresso milkshake. 

There is normally a long line, but the guys who were here are efficient and friendly. If it's cold, come grab a coffee instead. They offer all the great styles and flavors of coffee as any other coffee house you'll find.

We love that vaccines or a negatory PCR test are required for inner seating. That said, my companion forgot the proof at the hotel so we opted for the beautifully green outdoor seating. It was great...even in the light drizzle!
Dusty was our knowledgeable and accommodating server. I highly recommend the excellent French shallot soup with gruyére. The broth was to die for!! We thoroughly enjoyed the chocolate amaretto brûlée with a lovely coffee as well. 
Wines are to be enjoyed, and you can bet we did! Varying pours and styles will be sure to tickle your palette positively. Enjoy!

We love Bier!! It's an easy drive from our house. We love the beer choices and they are always coming out with something new . Their pumpkin beer is now in season and is amazing !! It's dog friendly and they have several weekly events to participate in such as euchre and trivia . Would definitely recommend !

This place is great! The food, the service, the atmosphere....all great! 

Our waitress yesterday was Alexis W and she was rocked it! She made suggestions on food and drinks! All of them were spot on! 

Alexis W is a keeper!

Stylish bakery just blocks away from the beach! Stopped by on a busy Sunday morning and service was still quick and friendly.  I ordered the breakfast sandwich on brioche (baked egg, smoked cheddar, bacon, and butter), a matcha latte, and a pumpkin loaf to-go.  The sandwich was delicious -- the egg is really the star of the show here! The matcha latte wasn't blended thoroughly and it was grainy making it hard to drink, I opted for a cup of water after a few sips. The pumpkin loaf was the perfect amount of sweet and a nice complement to my morning coffee the next day.  Aside from the food, the ambience here is very casual with both indoor and outdoor seating.  Location is prime, there is a public parking garage behind the bakery and it's only a few blocks away from the beach!
Food is SO GOOD and what an aesthetic! I love that you can convert the breakfast sandwiches to low carb option with lettuce at no extra cost. Fluffy egg is delicious.

From the ambiance, to the service and the food - I wish I could give this place more than 5 stars! The decor in this restaurant is modern with an extremely aesthetic pleasing bar in the center. I had my birthday dinner at Tuna Bar for a party of 14 people and Tina was extremely accommodating for all of my guests. She helped our party set up a pre-fix menu (from vegetarian options to sharing size portions) - she was amazing! All of the servers were attentive and the food arrived quickly. I highly recommend the tuna flatbread, the yellowtail & scallion roll, the Sindy Roll and their vegetable fried rice. All of which were delicious! Not to mention their cocktails were great also. Perfect for a date night or a night out with your friends. They also have outdoor seating with very cute string lights outside during the Summertime. Highly recommend if you're looking for a sushi restaurant in the city!

This place was good! I got a BLT and added turkey. It was quite delicious but too ezpensive for what it was. I spent almost $30 for the sandwich + tip. I also didn't love the peppered chips, but I will still give this good scoring because the bread, meat, and everything in between was very good. Service was great, and speedy too.

Went to a frontier event with a friend today at craft hall. We both arrived early because we feared it would be overcrowded; however although a lot of people everyone fit with ease. There's a small lot across the street by the outdoor beer garden, and a lot at the sugar house that you can park in. The bar staff was super quick. My friend didn't even realize I went and got us another round of drinks by the time I got back to the table. We ordered a margarita pizza and it was delicious. There are three different sizes of beer you can get 10oz/16oz and pitcher and are priced accordingly and reasonably. There are both dark and light craft brews, as well as some liquor drinks. Craft hall has a playground for kids, and various games for adults. What really set this place apart was I left my purse on the table and got distracted by everything that was going on at the event. When I got back to the table the staff had moved my purse for safe keeping, and everyone was aware when I walked back up. Multiple employees let me know where my purse was and that they moved it for it to be safe. Something you don't see everywhere, and something that is most definitely appreciated. I have already recommended this place to a few friends and will most definitely be back.

I'm a long time Chase credit card client with an excellent financial history of paying my bills in full every month! I signed a contract with a local company in St Louis after listening to their representative give a very good description of their services. Two days later, another employee called and that's when I found out almost everything the representative told me were either huge exaggerations or outright lies! The services she described of her company ended up up as not being as she described. She lied to me only to get me signature on a contract so she could get a commission. She misrepresented her own company to prospective clients!
I've appealed to Chase Cardmember Services twice and both times they've quickly  dismissed their long-time client in favor of the company with a rep that lies about their services with one reason only-money. And CHASE DOES NOT CARE about DISHONESTY. CHASE DOES NOT CARE ABOUT THEIR OWN CLIENTS! Chase should try to do the right thing. Think about your own clients first-they may be right!

I like the Chase credit card, but trying to contact Customer Service today (to report a phishing text) by either phone number, 1-800-432-3117 and 1-800-945-2000, is frustrating. The first time, I was on hold for quite a long time and then I heard a busy signal before the line was disconnected. The same thing happened again. Finally, on the third try I spoke to Michael who said I would have to report it to my Service Provider.
Breakfast Sandwiches were delicious. Not your traditional looking breakfast sandwich, but had traditional ingredients. Would like to go back to try more unique items during our trip.

Food is always delicious. Best way to try different things is to order several apps with friends. Great happy hour timeframe (Monday-Friday 2-6pm). Heads up, the happy hour wine flight wines are ONLY available during happy hour.

Tuna Bar has quickly become a favorite of Philadelphians alike and trust me it a great experience! Top tier service from the moment you walk in being that you're so welcomed! Tina is exceptional (thank you Tina! ) I have eaten here quite often and have never thought to do something like write one of these but I'm really hoping this encourages others to visit Tuna Bar! The food quality is among the freshest in the city with all dishes, and the wide variety of options is a treat every time! The drink selections are excellent as well... just top to bottom they did not miss! Thanks again Tina and crew we love the Tuna Bar!

5 stars ALL AROUND! The sushi here is amazing. The quality and the taste are superb! Not to mention it's a good looking restaurant with some pretty cool decor and a great ambiance.

We started with edemame, tuna tartar, tuna curdo and seared tuna salad. They were all amazing but my favorite was the tuna curdo which is basically thin slices of raw tuna in a delicious sauce. Order this app it's incredible.

Moving on to the rolls... We had the old city roll, white dynamite, peppered tuna and some yellowtail sashimi. Let me repeat the quality of fish they serve he is the best I have had period. All of these rolls were extremely tasty but my favorite was the peppered tuna! It comes with an amazing wasabi drizzle and the tuna is pepper crusted.

We also had a few Sapporo beers and the ladies had cocktails the geisha and the I'll see you lata. They said the cocktails were Great!

We had such a good time and enjoyed the food so much that we told the owner it was the best sushi we ever had. We are visitors from NYC and tuna bat does it better than any of the upscale sushi spots we have been to in NY. We have even discussed going back to Philly just to have dinner at tuna bar again. Absolutely love this place! Best meal we had in Philly by far!

Today was our first visit to Twin Peaks. I didn't know what to expect. The inside is very neat to see. It's very cabin, woodsey oriented. There are some animal heads on the walls, and a real stuffed bear as you enter. There are too many tv's to count. The waitresses are wearing short shorts and low cut tops, just as I or anyone would expect, but not so much as to embarrass me or themselves. I'm glad I went, because now I know. I would have given 5 stars except they were out of the first two items I tried to order. We had a great waitress named Ina. She was so nice and proficient. All waitresses should take a lesson from Ina.  My friend Karie ordered a chicken and cheese quesadilla which she had once before and loved that. My husband Tony wanted fish and chips, but they were out of them so he got a cheeseburger with lettuce, tomato, pickle, and mustard. It comes with onion-but he doesn't like it. I ordered fish and chips when Tony did. My next choice was the breaded Tenderloin...nope-our of that too. (third times a charm) ok-6 bone in wings and fries. Here it comes!! My 6....sigh... I got boneless wings?? Ok, why call them wings?? Folks in food land everywhere,,, here's some news form me me to you; There's no such thing as boneless wings. It's little chunks of chicken, breaded and deep fried!! That's why people like me order bone in chicken wings. I was offered some actual wings to go, free of charge. Ina is the best, but I wouldn't do that. I should have spoke up instantly if it was a really big deal to me. I'm sure we will come back and if we do we will ask for Ijna.

The ice cream du jour downtown was busy but a tad understaffed, with only two people working. The one who served me got my ice cream, left me to wait at the register a bit to serve someone else, and then asked me how it was despite the fact that it was visibly untouched; she was a tad busy. I used to think understaffed businesses just had owners who were being cheap, but in the COVID era who knows.

I might have thought that my flavor choices of chocolate raspberry truffle and mint white chocolate oreo were unique, but I was bemused to read someone else's review where they ordered the same combination. These must be winning flavors. I actually liked the truffle even better than my mint chip but both were abundant in complexity. It was a mild winter day, but I did consider their large selection of specialty hot chocolates as well. They didn't seem to have much in the way of non-dairy frozen desserts, but their beverage selection offered multiple alternative milks so at least there's something if you need. I guess because they're open late downtown they see themselves as a bit of a convenience store as they had Tylenol and a few other random things for sale at the register.

It wasn't quite so good that I would rule out ever trying another dessert in Nashville, but their flavor selection is more than the basics and it is good.
